reviews.text: We just had an outstanding dinner at Prebechu! Go for the tasting menu and you will get plate after plate of AMAZING food brought to your table. The pacing was perfect as were the portions. The servers were friendly, knowledgable and clearly passionate about the food. Such a great find!
Amazing!

Never been to a Guamanian restaurant. Is Guamanian even a word? Anyhow, Prubechu was a cool experience. I was really looking forward to trying something new. I had the tasting menu and was really impressed. I wish I could remember the names of the dishes, but I predict it won't be long until this cuisine becomes mainstream and we all know the names of dishes from Guam. I had some kind of coconut chicken and a porridge that had quail eggs. They were delicious. Apparently the menu changes every now and then. Great idea! I will have to come back to see what's new in a few weeks.

We liked this place. Given the crazy inconvenience of trying to park in this part of the Mission, not sure if we'll ever make it back here any time soon. But yeah, the food was definitely memorable and pretty good value.

A real find. Not only is the food delicious, the people who run the place do everything to make you feel welcome and well-fed. Head chef Sean (sp?) used to cook at Incanto and his serious cooking chops show. Meanwhile, everyone at the restaurant feels like family. Hope they last a good long time.

Great spot and great attentive service. We had the chef's tasting menu and I highly recommend it. Like many reviewers I had no idea what to expect but I saw the good reviews and thought it would be a great place to try out.  $45 was the price for the Chef's Tasting menu per person.  Look forward to returning sometime in the future.
So much more sophisticated and refined than what I remember from visiting to Guam and micronesia years ago-- From that visit I mostly remember Spam and ramen with hot sauce...

It might be very good but it is impossible to make a reservation. I called and followed their instructions so I sent a text message as  requested for a reservation for 4. The next day I sent a second text message. The finally responded and indicated that I needed to call after 5 pm to give them my credit card number to make a reservation. I have called at least 10 times since then and have only been able to talk to an answering machine. So I finally gave up. It might be a very good restaurant but they are not a good business.
The Tasting Menu blew my mind!! Most amazing courses I have had in a long time!! And the coconut ice cream was the best way to end the meal!  Great job guys!

I had the vegetarian dish with side of rice and wine. Absolutely loved my meal!! The texture of veggies were crisp and lively- just right.  The best part of the meal is that the flavor was perfect.  I hail from Asia and I find that almost all Asian food in this city tries too hard by over-salting, over-spicing... Not so at Prubechu, flavors are very well balanced! I will definitely come back to try other items.
If you're looking for styrofoam fiesta plates, you came to the wrong place.
wonderful food. really fun to eat. great tasting menu. and good family-like service.
Food was delicious and really unique... The owners are wonderful with true passion for their work...

nothing like it in the city!  Did the tasting menu with a group of 5.  Really creative and flavorful dishes - each course was better than the last.  This place is a huge find. Looking forward to going back again soon!

Had such a great dinner! Probably one of the best in San Francisco. These guys not only cook with great flavor but plate with such great fineness! Service was spot on too! I recommend the chefs tasting menu for sure!

This has got to be the newest, must-try restaurant in SF! Hurry before reservations become impossible to get! Their basic menu is the tasting menu with various add-ons. It was absolutely delicious with every bite, filling, and satisfying. I had never tried Guamanian food... and thank God I love coconut because it was in almost every dish! I thought it was cute that they serve many different types of beer, including Pabst (for $2!). The service and ambiance is genuine and no-frills. I felt like I was being served by a bunch of my close friends with their non-stuffy, friendly, caring attitude.

I went because I've never tried food from Guam and for the ridiculous high reviews.  I'm glad I didn't cancel because between the making the reservation and the res date,  (and always the pessimist )I'd convinced myself those reviews were fake.   Glad to say that it was a enjoyable experience.

Went here on the recommendation of a friend, and were we glad we did. We ordered the tasting menu and were not disappointed. Food was delicious and well presented. The service was warm and friendly, with each course accompanied by information about the dish and its provenance. Nice, bright place that is not too loud, and has a relaxed, comfortable vibe. Highly recommended!

Came here based on a recommendation from someone who grew up in Guam. What is Guamanian food?? I'm always down to try new things, and seeing as how this is the first and only Guamanian restaurant I've heard of, I was intrigued. For groups of 5 or more, everyone has to be on board for the tasting menu. $45 gets you five courses, not including the amuse bouche and dessert. Fortunately, they allowed my friend to opt out of the tasting menu, and to just order a la carte because of her strong aversion to coconut (90% of their dishes have coconut). We didn't know what we were getting until each course came out because they didn't have a printed menu of the tasting menu. With the exception of one course (ground up chicken in banana leaf), we all thoroughly enjoyed the food! It was very flavorful and while coconut was in everything, it wasn't overwhelming and all that pronounced in some dishes (and I only like coconut in some foods).

I'm so glad that I came here during my visit to SF! The owners are super welcoming and incredibly nice -- we spent about 15 minutes talking about the history of Guam and what brought them to San Francisco.

Got the tasting menu and I think it's a steal! It's a small, relatively okay looking place but the service and the food are outstanding. The waitstaff explained each course, and were very attentive to our needs. The food was plated beautifully, and it tasted as good as it looked. My favorites are the oyster (like butter), egg course (balanced taste), and the coconut ice cream dessert.

Not the food your grandma makes, but something that will definitely remind you of it. Food is beautifully presented and owners are welcoming. If you haven't had food from Guam, do it, and do it here. See Joie G's review for a more detailed review. I was part of her large party. They are very flexible about food interlorances and allergies so just let them know. We did the tasting menu. Meal has been awhile but I remember enjoying my dishes. Coconut soups, achote grits, makerel, and the dessert of pigigy (sticky coconut rice) with ice cream is what sticks out in my head the most! One cool thing that my brother ordered that sounded interesting was their homemade pasta with tinaktak (coconut milk, vegetables, and meat). I had no more room left to try it, but that was just to give you an example of what they are trying to do with Chamorro (Guamanian) food.

I was with a group of lovey ladies who just had an excellent tasting menu dinner at Prubechu! Wonderful atmosphere, delicious, creative and artistic food. It was so fun to watch the chefs and interact with them - telling stories and history of Guam. It was easy to make reservations and the chefs where more than happy to adjust to a few gluten free/dairy free requests. I would highly recommend this restaurant - marvelous experience!

I'm not familiar with Chamorro food so I had a great time learning about and trying the cuisine of Guam. We went with the tasting menu (very affordable!) for a casual sampling of dishes. I liked the shrimp patty with corn, the escabeche, and even all the coconut (which I usually don't) in the various dishes. I wasn't too fond of the porridge though, but maybe that's because I don't like it to begin with. Our server was really fantastic and took the time to explain each dish and answer any questions. He was also very informative and not at all condescending, which was really appreciated.

This place is phenomenal and one of SF's best kept secrets! I hesitate to write this review because I don't want the restaurant spoiled by legions of eager diners in line before me, but the chef is so kind and funny and hard-working, and the food is so damned delicious and beautiful, that I can't bear the thought of not sharing the good news.
Awesome tasting menu in a very family atmosphere. If you are not Guamanian you will be made to feel like you are.

Modest, small, restaurant with little in the way of frills in the Mission that executes an excellent culinary experience! We did the tasting menu, which was 5 (+1) courses of beautifully prepared, innovative dishes with complex flavors and techniques that made it so fun to eat and experience! Each dish engages all 5 of your senses. The menu changes frequently, and you kind of need to go in to see what they will be serving that day. There is also an a la carte menu, but the tastng menu will have completely different set of dishes. My only disappointment was the wine list -- but not going to knock the place for that since wine isn't a Guamian staple, and the food really does speak for itself.

I consider myself an expert when it comes to chamorro cuisine, why you ask...well more than likely because I am a chamorro, born in Vallejo, CA but raised on the island of Guam since I was 7 months old and since then I have had the pleasure of tasting, serving, cooking and of course eating our island cuisine.  By no small feat are many of the dishes simplistic, in fact preparation for much of what we eat is time consuming.  Prubechu has taken what is already great food and made it GRAND!  The succulent flavors from each dish burst out and compel you to want more.  As if the 5 course tasting menu was enough, NO!!!!.....we had to venture further into their simple but seductive and enticing menu and order more.  Then they top it off with ice cream and not Blue Bunny, Hagen Das or Bryers but their own, homemade....coconut candy and melon ice cream lightly sprinkled with salt that was made on Guam.  The sweet and salty totally blended well and made for the perfect end to the perfect dinner!  Btw....their service was pretty amazing too!
Prix fixe was phenomenal. So many diverse flavors and the presentation on every meal was superb.

Had a great time here with a few friends on a sat night.  We went with the tasting menu and we're definitely educated on some new flavor combinations and dishes from Guam.  This is definitely a hidden gem at a reasonable price point (for now at least) that brings something fresh to this strip of mission.
It was our second time here and we were not disappointed. I celebrated my birthday here a few months ago with 25 of my closest friends. I can say that the food and service are excellent for both.

A hidden gem (who knows for how long, though) in the Mission! I've not previously had the pleasure of dining upon cuisine from Guam, but if this restaurant is any indication, the country must be an island of earthly delights. Sean and the staff have taken a rather plain/dingy place and transformed it into a space that is cozy and friendly. The hospitality and the food are top notch -- we had the chef's tasting menu (a bargain for the price) and really enjoyed the spam and eggs, oxtail with with soy broth and calamari with melon and cucumber. There were other small courses as well -- they were all delicious.

Prubechu was phenomenal! The food and service were both top-notch. As other reviewers have mentioned, the $45 tasting menu is a great way to go. A fantastic variety of dishes and flavors that were very unique. The restaurant is also very accommodating to guests' food allergies, so if you have allergies or sensitivities to gluten, dairy, shellfish, etc., they can work around those constraints with aplomb.
Absolutely amazing food. A breath of new tastes for the city. The tasting menu is of amazing value. Can't go wrong. They take reservations over email or the phone so just call them up.

I Ordered the Chef's Choice Tasting Menu (5 tasty dishes specially prepared by the chefs) & everything was fresh, delicious with spectacular flavors with a Chamorro base! I can't remember all the fresh ingredients in each of the dishes but they were all outstanding! The service was excellent, too!  I'll be going back in September when I'm back in San Francisco!

A friend who knows his stuff picked this place and it kind of blew our minds. It's a nondescript and fairly plain room in an otherwise great location, but the service and food was full of enthusiasm and authenticity and was one of the better meals I've had this year. First off a $45 7 course tasting menu is almost ludicrously cheap for this quality - it'd be a great deal at double the price.
Great job and wonderful tasting menus, friendly and flexible staff. Highly recommended!
This place rocked. Off the beaten path and cute inside, the food was DELICIOUS and DIFFERENT. The owner/waiter was incredibly accommodating to my Paleo-esque ways. I really enjoyed it a ton. A+.

Most welcoming and friendly service in SF.  Sean and his staff are great and really make you feel like family.  The Chamorro menu is great and a unique addition to the culinary scene.  Do not miss the coconut ice cream dessert.  I will definitely go back sometime soon for the full tasting menu.

hey All You Guamanians in the Bay Area Hiding Among the Many Filipinos Out There, it's time to rise as food from your culture has made it's way out of the comforts of your homes and into the mouths of anybody willing to give it a try! hooray, right? right!

We came in on a rainy Thursday night. Took an hour to get our entrees. Not sure if this is the norm but was definitely frustrating waiting for so long. I ran out of things to talk about with my date... Stared awkwardly and ordered more beers. When I asked the waiter why, he mentioned that THEY ONLY START MAKING YOUR ENTREE AFTER THEY SEE YOU FINISH YOUR APPETIZER! I've never heard of a restaurant that does this... But what it basically means is that if you order an appetizer, plan to wait for another 30-40 mins before your entree arrives OR wolf down your appetizer immediately so that they "see" you finish it and start cooking your entree. Or just don't order an appetizer (which seems to be a terrible business decision on their part)

This place is great!  They have the Eastern European experience down to the T.  All of the sausages are fantastic!  The goulash takes you back to the old country in just one bite.  We went on a Friday night and were seated within 5 minutes.  Super service with a smile and answered all questions happily.  I love the beer selections!  Half liter or liter is so simple, thank you metric system.  Try any of the paprikash, you won't be disappointed.  We will definitely be back.

About a decade back, I took a trip to Budapest and Prague and thought for sure that I would struggle with the heavy food there but not really. I figured it would be a lot of stews and stuffed peppers, which there was, but it was the omnipresence of paprika that made all these dishes uniquely spiky. I doubt if I've had goulash since that trip since Central European cuisine is not that common even in San Francisco. It was nice to see Paprika as I was popping out of the 24th Street BART station one evening. I took a quick look at the menu and peeked through the window to see the place was nearly empty (photo:

My friends and I are always on the hunt for different food. On one such a quest, we went into Paprika. Once we tasted the chicken parishka we were mesmerized by the mouth-watering tasty sauce. This location has elegant European design touches, the service is good and the ambiance is equally captivating. We also tried the vegan sausage and it was really up to the mark. The beer was good but we wished they would serve cocktails as well. We strongly recommend this place to dine, the food is delicious, the service is down to earth and the atmosphere is elegant.

I come here rather often with my German group which we meet every week. I am hooked since the first time I came to this place. The owners are great!  Food and beers are awesome! If you're a fan of German/Polish/Czech food and beer, this is a place to be. And, talking about Location, location, location! Great low-key atmosphere.
Food was pretty good! I ordered the paprika goulash w/ gnocchi and I really liked the sauce. I wish the dish came with veggies to balance it out though.
Czech food. Awesome Czech food. Very friendly service in a casual atmosphere that looks fancier from the outside for some reason. I'm disappointed we waited so long to try it.

simple, comfort food. prices were reasonable. we ordered the mixed sausage plate and the paprika goulash and really enjoyed it. typical young hipster mission crowd. will definitely be back to try other dishes.
We had an enjoyable dinner at Paprika.  Casual atmosphere, delicious food and attentive service.
I never thought I would ever drink a boot of beer.  Enter Paprika.
Food is great. I had the best beer here. Service was also great. Only downside is they accept only cash.
Love the local vibe and that it's run by a husband and wife team! Beers are good and so is the small plate selection. Just wish they made a goulash with beef instead of pork!
Accidentally found this place and absolutely loved it. Food is delicious, priced well and very pleasant service. Wonderful experience!
Very delicious food, great service and very well priced! Don't know if I would choose to eat Czech necessarily, but we kinda ended up here and it was a nice surprise.
Be proud of yourself.
Similar to a lot of people, my friend and I wanted to try something different in the Mission and we stumbled on Paprika. And we lucked out.

Went here for a birthday party last night, and I was really happy with the food. Tried the paprika platter and the small sausage plate (with spiced German sausage) as appetizers, and though quite delicious, the two together were just slightly too small to feed 7 people. For the entree I tried the mix of two sausages, with vegan and Italian chicken. The chicken was EXCELLENT. I only got the vegan to be a little adventurous, and it was just okay (but what should I expect). The sauerkraut was decent but nothing too amazing, the bread was warm and fresh, the mashed potatoes and gravy were okay (needed more gravy IMO), and the pickles and condiments were fair. Though I am not a connoisseur, the beer was good (I got the pilser urqell).
Solid choice for Czech/Hungarian food. I just came from Prague so feel like I have a decent comparison set.

The whole point of going here was to try something new, and we were 100% gratified. In walking past other nearby places that were flooded with patrons on Mission, we chose to come to this quieter Czech/Hungarian/German cultural restaurant.

We dined at Paprika on the strength of Yelp reviews and we really like it. The restaurant has a very European feel to it. The server, who was gracious and attentive, turned out to be the owner. We dined on a Monday evening and it was busy. We shared a Paprika goulash, apple strudel, and a bottle of Malbec. The menu is geared toward home-style comfort food.

Pretty good but not outstanding. Sweet Hungarian sausage appetizer was good; garnishes were just average. Pork goulash was flavorful and fairly moist, but the sauerkraut and gnocchi accompaniment didn't work well: the gnocchi was quite bland. Pork quantity was a little lacking. Apple strudel dessert was decent; not my favorite fruit but there wasn't much else, and they did execute it pretty well: fresh and light.
The food was decent. I am giving it 2 stars because the waitress put an old/cold bread from another table into our bread basket.
Awesome hot and fresh meal!
Really nice place, friendly people, good beer. I'm from the Czech Republic so I can tell.

Stop in for lunch or dinner at Paprika and you'll feel like you're in Prague. Seriously, being here brings me back to vacationing there. The menu is short, simple and tasty. The food is fresh and well presented.

I tried this place because of all the good reviews here and on Bay Area Check Please. The place is a very basic "neighborhood" place which is fine.  The food is good.  My complaint is the portions.  The amount of meat in the Pork Goulash was tiny.  I left the place hungry.  The service was attentive & friendly.  The atmosphere very spartan.
Wow - we walked in for dinner on a Wednesday evening, and had a great experience!
Fantastic meal! Great service and run by a husband and wife team. Owner gave us great service and excellent recommendations. Mashed potatoes are out of this world!

I loved the goulash-it was perfect! My husband's sausage with sauerkraut was also really good. Impressive beer selection. Good service and cozy setting. We had no trouble getting a table on a Friday night with no reservation but the place was still lively. I just had to knock off a star because I think it is so annoying they only accept cash or checks, no credit cards, and we didn't know until they brought the bill. It was an awkward end to an almost perfect dinner. Luckily there is a nearby ATM.

I had my 40th birthday dinner here and the staff could not have been more accommodating. The food was delicious! And unlike most of the new restaurants in SF, this place is run by folks who actually know the cuisine - not some nouveau hipster fake-out.
Oh, too bad, my review was lost when I tried to sign in.  So much for Yelp!
I love Hungarian food and so this place appealed to me. Also the reviews were good.

Ridiculously good food, awesome ambience, ridiculously good prices. Owner-operated (literally, they're your servers), and you can tell they care about the quality of the experience. The goulash was out of this world. Plus, we got seated right away at a table for two on a Friday at 8 (though it was bustling). This is the best hidden gem I've found in San Francisco thus far. Tell your friends.
Fantastic Hangarian dishes & laid back atmosphere.  Live around the corner, and will definitely be back.
For all you lazy people: TL;DR: awesome food. Must visit!
Short version: good food, excellent wine and service.

Food is great (flavor wise) but very limited menu and not that much chicken in the chicken dish.  Service was also good, but the 3 stars go primarily for being cash only.  Cash only, really, at dinner time?
Old World and Old School!
Great food, service and beer. What more can you ask for.
I came to try authentic Hungarian food.  So without knowing what it tastes like, I came in with an open mind.

In a city so full of amazing restaurants, it's hard to stand out, but Noeteca does just that. I've come here a few times, and have had an amazing experience every time. I'm not sure how they churn such good food out of their tiny kitchen, but they manage to deliver consistently delicious and beautifully prepared food at very reasonable prices. The ambiance is cozy and relaxing, and the waitstaff is some of the best I've encountered.
Love this place.
A gem! Like others have said, Noeteca feels like an european cafe transplanted to the Bernal border. Nice, easy-going ambiance and good flavors. Plus, a good cheese and wine selection.
Today we tried the quiche Lorraine and Croque Josephine. Damn. Fu$"&in great! Awesome service. No wait. Outside dog friendly tables. Great restaurant! Highly recommend.

I parked nearby and randomly found Noeteca. It happened to be lunch time so I ordered the endive salad. It was delicious. Service was friendly and atmosphere was reminiscent of a European cafe. I look forward to returning with friends.

You have not lived until you have been here. This was like heaven dancing on my tongue. Everything was perfect and delectable. The coffee was perfect and the mimosas were as well. I got the croque Josephine and my boyfriend got the quiche. Get the croque Josephine was a bread pudding with a poached egg on top and this amazing cheese sauce. Ahhh I want it again just typing about it. Mouth drooling.
This place, oh this place.  It makes me so happy that we stumbled upon this place.  It's our favorite wine bar in the city.

Service was excellent and friendly, restaurant was clean and attractive for a small cafe, and everything we had was really good! My friend had the chicken pecan salad and a few shots of espresso. I had the ham egg and cheese sandwich and a side of their soup of the day (asparagus). The sandwich was crunchy and soft in all the right places, and the soup was creamy and delicious. Tasted very fresh, and had a distinctively "homemade" taste to it all. Our bill was reasonable as well. Strongly recommend it if you're in the area for a low key brunch

Having returned a couple of times, I can say this place holds up. The Belgian endive salad with bacon, gorgonzola, and walnuts is delicious (and also *very* hearty), with a sharp, mustardy dressing that really stands out. On the lighter side, the pecan chicken salad is very good, served with a small mesclun, cucumber, and heirloom tomato salad. On a nice day, it's lovely to sit outside.

Adorable little neighborhood bistro.  We live right around the corner, and it's so nice having this place nearby for those I'm-so-tied-don't-feel-like-cooking-or-spending-20­-minutes-looking-for-parking-and-then-half-hour-­waiting-for-a-table in typical San Francisco restaurants.
JL & JM are regulars at Noeteca, and recommended it as an easy, no-fuss dinner on a Saturday night.

I have eaten with Neoteca twice now. Once for dining in and once for pick up. Both times I have received great service. Everyone is nice and down to earth. They both care about your meal as well as how you are enjoying it. The atmosphere of the place is light and airy. Even though

One of the few places in SF where you're able to enjoy a perfect balance of delicious + fresh food, friendly + attentive service, and a quiet meal in the sun without the sound of cars, construction, or constant passerbys.

Small little fancy place on Dolores. Went here for brunch and ordered their croquet Josephine. Was pretty good but needed to be eaten quickly or the bread would become too mushy. Truffle pate was good and so was their flambé, forgot which was ordered. Overall a fine small establishment.
My favorite lunch place, best chicken salad in town, from little treats to coffee to mains, all delicious!it's my little piece of Europe away from Europe!!

I came across this place by chance.  My destination was the church a block away but I had a couple hours to spare so I decided to stop by.  The bright blue banner waving "wine bar" caught my eye and immediately I was excited to try a new place.  I'm so lucky I did because I was thoroughly pleased with my entire experience here!  The restaurant is intimate and the overall feel is casual and neighborhood-y.  The room has an open feel with many large windows allowing for natural light.  The main entrance was kept wide open the entire time I was there, which let the refreshing bay breeze flow through the entire room.  I was approached by a very attentive server who greeted me with a menu and a glass of water.  He appeared knowledgable about his wines and cheeses so I went with his recommendation and tried the Malbec, half glass of 3oz paired with Brie.  When the server presented me with the cheese plate, I was blown away by the presentation of all the wonderful accompaniments that came with just the one, $8 order of Brie!  I almost fell off of my chair and died because everything felt so surreal.  The Malbec was full bodied, too, and well balanced.  The couple hours I had to spare flew by and I was wanting even more time!  The location of this place made for such an amazingly relaxing afternoon that I would be crazy not to return.  I'm for sure coming back, oh yeah.  For brunch, lunch, and dinner.
Good food,  very tasty. The 3 stars are because they didn't refill our coffee, they wanted to charge us for another cup.
Food was ok.
The server's wine recommendation was off (I guess he thought dry = sweet), but the food was delish and the neighborhood vibe was perfect. Prices reasonable.  Would definitely go back!
I was here for brunch. It was nice and quiet since the World Cup was going on but I'm guessing it's quiet on most days since it's a little tough to come by if you're not in the neighborhood.
Two years since I've reviewed this neighborhood gem, and it has gotten even better!
This place had some of the best chicken salad I've ever had!! Ask for Alex or Ryan to set you up !
I don't really have anything bad to say about this place, except I would've preferred my Croque Napoleon + the bechemal sauce to be a few degrees warmer, but I prefer my food pretty hot.

Noeteca is such a hidden gem that I had an internal battle about writing a review about it! Even without a reservation on the Fourth of July, my party of 4 was able to just walk right in and get seated! Such a rarity in San Francisco!
Noeteca is a fantastic place for a fun night out! The food, drink, service and atmosphere are all fantastic!

Ordered the cheese plate. Food was great. Had lovely latte. Seemed over staffed-awkwardly standing around. very small space, seats about 20. Staff were standoffish, borderline rude. Wine selection was decent. No parking.
Ordered:
parking really really sucks in this area but the flambé is really good and so are the cheese plates, nice wine selection and the service is really nice. will definitely come back here again =)
A perfect lunch! Sunny Friday afternoon in Noe Valley. Not too much wind. A bowl of soup. Margherita, Glass of proseco. Every bite delicious. Perfect.

Very relaxing atmosphere. The food was extremely fresh and local. The cheese platter was delicious! It came with pepper jelly, assorted fruits and your choice of cheese and French bread. The margarita flatbread hit the spot as well. Loved the fresh heirloom cherry tomatoes. Would recommend this place if your looking for a light yet fulling meal.
Wonderful weekday lunch spot!  The pecan chicken salad is delicious as are the tartes flambees.  Good for meetings and working lunches. Service is impeccable.
Came in for an afternoon drink and bite and was very satisfied. Had a delicious croque Josephine with greens salad and a nice prosecco.
Croque Josephine is amazing and owner Alex is super nice.  Salads are delicious.  Beautiful raspberry snowball is a great way to end a meal.

Overall pretty decent but expected better. Went here on a Thursday night and was seated at the bar (which doesn't actually face the bartenders). I am honestly not sure if our waitress just thought we were getting drinks because after ~10 min of sitting, she took our drink orders, came back to drop off my glass of wine, and disappeared quickly without a word. Usually servers will ask if you're ready to order once they give you your drinks so I was kind of confused. Then I thought she would take our order at some point, but we sat around for another 10 minutes or so... she was walking around to other tables and then was at the register and we weren't acknowledged at all. I am unfortunately very grouchy when I'm hungry so I just walked over to the register and gave her our menus and asked to order--which I really shouldn't have to do at a restaurant like that. I don't know if i was just impatient/hungry and the service is usually at this pace? Who knows.
Simply an amazing French food experience.  It's a cosy cafe where I felt a little too gussied up wearing a dress, but I don't award points for pretentiousness.
Super delicious! Very fresh food and good service. The place is small and I would recommend it for lunch with a friend or brunch.
Great for brunch and dessert after dinner.
Went in hoping for more but was not disappointed either.

*Noteca if you are reading, hire me if you are looking. I read your bios and I share the same passion and drive for the excellent service and quality of food I received today at lunch. Or hire me after I've returned from training around the world.*
Been here twice. Once for lunch, another time for an early dinner.
The best service in SFO.
Best place in town, love the lengua tacos plenty of meat.
The tortilla & the rice made my simple, vegan burrito so incredibly flavorful! I can't wait to go back!
El is for the way you look at me
Love this place.  When u think of burrito, this is the standard.  I've never been disappointed and that sez loads.
Overrated! *Clap, clap, clap, clap, clap.
I can see and taste what all the hype is about this place.
I have this curse, where I cannot enjoy a Burrito from any Mexican restaurant, because I'll always think in my head "I would prefer Chipotle to this".
One of my favorite taquerias.

Asked for a breakfast burrito, no beans to go. Got home and found out I had a regular burrito (ie no eggs) with beans in it. I should have known something was wrong when the guy asked me what sort of meat I wanted, as the breakfast burrito always comes with churrizo, but I figured he was just offering a choice of meat. Considering the guy was talking to his buddy the entire time while taking my order, I should not be surprised. One star extra because this place is usually good, but they need to listen to what the customer asks for. Besides having al pastor meat, this burrito was not even close to what I ordered.
THIS IS MY ONE!
booooorritohz & tacos ^__^
AMAZING tacos, quesadillas and burritos - and for super cheap. The line gets crazy unless you're there in the middle of the day. Free chips and the portions are really generous.
Thank god, that places like this still exist in the city. One day it will all be brunch spots filled with obnoxious techies talking about work, and I dread that day.
One of my favorite spots in the city for a Burrito, especially after a night of late drinking or to grab a taco before going out.
Best burrito I have ever had! The tortilla, the meat, the ratio of rice and beans, the salsa...it was all perfect!
As if they need anymore reviews but hey, they're good. And cheap! What more could you ask for? My torta, side of grilled onions and aqua fresca were amazing! Def give this place a try!
Very authentic and delicious. The staff was quick and very friendly as well. I will definitely recommend this spot to anyone visiting SF.
After a night at Urban Putt, we wanted a quick bite and decided on this spot. There was a line out the door! I'm pretty sure it's because of the acclaim they've received for their burrito.

Super burrito al pastor is always fantastic. My friend got a plato de carne asada and that looked awesome too. Also enjoyed the salsa bar. Solid solid Hispanic fare at a great price. The staff is always really nice too.
Ok the Burrito was good. But I mean, a burrito is a burrito right? The place is very dirty and has a bad smell.

Vegetarians have significantly fewer options here, but what we had was okay. I had the super veg burrito, which had a few extra things not on the regular veg. It wasn't nicely organized - some bites were just dry rice and beans, while others were a mouthful of only sour cream and avocado (the second one isn't such a bad thing). My black beans were also a tad undercooked. The salsa choices were tasty and helped those dry bites significantly.

I got some kind of meat burrito, and it was delicious! The burritos come with plenty of avocados, beans, rice. The burritos were very well wrapped-- just don't be like me. You should apparently peel the foil off in strips as you eat your way down the burrito.

I usually don't go for Mexican food. It is not on my list of favorite food varieties. I just don't usually like corn, including corn tortillas and corn chips, I can't eat refried beans, and there is never enough spice or flavor other than maybe cilantro, lime, and salt. That being said, every now and then I get in the mood for a burrito. It is just such a convenient meal.

NOMS. Enough said. No but really though - do I really need to make a review for El Farolitos since everyone should know that this place is a MUST GO for anyone that likes mexican food. Or even.. any kind of food in general.
There was once upon a time, not too long ago, when my standard for a satisfying Mexican meal was a Chipotle burrito. How cute.
I seriously dream about their al pastor burrito. Just typing that made me hungry and now I'm pissed that I'm in Oakland and not SF to grab one!
Their grilled shrimp burrito is off the hook.   I wish it could appear on a magic carpet right now...
Sober or not, El Farolito serves up THE BEST carne asada super burrito in the Mission.  It fulfills all of my burrito success criteria:
Cash only. Really nice guys and glorious food--especially partial to the veggie burrito and their enchiladas.

What can I say about El Farolito that has not already been said?  The carne asada super burrito changed by life.  Now every burrito I have is compared to it, and none have come even close.  The meat is generous, flavorful, tender, and surrounded by salsa, beans, rice, cheese, sour cream, and (the best part) fresh avocado.  It's the size of a baby.
This review is directed only towards the steak burrito.
I have been lucky enough to try a variety of Mexican places all over California and as much as my friends from San Diego try to fight me on this, NO PLACE TOPS EL FAROLITO.

So good!  I love their quesadilla super suiza.  It's loaded with meat and all sorts of good stuff.  It's perfection and served piping hot and everything is creamy and melts in your mouth delicious.  Tacos and burritos are also  good.  Portions are undeniably generous and prices are more than reasonable.

Food is best Mexican I ever had. I ordered the steak suiza, it was prompt, you can watch them make it, the staff were not friendly but the prompt service made up for it. Place was packed and that must be a good sign. They are open late.
The... Best... After club/bar drunk burritos ever. Steak and shrimp burritos are to die for. Line gets really long after 1am so beware
Great food!! Had super burrito best I've had in a while good service in a timely fashion

I've been coming here for about 20 yrs. Best in the bay area hands down I've tried taquerias from just about every city in the the bay. I like Mexican food, it's like comfort food lol. But I will travel from Sacramento to get a super steak burrito, with killer green sauce on the side in a heartbeat.

If you want an excellent burrito this is your place! Especially if you need a late night fix. The service is quick, and the food is always fresh. Just delicious! The portions are huge, and worth every penny!
Oh El Farolito... this place is just the mecca for drunchies, late night cravings, mexican food cravings, and everything else in between those things.

Great community space filled with chill people, local artwork, and delicious snacks. From the sandwiches to the homemade poptarts, there are great times to be had at Mission Public. It's an extremely well kept and clean cafe with really friendly staff behind the counter.

Authentic, hip deli with seasonal beer that will rock your palate. Try the upper parking lot sandwich...Dijon heaven!!! Salads too are super tasty- organic ingredients and hefty portions to leave you satisfied.

There's nothing cooler than a cafe that serves great coffee in the morning and wine and beer at night. Mission Public is just such a place.  We happily stumbled upon this place on our way to a Litquake event, and decided to stop for a bite to eat.  We both ordered a Reuben sandwich and a Limonata.  We didn't order wine or beer because the event we were heading to was going to serve wine. The owner pointed out that it was still Happy Hour and that there are drink specials for HH.  We told him we will happily return for HH at another time.
Solid. Killer people, mellow vibe. Everything you need, nothing you don't.
Food was ok but nothing special. Atmosphere is sort of meh. Overall I was disappointed.
All people are friendly, good food, great location and no one can beat the grilled cheese with Tapatio.
Smellsssss sooooooo yummy I had to try! Amazing :) and the prices are a steal for good quality food!

This place was awesome. The food was good and the service was amazing! Four of us sat and had sandwiches and bottomless mimosas. Their menu of sandwiches was pretty large and offered all sorts of options. They also have a great wine & beer menu. I agree with another Yelper who mentioned that it creates the perfect cafe + coffee shop + beer experience.

This cafe is a great place to hang out! They have books and games and friendly staff. Just a warning - all the beers they have seem to be very hoppy, which is great for me, but not so great for the less hoppily-inclined.

Hot day in the Mission needing food. Decided to head back here. Great choice. Yes there are a lot of aces to eat but I made a great choice..great food and service and the coldest beers on tap.. Happy belly and mind..
As a former vegan the "cheating vegetarian" sandwich was a given! Cool place, nice beer, good service! Sat for an hour just to listen to all the Neil Young tracks they where playing!
Hipster cafe to the max.
love the food the staff  the beer always cold and my favorite  is  the blt or the grilled cheez on a chibata  bread with bacon yummmmmmm check this place out

Very cool cafe.  I went here for coffee while waiting for my truck across the street at Ken's wheel service.  The morning guy with the goatee there was very friendly.  No espresso drinks, but very good drip coffee and free refills for me.

My new favorite spot to grab a cold beer and some great foods in the mission! The staff is excellent, the food is fresh and prepared right in front of you, the coffee is excellent and the beer selection is pretty vast for the size of the place.
Delicious sangwiches, delicious beers, and great deals. Absolutely wonderful, laid back vibe, but in a beautiful wood and chalkboard-themed hole in the wall. Love love love!!!
I wandered in for a meeting and the guy took one look and asked me if I wanted a cup of coffee.

This place is the bestest. Ran by locals, good sandwiches, good beer, good space to hang out in. They've served me well for everything from lunch with the parents, weekend laptop campouts, Monday evening beer with a friend, and a Thursday night bottle of wine with my girlfriends. Mission Public will welcome you no matter what the occasion is. Such a great addition to our neighborhood.
It looks like a nice little place for lunch. The inside is neat and clean.

I've been here a couple of times now. Each time I've had a sandwich and a beer. It's nice that the best tables at the windows are reserved for people who are not on the computers. The atmosphere is nice, it's a little on the hipster side but not overly so. Service has always been excellent, friendly, and quick. The food is fantastic and they have a good variety of beer on tap. I'll definitely be going back.
DELICIOUS sandwich, super nice counter guy, he filled my glass of wine way up to the top and it was a real chill atmosphere in there. A weird location kind of but an oasis in the midst of tire shops.
Delicious and quick eats for cheap. And the staff is super awesome.
Nice ambience! Friendly people, but:
This place is basically a slightly fancier Clare's Deli.

I was very impressed by the service and food of Mission Public. Albeit the name is a little confusing, and doesn't really indicate that it is a coffee shop, cafe, and bar. After telling the server that it was my birthday, he immediately went and filled up a glass of their finest beer, and insisted that this one was on them. Anthony was as pleasant as can be and made me feel right at home.

Awesome neighborhood bar run by folks who actually live around the corner. So nice to have a place so close to home where beer is less than $10 a pint and the meal portions are generous. MP is a fantastic down-to-earth, inviting, and welcome alternative to the pretentious and overpriced Armory Club up the street.

If you want to grab some good grub with some spirits and free wifi, look no further.  This is the place to chill in the Mission with good food, snacks and music.  If you can't choose from their list of sandwiches, try the Chicken No Name, which comes with a side salad seasoned to perfection with just the right amount of dressing.  Try their tarts from a local bakery to sweeten your day.
I hope this place stay as a low key local place. Really friendly staff. Good selection of prohibition beer on tap, and a good list of sandwiches.
After walking around the mission fort hours in search of a good brunch, we ended up here out of desperation. Awesome decision!
The food is horrible, the staff is the worst. No one should ever go here. I wish they were open on Sunday, so that I could choose not to go. God I love these guys.
Great atmosphere and great service. Food was very unique, and worth the trip there.

Don't come to my coffee shop, it's mine. They make off menu sandwiches for me and pour me free refills. They can't possibly extend this behavior to others, so please stay at your Starbucks or Philz and don't come enjoy a place with real personality, a great menu, interesting people and good coffee. Stay away.
Pretty quiet on a Saturday night. Food is amazing and internet is fast. Love this place!
great lunch spot

Superchill deelicious cozy friendly place that is (as of now) a hidden gem in the neighborhood. Great beer and wine selection plus kickass coffee and toasty sandwhiches (spelled that way because they are ones WHICH are droolworthy). Did i mention great music, art and a very entertaining staff? I like to look at the dummy that looks like Charlie McCarthy sitting next to skull art.
Cute place to sit y have a cup of jo :)
This place is the JAM! Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! I HIGHLY recommend it to everyone! Hipsters stay out!

So impressed with this place. Fantastic cozy vibe with some rad art and lots of natural wood. Check it out soon before it has a line out the door. Lots of local ingredients it seems. Artisan poptart, 2 breakfast clubs with avocado, 3 cups of coffee for about $20. Try and get the table by the two giant windows.
I like it!! I walked in hungry and disoriented, after a yelp search I decided that a breakfast club sandwich would satiate my hunger, plus my kicking baby signaled that it was time to eat!
Great place to chill, enjoy a sandwich and a cool libation.

I have a special place in my heart for 20 Spot. I stumbled upon this cozy, classy wine bar one day by chance and found myself imbibing in a glass or two (maybe 3) of really good wine. The manager, who I got to chatting with, was a total gem, as was the rest of the staff. All smiles, wonderful personality, the type of place you want to roll into after a long day of work to enjoy ambience, a fantastic glass of vino and light bites such as their amazing deviled eggs! 2 thumbs up!
Really Good.
My favorite little wine bar in the mission!  Great vibe that is both chill and fun, perfect for dates!  Great wine, and food is amazing too!  Try the cheese plate, deviled eggs and oysters!
The vibes of a laid back coffee shop, universally liked music from a record player, and the menu of a wine bar. I'm in.
We were there on Halloween just last week and the food was spot on amazing! A bit hard to find but well worth it - cool atmosphere - cool music - awesome food.

Nice cozy wine bar. Good food and wine selection. Especially, we like an ambiance there. It made us feel comfortable! All of us enjoyed the night there and good people except only one waitress. She was always in a rush to clear all plates, no smile, unfriendly. Unfortunately, this was a big minus for our Friday night.

The 20 spot is a great place to go and have good wine, great company, and yummy bites to eat while in the Mission. The staff is always amazing and will always give good recommendations on the current wine selection. The ambiance is very relaxing. They even play good music from vinyl. Highly recommended!

It's a rather small tasting menu but everything on the menu was quite spectacular.  The deviled eggs were so creamy that it melted right on my tongue.  By far the best vegetable Ratatouille I've tasted in a very long time.  The vegetables were perfectly stewed and the sauce was tasty, savory, and paired fantastically with my exotic red wine.  Come early because this place gets extremely packed after 8pm.
Stopped in for a drink before dinner and found a winner!

This is one of those places you don't want to review because when it blows up, well, you know the story. That said, this is my new favorite place to go in The Mission. It has everything I'm looking for, a knowledgeable staff that knows and cares about the food and wine(which has been excellent every time I've been ;3x), coupled with a laid back but really polished environment. What really makes this place however is that I really feel the owner and staff really appreciate my business, not just my money, but good customers who want to have a good time. Lastly, the music is always really, really good, which for me can make or break any establishment.  I'm actually finishing this review and heading out to the 20 Spot.
Dropped by here after a disappointing meal elsewhere. Snagged a spot by the door for the desserts. Cool vibe, nice people and absolutely amazing desserts. Will come back and try the meal next time.
Cute little wine bar with a somewhat mod/mid century vibe. Came here with some friends on a random weekday night around the time of its opening in fall 2013.
Warm, cozy, a bit loud, not cheap, not huge food portions.  Better for a glass of wine with a date than a conversational dinner with friends.
Have been here several times now and thought it time to share its goodness (& hope this doesn't backfire into me not getting the coveted Eames rocking chair spot in the window on a busy night).
Might be one of my favorite new spots. Cozy, great lighting, great vibe, friendly staff, and delicious food and drink!
20 Spot is a cozy little wine bar perfect for a date or a small group of friends.  A little get together over some wine and small bites after a long day of work is always a nice touch before bed.

Dropped in on a Monday night to get a little wine and a light nosh at an affordable price. Turns out Monday was $20 off a bottle of wine, so we got a nice French red, a cheese plate, olives, and caviar for about 60 bucks. Bravo.
Lovely historic setting and waitstaff made us feel like family. Ambience, wine quality, and the delicious smorgasbord of appetizers were all excellent. Looking forward to my next visit.
I had a great night at 20 spot. It's not cheap but I thought the food was excellent and the service was better. The atmosphere is intimate but upbeat.
Every single thing is delicious including the desserts. Get the mussels and burrata though.
My new favorite wine bar!!  Love the atmosphere, food and wine.
I love the decor and intimate atmosphere, and the service was excellent with personal attention from the lovely husband and wife owners.

I loved this place. The food was really delicious, my sparkling wine was excellent, and we could actually have a conversation! I love a corner of the world where you can unwind and the noise level is reasonable. It's a rare find.
definitely a fan of this place. Service was wonderful, wine list was really great and the pork soup was delicious! Gluten and Dairy free so extra good in my eyes!
love it! the bar bites are top notch as is tgeir drink selection. i love the atmosphere and neighborhood feel. xo.

I absolutely love this little place! The decor is warm and cozy, but the vibe is chill! I was blown away by the delicious wines, particularly the unusual  white wines by the glass, including a yummy Marsanne Rousanne from California. The food is also great - though the menu is somewhat limited,.  We've had hamachi and avocado, mussels in whte wine, creamy burratta with asparagus, and  an amazing chocolate dessert.  The service is warm, friendly, and professional.  Can't wait to go back.
"CUTE"
I had a splendid birthday dinner here w/ the bf. The service was awesome, & the vibe is lively but not too loud, relaxed but still nice (I'd feel comfortable dressing up or down).

This is a great spot for a glass of wine!  We stopped by around 9:30pm on a Saturday night, were greeted by a warm, inviting atmosphere that was not too crowded.  The bartender was awesome, and let us taste a few different wines before we made our selections.  Our wines were great, and we loved the record collection and music.  We'll be back!
Awesome local neighborhood place. Have been four times and keep heading back there.
My favorite wine bar in the Mission, without a doubt!

Great first date spot or hang w/ pals and actually hear each other spot. Cozy - not too hipster-y. Excellent small but unique wine list. First-rate service. Snacky snacks are little inconsistent but I appreciate the healthier wine bar offerings. And I dig the tunes.

So I really wanted to like this place, however, I don't think I'll be back. The bread was good, but not amazing. The hamachi was good, but it vanished from our table (i'll get to that shortly). The wines were tasty, but pricey comparatively.

Great ambiance and wine selection. Pretty small and intimate space. Came here with a large party and there were not many tables besides us. Menu is good but not extensive. Really good cheese plates (fruit, nuts, vegetables), mussels, deviled eggs, bread and butter. Don't go if you are really hungry- more of a nibbling place.
Very nice interior, I loved the wine, the service was good, what we ate was tasty if a little lite size-wise.
Excellent wines, amazing food. Had a great chat with John about many things, including grat wines and food pairings.

It was ok. I was not impressed by the pricing nor the food/wine. I do like the location and the inside is very cute, but overall, I would not recommend this place to a friend nor would I go again myself. It's just overhyped (am I old?)

20th Spot is such a sweet wine bar! The selection is great, and the small plates they serve are carefully curated and prepared. The cheese plates are very reasonable in price and generous in portions. I love the mid-century furniture they have, and they have done a great job of creating different spaces in the restaurant that serve various purposes. For example, you can curl up on the couch for more intimate conversations, sit at the bar with a good book, or come in with a group and have a lively discussion around the table. The staff are warm and extremely knowledgeable--they know about their wine and they want to share their expertise.

First time.  You will likely spend a lot more than a 20 spot, but you will have some great drink, eats, and excellent service.  The staff is obviously happy doing what they do.  Cool atmosphere.  We had the Hamachi, Trumpet Mushroom, Beets and Burrata, and one other dish.  All were very good, but the Trumpet mushroom was my favorite.
A wonderful bar with great service and a good ambiance. It was bustling till about 11:30-a nice little spot to have a good ol' time!

My great grandma took me for the first time the day I learned how to make tamales.  This is the only place I will buy my masa from.  It holds a special place in my heart, and gives me a piece of my Nana every time I go there, and make tamales with their masa.

So I am embarrassed to admit that I never tried a Mission burrito when I lived in SF years ago. I was visiting the Bay Area this October and decided to add that to my SF must do list for the weekend. My friend who has lived in the Bay Area forever recommended this place. She said it was her favorite burrito spot in the neighborhood.

Best birria in San Francisco, plus fresh masa, habanero salsa, and great guacamole! Their chips are among the best in the City, and their menu options are  plentiful. On weekends you can ameliorate your hangover pains with their menudo!

Horrible customer service the woman at the cash register treats you like you're having a free meal so I went to a different one to get salsa because it's not exposed so when I ask her she try sell me one from the  grocery store which shares the space, no inside sitting the most of the menu is precook which is not a good for mex food (it's exactly when you see premade pizza) the tortillas are ok if you never had one before but that they're  taste like they're made with us ingredients..

After years of going to la Palma and other spots I can say with certainty this is the greatest burrito I have ever have.  Fresh made to order tortillas with amazing meat and a ton of veggies. Perfect * * * * *
best fresh tortillas! the tortillas melt in your mouth. the food is great too. i like that they have tables outside for you to sit and enjoy the food. it's also cool that its a tortilla factory.

Found a parking spot right out front so gave this place a shot. The real deal authentic food. I ordered a torta from a photo i saw near the counter... Wow. Torta cubana - buttered & grilled fresh baked bread, refried beans, sausage, bacon, fried chicken, melted cheese, jalapeño, avocado, queso, tomato, lettuce. Lucky to make it out alive, ha! Would go back no questions asked.

THE BEST EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I usually go to Pancho Villa's on 16th. St. for tacos. I buy Sopes & Pupusas & Tamales here!! THE BEST IN THE CITY OUTSIDE OF MEXICO!!  I lived in Mexico City!! BEST home made flavor!!! Buy the hand made tortillas, some green salsa, Queso Fresco, and Carnitas. Take them home. Heat the meat & torts. Put the meat in the torts w/ salsa, queso (cheese) and get ready for a "Food-Gasim!"

Once again, chicharrones are addictively outstanding. Salsa teriffic, chips mega fine. But we found a new use for one of their staples, homemade tortillas. Great appetizer, cut in triangles top with roasted duck with hoisin and soy sauce, crema with  cilantro and green onions, bake at 350 for a few and serve. Used the same tortillas with queso fresco and romano, pickled peppers and green onions and roast for a bit. Serve all with farmers market sauteed and salted padron peppers, watermelon radishes. Ahh, three day weekend!

This is my all time favorite Mexican joint! I absolutely love their Roasted Chicken Super Burrito with everything. They make all their food items in house --- the tortilla is made fresh to order --- so everything just tasted THAT much better!!

Delicious assortment of Mexican food in a carry out setting.  Like many have said, the homemade tortillas are definitely one of the draws.  Getting the taco on a homemade tortilla is definitely worth it.  The carnitas are a little greasy but very tasty.  This is a great spot to pick up provisions for a tailgate or for a group watching sports.

I was really excited to try some tamales here, as I was visiting from Boston, where a decent tamale is hard to come by. Since I was on vacation, I decided to go all out: I got the green chile + cheese, pork, and beef tamales. Unfortunately, all three were awful - I actually prefer those little frozen varieties I buy from Trader Joe's! I would not recommend this place at all for tamales. If you must come here for whatever reason, please try something else.

Best place on mission , I think ! They're nachos are so good and their pupusas are huge if u normally get two somewhere else just get one here that's how big they are! I travel all the way from Richmond jus to get MASA from this place for tamales or tortillas !!!! Definitely recommend this place

Y'all know what a delicatessen is?  It's a term meaning "delicacies" or "fine foods, or specially prepared food. La Palma is just like that but the Mexican equivalent.  It's a Mexicatessen, so much good looking baked goods, ready-made meats like chicharron, fresh made tortillas, and all the foodie eye candy I could handle.

Friendly service but the horchata is sickly sweet and the enchiladas were tasteless. We were offered a choice of mild or spicy. We both ordered spicy and both dishes lacked flavor. Will not return. Two stars for friendly service and bomb refried beans.  Enchiladas were also Luke warm.
The best burrito I've had in San Francisco and quite possibly my life.  This is the alpha-omega--the meaning of life.
Stepping into this Mexicatessen, I felt the homely taqueria shop that this place offered!

Fresh made tortillas are delicious and so good! I also got their guacamole salsa, regular salsa and fresh cheese (can't remember the name because it was eaten up so fast)! I will come back here again and again! Next time I'm going to try some of their other things I missed out on because I got there as they were closing. Yes, they do sell out of things.
Fantastic place for fresh tortillas, pupusas, huaraches, sopes, and all creations made with them. Great roast chickens too. Sweet and helpful people working behind the counter.

The food is pretty good at this place "normally" but the service horrible which made me give the place a 2 star. Last time we visited they totally forgot our order and when we asked 20 min later it was behind the counter COLD, suprise. They really could have re-done the items since the mistake was on them. We ate it anyways, cold and decided not to come back. Also this is more of a take to go, as the only seating it outside and often full.

I have lived in the city since 1986, how is it I have never been here before?  I bought a pound of carnitas to bring home, when my roomate tasted them, she cried, they reminded her of being back in Mexico.  I also bought some spinach tortillas (YUM) and fresh cheeses, guacamole sauce and sweet corn tamales (we have yet to try).  I will be coming back as soon as I can.  I want some corn tortillas and one of everything else!
Counter order, pickup, find a table...  No frills but food quality is very high.

Gorditas! A stuffed like pastry with your choice of meat and picante with cabbage, queso fresco and other fun ingredients. Trust that these are a must! I would definitely go for the carnitas, a heavenly marinated pork meat! Definitely go for 2, one is simply too little for this bite of deliciousness! ;)
an sf staple comparable to how bostons got legal & reginas, nyc has grimaldis & katz's, austin boasts stubbs & franklins and chicago w/al's or malnati's
Love me a good Mexicatessen. Everything's made in-house at La Palma, and everybody knows it.
The jello is super cool and yum.  Reminds me of the iris of an eye.
Best Mexican food EVER! I go here for lunch, dinner, parties, groceries, everything! I love this place!
Awesome Mexican deli! The tortas and burritos are delicious. I recommend trying the chicharrón (pork) sandwich
Must Try:

I ordered catered food from here over the weekend. I ordered the PQT#1 x2 and the PQT#2 x1 the pqt #1 was $79 each but i ordered 2 and the pqt #2 was $60 so about $210 out the door. for that the #1 came with 3 pounds of asada, 3 pounds of carnitas, rice, beans, guacamole, salsa, and grilled mexican style,onions  and a kilo of freshly made in house homemade tortillas for each meal and since i had 2 i had double all the portions the #2 had 3 pounds carne el pastor plus the above extras and they gave me a free whole chicken on the side. There is no easy way to describe the food but I will try.
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Everything I've had is delicious. Definitely try the chili verde.
Cheap and excellent tacos. They have a small outdoor patio as well.
Never really been to southern America, so I cannot tell you if it's authentic.
My favorite Mexican restaurant -- really more like the name says: a "Mexicatessen", since there is no seating. Be sure to pick up a tub of fresh guacamole.

Great service from staff in explaining what the vegetarian options were, quick service, good food & not expensive. They have many vegetarian options & will accommodate you easily for the items you want made vegetarian. They are very familiar with the ingredients as well. The menu is more than most authentic Mexican restaurants have as well. In addition, they sell Mexican food items that you can take home, like chipotle tortillas.
im a huge fan of mexican hole in the wall places to eat. this is a good example.
I asked for a pupusa with revueltas and got one with just cheese instead.  Not sure if this happened because I ordered towards the end of the day (5:40pm), but that's not acceptable.
I went here for lunch. The quesadilla was okay. There is no  seating though. They sell groceries and mexican food.

Woooooo. Man. Wow. I could eat here everyday. Well ok, I could but not for that long because my heart would eventually get clogged with chicharrones but the brightest stars also burn fastest. And this place shines.

I'm from Tucson, AZ and always trying to find authentic Mexican food in SF. This place hit the spot! The blue corn tamale is unreal, and flavorful. The staff is very accommodating and able to make recommendations.
My mouth is still watering from the memory of the cheddar bacon pierogi. Everything we tried was so delicious and comes with tasty little sides.
Great food, great service.

Love the Pierogi's. If 10 people walk in at once, it can slow down the service. Other than that, this is an awesome example of doing one thing really well. Love all the flavors, it just hits the spot. My hope is this place takes off and they can afford some back-up staff! That's all it needs to be a go-to spot in the mission. In the meantime, it's still my go-to.
If you want authentic pierogis with a modern twist, this is the place to go!!! This place has that  traditional polish taste to it yet it's cool and hip enough to blend with the mission crowd.
Good food reasonable prices. I tried the salmon mushrooms and dessert option three items all tasty fresh made good ingredients

My grandmother was this little Ukrainian woman from Poland so my youth was overflowing with Pierogi. They were a constant staple in our house and I haven't had anything close to the fresh ones she made since she passed away. I tried Stuffed for the first time tonight and was completely blown away! The pierogi were splendid and for a brief moment I was transported back in time. Will definitely become a regular place for me.

How this place has 4.5 stars, is extremely unclear. We made reservations and arrived Saturday night to only one dude working in the entire restaurant. Thus, we set up our own table (which consisted of chairs of varying heights and comfort), fetched our own glasses, etc. This wasn't a big deal at all, it was just odd how there was literally only one dude working here. And when you make a reservation, you kinda expect there to be a table set up.

Made from scratch including the fixings!  You will not be disappointed with any pierogi.  There's a passion that goes into making them that brings alive the authentic,  unforgettable taste.  Apple sauerkraut made with apples and cooked with agave plus a purple cabbage salad with it.  Even if you're not  from the Great Lakes region this is a 'must' taste.
This place is great, with a friendly staff and very reasonable prices! I love the mushroom piroshki!

It's something different in the Mission!  The pasta-like perogies are fun to mix and match, and won't break the bank.  We got there early and staked out a table out front.  Inside has counter seating.  Our party of 4 felt like being social, so we took our spot on the little patio out front.  We met the cook and the owner, and I gotta say that made the night really fun for us.  I give this place 5 stars because it's so dang unique, a gem of a place in the "casual dining" arena, the owners were over the top nice, the patio was comfortable, and we stayed for 3 hours without even knowing where the time went.  The food was good -- I really liked it -- but the evening was something I'll never forget.
I had the mushroom and the jalapeño pierogi's and the cucumber salad, and the sauerkraut was good too.
Did I ever mention that I was convinced I was part Polish when I was younger? Well, you can't ever go wrong with pierogis in my book, especially when you have so much variety.

Amazing stuff! Russian approved! Definitely get more than 1 pierog to fill up. I had the spinach mushroom one. All the sides are yummy as well. Lost a star because inside pierog was icy, but we came late so maybe it was poorly done. But it put a damper on a good meal.
The other reviews are right, you can't really go wrong with any of their choices.  The owner is super friendly and personable.

A gem in a sea of overpriced, underwhelming Mission restaurants. We had a delicious fun lunch: avocado and sausage pierogi, goat cheese and spinach pierogi, awesome sauerkraut and side salads. I had a $1 high life: you couldn't have picked a better option for me for a beer choice. And the owners listen to metal, hells to the yeah.

My partner and I went to Stuffed early in the afternoon for a pre-dinner snack of home made pierogies and found them to be authentic and creative as well as delicious. After a sit down dinner and a wonderful dance concert at ODC, we had a hankering for something else and made an instant decision to return to Stuffed for a meal with the sides. The owner/manager, Dana, is a friendly and charismatic woman who stood outside with us and talked about her background and how she and her partner came to create Stuffed. When we left we told her we would recommend her place highly to our friends so please go! She and her partner have been working very LONG days for over a year and if business picks up a bit they can hire another worker to ease the load.
Nice space, great pierogis! Sides ( sauerkraut and cabbage slaw) are awesome too! Will be coming back :)

Great, friendly service..and FANTASTIC food! My favorite pierogi was the bacon cheddar..and smoked salmon (hard to pick one). The slaw and apple sauerkraut were the best I've had of slaws and Sauerkrauts so far. Ambiance is clean-divey, but with clean bathrooms. Overall great experience and I'd come back again!
Awesome, tasted like a little piece of home. The ambiance, the service and the company was great, I will definitely come back for more. Thank you!!! From Poland with love.

I've never really had pierogi before but I've found out they are awesome!  Doughy, bacony goodness.  I especially like the spicy jalapeño ones.  Also, the beer selection is vast.  Eclectic but cheap and good.  A great find in the neighborhood.

45 minutes for our order (4 perogi and one salad) that came out wrong, with a dog running in and out of the kitchen area and filthy tables... Probably won't be back.  Also, the lack of an updates menu with items that weren't available was really frustrating.  Good luck Stuffed, you're gonna need it.

This place is great for $10 you get 2 pierogis. I think this place could kill it if they expanded the menu and made the pierogis the " we kick ass at" item and offer other items and weather the storm until you guys kill it. The owner has a good heart I hope you guys make it. The food is like what your friends mom would cook that you would want to come over for dinner when you were a kid....
This place is awesome! This restaurant is the passion project of the husband/wife duo that owns it. Service was friendly and quick.

This place is surprisingly delicious. It's a hidden gem in the neighborhood. The owners are really nice and service is fast. Overall I enjoyed their jalapeño pierogi and the borscht the most. Decent beer selection, nice service and great food. This has a become a hang out spot of mine.  Would recommend this place to anyone.

The owners, Dana and her partner, are the wait staff/cooks. They've put their heart and soul into this place, and it shows. She offered to refill our sides at no charge, no problem. Service is especially nice if you eat at the bar, a very "Cheers" feeling, with TV usually showing a sports game. Great selection of beer. Pierogis are comfort food -- my husband's favorite is Buffalo -- I loved the salmon, and it ties with the mushroom for my fave. The traditional is also great. O -- their cold asparagus side salad is a dream.
I stopped by for a quick dinner.  The pierogies are great, the sides are tasty and healthy and $3.00 Mimosas!!!  Conveniently located across from the BART station.  What a find.
Unrelated: I found a fabric store shopping bag in my grandma's attic with the address that Stuffed now occupies printed on it. Small world!

Fantastic food, great service. I tried them all and i love this spot. The buffalo is probably my favorite, but it is really hard to choose a favorite among all of the great pierogi offerings they give.

This was an amazing spot that I highly recommend to any perioge lover! Great selection, I would eat the 3 dinner plate again with avocado, mushroom, and goat cheese perioges all over again tomorrow. Great people, with Cleveland pride. I'll be back!

I could not even try their food. I and my friend showed up today during their business hours and... the place was closed! What a bummer. We drove all the way to the city, found parking, walked up to the place and this! Very disappointing.
I haven't written anything in awhile and with an extra day off of work I decided I had to write some stuff.  So what better stuff to write about than the great stuff they serve at Stuffed!
Tasty food and good service. They didn't seem to be doing much business when I was in on a Friday night so I hope they last.
i love perogies!!!

Cane here last night after bar hopping in the mission. Fun and casual spot for delicious eats. My boo and I shared three perogies: mushroom, bacon, and spinach & goat cheese. Perogies are essentially like large polish potstickers. The cook pan fried the perogies and the kitchen is completely open so you see all the action before your very eyes. My favorite was the spinach & goat cheese. I felt like the mushroom one was a little soggy due to the mushrooms releasing liquid while it cooked. The perogies also come with some relish sides and onions which are a nice complement. The cook/waiter took a few dollars off because they ran out of some sides. I thought that was really nice of him.
Gluten free fillings were tasty. Especially the spinach and goat cheese. But I can't recommend the bacon and cheese. Too salty. May need the wrapper...

Really enjoyed this place.  It's casual, the owners are super nice and great food.  I've never had a pierogis before so came in with an open mind.  Delicious.  They use seasonal ingredients to make the sides and salads too.

Wonderful experience - both outdoor and bar seating. Excellent food and a rich diversity in terms of what you get with your plate, colors, flavors. Definitely will be going back and taking friends. A must try in the city!

This place was pierogi heaven!  I LOVED it.  Can't wait to go back and try their other pierogi concoctions (had the mushroom, bacon/cheddar, and goat cheese/spinach). Delicious!  The side salads were divine, too. Go eat there NOW!
LOVE this place.  Great homemade non-greasy food and outdoor tables.  Dinner for $10.  Blueberry with homemade ricotta are a divine desert to finish off the meal.

Great location!  Being of eastern european decent and from Chicago I know what a pierogi is.  My wife and I stopped in for dinner and each had the three pierogi meal.  We tried a bunch of different pierogi, buffalo, bacon cheddar, spinach, goat cheese and enjoyed them all.  Each meal is also served with sauerkraut, your choice of cucumber or bell pepper salad and sweet red cabbage salad.  Everything was delicious.  in addition they have a nice selection of beers from cheap to fancy.  Can't go wrong with $3 for High Life tall boys.  Can't wait to go back!
One of the few restaurants on Valencia that quality matches price. Definitely check this one out.

Beretta is dim, sexy, and requires a hell of a wait, but the food is worth waiting for.  They don't take reservations for groups smaller than 6, but advertise a one hour 'place-holding' service if you call ahead.  Annoyingly enough, they don't actually answer their phones when they're busy (which is always), so that service is pretty defunct.
MM MM MMM.
Beretta is quite a classy joint that we picked based on the reviews and also the fact that I hadn't yet had my bougie pizza fix for the month.

Everything on their menu is fabulous! You can't go without ordering their mouth watering walnut bread with burrata cheese.  It is heavenly.  The cocktails are all delicious as well.  There is generally a long wait so I like to go with a large group and make a reservation.

First time I came here was with a date. Not a great first date place considering the music and overall noise level is pretty loud. But this time around, friends and I had our monthly dinner here and decided to ball out.

4 stars if you don't have to wait.  The dungeoness crab arancini balls were pretty good and the risotto was above average.  Pizza with arugula and prosciutto was pretty standard, but again nothing I'd ever wait more than 20 minutes for.  This place is in the Mission and super hipstery to say the least.  Again, I wouldn't wait for a table for this place, but then again there's very few places that I'd have the patience for that type of ridiculouslessness, especially in SF.
Loved the food here so much! Ordered the  Burrata Bruschetta, Walnut Bread, Mushroom Truffle Honey .... Arugula fennel Parmesan salad .... & veggie pizza.
Ate here with friends and was so stoked by the appetizers we offered.   All were flavorful and we had all of them.   Craft cocktails = so good and must do !   Going back 4 sure
Great spot!
YUM YUM YUM.   Best drinks in the Mission, and best pizza in SF (among other things).

I've only eaten here once but I wouldn't go back. A reservation for nine for a birthday celebration was seated at two tables separated by a giant wooden pillar, such that even with both tables pushed against it we were separated and effectively in two groups at two tables. The anti pasti we ordered was OK, but very overpriced for the tiny quantities. Sweet potato fries were soggy. And the squid ink risotto that three of us ordered was runny, tasteless slop. Pass.

This place is great. Ducked in here for a quick dinner before a Diwali party. We weren't super hungry but we got some delicious apps and shared them (the winter salad is absolutely fantastic) and a couple drinks. Their version of the Paloma was everything I wanted on that kind of dreary evening.

After being turned down by the snotty folks over at Foreign Cinema, we strolled over to Beretta. AWESOME place. Good vibe, good people watching and fantastic brunch. The frittata was one of the best I've ever had. The hostess was kind, gracious and welcoming. All three of us enjoyed our meal tremendously. Highly recommended for Sunday brunch!
We decide to go there for dinner because was 10pm and this was open till 1pm.

Service was good. We were immediately seated at what seems to be a busy hour for them. Decor is like shabby chic meets goth.  We ordered the margarita pizza, squid risotto, frittata, 5 variety meat plate, walnut bread mushroom truffle honey and the arugula Parmesan salad. Drinks: house made lemonade and ginger soda. Out of all the dishes I'd probably go back for the squid risotto and the walnut bread. Squid risotto dish was rich, creamy and filling.
