Walnut bread bruschetta was delicious and flavorful.
Carbo-loading before a race is ALWAYS a good idea - pizza, bread, pasta, come at me.

Came on a weeknight for a dinner and it was amazing. There was a 20 minute wait roughly but so worth it. The food was all delicious, the cocktails were great as well and it just felt like a really nice out. Highly recommended
Best thin crust pizza in the Bay Area - Hands DOWN!!! And major props for serving good late on week nights!!! Big ups and mad respect!

Really fantastic food, great service, and just a wonderful dining experience overall.  They don't make reservations for parties with less than 6 people so we called and hour ahead and got on the the list for dinner at 7:30.  We were seated by 7:45.

Great place but be warned they do not take reservations. I would suggest making a quick phone call in when you are 20-30 mins away and put yourself on the waiting list. The service was very personable and they made some great recommendations for food choices.

So I was told about this restaurant from one of the staff members at the B&B I was staying at.   I decided to go here as sort of my last great meal of the trip.    I had a rude experience with a #49 MUNI at 8:01 PM on 16th and Mission Street.    I wish I had gotten the license of that driver (I have some choice expletives but will refrain from typing them...if they're even allowed...*LOL*)  who chose not to open the very back bus door for me and then when I realized he wasn't going to open it, ran to the middle section where a couple passengers finished getting in, only to have that door slam on me and the ummm, ##@_!@!$*!, take off.    Yeah....I wasn't gonna let that experience ruin an otherwise great trip.    Moving on...sorta.
TRIPLE UPDATE.
I don't normally write reviews but when I do it's because they have good drinks and spicy meatballs.
They have a wonderful cocktail that is a margarita mimosa.  Excellent sweet potato with cheese dipping sauce and great meatballs.
UMM EFF YA!
Good Food,Good Drinks, Good Vibe.....Loved it.
I don't like the smug, judgmental face of that blonde hostess, or the way she stares at people on dates while setting places at the communal table.  Awesome food, though.  I'll be back.
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Whenever I have friends visiting we always make it out to Beretta and they are never disappointed.

Maybe the worst service, ever. I had been in on the previous Saturday and had a great round of drinks at the bar. I wanted to come back for dinner, so I popped in with a friend on the follwing Friday night. We arrived and were sat very quickly, only to wait. And then wait some more. And then wait for a second round of drinks. And then wait for our check, after we had to ask for it, THREE TIMES! As a former server, I also watched him to see if he was busy, and he casually walked around the small dining room many times in between our requests for the check. I get it if it was his last table and he didn't want another turn before closing, but come on, man! Service gets zero stars; food gets 3, and overall, they get 2.
The bartender was very friendly. I ordered the improved whiskey cocktail.
Not sure what people's obsession is with this place.
What an AWESOME spot for brunch! Affordable, no wait, great food. My personal entree was lackluster, but everything else made up for it.
We had a group of 6 and needed a place next to BART. Just a couple of blocks from Mission and 24th and a beautiful atmosphere!

Beretta has been on my bucket list forever, but the 2000+ reviews, no reservations, and guaranteed long waits scared me away. I finally took the leap and made it here for dinner a couple of weeks ago, and I'm so glad I did!

This place gets really busy! So try to make a reservation or be prepared for a wait. Went here on a Sunday night, and I was a bit surprised how busy it was. The pizza (hot salami, coppa, tomato, provolone & diavolicchio) was fab and well worth the wait. Service was fast (considering the busy-ness) and super friendly; the hostess was especially hospitable. I am also a fan of the arugula and fennel salad which - with the gnocchi - were great compliments with the pizza :)

After many attempts to getting a table here, I finally had the chance to do dinner. Though the house is always packed, and lines are out the door, I still think this is a five star establishment. The service is excellent, their servers are knowledgable of the menu and make great recommendations, and the food is super tasty! I really enjoyed the burrata mushroom appetizer and the chorizo pizza. I also tried a few of their cocktail drinks. So far I've liked them all!! Great drink lists paired with some fine food! :)

I had the pleasure of being taken to Baretta for brunch on my birthday by friends. The food was AMAZING and the service was impeccable. The staff made me feel really SPECIAL. A sweet girl who brought us all of our food recommended awesome dishes as well as wine/champagne and we were not disappointed! I really appreciated the extra attention I received on my birthday.

It's been here for a number of years.  I went back for the first time in 2 years and thought the food and wine selection continue to be excellent.  It's a lively place which means that it's best to keep the size of your party under 8.
WOW-everything was delicious! I was completely full, but didn't want to leave and end this amazing experience.

Mission Beach Cafe is close to Four Barrel Coffee, which is where you'll be spending most of your time while you're at Mission Beach Cafe. Don't expect anything under-seasoned. Toothsome, yes. Healthsome, no. I ordered the "vegan breakfast" and at the end I wanted to rinse the GFA BRANDS, INC Earth Balance Buttery Spread out of my mouth, except I couldn't no matter how much water I drank because water isn't fat soluble.
I had a pleasant brunch experience here, with no wait whatsoever because we came two minutes before closing on a Tuesday.
Please stop trying to memorize orders.  Write it down. It's quite obvious your memory sucks.

First time here and no complaints! Food was delicious, service was quick & not a long wait to seat. All men working were sweet and courteous. Parking socks like always but the HUGE  mimosa made up for it :)
So worth the wait!

I love this place! I was a bit hesitant to try at first cause the restaurant was really crowded and I've been relatively disappointed by some of the well-known brunch places in SF. Boy was I happy after trying the food.
Excellent brunch and lunch. Suggest a weekday lunch to avoid the weekend brunch lines!

Another 5 stars for you Mission Beach Cafe! Every dish I've tried has been nothing less than absolutely delicious. The service is impeccable and always friendly. If you don't want a long wait on the weekends then come right when they open, otherwise you're looking at anywhere from half an hour to almost two. But even if you do end up waiting, it's SO worth it!!! If you come during the week, you'll be seated within 30 minutes.
I've only been here twice because the wait is so long for brunch, but if you have the time I highly recommend this place. It's totally worth the rate! Top 5 brunch places in the city.
A wonderful gem in the mission. You really can't go wrong with the MBC pancakes, english muffin egg sandwich, or the MBC huevos. They do huevos with Prather ranch pulled pork like no other!
3 stars for the little bugs flying in the pastry case.  Yuk.
Delicious brunch! The burger I had was one of the best and my girlfriends eggs Benedict tasted great! The room is small and plain but the service was good!
Felt sick after Crab Benedict. Waiter first forgot milk, than almond milk was bad. Not the greatest atmosphere to wait an hour for. Don't understand the hype about this place.

Definitely one of the best breakfast restaurants in San Francisco, but be prepared to brave waits well over an hour on the weekends between 10am and 1pm. So come early or late. Dinner here is awesome too and busy, just not as crazy as Saturday and Sunday "Hipsterville Crazy". It's well with it. The Benedicts and crispy potatoes are spot on and the in house fresh baked pastries as well. Excellent!

I found a foreign object in my breakfast. The second time I've been there that they brought me food with something that was not meant to be consumed. They botched the opportunity to be a good host and still charged me. Garbage.
Great dinner!

Very nice place for breakfasts during weekdays, but something crazy is going on there on weekends-- you come there for breakfast but you find place when its time for lunch already. Food is always amazing though.
I come here for 2 things: french toast & mushroom benedict w/ truffle fries.

weekday brunch and finding no wait...small cozy cafe diner...little cramp and close seating to neighboring tables...table for four quite small, but manageable...service friendly and relaxed...water for the table and request for drinks taken..not ready and no feeling of being rushed...second visit and ordering just coffee...ready to order and taking the benedicts and a quiche...an alan quiche to be exact...alan taking ownership for the quiche assumed...the quiche was soft, moist and perfect...nothing bold or new in taste...just a perfect creation and construction...made on a flaky buttery pie crust...side of simple salad provided...this $10 alan quiche was simply very well made....the mushroom benedict $13.50 cooked to perfection..truffle hollandaise sauce was delicious..the benedict wasn't drowning in sauce...the eggs were perfect...smooth creamy yolk center...not oozing, but near thick honey consistency...just marvelous with the crispy fried potato cubes...the bottom muffin slightly more dense and chewy, but holding nicely against the hollandaise sauce...black forest ham benedict just as perfect at $14 for ham lovers...$17.50 per person total for simple brunch...saving the mimosa for a weekend visit...
Yum!!!!

Mission Beach Cafe has easily become one of my favorite brunch spots in SF.  I came here on a Tuesday afternoon so there was no wait! :) We got seated right away and started off with mimosas of course.  Besides your typical oj & champagne combo, they have different blends such as pomegranate and orange or pomegranate and grapefruit.  They also give you the option to have a small or a large glass.  The bigger the better! haha I tried the pomegranate and grapefruit blend and my girlfriend had the pomegranate and orange juice.  Both were good, but I think I liked mine a littttle more.  For the entree, I had their wild mushroom benedict and it came with a side of potatoes.  SO GOOD! You can taste the hint of truffle and usually I feel a slight emptiness when I don't have meat in my meal, but this definitely satiated my hunger.   The only bad thing about this place is that it could be a huge pain finding parking near here.

Would give 10 stars if I could. This place is so consistently good, and has been for years! Their brunch is top notch, comes out quick, and is worth a 1+ hour line (which there always is on weekends rain or shine)

Definitely not good enough to wait 45 minutes for brunch. I had the crab Benedict and a grapefruit juice. The grapefruit juice was good. Place is crowded. Server forgot to give me a knife. On a well located sunny corner.
The mimosas were amazing, duck confit hash was mind blowing. Small area, so try to get a reservation ahead of time. But well worth thebwait

Wow! This place is amazing! I had the duck confit and it was delicious! I love runny egg yolks and unfortunately mine was not quite as I like it, but after I started eating I didn't even notice. My husband had French toast, scrambled eggs and sausage and was raving! The blue bottle coffee is great and the fresh pastries looked beautiful. I can't wait to go back and try the Benedict!

Go early before 10am or late after 1pm... Otherwise be prepared for an expectedly long wait since its so good here! Luckily, it's an easy walk from BART or MUNI. I've only been twice, but I've loved it here both times. The french toast is amazing - a thick stack with sweet syrup. I've also tried the mushroom benedict, which is great if you're looking for something more savory. Can't wait to go back!

Oh good grief, you guys. Weekend brunch in the Mission is a complete nightmare. You know it isn't like this in other cities, right? Is it part of the Bay Area ethic? Prestige for pain? My friends and I were a large party, and we had a hell of a time getting a table for Saturday brunch. There was a rude hostess at Radish who treated us like idiots for putting our name down on the list (where she told me to put my name down when I dared to address her), then a ridiculous prix fixe requirement at Tartine. By the time we got to Mission Beach, we thought odds were even we'd get bounced. Thankfully, the host was really really nice, and the wait was fair. Thirty minutes, maybe.

Went here today with my toddler and husband's family.  No high chairs available, but they do have a staff that's very friendly to toddlers (i.e., no one turned their nose up when we said "four adults and a 15 month old").  Food was rich, but quite tasty. Eggs were perfectly cooked, and I felt like I got quite a bit of food for the price.  Truffled fries were fantastic!!  If I'm in the city on a Monday, and Plow is closed (love them), I'd definitely go back!
Great little cafe we stumbled upon with a solid cappuccino! Very friendly and helpful, both staff and customers! Great little brunch spot and will come again!!

Really more of a 3.7 or so.  Came here for brunch/lunch on Sunday around 1.  The wait list looked daunting with a ton of names, but it went fairly quickly and we were seated within 20 minutes.  Their huge mimosas are a great deal and are delicious; our table of 4 all had the orange pomegranate.
Coming here for a weekend breakfast? F your life cause you will have to put your name on the clipboard and wait 1 hour....but once you sit its not that bad!

This place was exceptional last week by not only the service but the food expectations blew my mind! Our wonderful server Addie was more then helpful with my picky date and made our experience very welcoming. I ordered the chicken sandwich that sounds simple but had an amazing aoli spread to it that made is mouth watering. Highly recommend for the overall quality. I will be back next week!
Great for vegetarians, not as great for vegans. But hey, that's tough to do.

A 5-star brunch is a Saturday morning well-spent. Brunch at Mission Beach Cafe has the ideal San Francisco casual-yet-trendy vibe. They serve up traditional brunch items (toast, pancakes, benedict, eggs, etc) with a modern culinary twist. The line scattered across the benches on either side was daunting, but we only waited about 20 min for a table of 3. And yes, let's commence the food...

One of the best eggs benedict I have ever tried. Veg huevos was very nice and an unusual thing to have on american brunch menu. Mushroom Benedict wins the show. We tried almond croissant, I loved it, my wife found it ok.

This place is the sheeeeit.   Read the reviews for brunch spots.   Started trying diff places out.   MBC has always been on top of my list but drive by and the line is around the bldg.....   Finally found a weekday off hour to drop in and Whaaaaaat?!!!   This place is amazing from food to service to decor.   Thanks to Addie we scarfed, laughed and got some exceptions done.....thanks again ADDIE!!!!    We inhaled the Huevos rancho with pulled pork (Ehrme-gerd....WOW)...chicken sandy was wuhhhowwwww....pomegranate mimosa was yummmmmin as well.
Mushroom eggs Benedict hands down best I've ever had, perfect balance of truffles, not too much sauce, poached egg was spot on.

The breakfast and brunch here is amazing. Im lucky my grabdma lives across the street and I'm only ever in SF on vacation so I can go on week days.  I've had their benedicts (delicious, fresh and creamy hollandaise sauce) and the wild mushroom one is so tasty although I may be biased because I love mushrooms.
I hate to give 2 stars to this place because it used to be my favorite brunch place, until this past weekend.
Orange-pomegranate mimosa - delicious.
Beautiful restaurant. It's very spacious and modern. For my birthday I got a table upstairs where I got a clear view of the downstairs.

Been meaning to write this for sometime now ....this place is just simply always "AMAZING!!!"  and more importantly consistent.  The wonderful atmosphere is always buzzing and alive with energy and the beautiful lighting and attentive service makes it a pleasure to dine here and I've been coming here since it opened several years ago. You have to try the to die for short ribs, pork chop, amazing desserts, delicious sides, the ceviche and delectable drinks! It's a great place to have a birthday celebration and a large group of friends celebrating for any occasion. Though I will note that on a recent birthday celebration back in August there was a bit of a disappointment when we left a hand picked bouquet of flowers given to a family member for their birthday and we called immediately and they said they would hold them pick up the next day but they never did this as promised by management. Seemed to be a result of a lack of communication and information being passed on from one shift to another and that's something that maybe they could just improve on to train their staff better for dealing with situations such as that...other than that the food is excellent!. Afterwords head upstairs to the outdoor bar El Techo for some kick ass margaritas as you sit overlooking a Beautiful view of the city.
Lolinda has been my go-to dinner/drinks place for a while now, but I recently had a very disappointing experience:
Amazing service, excellent food. Romantic ambiance  - everything lived up to our expectations.
Great food and beautiful space.  Just felt a little bit cold when we went.  Drinks are great and all the food we ordered was tasty and well balanced.  Service was attentive.
Omg. This place is AMAZZZINNNGGGG.
Great Reds, Lesser Fish and Instant Tres Leches
I love El Mission dining, and Lolinda doesn't dissapoint.  The waitress was charming and helpful. The ambience was classy, chill and dimly lit. Service was excellent.
Fantastic food...I will definitely be going back! YUM

This place was amazing brought my roommate for her birthday and she showed up an hour late but luckily they were very accommodating and let us have a large table and just let us know the next reservation was 8:45 which gave us plenty of time to order.  Had a lot of food and was reasonably priced.  I would definitely return here again, amazing service and food as well as atmosphere.
The food was very tasty and nicely presented. A lot of lime flavours and although being a steak house, vegetables were featured in one of our smaller plates as well as ordered separately.

Beautiful environment, great food and service is Lolinda. We shares small plates and the pork chop. The pork chop was probably the most tasty, succulent and amazing pork chop I have ever eaten. Kudos to great service, atmosphere and food.
One of the best dining experiences I've had in San Francisco. Out waitress was friendly and bubbly and made the experience a lot of fun and enjoyable. Service was prompt and very attentive.
Love this place, went here multiple times, and one of my favorites for out of town visitors!
Lolinda is a must go!

I fell in love with the ceviche. IN LOVE. great cocktails, excellent food. perfect for small and large groups, you just pick a couple small plates per person and share. cool decor too. I love the food so much I can ignore that the first time I came we got pretty not great service and keep going back for that DAMN INCREDIBLE CEVICHE.

Food was absolutely delicious! I am vegetarian and my sister is vegan and we had so many delicious vegetable dishes at this steakhouse. Grilled artichoke, dino kale dish, corn empanadas, hearts of palm salad, quinoa salad. Service was so-so but food and decor made up for it. Will definitely go again.

I am fan only because of the food. Do not come here thinking you will eat a lot, it's small proportion platters with decent drinks. I do enjoy the decor and ambiance. My company has hosted a party at their premises and it was delightful at that time.

I had heard of this place for awhile, and finally got the chance to try it out! I was surprisingly able to make a reservation for 6 online just the night before, which was a pleasant surprise. I wasn't sure if this place would be good for groups, but they were able to handle us very well. In fact, there were several other larger groups there, as well.

One of the few tapas style restaurants that I actually enjoyed dining at. I made reservations a few weeks ahead of time, and was able to get an early time slot on a Sunday night after a Giants game. The restaurant was mostly empty since they just opened, and we were seated right away. We ordered:

mmmmm legit. I am obsessed with spanish tapas. nom. Street parking is tough to find and it can be a bit shady in the perpendicular streets so just make sure to lock up. So I read that there is bar sweating and a communal table. I assumed that you can just walk in and sit there and order food. Correction. You can sit at the bar without reservation and just snag some seats. The communal table is like any other table and you need to put your name down for that. It is just that you will be sharing the table with others. Luckily I was able to grab the last two seats and it was still popping at 9pm. My recommendation is to make reservations regardless because it will be packed. It is actually really nice inside and you will see a lot of dates going on downstairs. Upstairs is for parties I believe. I would totally come here for my birthday just cuz the vibe is cool.
Great food at a reasonable price.

Very cool dining experience. The ambiance was fantastic. Very dark and romantic. Cool place to share tapas and good convo. The waiters were very attentive and always noticed if your glass was empty and/or if your table needed utensils.
Corn empanada was delicious, as was the Entrana and Bone Marrow.

I LOVE MEAT! I've been dying to try Lolinda for a really long time (especially since I love Foreign Cinema next door!), and finally found an opportunity when my parents came into town on a Sunday night. Having four people, you know what that means: more food options! Since it's all shareable, here's what we ordered:
Our favorite place in San Fran

I'm writing this review for Lolinda's unprofessional service. My husband had made reservations for us and our friends who drove from Dublin to the city just to dine at Lolinda. We were super excited to try this new raved about restaurant as we're all crazy fanatic foodies. We were sitting in our apartment, looking at Lolinda's online menu, deciding what we were going to order, our mouths salivating when about an hour before our reservation we get a call from Lolinda, telling us that they're canceling our reservations!!! Way to throw a dagger in a foodies' heart, Lolinda! They didn't even offer to reschedule our reservation for perhaps another night, nothing, just a call saying we can't dine with them that night due to problems in the kitchen? Which is fine, we understand, things happen, but I would assume that they would've at least tried to accommodate for a reservation for another night but then again what do they care when they got a huge line out the door. Lolinda left a bad taste in my mouth and I'm definitely not wasting my time again trying to dine there.
I was here for a private party with passed appetizers. The drunks were good but the food was average and came out very slowly. Servers didn't seem to be able to get around the room much either.
my new favorite place in San Francisco.
Ceviche was very good. The steak was nothing special and the service was just ok. Its very loud in the restaurant so you can hardly have a conversation.
I really enjoyed the food here!  Great atmosphere, friendly service, delicious food.  Will definitely come again.
This place is definitely one of my favorites around the area. I have been coming here for a while now and so far I have had no issues.

Our Lyft driver recommended it to us. The ambience was nice. We ordered the croquetas which were flavorless, the roasted peppers which were so spicy I couldn't eat anything else. My boyfriend had empanadas and an overpriced chicken skewer which was mostly corn husk. Pretty disappointed.

We were actually trying to get into El Techo de Lolinda. But since we came on a Friday night after 8p, there was a huge line for the rooftop. An hour and a half wait at least! We thought screw that and decided to go to another restaurant nearby. After we failed at that, we ended up finding a reservation on OpenTable to Lolinda and just snagged that.
the food here is *insert your favorite superlative*!!!
Best restaurant I've been to in SF so far!
Great cocktails, and amazing food. In particular, I was very impressed with their bone marrow appetizer.

A trendy restaurant in the Mission.  It has a very NYC vibe with cool lighting.  The flank steak was a bit salty but the ribeye was cooked to perfection. A nice place for a Friday or Saturday night, although we went on Sunday.  It was still packed.  Be sure to make a reservation early on for the weekend otherwise you will not be able to get one.
This place is wonderful.  We came here on an early Sunday night and the place is packed. Ordered asado mixto, octopus,  churros. All super yummy! Would highly recommend the asado mixto!

i was very impressed with Lolinda. We came here for a birthday dinner a few weeks ago and being vegetarian, a steakhouse isn't my first choice but after looking at the menu online I was pretty excited. They didn't dissapont. The roasted vegetable pie is amazing, the artichoke was perfectly done, the empanadas are great- lots of options for non-meat eaters!

This adorable cafe, which serves pastries & a couple of breakfast items with a Portuguese flair, was perfect for a leisurely first meal with my girl. I could see myself coming back, laptop in tow, & clicking my day away.
This is my favorite coffee shop in SF!

Adorable little cafe in a not-so pretty part of the city. While outside there is trash, shady looking people hanging out around cars.. inside, St. Jorge's delivers: good coffee, excellent (and unique) pastries, pleasant service, free wifi, lots of outlets, big ceilings, mostly ok music (though a little intense for a Sunday afternoon). Overall, a nice place to work. I only saw one or two people with food, and I didn't order any. But I'd come back.

Cafe St. Jorge is hands down the best coffee shop in San Francisco. It seems like the owners here have taken note of everything that other coffee shops in the city and beyond do wrong and have corrected all of their errors in a space that just makes sense in every way. Unlike most coffee shops, they have really great food at reasonable prices (chia seed bowl, Portuguese-inspired pastries, green juices and avocado toast are highlights), well-priced coffee ($2 for 1 cup and $3.15 for unlimited), a nice beer and wine selection, really good music, GOOD wall art, and an incredibly friendly staff. They also don't stare you down if you're on your laptop for a few hours. Rather, they place little signs on your table that encourage other patrons to sit with you. The place is always full of people, a testament to how well-run and welcoming the space and the people who work there are.
This cafe has the best of everything: good coffee, a wide selection of sweet and savory dishes, cute-yet-laidback decor, convenient seating at most hours, and friendly staff.
Holy cow, much delish!  Enjoyed our friends' wedding reception here and talked about how lovely and tasty everything was for days.  Will definitely return next time we're in SF.
I come here for the amazing fig toast and their Stumptown coffee.
This place was such a wonderful find. Cool breakfast/brunch/cafe Portuguese-inspired food, and tasty as hell.

Didn't get much sleep and didn't have the mood to make my own breakfast so I decided to eat breakfast outside. My feet somehow taken me to this place and went inside. Nice place actually, and has good atmosphere. The coffee was definitely good, enough to perk me up instantly! Also got myself an avocado toast, which was a first for me, and somehow it was actually pretty good. Gotta take note of this place.
Came to SF by way of Arizona. My girlfriend's family is from St. Jorge in the Azores so we thought this would be a good place to check out as the cafe is a tribute to the area.

Here for the first time and loving it! Perfect for getting work done. Music is loud enough to enjoy but quiet enough to do work. Gluten-free ginger cookie was delicious, but I was very disappointed in the avocado with chili flakes...I think it was way too lemony?

This is a nice little breakfast/coffee place in the southern part of the Mission. The coffee is Stumptown, so you know it's good. There is an extensive selection of vegetarian and gluten free options, and all items are labeled whether they fall in one of those two categories (or both). The custard tarts are really good, almost as good as in Macau. The homemade granola is also quite tasty, try it with fruit and yogurt.
Stopped by as we were in the area and are Portuguese and wanted to check it out. Coffee was good; Pastel de Nata was almost as good as in Portugal.

Good coffee, nice pastel de nata, but crap-tasting coconut pastry. Reaction to my complaining about the coconut pastry: basically,  "oops, I guess you're just sh*t-out-of-luck". Won't be coming here again.
DELICIOUS LATTE. So pretty and yummy.

Been there twice now and I have to say, I love it! I am really impressed with the place. I love their traditional portuguese desserts as well as their gluten free and vegan treats. And of course their sumol! I grew up in a portuguese family and consumed these desserts often, they pass the test, and make me feel like I'm back home.
Good coffee, some staff are super nice some arent at all.
The staffs are very nice. They have plugs and high speed wifi.
Excellent cafe and coffee shop! Coffee is perfect, cookies are amazing, breakfast is varied: indulgent, healthy, simple. Great service and welcoming environment. Don't miss it!
Good prices and really nice atmosphere tasty coffee too! Not super nice staff..

The barista's here really know how to make a good custom cup of coffee. And the food is nice and original. Give this place a try, you will not regret it. Many choices for you organic people too. Staff is very nice and friendly, always greet you with a smile. We have been going here enough that they already know what we are going to order before we get to the register.

*Swoon* I love this cute lil neighborhood cafe like no other. I'll admit, I was a tad bit skeptical of how noshworthy food in this particular part of Mission Street would be, but I truly fell in love with this spot when I tried their avocado toast and delish salad selection. Bonus points for anyone who happens to wander into this cafe while something yummy is baking (which is often!)-high ratings for food, ambiance, friendly staff and general good vibes!
Ew, this place is on the sketch side of bernal heights? Where are you taking me??

Service is at a snails pace, along with the rotten attitude.  I think I actually saw the girl behind the counter lick her finger and continue making a sandwich.  Where are your gloves? I did have the strawberry salad a month ago, dressing is wrong tooooo sour. Three stars for Stumptown coffee.
Love th e Chia bowl for $8.50.  Healthy and tastes good.  Parking a bit difficult at 6pm.  I parked after 5 min.  Quiet and clean cafe.
My CoffeeThesisProposal studying has taken me away from Denver and to yet another land.  But coffee shops are coffee shops are coffee shops.

Very cool neighborhoody space. My Chia bowl was great! Gets crowded on the weekends but overall young people reading, chatting, on their computers etc . It was a nice atmosphere. I enjoyed my experience.
I love LOVE cafe st. jorge. My coworker orders their cookies frequently and they are always delicious. My favorite thing we've had is mint chocolate chip cookies.

Every single VEGAN treat I've tried I've loved, and they're always changing! Had the fig coffee cake today. They changed my mind about Stumptown too. I love the cushy corner for how much it reminds me of home. Wish they were open later M-W, though!
great coffee, love stumptown! great coffee cake, great atmosphere. love this place and the staff is great too.

I love this place. Friendly owner and staff. Comfortable atmosphere. Great coffee and cool food options. Try the goose is loose sandwich! I am also always consistently impressed with the quality and variation in music. From bebop to indie rock but always solid. What else can you ask for in your local cafe?

Maybe I ordered wrong, but as far as their salads go, $10 for a "large" kale salad with avocado is not worth it.  It's more of a small-medium sized salad with just kale, parmesan, lemon, and half an avocado.  Overpriced and boring.  Plus 1 star for playing Air.

Still really glad this place is part of the neighborhood, but I'm increasingly annoyed by the service when the young male is manning the espresso machine. Attitude and ridiculous delays getting the caffeine out. For example today he cleaned the entire front end before bothering to start my latte, or perhaps more accurately never started it until I went up and asked about it. Just raised eyebrows and a half nod in response, no apology. Everyone else here is great so unclear to me why they keep this one person who has a bad attitude.
We recently went here to work from a cafe on a typical sunday.
Gem of a cafe in the mission. Ample outlets  + free wifi to work. Yummy healthy food and stumptown coffee. Friendly service. Overall great spot on the mission/ bernal border!
My favorite work and eat spot! Amazing smoothies- especially the date smoothie, great pre-made juices, CHIA BOWL is fabulous. Great vibe, awesome employees, definitely pop a squat here!
Full disclosure: I am a picky eater.

This review is only for the Portuguese tarts. I read an article about them in a magazine and decided to try it. I've had portuguese tarts from Macau and they were amazing! I was looking forward to the same. So bummed! $10 later my friend and I wish we didn't waste our money. They were tiny for $2.50 each, half the size of a normal portuguese tart. Maybe because they have been sitting out, they were soggy crusted and cold thick dense center with not alot of flavor. No bueno!! It's supposed to have a flaky crispy crust with a light creamy middle.
We want for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it. Lovely ambiance and vibe.my only slight gripe is that the egg sand which was a bit small... I wanted more!  Overall great spot.
As always chia seed porage is amazing. But this time the service was a little bit unfriendly. Which is strange because they're usually so nice here.
This place is very cool, I'm pretty active at mission, sometime it gets really busy. I was hoping a restaurant that allows me to order online, and pick up right away, so I can save some time.

I haven't eaten here or been here but I used their delivery service today! $15 minimum + $3-$5 delivery fee; not too bad for delivery service. Wanted to surprise the bf with lunch while being 2,000 miles away. Called around the time they opened and explained the situation to the lady. She was really sweet and helpful. I was able to order and pay over the phone (including tip). The food was delivered to him within 45-60 min like she estimated.

A nice change from the usual sandwiches. Fun, inventive and delicious. I had the Nuevo Cubano sans Avocado Jalapeño Aioli, and added their delicious bacon to the mix. Delish. Service was awesome and they helped me select a sandwich I would like, only problem, it was hot and the paper it's wrapped in got condensation and ripped apart in my backpack. I wasn't offered a bag. Kinda ruined my sandwich but I'll still go back and eat in next time.

I have actually never been to this place in person so, I cannot speak to the cleanliness of the restaurant, parking, etc. I have ordered sandwiches from here several times and they're always really good. I usually order the Franciscan sandwich. With chips, a drink and delivery charges the total comes to about $23.00 and that is not including tip-- Expensive for a 1 person lunch, but hey, when you forget to bring your lunch and hunger sets in, $23.00 doesn't seem so bad for a hot and fresh sandwich. Delivery has usually taken between 15-20 minutes. Not bad at all.

I order some food n got the email to pick it up 10-30 min later, only to receive phone calls n texts saying different things. One saying they were closed, another saying it was gonna b 30 min late. Long story short, I didn't get my food, n not sure about my money either. Girl on the phone wanted me to call eat24 to get my money back even though it was their mistake.

real good spot for sandwiches. all the ones i have tried have been great but i especially like the Cranturkey (Turkey & Cranberry) sandwich. their bread is always fresh. good spot to get sandwiches from before heading to Dolores Park.
Best BLT in town, hands down. I had been laying off the bread and this sandwich was more crisp bacon than bread! I'm too young for a heart attack so why not do it now.

Delicious! Ordered delivery for a meeting at the office and we all agreed, super yummy. The food was fresh and arrived when we requested, the dude even came up to our floor! We will forsure be ordering again from here. A great twist on some classics (we ordered the Cobb, Caesar, Cranturkey, and Mozzapesto). Loved it.
We ordered from this spot on eat24.

The cobb salad is a winner - savory chunks of chicken, fresh avocado, crispy bacon slices, hardboiled eggs and a homemade vinaigrette. Sparse seating but friendly customer service. I'm already looking forward to eating another salad here.

Sandwiches are good. But customer service should step it up a notch! If you want repeating customers you should make them feel more welcoming into your establishment. Very small store and only three tables to eat on which other people in line continue to bump your elbows. Thanks But No Thanks!

Whenever I'm in the area craving a sammie, the San Franciscan is my go to sandwich :D It has the perfect balance of meat/veggie/bread ratio and with the melted cheese and toasty bread it's just an amazing marriage of flavors in my mouth... I love washing it down with their watermelon juice and for a nice sweet treat after, the chocolate chip cookie, YUMMMM. What more can I possibly ask for? Nada :D

This place is so promising (nice ambiance, friendly), but I've tried most of their sandwiches and many of their sides and I still haven't found one that I'd go back for. Their sandwiches tend to be pretty dry and lacking in any real deep meaning or taste. I bought one of their salads and there just wasn't enough dressing--I had to go home and re-dress it. Do try their cran-turkey, though; that one is pretty good.
Tasty, and healthy.  I like it.
Tried the San Franciscan, ABT, and London Broil, and all of them were super delicious. I'd definitely come back again!
I'm not a sandwich guy. There's just something about cold cuts and soggy bread that turns me off.
I eat a sandwich here at least 3x per week...the san franciscan is too good. Staff is super friendly and owner is very attentive and friendly. Great service - thank you MP!
Had the chicken club and wasn't impressed. The ingredients were all good, but the sandwich was bland. And it was chicken salad, which I wasn't expecting.
I _liked_ Mission Picnic, but I wasn't blown away.
Wow, they immediately turned things around. Still pricey, but cheers for being responsive!
Great ambiance. Visiting from LA found this place on yelp. Sat outside enjoyed the weather the food was good. Not to mention they serve beer and mimosas at 10am!
Picnic without having to put together the picnic? Yes, please.
I really like this place. It's very simple, but really tasty and good sandwiches. They are fast and fair prices as well.

What a great find!  Fast service and a great menu!  The Nuevo Cubana is fantastic,  super tasting sandwich.  The ABT Sandwich has the most bacon I've ever seen on a sandwich, great sandwich!  Stopped by on the way home twice this week, I'm addicted!

Awesome sandwiches - I never would have ordered the Cuban sandwich, but my boyfriend did, and the addition of grilled pineapple sort of blew my mind. Delicious! The watermelon juice was also excellent. Great spot to grab sammies!

Mission Picnic has amazing sandwiches.  To be honest, I've only ever had the Picnic Club, and I am so satisfied with it that I have no desire to branch out.  The chicken salad defines what a chicken salad should be, and the tomatoes are fresh.  It's best to call in ahead of time or order online so you don't have to wait, and since there are only a few tables it's often better to get take out.  The sandwiches are so large they will probably last you through almost 2 meals.  My roommates say the San Franciscan, London Broil, and Pollopesto are excellent choices as well.
the sandwiches are good.

Small place with limited seating. When I say limited I mean 3 tables against the wall with the people waiting in line a few inches away from you. However, they did a mean cranberry turkey sambo on a toasted roll. I wasn't expecting much but was very impressed with the sambo. They rotated out the hainan chicken which I wanted to try. The hubs got a salad and was not impressed - too much salad box stuffed to the brim without enough of the hearty stuff. Id say its a good place to quick up a sambo to go not dine in.
Solid club sandwich.  Always a fan of a place that includes pickles.  The bread could have been fresher and I think the chicken was INXS.
Came here for the first time with a friend and I loved it!! Didn't like how little seating there was, but at least it wasn't crowded.
I love this place!

We ordered a huge lunch order for our office and although there were some inconsistencies with the Eat24 menu and their website menu. They called me to let me know were super nice and easy to deal with. Everything was exactly how we ordered and it came pretty quickly considering it was lunch time and we ordered for about 18 people. The salads are really big and filling and everyone really liked the bread. We will probably order from here again :)
Even though we came to Mission Picnic for their Hainan Chicken sandwich (which they did not have), my experience here turned out to be positive.
Mission Picnic got me to eat a Vegan Sandwich.

Amazing customer service, fresh, flavorful and delicious sandwiches. I had the vegan sandwich and it was loaded with avocado, tomatoes, hummus, sprouts and other goodies. They were out of focaccia so I had it on ciabatta instead and I added some jalapeños for a little more of a kick which was perfect! About $12 for a big sandwich and fresh lemonade.

Good sandwiches! I like the San Franciscan it was so juicy!!!!! I usually order from this place since I just live 30 steps away! one thing I recommend is call ahead of time because they do take 15 min to make your sandwich. I remember i called in one day and came in 15min and it was not ready since they had a huge catering order, so I waited another 10 patiently and then another 10min frustrated!! Everyone in that store was also with a straight face because they been waiting for a long time. Overall it took 35 min to get my sandwich, and I was late for my final and that is why I am giving them a 3 star. Every single time I think of this place I think twice because of that one experience I had. It does suck to not have an accurate estimation!!! Because i recently got San Francisco Jun16th and my sandwich was cold because I decided to go in 15min instead of 10 min.  But overall if you have time to wait and you want a good sandwich come here!

Fast delivery. 30 mins only! But the proportions for the potato and pesto salad are so disappointing, small as heck! The other salads are normal doesn't taste super good. Expensive-ish for just average things.

I work nearby and pass every day so its amazing it took me so long to try it out.  So just gotta let you know that it was a great sandwich, I had the San Franciscan which was recommended by the pleasant lady behind the counter.  What I liked best is that the ingredients stayed together upon biting into the sandwich.  Some places, they make it so the ingredients squeeze out but these didn't. Here is a description of the Sandwich I ordered and note that I usually would not spend over $9 for a sandwich, but then again maybe you are not a cheapskate like me.

I used to work near here, and every time I went to Mission picnic there was a bit of a wait. There's pretty much never going to be a chair available, so plan on taking it to go. The sandwiches really are good, but honestly this place gets more from it's trendy status than I think it really deserves. Worth a try, but I didn't make it a regular thing.
Nothing is worse than a boring lame sandwich that tastes terrible. NOTHING.
Awesome mole! Visiting SF from east coast and this quaint little Mayan joint warmed the soul. Amiga and I shared the turkey -like garnachas + mexican mole con pollo... Muy rico!!

I honestly can't even believe how fuxkin awesome this place is.  Chicken falls right off the bone, habanero sauce is legitimate as holy fuck and sweet Jesus the tamarind drink makes my brain jizz rainbows

I've never had mayan food before, but I hope I have more of it soon just based on this restaurant. I really like the flavor of the rice and salsa as well as the texture of the fresh tortillas. However, all the dishes have the same rice/salsa mix. I don't know if that's a staple for these dishes, though. The most disappointing thing is that the poc chuc is not as good as the chicken dishes (pollo pibil). It's not that the flavor was terrible, just the tenderness of the pork was bad. I really liked the stupidly spicy salsa they give you with the chips. The bean puree was ok, just bland.

It took a while to get food once we ordered, but we did walk in for lunch after 3:00 p.m.. A very nice and polite and young and short guy brought us table service, waters, chips and salsa plus one of the hottest sauces I've ever had.
Poc-Chuc is a Mayan Mexican restaurant, I walk by all the time but never walked in because it's a little too nice compared to my usual Taqueria

We visited Poc-Chuc prior to a performance at nearby Z-Space. The choice was sort of by default, since there didn't seem to be any other interesting choices near Z. We had some misgivings when we entered (it looked divey and understaffed), but we ended up with the food and the sense of hominess (it's clearly a family affair, from both a staff and patron perspective).

I like their food. This review is based only on the food as I always have it to go. Their food is tasty and puts me straight to food coma. I usually order the chicken stew (pollo pibil) and the panuchos which are very good. Last time I ordered the carnitas taco and it was the best CT I've ever had. It's not a a typical Mexican place. They have a distinguished flavor and taste home made.

Not being a Mayan food fan, I admit this place has won me over. Their food is excellent, everything appears to be home made and from scratch, portions are big and leave you very satisfied, and prices are budget conscious. It's the third time I've been here in 2 weeks, and plan on coming here regularly (it helps it's half a block away from where I live).
This place is such a hidden gem.
Everything was delicious, but the Poc-Chuc pork dish was fantastico.
I had the shrimp tacos and they were delicious, however I love really spicy food and this was missing just a bit of the kick I wanted (even with the salsa).
Awesome pollo pibil. The chicken was tender, rice was moist with sauce, and those TORTILLAS! V authentic con masa.
My friend took me here and i love it. Great food!!! Delish!!!

Been wanting try this place for awhile. I've traveled in the Yucatan so I've gotten to eaten many of the foods they serve here. We shared a Appetizer Platter. Great sabute, panucho, empanada, tostada and taquito. This could be a meal in itself. The poc chic and cochinito pupil were very tasty in huge potions. They could have each easily fed two people. We shared a caramelized banana with ice cream for dessert. It was fine nothing special but a nice finish to the meal. BTW when they packed our leftovers they gave us more beans, rice and tortillas
Wow I am one happy customer!

Poc-Chuc is amazing. I love this place. It's pretty much the best food within a 5 block radius of 16th and Mission. Everything feels homemade with love, and they give you lots of a food, and it's a really good price. They are super nice, too. Their spicy salsa is very spicy and their bean puree is delicious. I would eat here any time I'm feeling really hungry.

Authentic and delicious, a family operation that's as good as anything I've encountered in the Yucatan. Cochinita pibil and salpicon are outstanding, but it's the details that make for a great Yucateco meal - the rice, beans, pickled onions and marvelous tortillas. And that Habanero salsa. Oh my.
Take home: great, cheap authentic Mexican food with generous proportions.

Simply yet sophisticated menu. I suspect all dishes must be delicious since all of our dishes are awesome and neighbor tables' dishes are also visually very nice. Also great if you have no experience in Mexican cuisine simply because the servant can explain them for you!
A little boy just handed me a plate of salsa and chips. I'm sold, the food is also great..

Infallible. I've visited several times now, and it has not disappointed. The prices are worth it. The chips themselves are the best I've had. Try the Poc-Chuc (marinated pork). Extraordinarily delicious.

This might just be my favorite restaurant.  I came here with my girlfriend on a whim and it was so good we had to come back a few days later to make sure it wasn't a dream.  The portions are HUGE.  We usually have leftovers, and I always look forward to a Poc-Chuc leftover lunch.  One time we brought some friends here and my friend dropped a piece of pork on the floor.  Usually I'd cut my losses and let it go, but I couldn't let it go to waste and ate it anyway.  It's that good.  The food is flavorful without relying on being overly salty.  The salsa is top notch.  Black bean puree.  Yum.  I can't overlook the staff either.  They're always super friendly.

Absolutely delicious. My roommate is from the Yucatan and him and I could not get over the quality of the food.  It is family owned and so sometimes the whole family helps out including the younger son pouring water, etc.  I will be back and I definitely recommend.

The service was exceptional.  The food was very good.  I don't understand all of the hype over the black bean puree -- sure it was tasty but not mind blowing.  The pollo pibil reminded me of one of my mom's curries -- yet not South Asian tasting at all.  I suppose the flavors married together well.  The deserts were meh.
Four of us came here on a Saturday night at 5:30pm for an early dinner.  It's affordable, and the real strengths of this restaurant are the food and service.  I'd totally eat here again!

The food here is so good!  The only thing that they didn't have was coffee.  But I won't dock them for that.  Try the appetizer plat to sample what the have, that what I did.  The empanadas were my favorite!

Incredible food and great service! We shared the appetizer platter, which was made up of an empanada, taquito, deep fried tortilla with black bean puree, and a turkey taco type of thing. My favorite was the empanada - flaky crust, savory pork filling.
Definitely my new favorite place to eat. Food quality is comparable to Lolo, just less fancy, less expensive, and bigger portions.

The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and with generous portions... can't ask for more than that. The menu is different than the typical Mexican restaurant and  it does reflect the Yucatan Peninsula cuisine. I've been there twice on Friday nights and both experiences were great.

Huge delicious cheap plates of food. Husband and I stuffed ourselves for like $22 on the namesake poc chuc, a Mayan marinated, grilled pork dish that comes with delicious black beans, rice and salsa, and the Mayan appetizer plate which gives a good variety of tacos, flauta, tostada, etc. The tortillas are so good you'll be torn about whether to eat tortillas or more rice. Free dessert with Yelp check in!

Food is greAt i had the mayan platter as an app and we had pollo pibil but the best was cochinita pibil with a side of beans rice tortillas habanero sauce onions omg was great but the service was ok not to good but not to bad A+++ for food!!!

OMG!  I wasn't expecting much when my friend suggested the place.  I'm happy eating the same thing repeatedly, my gustatory habits being just that.  And though I love Mexican cooking, often find it too heavy.  Poc-Chuc was light in plates for vegetarians, but man, the one I had was so unexpectedly good, rich flavors without hammering away at you.  I kept turning to my friend kind of slack jawed, "Is you're platter of flesh good too," and him giving a beaming, "Yes!"  The chips, too, were delicious and the salsa a grade above what you find at CorpMex.  Service-wise, I like the non-doting kind, so the young kid who served us was efficient but reserved, and Mom was holding down the fort quite well.  I look forward to taking people here in the future.
Mind-blowing, simply amazing Mayan foods!  I always take my East Coast friends visiting San Francisco to Poc Chuc:-)  Their foods never fail to impress my out of town guests.
My boyfriend and I come here every couple of weeks or so and everytime their food is great. It gets a little busy when there's a lunch rush but everything is always on point. Definitely recommend
Reminds me of the intense, flavorful Mayan cooking in the Yucatan. Delicious.
I never leave reviews. This is a must. Excellent example of authentic Yucatecan food. Both of my Parents hail from Merida; Yucatan. The food here is phenomenal. I highly recommend.
The food here is soooooo good!! We shared the appetizer sampler, the fried plantains and the pollo pibil.

Food and service is fantastic! Chicken is the best. The owner was super kind and also gave us a free drink. The only thing is the place could use a little bit of clean up, it's not the nicest area but with some TLC, it has great potential!
Excellent traditional Mexican Mayan style cuisine.Very authentic,great flavors.Order with confidence!
Food is consistently good. It never fails you. It tastes like home cooking, unpretentious.

I really want to like blue plate but my experience was honestly not that great. I'm rating this place one star for their meat loaf which was surprisingly good. I'm usually not a fan of meat loaf but it was delicious. The mash potato and everything about the dish was on point but I personally didn't think it was to die for.
Great restaurant! authentic rich tastes and good wine selection.

Comfort food with a creative twist.  Chef Sean Thomas pushes the boundaries with his small plates then take your right back to down home cooking with his mains.  Service is spot and everyone on the staff was super attentive and welcoming.  Our server Emily was a gem.

Went here for my friend's birthday. She found out about Blue Plate as it was on the list of SF's best underrated restaurants. I had no idea this place has been around for 15 years (there's a sign in front stating that).
On Saturday, 11/8/14, my girlfriend and I ate at Blue Plate for dinner to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday.
My girlfriends and I chose this place for a celebratory girls nite.

Overly expensive and not very exciting main dishes - seriously meatloaf...? However, the appetizers were very good, especially the farro salad. If you go I recommend ordering a few appetizers, some wine, a dessert and skip the main meal.

I've been meaning to come here for years, and finally made it over late in the summer. We started with the deviled eggs, which we liked. Most people ended up getting the fried chicken, which we liked fine, but I thought the wagyu steak was better. But we especially liked our desserts.

Staying in the Embarcadero. Needed a place to meet a friend for dinner who lives in Napa. Somewhere on her way to SFO. What a find! Made a reservation several days ago. Seated right away. Nice wine, awesome food,  and very welcoming service.
I really enjoyed this place.
Fried chicken was amazing. It's kind of crowded though and service is a little slow, so not great if you're on a schedule.

The pork chop is the best in town, even better than Boulevard's (my previous all time fav). The ahi starter was fresh and clean and bright. The pasta carbonara was chewy and flavorful and just the right amount of salty. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner and he said it was the best dinner we have had in SF in awhile. Service was awesome. We had a woman with short hair and a nose piercing who was attentive and kind without being pushy or overbearing. They were also incredibly busy and she didn't show one bit of stress. All around a fantastic meal!

Definitely a busy place in general, although on the night I went the restaurant was hosting a wedding party dinner in the back room, so a little more packed than usual. The hostess was real nice and calm while trying to get us seated on our reservation at the bar, although they we're able to put us at a table last minute, which was great. We were in the back area, which was nice but the front of the restaurant looked much more cozy, intimate, and fun. Dinner was great anyhow. We shared the peaches and heirloom tomato salad (very sweet and fresh peaches and tomatoes, delish). For entrees, we ordered the meatloaf and fried chicken. All the dishes coming out of the kitchen were 90% meatloaf and chicken and no wonder, because they were delish. Meatloaf was moist, very flavorful, and mashed potatoes were very creamy. Fried chicken batter was good...there's def a kick to it, maybe a tad bit salty and more batter to meat ratio, but I still really enjoyed it. Came with a mac salad which was good. Also ordered the Mac and cheese as a side and that was definitely the star of the show! Love the creaminess, and flavor! Would definitely come again!

2.5 stars, demoted because we had leftovers (I had a big piece of fried chicken I wanted to take home to Jr.Yelper with some of the delish side order of mac n' cheese) and our wait person (who was training a newbie) forgot to bring us our leftovers when we specifically told her we wanted to take the food home and my BFF had a good size of her meatloaf she wanted to take home for her baby dog.  We didn't realize we didn't have our leftovers until we had driven about  1/3 of the way home.

The way Mac & Cheese should taste like. I loved it.. Super clean and the service was amazing! If you're in the mood for wine and a creative tasty food this is the best place to check out! When I come back in town I will definitely come again.
Overall rating - 4.5 stars.
Would have been a five star review if based on food alone.
Loved it and would give 5 stars but there were too many options with pork/ham/bacon when I went and I don't eat pork so I felt limited.
Awesome place. Good food. Excellent service.
Delicious food, good wine, friendly staff- this place is always great! My favorites:
Great cocktails, delicious food, very cool scene. I have been here twice and i enjoyed it each time.

Subtlety, excellence, flexibility and tranquility. The deviled eggs are subtle and interesting. The fired chicken is juicy and excellent. The wine list is flexible and curated. The outdoor back patio provides a tranquil relaxing environment to enjoy the meal. Menu selections are diverse and the service is great.

Good menu, good ambience.  Nice staff.  I wish something stood out more, but it was all around good. Standard good food place in the city/mission.  I'd go again, but maybe something slightly more creative would achieve 5 stars for me.
Local spot that's been there for I think about a decade. Always amazing every chance I get to visit. Really something special in its own little oasis (bernalish).
Very amazing food and great atmosphere. Little pricey.

Forward thinking, delicious, cool space, unpretentious , and just straight up awesome.  I recommend the salmon as a main and the Romano beans with fig jam and feta as a WTH OMG it actually worked choice.  The review is for the food.  Some of the servers could be happier looking but whatever.  I go to eat a place for the food not the smiles.  I have enough self esteem.  I don't have enough smoked trout deviled eggs.

Blue plate always seems to deliver.  Surprisingly good and clever flavor combinations.  Pork chop+grilled peaches+savory rye bread crumbs+dandelion greens+pickled onion.  A lot of great flavors to pick from in a single dish.  And the salmon dish was even better.  Really good service too.  For the price point it's a 5-star.  I'm more satisfied here then some one-star michelins.

This place is good, just go f@*king eat there. Some of these reviews are hilarious. Great fine American Dining, great service. Fried chicken, Mac n Cheese, key lime pie, butterscotch puddin are sure things. Do it.
It's easy to miss if you're just walking on Mission, but what a cute place--so glad I finally got to try it. And I'll definitely be back.

So far, this is the best fried chicken in town.  We ordered via Caviar delivery service, and so we did not get to try it in person just yet, but even delivered it was great!  I would like to have a buscuit or some of the other traditional accompaniments, but the foccaccia and the pepper-potato relish/hash worked just fine.

I'm normally very disciplined and stay away from bread, but I ate two pieces of the complimentary foccacia. TWO!!! In fact, I wanted to continue devouring the warm, soft squares and had to force myself to push the plate away. How totally wild of me!

The food was great. Really delicious. So why only three stars? Servers and hostess were off-putting. They refused to seat us in the window seat, because were "saving it for a larger party".  We were there early in the evening, and as we walked to the back, most of the tables were empty. I guess we didn't meet a certain look standard or something. Thanks.

Great meal.  Fun space.  Service is great.  Here with the 'rents for a post marathon meal.  Had the salmon, which was delicious.  Parents say the menu is a bit limited, but that what is there is  excellent.   (Dad suggests the mince not be so fine in the meatloaf but that the flavor was wonderful)

Toasted farro with slow egg is absolutely amazing. Decent vegetarian options - the food is delicious. The ambiance is great; very cozy and familiar. Service ranged from okay to good on a weekend dinner visit. A nice place to have in the neighborhood.

We immediately felt like we were on vacation dining on the outside back patio.  The menu had plenty of tempting listings and we loved all 3 courses (apt, entree, desert). The atmosphere and service was vibrant. This is certainly a repeat and a great place to bring out of town special guests.

It's absolutely amazing. Good food, good service, great, fresh desserts. I ordered the beet salad, the meatloaf, and the key lime pie to finish. The beet salad was probably the best I've ever had. It came with two sauces that perfectly complemented each other. Just divine. The meatloaf is light and tasty. The veggies are crisp and the mash potatoes are properly done. The key lime pie is beyond praise. It's just that good. Basically, do yourself a favor and stop on by.
Blue Plate is everything you could want in a San Francisco restaurant. The food is delicious and includes local, seasonal ingredients. Wine selection is also very good.
Chicken liver mousse was truly amazing! Not to mention eye appeal! So colorful and artisti. AND it came with duck fat (gasp!) crostini.
Really good homey place. Kind of an old house and you feel like you're eating at a friends house. Everything we had was good. Service was good as well.

Love the atmosphere. Mostly loved the food. The trout smoked deviled eggs were great, and I loved about 75% of my fried chicken. The grilled asparagus were also good, but didn't quite get the "covered in lardo" thing - why cover vegetables with fat?

These guys are artists when it comes to their sandwiches. If you're a Foodie you'll love this place for the creativity of their sandwiches. If you like to grub you'll appreciate the size of their sandwiches. I'm trying to make my way through the entire menu but every sandwich I try is my new favorite! The flavors are just as creative as their names.

Worst experience ever. This is my first Yelp review that's negative normally I only rate positive because I don't want to hurt the business of any restaurant where maybe the food is not great but where the service is good. I placed an order online and went into the store to add to the order with a sandwich. They were out of every bread except rye and croissant but it was after 2pm and they had a busy day. I left to pickup groceries and when I returned the man at the counter asked if I had someone pickup the Order for me. I had not. They gave my order to someone else!!!!

My coworkers and I regularly went to Two Sons for our lunch because they are nearby, and we used to like it. Our recent orders have been disappointing and I don't think it is worth going back to anymore.

Dutch crunch bread is a must.  Ive tried most of the sandwiches and have never been dissappointed. Lots to choose from. Good variety, cool guys. Decently quick service. $8-12 for the sandwiches. Fresh ingredients. I go about 3-4 times a month. Thumbs up.

The bomb. Incredible Dutch crunch bread and fresh ingredients. If you need a big sandwich for a quick lunch fix, this is the best place near SOMA/Mission Bay. Parking around the area and orderahead for no wait. The Watchu Talkin bout Wilbur is awesome.
First time here and it was amazing. I was on my way to McDonald's  bit saw this place on the way so had to stop and check it out.

This place used to be another sandwich shop called Calabria Bros, which was not up my alley because I don't usually like cured meats, and I especially don't like them COLD.  Two Sons offers deliciously toasted and ironed paninis with lots of turkey options, served with a variety of sauces, fresh vegetables, and cheese they melt down and ooze over your breadroll.  Verdict?  Way better than Whole Foods subs, not quite as gourmet as Market & Rye but also simpler and lighter on your wallet.

Walked in for lunch at 1:30 they were pumping with only one seat at the bar to eat.  Stellar customer service and great food all round. Tons of options leaves you wanting more. Can't express enough how caring this place is. The fact that they work very neat and it being clean all around makes it very inviting. Keep up the good work.

I am a sandwich lover, i literally often wake up craving a tasty combo of meat, fillings  on a roll... These guys hit the spot. Kudos to the cute guy behind the counter who was mad patient as my eyes glazed over staring at the menu... I went super boring turkey on sour roll, no cheese added peppers and avocado.  Sandwich f***king large is what handed me, and I am a happy girl. I will return maybe study the menu prior to going in.

There are enough sandwiches here that you could have a different one every day for a month... and then start all over again the next month because you've forgotten what the first ones taste like. They're good and filling but not particularly memorable, which is a shame considering what they charge.
This place is absolutely amazing. Great customer service and amazing sandwiches. I would recommend this place to everyone!!
Had to go back and give Ike's 4 stars so I could give this one 5.

High quality, clean, friendly place.  Awesome sandwiches.  They don't have the meatball or the tri-tip every day, so I am thrilled when they do.  DO NOT go between 11:45 and 1 or you will wait in line.  Crafting every sandwich to order takes time and the line goes out the door at lunchtime.  Beware - this is not SUBWAy - you will pay almost $12 for a sandwich and a drink, but the sandwiches are so large I easily get two meals out of one.  The panninis are awesome also.  Skip the salads - not a great goodies to lettuce ratio - but this is a sandwich shop so the salads are an afterhthought.  Nice buch of guys running the place.

I go to this place a lot because they make great sandwiches, but my last visit i had the Cluck for a buck that comes with bacon.  The sandwich was not as hot as it normally is and the bacon was barely noticeable in taste and probably only two strips.  Overall it was a forgettable sandwich surprisingly.  Not sure what happened there, becoming inconsistent maybe?  There is a new guy making sandwiches there, though not sure if that would make a difference.
Two sons reminds me of an old school New York deli with some modern flavor combinations. Personally I like my breads toasted on sandwiches and you can get everything toasted.

Definitely good. Definitely not mind-blowing. The dutch crunch was fresh, crunchy and tasty right out of the oven, and the meat was great (boar's head meats). But, the teriyaki sauce on my Mongolian monster was lacking in flavor, causing the majority of the taste to be overtaken by the sriracha. You get a lot of sandwich, though, which was nice. Overall, you can probably do better, but considering it's in an area where you don't have a lot of food options, this is not bad. Plus half a star for the menu item name puns.
Love this place.  Good bread, Boar's Head meats, a well though out selection of cleverly named sandwiches.  What more could you want?
Totally 100% fantastic. Truly. The Whatchu Talkin Bout Wilbur? Bomb. Add some Av to really put this one over the edge.
4pm, Thursday April 17th, 2014. Closed. Sign on front door and Yelp both say the place should be open for another hour.
First and foremost, if there was a quarter star to give that's what I would rate this place.
Great atmosphere people who work here are very nice and courteous. Also the ingredients are fresh and the sandwiches are delicious. I think I fell in love.

These guys rule - one of my favorite deli's on the west coast and a lunchtime mainstay for my work week. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but if you can make it over there, it does not disappoint.

Absolutely love this place. Went once on a whim and have been back since. Their ingredients are FRESH, their sandwiches are expertly crafted, and their coffee is really delicious. I can't figure out why their coffee is so damn good, but it is. I also think they are reasonably priced. Probably my favorite sandwich shop in SF.

People! You have to try the Triple C !!!! It's a special sandwich, not on the regular menu. Imagine chipotle chicken, chipotle Gouda, and crispy onions exploding in your more. Your parotids will pucker, my god this is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!!!

After I reviewed the reviews I decided to come here to get a sandwich for lunch. As me being African-American, I did not recieve the "great service" and staff were not that friendly. The bread I had was slightly burnt on the outside and the guy that made my sandwich seem to rush making my sandwich, I guess to hurry up and get me out the store. Oh and did I mention that the sandwich is $7 not including ships or a drink. I know other sandwich shops in San Francisco that gladly accept African-Americans as customers and will go to the extreme to make the customers feel comfortable and happy. Staff here seems to be racist, so they can do me a favor and kiss a sloppy, cellulite, shitty ass like they are. I will NEVER return to sandwich shop.
Great little spot that has a pretty extensive sandwich menu.  I have tried a few now including the Dirty bird and the Hot Pastrami and they are downright delicious!

Joe and his sandwiches are amazing. Great quality food, delicious taste and a real friendly feel in the place. My bf and I saw the yelp reviews and decided to check it out. We were not disappointed! Will definitely be back soon!!
Excellent selection of sandwiches, chips, and beverages and the service is always top notch. I'm so happy I work a block away! Try their Greuben or the Mongolian Monster. So friggin good!!

This place is a good value and I really wanted to like it. That said, I found the flavors of my meatball sub to be one dimensional. Also the meatballs and sauce were center of the sun hot. By the time the innards of my sub had cooled to a tolerable temperature, the rest of the sandwich was too soggy.
Great lunch spot.  Tip top sandwiches and good people. They do often run out of stuff so go early. Otherwise solid joint all around

Delicious sandwiches and super friendly service!  I had a My Gouda's Green (turkey, coppa, smoked gouda--yum) and I tried the Mongolian Monster (roast beef, muenster, jalapenos, with teriyaki and sriracha sauce--spicy & super yum).  My MGG was tasty and large enough to take half home.  My friend ate his whole MM and loved every bite.  Nice choice of soft drinks and bottled teas.  The guys behind the counter were smiley and seemed to be having fun!  We will definitely be back.

This place has never ever served me anything bad. The Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is sloppy as it is delicious. Also, I hate mustard, and they put mustard on one of my sandwiches with "everything". I wasn't even mad.
I love this place! Great food and good location and friendly service :)

First time to try this spot ...... I got the Mongolian Monster !! Soooooo good ! I wanted to order a second one just because it was so good even tho I was stuffed !!! Hahaha !! The bread was toasted PERFECTLY !!!! The ingredients were all fresh and tasty !!! Service was excellent ! Place is immaculately clean.  The prices are more than fair for what you get. To top it all off. There's tons of FREE STREET PARKING !! Go check not out for sure !!!

This place is great. I work around the corner and frequent it a few times a week. Most often I'm getting a cup of the pour over coffee, and a bagel (when my inner-fat-boy comes out, I get a breakfast croissant). I have never left unsatisfied. The sandwiches are great too, I have yet to work my way through the menu, but I'll do it someday, lol.
Best to accept.
Friendly, quick and unbelievably tasty deli sandwiches.  While they have tons of fun and delicious combinations on the menu, the 'Wilbur' is my favorite. Two Sons is my go-to lunch spot.
Two Sons Sandwiches makes gourmet sammies using boars' head meats. 8ish. pricey?  just dropping in for a brew.

The names of the sandwiches here are great. The selection of vegetarian options, not so much. There's an egg salad, falafel and a grilled cheese. I would have preferred they took a hint from Mr. Pickles and had some fried tofu to sub out on any sandwich, or better yet some tempeh. My sandwich was great though and the staff was friendly. Unfortunately they had some kind of sports argument program on the television which was really annoying, so I'm knocking them down to 3 stars for that too.
This place has great sandwich varieties! My favorite is their BLT, super delicious crispy bacon, super yummy sliced bread and oh so saucy spicy mayo.
Phenomenal food and wait staff! My new fave joint in SF!! delicious!!!
like any other brunch place in SF, long wait-over an hr! but my friend and I went to blue bottle around the corner to kill time. Quiet neighborhood and delicious food!

Seems like Universal Cafe has great food, but the service leaves something to be desired. Either they're really uncomfortable with hospitality, or I am not their customer target demographic, which makes me uncomfortable for even venturing out into this place. I actually couldn't wait to pay for the check and leave.
This place has been on my 'to-do' list. 930am, Low wait, great place to eat outside with dog. Food was fresh tasting...def. The quality is there.
Be prepared to wait.

Came here for dinner with a friend. This is a little out of the way for most, which makes it one of the few great places in the mission that doesn't seem to have a constant one hour wait around dinner time (in my experience). It's a pretty quiet area, I enjoyed a sidewalk dinner that didn't have a constant stream of people walking by like you might on Valencia. The interior has that trendy driftwood and candle like look going. I liked it, but the decor isn't any different than all the other American places in the Mission/Potrero area.

The wait for brunch on a Saturday was long but well worth the wait.  If you can keep your group to 3 or less it'd be much less waiting as the place is pretty small.  Service was good.  Food delicious!

Plow had a line around the block so we jumped into the car and went to Universal. The bill for three of us for Sunday brunch with tip was $100 which strikes me as a lot, but I wasn't paying. My French toast was superb and I had a side of sausage which had nice seasoning. I just tried to review the menu to jog my memory but the website makes it hard to read. I do think it changes frequently. Anyway, the food was great and I would go again. There is outdoor and indoor seating, lots of families with cute kids.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon (~1:30pm) and waited probably a good 20 minutes for a table of three. There was about 5-7 other parties before us so we were hoping it would be some good food cause we were starving.
Ever changing menu of very fresh ingredients.

Delicious breakfast, friendly wait-staff and good atmosphere. Good outdoor seating and the brunch bar makes eating solo feel less... solo! Recommend you get there early on the weekends as it gets busy.

Always a nice spot for brunch! We came on a Sunday around 1pm and waited probably 30-40 minutes (they estimated 20 minutes). I always enjoy their food and like that this is in a more hidden, residential part of the Mission.
I know brunch is so hot right now, but it's just not my jam.
Pretty average brunch experience.
Good, fresh food but beware they're a bit pricey. Definitely a great place to hit up for brunch especially if you live in the area.
My absolute favorite brunch place to go.
A-effing-mazing
The review is for brunch. I will be back.
This place is seriously the best! I was on vacation when I was recommended to eat at this cute cafe! SERIOUSLY the best decision of my life. This business knows how to be run!

Good but not great. Definitely don't  recommend the sake Bloody Mary. Great idea with it but just not very tasty. Had brunch and didn't have any complaints with the food. The french toast was decadent and the fresh whipped lemon cream in top was superb. Had an egg dish with truffle mushrooms that was also very good. Outdoor patio was small but nice if you can get a table on a nice day.

We had our first (and only) visit today.  Very busy with trendy and self-important folk.  Coffee was very good; service pleasant and very good.  Otherwise, food and drink were overrated and overpriced.  Food was just ordinary.
