They have beers on tap that I've never really seen before in the city. I had the a Belgian Pale Ale (I think it was from the Marin Brewing Company), and my partner got the Headlands RyePA. The Belgian had wonderful, smooth flavors, though it had a lighter flavor profile than I expected. However, when I tried my partner's RyePA, I loved it immediately. It was hoppy and you can taste the rye in the beer.
The Sycamore has a great selection of some fairly obscure beers. They also have a healthy supply of board games, which is awesome.
How have I not rated this place yet? Been about 5 times, and so far is my favorite place is the city for brunch. Love, love, love.
Went here for brunch this past weekend with some friends.
While I wouldn't come back for brunch, I would definitely come back for beers.

I chose this place for bottomless mimosas because it is near the BART station so my friends and I could get as drunk as we wanted to. The deal is AYCD for $8 with a food purchase. We got seats inside so the waitress was able to constantly top off our glasses.

"Wheelchair accessible" only partly; you can ask to be let in to the patio area around the back, although they may need to move some kegs out of the way, and the loo isn't accessible, which makes it difficult to enjoy all that beer. That said, the service was impeccable, the tap selection lovely, the food tasty, and the spirit of community is strong among the Burner-hippie-artsy crowd that makes this their local. If you like sitting out on the patio at Zeitgeist but want a little variety or some somewhat hipper snacks, get to the Sycamore. If you want a slightly more wheel-acessible option, try the Willows, which is its sister pub without a patio but with an indoors I can get into on cold foggy nights.

The Sycamore is a great, hipsta-fied (I think I'm going to trademark this expression) bar with a wide selection of beer and decent food.  The pork belly donuts are exactly what you'd expect them to be - greasy, delicious meat donuts.  We also had a pulled pork sandwich and the mix and match sliders, which weren't that impressive.  The Sycamore is a essentially a smaller version of Zeitgeist with a more relaxed atmosphere.  There is an outdoor area, although it's mostly covered so the smoke can get a bit overhwhelming.  They have board games, but when I was there most seemed to be missing pieces - although I did dominate my friend in Scrabble.  I'm glad this bar is in my neighborhood because I can drop in when I'm looking for a casual drink, and skip it when it looks too crowded.
Great beer selection. The sliders were good but not on the cheap side for the size they are. The side salad was really good, I highly recommend ordering it .

Came here for brunch because radish one of my favorite brunch spots in the mission for bottomless mimosas was packed to capacity. .. so I came here.  Wow terrible food I got the sycamore chicken waffles, man was it bad the chicken was like some sort of frozen Tysons chicken tender things and the waffle felt l was chewing bricks I mean I had to struggle swallowing them.  Now then, on to the service, service was friendly but could have been much more attentive. Basically had to walk up to the bar to place my order, then sat for ten to fifteen minutes waiting on a refill of my mimosa while all the staff gathered at the bar cracking jokes. Finally I got up again walked to the bar and refilled it myself. Ashame since this place has literally five tables total, two of which the only ones occupied. Bottom line if you come here I'd recommend do so only for the mimosas otherwise you can waste money on burnt ego waffles and frozen chicken tender suprises. You really do get what you pay for foods cheap and it reflects in the taste.
Their fried chicken is to die for. The friendly staff and lovely ambience won't disappoint either.
I came here in a group of 5 for Saturday brunch.  We had 1:45PM reservations and were seated at 2:00PM when 4 of 5 of us had arrived.

One of my favorite places in San Francisco. Great menu and the portions are more European than American which I prefer. Prices are very reasonable. Love their kale cesar salad. And the trio of meat are generally delicious. Great place for groups. The outside patio is very romantic and have an Italian/French feel to it.
16 days, three phone calls - still no credit back or call back regarding incorrect charge!

What used to be my standby reliable wonderful place to bring out of town guests to has disappointed. I saw the recent yelp posts and figured they "had a bad night".... But our dinner last night was literally spoiled by bad service: approaching the table too much, interrupting, rushing us, and no engagement with the menu or managing the pace of our experience... The flow of the evening you know was just rude? A feeling of bad service and no hospitality. My guests were put off and I was embarrassed at having said 'it's one of the city's longtime best that always comes through'...but unfortunately I was wrong! sorry to say foreign cinema, but I'm moving on.
The food was great and our waitress was stellar.

I went here for my husband and I's first anniversary and it was exactly what I wanted. IT was romantic with the outside seating and string lighting and the food was amazing and creative. I was happy and content dropping 100+ on this experience. I will be back on another fancy occasion. :)
Service stinks. Waiter seemed out off and pissed. $7 for 4 pieces of bacon most of which were burnt. How do you run out of sticky buns during brunch. Ugh.
Dinner Review - GET THE DAM PORK CHOP
Decent food, and ambiance ruined by poor service.
Really cool atmosphere.  Everything I've eaten here is delicious but nothing compares to their friend chicken.
Foreign Cinema is a great brunch spot. Recently, they changed the cocktail menu omitting my favorite spicy Bloody Mary. I wish they would bring it back.

Made a reservation for Sunday brunch around a month or so in advanced. I would definitely recommend making a reservation because it beats waiting the 1.5hrs that I heard the hostess tell the other party of two who came at the same time I did.

The food is a bit expensive and in small portions, but they are all really really tasty. The food was served either extremely fast or extremely slow, with mysterious gap of unwaited minutes between entree and desserts.

Great atmosphere! We got amazing seats on the patio. Drinks were on point, all of them! We got 4 dishes, 2 of them seafood. Food was good, but did not live up to hype. But its a nice outing so I will go back.
Absolute delicious food experience.  Staff lovely and very attentive... I highly recommend.
It's not bad but there was too much wrong with our experience to go back. I'd give it 2 1/2 stars if possible.

The ambience was great however they sat me in the dining room when I was one of the first people who arrived rather than seating me in the courtyard where the screen was. My bf got the fried chicken which was excellent. I had the scallops. The scallops were well cooked but bland, the lemon sauce was sour no flavor other than the sourness. But the worse prt was the radicchio- it was sooo bitter. I've had radicchio before but this was so strongly bitter it overpowered everything. I should have returned it but we were running late for an event. I just wanted to get out of there. I may return for the fried chicken, but maybe not.

My all time favorite San Francisco restaurant! I ordered the natural beef carpaccio and baked redwood hill goat cheese in escarole with lavender. For my main course I got the grilled kobe bavette and my boyfriend got the Alaskan halibut. Everything was soo delicious!

Went here for my anniversary dinner last week and was not disappointed at all. Great, lively atmosphere. Feels pretty posh. The food was outstanding. My husband got a steak which was seriously melt-in-the-mouth. The duck platter was also excellent. I can still taste the yummy Duck Pate in my mouth.

I came for dinner with my friend on a Friday night. First, how many freaking times are you going to come to my table and ask me if I am finished with my food? How many times??? If I came to have dinner and TALK with my friend, that's exactly what I want to do and if I want to take my time eating it while we are talking, why can't I do that?!

Not too happy as I write this. It was a beautiful day in SF today and I was really looking fwd to a good brunch at Foreign Cinema. The atmosphere inside the restaurant was lively, fun, although very noisy. I couldn't have a conversation with my guest and we then both resorted to reading the newspaper instead, which i was glad I brought along.

Had been long wanting to come to Foreign Cinema but just never had the chance. Finally, after a long night of music (and dranks) at the Bill Graham, we decided to make the trip over for some yummy brunch. The entrance is pretty unassuming and I was also pleasantly surprised to learn it is right next door to rooftop bar Techo de Lolinda (that's another review). We were seated right away even though we'd made no reservations. This was around 1:30ish. So far, so good.
Crazy good food, one of the most unique dining experiences I've had, the servers were more knowledgeable than most places you will go, and your friends will be jealous you found this place.
My friends and I had a great dining experience at Foreign Cinema a few weeks ago, and I'd definitely come back.

We couldn't get a reservation anywhere and decided to just pop in.  We sat at the bar and were very happy with the service and food.  It was simple and delicious!  The bar tender was lots of fun and taught us a bunch of new fun facts about aperitifs.  Overall, a great experience.
Another victory. Foreign Cinema is definitely a great brunch spot. Well worth the high reviews.

Don't believe the hype. Foreign Cinema is the Mission's Cheesecake Factory but at a higher price point. The menu over-promises and the final product fails to deliver. Your friends' Instagram photos of food from Foreign Cinema lie unless they've tagged with #oversalted and #underwhelmed.

Amazing ambiance and our server was more than helpful in guiding us towards some of the better dishes on the menu. Absolutely loved the persian omelete and was shocked to find out that they are one of the few bars in the area to carry Pappy Van Winkle, which is hands down one of the best and rarest bourbons on the market.

We came here for date night on a Saturday and had a great time. Make sure to make a reservation on a weekend for dinner becuase it was pretty packed here and I doubt we could've just walked in. The food was great, service was okay, and the environment is cute/unique/semi-romantic.

Nostalgia reinvented! Foreign Cinema is nestled in an old theatre complex in the Mission District, dripping with charm and clean, upbeat energy all around. The Brunch menu is diverse and large enough to please the confit and pâte connisseur or the standard eggs and bacon craving happily.

Finally tried Foreign Cinema after living in the city for two years!  Right off the bat, the ambiance is beautiful, classy, but casual with an indoor and outdoor aspect.  The service is friendly and funny, and the menu is varied and creative.

Such a great place.  I loved the ambiance, the food was SO good.  I mean seriously, I had the best pork chop I've ever had in my entire life. It absolutely blew my mind.  Certainly not cheap, but I think for a special occasion, it's a great indulgence.  Super romantic too!

A friend of mine told me about this place and I was eager to try it while in SF last weekend. I called to get a reservation, but they were unable to give me one. The lady over the phone advised me to arrive at 11 AM (when they open) and I'd likely be able to get a table. So, we took a taxi and arrived shortly after 11 AM. The place was more than half empty. We asked the lady for a table and were promptly turned down. We explained to her that we had called and were told that a table would be likely. She didn't seem to care. Apparently, this lady was under the impression she was running a hot new nightclub. There were countless empty tables and we even explained that we wouldn't be staying very long since we had a flight to catch, but alas, she simply did not want to seat us. Oh well. We left the place and went over the Beretta. Unlike Foreign Cinema, the hostess was totally gracious and gave us a table right away. the brunch was FANASTIC and service was excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. So, I guess I own the abrasive woman at Foreign Cinema a big, fat THANK YOU for turning us away :)

I finally have to review this place after so many consistently great experiences. I try to take my 5 yr olds to a new restaurant at least 2x a month to try new foods and give the kids the chance to practice their restaurant manners. Kids love this place and I love their great food offerings. So entertaining and yummy the iPad never got turned on the whole meal. Was nice to relax as a family and enjoy a glass of wine with husband.  There were other families on the Sunday morning we were there with well behaved children. I appreciated that.
Fantastic food and ambience! We had brunch here and we were blown away. Have recommended this place to many friends who are fans now too.

I am decidedly mixed about Foreign Cinema. The food is good, and the service was fine. It's a cool space for a group gathering. . We went for a departmental dinner and I found the group planning coordinator Janine to be difficult to work with, and the policies are decidedly unfriendly. When we booked the place I anticipated a party of 35, based on prior years. I was told there was a $4000 minimum, which I thought we would have no problems meeting.
Got the kobe beef and caesar salad.  It was good, but not so amazing that I was blown away.
The atmosphere was great, the food was eh.
Great atmosphere and meal.

The food wasn't.  We ordered different chicken plates, one a fried chicken, and one chicken smothered in onions. The fried chicken was super 'chewy' :/ and the smothered onion chicken was super bland.

This place was terrific. It was empty when we showed up at 6:30 with a group of 7 on a Saturday, and the entire middle section was still empty when we left two hours later. The bonus for us was we didn't get rushed out as groups at popular places can be.
Loveeee the decor here. Foods great . But no tostones ? Or plantains? Or monfogo? Come on . I would give it 5 stars and go
This is what I call puertorican food!

You know how difficult it is to drop in someplace in the Mission to get food on a Saturday night? Especially if you're not looking for something super fancy or cheap - just a place with good food to sit down and chat with some friends. Good thing someone knew about the Parada 22 pop-up in Boogaloos.

Super authentic. The pork is absolutely delicious along with the plantains and fried yuca. The staff is really friendly and helpful. There's rarely a wait as it's a bit of a hidden gem. Very reasonably priced. Get some!
I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Food was good, service was even better. They have really good sangria.
The food is delicious: the chicken was awesome, the salad was perfectly dressed, the sangria was sooo good. I usually don't like beans, but I literally ate the whole bowl of red beans.

So my wife and I can't even wait to leave this restaurant to give it such a good review. We are literally sitting here at the table telling you to come in!  That's right- you hipster girl in the padded vest and knitted shirt walking bye- why aren't you coming in!  Wait, young couple walking outside holding hands, it's warm in here- and even more delicious!  San Francisco May be cold but our hearts could never be warmer after we stuffed ourselves with succulent mofongo and sweet onion bistec. Did I mention we are from Oakland?  And that we will probably never go on a date anywhere else again?  And that we actually have money left over for our kids diapers? (Kids- they seem so far away here). Oh wait, my wife just did the happy food dance. I think I see palm trees growing in the middle of the restaurant! Could it be?  Are we back in Puerto Rico?  You outside!  Come on in!  It's tropical in here!  Best. Restaurant. Ever. (Ps. If this restaurant were actually in Puerto Rico it would be waaaaaaay more expensive. This is too good to be true)
We thought the 5 star review was too good to be true. Nope - they deserve every star.
I haven't reviewed anything in ages. HoweverI felt Parrada 22 merits a good review.
A pretty tasty Cubano and nice yucca.

This is a great local pop-up.  Being inside boogaloos, the atmosphere is very casual.  The food is rich and interesting and quite inexpensive for the neighborhood.  This is definitely a place to go if you want a really good meal at very reasonable prices

What a deal! Terrific, attentive and friendly service. Authentic cuisine.  Just right portions. Swell prices.  The vegetarian plate was super good - the white beans w/ green olives stole my heart. Will try their full-blown space in the Haight soon.

Went to this place last night for dinner and left with a huge smile on my face!! I love Latin food, especially authentic Latin food, and you don't find that many authentic Puerto Rican restaurants around! Amazing entrees and pretty large portions for super cheap prices, the Sangria is too die for and the flan topped off an amazing meal! The service was super fast, and friendly, and the ambiance with salsa in the background was a ton of fun! I'll definitely be back soon!! Yummy!!!
The food is ridiculous! The sangria is super good, great waitress....can't wait to go back!

With all of the great food in the mission picking a place to eat can quickly become quite the conundrum. Heard about Parada from a friend and can't say enough about the place. Puerto Rican food at it's finest with excellent service. No longer will I be driving to San Rafael for my PR fix. Still a bit of a hidden gem so easy to get a table at night. Come before the hipsters and techies find out about it!
This place has great food and the service was super friendly and quick! My new favorite spot!
Still speechless with how amazing my dinner was!! Service could not have been better! This will be my new spot in the Mission!! If you have not been, Go Now, you will not regret it.

I found out about parada 22's pop-up while having brunch at Boogaloos last weekend. My server handed me a coupon for a free glass of sangria and said to come try the food Friday or Saturday night, so I of course did (I can't say no to a free cocktail) and fell in love with the food! Such a cool atmosphere at night. My new go to dinner spot in the mission!
Good food! Great Sangria.  Nice pop up inside Boogaloos on the weekend.

9pm reservation for four and we were finally seated at 950.  Please do not accept late reservations if you cannot accommodate. This forced our dinner to run into your breakdown/clean up time which made us feel awkward still being there. The food was fine. They did give us one glass of free wine for the wait. But again there were four of us - were we supposed to split the one glass of wine?

We went on a double date on a Saturday night. We spent $ 170 dinner for four, although only two of us had a glass of wine. I think it is another over-priced restaurant in S.F. The interior is quite nice, the noise level upper-medium, which means we had to raise our voices to overpower the music. We sat on bar stools around a table which became painfully uncomfortable after entree was finished. But maybe that is the point to get you out of the door once you are done with dinner. It feels like you are not supposed to enjoy your company and pay your bill after you finished your food. The food was fresh, but not sensational. I do not think I will be back. There are still more affordable dinner options in this town with matching quality. But then again, everything seems to increase in price with the recent gold rush.

I really enjoyed the two meals I've had here. The space is small, as is the menu, but everything is designed with care. Seems like it doesn't get super crowded during the week for lunch and it's pretty to easy to get a seat. Their lemonade was delicious. I've had the burger and the open faced egg sandwich. Both yummy and requiring a fork and knife!
I lovelovelove the food here!  Can't wait to come back!

The vibe was fine, the service decent, and the food above average.  I had the pickles, octopus (great! Not chewy as usually happens), the trout (fantastic), the sirloin (not bad but not amazing), the cucumber salad (HIGHLY recommend! Sounds meh but it's really good), and the pumpkin funnel cake (a bit overdone but tasty).

Came here for dinner and was pleasantly surprised with the cute surrounding neighborhood. The waitstaff was very slow - it took almost 20 minutes for us to order and then the food came out pretty slowly. The kitchen staff is small, and the kitchen is also just as small. There's one stove, one grill, and a large countertop. I believe they cure their own meats and make their own baked goods. We ordered the charcuterie which came with lardo with peaches, rabbit and chicken pate with fruit, and a mystery meat glob on top of some sort of jam. This was served with huge chunks of buttered bread which could be replenished. The meats were delicious and the portion was more than enough for four people. I loved it! We then ordered the kimchi broccoli side, the bucatini with rabbit and Brussels sprouts and the risotto. The pasta dish was delicious  and I loved how fresh the pasta was! So good and the portion was big enough to share family-style. The broccoli was nothing particularly special - I think they made their own kimchi which didn't really taste like the korean style pickled vegetables. The risotto was interesting - I was not a fan of having little cubes of peaches in my savory dish. The rice was cooked well and it was tasty. Overall, I really appreciated the local feel of the food and the environment which is pretty indicative of California culture.
This place was good, though not great.

Nice looking place but waited 40 min for a sandwich at lunch told the guy we were in a rush (which we were) and had to walk out because they hadn't even made it yet. No wonder they make you pay first. No thank you.
Dinner on Sunday night.

Wanna-be elite restaurant but not there yet. First time, excited to try it. Party of 4. Service was uninspired, felt like a very difficult job just to take our drink orders, and bring bread. Waiter took 20 mins to bring first glass of wine, then eyed us drinking the the whole time and a sip or two before we're finished asks if we want another.... Then asks again the instant we finish. No. Borderline unfriendly hipster attitude during entree service, but gets very excited and friendly trying to sell us dessert. Too late buddy.
Place your order, grab a number, take a seat.

Poor quality food for price (soup, roasted beet salad). The bill included 2 items that we never ordered (an extra $58)...the corrected bill had extra alcoholic beverages that we never ordered. Poor attitude shown by staff (as if it was our fault the extra food that we never ordered were on our bill).
Best polenta I've ever put in my mouth! The Pomme d'Amour is a creme brûlée pastry and it is the best thing pastry in all of SF!!!!

Although our reservation was for 9:15 and we didn't sit until 9:40, we were pleasantly surprises with this place.  The food was amazing.  Perfectly done.  As a self proclaimed foodie, I highly recommend this place to anyone.  I just hope that not everyone finds it because I will be trying to go a lot more again.

You had me at small plates. I went here last night and the guys working here were all fantastic. The food was good but the service was top notch. The cooks and wait staff all looked very happy. The presentation of the food was nice. The glazed carrots and the pastured hen were a-mazing. I will totally be back.

I had dinner here on June 7 around 8pm-ish.  The ambiance and decor looks great...rustic...and still hip and trendy.  I was very excited to eat at this place from all the reviews...and their websites are awesome and designed well.  (Nice and navigable websites always add brownie points for me!)
well-done interesting dishes and friendly, low-key atmosphere -

This was a great night at a wonderful restaurant. Just got back from a wonderful date, where Sean took amazing care of us. The menu is small, but consists of great fresh and local ingredients. We loved the open kitchen, where we were able to sit and enjoy the fantastic food that was being prepared for us. For our first time here, they really made us feel at home. They have something great going here and you DEFINITELY need to come and enjoy first hand a great night out. Thank you local mission eatery for a memorable night

Really pleasantly surprised by this place. We came with a group of 6 and got the family style meal (which basically means the chefs make a bunch of stuff for you and the whole table eats family style). I highly recommend it!

Wow. Excellent seasonal fare. Perfectly presented and cooked. Super delicious. The custom wine blend wasn't to my liking but there were excellent choices at standard prices. I wish the portions were a little bigger and a just a slightly wider selection, but honestly, I'll be back.

Out of certain dishes at 12pm. Eggs were hard poached instead of soft. Had way better brisket from food trucks and crockpots. Dish would have looked nice in a magazine. Overall little interest in providing good service, mainly wanted to look cool.

Expected much better , based on yelp reviews. Maybe, an off day for the cook. We ordered the Beet salad and Hen and Salmon for entrees. The beet salad was good, but the Hen dish had too much salt and some of the rice was partly uncooked. The salmon was fresh , but the dish has no taste. When we informed the waiter about the uncooked rice, she felt bad.. but , that was it!

Decent food, but terrible wine list. Waitress even said "we don't have any full-bodied wines or anything with a lasting finish." No wine more than 3 years old! Otherwise nice atmosphere and decor, although it does get loud in there. Probably won't go again.

we ordered a lot of the things from the menu as we were a party of four. i didn't care much about what we ordered as i just wanted to catch up with my buddy. i'm not sure what theme they were going for, but the food was a bit too olive oily or buttery for me. overall everything tastes good, but i wasn't impressed with any particular thing or found any fault with it. the bill came out a bit steep, but the whole experience was good. not sure i'll come back though.

I debated between 3 and 4 star for this restaurant. The octopus was very tender however also very flavorless. The steak was very tender and done medium rare without asking our preference. The pork shoulder was dry and unremarkable. The size of the meat dishes were incredibly small for almost $30 a dish. The pork butter and cheese for the bread was great, especially that cheese! The gnocchi was probably some of the best that I've had however it was supposed to come with goat cheese and pancetta, neither of which I could taste or see much of. Overall a good dining experience but I don't think I will be back.
The food was very competent and well prepared, the wait staff excellent and attentive. The atmosphere was lovely.

Good farm to table restaurant the dishes were well prepared and with a pretty nice touch on it. They should have done a better job presenting the dishes and the ingredients as they are saying it's a Farm to table restaurant.

Good food, good service all part of standard fare when you go to a place like Local Mission Eatery.  Why none of our party of six expected was an entire wine list of wines we didn't know, the chance to learn about them and try them all.  The same was true for the food; the education and passion of the staff made the experience as enjoyable as the the dining per se.  Only down side?  After two and a half hour they politely explained we had already had the table for two and that the next set of guest had been waiting.  In fairness, even getting kicked out after overstaying our welcome, was done with grace.

This place has that down-home, earthy, farmhouse feel with a touch of upscale classy-ness. It's quaint and romantic. The staff is phenomenal and you can tell they really know what they're talking about when they describe the food.

Food is good & it seems made with good quality ingredients. This was my at least once a week brunch or lunch spot ...until they fed me stew which was obviously borderline gone bad. Very noticeable specially because I have had the same stew two days ago & came back for it. The flavor was off this time Beans tasted a bit rancid.

My boyfriend and I had a lovely date night here last week. The food was delicious (with the exception of the pickled vegetables, though I think that's more a taste preference of mine than a reflection on the restaurant). The drinks were also pretty good, even if the beer selection was a tad limited.

We came here last weekend with a large group and did a family style, chef's choice dinner. Everything we tried was amazing. I wish I could provide detailed descriptions of the dishes, but there too many interesting ingredients in everything for my food-addled brain to keep up with. The gnocchi and the halibut were definite highlights for me, but as I said, it was all amazing. We also appreciated their being so accommodating for our large group (although we obviously had a reservation).
Great food, nice staff, it just took a LOOOOOONG time to get our food.
Another 24th St local place that is very casual.  Open kitchen, you order and pay and your food will appear.

Lunch at 1pm on a Saturday: order/pay at counter, no table service.  At first taste, my $14 Italian sausage (browned meatballs) with polenta and a poached egg seemed bland, but I must admit it grew on me; the egg was perfectly done.  My wife's $14 brisket sandwich with sauerkraut was also fine, certainly not exceptional.

The food was excellent but the server was a little off. She took about 20 minutes to ask about our drinks. Additionally, she wiped her nose in front of us with her fingers. Right before she brought out more food, with the same hands. How appetizing!!

Had a very lovely brunch with friends this morning. Local Mission Eatery, really, is just lovely. The relaxing, casual ambiance combined with the creative dishes was a perfect brunch. Even the open kitchen didn't seem as chaotic as I was expecting...might've even been a little soothing to watch.

Been there twice and I am now convinced that I am not going back.  The food is tasty and it is definitely of good quality. My main complaints are portion sizes and price. I had lunch there today and order three dishes to share with a friend: the smoked trout with grapefruit, the butter bean mushroom and Brussel sprouts soup, and the little gem salad (which wasn't made with little gem lettuce, but with red lettuce instead). The soup was exquisite, but it wasn't even a full bowl and it costed $14 bucks. The trout was mediocre and it was no more than 2 slices of trout, hand broken into little pieces so it would cover the surface of the plate, with perhaps 1/8 of a grapefruit and some sprinkled herbs, $12. The salad was a-ok, disappointing because I ordered little gems and got red lettuce, and all the other ingredients described in the menu were scarcely hidden under the lettuce.

What a great place.  It's an odd combination of comfy and sleek, but the food is just outstanding.  This kind of place is what happens when the founder has that combination of talent, vision, and work ethic.  Yaron Milgrom not only has talent, but he's worked incredibly hard to create this local culture, train staff, make diners feel at home, and get his locals message out.

The decor here is the perfect combination of classic, hip, and cuteness. The menu is very limited since they only make dishes that are produced locally. I ordered the trout dinner and the combination of flavors was like a celebration for my taste buds. We also ordered the duck and the steak. I had a taste of those and they were also cooked perfectly. The service was also 5 stars which made the dinner an all around success.
My experience today was far better than it was the only other time I have been here, about 4 years ago.  Did not plan to ever return.

Highly highly recommend making this your "must have-stop@ when visiting San Francisco. I recommend going on an early weeknight to avoid a long wait. Worth the wait! I loved the ambiance in this small space and the pizza is tremendous!!

If I want trendy pizza on thin crispy crust with innovative toppings I come to Pizzeria Delfina. The service is always top notch...even if you sit up at the bar you will not be ignored!  I also don't think this pizza should be ordered "to go."  The delivery time will affect the greatness of the pizza.  Dining in at Delfinos will give you the full experience of its great crust. We love the Salciccia pizza and all their salads.  Be warned. It's very crowded at Delfinos. If you don't like the push and shove of impatient customers who might be hungry and ticked off, you might want to go early or go late...or order to go and eat it right away nearby ... But either way you will eventually get addicted to Delfino pizza. It obviously has happened to all those crazy customers lined up outside the pizzeria every night.
Sometimes you just need fancy pizza. Delfina is my go-to place!
What a gem!!

Very good pizza! Lines can be long, but carry out is always ready in a reasonable amount of time. Meatball appetizer is outstanding, along with the buratta are great starters. All the pizzas are equally good, with both veggie and nice meat options. Definitely worth checking out
This place is PERFECT for you if you like:

Neapolitan style pizza is my favorite kind, so I was stoked to try this place on my recent trip.  It is super, super tiny and my party of 5 were awkwardly squeezed in around an outdoor table, so not so great for groups, but the pizza is awesome.

Don't be fooled! Their pizzas are sliced into 6 pieces, not 8 - so when you open that box of deliciousness, be prepared. So either plan your group size accordingly or prepare to fight for the extra slices; because yes they're that amazingly tasty. I always get the margarita pizza, it's super.

Very nice staff, AMAZING food! Their menu changes from month to month, so theres always something new to try! A bit pricey, but it's worth it! I really recommend the prosciutto pie pizza and the margarita pizza. It's also really recommended to get there early, or make a reservation, because they get really busy, and really fast!
pizza is amazing! Service is terrible! Ambience awful.

There is no better pizza in northern California. The panna pizza is to die for. I haven't been able to stop my addiction to these pizzas. My other favorite is the stretched mozzarella and crusty bread. Very high quality ingredients that will leave you feeling fine about the long wait for a table. ;)
Nice Pizza and wine here! Dinner with my Japanese friend here, still have seat in Friday night.l

Went in there today because I had to take an emergency pee.  The kind gentleman obliged and I was out of there in less than a minute.  Don't ask Cafe UB on the next block this emergency request.  Everyone there was super nice on the way out and everything smelled great.  I will definitely return for a fat pizza the next time I have the time.  Thanks!

The food was fine. This review is for their customer service. It's hard not to get the impression that the staff thinks it's cool to be rude and disrespectful. I have never left a restaurant so frustrated and pissed. The waitress was completely confrontational and aggressive. It felt personal and uncalled for. I was told by the manager that she is a hard worker. I think you could find plenty of hard workers in this city with better attitudes and customer service skills.
This was a difficult choice..between 3 stars or 4 star review.  A tiny spot so I can understand how it gets so packed.

We were stuck at 10pm in the Mission on a Friday night needing a quick but late dinner. Delfina struck a good balance between good decent quality and fairly quick. They still had customers but had a couple tables open, and we sat, ordered, and ate all within about 30-45 minutes.
Been here a few times and always enjoyed myself; however on my last visit halfway through eating my pizza, I discovered a dead beetle!

We came here at 3PM for a late "lunch" and thought we'd get in no problem but the place was packed with an hour wait. Reservations are a must. Luckily they sell pizza by the slice next door and we grabbed a few and ate in the park nearby. Margherita pizza was amazing, so were the other slices we had.
Pizza Delfina is pretty good. I'm a huge fan of the thin crust pizza. They must make their own fresh marinara sauce - because that is a highlight of the pizza. The tomato flavor is on point.
I've been angling to try Pizzeria Delfina my last two trips out the San Francisco and finally got the chance.

Because we'd like for something lighter, we didn't have the pizzas. We had cauliflower, fried Sandabs (a kind of black fish) w/ aioli and spigariello (an Italian leafy vegetable). All were very good, especially paired with beer :)
My quest to sample the best Neopolitan pizza wherever I go recently led me to Pizzeria Delfina in the Mission. I was not disappointed.

If heaven had a pizzeria, this would definitely be it. Every bite was amazing! I ordered the 4 Formaggi which was basically four different types of cheeses. This is the first place where I have heard of that puts egg on top of their pizza, so naturally I was curious as to how it would taste. The egg on the top was unbelievably delicious! The egg was at a perfect consistency with the yolk being a little runny. I am a little sad that the pizza itself was tinier than usual, but the flavor sure made up for it! They even had a small plate on the side with freshly grated parmesan cheese, chili flakes, and some dried leaves or spices that I do not know the name of.

The pizza here will never disappoint. I had one of the specials and it was naked to perfection. The second time I once again was super satisfied and so was everyone who I dragged along. Overall I love the atmosphere, the service and of course the delicious pizza.

I suggest going at off-peak hours to avoid the long wait. For dinner at 9pm on a weekend, the wait was ~25 min for a table for 3. Totally worth the wait! Tasted the Margherita, the Prosciutto, and the Salsiccia. Couldn't really decide which I liked the most, they were all delicious! Thin crispy crust + fresh ingredients = great pizza. I can see why this place has the reputation of "best pizza in SF"! Also, the free breadsticks are awesome!

The bytch at the register for pizza pick up always has a fukkd up attitude. If you don't like your job or people bytch go work in a warehouse or something. I've been coming here once, sometimes twice a week for the last 2 months and every time I go her rude ass is there. Good luck with your visit.

The wait at Pizzeria Delfina can be discouragingly long during mealtimes. On my last couple of visits, I've taken the pizzas to go and enjoyed them at Dolores Park. I've tried the salsiccia ($15.75), funghi ($19), and amatriciana ($16)--ordered from most to least favorite.

Apparently Wednesday night at 6pm is the time to come if you don't want to wait.  Came with a party of 2 and had our pick of tables.  There were only two other tables occupied.  By 7 there was a small wait for 4 people, but still pretty fast for 2.

Had this place bookmarked for a while but what really pushed me this direction was Scott from NYC Scotts Pizza Tours.  He mentioned this place as being a SF Standout in the pizza scene and he is right!

Yum! Thin crust pizza, just how I like it. Went as a party of 4 at 6:30 PM on Saturday, the wait was only 10 minutes. Our party shared the Belfiore Burrata appetizer, broccoli raab (white cheese sauce with broccoli rabb), prosciutto pie (white cheese sauce with prosciutto & arugula), and the napolentana (tomato base with anchovies). As a vegetarian, I thoroughly enjoyed the broccoli raab and appetizer. Very flavorful food, a bit on the salty side.
Pretty good place to eat!! Good food +Super chill. I will for sure eat here again......................

Craving really good pizza?! Go to Delfina's!!! The restaurant is a bit small but the delicious food and great staff make up for it! I ordered the 4 formaggio pizza and asked that half of it have spicy salami just because I know it could be on the salty side. It was the best decision of my night! My friend had the margarita pizza and she wanted another one as soon as she finished it! Located less than a block away from birite ice cream for dessert right after! Totally recommend.
Yup, this place is totally legit. The margherita pizza may be the best I've had in the city -- possibly topping over Tony's in North Beach (!!!).
Margarita pizza is amazing! Also the baba rum strawberry cake is a must! I'm totally going back!

I've had the best pizza here. Always stop in when I am in town. All of their ingredients are fresh and the quality of the food is excellent! I've only visited the Burlingame restaurant. I love the atmosphere too!
Pizza was great but the meatball I are yesterday was extremely salted.
I love this pizzeria in the filmore! It's so worth the wait!
Love it here!! Such a cute little spot right down the street from Delores Park.

Cute pizza place on 18th... but seriously overpriced. Sure sure the food is pretty good, but I wouldn't say it was spectacular in comparison to other pizza joints in the area. I spent $56 on two individual sized pizzas... that is OUTRAGEOUS.
I'm giving this place 4 stars (rather than 3) pending my next visit..

Having been here a few times I actually really dig this place. I like the location, the atmosphere and the food! They have happy hour, most times but I don't know when since I am only here on weekends.

holy moley the food was good. it is expensive, but i walked up last minute late on a friday night and were sat immediately. the oysters were incredibly fresh, there was a plate of spanish ham that was incredibly strong and sharp tasting. the chicken cordon bleu bites were crisp and cheesey and smothered in burrata mozzerella and was rich but amazing. the only knock was that the deviled eggs with fried oysters were extremely salty and needed to have the salt shook off before being eaten the cocktails were really well mixed. i had one of the best manhattan's ive had in san francisco there. the price is the only thing preventing me from eating here multiple times a week.
Great atmosphere! Very attentive servers and staff!

I'm actually really behind on this review so I will do my best! Reservations were pretty easy to make, parking in the area is a different story! You can either circle around aimlessly and pray that someone leaves or you can just park around Dolares park and walk a few blocks. Got here around 7 and the place was pretty packed already. Shared the bone marrow and it was really flavorful and the plate looked really nice. I also liked how I cooked to the point where I could scrape ALL the marrow off... I've been to places where half the marrow was still stuck to the bone! Everything complimented each other really well on the plate (the peaches, fennel, onion, dill, etc). Then we shared the H&R burger and the fried chicken. The burger didn't stand out too much, but it was still a good burger. It didn't just fall apart on me (which I really hate when that happens) and it was moist and was seasoned well. The fries were fried perfectly. The fried chicken was my favorite dish of the night. Fried perfectly and the white meat was still moist and flavorful. Usually white meat is dry and bland... but not here! They also had some pickled vegetables that came with it... and I guess I just really like pickled foods cause I was really enjoyed that... LOL. Great meal and the service was good too. Place was clean but it can get pretty loud and packed. Definitely recommend reservations if you can get them!

Too over priced, the trick is to not get the hog or rocks. Been here a few times, including for a snack at lunch too. My oysters came out all shucked poorly and for $3-4 an oyster, you can do better at hog island, swan, or even at mission oyster. I want a clean and glistening oyster that is the size that each type is supposed to be. These oysters were all the same size and hella tiny. Wussup with that? Their mignonette is also weak. the egg fries are okay.

I love burgers and this place has the best burger i've eaten in the past few months. I was actually surprised at how flavorful and juicy the burger was. All ingredients offered a balanced delight, and there wasn't a single ingredient was was overpowering. So if you're looking for a new burger to try, give Hog and Rocks a go.

It is a good restaurant for oysters and cocktails. I've been here for brunch only because Radish was packed. No one was really waiting for Hog & Rocks and brunch and after my experience I can see why. It isn't the best food. My eggs and succotash/summer squash was very oily. They used a lot of butter. I've been here for dinner and happy hour too and was satisfied. The oysters are always fresh, but don't order the duck. It isn't seared properly and it is rather bland. I would suggest sticking to oysters, seafood or charcuterie.
Love:

Great cocktails. Good food, but not my favorite style (a little on the heavy side of the spectrum). Charming and professional wait staff. **Love** the popup on Thursday (after 10pm) with Korean food. So good.
It really is as good as it gets!
Based on the first visit:  Awesome place.  Try the bone marrow. Great cocktails too!

One of the best old fashioned cocktails I've had in town. They also have a list of 10 different ways you can change it up - but I love a great classic old fashioned. Come here just for that if nothing else!

I've been here a couple times now, and each time has been a great experience. The atmosphere is cozy and every time I've been there's been a full house. The bar is nice and big and there's usually room for walkins. However, perhaps reservations are recommended if you plan on coming in with more than two people and/or are going during peak hours (7-8pm).

Love that you can make a reservation for brunch on a Sunday and the place has a sufficient amount of space. We original thought 7 people were coming, but  5 showed up. The waiter let us keep our extra seats despite the number of people we had.

This place was really dimly lit and has high tables with bar stools. There were coat hooks underneath the table which I thought was cool. This place had a very limited food menu and nothing on the menu appealed to me. I looked over at the specials and saw the H&R Burger and I thought that would be a safe bet. Literally nothing on the paper menu caught my fancy. I ordered the $16 burger which came with fries. The burger itself was not bad with the melted cheese- but it was the bun that killed the burger's potential. The bread was SUPER crumbly. It was large and fluffy and would just crumble apart after each bite, making everything in the burger fall all over my plate. I ended up using a knife and fork because it got so ridiculous. I left some of the bun pieces on my plate when I finished, as the crumbly bread wasn't even tasty. I look over at the two people next to me with the same burger and they also had a pile of bun on their plate leftover. The fries were just meh.

What a fabulous surprise! The food here was good quality and delicious!! Staff was super nice and the fresh mimosas worth ordering! The chicken and biscuits were super yummy! Can't wait to come back... You should go!!
get bottomless mimosas for $20!
Awesome Old Fashioned, great oysters.

We made it right before the happy hour ended and were able to enjoy some of the HH menu (margarita, oysters, pork belly). The food was delicious. For our main course, my best friend had the H & R Burger (tip: it's a secret item not on the menu) and she said it was absolutely delicious. I had the fish and chips and it was amazing - one of the best I've had. The tartar sauce was delicious. Staff was super friendly and nice.
Hangry!!! That's how I felt after dining here- hungry and angry :(
Overload of flannel shirts? Check.
The food here, including appetizers- are hit or miss.
Probably one of the best FISH N CHIPS I've had in recent memory.  Perfectly pulled off.  Loved it and would drive all the way back to SF just for it.

Really enjoyed the brunch food here. They serve a dutch pancake that is covered in creme fraiche and strawberries. It was a great item to share, although it would have been too rich for me to eat on my own. Got the hamburger, which wasn't on the menu but is apparently available if you ask about it. Really tasty, and the fries were almost perfect in texture. It can be so disappointing when they are either too soggy, too crisp, or too fat, so having them be spot on was a refreshing relief.
A total meh experience. Super busy, an okay old fashioned cocktail, and overpriced bar food that wasn't super appetizing.
Here I had a Serrano ham charcuterie plate that I still dream about, over a year later.
Whisky flights?!?  Yes.
Food looks great. Only tried their  Deviled eggs, which were salt bombs!  :( Other patrons seemed to love their burgers though.
This restaurant is pretty standard for SF. It falls into my: "I wish I only ordered the small plates" type of restaurant.
Has "ham and oyster" always existed as a regular restaurant category? If so, I would like to make reservations to all of them.

Love, love, love this place! It is on a side street in Mission. A small restaurant with two large communal tables, so it actually can seat a lot of people. The two specialties of the restaurants are cured hams and oysters, hence the name Hog and Rocks. I think the Oysters are delicious, but the cured meat is just out of this world! We ordered 5 different kinds of hams and each kind has different fat content, texture, comes with different compliments, e.g. pickled grapes, cheese, olives, etc. and has its own distinct flavor. Every one is super delicious. I can eat this everyday.
Hog & Rocks? More like Smoke & Mirrors.

I am rarely amazed at what chefs can do even with complex/exotic ingredients, but I was truly amazed at what Chef Song was able to do such simple and ordinary ingredients. The H&R burger, Chef Song's rendition of the good ole American hamburger truly rocks. It was a perfect marriage of burger, cheese, greens and bun. The texture of the burger, flavor of the complementing seasoning, and skillful grilling propelled this burger to one of the best burgers I've ever had. Then just as I thought it could not get any better, I had a bite of H&R's Heritage Pork. From a casual glance this dish looked ordinary, slices of pork with some veggies but one bite dispelled that myth. It was one of the most tender slices of pork I've tasted. Everything we had that evening, the devil eggs, French fries, fish and chips, and the salad, were all simple, elegant and delicious. Chef Song is undoubtedly one of the rising stars of the SF culinary scene.
The best burger in SF. The. Best.

We settled here for brunch because Dr. Teeth was too packed and we were too hungry to wait any longer. However, for the amount of time we waited to get out food, we might as well stayed at Dr Teeth. I understand that the restaurant was packed during the World Cup but waiting for 1.5 for our food was ridiculous. One of my friend  came 15 minutes after us and she ordered wings and that took 2 hours to make. Unless they are killing some fresh chickens in the back, no one should ever wait 2 hours chicken wings. And not to mention, the food was very mediocre and overpriced too.
I can't speak to the oyster special that everyone else seems to mention.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about this place! I took my boyfriend here last week for his birthday and it was seriously some of the best food we've ever had! He loves oysters and said they were delicious.  We also tried some really yummy starters. The tots - oh my god, they were unreal. And the pretzels and homemade mustard were so good and unique.

WAY Overpriced, food was OK at best, and there were so many disgusting flies around our table the entire meal it was awful.  Their drinks were good, i give them that, but at $12-$20 a pop i expect them to be fantastic.

Really cool place with a great atmosphere! We loved the cocktails, the devil eggs and the dessert. The only thing we disliked were the chicken wings: too much pepper just kills the taste. But service was good and we would totally love to go again so it's a 4 stars!

FOOD: Epic nachos. So tasty. Large chunks of meat, a sliced up half-avocado. The cheese is real and the portion size is huge for the price. Have also had the Milanese Chicken which was interesting. The menu is a little small, but everything I have tried on it is absolutely delicious. They have some soups which look very good but I haven't yet tried them.

Simple, fresh, tasty. Homemade chips and tortillas. Fresh avocado on both of our dishes was a nice touch (Milanesa de res o pollo and vegetarian nachos). No salsa bar but their hot red salsa was good and plentiful. I'll be back.
Time: 2:03pm/68°F mostly sunny

La Espiga de Oro came to my attention like many of you via it's #1 placing on top of the fabled and now defunct BURRITOEATER website.  I immediately looked up this taqueria on Yelp and found a 4 1/2 star star rating (encouraging!) based on 83 reviews (the jury is still out!)  Being a passionate Eater-of-Burritos myself it was critical that I try the food here post-haste!
Worst Burrito I've had in San Francisco.
I have tasted tamales all over 24th and this place has the best pork and chicken tamales I've ever had. They are delicious and you can actually taste the meat ( I know how bad this sounds!).

La Espiga de Oro is one of those super low key neighborhood haunts that look kinda iffy from the outside but serves incredibly good home cooked gourmet food on the inside. From the first moment those chicharones/chicharon (fried crispy pork belly) touch your lips, you'll soon forget that you're sitting in a generally yellow and brown store whose original colors you cannot decipher. We ordered chicharones salad, carne asada tacos, and the champurado (chocolate rice porridge with cinnamon). All were excellent! The champurado was a bit too cinnamony and mushy for me but it was ok for my friend. This place is a definite  must-try if you're craving well cooked crispy pork belly!!!

My first visit here was 2 days ago. I had a carne asada taco and a horchata. The food took a little while to come out, because they cook the meat to order. Hot, succulent, sabroso. So delicious, and deeply emotionally satisfying. The horchata was also perfect. Everyone else in the place was Latino, and eating a bowl of soup.

This is the best Mexican and Guatemalan food establishment in the Mission, hands down. I have visited many of the other restaurants various times (La Palma, El Farolito, Doña Tere's, La Taqueria, El Metate, Papalote, etc) and La Espiga wins on all counts -- quality of food, customer service,  price -- except for the lack of a salsa bar and the weird hours they keep. The women that work at this restaurant run a tight ship!! Being a fluent Spanish speaker does help in placing an order -- much of the clientele and virtually all of the staff are Mission locals, although these Yelp reviews have spurred more visitors from other neighborhoods and cities.
Super Carne Asada burrito was impressive from first bite to finish. Very generous amounts of meat. Nice big fresh slices of avocado. Their Carne asada is really flavorful.

The best pupusas I have found in this area so far... revuelta is my favorite, but all of them are large, filled generously, and have a nice crisp to the edges. The curtido and salsa here are not my favorite, but still good too. Be okay with waiting a bit longer for pupusas- they take longer to prepare.
This place has some really great food, and super friendly staff.
Hole in the wall. Tasty, fresh, authentic food. Crunchy chicharon dishes. 'Nuff said.

So I know that Burrito Eater ranked this place as the best burrito on SF but I'm not sure yet if I agree. Admittedly we made some mistakes like not ordering the carne asada (got the carnitas instead which didn't rate as well) and waiting to eat the burrito. I couldn't help it - I also ordered the chicharron papusa and chorizo taco and they looked so good. I told hubby, put down that burrito because we have to eat these things while they're hot! 5 stars! Where have I been? How come I've never had these flavor combinations before?

Good quality Mexican food with a traditional feel.  The staff is friendly and accommodating to me even as I ask a lot if questions about items that I can't pronounce.  Food also comes out fast. Seating and tables are bare bones.
Carnitas and chiccarone.....amazing good food
I ate there only once but it was good. Thdey have good and really hot salsa roja :-)
I stumbled into here because sugarlump hadnt opened yet and it was very rewarding.

Best pupusas I have had. Very friendly staff. Right next to Humphrey slocombes ice cream. Good combo to end the day. What tempt me most are the chicharon strips on the counter. But that will be for another day.
Insanely great carne asada burrito. I got the super option (for sour cream and chunks of avocado). High quality steak, flaky tortilla, and quality ingredients. Carnitas taco was great, too.
4.5 stars

best. papusas. ever. i've only ever come here for the papusas , but if they are any indication of how yummy the other items on the menu are , i'll have to come back for those too ! frijol and queso (bean and cheese) papusa was their favorite, and ours too !
Pupusas are to die for!! $3 for golden crisp outside, soft rich heavenly bean and cheese inside served with yummy salsa and pickled veggies. Randomly walked in and got lucky :)
Dem Chicharron was killer delicious!!!
Girl at counter is super nice, but knows about 2 works of English! It was fun trying to figure out how to order with her.
The burritos at La Espiga De Oro are absolutely spectacular.  The tortillas are grilled, and the seasonings that they use just really kick it to another level.

Despite having utterly bizarre hours (opening earlier than many coffee shops, closing literally right at the peak of dinner), La Espiga De Oro is probably the best overall taqueria I've been to in my two years here. And that's coming from someone who probably eats his weight in burritos every couple months.
Unique and delicious. I ordered pupusa of chicharon con queso, burrito of carne Asada, Huarache Tamal and flautas. The flavors were sensational.

There's Latin American food next door and across the street. I have to pass five places with tamales, tacos and/or burritos just to get here. We're in the heart of the Mission, so they're everywhere. So how do you find the best?

Cook the tortilla on the pan until there are brown flakes all over, giving it a crisp texture while still being soft enough to sink your teeth into. Deep fry the salty little bits of chicharrón like it is chicken so it's crunchy as fuck. Stuff up the insides of the tortillas with a thick layer of something resembling cheese and sour cream. Mix small sticky rice with some salsa. Stuff in in the salty chicharron along with the rice, the salsa, a teeny bit of soft beans and now, marvel at one of the finest burritos to ever exist. Serve it up with a kind smile and a warm heart.

I live very close to this restaurant and frequent it often. As mentioned in previous reviews, their pupusas are definitely the item that sets them apart from the surrounding restaurants. Their tamales are fairly standard, with the vegetable one being my favorite as it is more unique and less bland. I feel they've increased their price over the last year, but still a good deal for the amount of food. One thing to note is they make their pupusas once ordered, so expect a decent wait when ordering them.

I probably wouldn't have come here if one of my friends did not recommend this place.  It's a hole in the wall that didn't have any customers at the time. I'm so glad I tried this place. This was a first for El Salvadorean food and shall not be the last.
You can't ever go wrong with their pupusas!

3 stars cuz their tamales are DISGUSTING.  All masa and no filling, i asked the clerk if they had filling as this is the usual problem with street tamales, they lack filling and she said she didn't know. So I bought one and of course it was all dry, flaky masa with one small piece if chicken, their champurrado and warm drinks are always good though!

This restaurant is a small eatery on 24th street in the Mission.  It's surrounded by a lot of other mexican restaurants similar to it so there are a lot of other options just on the same block.  To me, it did not do anything to stand out from the others and was rather mediocre.  They're most known for their "pupusas" which are fried bread stuffed with various meats.  I came here and ordered a carne asada super burrito.  The food was extremely oily and was bland in taste.  Moreover, it took over an 30 minutes for us to get our food.  It was made fresh, but it seemed a little excessive for our line.

I always knew of chicharones as those fried, crunchy "chips" sold in convenience stores. I steered clear as it was a) not very appetizing-looking, b) unclear what it was comprised of, and c) insanely carb- and fat-ridden.

I've tried almost everywhere in sf that sells chicharron. I've finally found a place that I'm satisfied with. Their chicharrons are always fresh ,crunchy and juicy, just DELICIOUS. the bf and I would travel across the city just to get some. (The reason why we gained 10lbs -_-)  .  The best chicharrons in the city!
Great service with a smile, good prices. I only ate here once and I only had a carne asada burrito so I can't speak about all their dishes but be warned that the grease can be overwhelming.
Went back and had the tamales.  They weren't fresh or very tasty.  I'd still go there for a burritto but definitely wouldn't venture back to the tamales.

Just as we have our go-to place for dim sum in San Francisco, we have a new tradition of making a trek over to the Mission for pupusas at La Espiga De Oro. We chose this restaurant at random a couple of years ago, but the pupusas have us returning every time we are in SF. I can honestly say they serve the best pupusas I have ever tasted, especially stuffed with chicharrone. The first bite always sets my tongue to dancing! The service is fast and friendly, the prices are very reasonable and the food is top-notch. We can highly recommend not only the pupusas, but the flautas, sweet corn tamale, and atol de elote as well. The restaurant is small, with only a small counter and about six small tables, so get there early or after lunch when the crowds are smaller, or order their mouth-watering dishes to take-away. You won't regret it!
The best burrito I ever had! The meat (beef steak) was very tasty, heaven in my mouth :)
amazing burrito and salsa. whatever they do with the tortillas, making them slightly crispy/crunchy, amazing.. love love love.
Carnitas and al-pastor tacos!

Great food for a great price, not only in quantity but also in quantity. Fast friendly service from the staff. Only reason not gonna give this a 5 star is the fact they dont take cash, but then again that's not uncommon for mission street. Definetly recommend to try it out
Came here for my Mexican food fix while visiting SF.

This place is a bit of a hot mess (half-empty plates and glasses everywhere due to infrequent bussing of the tables, super crowded) but that doesn't mean the food isn't good. It's good. And coming from a New Yorker, it is CHEAP. $7+ for a massive burrito covered in salsa? $7 for an al pastor super quesadilla that was basically two normal sized quesadillas? Yes, please!
Didn't change my life.

My girlfriend and I came here after a night of light drinking *cough* and had the munchies for mexican. I haven't stopped thinking about that veggie burrito since. So delicious and some of the best salsa verde ever. The line was long and it's cash only, so be prepared.
First time here and the food was great. We are Texas relocations and this was on par with most tex mex burritos. Would go again!
my friend introduced me to the al pastor burrito a few months ago and I have been back at least 9 times.
Word of Warning: The second that it gets dark, everyone from Dolores comes here. Expect some major lines on weekends, but partly because this place is a very solid post Day-in-Dolores taco place.
Taqueria Cancun is great!  This spot has been named one of the best in San Francisco and I totally agree.

We stumbled across Taqueria Cancun while out celebrating Halloween, and I'm pretty sure it was the highlight of my night.  I got a carne asada super burrito, and it was AMAZING. Yes, even a burrito from Taco Bell tastes amazing to me after a night of drinking.  BUT the burrito was SO huge that I could only eat half of it, and when I ate the other half today, while completely sober, I was still completely in love with it.
I had the vegetarian burrito that everyone has been raving about, and it was disappointing.  I thought it could have used a lot more seasoning and flavor.  I probably will not get it again.
Been coming here for years but in the past year the quality has really taken a turn for the worst.
Awesome food! I ordered the Super Burrito and it was amazing! It's HUUUGEE! The Horchata here is also really good!

My first taste of a "Mission burrito" occurred at this establishment in 2008 when walking around the neighborhood. Little did I know that 6 years later, it has still held up to be my gold standard burrito. I tried other popular joints like El Farolito and the so-called "best burrito in America" at La Taqueria, but Cancun has got to be by far my favorite. The tortilla wrap has a great texture and really flakey. The rice has a hint of lime that tastes awesome with the avocado. Although there have been times where the avocado was not distributed evenly, I learned that you can add in extra avocado for free! And it lowers your chance of having avo only on one side of your burrito. I have come here both drunk and sober countless of times, and either way this place is amazing. I am also thankful for that "best burrito" place directing the crowd over to La Taqueria as I can now stroll in and get my favorite burrito with a shorter wait time!

This is my first visit to the mission location. I've been going to Taqueria Cancun for about 13 years. I usually go to the one on Market and 6th and didn't know there was another location until my last visit to the city.

Pretty good burrito for pretty cheap price. Don't expect any frills here like clean tables or nice atmosphere. Instead, just expect a hole in the wall place but with terrific food. Probably best for late night. All food comes with some free chips and salsa though it's nothing to write home about. You're going to be constantly bombarded by announcements for orders so just come here for the quick bite and go.

Disclaimer up front: I came here during brunch hours, so my experience was likely different than what most people come here for.  I had a breakfast burrito and a carne asada taco.  The breakfast burrito was ok - it tasted good, but there was too much sour cream and not enough egg.  The taco was decent as well, though I don't have enough to make a call on its taste, as it was simply too small.

I love this place! I can see why people have been disappointed in this place after all the hype that has been happening about it. It's the same if someone hypes up a wonderful movie and you're disappointed when you see it. This food probably won't change your life, but it definitely will make your day. I recommend the super shrimp burrito. The shrimp is seasoned so well and they give you tons of it!
Service is slow. Had a wet burrito with chicken, it was pretty good. Had a regular burrito with carne asada and got this ground beef crap. Not so good.
Mojado burrito!!! Amazing! Not only because it's massive a meal for only $8.16 but it tastes amazing! No joke I had the burrito before my flight to Mexico last month, it's just phenomenal.

If you want authentic Mexican food, this is your place.  Right in the middle of the Mission. Perfect place for lunch while touring the Mission District.  Very simple looking storefront, that cranks out great food. Had the carnitas platter and it was amazing. Huge portions of tender pork. The beans were also great.  You can see them cook it up while you wait.  Highly recommended.
The best tasting ugly salsa I've ever had.
Excellent super tacos and super burritos.
I live on the same street as Taqueria Cancun and it has never disappointed me. Anyone who visits me gets to experience their delicious mexican food, ambiance and service. I absolutely recommend:
These guys boast the "Best Vegetarian Burrito" in San Francisco.

This place is historically overhyped. The five three eight "best burrito in America" award boggles my mind. Without exaggeration: This isn't even the best burrito on mission St within a one block radius. Do yourself a favor and skip this one. El farolito is much better, or better yet, La Palma mexicatessen on 24th.
Worst veggie burrito. Not understanding why anyone would consider this a great place to get a vegetarian burrito. Only rice cheese and beans. The Only vegetables are in the salsa. Gross.

Awesome place in the Mission, especially in the middle of a fun night out. You get a great amount of food for cheap, and it's delicious too. I've had the burritos here and have never been able to finish them.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but if you're a vegetarian who enjoys mexican food you have to try their burritos! $5 for a huge burrito that would be 2 meals for the average person.  My go-to place when im in the Mission!

My dad never says anything is good, and when he does, you know it is. He loves Mexican food and I brought him here for a few tacos and he left one happy guy. The place is truly authentic, cash only and the food is really flavorful without being too salty.
All great! But they don't clean the tables and there is no mirror in the restroom. ESL in CCSF is for you

I wanted to come here after I read in Eater SF that this place may close due to them being "too" popular and that they can't keep up with the high customer demand.  In any case, after a night at Southern Pacific nearby, we saw them on the way to the BART station and why not end the night with some lengua tacos and a burrito?  I got the tacos because I'm health conscious, for real, and my friend got the burrito.  When we went in, we lined up at the wrong end of the counter so we eventually made it to the far end  and lined up to pay and then waited.  At around 11pm, the place is occupied at all tables.  Total damage for two lengua tacos and a lengua burrito was $12 after tax. That's not that bad!!

This was the first taqueria I visited when I first came to the Bay so maybe I'm a little sentimental but damn. The super burritos are fantastic, both al pastor and carne asada. Chips and sauces are included with to-go orders and I always load up on their amazing jalapenos (with carrots and onions) while I wait. Okay yeah I'm always starving since I hit Cancun after my favorite bar but damn, those peppers are good. I fill up a plastic cup and help myself. Another plus is personal: cilantro is optional. I'm new here and haven't yet gotten used to the cilantro in everything so if I can request its absence, I politely do so. The clerk I've always dealt with is a sweetheart and service time is minimal, even on packed Friday nights. I live closer to Farolito but Cancun just hits the sweet spot.
I got a carne asada burrito for second dinner because this place is supposedly the best... Uh, what, why?
Haven't been to such authentic Mexican restaurants for a while!
This place doesn't need anymore reviews. It rocked my life tonight. Total taste explosion. Affordable AND delicious!
Very good Burrito.  I ate some of the carne asada and had my own cabeza (head) burrito.  Flavors were awesome and I'll need to try the tacos next time to reconfirm the goodness.

Trying Mr. Pollo had been on my list for a while, but I waited too long. Now the people behind Mr. Pollo have taken over the old Palace Family Steak House. I love that they did minimal work on the old steak house interior. I like that they would rather focus on the food than worry about spending a ton of money on building.

A friend and I went for the first time last night and what an enjoyable dining experience it was. Manny provided an environment that I can only describe as casual and sophisticated at the same time. Because this was a tasting menu, I was able try foods that I've never had before and in a setting that didn't cause me to feel out of my element. From what I understand, the tasting menu can change daily based on what foods are purchased that day from farmers markets, etc.
My experience:

Pleasant surprise!  Came here based on reviews... but arrived a bit puzzled cuz the owner left the previous establishment's "Pizza Burger Steak" sign up on the side of the building.  Prex fixe menu only.  Excellent service.  Excellent 5 course meal.  Took about 2 hours from start to finish.  We left very satisfied.  will definitely return for more!
Amazing flavors, creativity and presentation! It was highly recommended by a foodie friend and lived up to his words in every way.

Very different from what I expected.  Attire is a little more than basic casual but I stayed nonetheless.   The food was really good.  The menu is all a dedicated tasting menu and is mostly meat intensive. Don't believe the old signage about burgers and pizza.  This is a very upscale spot.  It's definitely a good place to bring guests or have a celebratory dinner, but not really a regular Saturday night dinner.

"Service, sophistication, and sumptuous food" best describes the hidden gem between Bernal Heights and the Mission District, known as The Palace.  Chef Manuel Torres and his wife, Katerina del Torres, have created the perfect spot for foodies and urbanites alike.  The food is mouthwatering.  The wine lush. The experience.... exquisite!  You will understand why Chef Manny himself goes to the local farmer's market to buy local produce and spices. The scallops were divine! The squash was truly scrumptious... I think I'm in love!

This is an amazing hidden gem.  One of the best meals I've ever had.  The food is on par with Gary Danko, but at about half the price.  The decor is nothing stunning, but almost provides an interesting contrast to the gourmet Michelin-quality food.  Five courses plus an amuse bouche for $50.  Completely worth every penny.  Very fresh ingredients, no processed food... mainly vegetables, meat and fish done amazingly well with great flavors.  Very accommodating as well to food allergies / preferences.

Amazing experience!! This restaurant made our special night even more special. Every day the dishes and ingredients are created and hand picked by two passionate owners. We stopped counting on how many courses we actually had and could not decide about a final favorited. Every single one was worth to be claimed a favorite!

We love to try places that pals recommend and sometimes think the adventure of eating is trying something new without a lot of research into the "spot". this is the kind of spot you tell people about - I heard it from a friend who then told my friends.

I took my partner there for a birthday celebration last night. At first I was worried I wouldn't like but they don't have any menus for anything. I was able to leave my worries at the door. They guide you through their creative restaurant experience model.  The food was beyond delicious.  It was fresh and lovingly prepared. If you want food go to a chain but you want to experience food and service in the way it was originally intended go to the Palace.
Great value for a five-course meal. I love how this restaurant is not the least bit pretentious. Service is great, food is pretty good but not the best.

5 Star food at an amazing price. I absolutely love this place, and the two owners, Katarina and Manny. I have been here twice, and each time was a beautiful experience. The two owners of this restaurant get it - to be happy in life, you simply need three things. Good food, good wine, good people. They provide all of these, and provide them exceptionally.

5 course savory tasting menu is amazing! They have wine now so there is a $15 corkage, FYI. Overall, a very satisfying and pleasant experience in a location that's had some troubles. Will gladly return!

I had known about this little gem for awhile and finally brought my wife and friends to try it last night. We were not disappointed. Outstanding 5 course meal. The dishes were very creative with a latin flair. Two standouts for me were the yuca gnoochi and venezuelan sweetbreads. Chef Manny and his wife provided great service. They do have some wines available now but we  brought our own. Corkage is only $15. It is a mystery to me why this place hasn't blown up as is the tendency in SF. Truthfully I wish Chef Manny much success but hope this gem flies under the radar for awhile. Will definitely be back again soon!! If you are looking at this review make a reservation. You will be delighted.
Is 5 stars really the max I can give a place ??  Because The Palace deserves even more stars than that.
Great food and great staff. Food was delicious and not overly fussy. Staff was attentive but not over-bearing. We will definitely be back for the ever-changing menu. A hidden gem in the Mission!

A group of 10 of us came here for dinner one night. We all got the 5 course meal, some got the truffle shaving, some upgraded and got the lobster entree. Overall, the dishes were fresh and OK. Nothing I could really rave about or pinpoint that made the dinner and most of the dishes were too small for me.
The Palace is where it's at!  Went there for my last meal in San Francisco.  It was the best. 5 course meal that never stopped being amazing.

A group of six of us made a reservation for brunch this past weekend and we were not disappointed. Unfortunately for them, we were the only ones there! Come on, San Francisco! Get your brunch act together.

Went here for a bday dinner and added several orders of the wagyu beef. The food presentation was pretty nice, flavors were all right, temperature of food needs work, and textures also needs work. In particular, the vegetables were slightly undercooked and cold when they were plated. Maybe they meant it to be that way, but my opinion that since they were served with a warm lamb chops, warm veggies would pair better. Their beets salad was my favorite, followed by scallops with a cream soup. The rest of the courses were average, even the wagyu.
Went to this restaurant with my friend while I was in San Francisco... just because of all these fantastic reviews. Probably the worst steak restaurant I have ever been.
