I've passed this place on numerous occasions and always wondered what the heck...there's Zagat postings taped outside with a Pizza Burger Steak sign on the side.  On a craving for meat, I did as most cyber food junkies would, logged into yelp and searched for "steak" near my hood.
I'm a fan overall and will definitely go back!

This is a diamond in the rough! I ate their newly available brunch and it was amazing!!!! Their breakfast sandwiches (arepas) are fantastic! I'd recommend the wagyu beef or the sweet one if you want to be wowed! I had mimosas with their Venezuelan juices that perfectly complimented the food! I also got to sit with one of the owners who explained her husband (the chef) goes to the farmer's market every morning and picks the most fresh ingredients and then creates the menus from there! It is five star restaurant food for a great price!!!! Seriously impressed, it's not very noticeable from the outside but packs a mean punch of flavor once you're in there! Go there and do yourself a favor?

Amazing, organic, fresh food. The staff is uber friendly and this is going to be my new go to place when I'm in the city. Organic, non GMO, and vegan friendly places are rare but I found one! Food is light and fresh, you won't leave feeling bogged down and fat like you would at a diner. Also, crazy good juices for mimosas. I'm definitely coming back again and again.

Don't kid yourself - even if you fancy self a foodie, you won't be able to pick a dish from their a-la carte menu that is going to rival beautiful complexity and tenderness of chef's own selections making up 5-course sampler: he's going to beat your every time because he's a true artist and you are just aspiring to be one :-). So just give in and let chef take care of you - it's going to be fantastic.

Excellent food at extremely affordable prices. The tasting menu is 5 delicious courses of small(ish) plates. We had an outstanding lobster ravioli, pork sausage over homemade pasta, perfectly cooked sea bass, chicken and plantain, and incredible petit filet.
So I actually came here looking for PIZZA, BURGER, and STEAK. Still pretty confused about that sign...
Best arepas in town! If you haven't have and arepa yet, this is the place to try one. You won't be sorry!!!!!!!

OMG! We were so looking forward to having dinner here! We have heard such wonderful things about the food and the overall experience. We drove up the restaurant to find a homeless encampment in the parking lot! We did not feel that the experience would live up to what we have heard and didn't feel comfortable eating here and went elsewhere up the neighborhood. Hopefully they can clean up their lot and we may reconsider.
This is a poor value and a relatively unpleasant experience.

The palace, I really want to like you! Service was excellent, attentive and down to earth but the food... It was fine but nothing special. It calls for 5- courses for $50 but we ended up pay about two hundreds for two people: little bit truffle and a shared dessert, you rack up the bill quickly.
I was excited to try this placed based on hearing about it from friends.  I was NOT impressed.

We came too late for the tasting menu but had the steak for 2 instead which was beautifully cooked to the perfect medium rare. The restaurant is run by the husband/wife team and our steak was actually delivered by the chef himself. The sides are nice but there could be more variety and a little more interesting. Can't wait to come back to try the tasting menu. Service was fantastic. Decor is a little lacking so come here for the food but don't expect much from the atmosphere.

3 stars. The Palace offers a 5-course meal for $50 per person. Sounded like a great deal when I first heard about it. However, after my experience, I don't think it was really that worth it. Food was not too bad, but it was not amazing nor too memorable. The portion size of the food was quite tiny too. :(

This is the best deal in town. The venezuelan chef started this place to make great cuisine accessible for the common people. The 5 course pre-fixe menu is fantastic, with a good balance of food. Some of the courses are almost a tasting menu on its own, the pork one with pork tenderloin, chicarrones, and pork belly (made 3 ways on some delicious beet sauce, golden beat and red beet). Every course is made with care, with plenty of experimentation that has clearly refined over time.
I love this place!
So nice to visit Manny and Katerina at their newest location! They are such lovely people with immense passion for providing good, thoughtful food in a comfortable, easy setting.
Really great food at a reasonable price, comfortable atmosphere, and good service.

decently priced sandwiches in the mission. the owner is a hoot. He's always around and helping out and sounds frantic speaking rapidly in spanish. These sandwiches are a favorite lunch spot for my team. Love it!
Delicious sandwiches and the women who run this place are darling. I want adopt them as mothers/grandmothers.

The Sandwich Place is a tiny little sandwich place tucked away somewhere near the 16th St BART station. It's difficult to find since it blends in with the other generic shops around it - but once you've found it, your taste buds will guide you straight back for more!

This is a great sandwich place in the Mission.  The sandwiches are each made using an oven , not a microwave and special orders are gladly accepted.  I usually order here about twice a week. Juan really treats his customers well.  It's a great bang for the buck and the quality is always excellent.  Be advised it's a take out place, so plan to take your food to go.  It takes about fifteen minutes to have your order made so call ahead.
Hot pastrami sandwich all the way! Hole-in-the-wall run by Juan, an interesting guy and a good business man. I'll mainly be back to try some of their other hot sandwiches for sure.
Best sandwich place in the area, and an authentic neighborhood vibe. Nice people, good music playing, bargain prices, great food.
A sandwich place in burritoland & Juan holds it down!

It took two tries to find a day when Gluten Free bread was available, but Juan stuck to his word when he said they'd have some the next day. I've done my fair share of gluten free baking, and it's hard. Bread is seemingly impossible so I have to give Juan props for getting his bread so close to normal bread in texture. But there was something in it that gave it a pretty bitter taste and made my gums and tongue itch and my throat had some swelling. I do have a buckwheat allergy, but Juan promised that he doesn't use buckwheat so, I'm kind of at a loss and super bummed that I can't get a GF sandwich here, because this is clearly an amazing place!

The owner knows his way around a sandwich and has a way with people. He is funny, engaging, and he knows that he is good at what he does. The portions are huge. The sandwich was stellar. The prices are a tad on the high side, but you could tell that it's because you're eating some quality food in the ghetto. The seating options are basically non-existent and if you manage to score on one of the two outdoor tables, you are guaranteed to find some random people causing a huuuuuge scene with some yelling matches. If it wasn't so terrifying, it might be entertaining.

They make the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had.  I eat a lot of pastrami sandwiches, but this place is my favorite.  They perfected the sandwich craft, just the right amount of thinly sliced onions, peppers, pastrami, bread, mayo.  The ratio of everything relative to each other is perfect.  Most highly rated sandwich places over do the flavoring, after a few bites it's just not as good.  But, this place, the 1st bite is as good as the last.

The sandwich's are fresh and good, but overly expensive (twice the price of Mr. Pickles and Bite Me sandwiches which are far bigger) and they are complete tightwads with the more expensive ingredients such as avocado or shrimp, portabellos, etc.

The pastrami is amaze balls, regular size is good enough for 2 meals. Recently I've had to go on a gluten free diet, so I had to rule this place out as a possible lunch backup, until I remembered reading Juan baked his own gluten free bread. When I walked in a month later (no hard feelings), Juan said he doesn't bake that bread too often anymore. Considering he knew I was a regular, he offered to bake a gluten free loaf just for me, and to give him an early heads up next time so he can try to plan to make sure I have the option. I love this man, 5 stars for making such a wonderful accommodation, I may never leave his place now!
I had the Steak sandwich and it was simply Amazing!

The sandwich I got was really great--the pesto mayo is delicious and their wheat bread roll was tasty and fresh.  The ambiance was terrible though and even at non-peak time the service time was pretty long.  Also, I may have mis-understood the situation but the manager seemed to bark orders at the staff which some might find unsettling.

Went here when I had a free Friday and a quest for a new sandwich place in SF.  Holy crap, the sandwich I had was AMAZING.  I'm mostly vegetarian and was happy to see a entire wall of 8 specialty veggie sandwiches, I ordered the South West and it was delicious.  It's kind of chaotic in there, the owner is a real character and there's a lot of shouting in spanish.  There's no place to sit inside, just a couple tables right outside but you're better off taking your sandwich to eat somewhere else.
The best vegetarian sandwich I've had in San francisco. Even if you are not a vegetarian do try their southwestern. Delicious !
Amazing food. Not just sandwiches, but home made desserts and hot dogs too.
Always awesome service . Great sandwiches at reasonable price . Check out their weekly specials . ESP . The Al Pacino
Let's see what I remember:

Family run place. The owner has his granny or great aunt or whoever running the cash register. The young gal who works there rolls her eyes at the bossman every time he says anything to her, and I get it. She's young and cool and is OVER IT! He is kind of a bossy-know-it-all. Above all this place just feels good. Like my family. We fucking hate/love each other. They work together and make some seriously great sandwiches. I love the banter, and I love how close it is to my house. Just a perfect dog walk away. Be careful not to miss it, it's kind of hidden between the McDonalds and the weird clothing bargain store. Great fresh home made bread too!
Warm and friendly mom-and-pop type shop. I ordered a giant pastrami sandwich and it was large and delightful. Looking forward to another sandwich the next time I go to the Mission.

Juan promised me the best sandwich I've ever had and he delivered! My Sophie's Choice with added avocado has tied for best sandwich ever (the other winner is the Caprese Sandwich with Prosciutto from Lucca's in Marina). The service is excellent and very friend, and the food is incredible. This sandwich spot has been in the family for decades and you can tell they've really perfected it over the years. A+

I've been going there to Juan's Sandwich place since I use to go highschool. His mom was  n still is a sweet heart. I remember goung to buy my sandwich every morning but I had to make sure it was before school time. Otherwise she wouldn't make us one, because we would be late to school. Now that I move across to the east bay I still love going there. Best sandwiches and the family love u get from them. My daughter goes crazy if I dont bring her one, she will text me sereval times to remind me not to for get her sandwich.  To me thats my #1 sandwich spot in the mission. Try them u wouldn't regret it.
Have only had two of the sandwiches from here but they were pretty amazing.

This place rocks! the first sandwich I had was the "Bad boy" and it was pretty solid. I have had various other sandwiches since then, and you really can't go wrong with anything. You can get a regular or lrg sandwich; the lrg is a gut buster so if you go that direction, don't expect to be able to do any more work for the rest of the day. The food great, but what really makes this place stand out is the service. The man that owns this place has owned it for years (20+ I believe) and is a real character. Its rare to find a place where the owner is taking the orders and genuinely cares about the product he is providing. Oh yeah, had the breakfast sandwich today with bacon, eggs, jalapenos, tomatoes, and swiss cheese, so good!!!

I'm not hung over today but wanted a hangover breakfast. Off to Mission. You know how it is. Wander a bit looking for somewhere promising, check Yelp a bit, not feeling it, start heading back up to 16... and then the planets aligned. I've been tourist-trolling this area for a decade and 16/Mission BART is always my first stop when I arrive on a plane. How in the hell have I managed to miss The Sandwich Place? Answer: truly a hole-in-the-wall. They've been around almost as long as I've been alive and have got this Sandwich Thing down to an art. For me, go big or go home unrepentant gluten-omnivore style: Giant Kitchen Sink with everything. They bake their own bread and the roll was amazing: that perfect light crispiness outside and just the right amount of soft, glutenous chewiness inside. The pile of meat and cheese was an inch and a half thick and the overall sandwich looked like it could fit at least four Subways. Very "me." Taste was as it should be: fresh. The kicker? I couldn't have made this sandwich at home for less money.
This place is awesome, and the perfect example of why you should support/try local establishments. The owner is hilarious, the sandwiches are delicious, and I can't wait to go back.

I was hankering for a stacked veggie sandwich and set out to find it in the Mission. The objective was to find gluten free bread. From the reviews I decided on The Sandwich place. The place was crammed and tiny but clean and bright and just fine for a pick up. I opened my sandwich and was in veggie heaven. So yummy and good. I just wish the slices were bigger. I nommed the hell out of that sandwich. Cant remember if I ordered a side of avocado or it came with, but I remembered getting a good amount and it being damn good. I as very pleased to find that the owner who also happened to be working bakes his gluten free bread daily. He told us his story on the evolution of The Sandwich place and that he works there almost every day. Keep up the good work Juan!
Being new to the mission district I set out with a goal to try out new food everyday based on yelp reviews.

Today we went to this place: "The Sandwich Place" in San Francisco and they charge us through Square. The amount was $22.25 and we paid it with our debit card. But before the end of the transaction they touch a button without showing us what it was and then we signed and I always, send all the receipts to our email, so I did it.
Waiting for your sandwich is like watching stand-up - the owner loves his work and his customers, and it shows.

If you're going to call your business 'The Sandwich Place' then you better serve some amazing sandwiches. Well, my friends, the owners of 'The Sandwich Place' weren't being too bold when they decided to name their restaurant that because they serve up some epic sandwiches! People say a version of this statement way too often but you can seriously come here and order any sandwich on the menu and it will be delicious. Unless you have a food allergy or just hate a specific ingredient you will love each sandwich on the menu here. If I was getting the chair and had to choose one it would most certainly be the Chicken Milanessa sandwich...giant size of course. The regular is plenty of sandwich but if you're going to get wet you might as well swim!

Hot pastrami sandwich ftw!  You get a plentiful portion of pastrami glazed with onions, lettuce, tomatoes, mayo and mustard.  Fyi, the giant size is enough to feed two people.  I tried the gumbo and wasn't enthused.  Just get the hot pastrami, lol. Also, Juan, the owner (I think?), is nice and likes to chat.  I'll definitely be back!
One of the best vegetarian sandwiches I have had. The Veggie Veggie on a freshly-made French Roll. The business owners are extremely appreciative of your business. Cash only. I will be back!

Best Sandwich shop on the mission. I always get my sandwich made by the younger woman who usually is in the front, she makes by far one of the best sanwiches ive ever tried. I come in often through out the week on my lunch break and my food is on point every time.
WOW! Just when I thought I have had the best sandwich in the city a place like The Sandwich spot comes along and kills it!
I went here at 11:45am for lunch with a friend. We wanted to beat the lunch crowd.

I promised Juan a review, haha, this guy is great, and so is this place! Great selection (Vegetarian and carnivores alike), good service, and decent prices. I got the "Kitchen Sink"- awesome stuff for a meat and potatoes guy like myself. My girl's a vegetarian, so she went with the "Tree Hugger" with gluten-free bread- she loved it! All in all, I'd definitely repeat.
This places makes good sandwiches. The bread is apparently fresh-baked onsite. Whatever they're doing for bread, it tastes good.
Gluten Free and Picky here writing another review.

Popped in again mostly because I found parking. Delighted to report an uptick in the burger department. The burger was actually seasoned, dressed beautifully, and the bun was quite nice even lightly toasted. The fries are dull and somehow tasteless. As they cool, it's like eating match sticks. Odd too, because this kitchen could def do better. Too early in the day to order a martini, so cannot report on that issue. They still have beer drinkers behind the bar tho. I had to inform the bar man that Cabernets are typically red."Still learning the wine thing". Sweet kid, but I wouldn't let him near a martini shaker.....
Had a delicious lunch here. Most staff are great and I freaking love their bathroom soap!
came for brunch, no wait at all! food was delicious and the neighborhood was quiet and residential. Great sunday brunch experience overall

If it were less expensive, I'd give it a solid 4 stars. However, it's expensive for what you get. I had a good turkey sandwich today. The salad that came with was overdressed and a little salty for my taste.

After 15 years of not visiting the Slow Club, we happened to be in the neighborhood tonight at 8:00pm 10/28/14 and gave it a visit for old times sake. After our pleasant host greeted us, we took a couple seats at the bar for some dinner and refreshment. Sadly, the bartender made no greeting, no smile, no hello, no eye contact just slapped down some clipboard menus and ignored us as he made more drinks for others. I guess that is commonplace these days in SF?!  He did however, greet and chat with customers who arrived after us and the waitress who was picking up her drinks next to us. We gave him 10 more minutes just to see what he would do...nothing. We picked up and left, he didn't even balk. We said goodbye to the host and explained that the bearded bartender had no idea about customer service. The host offered us a table, we politely declined and offered words of advice that perhaps upon the staff review the bartender should be given feedback on his lack of manners. It is incredulous that a business would be in the hands of someone who obviously has no people skills or desire to be around people. Perhaps he thinks he doesn't need the business.
Service was slow to arrive, so I asked the manager (owner?) about it and he took care of drinks and served us himself for the rest of the meal.

A group of seven of us went here for brunch one Sunday. Staff was quite good, the ambiance really nice, and parking was abundant. But to be honest the food is just OK. It's not bad by any means. Some of the dishes I tried were actually quite tasty. But the food just isn't that memorable and actually the burger I had I didn't enjoy much at all.

For some reason I keep going here with people that leave me with an ulcer and a headache for my time, but the food is awesome. I'm going alone in the future to keep up with appearances. Waitstaff is consistently friendly, and the wedge salad is the best in the world. On Earth, if you dig wedge salad. The heirloom tomato soup is very good as well, and I normally don't care for chicken pasta but the chef really gets the chicken thing. Shots of Rye required to deal with said lunch guests but they should probably not charge $9 for them - that is a really good cocktail at most places.

One of those places that you reeeeaallyy want to like--other people say good things, and it doesn't hurt that it's easy to find parking nearby--but honestly, it's just ok. I have been here a few times now for brunch, lunch, and recently dinner, and I find nothing particularly amazing.
I'm really surprised this isn't rated 5 stars across the board.
Food was good, service horrible. Our server was rude and short with us and we saw our food at the counter for 20 minutes before it was brought to our table.

Came here because I've been finding myself in this neighborhood a lot lately and I heard they have great cocktails, which is a siren song that I cannot but heed it's call... My goal is to drink every single one on the menu. Thrice. The decor is very urban casual but you could dress up a bit and not feel dorky. At happy hour there are a lot of tech bros at the bar, but they leave as the dinner hour begins. Waiter was great, laid back, didn't rush us and had a great sense of humor. Food: I really enjoyed the Seasonal Farm plate (excellent vegetarian option! Yay!) and the pommes frites. My friend got a pork loin dish that was very elaborate; almost too elaborate and could have been simplified but it was still thoroughly enjoyed. Would happily come back! Parking is easy after 6 and location is very convenient.
Went here for brunch.  Food was good but overpriced (my fried egg sandwich was almost $13); service was slow and amateurish; place was loud, which is not what I'm personally looking for at brunch.
Food was excellent! Drinks were too strong, in my opinion (I had to chug the drink because it was so strong) and the waitress checked up every once in a while.

This is my second time here! Tried the Pei Mussels, Prather Ranch Burger, and the flat bread. Both are definitely 10/10 food items. The burger is my favorite hands down. The chef cooks it perfectly to your preference and the cheese is melted to a stringy goodness! The Slow Club is so nice in the evening with dim lit lights and candles I don't know how it is a casual place! Definitely coming back more often for dinner dates!
Good food, nice drinks, nice ambiance, friendly staff. The only thing is that it was pretty loud.

Food was excellent as usual.  Burger is my favorite in the city.  I got the moscow mule with tequila (called it something different) and it was great.  Only ding was to the server, who must have been having a bad day.  Though it happens.

Pretty good little brunch spot. I was visiting from out of town and my friend took me here. Everything looked good on the menu but most of the dishes were priced around 12.50+, and $8 for a tiny glass of mimosa, being from Seattle, that is just atrociously expensive to me for breakfast...

A couple weeks ago my wife and I were attending a Porchlight Stories event at Club Verde on Mariposa, and we got there early enough for dinner at Slow Club.  I don't often eat burgers, but for some reason, that evening, I had a craving, so I ordered the Slow Club burger, medium rare with cheddar, no onions, but otherwise, the works.
I was a brunching fool this weekend so I tried 2 new places.  Solid experience at Slow Club.

My family: mom and dad and 2 adult children got there on Thursday for our reservation at 8:15, ordered hamburgers and drinks, served a salad and the drinks, then did not see our waiter for a half hour. After waiting 45 minutes I got the server and asked where our food was... the kitchen was busy, chef's working hard... our food came after an hour wait. Tasty, but we will not return. The server gave shit service, could have checked in with us but did not, explained the kitchen was slammed but did not, could have offered complimentary drinks or munchies but blew us off and acted put out when i asked... We will NOT return... hope your experience is not the same, or that you do not care...

After being shunned the racist hipster waitstaff at Rhea's Cafe nearby, me and my buddy came here for lunch. Our waitress was very accommodating. The drinks and food came out very quickly. Probably faster than the amount of time we sat down at Rhea's Cafe being ignored by the too important waitstaff falling head over heels to help customers of their "own kind".

Came here for dinner on a Monday night.  Cocktails are worth trying; several of us got the Malabar which was delicious (love the cardamom).  We enjoyed the carrot corn soup -- it was the perfect consistency, not too runny or thick, with a great flavor.  The seasonal farm plate, was good, but not that interesting.  The burger was awesome and I don't even usually eat burgers.  The heirloom tomato salad looked good but I didn't try it.
Went to Slow Club for the first time on a Saturday night. The crowd was lively, the bar was full, and most tables were occupied. So far so good.

Brunch here is super sweet and cute! No wait even though I was expecting one for Saturday's brunch. The slow basic was large and satisfying. The show dogs (house pork sausage) are amazing!! Probably one of there best menu items. Breakfast potatoes were not as impressive. Would have preferred some fresh fruit instead.

We went to Slow Club last night for a friend's birthday. It was one of the best meals I have had in a long time. We had the cheese plate, peppers, olives and flatbread for apps, which were all fantastic. For my entree, I went with the salmon. The avocado ginger purée was a totally unique addition, and it complimented the fish perfectly. The bees knees cocktail was refreshing and light, and the celery bitters made it unlike any other cocktail I've tasted. Finally, we shared the chocolate custard, peach cobbler and basil strawberry shortcake for dessert, which were all delicious.

Went here for the first time on a Friday night with some out of town friends. All 5 of us raved about the food and drinks. I had the Violet Cuban cocktail that was good. I don't like drinks that are all booze and this one had some mixers and I really liked it. I had the arugula salad which is the best salad I've had in a long time. At least a year. It was perfect.
This place has good food, but has always been busy when I have come in. Service was good but they mixed up my bill. The host was kind enough to squeeze us in without a reservation though.

Every meal I have had here has been top notch & the menu is always interesting. Consistently attentive quick service, full bar, open late, warm down to earth mellow ambience, and easy street parking. Need I say more?

Easily one of the best restaurants in SF. Twice now Iv've had the best Pork Chops I've ever eaten there. Besides the great food, I give it 5 stars for it's consistency. I've eaten there many times over the last decade and it never disappoints. A discerning chef makes the menu organic and sustainable and a pleasure to eat!

Good service, good ambiance, good wine and good food.  I didn't realize this place was around the corner from me, but I'm glad I found it because it was the perfect low key, but fancy enough place to bring my friend when she came in town for dinner. Our waitress was really cool and gave us recommendations. I liked it!

I had a vodka/strawberry cocktail which was supposed to be spicy. Well, it drunk like tabasco sauce (straight). We had a salad and a squash soup. Both were mediocre. The waitress was rather disinterested in us. Disappointing.
Food rocks.
6/25/14  Dinner
TL;DR: multiple items comped for non-existent to minor mistakes; excellent pork loin and yellowtail entrees; mind-blowing caramel apple cheesecake.

I have been going to this place periodically through the years. Have often been happy. Tonight, not the case.  I tried the Dine About Town  menu, and although the menu was excellent, and of same proportions of regular menu, service was very lacking.

After a decade of regular visits, I can remarkably say that I've never had a bad experience here.  My visits have typically been for brunch or dinner, and both sets of dining experiences have been quite good overall.
So this place is awesome for dessert and drinks. So much so, that I really want to try dinner here.
I have been to Slow Club twice over a couple of years and both visits have been underwhelming to say the least.  The food is uninspired and not that well executed.  I would suggest not going here.

If you have some coins saved, and want to have an excellent dining experience Slow Club should be a destination for you . The drink specialties are delicious . Share some appetizers with your friends such as their CHARCUTERIE PLATE (I just cut and paste that because I always butcher the spelling ). Last time I went I chose the Pork Loin entree and it did not bum me out at all , very delicious. The brunch is amazing, but kinda hectic of a scene so I don't mess with it but if you do the food is awesome. It gets a little dark inside , and service can be on a slow side if it's busy which is usual , but other than that outstanding restaurant.
Holy moly! This place is wonderful! And, very busy so be prepared to add your name to the list outside the entrance.

My wife and I happened upon Radish recently while spending part of our 25th anniversary in The City.  WHAT A FIND!!  Best bechamel (on Croque Madame) I have ever had at a restaurant and the sunny side up egg on top was perfectly cooked as the runny yolk mixed with the bechamel....OMG!!!   "Hash browns"....a revelation...crispy outside and super tender inside...delicious golden nuggets!!!  Great service with a smile and chatty happy patrons.  These ladies hustle.  Best Sunday b'fast I have had in some time.  Will definitely return to Radish.  Keep up the great work ladies.

Worth the long wait for brunch on the weekends (just don't show up at 11:30am starving and expect to sit in 10 min). Warning- the gluten free pancakes are only served on the weekends.  Personally, this is one of my favorite mid-week lunch spots.  Their gluten free options are still extensive and it's pretty quite compared to the weekends.  Great burgers and soups.
3 stars for a chill place where I can get passable Southern food on a random night. 4th star for lesbians, just in general.
Cute atmosphere, long wait. The staff are friendly enough, but the food took a long time to get to the table. The server brought us complimentary donuts to make up for us being forgotten.
Slow service. Good food, but not spectacular. Small portions. No real reason to return.
Was supposed to have two hours for "bottomless mimosas". Cut us off after one hour and a half because they had to "turn the table"
Had a very nice Sunday brunch here.  Positive points were the bottomless Mimosa for $12, fluffy and hot pancakes piled with strawberries, and friendly service.
4 stars = Food. Everything I saw plated looked and tasted really good.

The service is fine but the kitchen takes forever to prepare food (more than 25 minutes when the restaurant isn't even full). The scramble and breakfast tacos are nothing special. They make their hash browns like Plow, but they fall flat. If you're not coming here for the bottomless mimosas, I'd recommend eating brunch elsewhere.
Wow, that was a bummer. Ive wanted to come to this rest since it opened.
Food: 3-4 stars (kids' burger/pancakes and my scramble with tortillas very good, pulled pork sandwich ok)

I am so torn. 3 for service. Or 2. 5 for food The food here is really good and the service is not unpleasant, just indifferent. Maybe it's because we arrive around 9. Somewhere they must have heard that if the restaurant closes at 10:30 then that's it, wrap it up and go home while the last 5 tables are finishing their dinner. Odd.
Pros: potatoes, bottomless mimosas, good amount of food, nice servers.
I have been walking by this place on my way to the gym for months.  There was always some kind of line morning and afternoon.  Needless to say, i was intrigued by what this restaurant had to offer.
I think the servers were really nice. The place is cute, but the wait was EXTREMELY LONG.
Try their catfish po boy with gluten free bread. It is so good. They serve mimosas and wine which makes this place a good hangout spot for groups on brunch
RADISH IS SCARY STAFF!!! WASTE OF TIME ENERGY AND MATTER!!!
Good food, fast service, bottomless mimosas. It speaks for itself :). I would definitely come here again and try the brunch menu.
Pros: a solid meal, the burgers were good, though pretty pink. Maybe 10 beers on tap to choose from. Servers were very nice.
Ordered at Radish with GrubHub. Looked good on paper but service was terrible: 2 hours wait and the guy went to the wrong building. Hey Radish, how about you vet your delivery service a bit more?

Just had my 1st Radish experience, aaand it wasn't that great.  Came here with my friends who themselves really enjoy the place, and who themselves admitted radish was off today.  So let's go through today's experience, shall we?
Sucks all the way! Food suck! No question about that! Services suck! And way over priced!!!!!!!!!!
Catfish po boy was delicious, as well as the salad and the bottomless mimosas! Great ambiance and service, our glasses were never empty . Can't wait to try the brunch
MIGAS! Oh, how I miss the Tex-Mex staple. So far, Radish is the only spot that has 'em on the menu. Yum.

I came here today for brunch with a friend. It was perfect. We arrived at around 9:30AM and had absolutely no wait. We opted for an outdoor table since the weather was fantastic. Food was good. Service was friendly (though a little slow). Overall, a solid brunch place.

Comfort food. Me and my 3 GFs were in search of food with no reservations on a Friday evening in the Mission (yes not a smart move). We should have been suspicious that we got some seats here so easily (though they were at the bar). But now I know it was because we were slightly ahead of the rush. It was great.

I came here for Sunday brunch with some friends of mine and was really happy with everything! The wait was about an hour, but well worth it and we expected it. I ordered the eggs Benedict and was not disappointed. The service was awesome. I don't remember her name, but she was really pleasant and personable. The mimosas were fantastic. I've never had better. AND they were playing Beyonce station on pandora!! Five stars for that alone. I would definitely return.

Came here for dinner with my 11 year old. My grilled cheese was mediocre (full of wilted lettuce - odd choice, not enough cheese for the huge bread) and the corn chowder was bland. His burger and fries were very good, but overpriced at $15. Food took a long time to arrive and it wasn't that busy. The two female servers were nice and reasonably attentive. But they were clearly inexperienced, and seemed awkward and uncomfortable. They were obsessing over their reservation system and spent a lot of time conferring together about it even though the the place was not busy. Reserved signs on tables? I can't remember the last time I've seen that in SF. Overall, my takeaway is that this place desperately needs an owner or experienced manager on site. I had wanted to try Radish for a long time but doubt I will go back. Too many other great options in the neighborhood. I go to Hog and Rocks a lot, and would choose it over Radish. We ate at 7 Mile House the night before - what a huge difference an experienced staff can make.
Came here a few months ago with my BFF for the bottomless mimosas! They also offer grapefruit mimosas as an option, too.

To be honest, we chose this place because it was easily accessible by BART and they served bottomless mimosas.  Once we ate there, the food was good too.  We did have a few mishaps, keeping it from 5 stars:

I like this place. Cool art/decor, friendly service, and great food! well-priced too. We had the grilled-cheese sandwich + soup (very generous portion!), as well as one of the burgers. Solid food. Didn't have a chance to try the desserts but saw some on the neighboring tables and they looked good! My only negative remark is that the service was slow and the food was also slow to come out. Other than that, awesome place!
Huge fan. If you like to brunch, get in here immediately.

Came here for brunch and waited for 2+ hours not because there was a long wait but because I was there for a party of 3.  The hostess continuously sat groups of 2 at tables that could have easily seated 3.  People who came much after us were seated within 15 minutes.  By the 2nd hour we ended up leaving. Not to mention, the hostess was extremely rude.  When I asked her (for the first time) do you have a time estimate for when we will be seated, she simply answered, "we are busy" and walked away.
My gf and I had lunch here on Labor Day. Was seated around 2pm (no line, but STILL took 5 min to be recognized and shown to an already vacant table).
This place is hip to death.

Had a really bad experience here this morning. I've eaten here before and it was so-so, but seems to have increased in popularity. Put our name on the list for a party of 3. The hipster hostess had an attitude from the get-go (people like her give hipsters a bad name) and was clearly hooking up her friends. We left and went to Ritual for coffee, and came back ~30 minutes later. We had been next on the list a while when we noticed the hostess hugging people just walking up, and sitting them down immediately without calling out a name. We had been next on the list for at least 30 minutes but all these people were being seated and automatically handed mimosas and being kissed and chatted up. I also saw a four-top table empty for an hour with a reserved sign on it - fishy for a busy brunch restaurant. After waiting an hour and 20 minutes or so, I approached said hipster hostess and overheard her say in a friendly eye winky way: "I wouldn't worry about these 3 tops - I got you." Being one of the three tops not to worry about, I couldn't help but interject. Hipstress snapped, saying "excuse me!" When I told her we had been waiting an hour and a half, what should we expect as we'd been next on the list a while, she told me at least 25 minutes more. And she said it in a rude and dismissive way. I am sorry Radish, this is unacceptable. We walked over to Lolo and were treated with respect.
Ordered delivery. It was 30 minutes late and cold. My grilled cheese was burnt and the corn chowder was too sugary.

This is the best breakfast I have had in a while. Very well priced and delicious food. Everything is very well prepared. The coffee is perfectly strong. The service was great. The wait for a table wasn't too long and the cinnamon donuts with apple butter were the best thing I've ever tasted.
I didn't like the food very much, but still had an awesome experience thanks to the bottomless mimosas! I think it's a pretty good deal ($12 with food), and the mimosas are delicious.

The lam shawarma (spicy) is delicious and super spicy too so be warned! It was a lot of food too so they're not skimpy on portion size. I loved how the yogurt cooled down the spices, and the lamb was tender and not dry. Loved it, will definitely be back for another
Amazing service but wish the chicken kabob / falafel wraps had more flavor and more sauce.

I'm eating a lamb Schwarma (ok I know I totally spelled that wrong and I'm too lazy to check it lol) right now with a small side of hummus with pita, which is a very good size for the price (around 4 bucks). Shawarma (roughly 8 bucks) is delicious with tender seasoned lamb, onions, spicy sauce/paste, and I'm guessing a yogurt sauce. They toast it and the pita up on the grill. The wrap could use cucumber but otherwise no complaints. First time here, next time I'll ask to add cucumbers :) awesome find, I definitely recommend it.
Best Mediterranean food in this hole in the wall place in mission! Must try falafel, hummus and wraps. Extremely cheap, but let that not throw you away.
The falafels this place hooks you up with are tender lil' masses of goodness that are crunchy on the outside, steaming and flavorful on the inside, with just the right amount of graininess.
Falafel!  Really outstanding in the lavash wrap.  Ask for it spicy, yum!
Pretty standard shawarma and falafel, the kind you can find in just about any kabob place in strip malls across the country.

There's a reason this place gets such good reviews. The other afternoon I was in there to make an order. Three businessmen were in front of me, one of them obviously from SF, the other two obviously not. The one who lived here had taken these out-of-towners to this little hole-in-the-wall on 16th because he knew it was the best place to go for great gyros -- and he was right.

Whoa these wraps are massive. Consuming just one of these wraps it looked as though I was going to hit my daily calorie intake on this one sitting. But yeah we probably shouldn't have ordered that side of hummus.
The lamb shwarma is one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life. Get it with hot sauce.

My husband was craving a falafel sandwich, and we came across this place. Being from the Middle East I can say that their falafel was on point. From the tahini sauce they put to the bread, I would say that it is almost as good as eating it overseas. We got our sandwiches in less than 10 mins, and really no complaints. The sandwich was reasonably priced.
I have had too few good experiences here.  Usually the service is so poor I would rather go some place a bit more friendly--Zaytoon.

We ordered the lamb shawarma and falafel deluxe, both with the 'hot' sauce option. My girlfriend isn't a huge fan of 'hot' food, but she felt this sauce gave both a very subtle, but nice, level of heat, so don't be scared off by it. The falafel sandwich was rich and nutty with sesame aspects. They also use fava beans in their falafel, addition to chickpeas, which added more complexity. The 'deluxe' falafel has eggplant and potatoes added, which makes it very rich and filling. The lamb was very good, too with nice seasoning and not too fatty.
Best Mediterranean food of my life. What they do is... art.

Pretty solid falafel wrap. The deluxe one is particularly filling, as they pad it with potatoes and eggplant on top of the usual. Spicy sauce is not so spicy. On a whim I gave their 'garlic mint yogurt' drink a try. It's...unique...ok who am I kidding, that is a pretty brave combination to be masquerading as a mere "drink". This savory thing is garlicky no doubt, but the mint is noticeably there as well. Would I get it again? Probably not, but if you instead imagine it as a sauce to go with your meal, it actually goes pretty darned well with the falafel. Just make sure you have some in your mouth already when you take a swig. (And make sure you're not on a date. :)

i'm far from a connoisseur of mediterranean food but even i could tell the hummus and falafel were special!  i even loved the mediterranean sampler and i don't usually like tabbouleh. i can't rave though because i got a botched family style order and i ended up getting a side of dry, flavorless lamb shawerma with pita. i can't speak to how the wraps usually taste, but it was the same meat which makes me think the meats may have been overhyped.

Ok so it's not rocket science they hands down have the best HUMMUS I have ever eaten in my life. This place is why I eat garbanzo beans and eggplant. I usually buy a small thing of hummus and take it home to the babays who enjoy it also. The chicken kabob plate with the cucumbers....Can you say YUMMM! I try to budget this into a weekly lunch. Everyone should visit this tiny gem at least once in lifetime. Don't cheat yourself, treat yourself.
Excellent food. Excellent staff. Though the place is small with only 2 tables outside the food makes up for it. Its super cheap too
Super small place, they only have a counter with a few seats so probably best if you got you food togo and ate it while you walk around the mission, which is exactly what I did and it was pleasant.

I live down the street from this place and it's steadily becoming more of a regular stop than Pancho Villa or Arnells.  I work on the go so it's important for me to be able to get decent food that isn't a mess to eat and that doesn't leave me feeling bloated or tired for the rest of the day.
Very disappointing....the lamb shawerma was flavorless and mushy..... the people were friendly.... but the food was just awful.
Fantastic falafel balls and sandwiches makes this a place vegetarians must visit.

I have been doing my very best since my move from NYC to not be that jerk who thinks everything is better on the East coast. Well, if that's going to be the case then SF needs to up it's falafel game. Or the Yelp community needs to figure out good falafel. I was guided here today for an amazing, life-changing, need-to-eat-before-i-die falafel and I got...a falafel. Really heavy on the sesame, needed spice (even though I got it spicy) and acid, and maybe some salt too, and heck some red onions or something crunchy, and some parsley? Oh wait ... that is a new falafel altogether.

The lamb shawarma meat was overcooked and mushy the last time I was here.  This meat is actually not pure lamb, but a combination of lamb and beef - which is fine with me.  I guess its hard to predict demand as the meat cooks on the spit, so they cook it, slice it off as its ready, and cook it again on a flat grill.  Then its stored in an oven.  Just too much cooking!  The best lamb shawarma I've had was when its still crispy fresh off the spit, maybe grilled a bit.  Mush sucks!

I tried lamb shawerma and it was awsome, tasted healthy and fresh, he asked me if i want hot sauce before adding it and i said yes but next time i will have it without hot sauce because the lamb was tasty enough without that much pepper, the shawerma was baked on the oven before serving and i liked the baked taste of the bread, there was not so much space to eat inside and there was couple of tables outside; but i will definitely come back for the quality of the food and reasonable price! Good job!
My favorite takeaway Mediterranean in SF. Leaps and bounds tastier than Old Jerusalem. Nobody makes falafel like these guys.
Two words: lamb shawerma. Amazing. Generous portions, full of flavor all at a great price. My friend had the falafel which he loved as well.  I will definitely be coming back.

HANDS DOWN the best Middle Eastern establishment in the city! Fallafuls are crispy and fresh daily, and the schawerma's are the real deal.  Family owned for almost 2 decades. Will be going there in about 20 minutes!!!

I've been coming to TM ever since I moved to SF in 1990. Consistently the best falafel on the west coast. (I was raised on taziki drenched, soggy pita sandwiches from the Fairfax district of west LA.). To have a real falafel wrapped in lavash...simply rocked my world.  I love the regular falafel with roasted tomatoes and baba with a little extra red onion!  So delish!

Stopped here today for a lamb shawerma, not expecting too much.  Boy, was I pleasantly surprised!  Everyone here is so nice and helpful.  I can't  do raw tomatoes, so I asked for them left off... the counter man very nicely offered my choice of something else to replace them!  So.... I took the hummus.  GOOD CHOICE!  I also saw one of the guys pulling out freshly made falafel.  They looked SO GOOD I wished I'd ordered a few to take away.  Next time for sure.... Mmmm a 'doggy bag' of falafel to munch throughout the afternoon!  I'm drooling.  And that hummus... definitely will need to see if I can get a take out container to bring home next time!!

Decent hole in the wall Falafel Deluxe but the combination of being a little too spicy and lacking strong flavor is never ideal. 9$ is not exactly a steal when compared to comparable burritos in the area but solid for a quick grab if you don't feel like waiting in line.

Truly Mediterranean is the local joint for kabobs and shawarma in the Mission. It's neither authentic or as fatty as I'd like it to be (in fact, it actually tastes healthy), but it'd suffice for those random cravings for Mediterranean food.

Hole in the wall shawarma/falafel place on 16th street. They have some bar stools that face a window inside and some cheap backyard tables outside. The lamb shawarma costs $9.30 exactly and takes about 5-7 minutes to make. It definitely hit the spot but I do think $9 for a sandwich is OD, also the workers use their hands on everything, no gloves.

Eating here for years a hole in the wall Mediterranean place. My fav the chicken shawarma with hot sauce but I also like the lamb. Sometimes I just stop by for a snack and get 3 felafels with Tahiti sauce.
I love this place! I'm obsessed with their falafel wrap! I eat there a few times a month, and it's always consistently good. :)

My friends and I went here on 4-13-14 9:30pm'sh.  We ordered the lamb shawerma, it's delicious/most, $9'sh each.  I wanted the chicken shawerma (but only available on tuesdays+fridays). My friend ordered the baklava (Mediterranean pastry), flaky/sweet.

My friend told me I HAD to stop here when I got in the city and so I did, first stop actually and it was meh. I know this place gets amazing reviews but I expected better. I had the lamb shawarma and don't get me wrong it was good but not mind blown, however, I did get one falafel ball to try and that was amazing, it tasted like it was homemade by my parents. When I'm in the city again, id give them another chance and try the falafel.
Simply Amazing!!!

Great falafel and chicken shawarma! Even better if you combo it up.. It does exist! I happened to stumble upon it asking for a chicken shawarma and two pieces of falafel (thought I mean't on the side).. but they stuck it in the wrap.. and it was delicious!
Was in the area and craving Mediterranean, glad I ended up here! The staff were....not the nicest. But the food was AMAZING! Seriously, the best falafel's I've ever had!

Been here twice for brunch on a Saturday morning. Besides no wait for a table, this is the only place I know that serves a traditional German breakfast (a variety of breads, cold cuts and cheeses)  and it's delicious. Their other German brunch items such as the different sausages and the potato salad that my friends usually order are equally good as is the German beer (obviously) and their mimosas. The place also doesn't have that stereotypical "beerfest" feel to it which is nice for a change. My only complaint is that they do not serve Radler.
Very slow, spacey service.
Solve the wild boar sausage and potato salad. Always order a pretzel! Beers are tall and cold. Decent parking.
Ate here for Sunday brunch. Place is small but wasn't crowded at all at 1pm.
Consistently great!  Love this place.

Charming restaurant - clean, modern, rustic ambiance.  They serve German food, so there are some menu items that aren't so familiar to Americans.  We went for brunch. There are some more recognizable items, like waffles, german sausage, eggs, etc.  I had a dish with waffles, 1 egg, chopped up bacon, 1 sausage, fried potatoes.  Heavy dish, but good.

Came here for Brunch early Sunday morning. No wait for a table. My friends were running late, and they were cool about me sitting before my entire party arrived. The place is pretty casual, and family friendly. There were 3 parties with kids and giant strollers by the time we left.

awesome place to hang out with friends. i particularly like to come here with the girlfriends for some fruity beer. so far, the strawberry one is my favourite but they didn't have it the last time i was there :( friendly service, and so far i haven't seen it too busy so it's always been easy to find seats, even for bigger groups.
Great food, brunch: you gotta try the chicken and waffles.  Dinner: standard tasty German fare.  Beer selection is one of the best I've seen.  Yum
Good food, friendly servers, a favorite dining place for our family. My favorite is any dish they make with potatoes!

Fast-casual-ish Germany food with great brew! Doesn't get much better. Well-priced for SF standards... If you get there early enough, get a homemade pretzel... And the spaetzel is a delightful partner to any brat you decide on.
Three words come to mind.
Second time around.
Small portions, slow service, expensive menu. Does not deserve more that three starts if at all.

I hadn't been here since it first opened, and I think it's gotten even better.  I hate to say it but everything was great, although we kind of went simple with sausages selection, potato salad, pickled kraut, pretzels and the like.  And, delicious beer to wash it down.  Great late night dinner w/ friends.
It's that restaurant you fall in love with when you're new to town. More than the food, which is delicious, the staff is really friendly without being cheesy.

If Schmidt's was a boy I would drunk text it, and Schmidt's would in turn sense my thirsty crazy girl pheromones and give me the Deutsche every night. What I'm saying is don't come here unless you have some self respect and otherwise you should go to Leopold's. 'Tis delish.
It's important that you know this is not GERMAN German food, it is Californian German. This means there is oregano in your un-crunchy schnitzel and cinnamon in your red cabbage - and no vinegar.

We stopped in here for a snack during a 2 hour wait for Flour + Water. Our snack was so good, we stayed for dinner and skipped out on Flour.  We started with an anchovy vinaigrette romaine salad with crispy kale and it was divine (though not exactly German seeming). Resolution to make at home. The potato salad seemed more like a cross between a dijon egg salad and a normal potato salad. It was totally fab! Duck sausage. Check. Devilled eggs. Check. Pretzel roll check. It was all soo good! Not to be all superlatives and no criticism, but we also had two great German beers - an amber and a kolsch. A lot of great food and a couple beers for $60. I'd definitely go back, as a destination and not just a random stop in.

Excellent meaty, lean sausages: almost no grease. And in good variety: I had Hungarian, and Bavarian Beerwurst, among 5 or 6 choices. Accompanying potato salad was much better than average. Good selection of beers on tap, including weissbier, my favorite.

Better than food in Germany. Fantastic. Every time I come here I tell myself this is one of my favorite restaurants. Flavors are great. One of my favorite dishes is the pea pancake with smoked salmon. Great beer selection. Feels like a hip pub in Germany.
Absolutely love this place. Delicious food, great beer selection, friendly and knowledgeable staff. What else could you want?
Awesome apple pie. Honestly, I came here just to try this, and it lived up to expectations. The rest was quite authentic and classic German fare. Great if you don't want to wait at Suppenkuche.
I brought a native Berliner to Schmidt's and he gave it two thumbs up!
The food and service at Schmidt's are both WONDERFUL!!!  This is, by far, my favorite German restaurant here in San Francisco!!

May be in part influenced by the great company who joined for dinner, but the beer was tasty and the sausages great as well as the pretzels warm and great consistency with just the right amount of salt. Street parking may or may not be easy to find. Ten minute walk from 24 mission bart. Nice, candle lit ambiance.  A clean toilet. Very friendly and patient staff. The duck and fig sausages are amazing and a must try. The apple strudel was crispy, and the bread pudding was warm and just sweet.
What do you expect when you put a German eatery in the Mission? Well, if you expected a lot of beards, thick-rimmed glasses, excessive prices, and good beer, then you'd be correct.
While the place is a bit loud it was well worth the visit.  We had Oxtail stew over Spaetzel, 3 sausage dinner with a very tasty mountain of potatos with a smokey flavor.

What a gem.  Tasty sausages and veal schnitzel.  Wide selection of well paired wines and beers even gluten free beers.  Go early as there is usually a wait for dinner with no reservations taken.  Have been here 3x for dinner and it's always a treat.

Came in on a rainy weekday evening and was super excited since I love Leopold's and Suppenkuche (in that order). Walked in and found my friend who had arrived a little before me, but in retrospect, it's kind of odd that the host stand is in the back corner of the restaurant, especially since the server/hostess spent a lot of time hiding behind it with her head down, ignoring the dining room (more on this later). There was one large party of about 10, a small family in one booth, and two other pairs seated.

I have been to this place more time than I can remember. I am a huge fan of their spätzle and would highly recommend their pretzel when it is fresh from the oven. (not so much a few hours after) The staff has ALWAYS been nothing but friendly and their food is well prepared. I think they are are on the side of moderately priced, but their happy hour is very reasonable. Their German beer selection is pretty great!

We went to Schmidt's on a Sunday for an early dinner. When we walked in, we noticed there were a few Germans were eating dinner already. Good sign for authenticity!  We sat at the bar instead of table. The staff were friendly and the bartender was very knowledgeable on all the beers offered there. The food was fresh and simply GERMAN. No fancy "nouveau cousins" here; just your hardy authentic German everyday food. My pork chop was tender and juicy. It needed a bit of salt but I didn't mind. I'd rather taste the freshness of the meat and not overly spiced. Excellent selections of beers. The price was very reasonable and we walked away two very satisfied customers. We will mostly likely return again in the near future!
I would love to give this place 5 stars because I love love love the food, beer, & Tim buuuuuuuuuut....
Great beer, but only okay food.
Bartender was awesome! Went there for pre-dinner drinks and got the grapefruit beer called the schofferhofer! So light and refreshing! Ambience was fun and laid back! Would definitely return!

I usually don't seek out German restaurants, but a friend suggested we eat here, and it was delicious. The wienerschnitzel (heh heh) was delicious. Great ambiance, too -- wasn't too packed on a rainy Wednesday night. Yum!
The food was great here.  I had the David's which was absolutely, sinfully delicious.  The restaurant can be a bit loud so be prepared for that.  Lots of people with kids, cool neighborhood.

My bf loves german food, this place is rustic modern, all the community tables and wood panels, it's a very cool spot with very dim lighting, making german food more romantic than it really is. After ruining Valentine's Day, it was a treat to go somewhere we would definitely both love to eat it. I have been wanting to come here but never found the occasion to do so...so voila! V-Day!

Good restaurant that could be a 5 stars if the service would not have an attitude. We had dinner last night with my wife and twins. The restaurant has a great design and they have great selection of beers and wine.
Pea pancake!!! Must have. Enough said. Sausage is always too greasy for me, but this place wasn't bad at all. Great selection of draft beer.
If you love rich dairy, you should get down to Mission Cheese. Good atmosphere, great wine and delicious cheese. Decent prices too - it's luxurious cheese after all.
I love cheese. This place was delicious. :) End of story.

This is a great little spot for dates or catching up with friends. Their wine and beer list is good (had an awesome rye IPA) and the grilled cheese sandwiches are pure gourmet. They seem to always be playing great music and the waiters are really friendly and fun to talk to.
I am a sucker for wine & cheese so I looove this place!

Came here this afternoon with the BF, who is a cheese fanatic.  We had walked by so many times, but never stopped in.  Today was a beautiful SF afternoon, and there were a few tables open outside, so we stopped in for lunch.

I love this place because my girlfriend loves cheese and when I took her here she felt like she was in heaven -- so thank you for finally allowing me to make her feel what she makes me feel on the daily.

To be completely honest I came to this place because the pictures of mac n cheese reminded me of Homeroom in Oakland and I thought it'd be cool to compare... but when I got there the place wasn't what I expected. It's a nice place with indoor and outdoor seating. Self serve water with cute mason jars, towels for napkins and utensils that you have to get yourself.

I loved my dinner at Mission Cheese. It was perfect weather, so the outdoor seating was great! It was a very cheap meal all-in (you order at the counter and then sit down), especially considering the quality of the food.
My manfriend jokes that I'm made up of 2/3 bread and cheese. He's probably right, which is what drew me, like a magnet, to Mission Cheese.

OMG. After having moved to SF from Montreal, we despaired ever finding a great place to get a simple and high quality cheese shop. Hurrah for Mission Cheese. Everything we had was fantastic and explained well. Wife loved the shredded duck and the baguette they used (from a place a couple doors down) was the best I've found in SF. Going back.

This place is an all-round good place to stop by if you want a special cheese-outing.  It is a rustic, classy lunch spot specializing in artisan cheese and paired wine.  Their cheese selection includes San Joaquin Gold, Gruyere Surchoix, Cabot (delicious, crumbly Vermont clothbound cheese) and Vella (from a depression-era creamery in Sonoma) cheddars and many others.  I tried each of these (in sandwich form) and enjoyed them all!
Good cheese. Excellent cheese. However, the service is a little slow and the place can be unpleasantly crowded.

They have a pretty good selection of good cheeses as well as a good wine selection. They also serve gluten free crackers if you ask them instead of the usual bread that accompanies your meat and cheese plate. Their gluten free crackers are good. It is a pretty small wine bar. They have outside seating. A good place to get your wine and cheese/meat fix after dinner.

We wandered into Mission Cheese on a whim on a Friday night. There seemed to be a huge group at the bar area but thankfully, they were with a foodie tour that was shortly to move on and there were tables available.

The perfect neighborhood place to get something delicious to eat and drink. I seriously think that the Chedd or Alive sandwich is one of the best I have ever had. Their cheese plates are a delight and the thoughtfully curated cheese flights are always great. They are open past 8 now - awesome - sometimes they have run out of sandwiches - not awesome. Why 4 stars not 5? If they don't want to do actual table service I think some pre-done roll-ups would be nice and come out and friggin bus the tables yourselves ;-).

I love their plating and assortment of sides that comes when you get a cheese platter. I chose the Monger's choice and didn't listen to a word the waitress/monger said when she brought it out, but I know that I liked 2/3 of the cheeses.

A good casual spot for a light meal. With SF's Indian Summer on full blast, it gets a little hot inside, but the sidewalk tables (if you can get a spot) provide access to the cool breeze. Food and drinks were all enjoyable and not crazy expensive.

I stopped here for lunch with a friend and was thoroughly impressed! I love cheese so I decided to out fat-ass myself on this meal. Just choosing what to get was an ordeal because everything looks amazing.   I got the the East Coast flight on a staff member's recommendation.  I also had the Mac & Cheese and the Pork & Cheese sandwich. Don't judge me! The Mac & Cheese was perfectly baked and an absolute dream to taste. Surprise surprise it was extremely cheesy!  Similar experience with my sandwich.  It was toasted to perfection! The staff is very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about their menu.  You really can't go wrong here! I'm already dying to go back.  I need the milk and cookies in my life!
I knew there is limited seating here and when I found myself on Valencia in the middle of the day on a weekday I figured it would be a good time to have a snack.

I really can't imagine a better restaurant concept than one devoted to cheese. The food here is awesome and the employees are really passionate about the cheese/ really knowledgable. Also, the cookies and milk are bomb.
They have cheese flights.
Solid cheese and charcuterie. If you like Gouda, I recommend "el Classico".
Wine and cheese! What more could you ask? Amazing food, super nice servers and a really cute environment. Will for sure come back anytime I'm in the area.
Super Cute date spot. Fun atmosphere with lots of wine/beer on tap to choose from to pair with you your cheese and or meat plate! The ladies that work here are cheese ninjas!!!

Unless your lactose intolerant, who doesn't love cheese? Actually a guy named Jon doesn't like cheese. Go figure. But for the rest of us there's Mission Cheese. I loved the California Gold sandwich I had, but it is the flights of cheese that take center stage. Much like your high end restaurants, the server provides a wonderful description of each cheese being provided on your flight(s). Like fine wine (which they also offer), you find an appreciation of the variations of taste, smell, and texture. I hope to come back again soon. For dessert go next door to...
I love their sandwich with mozzarella cheese! The staff tells us stories of famers and cheese companies, which is incredibly interesting. Also, everything is less expensive.

Right on. We've been wanting to visit forever, so my birthday seemed appropriate. Delicious Sammie's for sure, but I really loved their cheese plate and the very full descriptions that came with. The Mead was great. Lovely and intelligent staff. We took a couple amazing cheeses home.

This is probably my fav restaurant. Just kidding. One of my favs. One out of a lot. BUT it counts for something that we keep coming back here, right? When out-of-towner friends come to visit and and tell me they like cheese, this is the spot we take them to. Tell me your favorite cheese is string cheese, and I'll still drag you here.
It's pretty fancy inside. I lot of different cheeses. Have to try the mac and cheese and the potatoes next time.
You know how you go up to a sushi chef and just tell him, "Feed me," for omakase? DO IT HERE. Just order a Monger's Choice. I think we usually do 4 cheese to 3 meats. And we're always in heaven.
To balance the previous review. This place is awesome and last guy actually got what he ordered, it just wasn't what his girlfriend had in mind. I was at the next table

If I could provide negative stars, I would. We did not know that an item on the menu was pork (or meat).  When we recieved the item and pointed out that we dont eat pork to the resteraunt, we were tild it was our f#ck up and therefore if we wanted another item to eat we could pay for more.... but essentially they did not care.  We should suck it up.
REALLY cool ambience on a hot day. I can't speak for the wines and or food.

My friend and I shared a mixed greens salad the peaches that accompanied it were the standout but it's greens I wasn't expecting explosions. We also shared the Mac and Cheese which is OUTSTANDING , that may have caused an explosion. Then we got a cheese flight that was delicious. The first Rosé they had on the menu that night was delicious and a perfect compliment to the meal. Unfortunately by our third glass ordered they had run out and so they had us drink another brand that was less stellar that the OG. Friendly staff, cute location. Get there earlier than later if you want to snag the outside seating because people seem to hang tough once they get it . I want to come back and try the meat (my friend I dined with is vegetarian )!

Burrata plate was so yummy! I wish the bread was better though. Really enjoyed the side salad and the spicy tomato jam. The California gold sandwich was good, too, but not as memorable as burrata. Sit outside on a sunny day or have a chill catch up sesh with your friends in the evening inside. Great ambiance!

Really delicious cheese and wine. Not sure if it was just me or if the service was slow. The people behind us got there food and drink wayyyy before us. Not sure if I was just starving or what haha. Overall great, but service was slow considering there were only a few of us there

Who knew Valencia St. has all these small boutique dining destinations?  Maybe a lot of people do but I don't venture to the Mission and Valencia area too often because of parking.  Anyway today we came here to check out Dandelion Chocolate and decided to have dinner here at Mission Cheese.
14.08.06           First Visit

Eh. It's okay, but certainly nothing to blow your mind. The bread on the sandwiches is too thick, which not only dilutes the flavor of the other ingredients (namely CHEESE), but the crust is so hard and sharp it cuts up your mouth like tiny little daggers if you don't chew extra carefully.

I ordered the Alotta Burrata and a Raclette.  To my absolute surprise, both of these dishes came with very, very mild cheeses--so mild that when mixed with the other ingredients (potatoes, bread, tomatoes), I either couldn't or almost couldn't taste it.

This is my third time here.  Started coming when my son started taking ALS in high school.  He is now in ALS 3 (junior).  First off the food is AWESOME so well worth the drive from the east bay on a Friday night.  Second the staff is super friendly and super patient with a 16 year old boy doing all the talking and ordering for him and his mom.  Tiffany was our waitress tonight and she gave us 5 star service.  This place is authentic and a must dine experience!  Can't wait to come again in the Spring with my other son a freshman who is now taking ALS 1.  Thank You!!

You may think it weird I'm writing a review for a place I've yet to experience, BUT, I am an interpreter and wanted to experience, first hand (no pun intended!!) this place. Another friend (Deaf; as well as my son (Hard of Hearing, but skilled ASL signer) and his girl friend) made reservations for this place. We went round and endlessly round, trying to find parking and FINALLY called it.  They were, via Sorenson (real time phone interp services) very sweet and I allowed we wouldn't be showing up that particular time. I told them we simply couldn't partake of the place as parking was impossible.  So...NEXT time, as I WILL make that effort, we will try to be somewhat inventive as to how to orchestrate this problem.  I think the most discouraging part of this is that we made the trip all the way from Fairfield/Vallejo area.

Staying around the corner, I moseyed over to Mozzeria for a margherita pizza. It was very well made - on a simple margherita there aren't a lot of ways to mask problems, so if the cheese, crust, or sauce aren't working, you'd know where the issue was and why. The crust and cheese were excellent, but I do wish the sauce had more of a punch. I think that would have pulled it all together and elevated the pie, but I would return to order a version with more ingredients to see if that gives me a fuller flavor experience to complement the solid base.
i ordered through caviar and it took 2 hours to get here and was freaking cold..  rediculous...

I can't visit San Francisco without going to Mozzeria a few times. Luckily many of my friends love it as much as I do and so its a great meeting spot for a fantastic gourmet italian dinner.  When I go with my friend Ken we always order several things and share all in order to taste as many different things as possible. The panorama of tastes is truly impressive.  I have had a roasted pulled pork pasta dish and also a lemon dessert both were out of this world delicious. I LOVE that the entire staff is ASL fluent and friendly. I love that the place is immaculately clean and pretty and inviting. Classy Beautiful Hole in the Wall:)  I will continue to meet my favorite people in the Bay at Mozzeria when I come to town.
It seems like most of the complaints here are in regards to some Gilt thing, idk what that is. I'm here to do one thing, drink some beer and write some reviews, and it looks like I'm all out of beer.
I love this place! The staff are wonderful - so nice and patient. And the pizza is great. I will definitely be back. And am inspired to learn sign language!!

My wife is a recurring character in my reviews. Rarely does she urge me to write a positive comment, or anything at all, about a restaurant. In this case, she suggested to me I praise the establishment. So that is about the best compliment I can share: my wife was satisfied.

The first thing that stands out about Mozzeria is the staff - everyone is deaf and uses ASL.  Once I become accustomed to my initial surprise, the rest of my dinner was splendid (if a bit warm - the place does not have A/C).

Everything about this place is literally amazing. The quality of the food is perfection. The service is fantastic. Parking can be quite troublesome, but it's totally worth the hassle because this is one of my favorite restaurants ever (so much so, I went to dinner there for my 20th birthday).
Do you want a quiet and friendly atmosphere???  This is the place to be!!!  The food is just befitting for your palate!!!  You won't be sorry here!!!

SCAM!  Used my Guilt City voucher and brought a friend.  Understand that they don't want 3 people eating from one certificate, they forced our guest to order a starter as well as her main.  What???  If she was dining at a another table they wouldn't make her do this.  Why now?  Oh yes to rip her off.  While the food is good their business practice is a scam and they should be ashamed of themselves. I was embarrassed for bringing her there.

This review is to address the handling of a Gilt City Voucher and why despite good food I would never return again.  I dined with two people who had a three course meal voucher for 2 and planned to order my own meal. When I placed my order for a pizza the server insisted I also had to order a small plate even though I didn't want it. She handed me a piece of paper that said they 'suggest' I order one and then told me I had no choice and it was part of their agreement with Gilt to enforce dining options on the whole party. I do not think think it stated that on the voucher and have never heard of a business punishing a full paying diner for eating with people who had a coupon. This a shady bad business practice and I will never return.

Want a new dining experience!!  Go to one of the new SF businesses owned and operated by Deaf people.  There are paper and pens on the table to make ordering and communicating a breeze.  We did a bit of restaurant rubbernecking while waiting for our food.  We loved watching all the sign language in use around the restaurant. The people that  took sign language in school had a wonderful time showing off their communication skills.  There was an eclectic mix of hearing and deaf people in the restaurant.  It was a great  experience!

All the pizzas were creative, with ingredients I've never seen on pizzas before. Got the farm egg pizza and pear pizza - delicious! Actually the pear was a bit on the salty side with the pancetta, but still really good.
One of the bestest pizza in the world.
The first time we went to Mozzeria, we didn't realize the staff was deaf.  The experience was definitely interesting and the food was great so we vowed that we would come back.

What a great experience we had last Friday night.  Could only get a late reservation but showed up a little early and we were seated in 5 minutes.  The staff was friendly and very prompt.  The 3 meatball side was to die for, in fact, so good we ordered another one.  The beet salad (x4) was delicious and went well with the goat cheese.  The in-house made burrata was also very creamy with a hint of sweetness, didn't like the wontons though - would change that up.  Pizza was cooked in 90 seconds and to perfection.  Just the right amount of ingredients to tantalize your tastebuds.  Got the meat pizza and it did not fail!  Would definitely go back.
Ordered a margherita slice and it didn't even have any cheese on it, not impressed
Food was excellent.  Prices were a bit high for what you got but service was excellent.  All the servers were deaf.  So novel, loved it!  They were all on their game!
Mozzeria's @ eat real feat 2014. couldn't  resist. s.f. pedigree. a direct challenge to Forge? nada. styles are distinctly unique.

This place was quite a memorable experience. The service was amazing and the food was so good. The language barrier might be an issue for some people, but it was not something that really made the dinner experience a problem. I'm glad I found out about this place. It's a true gem in San Francisco.
Damn fine food, service and concept. Went with someone fluent in ASL, although the FOH is just as friendly and efficient if you're clueless and write everything down.
This is a neat restaurant. I was excited to practice my ASL, but then realized I forgot quite a bit of it.
Great pizzas simply prepared & delicious.
Fantastic Neopolitan pizza, as everyone's saying.  Just wanted to correct the info on this page: you can indeed order delivery through Caviar, with a $4.95 delivery fee.
Hands down the best margherita pizza in the city. This is as close to the real deal as you can get.

Hands down the best pizza I've ever had! I am extremely picky about pizza - I love thin crust and the sauce has to be just right - not too sweet and full of flavor. Their wood-fired oven pizza is incredible. The crust is thin and perfect (Neopolitan style). The sauce is out of this world (pomodoro tomato sauce) -- in fact, you can order a side of sauce to dip your pizza crusts in for $3. We had the margherita pizza and charcuterie pizza. Both delicious, though my boyfriend and I both agreed that the margherita was better. Their wine selection is very nice too.

This place is cozy, quiet, and friendly. I had an amazing hibiscus saison, and my friend who ordered a zinfandel loved his wine.  We ordered the raddichio pizza and were impressed by the interesting combination of flavors it had with the root-y bitterness of the raddichio, nuttiness of the almonds and saltiness of the cheese.  The crust was soft and very chewy, and I really enjoyed the meal!

Mozzeria was at the 2014 SF Street Food Festival and I ordered the small bite of the margherita pizza ($3) which was about a quarter of a personal size pizza. Despite the small size, it was packed with flavor. I just wish there was more of it cuz I could have eaten more.
Pretty cool atmosphere, super small.
Megan M, our server, was terrific and very friendly, too, even pausing to chat with us briefly and satisfy our curiosity about the restaurant...the food more than satisfied our appetite!

Went to Mozzeria on quiet, cloudy San Francisco summer evening with the fiance.
