We had a gilt city voucher which I presented and had no problem with redeeming -- they gave us the special menu for the voucher. We ordered the burrata and the mozzeria bar as appetizers. The housemade burrata was delicious and it was accompanied with deep fried dough which was different from other places and it was quite tasty and worked well. The mozzeria bar was basically a flattened, large mozzarella stick with a marinara moat, which was was excellent in our book. We ordered the spinach pizza and the margherita pizza. The real standout was the crust -- perfectly chewy, fluffy and crisp. The margherita was a solid pizza and we were pleasantly surprised that the vegan spinach pizza had great flavor and satisfied. We finished with the bombolini dessert which was executed well but we didn't like the flavor. The house red wine was standard. As you know, the restaurant is a deaf owned and operated establishment, which was neat. The service and ambiance were great and it was a fun weeknight date spot. We would recommend this place and would come back in the future.

Four of us split the Hosui Pear, Italian Sausage, Mission Figs and Farm Egg pizzas. All were amazing. I didn't want the Farm Egg, but I was outvoted. SO GLAD! That was the best one. Sorry, no pictures. We ate everything too quickly. Great space and wait staff. And if you haven't heard, it's Deaf friendly. Would strongly suggest this place. We head back to Minnesota tomorrow from our vacation here. This was a highlight of our week long trip. Both desserts were a great way to end too.

Stopped in for dinner to use a Gilt voucher. Overall we had a really pleasant experience and I was grateful for the opportunity to dine in a deaf owned and operated restaurant, the food just didn't wow me.
I absolutely LOVE this restaurant!
4 stars for great pizza dough, -10,000 stars for service and policy.

I'm from So Cal but was in San Francisco and ate here with some friends.  The ambiance was very good.  Casual, yet trendy; upscale, but not pretentious; intimate enough for a date, yet I saw one young child.  The centerpiece was a huge wood burning oven.  The owner said they bought it in Italy.  It was nice, inlaid with tile, and made for a really cool attraction while sitting at or near the bar -- anywhere in the place, really since it's a fairly small restaurant.
Great food, great service, wonderful vibe!  Can't wait to go back.

My wife and I come here often, we love it! The pizza is amazing, and you don't have to wait for an hour like in Delfina. The appetizers are maybe even better, we love the charcuterie platter and the burrata. A great place to escape the crowds and still get top-notch food.
This is truly a wonderful sushi place. The omakase menu is amazing, and at very reasonable price. Probably the best in SF
Maruya has the best Omakase meal that I have tried in the Bay Area so far. I liked the portion size and quality of fish more than Sushi Ran, Kusakabe, and Roka Akor. Highly recommended!

A small and unassuming place, but the food is spectacular. Tried the Omakase tasting menu, every dish was presented in a very beautiful way, the sushi part was OK but a few dishes before it was very impressive. Also they have Japanese IPA, Japan also produces IPA?

I was really excited to try Maruya after the unveiling of their Michelin star.  I understand why Michelin would like Maruya.  It's clean, modern, and undoubtedly, the quality of fish is excellent.  However that was just it.  The fish, especially the Hon Toro and Japanese Uni nigiri were transcendent but everything else was either just ok, or lacking.  I did enjoy the service. Everything that did not have to do with nigiri was flat, under seasoned and to be honest, boring.    It was fast and there were no lapses in timing.  Overall I did feel disappointed, and after dining at nearly every Michelin starred restaurant in the Bay Area, I would have to say that I personally did not believe it was a Michelin starred experience.  I would be interested in giving Maruya another shot though.  If I have to, I will have 7 courses of Toro and Uni.
I really really wanted to love this place, but it just can't be done.
It is a tough choice Kusakabe VS Maruya

My husband found this place because he really wanted to introduce his family to Omakase, which is one of our favorite ways to dine.  We had the back room all to ourselves and were totally in the hands of the chef.  No menu, no idea what was coming next.  It was a lot of fun.  We had pieces of sashimi and nigiri sushi, grilled fish, steamed tofu custard with uni, various other small dishes and vegetable preparations, and a soup to finish, along with dessert and a shot of yuzu lemonade.  Standouts were tiny vegetables with a miso dressing for dipping, still crisp white asparagus with strawberry sauce, the grilled fish jaw, and for me - the uni custard (which was fortunate because no one else was a big uni fan, so I got to finish all of theirs).  Sadly, no one liked the mushroom soup at the end and they all sat there, uneaten.  This is definitely an experience to be savored and enjoyed, not rushed.  And it's maybe not the best idea if you are not an adventurous eater or haven't had much Japanese food before.  But if you are a sushi lover or Japanophile - please go here.
Love their omakase and simple adherence to a true sushi experience.

Maruya is delicious, albeit expensive. But who am I kidding? I have been known to turn a blind eye to any expensive meal if it blew me away. I think what feels conflicting about the cost of this meal is the fact that it's located smack in the middle of a dodgy neighborhood. So you nervously park your car, walk past a homeless person or two covered in blankets, and then step into a fancy Japanese restaurant to drop hundreds of dollars on tiny bites of delicate sushi goodness. Something here just feels a little dirty. But I digress..
You my friend take the number 2 spot of my favorite sushi spots for omakase (sorry but you fall shy of Shiros in Seattle).

I walked in here randomly on my way home from work to see if maybe I could sneak a seat at the bar by myself. It was the middle of the week and they were only about halfway full. I was stoked to immediately be seated at the bar in front of a very serious-looking Japanese dude.

Wow. It's going to cost you a pretty penny to dine here, but this is a sushi experience you must have at least once. I think that was the best sushi I've ever had in my life and I've been to some incredible places. We sat at the sushi bar and allowed the chef to give us a selection of a la carte pieces. We ended up eating 10 pieces of fish that actually melted in my mouth. The quality of this fish was outstanding. The presentation was impeccable. The finesse of the chef and his attentiveness to us during the meal was exceptional.

Went back and sat at the bar and neither of the main chefs were there.  We had the chef who used to work at Ozumo.  He was a nice guy, but some of the fish was just so darn chewy (we did omakase).  Also, the uni from Santa Barbara was quite fishy.  He just lacked a lot of the finesse that Chef Hide had when I first went.  I just went to their website and I guess he's gone.  He's not mentioned on there anymore.
It was hard to book a table through

I went BD dinner we had omakase " it was amaizing. Masa chief was personable 3 ladies server was polite and extremely attentive . I should have leave more than 25% tips. I had budget the night left 20% but they deserve more. Almost fish from Japan they all fresh no smelly at all it was extremely great . Beautiful artistic but taste was AWSOME. Highly recommended all of what I experienced but you need make reservation . I really appreciated to Masa he gave us wonderful birthday dinner and comp birthday desert ! That was great desert too!!! Love to back again!!!!!!!!! Price is compare is quality of meal I believe that was descent price and no complain at all. But you need have $$$$ if you want enjoy it. It is totally worth it! Great people there too! I didn't find Japanese place like that years..... Just amazing!!!!!! They are more than 5 stars!!!!!

I'm sad...it's not as good as the first time :/. Fish weren't as high of a quality and didn't seem as fresh as the other times.  I'll come back again to see if they get better.  Great service still though!

After eating at Sushi Sasabune, we had high hopes for another amazing omakase. Those hopes were dashed away quicker than it takes fresh, quality toro to melt in your mouth (which, by the way, it didn't at Maruya).
Holy Moly.
Simply. Amazing. Sushi.
High class sushi resturant, make sure u make reservation, this is a small place and they serve slow! Buy good are great! However they don't have much food except sushi n sashimi .....

Went with boyfriend for his birthday celebration, they were nice to call ahead of time asking what his name is so they could put on a cake. I guaranteed him, his first time there, that we'll be blown away like my first experience there. But we were so disappointed.
It doesn't get much better than this for a traditional sushi restaurant in the Bay Area!

I had high expectations for this place after reading all the great reviews and came with my SO for my birthday dinner. We were both somewhat disappointed. We got the Hide omakase and everything was good, but not amazing. The nigiri sizes are amongst the smallest I've had. The preparation was nothing special. They didn't have hotate (scallop) or amaebi (sweet shrimp), though they had a few unique items like giant clam. Don't get me wrong, it's definitely very good, but for the price (over $400 after tax and tip) I expect amazing. Go to Akikos or Yume in the easy bay, I've been to both multiple times and both are better with more unique fish, preparations and bang for your buck.

I am a serious sushi/Japanese cuisine lover and Maruya is top notch. It is a small restaurant with maybe 6 tables and a sushi bar that can seat 10 people. It's a special occasion restaurant where most people opt for the omakaze to have the full experience.

The experience was very memorable, the restaurants decor and floor plan is very fitting for a high end sushi restaurant.  The chefs were very meticulous in their set up, the fish was extremely fresh, refrigerated just perfect and served well.  No surprise to anyone, it's very expensive and in all honesty you can eat the same level of sushi elsewhere for less than half the price.  These prices were higher than Vegas.  You're sure to eat on an empty wallet!

We had the Maruya omakase in the private room in the back of the restaurant.  We actually wanted to order the Masa Hide omakase where you can order as much sushi as you want (hubby is a huge eater), but we were limited to the Maruya because we were sitting in the back room.  The Maruya omakase was a nice combination of cooked and raw dishes.  Every dish was nicely presented and were delicious, but at the end of the omakase we were still a little hungry so we ordered more pieces of nigiri and they were absolutely delicious.  Next time we come back, we would either choose the Masa Hide omakase or go a la carte off the menu so that we can choose the pieces of fish/shellfish.  The restaurant is located in a neighborhood that's a bit sketch, but once you enter the restaurant - it felt like you were transported to another world!  Overall, very authentic & amazing fish - but pricey for the area and amount of fish you get (but worth it!).

Very authentic, located at a real crappy (or "up and coming" if you prefer) neighborhood.  Sat at the sushi bar.  Reservation is a must.  Very quiet restaurant.  The chef serving us looked very serious.  He seemed to treat the Japanese patrons nicer as he could converse in Japanese.  Food was amazing, but it's not cheap. You get what you paid for.  Omakase is a good deal.
My favorite go to spot for Japanese food in S.F. Excellent food and very attentive staff.
you wouldn't think it, but good sushi is hard to find in the bay area.  i had been craving good sushi for long and finally found it at maruya last night.
The food - ambiance - service were all spectacular. We did the omakase. Spent $400 for 2 omakases and 1 bottle of sake. Really delicious and really expensive.
The name of this restaurant should be "CHA-CHING BLING BLING BLING BLING BLING", because you'd better be prepared to drop some dolla dolla bills to eat here.

This place is a solid 5 stars, even makes me think I should go back and reduce some of the other 5 star ratings I have given.  I liked it so much that I went twice in the past week, the first time with a friend and then again with my wife so she could enjoy it as well.  Sit at the counter and order the Omakase (trust the chef) course and you will be delighted.  This is the best sushi in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Chef Sasaki is a master at his craft.

I sat with Chef Hide and had the pleasure of experiencing an extensive version of his omakase dinner. I loved the ambiance of this small establishment. The whole place is decorated with wood which created a warm natural environment which complimented the sushi. The fish selection was also kept in a wooden box that was put away in the refrigerator underneath. I love that they encouraged the traditional method of eating sushi with four fingers by providing a finger towel-- have yet to see this anywhere else in the city. Both Chef Hide and Chef Masa displayed that they are masters of their craft with the rhythmic flow of the sushi preparation. Fish quality was great as well and they leave the menu in front of you so you can peruse and see exactly where it came from. If you take your sushi seriously, this may be for you.

Amazing. We sat at the bar and had an awesome meal. We splurged and added onto the Hide omakase. The chef in turn, treated us kindly. Definitely not your typical night out for sushi. But a very special, eat with your hands, traditional sushi experience. You have to know how to appreciate this place.

Very fresh fish and the sushi rice was perfectly made. We ordered the Maruya Omakase which features a few non-sushi appetizers including some great grilled fish then on to sashimi, nigiri and finished off with a miso soup with clams. I can't claim it to be the best sushi that I have had in California but it was a great experience of flavors and highly recommended! If you go, make sure to ask about their toro as they do offer different grades of toro.
I have eaten at Maruya twice so far.  As much as I like this place, it is not my favorite at this moment.  But it comes close.

Came here on a random weekend away and got reservations at 9:30 on a Friday night. There was 4 of us and we all got the Maruya Omakase and a couple of bottles of cold sake. The entire meal was amazing. We started off with a bit of broccoli with sesame sauce on top as our palette cleanser and then moved on to the first part of our omakase it was served on a small rectangular plate with 3 appetizers; miniature vegetables with beschamel sauce, homemade tofu with Uni on top and miniature squid. All three achieved a great blend of flavors and texture, from crunchy fresh vegetables to melt in your mouth delicately flavored tofu and Uni to the savory flavors of the mini squid. The dinner progressed equally as delicious and seems to keep getting better and better.
Let me give you my background.  I'm Japanese.  I grew up eating "real" sushi.  In Japan.
Omakase was truly fantastic.  I can't recall the entire night because we had WAY too much sake.  And expensive sake it was.

Happy to have this place open. Great New Yorkish style pizza. Flavorful bright tomato sauce, plenty of cheese n charred crust. The couple that run it are also really nice. Hope they continue to do well

I read about this place in SF Weekly and while it's pretty no frills inside, the most important thing delivers...excellent pizza.  The crust is nice and thin yet crispy at the same time.  A feat that is difficult to accomplish.  I got the special of the day which was cheese and pesto and a meat one as well.  Great spot!

Stopped in by chance for a slice - The Meat (pepperoni, sausage, and meatball). The perfect amount of toppings, very tasty sauce and high quality cheese, and the crust was light and crispy. A very pleasant surprise! Highly recommend!
Quick and delicious! Crispy crust, stringy cheese, and flavorful sauce. I also appreciated the clean and simple interior. Definitely will be coming back!

I got the artichoke slice and a cherry coke. Perfect dinner. Wait time was short for heating up. The circles of tomato sauce on the slice were so yummy and the toppings tasted really fresh. Love the amount of cheese-to-crust ratio. Their crust is really good especially if you like NY style 'zza.
Felt like popping in for a slice.
Great tasting pizza, available by the slice, good variety, and the staff was friendly.
Excellent Pizza, Great Music.  Very quick and friendly service.  Lots of options - all looked delicious. Will be back!
It is simply just that - the best piza that you have ever tasted... on this coast. :)
Mmmmmm! So good. Yummy crust. Simple, clean, cute. The young man taking orders and cleaning is very nice and friendly!

Yeah, the lighting *is* questionably dim in here (and it's not some hip rustic look or anything) but, fortunately, it has NO effect on my ability to devour the heavenly pies that this place pumps out.
Tha pizza here is aight. The upside is that they have some cool flavors you don't really see around. It's very odd they just aren't open a couple random days in the week.
Great pizza for a good price. Lots of options pre-made to be ordered by the slice and good prices on full pizzas. Nice service as well.
The crust is so thin and so crispy and SO GOOD.

Moving from New York to the Bay area meant eating more Mexican and just not eating pizza.  The idea that someone would have the audacity to recommend Escape from New York or Zacharys as viable options is appalling.  The Pizza Shop aims to satisfy the needs of grabbing a slice or two of solid solid pizza.  It doesn't try to be a fancy sit down place, just a consistantly great slice of pizza.  I have pizza in my life again, and it makes living in San Francisco almost worth it.
Mind. Blown.
Great addition to 24th St.  I can't walk by without grabbing a slice,  the pizza is delicious!
Love it!  Wish they delivered and wish they had salads, but their pizza is a-ok.  They really do a great job, nice staff, reasonable prices, best pizza around.
The dough is the starting point and the key!

Wanted to grab a quick bite to hold me over until dinner. Light and not greasy with great customer service (a dude walked in and was a dollar short, the girl behind the counter took a dollar out of the tip jar and have him the slice). No hot sauce available (but if you get the "pie of the moment" with cherry peppers then you won't need hot sauce).

I agree with the comments that this is the closet to NY-style pizza that you could probably find in SF. The pepperoni/mushroom and plain cheese slices were both delicious - perfect proportion of cheese to sauce.
My favorite place to go eat real NY style pizza in SF!

When The Pizza Shop opened up, I was so happy to have something convenient and close to me; I would have been willing to have mediocre pizza slices. SURPRISE, it's a great pizza place! The shop is clean, the staff is super friendly, and my Jersey friends are always happy to go there.

Wow I am impressed I am a deep dish lover but this crispy thin sliced heaven is just what you need when you want a quick and easy delicious slice. And for 6 bucks with a drink you can not go wrong. They only take cash but worth every penny I highly suggest you take a leap of faith and ask the ladies what they recommend you really can not go wrong. Awesome!

Found my pizza spot in this neighborhood, whee. I've passed it so many times, but just recently stopped in because my boyfriend and I were extra hungry before dinner and wanted something for the walk.
On point! Solid, no fuss tasty slices. My only complaint is that it took you so long to arrive in the hood.

Dude, tone down your sarcasm when speaking to a customer who is paying you nearly $5 /slice...i got a pretty sarcastic attitude from owner on 2 separate occasions..I get it, you're from east coast..and so am I!

FUCKING FINALLY.  Arinell's is close, Giorgio's is pretty commendable, and that place on mid-Polk is on the right track, but SOMEONE FINALLY MADE AN EAST COAST SLICE IN SF.  The je-ne-sais-quoi is there!    Now, someone needs to open a real mission-style taqueria in Williamsburg, and the global culinary cycle of gentrification will be complete.  Just like yo' momma.
By the slice or entire pie. Cash only. But the pizza is good. Gonna be about $4 a slice. My only complaint is that they should put on more tomato sauce.

I'm an East Coast snob who constantly berates the quality of West Coast pizza, but the owner of this place is supposedly from New Jersey and it shows in the pizza. Nice thin crust, just like I used to get back home in CT (but go to anywhere in New Haven and you'll get this quality).

Pizza Shop is the bomb and I am psyched they have opened around the corner from my place. The crust is super crispy and the pizza is not too greasy. Like NY style, but maybe a little healthier.  Price is right at $3 or $4 a slice. Excellent add to the neighborhood. The reviewer who compared this pizza to Costco should be shot.

In the matter of years, the world of pizza has become quite complex. The complexities are rooted in the desire to either have a cheap pizza (not that flavorful) to an epicurian delight that will charge you 30+ for just a small personal pan pizza.
Cash only. So worth it!

the legit way to eat NY style pizza is to fold it in half, hold it in your hand like a taco and chow down. You know, like in the opening credits of Louie. There should also be a small pool of grease in the middle. If you use a napkin to absorb the grease and dab at your pizza disgustingly, then you aren't worthy of pizza.

i love pizza so much i started my own pizza club back in the day, so when i met someone who attended the LV Pizza Expo and made NY pizza at home for leisure, I knew he knew what was up and took his every pizza rec to heart. The Pizza Shop is only about 4 weeks old I hear and it provides really cute and casual seating that can accommodate small groups. This is pretty close to the real deal. NY pizza lovers- delight in it! Cash only.

First by the slice place in this part of the Mission and thank god they arrived!  I was getting sick of burritos and sandwiches constantly.  I say its 3.5 star slice of pizza.  I am always still hungry after 1 slice and $4 per slice is about $1 higher than I would normally expect since you need 2.  But hey, I can still get lunch for under $10 and get my pizza fix weekly now.

So, we are hungry. Driving down 24th St. What to eat...what to eat? Mexican, nah... Deli Sandwiches, nah...Chinese, nah. PIZZA, yeah!! Where to now? oh, wait look at that place in the "almost" corner. Let's check it:
Solid New York Style Pizza
Awesome $3/slice pizza - the crust is so perfectly crunchy! - our new favorite pizza place.
SOLID grub. Highly recommended. An east coast gem in the west, what more can you ask for!? Don't miss out on the spicy wings with blue cheese dip.
Great tasty unhealthy food, especially their signature philly cheese steak sandwich.
As a Philly person, I'm happy to see they sell Tastykakes. :)
Mushroom steak with whiz cheese - delish!
Cheesesteak with beer cheddar sauce was very good, though it is too messy. Onion rings on point.

Let's not just throw around 5 stars. But a winner is a winner. I came late on Monday night. Had been looking forward to this for awhile but hadn't made time. I even grew skeptical that it would be that good. Nope it was and the service was great also. I had the Whole Shi-bang w/o bacon and it was sex in my mouth. The ingredients were A1 and the service was phenomenal. Def will head back there after the WS is over! Go Giants!
Solid Philly Cheese Steak sandwich. i always get mine with cheese whiz, mushrooms, and peppers.

The sandwich tasted fine but was all but was a mess to eat. There's no "eat it quick" when the roll falls apart as soon as you get it, leaving a pool of juices in your tray. The bread is soft and weak and thus no help against the dripping juices of the meat, onions, and peppers.
This place seems like corp chain that was once excellent. The only memorable part of the experience was the cash register.

This place has that hipster-divey feel. It certainly isn't the first place I'd think of to have great food, but appearances aren't everything they're made out to be. The food is excellent. The sandwiches are good with good portions and not too much of one thing. I had the waffle fries with the cheddar beer sauce, frickin excellent! And of course they serve coca-cola, which is a plus in my book.
hella tasty. had a classic with mushrooms and white american cheese. waffle fries.

I tried 12''classic Philly and it was good. Sandwich was huge  and overflowing with meat which was very juicy, so it was very messy to eat (definitely not for to go, you'll have to eat it there). Prices are reasonable.

Italian beef close to Chicago style, needs to add the yellow peppers but the bread and beef and au jus very tasty.. Spicy type also added some zing but not too much to take away from the sandwhich ..I'll be back.

I got their classic Philly cheesesteak. The meat is very tasty and was the highlight of the sandwich, and the service was excellent. The bread was a bit bland and soggy though. I'll be back to try something else on the menu but for the price and service I recommend it.
Had the cheese steak with mushrooms and their special cheesy beer sauce!
Stopped by here after seeing Joe Montana, Jerry Rice, Steve Young and other 49er legends play at Candlestick one last time.
Was in the city for the last hoorah for the Niners at candle stick. I looked up cheesesteak places and came across this spot.
Ah grease, the true hallmark of any Philly cheesesteak. Without that, you'd just have some meat on a bun.
I went here with my husband Sunday night and it was the best Philly cheesesteak I've ever had!! They even have Cheez wiz!!

Great place right off mission street. Though I didn't have a cheese steak they made me a hybrid of the "chili cheese fries" and "hangover cure" that was to die for!  Light and fun ambience, seating for about 20, 30 with the tables outside. $2 cans of Pabst arent bad either.
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)
Really welcoming feel to it! And the art all around is really well done and the beer selection is really awesome,denogginizer & heretic and new castle for 5$ for a draft pint! Can't beat that!!
Talk about fresh! Absolutely amazing food. Super quick and great service! Great beer selection as well! Can't beat it  if you're
It was late but that should be no excuse to make a horrible Philly. The cashier person, no personality, I just didn't want to order but it was not place open after watching Godzilla!

I'm from Philly.... I've had tons of delicious cheesesteaks on the east coast. Maybe these guys do have the right bread - one of the most important components of a cheesesteak - but they have no idea about the ratio of bread to meat to cheese. The put so much of everything on the roll that it turns into a soggy dripping mess. Don't even try to take it to go, the sandwich will be ruined because of how soggy the bread gets. Also, garlic mayo is not a Philly thing and neither is cheddar beer sauce. They were also out of Tasty Kakes. Could be so much better.
My Philly was good. it could use a little salt n pepper, but that's just my taste. The waffle fries and the onion rings are on point and the service was good. I'll go back
Great food and they have 21st Amendment Beer for cheap.

Let me start by confessing to some snobbery:  I consider myself a cheese steak connoisseur.  I lamented the dearth of quality cheesesteaks with my fellow East Coast transplants for several years after I moved to SF.  Jay's felt like a shadow of an authentic cheesesteak in comparison to a true Philly classic.  DC, NYC, and Philly all know cheesesteaks but the West Coast hadn't figured it out until as of late.
Sandwhiches are okay.. Tried the sandwhich with the whole shibang. Bacon avocado and bell peppers. Sandwich was tasty but not much cheese. Considering it's suppose to be a Philly cheesesteak.
The neighborhood bar-food place.
I know, having spent sometime in Philadelphia, it is not that easy for me to "love" such a place.

Make sure you order your cheesesteak with whiz NOT provolone. I've always ordered my cheesesteak with the typical provolone and never had problems with flavor. I ordered my sandwich with provolone and was super disappointed. No flavor. I ended up throwing away half of the sandwich.  I give 3 stars because my husband ordered his with whiz and extra onions. His sandwich was ON POINT. Better than cheesesteaks from San Diego and Vegas. Got the boneless chicken wings too -- it was a little too salty/zesty (?) for my taste.

While wandering around 24th street, I stubbled upon Phat Philly. Decided it was time to try a cheese steak again and walked in. First thing I noticed was the nice seating area right outside of the location for those nice warm days.

When my daughter wasn't eating her pizza, they noticed and asked if it was okay.  When she said she thought it was too spicy, they made her a new one right away.  Thanks for excellent customer service, and rockin' good food!
Phat Philly doesn't mess around. Every component seems to have been carefully selected to be combined into a glorious, gut-busting cheesesteak... And I mean that in the best possible way.
eh! I may have ordered wrong because after hearing/seeing all the rave reviews, I don't have the same feelings toward Phat Philly.
I don't have much to add here except that the prices are about a dollar more than what you see in the menu.
This place is so good a little too much for the fries but it's worth it it's so good cross cut fries with ranch an add some cheese wiz it's the best keep up the good work !!!!c:
Expensive, but also really good. I always get the one with bell pepper. Mmm cheese. Fries are excellent.
Stopped in a couple weeks ago to re-up on some cheesesteak in my life.

5 Stars all the way for this place. As a pie shop, it's great; as a local business, it's one of the best in the city. Owned and operated by women, it not only serves great food, it also gives back to its community. In a city quickly becoming overrun by greed for corporate profit at the expense of all else (I'm looking at you, Uber), it's nice to have a small corner in a great neighborhood where the conscientious heart of San Francisco beats on. Come here and be nourished--by pie, and by a real community.
Friday night and the place was jammed-packed and the pie was good. Just as you would expect from an A+ pie: Mission Pie presented a thin, sturdy crust with fruit being the center stage for flavor.
Damn good pie! Not great pie, but good pie! Great place to curl up in a sunny window like a cat, with a slice of banana cream.
Amazing pie! But I recommend going elsewhere for coffee. A shame because coffee and pie go so well together
God, these people do pie right. I've never been disappointed with any sweet pie I've tried. Sure, $22 for a pie can seem a little steep... but (1) this is San Francisco, and (2) pie is happiness.
That pumpkin pie is the best I have every had.

On my  3rd visit, yesterday, I  had a slice of their Shaker Lemon pie and it was outstanding.  The crust was flaky and tasty, the lemon filling had bits of lemon peel - the taste and texture of the slice was really good.  I picked up a pear-raspberry pie and wow, especially reheated. it is delicious.  The service was fast and very friendly.  5 stars all around for Mission Pie.
This place was good, but not out-of-this-world amazing.
Some of the best pies in SF I've ever tasted. Such rich and fresh quality. How i overlook this gem in SF for most of my life I don't understand. Will come back when I'm in the mission area again.
I've got the best pumpkin pie ever. It was so tasty and real pumpkin taste, not so sweet and it was just right amount of everything.

AMAZING chicken pot pie. Seriously, this is the best chicken pot pie I have ever eaten. The only thing that would make it better is if the crust were not just on top, but also along the edges of the pie tin too. The filling is chock full of quality ingredients, with carrots, celery, large chunks of potato and chicken, and just enough creamy filling to be satisfying. I like the fact that nothing is too salty either. My sister and I split the pot pie as an early dinner, and it was filling enough for the two of us. I will definitely be back for more chicken pot pie. I also think it's better to eat in than take it home to heat up, but that's an option too.
I'm a lookin and I'm a likin.  Well actually the bannana cream pie doesn't look so hot but it tastes delicious. Washed it down with a tall glass of cold milk and this man was quite happy!
damn. Hipsters make the best pies.

Got their banana cream and pumpkin pie. Both were just okay so they were nothing special.  Banana cream pie was sloppy and it didn't hold its shape.  Pumpkin pie had black beads of spices in it; not sure what they were.
I have found my nirvana.

The location is awesome and the cafe layout is beautifully put together. In my opinion, the pie was a 7 out of 10 as its taste was not all to my palate. I love banana cream pie, and this one was good, just not my most favorite. I loved the for-here wear coffee cups!! Pie+coffee+conversation = A nice night visit to Mission Pie.
LIFE ALTERING PIES. Mission Pie, You have ruined me. I have never nor will I ever have a pie like your banana cream pie. It is heaven on earth. I wish you would open a location in Kansas City.

This was the first time here and was looking for a slice of great pie. I found it here at Mission pie all the pies were fresh and delicious. I ordered the chess cranberry pie it was sweet and tart and now one of my favorites. The pie had a perfect flaky crust and topped with  organic vanilla ice cream. We also had the lemon pie which also had the whole lemon inside baked into a sweet and slightly tart treat. The slices are a decent and the service was friendly and fast.

Have to give a perfect rating, simply for the pie crust alone. It is just the right texture and consistency. We ordered an equal share of sweet and savory offerings, and, while I'm not much of a sweet person, I went ga ga over their sweet pies.
This place...is amazing!  From savory pot pies and quiches, to dessert pies, you literally can't go wrong with anything you choose.
Great pies but you have to remember to tell them to heat yours up.  The strawberry rhubarb is really good but they only have it when it is in season.  Raspberry pear wasn't that good.
Review is for a berry/strawberry mini pie.

I have been craving a good slice of pie since the husband and I came home from our honeymoon (seriously almost a year ago? Shit) during which we accidentally discovered Pie Bar while in Seattle and I've been looking for local equivalents ever since.

Today was a very disappointing lunch day I been driven past this place for a long time now so today I decided to stop but that was not a good idea lol the banana cream pie was bland and the classic chicken pot pie was far away from classic the whip cream they use is gross it's flavorless and leaves weird greasy feeling in your mouth the crust on the pot pie is more like a Filo dough and the filling deff needs lots of salt and pepper and more CLASSIC veggies
The place is cute, the coffee is good. Would love to try pies when in this area. Check it out!

Want Pie? Come here for pie, it's all in the name. Considering the number of restaurants near Mission Pie, this is the place to go when you skip desert because you don't feel like dropping another $10-12 on a store bought chocolate mouse. Buy a slice of pie for $4, buy another one because you couldn't decide between Pear Raspberry and Pumpkin.
Picked up the bolognese ragu savory pie for lunch today and was not mad about it.
Who doesn't love pie?

I've just never had a bad experience here. The workers are always friendly and they have just the right thing when you're craving a late night mini pie and don't want the standard grocery store pie that was made days ago. My favorite has got to be the apple pie. Buy a mini and share with a friend!
Amazing pie. Definitely recommend getting the ice cream along with it. Sometimes can be crowded. Go early they run out of flavors quickly.
Oh Mission Pie. I've heard some amazing things about you, but the time I got there, there wasn't too many options. I went with 3 other friends and we ended up getting 4 difference pies:

One of my favorite places, I love the potato tart! I am a sucker for desserts so I will always spring for that too and they are tasty. The crust is delicious and I pay particular attention to pie crusts as it is my favorite part.
Just walking around San Fran with a friend, we suddenly saw this place, and well, who can say no to pies?
Very chill place with lots of people chit chatting over coffee and pie on a Sunday.
We had the chocolate cheesecake the first night and it was amazing. The next night we had red velvet cheesecake, which was good but not the best. We also had blueberry jamboree, which was very good.

Banana cream pie has consistently been OFF THE HOOK SLAP YOUR MAMA GOOD. Creamy, smooth, crust perfect on this one. Coffee strong but never bitter. Slightly pricey for mini pies, which was soggy in the middle and the crust wasn't as good as the banana cream.
Delicious pie!  Loved the peach raspberry!  The plum frangipane was great too.  The chicken pot pie smelled tasty.  Go and indulge.

It was hard to believe that, at 9pm, the most bumpin' spot on the block was a pie joint. That was, of course, before I tried my pie. I went with the classic apple pie (it was in season!) and I wasn't disappoint. The pie itself was a little too tangy, but it was complimented by the homemade whipped cream, don't let the staff skimp on that stuff.

We came here after reading such great reviews, but were utterly disappointed. The Moroccan lamb pot pie, banana cream pie and apple pie were dry and unseasoned. They seem to use quality ingredients, and local source is to be commended, but the execution was very poor.
Had the banana cream pie & it was yummy.  I've been here several times and really enjoy it. The only thing I don't like is there is never any seating.
If you are in a panini kinda mood, can't go wrong here. As an extra bonus, the Lebanese guy who runs the place is super nice, plus there are pitchers of basil-cucumber water in the fridge.  :-p
Who doesn't love a good panini?!

Hubert is really nice and friendly. Got a cup of tea in the morning (before official opening hours, you can tea/coffee), and he was very inviting. Even encouraged me to hang out if I needed to, since they had WiFi and I was waiting for some people! Definitely coming back here!
Garbage sandwich that was messier than a bums shopping cart. Overly sauced and they put onions when I explicitly said no. Barely any meat as well.

Hot Press has the BEST panini I've found in San Francisco. They're made with fancy but not expensive ingredients, they're pretty good sized, and the price is fair. Plus, they're spicy if you want them to be, in a way that accentuates the flavor palette rather than covering it up.
Consistently delicious! Their panini is big enough for 2. Their ingredients taste fresh, and I love that little hint of heat that they put in it. & prices are fair.
Best panini sandwiches in SF.  The shop is only made better by the selection of Three Twins ice creams.

I made it Hot Press for the first time this afternoon. They have something for everyone, and I think I will be back again for more before long. The food was good and the guy that worked there had a great vibe! Im surprised it took me so long to find Hot Press, but now that I found 'em, they'll be seeing more of me.
Tasty sandwiches!  Had the chicken one.  A little on the small side, hungry eaters may be left still hungry.
My company catered from here for lunch and I had the beef panini. It was pretty yummy, although a tad dry. Had to add some hot sauce to spice it up!
Ok. Do you want to know a secret?  Cause I have a secret.

The best Panini place ever. Get the Daredevil, I dare you. It's a masterpiece that's not on the menu -it comes with Smoked turkey, Sriracha garlic aioli, Jalapeno slaw, Monterey Jackcheese, Carmalized onions on Italian ciabatta  bread. Or something like that. It's awesome.
I'm in agreement with Aristides N. Way overrated.
Definitely recommend the pollo de la mission panini! The service here is phenomenal as well!

Despite the unassuming interior/exterior, the panini I had (the tuna) was beautifully flavored, and the bread crunchy, and the gentleman behind the counter was friendly. I would probably have preferred the sandwich to be warmer, but overall, it was a pretty good panini experience in a sea of overpriced sandwich offerings in the rest of the Mission.
I love this place. Been eating here for over a year.
Way overrated.
Time: 12:06pm/66°F mostly sunny

A little hidden gem. Only stopped there because La Taqaria was closed. Had a hard time deciding because everything sounded so delicious. Went with Mr Gobbler and Mrs Hen (turkey with cranberry chutney).  Yum!  Can't believe it was almost deserted.
Finally a good sandwich within a block from me. Great pricing and taste buds very satisfied !! This is located in the mission little middle eastern corner and proud to have them around

That "Try Trick Me" panini is bomb!! So good and tasty! The waffle with 2 choices of ice cream is also really amazing! Gotta love it! The man that works here is super cool and proud of his food! Gotta love him. Anyways, check this place out when you're hungry for some good food!
Awsome sandwichs or paninis pressed to perfection , my favorite is the The end Up , great variety of cool drinks and a comfortable spot to eat and relax , cant miss out ..
Dear yelpers,
Order the 'in the mix' spicy, couldn't eat it fast enough. The flavors complimented each other so well my taste buds were singing!
If I could give 6 stars, I would.
This place is so, so good.  I usually hate the types of salads that come with food, but the three-bean salad is awesome.  Try it if you like beans.

How did I ever not know about this place - great, fresh food with fantastic basa nova music. Large selection of different root beers and unusual drinks like coconut, pineapple and nutmeg which I did no try but will be back. The man working there was super nice.

I've always walked past this place but never had gone in, until last week. I went in and ordered the Pollo panini followed by cookies and cream ice cream! It was so good and fresh! I just wanted to keep eating more. The owner was also nice and the big screen TV they had kept me entertained.

Best sandwiches ever. When I walk in I just tell them to make me whatever they want and it always comes out good. Sauces are always made from scratch and the people that work there are very friendly. Good selection on chips and drinks too!!!!

I've had almost all of their sandwiches and non of them fell short of amazing! i had them all spicy and adds great taste! I've brought 3 coworkers and they said even liked them! Also you get a small side with every Panini.. Coleslaw is my favorite! The pollo de la mission, the End up, mi Place Molto and try trick me are super delicious! Definitely a spot to try and go back for more!
Trust me the best sandwiches in town!!! Try it!!!
Excellent Panini's. Friendly service.
I love their panini, the best so far!!!!

Our new favorite neighborhood cafe - friendly people, fast wi-fi, and plenty of outlets and tables. Got the tri tip panini and it was INSANEly delicious - tasted like it was from  a restaurant that specialized in paninis, not just any generic cafe panini.

the panini here are DELICIOUS. they are pressed so that the bread is perfectly toasted and the ingredients are really fresh and yummy. my favorite is THE END UP and i've developed a serious addiction for it. the other night, i was craving it but saw that they were closing. i called them to see if they would make me a sandwich, and they told me they were closed. i begged. they were SO NICE and said they would make me one! they had already started wrapping the ingredients up for the night, but re-opened everything just to make me my favorite sandwich. i love them!!!
Oh My Beef. Get it.

One day, while visiting San Francisco, I was walking from Bernal Heights to the Bart at 24th St. . I was craving a panini the entire walk and didn't find anything. Well, a block and a half before the Bart Station it happened. I saw the sign - "HOT PRESS / PANINI" . I hurried in and felt like I was home! I had the special panini of the day and after my first bite I had bigger plans - I was going to have Panini sandwiches at a party I was hosting in the City in a few months!
Tri tip sandwich....is divine. As a recent convert to the world of spicy, I like the burn!

I've been meaning to come here for a while and I'm glad that I finally did. It was definitely one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I would highly recommend the food here to anyone and I'll definitely be coming back again.
Delicious and fresh. A good spot for a lunch break during the work week and their specialty selection of unique bottled sodas are super cute.
There's still only 4-5 beers to choose from, but the quality of those choices has improved. Yay to good beer.

i got the get a room pizza and it was good. if i can eat the crust that means it's a good pizza. the dough was good, crust was great, it seems to need more flavor though. could be due to the sauce, felt like it needed more. but other than that it's good pizza.

Chill, local spot for thin crust pizza that is kid friendly. Inside reminded of being at an outdoor party at night. Tried the Yo Vinny and Margarehita which were pretty good. The highlight was the super sweet onions on the Yo Vinny.
We were expecting more from this place. Others raved about the salad which was ok. The beans were clearly canned and could have benefited from a rinse or vinegar

Every bite of pizza was better than the last. No joke. Even just the one with literally sauce and crust. Amazing. Was a little tricky coordinating with 4 adults and 2 little kids to get a long table near the chalk board (and then to find a piece of chalk to draw with) but we managed. Wait staff was low energy (overall seemed a bit grouchy or maybe just overworked?), but once we bit into the pies all was forgiven.

The crust is ridiculous , the closest one to A 16 , place is awesome , benches are perfect for group of friends to come hang out and have some beer, waitresses super gorgeous just sayin' .Pizzahacker the hottest pizza spot in town .
Came across this place unexpected... However was very lucky I did! Great service and ambience. Felt like I was hanging out in a good friends backyard! I will be back for sure!! Great waitress!!
Stopped after work and ordered a pizza from PizzaHacker.
Just great pizza. Really, it's just delicious. Thanks for opening in the neighborhood!
Loved this spot for eating with little kids! Chalkboard walls, benches, un-crowded dining room, and a casual atmosphere make this a perfect place for hungry kids that won't sit still.
Amazing pizza--crispy greatness. I miss the dandelion pizza, but I'm sure the new seasonal ones are great, too. Also, it's super easy to text for takeout.
Very fresh, delicious pizza! Worth trying!
I'm from New Jersey and a bit of a pizza snob.

I've eaten here twice.  I would have been three times, but the first time hubs and I tried to go, there was a sign out front that indicated that they had run out of pizza dough.  Hey, it happens.  That shit is fresh.

Honestly, I just went to famous famous famous Roberta's in Bushwick, Brooklyn (basically the reason Bushwick became "cool"), and I think PizzaHacker is on par. The charred crust, the homemade sauce and handpulled mozz, and ingredients so fresh I could swear they have a whole farm of pizza toppings growing on their roof...I am so spoiled now that this place is 1 block from my house.
Best pizza this side of town. Service is a little hectic, but the pizza makes up for it.
I forgot the names of the pizzas I had, they were two of the seasonal ones. BUT both were delicious!

Just had the Top Shelf Margherita last Friday.  I've been here only once before and had their standard Margherita and wanted to compare the two.  After my first or maybe second, I started tearing up and cried.  It was just that good.  Sure, I will probably never capture that moment again but I am indebted to the hacker for giving it to me.

We wanted something fun and casual, yet delicious, for our rehearsal dinner and immediately thought of our favorite pizza spot, Pizzahacker. From the beginning, Jeff was really responsive and excited to prepare a spot in the back of the restaurant to accommodate us.
Top Shelf Margherita pizza - for an extra $2, you get the Early Girl tomato sauce which is sweet/tangy, and delicious. Highly recommend over the regular Margherita pizza.

Great pizza, questionable hygiene. Fun, low key vibe. Friendly service. Fair prices for high quality and creative pizzas.  But I don't want to see a guy with long stringy hair preparing my pizza without a hat, hair net or even a pony tail!

Pretty solid Za off the beaten Mission path.  We had the purple rain which has these delicious sweet tomatoes and prosciutto and some sweet cheese.  The crust was excellent and the flavor combinations really worked.  The salad they serve is enough for 3-4 people so next time I would probably nix the salad and eat more pizza.  I would definitely go back and try some of their other flavors.
I can usually tell if I'll like a pizza immediately base solely on it's appearance. So superficial. I know. This time, with Pizza Hacker, I was wrong...

I love how close PizzaHacker is to my house! It's crazy how all these hipster places have been opening up in the neighborhood lately, but I guess I'll just go with the flow... since the flow comes with good food! Considering these pizzas can be small enough to be individual size, it's a bit pricey running at $15 a piece, but if you share it's totally a steal. My bf and I shared the Yo, Vinny! - marinated onions, peppers, house Italian sausage, tomato sauce and fresh mozzarella... we also added chorizo and black olives. The sauce was great and the crust was so good! I usually don't like crust, but I liked this one so that's really saying something. I didn't get a chance to try the other pizzas but they looked promising... and the beer menu looks great too! I'll definitely be back.
Normally when you order pizza you get a stale loaf of bread with some tomato sauce and cheese on top. But, occasionally you find a place that delivers real authentic Italian pizza.
Top Shelf Margherita
This place is the bomb.  The crust is the best I have had.  The servers are super nice.  The Yo Vinnie pie is so good, I am losing sleep over it.
Good pizza and good price. Been here several times and it is consistent.  But last night was a pop up chili night.  I tried a frito chili pie and it was excellent.

Pretty good pizza. The one to remember had dandelions in it. Thought it'd be a bit strange since I never had dandelions before even though I was aware that people eat them. It was pretty good I must say. Good mix of flavors too. The pizza is on the thinner side of crust just for you to keep that in mind. The white sauce on the pizza is good. Salad is plenty enough for at least 4 people too:)

Best pizza I've had so far in San Francisco! The Margherita pizza was everything I hoped for and more. The smoked salt was a superb and tasty touch. The Crust was thin without being too crackery, and it was actually a bit soft to my liking. The sauce was just a little sweet and light... And it still tasted great the next day! Huge props to this place, I'll definitely be going back. The decor was cute, not overdone. Good vibes all around.
Best Margherita pizza, freshest intense smooth sauce (not acidy), grilled crust.
I love this place, it's simple and great. It feels a bit like a German beer garden with the benches and lights they use.

Being new to the neighborhood, I came here on a friend's recommendation and was very very pleasantly surprised! I have lived in San Francisco for 4 years and this is some of the most delicious pizza I have had here! Fun environment and very yummy food!
the only nice thing I can say is 'This is not the worst pizza I've had.'
Good pizza. A little too thin at the center of the pie, but VERY tasty. Great service. If you are two people dining, get two pizzas if you're hungry. Thanks for a pleasant experience Pizza Hacker.

While our pizza was good I thought it paled in comparison to other SF top pizzas. A friend and I shared a Top Shelf Margherita. The crust was on par (slightly crunchy and salty but not too chewy or wet like a Neopolitan) but I was not impressed with all that cheese overpowering the tomatoes. And secondly, our pizza looked nothing like the other photos and I was disappointed. So I'd like to give them the benefit of the doubt and say perhaps it was an off night.
Oh my, I think I'm obsessed with this place. Simple menu, but everything I've ordered has been completely delicious.

Excellent thin crust pizza. Some great options for toppings and crispy crust. My husband thought they were a little stingy with the toppings but they probably can't add too much to a thin crust pizza. They only have one salad option so if you don't like an Intermezzo salad, you might be disappointed. Would be great to have another salad option. Pizza is the focus of this place so they deserve a good rating for that.

Came here for something new on a Sunday night. The pizza was better than I thought. Nice crust, different flavors from a traditional pizza but the customer service was pretty crappy. The owner took our plates and asked how the food was. I told him it was pretty tasty, and gave me one of those "you don't know shit" kind of looks. Maybe I'm not hipster nor trendy enough,  but I know when people are singling me out because I don't look like everyone else...anywhoo, food is okay. Customer service is selective.
Don't get me wrong. The pizza is great! However, the customer service is not.

If you can't tell by my photo, I'm Vietnamese. And I think this is the best Vietnamese restaurant in the city. The ingredients are always fresh and high-quality. The food tastes amazing, which is why there's a long wait for a table 7 days a week. It's worth the wait though!

I've been here twice within the last month, the first time being better than the second. They do somethings well, but I think I prefer Thanh Tam II (right down the street) if you're looking at just getting pho.

My husband and I came here on a Sunday night around 7:30 pm right before the rush of people hit, perfect timing. We decided to sit at the bar which was a great choice. The guy working the bar was super nice and inviting. We asked him for a suggestion and he said to keep it simple and go with the Pho Bo, and so I did. Our food took a while to get cooked, as it was pretty busy so the bartender/waiter came over and apologized for the long wait and gave us each a free sake shot because we had been waiting for a while. We didn't mind the wait as we weren't in a hurry so his kindness was very much appreciated.
I came here on a Sunday night at 6:30pm and the place was pumping but was able to get a table for 2 soon after arriving.
My review is based on the disorganized reservation system/ discourtesy of folks answering the phone:

I was traveling in Vietnam over the summer, and I would say that this is the most honest interpretation of vietnamese food I've had in the states. Most people think Pho when they go with vietnamese, but the real authenticity is in the Lemongrass Chicken. It has a good balance between the lemongrass and chili. Usually they add a hint of honey to sweeten the dish, which gives it a great overall flavor.
Really really tasty.
Young coconut, please. I order it every time. So. Damn. Good.
Attention Management: LOVE your food. HATE HATE HATE your service.

This place is in my hood but we just happened upon it for the first time during Sunday's Valencia Streets.  Where have we been?  We dug into the Chicken Pho and Spring Rolls and had them bring a plate of other additions to add to the soup.  It was delicious.  So good we are heading there for lunch again today.  ENJOY!  Next time I will try to remember to take some photos before it all disappears!

I remember when this place had its soft opening. Took several months to really start spinning it's wheels, but most new places have that ramp up period here in SF right? Getting right to the standards with ordering the chicken pho noodle soup with the signature ginger/chicken broth is pretty stellar indeed. Side of spring rolls of course with the pork and shrimp inside just has to be present as well.

This Vietnamese restaurant is great! The best thing about it in my opinion are the number of delicious, satisfying vegetarian options on the menu.  The tofu pho is by far and away the most richly flavorful broth I have found.  The bowl is loaded full of bright vegetables, the noodles are done perfectly and it is a really balanced and delicious meal. The vegetarian hue rolls are also not to be missed.  Anytime I am out of town for a while, as soon as I come back to town I need my Mau fix!!  They also have delicious cocktails that pair really well with the food.  Its got a great, casual ambiance.  The only reason I don't give this place all 5 stars is because the service can be very slow.  It would be great if they were open on Sundays! Great restaurant!!!!

I got a Chicken Pho this past Sunday while trying with my friend whom has been there several times. Chicken Pho was hella good the only reason gave 4 stars is they only provide Siracha in a tiny container, wish they would just give you the actual bottle so can I unload on my Pho with some deliciousness. Otherwise this place is awesome and the wait staff are super friendly.
Stumbled upon this place with my friend after we discovered a ramen shop down the road did not serve ramen during lunch hours (... D': ) and i'm glad we came here instead.

Mau is modern and slightly overpriced, but serves up some close-to-authetic Vietnamese food. It's definitely Westernized (I mean, we're on Valencia, so...), but the herbs and meat are fresh and the portion sizes are giant. The interior incorporates a lot of natural wood elements and is very clean and spacious.
Tofu pho is delicious!
We came here for the first Time, it was very busy but the food came very fast!

This is a great casual place if you want to have a decent meal with no frills or if you need a great Vietnamese soup. Lots of stores and distraction in the neighborhood while you wait for a table (there will be a wait at the peak of dinner time).

A solid Vietnamese choice. Portions are large, food tasted very fresh, and service was good. I like the spicy sauces they had on the side...very unique tasting and flavorful. Another great thing about this place is that unlike most Vietnamese places, they actually have a good beer selection. Prices are very reasonable too. Will come back and would recommend.

My girlfriend and I met up with one of my very good friends from high school the other night. None of us have been in the Bay Area for very long, so we really didn't know how the waits were going to be in the Mission area. For those of you not from around here, if you don't have a reservation, expect about an hour wait on the weekends around dinner time.
If you're in for mediocre service, a bleh ambiance, and unauthentic Vietnamese food, go here!!!
Mmmm... the pho... sooooo good.
Good bartender very nice and attentive.

I really wanted to like this place, but from the moment we stepped in the packed restaurant, I was already dissatisfied. The host ignored me and my family for several minutes (which is quite a feat with a toddler and 5-year old) while we waited patiently next to the "Please wait to be seated" sign. We were finally acknowledged, then sat down at our table, where we waited about 15 minutes for our order to be taken, despite my numerous attempt to catch the eye of our server. We at last ordered, and received our spring roll appetizer. It tasted fine, about what you would expect from any hole-in-the-wall place, and when we got 2/3 done, I noticed a hair. I tried to brush it off, thinking it might have been one of my eyelashes, but no, it was very long and completely woven into the noodles of the roll. I sent back the remains after telling them what had happened, and they didn't seem too concerned about it. Then, my husband and girls received their lunches, and mine was nowhere in sight. I waited for 10 minutes, nothing. I finally flagged down the server to ask about it, and he seemed confused, and says he'd inquire in the kitchen. Five minutes later, still nothing. Finally, I gave up, and asked for the check. My meal wasn't on the receipt, so I just decided to cut my losses and leave without my meal.

My boyfriend and I are always saying, how can we live in San Francisco, one of the most dynamic, delicious food capitals of the world, and never be able to think of anywhere good to eat? Turns out that everywhere "good" is crazy expensive or out of the way. Except Mau, which has turned into our go-to going out spot in the city.
Food was good and tasty. I'm not Vietnamese but I think this is more Americanized. The portions are also really small. I'm 5'2 and 120 pounds and wasn't full. So average sized people, beware lol.

If you want Vietnamese food, go elsewhere. The pho is almost as bad as the seating which is so close together to other parties. I recommend avoiding the gentrified Valencia street altogether. Unless, of course, you ride a Google bus and don't know you suck.

Almost as good as home at my parents place. Awesome pho bo soup, filling of the summer spring rolls has too much vermicelli and too less meat if you ask me. In overal, good stuff & super friendly staff.

Mau really delivered on its pho!  I ordered the Pho Ga and was very happy with the dish..chicken+ginger broth and lots of yummy chilly sauce to go around.  The restaurant itself is up scale and modern, unlike many good hole-in-the-wall pho places that you might expect.  Even the prices/service were totally on par, try this place next time you're in Mission!
sibling of Tin restaurant. Same great food and prices, even better neighborhood. Try the hue rolls!

Amazing food and great for celiacs! I called ahead to make sure they had gluten free itemsI ordered the chicken pho and asked for garlic broth instead of ginger. It was so delicious! I also had the spring rolls and they were incredibly fresh and high quality. I asked for fish sauce to use for dipping and it was the best fish sauce I have ever had!

I got a pho ga. The broth was not flavorful enough. And with pho flavor is everything. So no I am not impressed. The ambiance is hipsterish. Play crap music in the background that has nothing to do with vietnam or its food. I can't say much for the other food cause I did not try it. But you gotta get the pho right man.

I came here while apartment hunting and was slightly skeptic since the place looked too upscale to have good food. However I ordered the Bun Nit Thuong and the lemongrass pork was excellent! Lots of meat and super tasty!

I had on good authority that the BBH here was among the best, and sadly I cannot agree. The broth didn't really taste particularly apart from pho with some chili in it and the cuts of meat lacked the variety a good bowl of BBH should have. I wouldn't say it was objectively bad, but I was hoping for some SJ quality stuff and this was not that.

I'm a big fan of Vietnamese. But a little skeptical about Vietnamese on Valencia. Just because I am not drawn to the hipster environment. Overpriced and don't really care for the people. I was wrong! The food was not bad and it was quite tasty. However, we got our appetizer when our meal came. That sucked a little cause we were hungry. But, I would come back here.
Hands down best Pho in SF! Order the amazing chicken wings they will not disappoint.
I like that they have a veg option for pho. I love that it tastes really good.
Quick service, good and flavorful food. Nice and attentive waiter. Interesting people watching. Fair price. In short: good stuff!

There are a bunch of things about this place I love. The hue rolls are absolutely fantastic here. They are topped with a sort of roasted onion which gives the dish a nice crunchiness. Frankly, all the dishes are great and it's fairly traditional, so it's really perfect food wise. But one reason I like it is because most traditional Vietnamese places usually has a tv in the corner with the owners kids studying next to it. This place, however, has more ambiance. It's casual, bright, nicely lit and more hopping than any other Vietnamese restaurant I've been to.

It's funny how there aren't that many upscale/trendy Vietnamese places. Not funny ha-ha but funny like Michele Bachmann explaining how gays are fully responsible for pedophilia while she maintains her seat in Congress. Except that's more scary-funny. Mau isn't scary-funny, but it is funny that Charles Phan has pretty much sewed up this market with Slanted Door and Out the Door. There was Zadin in the Castro - but that closed, and Sunflower in Potrero Hill except they're about as edgy as Aunt Martha's Old-Fashioned Salad Dressing. Mau definitely fills a void, and while I was ready to drink the haterade when I first saw this hipster-centric Viet spot on Valencia, I don't. The food's good, and the service is friendly if a bit harried. And why not since the prices ain't that bad.

This place is perfect if you enjoy being treated like dirt.  We went in for dinner and spent 10 mins at the door without being helped.  I finally had to get the bartenders attention just to put our name on the waitlist.  Upon doing so, the hostess reacted like it was the most troubling task she'd done in her whole life!! Really girl?! Get over yourself! Get over this place!  It sucks!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Friday night. We Were greeted by a friendly hostess and we agreed to sit on the "heated" patio. Only half the tables on the patio actually get heat from the heaters which are attached to the wall. We moved ourselves to a table closer to the heater.

Went with family and friend this afternoon, we were seated rather quickly, got some drinks, then it took about 15-20 min until we could order mains. Service was not very attentive, mostly a "what would you like to order" type of dialogue. Asked the waitress to take a photo of us and she told us she's busy at the moment, she'll be right back. Guess if she ever showed up at the table. She was nowhere to be seen and we had to ask one of the floor managers to give us our tab and run our card. This is the second time I had eaten here and had a bad service experience. There's a difference between being high maintenance and just asking for basic courteous service. The waitress probably finished her shift and just left without telling us who we could ask for help if we need something.

I'm updating my review since I've posted before my wedding. The food was delivered and was exceptional is was soo yummy! It was my wedding day and they sent the entire wrong pan of food a substituted with veggies instead of my ribs, no big deal I mean there was plenty of food and everyone was very pleased with the quality of the food and our delivery guy helping set up. After the wedding it was easy to price adjust and the catering dept. was on top of their stuff! Thanks all

I was around the mission yesterday and was trying to find a New Mexican place to eat at. So I yelped to see what was around and TACOLICIOUS popped up. I saw the reviews and decided to give it a try. I already knew this place was not going to be authentic buttt I heard good things about it so decided to go with that. I first walked in and you can see that there was no seating and there would be a bit of a wait. So the lady in front took my name down and said it would be at least a 15-20 min wait for 2. Ok that didn't sound too bad so we waited. literately as we walked in there was a massive of people who came storming in right after us. It was crazy because all of a sudden it got super busy. Anyway we were still waiting and I got a little impatient as I saw the group of 18 get seated. how the hell did they get seated and we got here way before they did. But oh well. Still waiting. so I had my girlfriend go ask how long the wait was going to be for a seat. She said another 15-20 min. Girrrrl you said that the first time. So we have been waiting for at least 30-40 min now. That's why I am giving this place 4 stars for the wait. I understand this place is popular and they have so many people to cater to but if there is a list that you put me on GO BY THAT LIST. Mind you this was at night time around 7-8pm. anyway we finally got seated outside. The waiter brought some chips and salsa out. OMG that salsa and chips was on point. The salsa tasted so fresh and so good. you can tell it was house made. Not spicy at all but had a hint of right zest. I love cilantro and you can taste the extractions of cilantros in the salsa. Mmmm we ordered the beef short rib taco and traditional carnitas tacos. 4 for $16. A little pricey but worth every taste for what it was. So much flavor in the meat. I liked the fact that when the tacos were brought out there was 3 types of salsas that came with it as well. Mild guac, medium, and habanero. I love choices and condiments. That's a plus everytime I have choices. We also had the queso cheese dip. that was also very delicious. Very creamy and thick full of peppers and veggies mixed in. Could not finish it since there was only two and it came in a bowl. We also ordered a pitcher of SANGRIA. $30 for a pitcher which will be 4 cups in total. one cup of sangria is about 9.50. So your at least getting one sangria free by ordering the pitcher that is if you will drink two cups each. At first I wasn't so sure how to feel about the sangria. I thought it was ok at first but the more I drank it I actually realllllly liked it. No that's not the alcohol just kicking it. It was actually this taste I didn't realize it had until a few sips later. it has a tad bit pico de gallo chili mixed in with a tiny hint of sweet but of course the wine was still there to overpower. Chili and sweet is something I am all for. Finished both glasses. I can't forget about our waitress. I loved her customer service. She was very attentive and came around when she needed to. I can tell by her body language that she was trying to check up on us but not interrupt our conversation we were having. I liked that because that shows she was being courteous as well in a shuttle way. anyway, I liked her patience in packing the left overs we had. I not only asked her once but twice to do it since we weren't done with our queso. but she seemed gladly to do it and came back with extra chips. I feel like that's how customer service should be. I had a good experience and I would reccomend this place to anyone only if you have time to wait a little.

Tacolicious is phenomenal. I'm from Santa Ana, ca so I know my tacos and tacolicious takes it to the next level. I recommend the beer and shot braised chicken taco with the Baja- style pacific cod second. Getting the margarita de la casa is not optional! The mucho gusto margarita is also sinfully delicious with pineapple and coconut water. Definitely a must- hit spot in the mission.

The vibe was awesome,  service was on point,  and food / drinks were incredibly tasty.  But the prices were so ridiculous. They're is no reason 4 grown ass men need to spend $120 on tiny margaritas and 3 skimpy tacos each. They were incredible but this is straight robbery. They're just fu*kin tacos

Tacolicious is the bomb diggity. I was impressed from the start because the waitresses knew so much about each item, and the chips and salsa served from the beginning were incredibly tasty! I ordered the empanadas with my friend to start and we could not have made a better decision. They are packed with so much flavor and the tacos themselves are the REAL deal. I'm still remembering the delights of their goodness 6 hours later. Highly recommend the carnitas and the shrimp tacos! You will not be disappointed! If I were vegetarian I would eat meat again for these tacos. Service was impeccable and beer was flowing! I am for sure coming back. Love love.

The best thing about going to a concert at The Chapel on a Tuesday night is that when you leave the show drunk and starving, you realize that it is Taco Tuesday and Tacolicious is not a far walk away.
Great.
Tacos were okay. There are much better, much more authentic street tacos within a block. 3 stars because the staff was friendly and the place was clean/comfortable.
I really like authentic Mexican tacos. So prior to coming here with a couple buddies for dinner, I didn't know what to expect.

Hey  everybody got to try this place on Sunday and the margaritas were perfect.  Good tequila and the juice was not to sweet, freshly squeezed.  The chips and salsa were yummy. I have to say the tacos just so good, heaping portion of meat. I will come back again soon with my friend Melanie. We so enjoyed the evening together for dinner  and drinks

So on my trip in San fran, me and some friends stumbled in this place after a terrible experience across the street. We were traumatized but still hungry so we came in here because it was the closest to where we already were. To my surprise, we were seated right away on a Saturday night and it was busy. The atmosphere was nice and warm. Very Upstate New York woody look. My friends had tacos and I got a taste of a couple, they were very good. I would recommend any and you should not be disappointed. The service wasn't the best, after our waitress took our order, she did not come back to the table till we asked for the check, other people brought our drinks, food, condiments, ect. So that wasn't so great, but over all, it was a good experience.
A true taco establishment must be judged by the quality of its fish taco, which is the food of the chosen ones.
5 stars for Jacob!!

Creative tacos - happy to see options for vegetarians! We were fortunate to be seated with zero wait during the world series. Fun atmosphere (maybe amplified by the game being on the big screens?). Good food, good service. The fried plantains were definitely a fave.
I've always wanted to try this but never in the area. Finally got to try this place when my cousins from socal came to visit sf and wanted to try this place too.
Great place for a Bloody Mary on a Sunday afternoon.....
NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY (or friendly at all).
American-washed hipster tacos.  A bit on the blander side.  I prefer the authentic Mexican hole in the walls in the Mission.

Had one night in town and am very glad we spent party of it here with Jacob behind the bar. The BEST skinny margarita I've has in a long time, and a delicious prickly pear shot from our skilled barkeep. Chorizo taco for the win. Great atmosphere on a Friday night.

My order is pretty vanilla when I come to Tacolicious, but I always leave satisfied.  I straight up go for one of their house margaritas and braised beef/carnitas tacos.  Both meets are tender, the salsas are delicious, and the atmosphere is great.
Crowded, busy, noisy, "ok" food with a lot of hipster window dressing.
Rating 2: The dry, not yummy tacos overrides anything.

Rented out the back room for a team development event for our company. Overall was a good experience. The food was a little slow to come out and some people had to leave before they could even eat! Food was yummy and served family style which was fine, except our vegetarian friends could not eat anything since the meat tacos were overflowing to the veggie ones. Probably my bad and would ask those to be separated next time. We ended up having way too much food left over since so many people left early, but they provided to-go boxes for us which was nice.
Basically, this is a Marina transplant in the mission offering upscale, overpriced tequilas, great refreshing agua frescos, and decent, fresh "Mexican" food.
When we first arrived, we were not immediately helped nor greeted although workers walked right passed us, standing in the oddly confusing front door area.
It's a nice little joint. Very cool hole in the wall style Mexican cafe, with a separate bar on the other side.

As a taco enthusiast, I was super excited to try this place, but ... was a little disappointed.  First of all, due to the music being played too loud so that everyone had to yell their conversations, the restaurant was almost unbearably loud inside!  My friend and I wanted to sit outside to avoid the noise, but when I asked about a table outside, the hostess shortly told me "All the tables outside are taken, if there were any empty ones I would have asked you if you wanted to sit out there."  Apart from the noise and the less than friendly hostess, the food was just not worth the price.  The best part of the meal was the yummy rice and beans, but for a place that's famous for tacos, that may not be a good thing.  I got the "shot and a beer braised chicken" taco, and the chorizo and potato taco.  The chorizo taco was ok, but the chicken taco was not so good ... I took one bite and handed it over to my friend.  For dessert, we got a "chocolicious taco" which is basically one of those ChocoTaco ice cream treats that you can buy at 7-11 for $1, only this one was $7.  We also got a couple of cocktails, the Mucho Gusto was pretty good, and the Berry Good was ok.

Once upon a time, we enjoyed dining at The Big Taco. Granted, reservations are hard to get, but we never minded waiting for a table. But now, entry to this exclusive party with a VIP list seems to require a secret password. The ever evasive and rude, yet smiling, hostess gives you the sense that you are not truly welcome.

I can finally cross this place off my SF list after living here for 4+ years. The tacos are definitely delicious -- I had the braised short rib (yum) and the fried calamari taco of the week (double yum). Service was great, too. Also: one of the rare Mission/SF patio spaces -- great for those warm Mission days

Guacamole literally tasted like mashed up avocado. We got a pitcher of sangria which was mostly just orange juice with some random sour apple slices in it. The bartender was so busy hitting on the drunk chicks sitting next to us (taking shots with them in clear hopes to get it in) that he forgot to charge us for our $10 mashed up avocado. Yeah, go elsewhere.

Came here once on a Saturday afternoon during my first visit to San Francisco and it was packed! I knew there was going to be a wait but I got a little irritated that we saw people who got there after us get seated before we did. After confronting the waitress about it, we finally got a table in this kinda noisy restaurant. Being Mexican, I am a huge fan of authentic tacos.
