While these tacos were okay, I wouldn't call them authentic. I was hungry, so they did the job. My favorite part about this place was the drinks. Their margaritas were really good and I enjoyed them more than the food. After a few, they also helped mellow me out about the service and having to wait about an hour to be seated. All in all, it was a decent experience. I would go back for drinks and a couple tacos if I were in the area with some time to kill, but I think I'll stick to the taco trucks I already know to fulfill my AUTHENTIC taco cravings.

I have been dying to try this place for the longest time! To be honest, I have only had tacos ONCE in my life, right?! Where have I been.. and it was a fish taco. Since my boyfriend was in town, I asked him what he wanted to have for dinner before we went out to see some friends at the lounge later on a Friday night. My boyfriend is always pretty open minded when it comes to trying new things. So, we went. Parking was not the easiest to find. The location of the restaurant was somewhat hidden and we walked back a fourth from the block until we really figured it out. haha. But, we asked the lady in the front how long the wait would be and she said 30-35 minutes. Which did not make me that happy because I am impatient when i'm hungry =/  But, we stood inside since it was relatively cold. With only about 10 minutes of a wait, the waitress seated us! I was so happy. We sat down and they brought us what looked and tasted like homemade chips and salsa. IT WAS SO GOOD. The salsa had a spicy kick to it. As we were deciding on what to order, I immediately knew I wanted the made to order guacamole because I love guac, I could literally eat it on everything if I had it with me 24/7. We ordered a total of six tacos. 3 short ribs, 1 chicken, 1 cod, and 1 traditional carnita.

Although a fun, cute place to go out for drinks and dinner, the tacos were not impressive. My boyfriend and I came on Friday night and the wait was about 45 minutes. The chips taste really fresh and the salsa was deliciously tangy. We ordered five different kinds of tacos, not really certain of the names. They were all extremely meaty, as in the amount of meat per taco would've been plenty for another. I guess that's a part of the price justification. The only me memorable taco was the short rib. All the others tasted really dry. I would probably only be back to try other appetizers. Overall, nice little place.

I've been to this place a couple of times and the food has been delicious. Their taco selection is creative and the margaritas are fantastic. The venue is hip, clean and well designed. Love how the kitchen is open to the entire seating space.

I must say that I was disappointed by the fish tacos.  While waiting for over 30 minutes for a table I saw so many of them go by, looking delicious that I had to order one.  What a flavor-less let down.

I'm a huge T-Lish fan, unfortunately the closest one to me is the Palo Alto location which I've reviewed before (and wasn't the best of reviews). After visiting each location several times I'd rank the Mission location second, the Marina location #1 and the PA location last. The marina location is tiny but the service is GREAT. The Mission location is fairly spacious and has a good sized patio for outdoor eat BUT... the wait is usually pretty long and the service hasn't been amazing each time I've been. The PA location is VERY spacious with no wait most of the time BUT... the service is bad enough for me to avoid the place all together.

Phenomenal every time. A+ on the tacos and the best guac as well. The margaritas are perfect. Sometimes there's a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. Usually you can find a spot at the bar to grab something. A must hit spot if you are in the mission district. T lish in the mish NOM

Nebulous potato thing! It was pretty dang good, but next time I go I am definitely going to get the half order instead of the full. Service was great. The atmosphere is really laid back so don't be expected a fancy breakfast place or anything. My friends and I came in with a pretty big party around 10:30 AM I believe and we got seated pretty fast. It's great that they have two spaces to accommodate more guests. I would definitely come back here when in the area.

I am from New Jersey and this place makes me feel like I am back in my favorite diner. It is a small place- be prepared to wait. But I assure you, the wait is worth it. Great place for breakfast, with many choices to please pretty much what ever type of eater you are. The vibe is so hipster while being nostalgic. I love coming here when I visit my cousin. We go here for brunch and make sure to also stop by Dynamo Donuts as well, which a little bit up the street from here. All in all, a wonderful establishment to support: the combination of food and ambiance make for a memorable meal.
My own little slice of Portland, OR, right here in the Mission. If you're looking for your hipster fix of brunch hashes, benedicts, and wraps, this is your place!

A decent breakfast option in the area, though many of the options are fairly heavy. The portions are huge! Had an experience where I ordered The Veggie Thing and the waitress immediately assumed I wanted the large. Regretted it as I could not finish it. The small is much more reasonable. There are waits during peak hours. The service is alright, I feel like they need more waiters. Often times they have open seating outdoors that is open for a good 15 minutes before people actually get seated.

Came here on a Saturday morning and waited around 20 mins to be seated for a hungry group of 5... and boy was it worth it. I ordered a veggie omelet for myself and also tried a few bites of the nebulous potato thing and my goodness! Everything about this place was great. Fluffy eggs, fresh veggies...their avocado melted in my mouth. Breakfast potatoes were flavored perfectly with a hint of onions. So glad we tried this place, it was simply amazing. Even my picky 4 year-old loved it. Service was great too. Friendly staff & the food came out fairly quickly once we ordered. A must try!
Update: gets better and better! I've introduced so many of my friends to this place, great hang out after the movies.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places. I go for the tofu scramble with spinach, mushroom and peanut sauce - plus some added jalapeños for added zing. I order fruit instead of potatoes and dry whole wheat toast. Delicious - a yummy big breakfast. And pretty healthy. I highly recommend this place for a good vegan breakfast.
Great food, friendly service in an old-fashioned soda fountain. I enjoyed biscuits and gravy, hash browns and eggs with a side of bacon.

So good and cheap! If you want high quality, all American food then definitely come here. I'm a vegetarian, and I've been extremely satisfied with their options. The long lines during weekend brunch should be enough to convince you this place is worth trying. Just expect a 20 minute wait. ;)

When I walked into this place I didn't know what to expect with the soda fountain and all the ice cream drinks but this is hands-down the best breakfast I've had in San Francisco. Tofu scramble onions jalapeno tomato, and the best fried potatoes I've had in my life. End of story.  The crust on these potatoes was half an inch tick and is possibly most delicious thing I've ever tasted.  |drops mic|

Finally got a chance to eat at this place. There always seem to be a line on the weekends, so weekdays may be your best best. We were seated promptly. The breakfast hash and nebulous potato thing is very filling, The decor is a throwback to the old world soda fountain shops. I have not had a chance to try the desserts yet.

I live a block from here and we eat here 3-4 times a month.  The food is consistently good and affordable and normally I love everything about the experience but lately the service seems like it's going downhill.  We had lunch here last weekend and had the worst server ever.  It took at least 10 minutes for him to even acknowledge we were even there, took our orders and then never returned to our table again.  Not once.  The busboy(?) delivered our food and filled our water once but otherwise we sat there the whole time without water or soda refills.  In the meantime, he was chatting with his friends at the table next to ours.  We then sat there for another 10 minutes after we were done eating before I flagged down the busboy to get our bill.  5 minutes later I had to ask the busboy again for our bill before we finally got it.  With a long background in the service industry, I never, ever tip less than 15% but the dude got a whopping $0.80 tip and that's only because I didn't have exact change.  Get it together St. Francis Fountain!!!!!
I love the feeling you get when you first walk in here. Its gives off a 50 era feel. Which I loved! The food wasn't bad either, it was delicious actually!

Poor service and whiny waiters. Major slackers. Never eat here. The owner should fire those waiters because he/she is loosing money because of really bad waiters. Keep the cooks, they were trying to work.

St. Francis Fountain is one of the best brunch places in the City! It has all types of food that would make any meat-lover, vegetarian or vegan extremely happy. We didn't eat any breakfast foods - but opted for sandwiches instead. I got the Devil's burger and my husband got the polar melt. Both were delicious! For sides - I got the Mac N' Cheese and he got vegetarian chili fries! The food was top notch, and there was so much, we did not get close to finishing off the sides. (Fair to note - we even got small milkshakes.)
Why I Heart Burning Man:

I came here with my mother while she was visiting me from Washington DC.  I was hoping to give her a great showing of the food offerings of San Francisco.  We came to this diner hoping for some killer country biscuits & gravy and buttermilk pancakes.  The pancakes were pretty good, as was the coffee.  The potatoes that came with the country breakfast were *fantastic*!!  But the biscuits and gravy were awful.

During my last visit to San Francisco I ate here TWICE.  Why you ask?  Because the Vegan Thing was SO GOOD.   It took a while for me to go here because I heard that the lines were usually stupid long, but both visits proved different.  We were seated almost immediately by opting to sit at the counter.  I ordered a side of vegan sausage and the chef masterfully mixed the spuds and sausage together, it was so very tasty, tasty, tasty.  I'm so happy I have another place to go to that is vegan friendly.

This is one of my go-to places for taking out-of-town guests for breakfast, as it is a historical site, unique, and not as crazy crowded as the trendier spots in my neighborhood.  I even took my father there.  He was the only guy in the place who could remember going to original soda fountains and he loved it.  Extra star for the servers being very nice to us.  The food was fresh and satisfying.  Be aware that the food and prices are not historically acurate, but the menu has lots of options.  There should be something to please everyone.  The music was upbeat reggae,  not too loud or frenetic.
This is a fun place to go, especially when it isn't crowded, for ice cream. The food's good as well.
Had a great 1950's feel inside. The food was fresh and delicious especially the spud's. It's a great start to the day to come here for breakfast.

It's a long walk from the 24th street BART station but it's well worth it for these yummy breakfasts. Get there early to avoid the lines (there's a bench outside if you don't) and indulge in hefty portions for bargain prices. My fave? The scramble with green onions, cheddar and bacon. Comes with spuds and toast and you're done til dinner.

An interesting retro place. Coming in for a burger and a chocolate shake.  You might take a walk around the neighborhood and see what else is here.  There is a great Mexican bakery across the street.  I can imagine this place gets crowded on a Friday night.
St. Francis Fountain is a classic, old-fashioned diner. The ambience was great - very low key with big booths and lots of space to sit at the counter. The servers were all very friendly and relaxed.

We were told this is a SFO institution that we absolutely should visit, and my family agrees! Two thumbs up. My daughter really enjoyed the vegan pancakes, and my son had the French toast.  I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.  We topped it off with gelato for the kids. If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.

I ordered the infamous Nebulous Potato Thing of course. And it was definitely something I would order. Potatoes with guac, pico de gallo, and sour cream? Perfect in my mouth- seriously. And I'm really glad that they offered it in a smaller order because it was just right. The boyfriend ordered an omelet and his order was huge. Also ordered the egg soda thing. It was okay, like carbonated hot cocoa powder.
I've been frequenting St Francis' on and off for almost twenty years.
Recommended item: Chef's Mess and a root beer float for dessert.
This place is equally cute and delicious. My friends and I came in for a quick breakfast and were blown away. Simple and great food. Everything it should be. The service was equally just as awesome!

The feel of the place is cool, they have super old school candy for sale, mostly just to have.. not to eat, it's that old school. The customer service that night was not too great though. The servers were very inattentive, but friendly at the same time.

The best breakfast that we have ever had!!i got the nebulous potatoes and they were super tasty. He had the country breakfast which he really enjoyed. The atmosphere was very hipster and cute old school dinner. The service was prompt and very friendly.

There is never a time when I don't love St. Francis soda fountain. Whether you're having a me day and want to leisurely eat a rather large breakfast while getting caught up on that magazine collection or taking your little kids for an early dinner because you're tired of cooking/cleaning up. Whenever they ask you what kind of bread - always answer cornbread. Always get the homefry potatoes - the best.

I really enjoyed my meal today. I had their delicious orange juice and the fried egg sandwich with avocado and tomato. It was so yummy. The bread was toasted and buttered, the cheese was sharp and my eggs were cooked perfectly. I was really happy. Service is still friendly. Wait for the food is still a bit slow and flies are everywhere. Place looks a little dirty. That's why the three stars stay.
A good place to stop while in San Francisco. Food is great and inexpensive and the Mexican bakery next door is a great place to go while waiting for your food.
Perfect Sunday hangover diner cure for carnivores with veggie/vegan friends!
Items Selected:

I ordered a milkshake and it took 15 minutes to get it even though it was pretty empty and 4 in the afternoon. The milkshake was small and expensive but tasty enough. Also they do not let people use their wifi and the benches are really short and weird to sit on.

If you are hungover and you go here, the probability is very high you will feel better.  They advertise that they offer hearty breakfasts and by hearty, they mean greasy.  But it's a delicious kind of greasy.
Do you know what an egg cream is? I didn't either until I shared one with my mom at St. Francis (it's basically chocolate soda, which is delicious).
I had the Nebulous Potato Thing. It was very good with a blend of cold and hot, with the salsa and chives counteracting the sour crème and yellow cheese.
Food was descent, service was terrible.
When my friends wanted to go here after our flag football game, I was skeptical.... Bar/Brunch in the Mission at noon on a Sunday... I was expecting to be waiting in line or the place over crowded.
Dr. Teeth can go all Electric Mayhem in my belly any day of the week! I'm not exactly sure what that means, but my point is that I absolutely love Dr. Teeth.

Came here after work with some coworkers on a Wednesday and this place was packed. It took us forever to find a table, but we eventually did outside in the patio. We got every flavor of the wings except the spiciest one, Mac and cheese, and tator tots. Everything was good, but the tator tots definitely hit the spot. I'm not sure how the crowd is usually, but I wouldn't recommend coming here when there's a game (the giants were playing when we went). Be prepared to push and shove as there's barely any room to stand in the line with the servers and customers constantly walking around you. Also have someone from your group stand in line to order everything while the others hunt for seats.

Went here to watch a niners gm! The Sunday brunch menu and the bottomless mimosas served n a small plastic cup stole the show. Overall the food is good the atmosphere is good. The TVs in the back r clutch too!
25 CENTS WINGS ON WEDNESDAY. Just go, bro.
Very considerate staff. It was busy when I went and they missed an order but gave us a round on the house. Food is also incredible. If you don't get the tatchos, you're missing out.
Decent And your typical Mission Dive Bar. Somewhat of a mixed crowd. Outside patio is great, staff and service okay. TV screens perfect to watch local sporting events.
Yes Yes Yes for Wings Wednesday!

Great drinks, awesome "drunk" food. Bottomless brunch mimosas, decent bartenders. Try to hit this place up on an off night you'll have more fun. The bros tend to invade it around 3pm on weekends. Lots of tech but the drinks are decent enough to sufficiently ignore them. Also you gotta try their tater tot bar and wings. Don't be an ass and the bartenders will treat you well!
Yelp'ed a couple of places to watch a Niners game, and Dr. Teeth popped up.  We came here for brunch.  Overall impressions:

Burgers were delicious and tots were awesome! The service was alright and it took while to get our food. I would come here if you're down to hang out for a while. However, once the outdoor patio closes, things get pretty tight inside. Then it's time to move on to the next bar.

Went here on game day.... I wasn't impressed The doorman is rude and overzealous (I'm in my 40ies with the salt and pepper thing) he was hyper vigilant on id; fine but do you have to be such an A%% in the process?

Tuesday Trivia was pretty fun (especially after winning a bottle of booze on the final round).  Wouldn't mind another night of Whiskey breeze, Parmesan meatball sliders, and yummy sweet potato tots. yum yum
I DIDN'T COME ON WING WEDNESDAY. but let me write a review on my visit on saturday!
For some reason every time I come here I find myself consumed by the fact that they have good taste in music.
Tots tots tots! OMG best Sunday breakfast and drinks ever!!

The two times I've been here now have both been on game day Sundays, but for some reason it doesn't get close to packed here at all as other bars/gastropubs would in the city while the 49ers play. I'm convinced now after scoping the crowd both times that it's because most of the people here are SF implants which is more frequent in the Mission nowadays...or just aren't die hard 9er fans, which are both fine. But for those looking for that type of environment with people decked out in Niners gear, high fiving each other after each play, this is not where it's at.

A cool place with weird stuff on the wall. They have a full bar, food and beers on tap. If you're looking for a hipster bar,  a dive bar, a sports bar, or just a good shuffleboard table,  this place fits the bill. A fun place for anyone!
I ordered a white russian and got a shaken up foamy glass of milk with an almost imperceptible amount of kahlua in it.  I'm not sure if there was any vodka.
---Mayhem Indeed---
I love Dr. Teeth!
Good ambience and strong drinks but don't be surprised when you get the bill. We were lured in by the novelty of Dr Teeth but long wait times and over priced cocktails took from the experience.
Heard about this 25 cent wings Wednesday. Was pretty skeptical about it, but was I proven wrong. The wings aren't dinky as you think. They're pretty voluptuous! Check out my pics :)

Tots, tots, tots. Dr Teeth is a local favorite, and one that I've been meaning to check out for a while. The interior looks like a dive bar with a few tables in addition to a bar area with TVs. I came around dinner time on a Sunday, and the place was pretty empty. The ID checker and waitress were very patient and kind! They card at all hours of the day, even if you are not drinking.
Totchos with Ohio State football proudly playing on the big screen on Saturdays mornings. I couldn't be happier. Oh and that back patio? I dig. Especially on sunny days.
I found the food to be really average. My sandwich wasn't anything special and tasted a bit bland. I got a buffalo chicken sandwich.

Tried out this place tonight with my boyfriend and I must say I'm pretty impressed. The place was slowly getting busy and the waitress told us we could sit whenever we would like. The tables are pretty big and the seats are very comfortable. The place is a good open space with a back patio.
Big O Wings for 25 cents on Wednesdays (with the purchase of two drinks)!
orgasm for 25 cents, those wings are a gift from god or a curse. 25 cent wings + those  cucumber drinks its dangerous... but worth it

This place is a lot of fun! The decor and the heap of board games makes you know that you're going to have a great drink/meal, along with the fact it's very loud. Try to get a close together table or one in the back by the TVs if you want a serious conversation, or are very determined in Trivial Pursuit games?

I love Dr. Teeths! Totchos are so damn good you can keep stuffing them down even after you're full. The PBJ bacon burger is like no other and if you love PBJs you shouldn't miss out. The mac n cheese with crab is the best mac I've had!

Fun and funky inside. Loud, but that is the nature. Some good beers. We ordered the hummus, which was under-salted and watery with a very bland pesto. The red bell pepper served as one of the accompaniments had seen better days, and it took 20 minutes to be served humus!
25 cent wings on Wednesdays.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Dr. Teeth!! The Raspberry Fix is one of the best drinks I've had in my entire life and the Moscow Mules are awesome too. Truffle oil fans will rejoice at their mac n cheese and and tots! Their burgers are out of this world. Staff is super fun, professional and friendly! I can't recommend Dr. Teeth highly enough!!

This place has an awesome happy hour. 25 cent wings! I liked the original and sweet chili the best. The buffalo and bbq wings were good, but too saucy so they were a bit overwhelming. The truffle tator tots were good too, but I was too full to try anything else. I'd like to try their totchos and other bar food in the future.

First time attending this bar for 25 cent wing wednesday. The wings were not to shabby! The place was definitely packed and we were lucky to snatch a table (beginners luck?). Imagine eating all those wings and drinking beer and cocktails without a table? doesn't sound like fun. Drinks are a bit pricy but the atmosphere is nice and alive. The night ended with a bar fight, good time to leave the scene!

Good place for $5 watered down well drinks. $3 bottle or can beers from 3-7pm. Monday Burger and a drink for $10 and the burgers are good. Tuesday is taco Tuesday $2 and Wednesday is wing Wednesday for $0.25. I forget what Thursday is.
You disappoint me Dr. Teeth.
Love the patio in the back!
Awesome vegetarian options - I love their mushroom quesadillas and their mushroom tortas - made with portabello mushrooms.
Best Tortas in the Bay Area had carne Asada and carnitas it's in the mission you know it's good. Next time I'm trying the cubano torta, highly recommend.

As much as you try to explain flavor, smell and texture, you simply cannot experience the Foorgasm that the best Torta Ahogada in the country can give you, even though it's a small place their menu is very extensive and simply delicious, from a natural smoothie to a freshly squeezed juice, Agua fresca or antojitos you just have to try it all because everything is great but after enjoying their torta Ahogada I can honestly  say I left my heart and my tastebuds in San Francisco.

Amazing Tortas! I love grabbing food from here and then heading to a park for a picnic.  The best I've tasted in the Mission. The tortas (around $8-9 each) and the agua frescas are both delightful. Recommend eating pretty quickly after you buy otherwise the bread will get pretty soggy.
Delicious tortas and agua frescas. Very reasonably priced and the service is friendly and quick. A nice little gem in the neighborhood.

A torta is pretty much like a Mexican sandwich. I thought this place was so interesting because it made healthy smoothies and I have never seen a Mexican joint do that. Even though I didnt get a smoothie, I got a torta for $8 and these puppies are huge so I split with a friend. We shared the combo with carne asada and carnitas without mayo, sour cream, or butter. It had lettuce, tomatoes, guac and some cheese. Because we opted out of those unhealthy creamy things, our sandwich was quite dry. The bread tasted buttery enough though. The carne asada was super tough since it was just a huge slab of like beef jerkey and not the tender little pieces you would have in a taco. The carnitas were ok and better than the carne. If I were to get it again, I would still split since they are huge and get the egg and chorizo torta. That thing looked bombbbbb. Side note. Check in and get 10% off of your drink.
Good but not spectacular tortas. The bread was too soft and airy. I prefer tortas with dense, crispy bread and a substantial bite.

Ordered an enchilada Verde that turned out to be full of delicious vegetables and did not leave me feeling like an overgreased pig. They certainly did not skimp and I had enough for two people on my drive down to socal. I also liked how they let me use a normal tortilla instead of a green one, very nice people.
Yum. Yum. really Yum!

This place is awesome!!!! The people here are so nice as well, great for lunch! I had a split chicken/fish sandwich and it was so flavourful, I will for sure come back again. Lots, lots lots of flavour and the sandwich is really big, you might not be able to finish it.

As soon as I got home from Tortas Los Picudos today, I hopped right on the computer to write a review--because San Francisco deserves to know where they can find the best service & food that will make you feel great!
Great food... Really good service....
There are four ways for a meat-serving place to accommodate vegans.
I ordered a torta de carnitas intending to eat half there and save the rest for later. Unfortunately, the other half never made it out of the establishment because it was so freakin' delicious.
Love their tacos, fresh juices and aguas frescas, and their tortas! Every time I work at General Hospital it is always a short walk to some amazing juices like the vampiro (greens with beets).

Best. Torta. Ever. I had never actually had a torta, until my boy friend took me here, but it's amazing. My favorite is chicken, be sure to get queso fresca on it and grab extra green sauce! And napkins! These things are messy. The sandwich is big, I can usually only eat half. G always gets vampire juice which is a made to order juice with a whole bunch of veggis, it tastes a little earthy to me, but its worth a try. This is a tiny little shop with a few tables. I've never had a problem with finding parking, but bring quarters!
After a night of debaucherous drinking and galavanting about town, my roommate surprised everyone in the house with God's Hispanic gift to humankind: La Torta.

This review is looong over due. I have been coming here since high school. I have lived in the city my whole life and no one has ever beaten Los picudos for tortas. They are the absolute best around!! Ugh my mouth is watering just thinking about it. Yum yum yum
Good lunchtime spot!!
Thee sopes, the burritos, and the tortas are THE BOMB!! MMMMMMMM the fresh orange juice the best!! Cant wait to try more
Súper tasty tortas and sopes and any kind of licuados from this places.
I did not like this place too much - the torta I had was only so-so, honestly. I might have to come back later and try something else.
My favorite torta place in SF. Not as big as That's It but they taste better. I wish they had better hours, like late night hours. Highly recommend this place!

This place is the bomb. Really nice people working here, lots of options, and they serve not only tortas but a variety of juices and smoothies. It's a hole in the wall and seems authentic to me, since everyone in line was Hispanic or local.
When it comes to maneuvering around San Francisco and you're a total newbie, at least I can say food is not hard to find. However..............

$7.76+tax for the best Cubano (four kinds of meat!) I've had.  Crispy and crunchy and all kinds of delicious.  That's the only torta I've had here yet but why mess with a good thing?  Took half to go today - it's big!

The torta or sandwich are delitious my fever is breded beff with fresh cheese huumm and a vapire juice the best just like in mexico city the enchiladas are great also the bionico fruit with granola and yogurt exellent .
It was okay, nothing amazing that stands out. But this was pretty good for its price.

Love this place. I've had a variety of the Tortas and they are all delicious.  Big sandwiches!  half of one can fill be up and I'm a big guy!  No matter which torat I choose - almost always include the smoked ham and queso fresco.
After going to Philz coffee, my friends wanted to get some fresh fruit from this place.

Amazing tortas!  I would recommend the Hawayana with Mexican cheese: perfectly balanced with plenty of cheese, fresh grilled pineapple, ham, veggies (lots of avocado), and sauces.  I'll certainly be coming back the next time I'm in the mission.
Had the portabello mushroom quesadillas with spinach. Holy cow, they are the bomb! Thank you for having a good veggie option around this neighborhood!
Best sandwiches I've had in years! We tried the chicken and fish tortas. Can't wait to get another.

I first visited Tortas Los Picudos on the Foodie Adventure tours and I couldn't wait to come back. The drowned pork shoulder sandwich is pure pleasure on a plate. The owner was telling us Chris from FoodieAdventure Tours loves that sandwich most of all, but he prefers the Enchiladas with green sauce--and I must agree. I couldn't believe I had two plates of totally unique and delicious food and I had to choose. IT's definitely like choosing between two different super model's to kiss your ear--can't go wrong. Our total bill was just over 20$ for two entrees (not including a free enchilada given to sample) and a pina colada fresh smoothie. I can't think of a place I'd rather eat in the whole world. Honest, friendly staff, amazing food, excellent prices. I thank them for working so hard to provide such great food! Whenever I am in the city I will have to stop in. It's a "cant' miss."
I came here today because I couldn't decide between getting a regular deli sandwich or getting Mexican food. Solution: get a torta.
I had the most wonderful of experiences at my recent, and first, visit to Tortas Los Picudos. Needless to say I'll be going back.

For real, I created a yelp account just so I could tell the world how straight up amazing this place is. My office just moved to the neighborhood and a few friends and I ventured out for some breakfast. Walked into this place and thus began the greatest customer service experience of my entire life.
My sister told me she was going to take me to have the best torta in the Mission. She was right. I had the carne asada torta with queso fresco. It was huge, but I think I ate it all. Is that bad?
My smoked ham and carnitas torta was the truth. Oh Tortas Los Picudos, how do you make your ham so damn smokey. Whatever it is, never stop.
I love these guys' tortas. You can order a vegetarian torta, although sometimes you get a funny look. Get the queso fresco and, I suggest, mushrooms.

Came here for a bahn mi sandwich since I was in the area. I ordered the #1 Vietnamese bahn mi. Although it is packed to the brim and looks very tasty, I thought overall it lacked real rich flavors. There were times where I was eating parts with only the pork and it was not very flavorful and a bit dry.

Enjoyed their chicken banh mi sandwich and it's very tasty!  I'm Vietnamese and very picky about Vietnamese food and their sandwiches are authentic. My buddy had their eggplant banh mi and he really like it.  Both had fresh pickled garnish and warm toasted crunchy baguette.

Have to give the a 3star now cause this place is a hit or miss and definitely miss this time!! The bread was not fresh at all and i ordered a bunch of them for the family and they were all like that. Thats not cool..... especially for that price.... not sure if im coming back
Cheap, delicious, friendly staff. The original Vietnam banh mi = tasty times.
Thank you Yelp!!~

Very good but just not as good as the Saigon Sandwich. That's a tough standard to meet, though. The #1 combo banh-mi was complex and more subtle than SS, which I could see some people liking better, but not me.

Quick blurbage about this place. Probably one of the biggest and most stuffed Vietnamese sandwiches I've ever had. Was only able to eat half before having to wrap up the other half and take it to go. Pretty tasty as well. Had a bunch of daikon and carrots which I'm always appreciative of. Kind of a random spot to have a Vietnamese sandwich business but it's still worth it if you're in the area. Probably would hit this place back up!

I probably go to Duc Loi at least once a week for their $5 banh mi sandwiches. My favorite is the #1 authentic (with the pate and head cheese), but the lemongrass BBQ pork sandwiches are also pretty good. Sometimes there's a line, but they make them pretty quickly. There are other places in SF that have cheaper banh mi sandwiches, but I'd say you get your money's worth.

Best five dollar bahn mi in town. get the number 1. Loaded with everything - pate, headcheese, pork belly, and BBQ pork. I gave half to a beggar and his dog. Half was satisfying. I loved the old Duc Loi Supermarket and am so happy that they reopened after a few years and better than ever.
Good value for $5.

I haven't visited all the other banh mi places in the city, but I'm pretty confident in saying this is probably the best.  Now you might wonder, like I did, how something housed in a supermarket could possibly be this good, and I'd have to answer, I dunno.  But it is and that's great, and maybe you learned a lesson about not judging things by their covers, you shallow dick.

This is the single best bahn mi in the United States of America. I hesitate to write this out of fear that increased knowledge of Duc Loi will somehow indirectly increase the prices or dull the quality- but this magical sandwich in all its goodness just cannot be contained.
Stopped by here and grabbed a BBQ pork sandwich and shrimp spring rolls before heading over to Dolores park on July 4th!
From a SF native, the sandwiches are the absolute best. Better than the ones in Chinatown, Irving or Clement Streets. IMHO, these are the best bahn mi (sandwich) at $5.

This place is amazing, and will stay that way until they jack the prices up on their sandwiches. Right now, the $5 Vietnamese sandwiches, are the best thing about the Mission. I get the chicken BBQ sandwich.  They are delicious, spicy, and big. The place also has other key items, like kimchi by the pound, seaweed salad, papaya salad... It's all delish. I love these guys and hope they don't raise the prices any time soon.
The supermarket portion of this place is one of the better ones in the neighborhood - friendly staff and easy sections (Latino grocery/Asian grocery, etc) to navigate.
Supermarket within 3-4 blocks of Dolores park. Get your sandwich, drank/drink/snacks here and then chill in the park. LOTS of variety, surprisingly lots of organic options in an Asian market.

This place is located inside a grocery store, its at the end of far wall next to the butcher counter.  You get that deli feel when ordering, but the ladies making the sandwiches are not really attentive to take your order.  Once they realize you are present, which is usually after they call out a finished sandwich, you place your order.
I hate doing this - I loved Duc Loi banh mi. But after a serious bout with food poisoning, I have to knock them with a bad rating.

The Mexican lady made my $5 bahm mi like a burrito stuffing it full of delicious goodness. I had the traditional Vietnamese and my bro had the pork one, both were filling and delicious. It's a great value.
I don't have anything new to add to these reviews, just wanted to help add two cents on what a great resource this little shop is.
This is the closest thing I've found to dirt cheap old-school Vietneighborhood bahn mi that doesn't require a trip to the tenderloin, and quite possibly the accompanying tetanus shot.

I can't begin to describe my joy over mission banh bi.  I grew up on this stuff (Lee's, K's sandwiches et al.) and so I am used to one sliver of pork and very little filling.  This place throws it down. Tons of meat, fresh pickled veggies, and something unctuous that only a mission district establishment can deliver... all for $5! You can't beat that, esp in the mission.  I have tried the #1 and the grilled pork. Both excellent.  The fried chicken is next up.

I got a classic sando here after seeing that the market had opened a sandwich shop on yelp.  The short and sweet... not super authentic so go elsewhere if you want that, but the portion is huge so try it if you're hungry and are seeking value.
Yes it's a grocery store--but the deli counter has amazing banh mi's.

This place is legit. Not much room to sit or anything but damn their pork sandwich is delish! Not too far from Dolores Park too and other fun stuff, so you can always snack on it there. They've got plenty of snacks to accompany the sandwiches as well. Would deff come back.

I stumbled upon this place in the Mission. This joint is located inside a supermarket and they have a single round table and a couple bar stools by the window. Best for a grab n go lunch. Looks like a Viet deli.
Came here for a shopping trip for other goodies and stopped to also get a banh mi sandwich.
Probably one of the worst Banh mi I've had since I started eating them 25 years ago. Was it a bad day? Bread not fresh on a Sunday? Oh well.

Not very good banh mi.  The carrots and daikon were OVERLY pickled so there was not a good balance between tart and sweet.  The meat didn't have enough flavor.  I think they smeared on a thin layer of pate onto the bread.  The bread was neither crispy or soft so that was fine; that's really personal preference.

Viet sandwiches are huge with large portions of meat :-) I wish they offered organic humanely raised free range lemon grass/fried chicken. I would put down a couple extra bucks to dine on happy chicken. The niman ranch beef sandwich is okay, but the chicken is to die for. This is my second favorite place to get Vietnamese sandwiches. Please add organic chicken to your menu and you will be my ultimate favorite!

Had my first Banh Mi from here on Sunday.  They use the same bread (Bakers of Paris) as Saigon Sandwiches, which I consider my reference standard for Vietnamese sandwiches in SF.  I had their Authentic Vietnamese Sandwich, with pate, cha and another coarse sausage with all the fixings.  It was huge and delicious! A bargain at $5. The ladies working behind the counter are great.  One is the owner of the supermarket.  I like how she really runs the market that meets the needs of demographics in the neighborhood.  My boys had the fried chicken version and loved it.  My friends enjoyed their Lemongrass Pork sammies.
I tried a bbq chicken sandwich. Oh man, it's so tasty and only $5!! It can get busy around lunch time but you can get fresh one! I absolutely recommend this place to my friends!

The Vietnamese deli is fantastic. Fresh, authentic, healthy and made with pride. I love the tofu bahn mi and pickled vegetables. This is a staple in a city of abundant great food. And the people are lovely and caring of customers.
huge bahn mi sandwiches for 5$ .. great fresh ingredients and the woman running the place is really funny(and nice)

Amazing flavor in the fried chicken banh mi. $5 and I was full after eating half of it.  In the back of a supermarket. Get it to go and grab a beer at the Sycamore a half block away ( and with an outdoor patio).
Best sandwich you can get in this city for five bucks.  Yes.  The effing best.

Such a good deal for amazing sandwiches. The vegetarian sandwich is loaded with flavorful tofu and a thick, juicy mushroom. The lemongrass chicken sandwich is also exceptional - really well prepared chicken stuffed into the sandwich with a bunch of other delicious things. The jalapenos keep you guessing- sometimes they're crazy spicy, sometimes just a little. And the best part is the sandwiches are $5. Why wouldn't you go get one right now?
Loved fried fish, lemon grass bbq pork sandwiches! They are only 7 and 5 dollars and are more than enough of portion to satisfy!
This fried chicken sandwich is the sh*t!

name: Mission Banh Mi / Duc Loi Kitchen

reviews.text: Rainy day brunch for 6 that I won't be forgetting soon. Heart the large black & white photos of classic Mexican entertainment stars(?) along the walls. Heart the loud serenading guitarists randomly walking in & out. Hearted my sabotender omelette + fresh 6-juice blend that matched the deep red tablecloth. No matter what you order, eat some of it on the handmade tortillas = must-try.

We came for lunch today & had some beers and a Pacifico michelada to start. Good start! The waitress also brought chips and salsa for us to munch on and the salsa was good, just a little spicy... So we ordered a side of guacamole for the table and mixing them was great.

Very clean, well lit place with beautiful framed movie stills from 1940s-50s Mexican cinema (the "golden age of Mexican cinema"). Food is honest no-frills Mexican at cheap prices. Wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.

As a Mexican living in San Francisco I am picky with Mexican food. This place is so delicious. Everything is really fresh, the people are so incredibly nice and the service is so kind. This place is exactly like their pozole: hearty, authentic, generous.

Most of the soups are good, but I tried the shrimp soup and it was disgusting.  The worst part was that the shrimps where not cleaned at all.  I had to devein the shrimps myself.  They where crunchy due to the fullness of their intestinal tract (disgusting) which is why I tasted a lot of dirt in my mouth. When I told the waitress she said that most places don't clean them.    I was very disappointed.
Love this Mexican restaurant in the city
Disappointed in the food and service.  Mainly food- ordered the chorizo and eggs dish.   I've also tried the camarones al mojo de Ajo.  Also not very good.  Sf has high standards on foods.
Gallardos is a really special place. The huevos rancheros totally blew me away. I had thought I knew what a good plate of huevos rancheros was before coming here, but I didn't. So good.
Mexican food heaven. This place was packed with a local old timer mission crowd. Fortunately the outdoor tables were wide open.

Gallardos is hands-down my favorite Mexican place in the city. It's off the beaten path, and the restaurant is generally populated with local Mexicans rather than the Valencia yuppies, which is always a good sign in my opinion. It's humble and unassuming, and the food is absolutely delicious. The salsa they serve before the meal is actually spicy and always tastes freshly-made. I have always ordered the enchiladas, which are some of the best I've had in California, but I have friends who have had the taco and quesadilla plates, and they were equally satisfied. The portions are huge and the entrees are cheap. Also, I recommend the guacamole to start - delicious! The food comes out very quickly, and the waitstaff aren't incredibly attentive but very friendly. This is a great place for people who want delicious, cheap Mexican food and want to support a local, family-owned business.

I love this place. The food is awesome and at a reasonable price. This is truly a family owned business. Super Clean and friendly. I read a previous comment how ever I have paid with my card many times at Gallardos. I do think there is a minimum amount.

I love this place. It's super close to my apartment. Prices are great. Everyone is always super nice. And the food is delicious and always fresh. I confess, I need to branch out with the menu. I've only had the tacos, enchiladas, stuffed relleno, rice and beans, etc. After reading other reviews, I realize that I need to try some new things the next time I go. Their freshly made tortillas are absolutely perfect, too. Between them and Poc Chuc, I really have no reason to eat anywhere else (but I will, because I live in food heaven).
Awesome food, fresh squeezed oj, lovely service. Everyone is always nice in here, food is great and prices aren't bad. It's hard to find a place near mission that is clean, yet here it is.
Absolutely wonderful breakfast. Love this restaurant. Clean. great staff. Wish it were in Wichita.
They were really accommodating to my weird dietary restrictions and made a deconstructed burrito, which was decent. Cute, clean place. Honest food.

This is not a fancy Mexican restaurant. Instead, this is the kind of place where you go to feel like family. Relaxed atmosphere, great food, and excellent (friendly) service makes this a great place to go if you want tasty food without any pretentious bells and whistles. My girlfriend and I loved the guac in particular!

I've been eating Mexican for a long time. Then I discovered this place and realized I'd been eating a cheap imitation all along. Silly, silly boy. This place is right out of a neighborhood in Old Mexico. No pretension or attitude. Just honest, hearty and authentic food. They've got you covered from breakfast to dinner.
The food was great, there was no long wait and people there were very friendly. I had one of the combinations and will probably not have to eat for three days.
Best service I have received at a restaurant. Huge portions and amazing food. I really liked their menudo and chilaquiles. Recommend this place to people. It's always packed each time I come here
I have been going to Gallardos for a few years now and always have a great meal there.

I love love this place so much. My favorite things are the the pozole and chicken enchiladas verdes. SO GOOD and very reasonably priced. I wouldn't come here to get tacos or burritos - go to a taqueria for that. The people are friendly and efficient. Yes, it's cash only but who cares. In fact, I'm glad it's cash only so whiny "i refuse to carry cash" people steer clear. Also, very good micheladas.

Just had the most pleasurable morning this past Saturday @ Gallardos. Friendly service and an ample plateful of shredded, crispy-edged birria with a tomato-chile home cooked broth for DIPPIN. The kind of food your grandma cooked. Great stuff.
Awesome food and great service...   The amount of food they give you is ridiculous, in a good way.  All their tortillas seemed homemade and the decor was really cool.
The food is amazing and unmatched by any Mexican food I have ever eaten. We come here pretty regularly and have never been disappointed.
hey yelpers...

Food was ok nothing to write home about the waiter got upset cause we asked for chips and cause he got my order wrong don't think I'll be back and make sure you bring cash the don't accept credit cards.

Saw this place while walking past, looked inside, it seemed inviting, clean, friendly, attractively decorated, friendly staff. An excellent range of Mexican entrees around $10 on the menu. The food was excellent, the service efficient, I'd certainly go back. Now I've seen the other yelp reviews and agree entirely with almost all.

Fantastic for morning breakfast with a large group - wonderful friendly service and generous portions. We have made it our regular monthly weekday breakfast place for our work group to rejuvenate and reconnect. Appreciated the bonus plantains as well!
If you want great mexican food, this is it. I mean real mexican food - when the place is packed with mexicans, you know its real and its excellent!

Friendly folks running this place, but with so much great Mexican food in the city, they need to up their game with their food quality.  My wife got the seafood enchiladas, and she was disappointed with the American cheese used on it.  I had a veggie burrito that was pretty dry and unspectacular.  They could get away with this quality if they were in a small town somewhere, but not in SF.
Thee best Mexican food in San Francisco! You guys need to try the machaca plate! It's soo good! The handmade tortillas are a huge plus and excellent service too! ;)

Favorite Mexican breakfast in the city! Do come early though, this place gets busy. I love anything they make with chorizo. The goat stew is also very, very good. I was eyeing someone else's and decided to get my own one morning. The man sitting next to me was kind enough to explain what the different bowls of condiments were and I had amazing feast. Portions there are huge. One reviewer mentioned their salsa - and yes, it is the best. I ate almost an entire jar of it one morning... Love to see cool, local, small businesses thrive!

Birria De Chivo - one of my favorite dishes to savor when I want to disappear with a book for a few hours. The relocation to 18th was worth the wait. Staff is even more cheerful & friendly in this sunny Mission location
Nothing great here.
The ladies that work here are so sweet. I didn't know it was cash only and they told

Our visit went from bad to worse. Although, it's crowded due to popularity, this restaurant hasn't figured out how to move customers and service along. We waited at least 30 minutes to be served, then only to find out they had completely forgotten my father's plate. When it was brought out, it was the wrong meal, which we returned. It finally came, so by that time we took it to go. Then, you'd think the wait staff would be courteous for the error - wrong. They got rude. The meal wasn't even comp'd - I am always glad to pay and I do consider myself an above average tipper, never looking for a hand-out, but this was the last straw. I am never going there again and I will not recommend Gallardo's to anyone. There are far better Mexican restaurants in SF to be had.

After walking by and spying the black and white photographs of Mexican cinema stars on the walls I thought I'd give this place a shot for brunch. The restaurant exudes a friendly and unpretentious ambiance, as most Mexican restaurants do, displaying an open prep area on the right hand side. Thought it strange that they sat the two of us at a table capable of sitting eight, all alone despite the line out the door--in fact, felt uncomfortable enough that when a party of five asked to move to a larger table near them I asked if we could relocate to their vacated table. This was an early indicator that the management suffers a few organizational obstacles in the running of their restaurant. The wait staff looked run off their feet, bringing me a Diet Coke instead of the coffee I ordered (huh?), and then taking a good while to remember the coffee.

Since Gallardos moved two blocks away, I have found myself here very often. Everything is as delicious as the first time. Thank God because good authentic Mexican food is hard to find in SF. Coming from SoCal I am used to a specific flavor, spice etc.

The pozole is still amazing! The huevos rancheros are bomb.  My husband and mom rave about the menudo and my son loved the shrimp omelette and devoured the bacon cheeseburger. The micheladas are a MUST have! This place is overall amazing and now at the new location it made it even better! A modern twist with all the same fabulous familiar pictures covering the walls. It definitely attracts all types of cultures now too. Not just Latinos. ONLY reason why its still at a four  is b/c of the wait to get your bill at the end. It still only accepts cash too. Kind of inconvenient but the food is way well worth it. Keep it up Gallardo's. We will be back again!!!
I love Mexican food, I'm so glad this place is pretty close to my home. Food was good and portion is huge!! Will I go back again? Yup!
I wanted to try after recommendation from Checks Please.  I think I will head to South Bay, then next time I crave for Cambodian food (see below).
Delicious pumpkin curry, soups and spinach leaf appetizer. Consistently wonderful.

I am a huge fan of Thai/Burmese/Vietnamese/south asian food, so I was excited to try Cambodian food for the first time.  I ordered the beef appetizer, the beef peanut curry, and the fried fish with three hot sauces.

I heard about this restaurant from 'check,please, Bay Area' and two visits to this place were no disappointment. I am not so sure how authentic Cambodian this food is but some of the dishes from Specials are utterly delishious and so worth coming back to. Pumkin curry and tofu is a must. All ingredients are fresh and you feel like you are putting something healthy and good for you into your body.
I visited this place twice, first time was about 2 years ago with a Cambodian friend and I went again tonight.
I had high expectation, because I really enjoyed Cambodian restaurants in the South Bay.

This is the second time I go to this place, and the reason was the food was good the first time around. But this time I found a nasty long hair on my pumpkin curry. I'm not into making scenes, so I quietly told the waitress, she apologized, took everything away and brought me a newly made (?) one.  (IDK...you always wonder in these situations). I forced myself into putting aside what happened and try to enjoy the food, which I did. (I'm not too picky,  as you can tell.  I have a friend that when a similar thing happened to her, she would not eat anything else, even if they offer new or different food, nor even for free.)

Stopped here for lunch, after it was recommended highly. I had never had Cambodian food, and must confess, I didn't even know where Cambodia was...Africa?? Wrong. I learned it was by Thailand and Vietnam.. Oops, Geography was never my thing.

The house we rented for a week in this neighborhood had a binder full of places to eat at, and this was right up front, with bold lettering stating that we "absolutely must eat here". My love of food runs deep, so that was enough to pique my interest and get me over here for lunch.
Had a quick lunch during work on Friday and the food was pretty good.
Good food nice people but hard to park ( depending on the time of day I guess)

Delicious food and polite, attentive, friendly service in a homey atmosphere. My go to dishes here are the Pineapple fried rice, Pumpkin curry, and Crispy Tofu with Basil appetizer. I've come here with groups ranging in size from 2 to 12 and they have easily accommodated us.
Delicious, unusual, reasonably priced food prepared with care. Very nice owner. It's been open almost 30 years!

Absolutely delicious ethnic Cambodian food and great service!! Highly recommend this place. I went with my buddies and we ordered Ahmok (fish mousse) and Prahok (ground pork with anchovies). Both the dishes were flavorful and the staff was polite to let us stay and chat even after their closing time.
Tasty food, quick service, calm atmosphere, very subdued. I had a sauteed beef and vegetable dish with a nice level of spice to it. I will definitely be back!

tucked along the side...a hidden gem in the rough... $7.95 two item menu...a bargain lunch...side of soup slightly sour, fishy and delicious....bbq chicken with sweet dip moist and tasty...red curry great...loving heart shaped rice mound...a big meal...ginger beef is flavorful and chili squid good...chili sauce is awesome and probably better on a different meat...a great meal averaging $10 person total...

This place is awesome. I have never tried Cambodian food and I had a couple of friends who were Cambodian and so wanted to try this place. The atmosphere was very chill and pretty much I have to say it can be a great place for a great relaxed date. Their Pineapple Fried Rice is a must I have to say. I am a rice lover but it had a unique taste and it was awesome. Definitely recommend and it's the only one in The City!
Nice intimate atmosphere with a few decorations and romantic lighting. They stopped delivering half a year ago; not sure why Yelp! still says they do.

The crispy crepe was tasty and delicious, but not very crispy. The pumpkin curry was pretty awesome and accompanies the rice very nicely. The service was also great, leading to a nice meal out. Yup, recommend I do.

This place is a true gem, absolutely amazing cuisine, gentile service and relaxed atmosphere. We keep coming back again and again for the amok fish. My girlfriend who has been to Cambodia says this is the real deal.

Took great delight in the appetizers, especially the spinach leaves appetizers; each one was an experience in new flavors. Fantastic, fast service; super friendly people, clean bathroom. A neighborhood gem; a bit run-down but once I was seated and served, what's most important shined:  Good food and friendliness!
This restaurant is serving Thai foods like chicken satay, red curry, pumpkin curry, yellow curry and even Hormok. They are all Thai dishes.

My friend and I met up for dinner at Angkor Borei since it wasn't too far from her workplace. We were greeted by a really nice lady, who may be the owner of the restaurant! Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs as we gazed through their menu!
All the reviews are true! This place is wonderful.
the place is tiny and the decor nothing special but the food is AMAZING and the service is friendly. Enjoy it every time I go!

This place is better than most of the Cambodian food that I've eaten in Cambodia.  The mock duck curry is my personal favorite dish, with exactly the right amount of fish sauce.  The larb and the ribs are also both excellent.

It was good.  I guess I'm a little biased being Cambodian.   I felt like the food wasn't really authentic.  I recommend the prahok and the pineapple fried rice.  The fried rice had curry in it which was really interesting.
This place is fantastic.

I remember coming here a long time ago and decided to come try it out again.  There's never any street parking in this area, you have to try to find parking in the neighborhoods behind the restaurant. The service was friendly but slow at times.  The servers were not Cambodian which I was a little disappointed about.  I wanted to be able to ask about dishes that I remember eating while growing up.  I was told that I can go to the kitchen and talk to the chef about the dish which I did. I went to the kitchen and asked the chef to make a beef sour soup dish for me. Yeah, I got my dish and it was pretty good.  Although it wasn't made the same way as in other Cambodian restaurants.  I ordered the crepe, prohak, beef sour soup (not on menu), catfish dish with vegetables, and fried banana with ice cream.  The crepe was very good.  I enjoyed all the other dishes but the prohak tasted different than what I am used to.  It was a bit sweet which I think caters more towards Thai people.  The beef sour soup had good flavors but the beef itself was a different texture.  Would recommend since this is probably the only Cambodian restaurant in SF.  But if you are in Oakland, there's a couple of them that you should try.
I'm a big fan of this joint!

I ate here about 3 weeks ago because I wanted to try a Cambodian restaurant. I think this is the only one in SF. There's about three in the East Bay. After watching PBS KQED's program and review on one of the Cambodian restaurants in Oakland, I wanted to try a Cambodian restaurant. And after an opinion by a family friend who visited Cambodia last year. She raved about the food.
delicious. authentic flavour.

All we tasted was the pumpkin curry special and a beef+peanut dish. Pumpkin curry was amazing, probably the best pumpkin curry I've ever had. The beef dish was good too, but didn't blow my mind. Overall the place is nice and the wait staff is friendly. Would definitely return.

It's worth taking the J to Bernal Heights. This was our first time trying Cambodian food and we really liked it. They had lunch specials for Saturday but didn't see any Cambodian items so ordered from the dinner menu.

Please note: This review has NOTHING to do with the FOOD - Had we been able to eat there, I am certain the food would have been exceptional: I had taken a look at the menu, and other Yelp reviews, before making the drive across town (I live in the Sunset). Everything seems positive.

3.5 stars.  I came here to try 7x7's fish dish (ahmok).  It's kind of like a giant fish ball steamed in banana leaves with spices.  This was delicious.  We also shared some lettuce cup appetizers and a chicken curry.  My only complaint is that this place is slightly overpriced for the portion size/ambiance/neighborhood.  Expect to pay 1.5x what you would at a standard Thai restaurant for similar food.

Like other reviews note, this too was my introduction to Cambodian cuisine. Overall, I found that it shares similar flavor profiles with other Southeast Asian cultures which I love so the food at Angkor Borei was no exception. I had the:
HOMEY FEEL. FAMILY RESTAURANT.
excellent local option, well executed dishes, competent, well run restaurant.

I went there on a Monday night. Found the ambiance very nice, and since it was a week night it was pretty quiet. The staff was cordial and efficient. We tried the hot and sour vegetable soup, spicy prawns, ginger chicken and the black rice with mango. Of the 4 dishes we tried, only 1 was great - the ginger chicken. Spicy prawns were under seasoned. Soup was just okay. Dessert nothing to write home about. Not a bad experience but average food.
When I drink, I end up eating at Taqueria Los Coyotes later that night. It's the one constant in life - like the sun rising in the east.
Really enjoyed the chicken tacos! Great sauces and flan. My friends love the California burrito. Will definitely return.

All I wanted were two tacos as a snack before a play. After waiting about 10mins, the people 20 numbers ahead of me complained that they'd been waiting 45min for their food (and had evidently gotten skipped). I cancelled my order and had to wait until after the play to get food. That made me very cranky. Tacos should not take so long!

Not much to say, the tacos are good, the prices are fair... there are tons of places like this in this area... One thing I really like here is their California burrito, - who knew that fries were the one th8ing that would make a burrito excellent?
Oh man, portions are huge. I knew I didn't need those guac fries, but last minute impulse buy got the better of me. So good. So fat. Ugh...
Pretty good.
So um, i havent been here in awhile but did the portions get alot smaller or did the price increase?

Wow this is gross! Why didn't I just go across the street to pancho villa where food is always good, my own mexican food tastes better.  The lady at the counter needs another job, anything not dealing with customer service. She appears to be on salsa bar patrol duty ready to snap at anybody getting and extra salsa. I'll take my business elsewhere

Delicious tacos! I ordered a super carne asada taco, loaded with rice, salad, salsa, and sour cream on top of the basic ingredients. It was so loaded that it became a taco bowl with a side of mini tortillas.
The girl at the register... Maria! Have a stank ass attitude! I'm like be chill. She is so mad for no reason. She needs to go. Maria bye.
A burrito with French fries and steak sounds like the most American thing since Freedom Fries, but only a taqueria can pull it off.
When you get off the 16th and Mission BART, you have arrived. As soon as you get to street level, you will see Taqueria Los Coyotes. Cross the street and go no further.

Very good. We got the super nachos and the carne Asada with pork for both. Huge portions...will be taking back for breakfast. Great green and red salsa. Very clean, in fact they were mopping the bathrooms at our 330 pm visit. We lived in El Paso so we can say this is very authentic. My husband said we tore our food up like wolverines.

I was concerned I wouldnt be able to find good Mexican food in SF. Being from LA where we have hundreds of great places to choose from...I was worried. My friend found Taqueria Los Coyotes on Yelp and we decided to check it out. Being new to SF (1 week) I wasn't familiar with the Mission. People kept saying, you can find good Mexican food in the Mission. Huh?!?  Why only in one area?!?  Oh well, I'll just accept it, this is my life for now.

This is my favorite Taqueria.  The rich salsa bar really sets it above any neighbors I've ever found.  It is my go-to Taqueria.  Best meal for under $5 I know of (love their Tostadas.)  In the day, can do some grocery shopping nearby too.

Looking for a California Burrito? This is what most people that come here order. My friends and I ordered the grilled chicken and beef super burritos. This place is spacious and love their salsas but beware, most of them are spicy!!! One salsa I never usually see at taqueria's is the mango salsa. It's sweet and spicy and goes so well with the burritos if you want to add a touch of sweetness. The chips are thin and salty. Take advantage of all the salsas and try them all!

Very disappointed, I don't think anyone likes getting their order wrong.  I order a vegetarian burrito with guacamole no lettuce instead I got no beans, no guacamole with lettuce and the place wasn't even busy.  Needless to say we will not be coming back.

I needed a quick filling dinner before a cheese and wine class at the Cheese School.  I spotted Taqueria Los Coyotes and noticed a couple red Yelp stickers on their entry doors, so ok, it is trusted by my Yelp comrades!
Decent food.  What I like? Clean and they take American Express.

Don't get me wrong, it was a solid burrito, but it did not meet up to my expectations. The sauce was really good and it very cheap, but overall, the burrito was not worth going to when there are so many options in the mission. Basically, I wouldn't waste my time going here. Find another place in the mission to get your Mexican food fix.
I pass by this place all the time and read some reviews about hunting down a "California Burrito".  A burrito with french fries in it?  Sign me up.
Excellent food. Staff is really nice. The ladies at the cashier are very polite and the men making your food are equally nice. Overall it's a great place on the 16th Street Corridor to enjoy a meal.
A pretty chill place :-)

Oh. My. Gosh. Never have I ever had a California burrito outside of San Diego that tasted so good! Well, there goes that! Los Coyotes knows how to make a great california burrito, not to mention some TASTY carne asada fries. Luckily for me, and everyone else reading this, you don't have to dream about what either of these SoCal specials taste like, because they've got em right here! I've had just about every CA burrito and carne asada fries that SD has, and Los Coyotes most definitely hits each of the flavor spots.

Well hello! This is THEE perfect spot to go to after bar hopping around Valencia. Okay I'm not even going to lie. I even come here after work. Is it worth getting on Bart twice and paying for two trips just to have some carne asada fries? I think so. They're not the typical carne asada fries that come with the fat thick cut fries. They're the thin ones that look like McDonald's. They load it up with carne asada, guac, pico de gallo, and sour cream. Extra sour cream on mine please!
I'm hard to impress when it comes to Mexican food. This place impresses. I ordered a salad and actually got something satisfying and healthy.
GET: California burrito, California fries & taco's especial, which are their meat & shrimp tacos. Delicious.

I felt that a Mission burrito was a must to knock off my list of things to do in San Francisco.  Los Coyotes caught my eye and went in to check it out.  First of all there is a giant menu board.  It is massive and if you're not familiar with the menu as I was it took a while to digest.  That being said they had some interesting options like a california burrito with fries stuffed inside.  I ended up getting a steak burrito with Guacafries® on the side.
I will go out of my way to get a California burrito from here. It's that good.
soooo good!
They are always so nice! The food is great, and the ingredients are fresh. They even have fresh squeezed vegetable juice. The California burrito is delicious.
This is my favorite taquiera in the mission. If you catch it at non rush hour times the food comes out pretty fast and there's usually seating.
I'm from San Diego, so it goes without saying that I have a taste for sudo-Americanized Mexican food. Not quite Chipotle, but definitely not authentic. This place definitely fit the bill.
First of all the service was pretty freaking good, considering it was during pride parade. It was slam packed but we still got our food in a timely manner.

After the Pride parade, my dh and I walked all the way over to Mission and 16th to have lunch at Los Coyotes, on the recommendation of our son who lives nearby. Before we found it though, we walked by some of the other restaurants within a block or two on Mission. While they all looked like the food was good, most of them had lousy or non-existent decor and there were an awful lot of sketchy looking people on the street, practically blocking the restaurant doorways, which really didn't encourage us to walk in (not their fault of course). Los Coyotes is a half block off of Mission, on 16th St. and the inside was much nicer than the other places, with tile mosaic tables and pretty spacious area. So we stayed and ate there. I had the Red Mole Chicken plate: whole beans, rice, a little melted cheese and a huge serving of tender white meat chicken with plenty of mole sauce and 4 homemade corn tortillas. I liked it but thought the mole sauce was kind of bland. In all fairness, I have nothing to compare it to because I've never had a red mole guiza before, but I thought it would have something more interesting about the flavor. I added squeezes of lime and a few drops of hot sauce, which helped. It was enough food for 2 meals easily, so I ended up taking a lot of it home. My dh's fish burrito was fine, and very filling. He couldn't finish it there, so took the rest home to finish later. It looks like most reviews are for burritos and tacos, but they have a really extensive menu with lots of choices. I'd go back again, but I might just have a simpler choice next time.
YOM. THE MANGO SALSA IS BOMB.
Yes!!!!
Can I just say that this is my favorite taqueria in the mission?

If you like Mexican food, This taqueria is one of these places you can get good food for cheap in the Mission District! It's not the only one but it's good. The Super Quesadilla should be enough to fuel you for the whole day ! THe guacamole is really GOOD !

Icame here because I seen a lot of yelpers come here. there was the steak and fries For 5 bucks but it turned out to be 9 dollars, steak and fries they were okay. I'll eat half my cousin who came from texas to visit he ate all his they had different Ones mild to spicy to fire hot sauce and I have variety of different kinds of what you want to eat I am I will be coming again it is in the heart of the mission so always go with somebody cuz it's not a really good neighborhood and it's kinda big spaces and the food is good.

My favorite place for cocktails. we usually arrive early when they open and have a couple of high end, delicious, perfectly crafted cocktails before a nice dinner at one of our other favorite spots in the Mission. The best Sazerac this side of the Mississippi!!!

Great little spot. All the bites we ordered got raves and the drinks were good. Love this little area of 20th Street and all the options available.  Be sure to check their namesake (the Trick Dog).  Cute.

Did not completely understand what kind of place it is. Drinks were really good, doorman and other staff was friendly and funny. Just nothing else to say about here, I felt like it was not my place, I felt  like an alien.  It might be because of the other people.

So I was on a recent trip to SF and Trick Dog was a definite must on my list. It was recently names one of the best bars in the world along with another SF bar. I had tried to go to the other bar on the list, Smugglers Cove, the night before and didn't even get in because of the pretentious and angry man working the door who had an attitude problem. I had almost lost hope that I would get to try one of SF's best bars but then I went to Trick Dog.
Not my kind of place....

Amazingly imaginative drink menu that changes every 6 months.  Great music. Very cool industrial kitschy decor.  Bartenders are bitchen!!  You HAVE to know where it is, since its not marked from outside, but when you find it, you will NOT be disappointed .
I've been meaning to update this. I love love love love their drinks! They come up with an entirely new themed cocktail list every 6 months, and they're always the most creative drinks I've ever had!

I'm from San Jose, so the concept of the SF bar/restaurant combo thing is new to me.  This place has a great vibe as soon as you walk in, it has separate seating upstairs which I loved because we came more for the food than for the bar.  The service was great, the food was tasty, and the crowd was lively. I had the trick dog and manimal fries.

Generously, the venue can accommodate mayyyyyybe 40 people. Last Friday night, they easily had 80 people crammed into that tiny box of a room. How people even hear each other is beyond me. I went to school in Austin, so I've been around 6th street and I know what crowded is, but this place seemed to be crowded for no reason. No where to sit, no place to lean, hardly any place to stand -- I don't get it.
Yep. Kale salad - amazing. Duck egg - good. Tasy Dog 'burger' - excellent. Waitress - fabulous. So happy!

This place is pretty cool! Each month they have a themed selection of cocktails. One month it was the zodiac, and another it was neighborhoods of SF. All very different, well thought, and delicious. I didn't think a place like this existed in the area! Great place to hang out!

Nice friendly environment, wasn't too crowded for a wed night but u would still have to speak loud to be heard. I ordered the Alcatraz drink and the duck egg. The drink was strong and the egg was good but nothing i was overly amazed at. Some drinks and dishes were out which was a - :( on their part bc there wasn't that many ppl upstair dining. In my opinion, nice place but wasn't as great as all the hype.

Amazing cocktail menu. Really cool spot in the heart of the mission. The whole neighboord has a cool edgy vibe. This place is awesome - two floors but still feels intimate and swanky. The menu is awesome, all based off of the San Fran. I would highly recommend to anybody who wants a "local experience".

The type of bar we only dream about in Boston. Was extremely well treated by the barkeeps as we walked in as obvious tourists of a certain age on a Thursday night -- recommended to go their by a local sommelier we knew -- promptly got the "tourist map" of cocktails -- not offensive but perfectly done and appreciated in the moment, kudos to the person who crafted that -- and got great recommendations. As I hinted, we were obviously outliers in a wicked local crowd, but all good and won't be outsiders next visit, trust me. Bartender even gave great recommendation on what whiskey bar we should hop to next, as one in our party (me) had a craving. Good, on ya, Trick Dog, a must stop for us next time -- and we'll definitely blend better and stay for more than one. A+++

I got here closer to 6pm, and it wasn't very crowded. But give it an hour, and this place gets packed. I got a seat at the bar where I was meeting a friend. Open up the menu to a map of the different areas in SF, and those are the drinks. I thought it was actually just a map at first glance. Their drinks are stiff, so be careful. They may taste like juice but they are strong.
Trick Dog is cool.

This is another Yelp! success. One of the fine community managers sent out the standard email with cool bars to try, one of the options being Trick Dog with its 4+ star rating, and I absentmindedly bookmarked it. Fast forward to a goofy weeknight in SF and we're looking for somewhere to have a late drink. I pulled out my phone and, viola, there was Trick Dog in my bookmarks. Done deal.

Trick Dog did the trick. Delicious cocktails! Especially the Dragon Gate. The Trick Dog burger was right on! The tomato salad was devine. The entire staff delivered. Cannot wait to return! Five friggin stars...

This place is solid.  I went after work for drinks and a snack while waiting for a table down the street at Flour + Water, and it was a great spot to hang out and have some really good drinks.  I had the Painted Ladies which was was pretty sweet, but not cloyingly so.  We also tried their Chickpea Falafel Sticks which were amaazing.  Very light and airy for something that's usually so heavy.  The place is also spacious, so it's a perfect place to hang out with a group of friends.  Highly recommend!

Delicious drinks and good music. The only downside is this is a very small space and if you are going with a group that more than 4 you might want to skip for another spot. But if you are willing to wait for drinks, which should be easy cause your with friends listen to awesome music, then it's worth it.
Great HH spot. Haven't been for dinner yet, but definite will be at some point.

Trick dog? More like bitch dog. Servers and hostess are extremely rude. Sucks for them cause we were six people planning on buying a LOT of food and drinks. They would not accommodate us and we had to basically light a flare gun to get service. Well, we went to Southern Pacific a few blocks away and got food and drinks all night. Like I said THEIR LOSS!
The bartenders can be uppity and annoying. Yes, they are good at mixing drinks. But he made some strong comments, and made us feel pretty crappy. So uncomfortable. Ugh.

1 can of apple cider + 1 bottled beer = 16$. It's pricey and its trendy - but well crafted drinks. It's hard to get a seat as well.  Young well dressed good looking crowd. Will I go back - yes because of their kale salad that I can't find anywhere and it's out of this world delicious ( even tho I m not a huge fan of kale)
My review is strictly based on their food menu because I don't drink.
Creative and delicious drinks, no real complaints there. Didn't try the I'm-sure-magical food program.
