This place, what can I say?, I'm here pretty regularly and there is a reason, atmosphere, friendly staff, nice little bar snack menu, and the drinks are very good.  I'd say that the staff is pretty outstanding not only are they pretty but they are also outstanding :)  I feel like the menu is pretty original and I even like the location, I like that it's tucked away. Over all such a chill cool place to hang out, check it out
I was digging the prohibition era set up and crafty drinks. I had one of their special boiler makers, which is a bottled beer and a shot of the suggested liquor.
Love this place! Phenomenal drinks, and great food to go along with them.
Such a neat joint! Great food, drinks, and service.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Drinks are always excellent with unique, one-of-a-kind mixes. Great vibe - off the beaten path, but always full of people. I was most impressed with their Kale Salad - it's to DIE FOR!!! - I enjoy it as a meal in itself, but if you wanna get it as an appetizer it's big enough to share! ; )

What is this? A super hip bar with stellar cocktail menu designed by the Bon Vivants that changes occasionally. Expect a long wait and loud crowds inside. The cocktails are unique and themed. The menu is usually a statement itself. Their current menu is the SF Tourist Map. My favorite of this is Sutro Baths, which incorporates Sightglass Coffee, located just next door. Lombard Street and Coit Tower were nice for the summer. Their dining menu is small, but you'd get to sit upstairs if so.

Best food I've ever had and I'm not exaggerating. I'm visiting from San Diego and have travelled all over and this is hands down the Best. Food. Ever. I was blessed to sample basically the entire menu and it was all Amazing. Reasonably priced, perfect portions. Great drinks too. The tomato salad was delicious and light, the Trick Dog was scrumptious and savory. And everything else was perfect too. The ceviche was light and flavorful too. Oh, and the Thrice Fries... Best fries ever.
**Drinks and bar review only

My boyfriend took me here on a random Friday night because he thought I would enjoy the Scotch Egg (I thought I would enjoy it too). We got here relatively early, around 6:30? The bar area was already extremely crowded, but the dining area is upstairs. It's pretty small though. Fits probably 20 people MAX. It's also really loud since its right above the bar, so really hard to talk to. Not really good for date night, unless you don't want to talk to your date. Anyway, we ordered the Trick Dog, Thrice cooked Fries Manimal Style, and the Scotch Egg. The Trick Dog was surprisingly very good and flavorful, so were the fries. Only thing that disappointed me was the Scotch Egg.. We also ordered drinks, but they were just okay. I didn't really like them.

Not just anywhere can I order a drink called the Castro Theatre nor the Dragon's Gate, all SF location-based titled cocktails. They actually had some tasty food items, too, including "manimal" fries and a sea bass crudo dish. Trick Dog even blends up their own unique version of a Fireball shot, should you choose to accept it.

My friend wanted to go to a chill bar with cocktails and good food. I found Trick Dog on Yelp, and it might be one of my new favorites. The atmosphere was perfect for us. The building is industrial, which is normal for the neighborhood, and I couldn't really see the sign if there was one but it appeared to be the only bar on that block.
Since I fell in love with the Aries cocktail on their Astrology menu, I've become a Trick Dog follower so now I'm here to report on their latest SF Landmark menu:

great venue and great idea which earns all three stars...brings in too much of the kitchy hipster crowd that just tries too too hard...painful to watch one geek after another try to out hip each other

When my friends and I hit up Trick Dog for dinner, we tried almost everything on the menu. I really liked everything, but there were a few real standouts. My hands down favorite thing was the Kale salad, and by the sheer volume of them flowing out of the kitchen, a lot of folks out there agree. Part of its' wonderfulness is its' simplicity. This one has  avocado, parmesan, pepitos, and a slow-cooked egg yolk dressing. Yum Their version of a Scotch egg was pretty fabulous too. It came with the requisite soft-boiled egg, but instead of the typical sausage wrapping, they chose to go with a brandade (an emulsion of salt cod and olive oil) wrapping. The fish tasted like fish sticks (in a good way) and made me think of breakfasts as a kid. If I HAD been at home, that would have mean it would be paired with a warm Winchell's jelly doughnut, but I was at Trick Dog, so I had to make due with purple potato salad and romesco sauce. My third favorite was the Fig Tartine. It had Kadota figs, housemade ricotta, and pinenut brittle (!!!) with a verjus and lime vinaigrette. It was delicate and super fresh. We didn't try the burger or fish tacos, both of which looked intriguing. I think they may be on the docket for a future visit.
I am glad I finally got to try Commonwealth because it's pretty good. The restaurant itself is tiny, very cozy and the staff are friendly.
Food poisoning!
Cozy, upscale atmosphere. Service was great.

Very disappointed in Commonwealth.  My friend and I did the tasking menu with wine pairing--at $115 per person.  The oyster  course was replaced with a muscle course, though very good, we were anticipating the oysters.  I have grown up eating abalone but I couldn't even find the abalone in the second course--it was all mushrooms, the asian pear salad with the highlight of the meal--excellent and interesting.  The lamb course was nothing but a small hunk of fat, I maybe had two bites of actual lamb.  The three bites of pumpkin that accompanied the the lamb was okay, but nothing to write home about.  when the server cleared my plate I graciously commented about the fatty lamb and said i was very surprised the kitchen would serve up such a poor and tiny piece of meat and she said she would let the kitchen know.  The celery sorbet was interesting, buy by no means should celery ever be the centerpiece of a dessert....ever!  The next dessert, was a chocolate ganache and pretzel meringue combination that was just okay and  completely uninspiring.  It felt like they were more interested in presentation and pushing the boundaries of culinary combinations--which I appreciate and respect--but they fell far short on most of the dishes.  The wine pairings were hit and miss with the standout being the last pairing, a sparkling red Brachetto.  At the end of the meal we each ordered a glass of the Branchetto and were served what looked like half a glass (same size at the tasting pour).  We had assumed it was a complementary pour, especially after the bad lamb, but sure enough we were charged $12/glass!  So, after spending over well over $300 for a dinner for two, with a $100 spent on wine alone, we left without even the slightest buzz, completely unsatisfied, still hungry and wondering what all the fuss is about.  Aside from the fact that noting was really done to compensate for the poor lamb, the servers were all quite friendly and engaging.  However, at those prices, there are dozens of other restaurants in the city where one can have a truly excellent and innovative meal and not feel they were ripped off.  Thankfully my dinner companion was excellent company, but I'd recommend you do yourself a favor and spend your pennies elsewhere.

Yes! I can finally un bookmark this fantastic place. I really can't describe how tasty and unique each dish was so you will just have to go check it out yourself. We booked in advance but we're able to walk in a bit earlier and sit at the bar.
My husband and I came here for dinner recently. We had the tasting menu and we are very glad we did. I love that the staff were so willing to customize the menu for us.
Way way overpriced!

The food here is anything but common, but being wealthy wouldn't hurt when dining here. Ok...well, it's actually not really that expensive in comparison to other restaurants serving similar quality food; it's quite fairly priced in my opinion.
Absolutely lovely meal start to finish!  Thank you Ian for such imagination and delight!  Can't wait to return.

Was there Thursday night. Had the tasting menu with pairings. Divine. Period. The service was warm (thanks ... Stephanie??) the wine with the dashi/mushroom/abalone course was especially spot on. World class food without any pretense and with plenty of fun and passion. We will be back

If you are looking for a tasting menu that rivals Quince and Gary Danko but want a more casual atmosphere, this is the place for you.  After 10 years in SF and countless restaurants, this meal lands in our top 10. Executive Chef, Jason Fox is nothing short of a food artist and I have to believe this caliber of talent isn't just something you learn in culinary school but are born with.
Visiting from Australia and was recommended by a friend and lived up to expectations. Great wine list, service and atmosphere. The hazelnut desert was  a tough pick as my best dish. Will be back.

Didn't feel tasting menu that night, so we order from a la carte items. I order 3 dishes , 1.clams, summer beans, shaved turnip, meyer lemon kosho, eucalyptus and hops broth  $14, I got bite a stone....so I called server, she bring the dish back to kitchen, didn't offer me the new one but asked me to see the menu to get another dish. it was my first dish, so I told her, it's fine. I still have two more dishes.

Honestly, I don't know how anyone could give Commonwealth a poor rating. The food is out of this world and the service was great. There wasn't a single dish that didn't cause a foodgasm (I even couldn't get enough of the mushrooms! I don't usually like mushrooms!). Overall, even the prices were incredibly decent (7 dishes and two glasses of wine for $120 - I've paid more for far less quality and ambiance). The restaurant itself is very cozy and comfortable with the perfect amount of music. My husband and I went for his birthday and were blown away - can't wait to come back!!!

Dessert saved this otherwise mediocre, 3 star dining experience.  To start, we may as well have been at a communal table, the tables were so close together.  It was relatively early and there were a number of open tables so why we all had to be crammed right next to each other I don't know -  so much for our romantic date.

Run and grab a burrito while you can and save $500 in the process. Our group left staving, unimpressed and over $500 lighter.  We literally walked down to for tacos scolding our friend who brought us to the CommonWealth. Top it off with pretentious waiter to boot.  Everyone unimpressed with what was served and the douche bag waiter we had.
It's not often I find a gem of a restaurant, but when I do, I must let people know.
Pretentious!!! I'm usually pretty open about food, I've tried all sorts of exotic foods and combinations in USA and my travels around the world.

Came here hoping for a great experience but it didn't really turn out that way because our waitress was very rude. The food was wonderful, despite the small portions. I would have given this place 4 star away for the poor service.

Every dish was a well orchestrated piece of various and sundry flavors, not all of which you'd expect on one place but all of which sang together. This place delivers a Danko-like level of food quality and creativity, in a more casual setting and at a lower price. Will be a go-to spot in the future when the inner foodie calls.
They serve creative dishes. It is a good restaurant to have a casual dinner with bosses.

To appreciate an expensive place like Commonwealth, you really have to be the kind of hyperpatient foodie who's ok with a smoothly paced multi course tasting menu where you're ok with turning your palate over to the chef gods instead of selecting a la carte off of a menu based on what you think you like.

4th time poppin in last night and it was delicious as usual. Ambient lighting but in a warm and I can still see kinda way. Did the tasting menu: smoked trout - scallop - uni n roe in a foam - stone fruit salad - celery sorbet - choco ganache dessert. Everything is always consistently good and at the same time surprising. The presentation is awesome bc it allows for each bite to be perfectly crafted and enjoyed. Also a great wine list. A must for a delicious and relaxed date night or quality atmosphere with a friend or 2. Love this place.

I had an absolutely amazing experience at Commonwealth. The food, the ambience and the services are top notch. The food also brings food lovers together and it adds to the specialness of the experience as we actually had great conversations with fellow diners around us. My friend and I had a hard time deciding whether to go with the tasting menu or ordering a la carte. Finally, the table next to us convinced us to get the tasting menu and that was a great decision. For the first course, we had caviar with greens. It was like a beautiful art piece and I almost didn't want to eat it. The taste was as great as the look - very delicate and subtle. The second course was fioe gras coated in honey oatmeal. The serving size was pretty generous and the taste was out of this world. The came the carrots and radish spring salad, which was another looking. The main dish was rabbit. Next was a sorbet. The grand finale was a peanut butter chocolate bar with popcorn cream. I am not a big fan of peanut butter, but I adore this dish. All 6 courses for only $65! When I was eating, the words I heard most were "Wow" "Yum" "On My God". This is the restaurant that I can't wait to go back to.

Tiny portions.  Uninspired flavors served up with zealous, pretentious flair.   Uncomfortably hot atmosphere in dining area.  Disrespectfully expensive dishes.  Like so many other reviewers, we needed to satiate our appetites with a follow up meal - pupusas around the corner.  This, after dropping over $200 for two on 5 "dishes", dessert and a cheap bottle of wine.  Service was average, but slow and awkwardly timed. Expected more from a restaurant with such an elevated status. Will never return.

Last night we finally went  CommonwealthSF.  We ordered ala carte and the only dish that was disappointing was the "sea urchin, trout roe, potato, little gem lettuce, sea bean, lime cream, pickled wasabi"

Commonwealth is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. I know that's a bold statement, but this place has been an absolute darling for the past two years! From the intimate vibe, to the constantly updated wine list, to the creative seasonal menus, you can tell that Jason Fox is tremendously thoughtful about his dishes and craft.

The food here is excellent. Every dish is distinct, unusual, and memorable.  All the plates are small and I recommend sharing a bunch of things. This isn't the type of place I'd go every weekend, because it is pricy and not super filling.  It is however a really cool and fun experience.

Went here for a fancy celebratory meal. And fancy it was. We had the taster menu with wine, and the food and booze were incredible. The sommelier was great without being pretentious. The service overall was perfectly timed. They lose a star for the MASSIVE desert that almost ruined everything. It should have been half the size and it kind of made me feel a bit sicky, so lose a star for that. Oh, and it'll cost ya a pretty penny but ho hum, they don't pretend to be cheap.
This place does not serve food. It delivers ART! Very innovative - the chef played with all the different layers in food so well. Highly recommend the experience!!

This place has been on my list to try for awhile. Glad I went, but probably wouldn't go back unless I had a HUGE lunch to prep for the portions. The service was great, the tasting menu is middle of the road on price when compared to other options in town and the food was super tasty, I just wish there was more of it. Salmon crudo, ONE scallop, a handful of stonefruit and sweetbreads as a meat course (seriously??) does not a dinner make. I literally grabbed a slice of pizza afterward.
Unfortunately, I wanted to like it but found it pretentious, overpriced, tiny portions...I left hungry. Got tacos at Cancun afterwards and felt much better after that.
One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. progressive, delicious, consistently inspiring. Pricey but worth it!

We arrived at 8:30 on a Saturday night with reservations for a party of 11 (down to 10 by the time we got there).  The front of the restaurant is very unassuming and easy to miss.  The entrance is located on the side of the building off a small parking lot.  The parking lot holds 8 cars and is $5.

Ive never been to a place where dishes were so hit or miss.  All dishes on the menu are the same size and are arranged from cold to hot (rather than appetizers to mains).  There were four of us and we each had a cold and a hot dish plus dessert.  We each felt our cold dishes, which were all some form of salad, were fantastic.  Truly well made, imaginative dishes; the favorite being the smoked mushrooms.  Had the meal ended there, I would give five stars.  Next came the hot dishes.  Two grilled pork and two hake.  The pork was a bit overcooked and generally bland.  The hake, which was a very small piece,  lacked flavor and mine included the spinal column which made it inedible.  You know there is a problem when you need a knife to cut a white fish.  The waiter saw that I did not eat it and offered a replacement, but I was completely disinterested.  We finished off by trying all four of the available desserts.  All four were very good with the hazelnut pot de creme being a standout as one of the better desserts any of us had tasted.
mussels: excellent; combination of flavors is surprising and fresh
Very nice place, good food, elegantly displayed.  Portions a bit small, but I would certainly return.

I don't even know how many times I've been to Commonwealth now. It is my absolute favorite restaurant in SF. It is my point of comparison for all others. I have yet to find one that even comes close...

Oh San Francisco, you are filled with overpriced restaurants. I felt so pretentious coming here with its dim lighting and hush hush atmosphere. It was a date, and he had a $50 off coupon. Don't think I would have ventured here on my own.
The pluses & minuses even out.
Have I not reviewed this place yet? It's gotten better and better. The kitchen is 100% gluten-free, so every fried item on the menu is safe for celiacs (a.k.a. "heaven").
Came here with a group after happy hour on a Friday night. It was crowded, yet with good reason.
The place caught my eye because of the DDD Guy Fieri thing on the window. My husband reluctantly agreed.
Where else can you get yuca fries, much less ones so perfectly fried (hot and soft on the inside and crispy on the outside)?

Not bad food but NOT what I would ever want someone to associate as typical Venezuelan food. The arepas didn't have enough salt and were limp, the plantains were great - sweet and cooked to a burnt crisp (I'm not joking - that is a great thing). Empanadas were ok but not what is typical. Would I eat here again? Yes but I wouldn't go out of my way - I hit up places that say Venezuelan food because I want a meal that reminds of meals with my family.

A nice place to hop in and stop for a quick bite. Every bite you eat will be packed with a trip to flavor land. If you're walking around Valencia and have the evil hunger flowing through you, just direct yourself here.
I really love arepas and this place absolutely delivered!
Had this place bookmarked from Guy Feiri and since all the Nicaraguan restaurants we tried were closed, why Not.

Very casual atmosphere and good food. The cachapas are like little burgers with arepas. You can choose the filling - meat, tofu, etc. This place is super veggie friendly. The yucca fries are to die for - get a full basket of them. Best part is good food for a good price!

Everytime I go here it's amazing. If every selection being delicious in its own right wasn't enough, the sides and sauces are out of this world as well. Get the yucca fries and dip them in every sauce possible, you won't regret it.

This review is a little late, but I was there 2 months ago, my wife had seen it on DDD and thought I'd love it...well I did! I was born and raised in Venezuela and this is as close as you can get to real Venezuelan food, the other good place I know of is in Vegas, so anyway I say as close as you can get to Real Venezuelan food because as someone who makes his own empanadas, arepas and cachapas at home you find yourself making due with items that will work close enough because you just cant get it in the US, you can't get Queso Guayanes or you gotta use crappy California Avocados in lieu of the tastier more flavorful South American Avocados,  that said  the food was great and it was a great experience that brought me close to a home I have not been to in over 20 years, the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the one other thing I REALLY wanted was the fried Yuca and they were out. I visit the city from time to time so I'll be back and try again. thanks for the good food, the friendly service and the fresh taste of home.
Wonderful to know everything is gluten free!  Had the grilled chicken arepa and plaintains. Yummy

Walked from the office all the way to the Mission and saw this place on the way. Hopped in to order an arepa and got my boyfriend one too. The arepa's are SO EXPENSIVE! It's like $10 for small one and a side of coleslaw-ish stuff. Definitely not worth it and I'm sure these are like $1 in Venezuela. Totally price gauging us! I was going to share mine with my bf until I realized how small it was so I had to go back up and order one for him. Definitely not worth $20 when we could've easily gone to any taqueria and gotten twice as much food for the price. It was fun to try one for the first time but never again.

First, don't order their special! They sold it hard to me, but the asado negro special was this cold overcooked beef thing that looked like last night's leftover with some even colder burned sauce. I've never had this at Venezuela but I surely hope the real asado negro isn't leftover overcooked beef with colder burned sauce.
Pica Pica CHU! Can't help but think of that little fur ball. But really though, these arepas are electrifying! They zing your tastebuds with a delicious array of flavors; definitely worth a visit.
Gluten free.Quick.Innovative.My fav Guy Fieri been here.We had corn veg maize and coconut lime.Great creamy spicy stuff.Loved their 3 sauces.
Awesome food

yesterday was my second visit to pica pica. I ordered the chicken arepa which was good. I saw that they had a giants world series themed arepa (orange arepa filled with cheese and beans), so I ordered it. it wasn't what I expected. they charged around $8 for the giants arepa which was somewhat pricy given that it is only filled with cheese and beans.
It's OK. Not jumping up and down awesome, but OK.

I really enjoy the food here. I would give it 5 stars if the staff was a little nicer to the customers. Sometimes the person taking your order won't even make eye contact with you. Still, the food is pretty tasty. Who knows, maybe you hate eye contact and would love to have your order taken here. Parking can be annoying though. Give it a try.
This review is also a few months behind, but the food is so memorable I must review.
Pica Pica was a major let-down for me. We tried the place after getting a Gilt City deal that provided us with a pitcher of Sangria and what seemed like half the menu. No complaints there.

Heard about this place from Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. Being an active viewer of Triple D and going to the places Guy goes to around California, I was expecting a lot from this restaurant. Especially since I've never tried this kind of cuisine before.

I was spoiled by having a fluffy chachapa in Florida that was amazing & still the best I've ever ate. At the Pica Pica Arepa Kitchen, the arepa was decent. The chachapa was a bit over cooked and pancake thin. The hot sauce in the tall bottle was the great. The fresh fruit drinks were ok. We ended up mixing 2 of the drinks to take away the bitterness and then it became a great drink.
Ok, the food at Pica Pica is ok. I usually order from here for my work, about 3 times a month. We spend about $200 per visit for the 10-15 of us.

The food was really good. I left feeling full but not gross, which is often custom after eating Mexican cuisine.  It was my first time eating Venezuelan food so i did have some questions.  The person who took my order was not super happy to answer my questions but all and all a good experience.  I will definitely go back.
{ FOOD :: 4/5 stars }
It didn't meet my expectations of a Venezuelan arepa. Too juicy to eat like a normal arepa.

This place is a great find! We specifically went here when we went into the city and are glad we did. We both got an arepa and split nachos. We were stuffed, but knowing everything was healthier than your average restaurant was great. And for being on the healthier side, EVERYTHING was delicious including all the sauces set on the table. We will be coming back!

Amazing. Sweet corn arepas are awesome. Perfectly arranged and delicious. Got plantains and was very pleased. Crispy not gooey. People at the local were also very relaxed and only increased the ambiance. Loved it and will done again!!

I was visiting SF and went there for lunch with a friend. Being a vegetarian, I had at least 4 different options to choose from and that is pretty decent considering it is a Venezuelan place. The food is made fresh, and the portion sizes are pretty good. I loved the vegetarian arepa and I got mine with yellow corn. This is my first time having arepas and I would definitely have them again if arepas i get back home will taste like this. Not too crowded and we were able to find a seat quiet easily. The place cleared out by 1.45 pm and was almost empty when we left.

I was in the area and I was hungry but I wasn't looking for an ordinary burrito - I wanted something different.  I was actually thinking about skipping the food altogether and hitting up CREAM but quickly decided against it for my body's sake.  I saw a pizza place but it was kinda crowded but then I stumbled upon this jewel!  OMG I had the Beef arupa with coconut lime juice for a beverage and my life has not been the same since!  The sweet plantains were everything and I just can't wait to go back!  Love it!

Hello hello, first of all I want to point out that I'm Venezuelan. On International Arepa Day I wanted to take my friends to experienced Venezuelan food and maybe more, hoping to be more than an event in that special day. When we got there they already ran out of Reina Pepeada which is emblematic. Looking to the menu I saw that almost everything was spicy, even considering that most of the people here in SF mostly like spicy food, it's not normal in Venezuela to eat spicy, we just have different sauces and you choose how spicy do you want it. The arepas were completely burned which make no sense because they just made arepas and a few other stuffs. I tried also the empanadas and surprisingly they were spicy as well. Sincerely as a "Venezuela place" is just awful because there was not even one dish exactly as is prepared in Venezuela and they are not hard to do at all. During this International Arepa Day I was hoping to hear at least Venezuelan music and not even that happened, they were playing just latin american music which is ok in a normal basis but not good at all in the day they have to promote Venezuela.
Wow this food is heavy. I had the sweet corn spicy chicken Arepa. One was more than enough.
Great find! The arepas were so delicious I didn't want to share! Great value for the serving sizes and quality. Friendly staff, local feel. Highly recommended

I had been to the Pica Pica location in Napa so I decided to give this one a try.  Overall, it was an ok experience.  I ordered the Crispy Chicken Platter and it was ok.  The Chicken has a nice crispiness and was rather moist but I thought that that the batter got a little burned.  It was a darker color than I expected and had a bitterness to it.  After dousing it with the sauce on the table, it was hardly noticeable...but not ideal.

I love, love, love Pica Pica's food, being gluten-intolerant and a lover of all Latin American cuisine. It was my first time trying Venezuelan food and I'm definitely hooked! Some friends and I tried this place on a whim after wandering around Valencia and looking for a place to have lunch. We had settled on another restaurant and while we were walking over, I brought up wanting to try Pica Pica. My sister made up a word for me and my habit of bringing up other places when we've already decided on a place to eat, so when I brought up Pica Pica she accused me of 'clamberponding' but when we reached our chosen destination, we found out they were closed.
Some how ended up at this local restaurant while visiting San Fran from LA.  I haven't stopped thinking about it sense.  I had a vegan arerapas.  So so so good.
Visited Pica Pica last week. I am Venezuelan and I want to be as fair as possible on my review.
The food here is DELICIOUS!  It brought me back to when I visited Turkey a couple of months back and boy was it reminiscent of the tasty Turkish food I had!  This is what I sampled:
THE WAIT: None on a Sunday night at 8pm for two.
this lovely restaurant reminded me of the truly awesome food while i lived in the middle east - such good memories!
Loved it!

This place is fantastic. I'm gluten-free and dairy-free and sensitive to a thousand other foods, and the staff at Tuba accommodated all my questions and served me one of the best meals I've had in the neighborhood!

Friendly staff, friendly servers and a great ambience. Pretty good food too. We had dietary restrictions on the table and one of the waitresses missed the fact that a particular dish was not dairy-free. But she was quick to fix it.

Tuba is NOT a vegetarian restaurant, and I do not understand why it is categorized as such on Yelp. The vast majority of the menu is heavy on the meat factor (I mean, it specializes in kebabs...). I came with a vegetarian friend and we were able to comfortably order non-meat items, but this is by no means a vegetarian specialty restaurant.

Had a great experience at Tuba! All the food had wonderful flavor, and the service was really good. The waiter had a really positive vibe and a big smile the whole time--he seemed happy to be there (it makes a difference). The restaurant was busy and had a certain energy, but it was not filled to the hilt accompanied by loud conversations. All in all it was a great experience and I would recommend Tuba without any trouble.

Tuba is delicious Turkish food in a low-key setting. All the dishes Tuba serves have a terrific spice and flavor to them without being overwhelming. The restaurant is dark and intimate but friendly with service that is on top of things without being overwhelming.
Good ambiance, but the food tasted like it might have been frozen - especially the falafel. The domas were too sweet for my taste, but might be good to someone else.

I took my family here for my dad's birthday. Everyone was satisfied with their order. we tried their salmon dish, lamb chops, lamb kebab, lamb kebab with a wrap, ground beef on eggplant. My dad got a complimentary birthday mousse cake which was nice of them. Service is as always...great! I have been to this place many times. Try their yakut red wine. The chianti was also good with the dishes we ordered. They also give you complimentary bread.
I've been to Tuba 3 times and it just keeps getting tastier with each experience!
The food is yummy, the place is small and cute. That said, they are not prepared to do Ramadan meals.
The food is excellent. The service is okay.
Unfortunately, I do not agree with the rest of the Yelp community regarding this restaurant. The service and the food was nothing special and I will not be coming back.

Yesterday we came across Tuba walking randomly around the neighbourhood, being rather hungry I suggested we take a quick look. I have already heared of Tuba, but wasn't sure it was worth the trip, eating Turkish food outside the Middle East is hardly ever a mind blowing experience!
Icli kofte, ezme, kizartma fabulicous awesomeness. Great service. Not loud turkish music. Recommended.

The most  wonderful dining experience I've had in a while.. The dumplings were divine...can't remember what else we had but everything was very good.. The dessert wasn't the best though..some sort of fried pastry swimming in honey... It was OK... But everything else was excellent!! Would definitely come back. Try a sampler to get a taste of different dishes.
What a shit show.
Nice place , but a bit expensive .

Tuba is great in many aspects, the food, the service and the atmosphere. We were there during a weekday evening and it was nice quiet atmosphere. The owner was ver personal, remembering that I just had been there a month ago. We shared the cold mezzo variety, which I can only recommend, but all the other food I have tried there was very tasty. Definitely a restaurant I will go back to.
My first time at Tuba and my friend and I loved it.  We are planning to come back with our men soon.

Our second dinner at Tuba on 9/12 was as memorable as the first, a few months before. The food is delicious and the flavors unusual. We eat a wide range of cuisines regularly, and the Mediterranean ones are pretty familiar -- hummus, grape leaves, kebabs... Tuba has some of that, but covers a much wider range. Delicious and interesting is hard to beat!
Great food and decently priced for the portions. I'm giving them a four because I want to come back and try more to make sure everything is as good as it was last night. We had:

Delayed review! My husband and I went to SF in May to celebrate my birthday and wanted to find a vegetarian-friendly spot to treat our awesome friend/host on our last vacation night. This place did not disappoint. We had a reservation and were seated quickly. The bartender came by and asked if we'd be interested in drinks. He suggested a Turkish beer (our friend had that) and we went with Anchor Steam Beer. Delicious!
Fantastic Turkish food!! Great service and ambience
Wow. We stumbled on this restaurant, what a find.  Definitely a be-back.

First time to go there tonight to celebrate a friend's birthday! The menu was very excellent! We were all very pleased with our choices...the presentation of the entrees was beautifully done! AND the desert was great! The waiter, very nice!  They even brought a beautiful desert for our friend and gave her a $20 coupon towards a future dinner! What a way to get her and us to come back again! Thank you!!!
Good stuff. Especially enjoyed the peynirli karides (prawn appetizer dish) and the sarma beyti kebab, which is a must-have amazing dish!!!

I have eaten every dish on the menu, and they are all a culinary vacation for my taste buds.  The flavors of roasted vegetables, lemon, cumin, garlic, and other fresh herbs are found in the roasted meats and vegetables, the delicious sauces and dips.
Delish! One of our favorite places.
Fabulous food, attentive service. Nice ambiance. Easy street parking. One of my favorite places. I would go outta my way to eat here, anytime. Do make a reservation though.

This meal was great from start to finish! We were warmly greeted at the door and led to a nice table. Our server was attentive and helped us pair good wines with our dishes. The food was absolutely delicious! We ordered the lamb shank special and the meat was delicious, falling off the bone, and perfectly flavored. Combined with the bulgur, it was out of this world. For dessert, try Noah's Pudding. It's lightly sweet and the perfect way to wrap up such a meal. The little show with the delivery of the coffee is great, too. I had to take away a star because of the noise. It was difficult to hear my girlfriend speaking across the table. But we will definitely be back.
Food: Sauces and dips are the strong point. See the photos on yelp to get an idea. We tried the beyti kebabs and 3-day marinaded lamb entree. The former was good but the lamb was a bit disappointing.

Outstanding food and service. Order beyti, sigara borek, and some Ayran. They make the Ayran there and it comes out of a tap. This is some of the best Turkish food I've had outside of turkey. Will definitely be back!
Now also the music is authentic...food, service, everything five star rating!
Really nice ambience and great service. The food is authentic and delicious. Definitely recommend trying this place out.
This is one of my favorite places that I've been to in San Francisco. The food is phenomenal and it's owned by a very warm and funny family.
Delicious! Nice atmosphere and good service. They even brought me a delicious little dessert for my birthday and sang. Server recommendations were spot on. Would definitely eat here again.

After all these years, my first Yelp review goes to a superb experience. We had dinner here for a surprise birthday dinner my fiancé coordinated for me and we left feeling beyond content. We had 14 people in our party and they were able to accommodate us well. The staff was on point but also had fun providing excellent service. So what about the food? Authentic and delicious  just as I remembered when I had it visiting Turkey.

Living here my whole life and never dining at this spot was a crime. This spot is tiny, a bit rough around the edges, but the food and hospitality of the staff is top notch. Such a very delicious meal made but lovely people! Will definitely become a regular here.
We waited for 45 minutes while everyone in the line got their orders. After that we had o ask to get a refund. Making a burrito ain't that hard. Get your act together.

I came here at the end of a night to grab a burrito because the line at Tacqueria Cancun was out the door, hoping this would be a little quicker. I ended up waiting 40 minutes and ultimately getting a refund because my burrito never came.

This is a very solid place to run to when craving a solid mexican fix for dinner. When your friend comes to town and wants that "authentic mexican fair from the mission", this is the place to go. 4 stars because the service could be more organized, but this is not an issue if you come ready to deal with a delayed service.
Delicious chicken in banana leaf tamale with mole *drool*.
Excellent authentic food. Got the sopes with grilled chicken, carne asada, and carnitas. All were delicious!
It's been too long since I've felt your loving embrace, Oaxaquena! I forgot how delicious your tacos are. I swear they're even better than before too!
Came here to try the pupusa and the ostrich tacos but they don't have ostrich anymore and they were out of pupusa

Rolled up here because it was open and within walking distance of where we were at. The food was delicious. I had a loroco pupusa and a vegetarian tamale wrapped in banana leaves. SO GOOD! They are also open late and inexpensive. Win win!

This place used to be one of our favorites but they have really deteriorated lately in terms of quality of service.  I would recommend they remember the early days and get their service back up to speed.

Every Valentine's Day, hubby and I do taco night.  We pick a taco spot, usually a spot we haven't tried yet.  I've been to this place but I wanted to take my husband here because I had great experience the last 2 times I've been here.  Unfortunately, this last Vday, their food was off.  We got tacos (carne asada and al pastor).  Flavor was bland and disappointing.  Service was good though.
Catered lunch from here today and it was great!! Huge burritos filled with amazing, yummy ingredients. We will definitely order from there again!

My teens wanted to try eating bugs, so we looked up don bugitos and they were sold out of inventory and we'd driven 3 hours to get there. We googled a restaurant that serves insects and found that THIS place was right around the corner and TEN times better. The bug portions are huge, not modest as the photos shown of the other bug eatery.  The bugito place had photos where you get a small serving of insects, but THIS place had HUGE portions of thick, juicy insects. We got grasshopper tacos and I swear to gosh they were amazing. I had two and so did the teens. The grasshopper tacos are around 5 bucks each but worth it. I can't believe I can say this, but the kids were right, bugs are pretty good. I was told that the bugito place is sometimes open, mostly not and that they are usually out of insects by the time you get there. If that happens to you, go around the corner to this place where you will have the surprise of your life! And their other food is authentic and SO tasty.
I love this place, but we showed up at 2pm on a Saturday and they are closed!!!!! Please update your yelp hours or at least post something in the windows or doors?!?
Banana leaf chicken tamale is absolutely delicious! I would recommend this place for a quick bite for singles, couples or small groups. The space isn't large but the food is very good!

DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE. EVER. Almost 3 hours late, and the order was 100% wrong. Not a single thing was correct. Reaching the restaurant by phone after was VERY difficult (took 45 minutes because they only have 1 line) and they were VERY rude about the entire situation. Never supporting this business again.
I haven't been back for ages since having a baby shortly after my last review in 2012. I was craving the mole tamales again today, so I checked their hours on Yelp and went in eager anticipation.
Bad place to eat.

First time trying this restaurant and the last. We came all the way from Lake Tahoe Ca. We saw that this restaurant had 4 start, and we wore excited to try it. I've never had a bad experience in a restaurant in San Francisco. This is the worse experience I had in my life. Service was horrible. The waitress was super slow. It took an hour for our food to arrive. And only to be the worst food that I have ever tried. Even my brother in law who's not a picky eater, couldn't eat his food.  I gave it a star because the Mexican hot chocolate was the only good thing that I tried.
Really good hole-in-the-wall Mexican joint.
This place is just a gem, I absolutely love it.

I will not be ordering from here again.  I placed a sizable order for delivery for myself and a group of friends. The food arrived over 2 hours late.  It was luke warm and half the items were incorrect (e.g. there were a few chipotle chicken tacos which I did not order and pork tacos that I did order were missing).

This place is an absolute gem. Most people walk right past it because it's a true whole in the wall. They have an excellent array of baked goods and amazing mexican rice. Their tacos are cheap and full of flavor. The decor is adorable and the owner and employees are lovely. One of the best mexican food restaurants in San Francisco all around.
Racist staff.
I went there for the grasshopper tacos which had a lemon taste to them. Delicious.
This place is awesome for some Mexican Hot Chocolate! I've been here two times already and I always make sure to get the Mexican Hot Chocolate when I'm here!
This place is hella delicious. Tamales. Mole. Mole with tamales. Papusas. And he gave us free tres leches.

So it turns out this place charges double at night.  I went in and ordered a chicken sope, which was on the menu at $3.95.  I saw some larger number next to it, ignored it, ordered, and was asked for $7.61.  I verified with him... 'For one chicken sope?'  'Yes, one chicken sope.'  I thought, oh, cool, this is gonna be huge.  I tipped a buck.  I waited. It came.  It was tiny.  I was decent.  It was a decent two dollar sope, but it's sf so I would have been fine with $3 or begrudgingly accepted $4.  Not 8.61.  No way.  So I ate it and looked at the menu again to see if there was some confusion... Maybe he charged me for the granddaddy size and the cook made the small one?  Nope, the higher price is for three of them.  This place is no good at all and intentionally gauging as well as falsely advertising prices.

Went here for a quick bite. Ordered two tacos that had a decent amount of meat but too much onions, like onion overload. Maybe even more onions then meat. But that's easily fixed by removing them from said taco. Tacos are pretty standard for the mission, minus the onion overload

Not a date place! but very good food. The tomales are healthy and tasty (doubtfully organic) but at 1am whatever. BYOB which cuts on the cost as you can get excellent IPA next door. Give a nice tip and the owner will bring chips, mole, etc. One of the better taquerias in the Mission, and I know the Mission. Enjoy :-)
Got a office lunch catered form them and I was happy with their catering. Their Churros was awesome. Nice food and they had labels defining the ingredients and if they are vegetarian :)
This place was pretty gross.

We figured that the fact the place felt dirty, catered to strange characters, and reeked strongly of bacon would be offset by the great food.  We were wrong.  My steak burrito was a bit bland, and I felt queazy the rest of the night.
You've had those debates about best burrito/Mexican in the Mission. Go here and put the debates to rest. Veggie & gluten-free options!
The mark is high for burritos in the Mission and this place falls way short.
Still hopping.
I have a love/hate thing for la oaxaquena.
Best taqueria in the Mission. Don't agree? Go stand in line for half an hour for a zucchini burrito in a tomato spinach wrap. I don't have time for you.

I like La Oaxaquena! Good chicken mole. Kind service. A great deal because of the low prices. Not a spiffy date place, but a place to good for quick, inexpensive eats. More of an authentic decor and comes with a Mexican client base to boot. Open until 9:30pm.
Damn dude... the corn leaf tamales with chicken and black mole are REALLY good.
Solid place from some late night pupusas. Salsa was delicious and the staff was very friendly.

I have been coming here for as long as I can remember. The staff is friendly for the most part except for on of the waiters. I honk he's to owners son. I have no other complaints but he needs to work on his social skills bc he gives everyone attitude. Other than that I love the food here. Reasonable prices and really good food. The waitress here are very friendly and attentive. I love ordering the 1/2. Soup w two pupusas. And the chan is my favorite drink. If you are ever in the mission district stop by but just remember that parking is a bit inconvenient as it's such a busy intersection so just be patient!
Definitely good for what it is, don't get anything but the Papusas Locas, they're amazing.
We ordered the Pupusas and they were delicious !

First off, this place is surrounded by bars so we assume hat anyone that says this place is good MUST be drunk.  We came in sober looking for pupusas since El Zocalo closed down.  We  don't usually get pupusas here. Our favorite place is a lil ways down the street on Mission/Richland (La Santaneca--AUTHENTIC Salvadorean food)

So we just arrived in San Francisco on a chilly 60° night I was craving chicken soup but also enchiladas and pupusas and it turns out we found a place in the mission that has all of that. We enjoyed friendly ad attentive service. She didn't laugh when Victor accidentally ordered "puputas." I had the enchiladas suisas and  Salvadoran horchata. It sure hit the spot. Vic ordered the chicken  soup and pupusas  as de pollo. Everything was delicious. Would recommend it!

My original destination was El Zolcalo and learned that it has closed down.  Now, what?  Saw this place a few doors down and thought I would checked it out.  The place is decorated in fun festive colors, music playing and clean.
I came here to eat the other day with my family. I had the milanesa, my mom and dad had the carne asada. Everything was delicious. I still have yet to try the pupusas.
Service sucks at this time waitress not attentive and they don't care if you are there

Love this place. Pupusas and caldo de red y caldo de camarones is the best. But please owner tell you waiter not to wear so much cologne. It's bad when you walk away and your smell stays at the table for several minutes after.

Freakin love this place. I've been going here since I was a kid in the 80's and the food is still awesome. Best pupusas I've ever been able to find. Every time we are in the city we make it a point to get pupusas to take home.

I have been going to this place for years and I am disappointed that I haven't written a review yet. It has been over 10 years that I have frequented this restaurant and within that time frame, the quality of the food and service has never faulted. It's nice to keep on going to a restaurant where me ans my family are recognized as frequnt visitors. The papusas are absolutely the best in town. I always get papusas and empanada del leche. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. If you are looking for great quality food and awesome service,  this is the place to go :).
I love the pupusas here.  The beer is really good here too.
The Pupusa was off the hook!

Maybe it was an off night. The chips were stale. My papusas were cold as was the rice and beans and the beans were runny, mostly water. My husband's plate looked better. How can two servings of retried beans brought to the table at the same time look so different? He said his food wasn't cold but not hot either. Oh well.
What I love: Papusas, sangria, beer, open late.
Best papusas and enchiladas in SF. loved every bite of good quality ingredients!

Stopped in for a quick bit before an evening concert at a bar across the street. Recommended by the barkeep, the food was good - less oily than most taquerias. The sopas de platis had a good amount of tripe and vegetables, and the pupusas were awesome - big, hot and tasty.
I'm going to keep this review short and simple. Best pupusas I have ever had in a restaurant!
I am only ever happy when I am eating at this restaurant
Traditional salvi. In love it's this cute little place reminds me of Grammys home cooking can u say magically delicious for sure I'll be returning

Yum, awesome food, fresh warm chips and spicy salsa, really nice service, what more could you want? I got the Plato tipico (sp) and it came with a luscious tamale, a delicious pastel, a flavorful and NOT greasy papusa!!! and a traditional cabbage slaw for the papusa my fave) as well as a different cabbage salad on the plate that's traditionally eaten with the pasteles. My man got carne asada and it looked Pete rly cooked, juicy and tender, the rice and beans were
My favorite spot for pupusas in San Francisco. I've stopped looking. The pork, the chicken, the bean and cheese... All are good. Free chips and salsa. Reasonably priced and tasty sangria.
I ordered 2 Pupusas to-go. The cashier kept saying they are almost ready. After 25 min of waiting, I finally fed up and left the restaurant without getting any Pupusas. Extremely slow service.

Los Panchos is a nice taqueria on Mission Street.  It's a sit down restaurant with a order-in kind of feel (even though there is service).  I much prefer it over Taqueria Cancun which sits right across the street for a place to eat.  The service is a tad slower (because you are served), but it's better quality and the portions are larger.

Came here around 1:30am after a night at Knockout across the street. My roommate and I ordered 2 zucchini and cheese pupusas to share. The waitress was so friendly and very attentive. Granted, we were pretty much the only table there, but still, she was nice!!

I have been going to this place for years! I would say that this is hands down the best Pupuseria in Frisko! They stay open late, for those who get the munchies after the club scene and always have been very courteous. I love their pupusas de harina de arroz!
Horrible... very disappointed with this place.

I've been here quite a few times and I've never been disappointed. Their pupusas are delicious and flavorful. I also highly recommend their sopa de res. The meat and vegetables are tender and the broth is light, but still savory. They have a combo where you can get 2 pupusas and a half bowl of sopa de res for about $10 (or maybe even slightly less, I don't remember).
Asked for carne Asada fries. Made it happen !
Oh holy, pupusas!

The Pupusa Loca was pretty good, filling and freshly made. (I believe that's the option with everything in it) The staff is nice and the place is open late which is convenient to stumble upon after hitting the bars in that area. They refill your chips and salsa if you dine in which is always nice.

Delicious! I ordered the pupusas with chicken and cheese. It was very flavorful and I especially enjoyed the filling. The rice and beans were good but nothing special and I probably could have done without them. My friends ordered some sangria and had to dilute it with water because it was a little too sweet.

These guys lost a customer today- I order Los panchos on Gopago.Paid. Get a message stating food will be ready in 10 minutes. Arrive at restaurant 15 later,and I quoth "yeah we're not gonna honor it because the  machine did not print out a machine and without it we dont get paid." Left hungry. No call. No Apology.
We both had the Bistec Ranchero.  Not as good as I've had elsewhere (even in the East Bay *gasp*) but it'll do.
My favorite latin-american food in the Mission.
best place hands down to go to if youre looking for a good meal and not jack n the box or mcdonalds after a long night of clubbing or bar hopping; open really late and very affordable! delicious :)

The pupusas here are good. The staff was friendly. The salsa and chips are delicious; there is a complexity to the salsa that is really nice and the chips are thin and crispy like I like them. The real bonus here though is that it is open past 2AM every night of the week. So why 3 stars? Because its just a solid good. Nothing pushed me into the excellent range. But I'll definitely be back.
Little hungry? Lotta hungry? Drunk? Sober? Hungover? Capable of eating?

One of my favorite places to grab a bite in La Lingua. The pupusas aren't too greasy and the rice is great. Admittedly, I haven't shopped around that many other pupusarias, since I found this place and pretty much settled on it. I recommend sticking to the pupusas but I don't think you'll be too disappointed if you venture off.

We call this place "secret pizza" but it looks like the secret's out. They have some of the best pizza in the city, and that's a bold statement! Along with that comes pitchers of beer, a pool table & an outside area? Oh did I mention its dog friendly too? Yes, it can be a little rough around the edges, but it's an effin bar! With amazing pizza! And dogs!
HOLY FVCK
i love this place. reasonably priced, great feel, outdoor patio, pool table, nice dudes working there.
great pizza, great bartenders, great atmosphere. easily my favorite bar in San Francisco!
Fantastic pizza + a locals spot with pints for $4.50. Absolutely recommended.
Best pizza in SF in my opinion!  Friendly staff, great locals, this spot can't be beat if you're looking for a relaxed dive bar with great pie!

Probably one of the best pizzas I've had in SF, and lots of variations on an original theme. Reasonable prices and solid, strong drinks, plus cold, cheap beer. Tried to plan a birthday for a friend here, but by the time we showed up around 8PM, the place was absolutely packed.
Excellent pizza. Great neighborhood feel. Cool mix of old-school SF regs and newcomers. Place always welcomes new faces.

This will be the most honest review of this place.  These guys are jerks and if you dont have a thick skin, then you are going to get offended.  If you can handle jokes.  If you can handle laughs and enjoy a beer, then get some good ol fashioned San Francisco Mission hospitality.  You will enjoy this place.  These bartenders may seem scary, but they are legit.

Best neighborhood dive bar, with great pizza and great service. Seriously, these guys are awesome, even to people trying to drink on crutches. Come in to watch a game, grab dinner or hang out on a weeknight.
Awesome thin crust Pizza, Great beer selection, decent priced Pizza (under $20.00) beers $4.00-5.00. could be cheaper, Hard to find parking but not impossible (welcome to SF)
Neighborhood bar, has a pool table and outside patio. Full bar.

Jay'n Bee Club is great.  Very simple concept: beer and pizza at a bar.  My friend and I shared a pie at the bar while the bartenders kept attending to our drinks.  The bartenders are nice and not overly-chatty.  This is what every bar should be like in San Francisco: friendly and affordable.

Attended a farewell party here and as I walked through, looking for my friends, I was pleasantly surprised to see a patio at the back of the pub where the party was.  Really enjoyed the thin crust pizzas, they were all great with a glass of beer.  Prices were cheap and found plenty of parking on the streets. Really like the neighborhood too.  Will go again if ever in the area.
We were at a day long event at the nearby Verdi Club, and pickins are slim for an easy to walk to eatery. This is where Yelp comes in, and thank g_d for the Jay'n Bee Club.

For thin crust pizza there is no place else in the City I'll go. Grab a drink, take a seat out back and enjoy. The super chill people who work there just make it an all around awesome time. I almost don't want to give this review in fear my spot will get blown up- but far be it from me to deny anyone such killer pizza, I guess....
Awesome place: cheap drinks, strong pours, friendly bartenders.  Just don't tell other people - let's keep this secret!
Love this place! Friendly staff, simple place, delicious fresh made pizzas, nice drinks, relax atmosphere, patio! ... Great neighborhood place.

Been going to this spot for a while my GirlFriend loves it and she's love it for the past couple of years. Their Pizza is amazing (coming from a NY boy) and their drinks well...they get you drunk, what more can I say. I was there tonight and met Nygel (Alfredo one of their bartenders) and he was amazing! Now  I have to say I will be going there not only b/c my GF loves it but because I have found my new favorite bar!
Good place to just have a beer and relax. Place has been around since I was a kid riding my bike in the hood. Good to see it has changed but not to much.

This is an easy, straightforward, unpretentious, casual neighborhood bar where the drinks are strong and inexpensive. The owners and people who work here are really wonderful. It's easy to throw a party here or invite a relatively large group of people (say, 10). I think the food is fine; nothing remarkable. I would come here for the drinks and the local-bar feel and eat somewhere else either before or after.

This place is the best!  No BS, just great food, cold beer and friendly people.  The bartenders are as good as any in the city- they make great drinks but they don't expect you sit there in awe of their 'mixologist' cred.  They just want you to enjoy yourself and come back often...  which you should!  My only regret is that I don't live right around the corner- I can only go there when I visit my daughter... Of course, it gives me one more reason to visit...
Great place knowledgeable bartenders good atmosphere and affordable prices only wish they had a more diverse food menu but what they do have is delicious
great lemon drops!
Good, simple dive bar. Not overly crowded. Serves fresh pizza, to order.

Great dive bar with food. The pizza was very good (though that spicy pie was danger bay).  Get's a bit cold and drafty by the door -- which requires a certain level of insulation with beers (but again, watch out for that spicy pizza. It will not help you).
The biggest plus is that this place is 2 blocks from my house!
Live in the neighborhood.

After living in the neighborhood for years, Jay'n Bee has always had that local bar feel. I had not been here in years and was asked to arrange a get together at the bar for my coworkers before the holiday season.
Delicious Pizza - Green Mo' has so much Spinach on it, which makes it really healthy.  Also endless garlic, so bring mints if you order this.
thanks for being such great neighbors! i work around the corner at asiento
Score $4 beers and cheap pizza... cash only though

I love this place.  It is the kind of bar where 'everybody knows your name' with good drinks and food.  Great thin crust pizza for a great price plus cheap pints and a pool table. This is my new neighborhood joint (just moved in a block away) and I will keep coming back!

Went back for 2nd time with some friends and everyone freaked out how great the food is!!!!!! We had 2 large pizzas, caprese salads and 2 pitchers of beer for 56 bucks. Are you shitting me why don't they just give it away!!!? The bartenders are great, cheap drinks, always a game on, and the best pizza in the city! Anyone who doesn't like this place must be a social misfit and should probably move away from here!!!!!!!

Pizza ($12) and a legitimate IPA draft ($4) were both satisfying. I only ate 3 of the 8 pieces of pizza - it only comes in one size. Basketball on the TV, plenty of people for a Tuesday. I read at the bar and felt comfortable. Seems like it'd be a good place to meet people if you felt so inclined. Server/bartender was friendly and cute. They reported they are only closed on Sundays. Atmosphere was lively without being annoying. Will go back.
It's my bar! Stay the hell away!

Are you kidding? Asked for sausages and peppers without bread and cheese (due to food intolerances) and they wouldn't serve it because they thought that sounded gross. Immature, unprofessional, rude. Won't be back.
Friendly, towny vibe

My friend and I were in town from Seattle and stumbled across this spot after having some hoity-toity sushi.  We had an early dinner so were just wandering about the neighborhood drawn by the cute apartments and wondering what it would be like to live here.
The nite I came here, it had the most random groups of people I have ever had the pleasure of being in a bar with.

OMG.  The food is so original and tasty.  There is nothing like this that I know of in the United States.  Truly they march to their own tune and the results are delicious.  This was my eighth visit since they opened and they just keep getting better.  Of course the bread is exceptional (and better than at Tartine bakery).  Every dish was spot on but the unanimous pick of the evening was the spaetzle with bottarga.  The chicory's with anchovy dressing was one of the tastiest salads ever.  The chicken had great chicken flavor and I loved the black cod in a green chile broth.  We had more but these cooks are doing something original that you cannot get anywhere else.

All the dishes we ordered were delicious.The beer tartar was a favorite of mine as well as the flat bread and the bread and lard.  My friend ordered a fermented drink of theirs and it smelled cheesy which as really weird. I had a Hen House Saison which was soon so good. Service was friendly and our food came out super quick once we decided on what to order. My biggest complaint was the dessert. This could have been a wonderful dining experience had the dessert not completely ruined it. We tried all three dessert's on their menu and not one of them was good. I'm pretty sure they don't believe in actually baking their desserts or using sugar -- it was weird and unenjoyable. I'd come back but I'll go elsewhere for dessert.

Had a fabulous dinner here. Sat at the bar and watched the prep. They create beautiful food, sorting through the components of each dish to select the best ingredients. The kitchen was low key and methodical. Definitely one of the best meals I've had. Loved the Brussel sprouts and the sweet potato salad. The crispy skin on the black cod was amazing!
Food is very delicious. I will say it is a bit too expensive for the serving sizes. Next time I will try to have a small breakfast before I eating here.

Praise the lard! Hehe, while it should probably be eaten minimally, their lard dish -- lard, onions and paprika with bread, dipped sparingly -- was surprisingly tasty in the unhealthiest way possible! Presented very well, so at least the thought won't linger too much. This is my #1 memory of Bar Tartine: trying lard and liking it!

My last meal was super disappointing. Every dish was pickled. How can every dish be pickled? This place goes through experimental menu. I get that. I've also had amazing and balanced tasting meals here several times before. I do like the ambiance.

After my initial brunch experience here, I returned for dinner and brunch again today after 2 years since my initial review.  Both dining experiences were unimpressive - both the food and the service.

We are from LA but in town for a wedding.  We absolutely loved Bar Tartine.  It's a great balance of it all by providing great service, casual ambiance and amazing (and I mean) amazing food at reasonable prices.  Highly recommend it.

Our first time going to Bar Tartine, our group of 4 walked right by it because their sign is teeny weeny. I hope that's temporary, as it might lose them business from random passersby. The restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere, and service is friendly. The menu is designed for sharing, with a range of small plates that were mostly good, but a few misses. The prices were kind of high when you saw the portion sizes. Surprisingly, the least favorite dishes in our group were the two meat ones, but others like the flatbread and the lentil croquettes are delightful. It would be nice to see some entree sized options, though, in addition to the small plates.
really cool spot in the mission. The food is great, and relatively healthy. Service is awesome too. Can't wait to come back and try more things!

Parents were visiting from out of town, so I thought I would bring them here. Service was pretty horrible. Fifteen+ minutes for drinks and bread, poorly timed with food. Three dishes came at once, next three very much later. No apology when this was pointed out, either. Very, very disappointed. We asked several times "do we even have a waiter?"

I really enjoyed Bar Tartine and found the cuisine more interesting and compelling than other similar SF restaurants. The setting is nice and I liked the decor and ambiance of the restaurant. The service was efficient but could perhaps use a little more warmth. The cuisine was rustic bold cal-med fusion but fusing different cuisines than usual in innovative and fresh ways. The night we went we got hints of Scandanavian, Greek, Italian and Japanese cuisine in some of the dishes. The food is flavorful and fresh herbs like mint and tarragon accentuate spices like cumin and coriander. Almost every dish worked for me. The table next to us, a 20 something techie and his visiting parents were befuddled by the cuisine.
Excellent, inventive breakfasts
Excellent food!

Great food, awesome atmosphere.  A bit on the pricey side but it's definitely worth it.  The main courses can be a little underwhelming sometimes but that happens VERY rarely.  However, the bread and butter is always magical and probably the best thing on the menu.
All I needed was a cloud bed to float me home! really enjoyed being exposed to a variety of new wines from eastern europe, too.

Made a reservation here after reading it was rated tops in the s.f chronicle. Very impressive meal - bread was some of the best ever with their homemade butter and cultured squash. The name cultured squash wouldn't normally get me to order something but the guy at the next table had just eaten two bowls of it and said it was worth the stomach space. We also were intrigued and satisfied with the steak tartare and pickled white beans. Unusual and tasty. Another memorable dish was the sweet potato salad with avocado, marinated mushrooms and house made feta. It had a terrific dressing with the perfect combination of vinegar and savory herbs. Go and enjoy as we did.
Service - 2 stars -- I had to ask the waiter to come back and serve me coffee. The waiter did not come often to check on our food/drinks.

Extremely adventurous and unusual fare awaits your taste buds here!  The menu is varied and unique, but I'm sure everyone can find something that appeals.  Definitely a special experience, and highly recommended!
Split the below with 3 friends:
Ordered the MS tufted mushrooms.  Tartare. Lard and onions. Albacore. Food lacked flavor. Best part of the meal was the bread frankly
What a great experience!
If only I could write separate reviews for the food and service...or just return here and serve myself.
Most overhyped and overrated SF restaurant. All my ordered dishes are either bland or monotonously acidic. Very disappointed with the food there and the reviews here.

Exceptional! 100% perfection is what you can expect at Bar Tartine. The amount of time and effort that goes in the prep of each dish is what makes them so delicious in the end. The chicken doesn't just have salt and pepper, it has something close to 10 ingredients. We had a potato dish in which the potatoes were smoked..yes smoked then roasted then finally fried. They were seasoned in a fermented black garlic vinaigrette. Say what?! It was amazing!

I think this place is great. Innovative, tasty, adventurous, and filling. The smoky potatoes are a total standout and with the herby, lemongrass fish stew. Wow! I've had a few dishes over the 5 or so times I've eaten here that are pretty good but not outstanding... But usually it's a total hit and when it is, it's special.
Ive eaten here many times.  Innovative cuisine.  Delicious.  Healthy food. Great people.
This was a fabulous foodie experience.
We ate here for dinner and really enjoyed it.
just a quick review.

Highly disappointed with the overall caliber of this restaurant. I could go on for days, but to sum it up; the food was low quality, the staff was inattentive and the prices were absurd. This place has gone downhill! I have dined here before, but after this experience, I would never return. Their "secret" additions on the menu were disturbing. I ordered salmon and out came 4 tablespoons of roe. This restaurant is entitled, nontransparent and a poor excuse for an establishment. The management is low grade. Mackenzie, tried to empathize with the situation and said "I'm sorry, our food is weird." Not what I want to hear from someone who is at the forefront of the restaurant. I would never return for this dining experience again. At this point I feel robbed of my money and time. Beware.

Had lunch here on the spur of the moment. I liked the look of the place, while spare it was inviting. Our server seemed bored and uninterested. There was nothing wrong with his service, it just seemed like he would have rather been anywhere else. Maybe we were not hip enough.

Not what I would call a "bad meal" but it left us not overly impressed. Tapas style menus need to deliver otherwise you get a small plate of food for a lot of money. My wife and I left full with having had 4 plates but the dishes were a bit salty with lots of sauce with no real stand out selections in our order. The menu was half vegetarian which I can appreciate but sometimes need one or two hearty dishes for the meat lover in the group. Great atmosphere and decor. Limited beer selection and excellent wine choices. Great staff.  This place has good potential with a bit of menu tweeting. I hate to give 3 stars with only one visit but this is San Fran the land of dining and  you don't get two visits unless you deliver.

I gave the restaurant 2 stars because the waiter was very good however the food leaves something to be desired and the prices are ludicrous for what is being served. The wine list is full of eastern european wines that are probably $5 a bottle and they charge $14 a glass. Really bad wines - no liquor so you are stuck with beer and bad wine. The menu is so strange it is hard to find anything worth eating. The $13 beets that allowed each person to get 1 bite of beet tasted good but was so overpriced, it was hard to fathom paying that for a bite of a beet.The $24 chicken was not edible - I  had to ask the waiter for a new plate to get the awful taste off my plate. The kale was fine - weird preparation. Dessert menu was so weird - we left and went to cream around th corner which was the highlight of the evening. Totally disappointed in the restaurant - only thin I enjoyed was the bread and butter and they charged me $6 for it! With all the fine dining in bay area - not sure why this one is popular - I giuess the excellent bakery keeps them floating along. Expected a great dining experience and left totally disappointed. Will try the restaurant next store next time and if that is bad too I will head to the mission for tacos and dessert only - forget about fine dining.
good atmosphere but the food was pricey, small portions and not that great. rotating menu so maybe the day i went it was anticlimatic. definitely wouldn't go back for dinner for the cost and food
So, when I first went to Br Tartine many years ago, I thought it was just fantastic.  Food was lovely, fresh, interesting and subtle.  Service was awesome.
I was so excited to go to Bar Tartine. The cuisine sounded so interesting, and indeed, it was the most creative food I've had in a long time.

This was an interesting dinner and one of the most unique I've had on a recent trip to San Francisco. From word of mouth, I've heard many good things about Bar Tartine, and was excited to dine here. The menu changes with the seasons and the concept is small plates, with flavors ranging from the mediterranean to even the eastern european. There is a lot of pickling and brining throughout the menu.
RUDE General Manager- Molly
Great food and service! My boyfriend's all-time favorite place :)
I love their falafel wraps, and their service. Their food is very fresh and reasonably priced.  i will be back soon.

the Falafel wrap is delicious, fast and (kinda) healthy.  Cooked just right with great sauces, they also have a house hot sauce which has plenty of flavor though could do with slightly more heat.  Will be back.
Don't miss this place! I rarely say that in reviews,  but I'm so serious.
Kick-ass mediterranean food. Friendly staff. It's a take-out go-to spot for us. If you're looking for something fast and easy that won't disappoint, Zaytoon is a super safe bet.
I love this place, if it was closer to my place I'd probably be here every other week. The wraps are a good size for what you pay, and the fillings are fresh and tasty.

This place is now my favorite go to hole in the wall for things Eastern Mediterranean. Which is to say Lebanese. And maybe Syrian but some places avoid both of these terms in favor of cryptic euphemisms. Regardless, the shwarma/donor kabob/gyro is delectable. That would be the lamb variety. The chicken wrap/shwarma was also a savory experience. The meat is from that pricy friend of our (Nieman Ranch) but the prices here are very reasonable averaging about $12 (non adult beverage included) for a meal. You won't get a hookah but then you also won't get pneumonia from sharing a strangers water pipe. Perspective. It's what's for dinner.
Hmmm, this was a disappointment :(
So good. Such nice workers. Fast service. Great having some Mediterranean that's affordable in the Mission.

Best place I know of to go for amazing food! And service!. Was brought here once to try a sherwema and changed my life I live in San Mateo and will gladly drive here for sherwema any day!. Cute little location with nice outside seating. Catch SF on a perfect day and enjoy!.

First time here! I ordered the lamb shawarma  wrap and it was absolutely delicious & savory! The lamb is well marinated & all the ingredients combined in this wrap make it a perfect meal, that is also made to order & comes out piping hot:)) It was definitely a huge serving size as well. Zaytoon is a very nice, clean, well-lit dining spot with very friendly staff! Definitely will recommend this place to friends, family, & anyone craving a quick, yummy Mediterranean meal!

Zaytoon is my go-to for a quick chicken shawarma wrap, and it's one of the best I've had in the city. Authentic mediterranean flavor, healthy food and fantastic service. If you're into spicy, ask for extra spicy red sauce on the side. It's amazing.
This is our go-to for a quick chicken shawarma wrap. Always consistent. Spicy, delicious, affordable. They're always fast and the guys working the counter are super friendly.
Better chicken shawarma than the ones from 16th. Plus it's sold daily, not like once a week over there. Ready to come back and try the rest of the menu.

I give it 5 stars because to me it executes on exactly what is promises- fast casual Mediterranean food made with high quality ingredients and made quickly. They are not reinventing the wheel but overall Zaytoon delivers consistently- we have never had a bad meal and we order takeout here at least 2 times a month. We get the lamb and chicken platters and falafal, the greek chicken salad, schwarma, etc. Can't go wrong.
Love this place. Fantastic wraps, very affordable and freshly prepared. They taste delicious. I go for chicken shawerma every time.
This is by far the best falafel in the area.

Decided to try this place after going to Dolores park for the day. The Falafel wrap was delicious. Large and very flavorful. They add potatoes which is very tasty. My husband ordered the chicken plate and loved it. We sat outside with our food and a couple of beers and had a nice quick dinner. Not really a sit down place, but a great place to go to get tasty food!!
Tiny wraps store across City College

Really great food at a good price. I had the chicken shawerma wrap. The chicken was juicy with delicious sauce, and the tomatoes and cucumber in the wrap were crisp and very refreshing. The lavash bread was perfect. It is also plenty of food, more than filling.

Had the chicken shawrema- delicious! Good service nice guys. Ordered fries as thinking might be something different/ Mediterranean but just ordinary American fries. Good but didn't really need them as too much for one person & more something to go w/burgers which they do have (lamb & kebab). The Mediterranean food was great & would come back!

This is the only place that I really think You can find the authentic Mediterranean Flavor and with healthy organic products, very clean environment.. I travel often to Europe and  I must say there is nothing different than the food I can find in Europe with the one I find in this Great Spot....... A friend introduced me to this place and the minute I tasted the first bite I knew I was on Heaven   a place that I had been looking for a long time....  To bad I do not live close by otherwise I could pop more often.....  You can also call in advance and Your food would be ready... that is a Great advantage for a great Falalfel or a Shawarma .

You know what I love? A good LAMB shwarma. My only complaint as of recent is that these places are advertising lamb but what they're selling is a mix of beef and lamb. I love the taste of lamb and would appreciate a shwarma with all lamb. If I want a burrito I'll go order one. Spare me the cost mark up of lamb minus the lamb.
