This sandwich shop has settled in and I am a fan of their Falafel.

Zaytoon is a great family owned Mediterranean cuisine with friendly service. Great variety of authentic dishes and real flavor of the Mediterranean. Chicken Shawarma is superb.  Located in the heart of the mission district with plenty to do in the area.

Best shawerma wraps in the Bay-Area. My go-to joint for the lamb Shawerma craving. All natural and sustainable meats from Niman Ranch. Taste and detail goes a long way when it comes to service, all at the right pricing point.

Yum. Small menu, but very satisfying. For a snack, the portions are large enough to split between two people, but if you're starving order your own plate :D Love the way the meats are seasoned here. The chicken is juicier, but I have a love affair with the lamb burger and lamb shawerma. I always order them spicy and ask for more spicy sauce on the side.

Worst shawarma I have ever had in my life. I went in optimistic because of my love for shawarmas. I was highly dissapointed by this place. The chicken meat was disgusting and they had my order completely wrong. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!
Still awesome and officially my favorite place in the 'hood!

3.4 stars. Its really good quality food, just a bit over priced or small portions. Its also pretty straight forward falafels and wraps. What makes this place special is the quality and freshness of the ingredients.
Ordered a house salad and added falafel and chicken, and they were a little skimpy on the chicken, but otherwise tasty salad.

Fresh, good food. Excellent customer service. We opted to sit at one of the tables shared with the Crepes place right next to it. The food was brought to us, the wait was short. I tried the lamb platter (two meat patties and some sides) and the chicken platter (free range organic chicken). My favorite, however, were the parsley sprinkled fries. The platter portions don't look overwhelmingly big but were definitely filling. I would opt for a wrap next time I stop by.

I just went there for the first time the other day and had a chicken and falafel shawarma, which was ok to me. I didnt like how i had to pay for each falafel so i opted for getting a hald dozen, with 4 in the shawerma and the 2 ate seperate. at other places itll be just about $1 more for the combo...and the falafel werent that great..Good...yet small and kind of bland. There was no specific nor combined flavors that were accentuated..and the excessive crispiness to em, wasnt ideal neither. The chicken was soft...and almost shredded like...tiny little pieces...and this sauce that thy put has an overpowering taste that i didn't enjoy too much because it was kinda of like peppered..and too much...if the chicken pieces were bigger itd soak in some of the sauce and give it a firmer taste...i cant imagine having it without the falafel and still enjoy a solid wrap.. Overall it was good enough..
This place is amazing! When I'm craving middle eastern food, this is definitely my go-to spot. Great service, great food, small but delicious spot.
I would recommend this place to Anthony Bourdain.  (Are you listening Tony?)
Food is fine.  Nothing spectacular.
Awesome place, food is very authentic and fresh.

I've had a couple falafel wraps here, & they're okay but I have other favorites in the neighborhood, I'd say they're missing a little something, they've got nice flavor but maybe the sandwich is a little too dry. more expensive than other options around.
Great food! great service! employees are very friendly, the chicken shawerma gets 10 stars, been looking for a good place to have shawerma and i just found it :)
The food here is really good but its just so freakin expensive.  Chicken shwarma is the thing to get.

Very disappointing experience. We got food to go and when we got back there was nothing redeeming about any of it. Underripe tomatoes, small portions, they messed up our order (missed an entire plate), the falafel deluxe was dry and flavorless and didn't have eggplant.  And it was all overpriced to boot.
The best burrito in San Francisco.  Veggie options are plentiful and the quality of the experience has been exceptional every visit.  Easily my favorite spot so far for a quality mission burrito.

Went here one evening and I had their guacamole and chips while my friend had their veggie burrito.  Their guacamole was delicious but disappointed with the bland flavor and very little portions of their chips.  I liked the pickled Jalapeños they give for free which you can find beside the counter.  Had a portion of my friend's veggie burrito and it was tasteless to me.  There are other burrito places within that neighborhood I'd rather go to to be honest.  Their prices were even too high for me.  $8 for guacamole and chips?  Too much.
Great food, super tasty, it can get busy in the evening. So be prepared for a short queue.
After a two year break, I went back to Papalote and now I'm 0 for 3!

Gave this place a shot and I wasn't impressed. Their food was overpriced and lacked flavor & authenticity in my opinion. Experience wasn't that welcoming either, word of advice, don't order carnitas or they'll frown upon you! At least that's the impression given. Just an "Uppity Mexican Grill." Gave the place 2 stars as the ingredients do taste fresh.  If you want to feel as if the Mexican culture has been robbed out of your food to appeal more towards "American's" or our new found hipsters, you might as well go to chipotle.

Oh boy this place is so sweet.  The staff are helpful and courteous.  The food is amazing.  I have never had a bad time here both with the atmosphere, the food, the clientele.  I challenge anyone to go and not have a good time.  In fact I know what I am having for lunch.
Been coming here for years because of the superior salsa and veggie options.  But now that I'm eating meat once again, I have to say the meat burritos are rather meh.
The Chilaquiles - enough said!

This is the best place in the Mission for burritos.  I bet the rest of the menu is amazing, but I've only had the burritos because they're so good!  The soy burrito is good because of the sauce/marinade they have it in, makes a great 'rito!  And the carne asada if my favorite meat burrito, great stuff!  Sitting there with a  beer and a burrito...can't be beat.
Really delicious burrito and that salsa that comes with is both unique and out of this world!

good food and kind service.. but i'm always shocked at the total.... if all the ingredients were organic and locally sourced, the price might be justified, but for a standard burrito in the bay, it's steep.  if you are getting it to-go, i highly recommend calling ahead - will often save you 10-20 min of wait time.
- Delicious americanized burritos
2 words - THAT SAUCE. The salsa provided with your meal has a taste you will not find anywhere else - makes anything taste good.
Love the food chips and salsa are great. Shrimp tacos are hands down the best sautéed in white wine sauce and butter.
This review is for the service.  Awful, unfriendly, and rude.  We walked in and the staff did not say hello they just stared at us.  We ordered some guacamole and chips along with 2 beers.

I used to work around here and went there for lunch almost every day. Their burritos are quite tasty but one day I found a large piece of glass inside my burrito. Went back with my burrito to show them and complain and the lady behind the counter told me that they find glasses in the black beans all the time.!!!! she did at least offer me a refund.
Charging for salsa?!? Are you kidding me?
Really tasty fish burrito with fresh grilled fish.
WHAT!?!?! No carnitas?!?!?!? And you call yourself a Mexican restaurant?!?! Sorry, but even Chipotle is better than this place... and I don't think very highly of Chipotle either. Just saying....

Three stars only. Simply because the carne asada burrito needed about 3-4x more meat. The flavors were excellent. The salsa was really good. Even the roasted tomato habanero salsa, which I bought too, was delicious. I will go back, but order a 3x meat, 1/2 portion beans, 1/2 portion rice burrito. Probably cost me $30 as the 'bean' burrito was $9. Soo disappointing. La Taqueria around the corner does supply 3x the carne at the $9 or better price.
Tastes alright. Really pricy for what me and my 7 other latino friends consider and rate as a "mediocre burrito". Just see who is sitting at the tables. Latinos? Nope.
The best Mexican in SF. I don't know why La Taquiera gets so much buzz. This place is so much better.

I'd say a solid 3.5 stars. The service was good (order at register, pay and have the food brought out to you). The food was solid, but nothing special. Overall, I'd say decent value with good service and decent food.
Their salsas are the best- have been wanting to try the restaurant. It does not disappoint. I got the chicken mole- so good! Fresh and plenty of food!

Decided to stop by once I heard there was a lot of buzz on the FoodNetwork about this place. I'm all for supporting local businesses but this is one I will never return to. I was dead set on stopping by here after picking my wife up from work. She wanted to to to La Taqueria on 25th/Mission but I just had to see what this place was about. My first and last experience here left a bitter taste in my mouth.

I had a fish burrito. It was tasty but not enough fish. Had to take several bites to find the fish. The biggest set back for me was the price. $14 for a burrito with just a little fish is waaay too much for me. They also need to work on a better system to take orders and deliver better service.

I honestly did not have a welcoming experience here. My boyfriend I were planning on meeting a friend here and were wanting to sit while we waited. The sign said "wait to be seated." We waited awkwardly for a while and finally asked some one. She said we had to order food before sitting down. We mentioned we were waiting for a friend and if she minded if we sat and waited for him. She said no. Strike one.

Beyond being an incredibly fun name to say,* the fine folks at Papalote are churning out tasty fare that may not be 100% authentic but it's mighty tasty to gringo tongues throughout the Bay area. I ate my burrito whilst sitting on a couch and drinking wine. No, that's not their set up (although, it's a winning idea; give me some commission on it), I ate from (my friends' home). Take out is the way to avoid the crazy lines and unwashed masses.

One burrito, two burrito, three burrito - floor?! Seriously filling, big, bad (in a good way) burritos to be found here. I had the grilled vegetables option, which was one of several vegetarian choices - great to see. Order at the front and take a seat, your bodacious burrito* is en route.

Papolote has become a go-to for takeout Mexican. Tip top burritos and quesadillas with excellent house-made salsa/sauce and mediocre tortilla chips. My wife loves the Chicken Mole quesadilla (it's great). I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito. It tastes great, but I prefer the more classic burrito offerings (from them and everyone else).

It's billed as the having the best burrito the the United States, and being a Bay Area native and Mexican food connoisseur, I had to check it out.  I ordered the steak burrito and I must say, overall, it was very good.  Fresh ingredients and made with love I'd give the burrito an overall 8.5 out if 10.  Have I had better?  Probably.  But the burrito was great and I would highly recommend it, at least so you can say you had the best burrito America has to offer.

Way better than their NoPa location! The service is much better and their guacamole actually wasn't rotten. I love that their burritos aren't greasy. Their ingredients are very fresh and they have a variety of options. The downside is the price. It's pretty expensive IMO for a burrito. Regardless, it's good and a great place to stop by if you're hungry and in the mission.

I was speeding to work and backtracked just to get Papalote. I eat it from time to time, and it's always good time to time lol. It isn't greasy, I don't feel extremely tired from eating it but I feel full. The sauce, YUM. I realized that they carry it in Whole Foods now. 4 stars on a solid burrito.

Amazing rice and beans burrito. We are visiting SF from Vancouver, where Mexican food is really hard to find, and this place totally hit the spot. The salsa was also fantastic! FYI that the bathroom is kind of dark/gross, but hey, at least they have one!

SO I am going to say that this seemed to me to be a very eel put together and healthy tasting burrito. Not greasy, very fresh, great options. I had the carne asada burrito with whole black beans, and I appreciate their  mission of providing healthier burritos.

Two words: Mole Tofu. This place is the answer to every vegetarian's dreams. I know nothing of the chicken adobo, or whether the carnitas (if they even have it) stacks up against El Farolito's or Taquieria Cancun's. That can't matter to me cause I'm stuck with the veggie (really beans, or at best chile relleno) options over there. Papalote gives the treatment veggie options deserve.
I only went to Papalote during this visit mainly to try the Mexipino Burrito that all my friends have been raving about.  And it did not disappoint!

Papalote is known for their amazing orange salsa! I'd like to confirm that the amazing orange salsa is truly amazing. It's savory, flavorful, and has a spicy kick to it! They sell their sauce in packaged jars, I will probably pick up a bottle during my next visit

My first time at Papalote and it was soooo worth it!! The art, music and vibe was dope. I ordered the Mexipino Burrito and inhaled it..listen when you order this you will understand PLUS the salsa was so on point. Will make sure to always go back to eat at Papalote EVERY time i come to SF.

First off, their sauce is aweeesome.. I was sweating. Free chips and salsa which is a plus in my book. I ordered the chicken salad with the cilantro sauce. Yummy! It is one of the hardiest salads I have ever eaten. You'll be full guaranteed. We ordered the shrimp and streak super burrrito. Delicious! Its large. Massive food coma afterwards no doubt. Last note, the triple threat is not made for 1!

A friend of mine mentioned that there's plenty of places to eat brunch at in the Mission so I decided to look for them on yelp. I found a few places I wanted to try out but El Techo de Lolinda stood out the most because it's on a roof unlike others.

Had a reservation for brunch for today.  Was seated in a low 2 person table crammed right between another table and the open kitchen. Plenty of other tables with views were available but having a reservation doesn't mean getting a good table.
WOW! how was I unaware a glorious place such as this existed in San Francisco, and in the Mission, no less?!
Excellent place!
This is my new favorite place in SF. It's great that you can make a reservation for brunch and it's not super packed like other popular places.
Good food, good beer, good atmosphere, gorgeous environment, nice people, trendy as hell; highly recommend.

This place does not live up to the hype. Long wait to get in, then an undersized table without enough chairs, heat lamps not turned on, and food that is sub par. The chicken was fatty, the beef was chewy, and the margaritas were overly sweet with no salt.  The menu was small, and the place is understaffed. Not worth a second visit.

My brother took me here while I was visiting him and I really liked the ambiance.  You have a beautiful view, sheltered from the wind, heat lamps, and excellent staff.  I can't tell you what the food tasted like, all I know is it wasn't bad.  I'm giving this place 5 stars due to our great server and everyone else we encountered.

Came here for the eve of my 21st birthday and was in heaven! Somehow I managed to stroll in with 12 people and get seated right when we got to the rooftop because a large party had just left- call it a birthday miracle. The views and ambiance are spectacular and the drinks are pretty good too! Perfect place to be surrounded by good people, and the vibe this place brings cant help but put you in a fantastic mood. Don't let the lines and the wait scare you- this place is a must.try
This place is fun to say over and over... El Techo de Lolinda! (repeat x10)
I gave this place 4 stars, but i'm gonna be weird and write a pretty mixed review lol

This spot is a sweet hidden hipster oasis with some seriously stellar waitstaff as well as outrageously tasty treats and some sumptuous drinks on the menu... If you're going for happy hour be sure to get there early as it tends to get packed after 5... All in all a real gem!

Great attractive rooftop location, protected against the wind, close to BART. I love outdoor venues. I was there on a warm October afternoon for happy hour 4 PM. No problems getting a table in the bar section at that time. By the time we left at 6:30 PM, the place was packed with folks waiting for tables. Good bright place to meet friends.

My boyfriend and I heard of this Rooftop bar/restaurant and attempted to go once but it was closed due to a private event. We tried again today and it totally made our week! Yes the food is good, yes the rooftop is spectacular (surprisingly uncommon in SF). Above all however, our waitress Christy was a breath of fresh air here in this city! Ive have the worst service in SF than any other city I've been too. Lived here now almost two yrs and seriously considering giving up on the place but we felt better about giving it another chance after visiting this establishment. Going back soon with many friends and will spread the word.
Had some delicious rooftop brunch. I went on a weekend afternoon and you needed reservations to sit at the tables but they had plenty of high tables that had no wait which were basically the same.
I have only been here once upstairs. Nice lovely view, but yet to really check out during the day. Might go for a happy hour with coworkers or friends one of these days.

Friend: "techo is roof".....WAIT, the roof of Lolinda the restaurant! I get it! It took me awhile for the stars to align but the name is pretty cute and catchy. This rooftop bar is located above the restaurant Lolinda. We came to this bar after dinner at Foreign Cinema. There was a bit of a wait outside to get in on a Saturday night. After about 15-20 mins, we finally got in. No cover; yay I love how chill SF bars are. You take this elevator up to the "Pent House" area, which is essentially the rooftop bar. To the left looked like more tables/seats for a sit-down meal. To the right looked more like just the bar area; so we walked toward the right and found a table. We waited for a waiter to come and take our order. We ordered the El Techo Margarita pitcher; that stuff was strong and almost tasted like roasted chipotle pepper. It was odd and quite difficult to down for a few of us in the group. Bad choice of drink and also pricey as heck. With tax that one pitcher cost us $55. Ridiculous! I wouldn't come back here when there are much better dive bars and cutesy hipster lounges scattered all over SF.
the brunch?
Located in the heart of the Mission, you might recognize this rooftop bar and mexican tapas place by the long line outside.   But even though the Mission is overcrowded, I won't be returning again.
Romantic place.. beautiful view, good drinks. I just love this place, can't stop going there. Celebrated my birthday there and it was nice.
Rooftop bar is awesome! It's hard to find a nice outside spot like this with such great views where you're not freezing your ass off. They have heat lamps and plastic tents which is nice.

Had brunch on the rooftop patio on the most beautiful SF day of the year. The sangria was delicious and the chicharonnes really stole the show for me. Service is decent for how constantly busy they are. We were in no rush and enjoyed the whole afternoon. Thank you for a memorable day!

Food is meh. Eating the minimal soopy water like eggs on what tasted like an over cooked burnt hard shell tortilla. The menu is unappealing and you just end up ordering whatever. Then when you eat the little bit on your plate that seems eatable your pretty much just eating to eating and little enjoyment.

What view is everyone raving about?! There is no view! The rooftop is only on the fourth floor and you are over looking some shabby lookn buildings and streets! I did like the raw feel of the place and the service was good. Food and drinks were fine too, but you can't really go wrong with shots of tequila and guacamole!
City rooftop bars just steal my heart away. Beautiful views, especially if you come on a clear day or night.

the food was very very good. Can be kinda hard to get a good place to sit but its totally worth it. Go for anything with jamón! I can't say enough about anything with jamón. Also the olives are so great.
SO DAMN FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC
The location of the places nice as well as being the roof however I really did not enjoy the drinks. We decided to try this place after having dinner at their restaurant.
Situation:

Wow, I think this is a best kept secret because I didn't know this bar existed in the Mission until this past weekend! The view of the SF skyline is incredible and for those rare, warm SF nights, it is a real treat. Drinks and food (pork quesadilla was amazing!) are also good. Perfect for a great night out with friends or a date.
The food is actually quite good, so this one star rating is specifically for the service, and it makes me sad to give it.

Ok. I have been here twice now-- once towards the end of the brunch rush and once at peak dinner time on a Saturday night. I preferred my brunch experience because we were seated almost right away. The drinks were really great (particularly the La Paloma). And I am a sucker for good jalapeno corn bread. I was with a group of 6 and we arrived late afternoon (around 3pm) on a Saturday. There is a beautiful view of the city from this rooftop location. And the food and drinks live up to the quality of the view.

Came back this weekend and had another great time! I ordered the usual but this time I got the La Paloma pitcher! I have to this was the best La Paloma I've had. i had the chance to meet the GM.. i forgot his name but he was really friendly and very accomodating! we set reservations at 12pm.. but ran 30 min late coming from sacramento.. they ended still holding our table! I cant wait to come back!
Good SF view. THE BEST salsa I've ever had.

Excellent brunch experience. Shared the Tostada Francesa, but ordered the Benedictos for the main event. Delicious! The drinks were really good too. Had a Mimosa, then a Pisco Sour. The view is spectacular from the roof. And we had a great server, Luis A., who delivered expert service. It was quite pleasant and relaxing, and will return soon.

As a newcomer to SF from sunny southern california - there's two things that really stand out about this spot - beautiful skyline views and HEAT LAMPS. Not being accustomed to the cold, it was a nice first place to visit after moving into the city.

El Techo has great food and I love the pork, plus the tres amigos drink combo, although the service is not that great. It is worth the wait for that amazing view and the food, but I feel like unless you keep checking with the host, they eventually forget about you. And if you make your way to the bar for a drink, don't even bother thinking your party will be seated - expect to stay at the bar. I like the space heaters for cold nights but wish they occupied more of the rooftop space to accommodate more guests.

A friend recommended El Techo de Lolinda for its amazing rooftop views and good food. I'm a poor graduate student and don't usually splurge on fancy places like this, but I decided to take my friends since I was moving soon.

Love this spot in the city! I've been three times now with groups of friends and the views from the roof are beautiful, especially if you arrive early enough to see the sunset. Food is also delicious, I always get the pork quesadilla and the meat is to die for.

My friend and I were in town for a fun girls weekend and we were told by another friend to try this place for brunch. This review is about BRUNCH only. And boy was it a good reccommendation! This is a rooftop restaurant that serves delicious tapas as well as larger, more filling dishes. The food is fabulous! We didn't have a reservation but got there early enough to be a walk in...we stood in line for 30 minutes and then they opened and we got seated fairly quickly. I will make reservations ahead of time next time.
Solid, traditional dishes with rich, delicious flavors and reasonable, unpretentious prices!

It was a Friday evening around 730-8ish, me and one of my best friends were looking for Italian places to eat around the mission area because I was craving and I wanted to go somewhere I've never been before. Walked into a couple of restaurants by the help of yelp but unfortunately the wait was too long for impatient stomaches. We stop by Phat Phillies restaurant to say hi to his friends. One of them recommended La Triviata and boy did we hurry there (at this point we were starving). The entrance was really low key and a little endearing. Walked into a cute little waiting area where you can sit down and look at the menu until they seat you. "Table for two?" Said the kind host and then he proceeded to seat us onto a table. All I see around me are painting and photos of what seems to be family, mixed with cultural art. So beautiful. The waiter came to take our order but I had a couple of questions about the menu and he answered all of them with an assurance that he understood my question trying to answer it as best as he could. The service was amazing and the food came quick! Okay, here we go. THE FOOD- let me just say I'm a hint of Italian so it explains my weekly craving for the delicacies and I've had my fair share of Italian cuisine. This place, by far, hands down has one of the best, tender cooked chicken I've ever had with some bomb pasta and the creamiest sauce exploded in my mouth. Accompanied by La Rossa of course, woah party. Ah, satisfied but sadly too full to try dessert, thank God for next time. My favorite part is that it's not too loud in there. Everyone respects the quiet atmosphere. Great service, great food! What more can you ask for! Plus I went to the bathroom and I was always told that when in a bathroom of a restaurant, check the cleanliness. If the bathroom is clean than most likely the whole place is. And it was! Five stars! Love this place and will be back sooner than soon!
Amazing Italian food really!

Love the food. Got pasta , hubby got veal. He is not a big fan of pasta, but this place makes him ate all my pasta. Veals with sautéed mushroom with white wine was great too. Cozy restaurant, love when the owner cares about their customers. Will definitely go back next time we visit San Francisco.
Ate here with the bf on a rare warm sf summer. It was pretty warm inside but they were very good about replenishing the water.

Note that the menu you see on Yelp is outdated. Everything is about 2-3 dollars more expensive now. It gets pretty busy on weekend nights so I would recommend getting a reservation. Very cozy atmosphere, clearly the restaurant has a lot of history. Had the Alla Carreras (sausage pasta) which was delicious. One of us got the tinta (calamari pasta w/ squid ink sauce) though he didn't think it was that great. Another one of us got the Salmone Alla Wixell which was very delicious. The service was great, however, and I would definitely come back again.

After so many years, I'm pleased to say that La Traviata remains a very "homey" restaurant--cozy, with well cooked (and well presented) entrees.  I hadn't been in quite some time and last night I got together with a couple of my closest friends and I'm so very grateful to the restaurant, that they paced our meal, permitting us to enjoy and savor every moment of our dinner and company.  Thank you La Traviata!  We'll be back!

Very nice place. Went in randomly with my girlfriend. Food was really good, service attentive, prompt and the place in really clean inside. Kitchen area too. That's a big plus in my book. Old school is the best school :). Big selection of items on the menu and huge desert menu too. If you want a chill place with good food and a relaxed vibe don't hesitate to try it anytime.
It's refreshing to have an authentic Italian spot in the heart of the mission.
Less than a minute walk from 24th Street BART exists LA Traviata, an Italian restaurant we'd never really noticed before.
This place never disappoints, great food fine wine fabulous service. Not sure why people wait in line at other places when you can go here.

The menu is completely wrong, make sure to go to the restaurants website before coming. We were a little thrown off by the prices so be careful! Otherwise, La Traviata has fresh yummy bread, fast refills, and is a quiet and quaint place for family and friends.

Old school Italian decor w/ friendly enough servers who liked to joke around except 1. Didn't get to order until 30 minutes later despite holding my arm up several times and making eye contact. When we FINALLY flagged down the server who was avoiding me, he told us he'll get the other server to help. Great. Another 10 minutes rolls by.

I tried La Traviata for the first time and really liked it.  It is a cozy gem in the Mission District with just the right amount of background opera music.  I'ts a great restaurant if you want to enjoy a good meal along with interesting conversation and not have to compete with loud music.  The fresh bread served is outstanding.  They give generous servings of wine and the Pinot Grigio was very good.  Best of all was the meal itself.  I had the basa piccata with capers and it was delicious.  My partner's meal was also yummy.  The service was very good and the atmosphere is friendly.  I liked the overall ambiance with many pictures of patrons and celebrities on the walls.  A great Italian restaurant that is now on my list of favorites in San Francisco

If you are looking for a quaint, cozy red-sauce Italian restaurant, this is the place! The food is delicious and unpretentious and the staff is warm and friendly. A wonderful break from the newer, glitzier offerings of the Mission.

From New York. 30 years looking for a good Italian family-style restaurant in SF. Disappointment after disappointment.  The came La Traviata. Superb food. Great atmosphere and staff. Veal scallopini the way it's supposed to be (no knife needed),; outstanding lasagna and soup.  Great desserts.  Just wonderful homemade food. Go there.  You won't be disappointed.

This is possibly the most authentic Italian place I've ever been to. Upon walking in you'll notice the place is quaint. The walls are full of pictures and paintings. My favorite was the stain glass of a woman whose dress reminded me of Belle from Beauty and the Beast. But, back to the point.
Consistently good Italian food. The bread is always piping hot and tastes really fresh. I recommend the seafood pasta.
Love this place. Old school authentic. Crowd always pleasant, staff top notch. Great place to "get back to basics" when you've had too much if the trendy "next best thing".
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the City.
I love, love, love it!!!
Best Italian.

Love this place - it's so bizarre to find a great Italian restaurant in the Mission, but I'm a big fan.  We had the lasagne - perfect - and the salmon in parchment - a real stunner of a dish.  Food was perfectly cooked, served with expertise, and it's a great find.  Happy to be a repeat customer, and recommend it when a burrito in the nabe isn't quite what you are looking for.

Discovered this place the other night.. SUPER cute inside. Love the cozy, comfortable feel of it. Front of the house was a very nice older gentleman. Caesar salad and pasta was fantastic and reasonably priced. Already looking forward to my next visit!
Came here with a friend for his birthday last night.  Yum yum!
You know it's the real deal when the staff is speaking Italian!

I love this place. Yes, it's a bit kitschy with the opera theme, and the menu's a bit on the simple & heavy side (they do have salad, but it's not their best menu item), but the service is always friendly and I've never had trouble getting a seat. In fact, I walked by for years without coming in because it looked so empty I thought it had to be a front for something... but now I think of it as a well-kept secret.
Our first time here and I have to say it was really good! The service was great! Were definitely coming back!!

I love this restaurant. No frills Italian food at good prices (the horrible, horrible pasta at Pizza Joint down the street has comparable prices). Friendly and unique. For Italian in the Mission, it doesn't get better than this place.

Delicious small good Italian restaurant try the tortellini the white sauce is to die for great small business will go here again waiters where nice and food was real good everything we ordered we liked.

I love this place located in the mission it's a fantastic restaurant to go to. I was with a group of friends there last night as it was one of their birthdays. It was fabulous they even unexpectedly turned out the lights to sing her happy birthday with a tiramisu and a candle, the waiter must have heard me day to her that it was her birthday and randomly just thought of this kind gesture. Love the staff so warm and inviting.
Unique atmosphere. Good food.

My first time eating here. (I had the alla carreras.) Spectacular and delicious no-frills Italian food! Homey decor, soft opera music,  great presentation, friendly service, open late, and the price can't be beat. What's not to love?

I can't understand all of these high reviews.  The service was fast and relatively attentive - 4 stars - but the food was 2 stars.  This is like a 1970s throwback, in terms of decor, ambiance, and food.  Strange to have this here in the Mission's Gourmet Ghetto.  The octopus was not fresh and had a strange texture - perhaps it was from a can or a jar.  The shrimp was slightly old and the pasta with it was so bland that I decided to take most of it home and doctor it with my own spices.  (Salt alone couldn't compensate.)  Yes, there's hot bread, but it's like Wonder Bread with a harder crust.  I won't be returning.

I had walked by this place a lot of times and finally wandered in late on a Friday night. I couldn't find the hours posted outside so when we came in we asked how late they were open, only another 15 minutes or so. They were still super nice, and told us it would be totally fine as long as we ordered soon. They brought us bread which was delicious (we were also super hungry). I had bruschetta and gnocchi with pink sauce. Both were tasty and the gnocchi was some of the best I've had. I've had trouble finding an Italian place I love outside of NJ. This place is much more accessible than North Beach.

I found this little place randomly while walking down mission st. I felt like I wasn't dressed well enough at first, but then I looked around and realized there was a mixture of attire amongst everyone. I was there around 6 on a weekday and it wasn't that crowded.

After facing an hour and half wait at Beretta, my hungry tummy brought me to La Traviata instead. I was immediately drawn in by the authentic old-school Italian look and feel to the restaurant and the extensive menu looked promising.
If you're looking for no frills, great tasting Italian cuisine in the Mission, you got La Traviata.
For many years, an icon of Italian food in an incongruous place. I have never had a so-so dish of anything here, and portions are large.

Italian is few and far between in this neighborhood. As such, I settled for this place, but will not be going back any time soon. I was in the mood for some basic Italian staples. A Caesar Salad and some bolognese - I ordered both. And for good measure, also tried the vinaigrette marinated octopus. The octopus looked and tastes like it had come out of a processed can and was tossed in a bowl of Newman's. The Caesar was served room temp and was only saved by the waiters generous offer of cheese.  And without a bolognese option, I settled for sausage and mushroom with fresh tomatoes. Sausage and mushrooms - yes, fresh tomatoes - no. A few Roma tomatoes cut in half with some canned sauce doesn't quite count as Italian.

New Alternatives Café is a very comfortable small neighborhood breakfast and lunch café. We've eaten here a few times as it is around the corner from where we stay when in San Francisco. You get a warm comfortable feeling as soon as you walk in the front door. I've always had sandwiches or paninis for lunch and they are very good. I haven't tried the breakfasts, but I understand they are excellent also. Large menu on the wall behind the deli counter. The Women working there are very helpful and friendly. They have free Wi-Fi too. We will keep eating here
Comfortable spot in the city. Plenty of items to choose from the menu. Free WiFi and t.v.
cute coffee shop with sandwiches, awesome paninis, smoothies, omelets , bagels.. Loved the Madonna Panini !

Very strange coffee shop. My chai latte was yummy when I got it and my cheese croissant was huge and pretty good! I cut back on the stars for very slow service. My latte took at least 8 minuets and my croissant took about 15. Needless to say they were 2 ladies working on my order and it felt like it was taking forever! It's a good thing I wasn't parked at a meter!
nom nom.

Yes, this place just got better.  They now offer WINE and BEER!  How about having a Saturday or Sunday morning mimosa with an omelet.  I did and it was was great.  Then today a beer with my sandwich.  So from now on I can relax, read and enjoy a glass of wine.  I love it as there are very few places I can hang out without having to by a coffee drink.
Had a really nice vegi omelet and the coffee was good.

Cute small spot for a quick, light breakfast or panini. Friendly service, fresh ingredients. I'd check it out again for sure. Best to avoid weekends and lunch time, unless double wide strollers are your scene.

Nice little cafe on the edge of the mission/noe/bernal. The food is solid, good lattes and egg bagels! My son loves the ladies that run the place and they do a very efficient job and are super sweet. Breakfast stop at least 1-2 a week.
Extra caffeine and extra strength wireless! Perfect for getting your caffeine fix and gettin a spot of work done.

New Alternatives is a small, cheerful and comfortable neighborhood cafe offering coffee/teas, organic foods, smoothies and fresh pressed juices. There are 8 tables inside and three tables outside on the sidewalk. Counter service; free wi-fi.

I love this cafe! I spent hours here one day and had the pleasure to get to know Luz the manager- a very pleasant and friendly person. When you walk in, the cafe has a charming ambiance that is welcoming and cheery. You order at the counter where you'll see their menu written on several blackboards up on the wall.  You have an abundant variety of choices from paninis, sandwiches, salads, egg bagels/breakfast, coffees, teas, iced drinks, smoothies and juices. Food items are less than $10, smoothies and juices are under $5 and are organic.

A great small mom and pop vibe coffee spot a short walk from Mitchelles ice cream. If the line is long take the excuse to warm up with their mocha. I tried the white chocolate one and it was so delicious!
The food and coffee are great, but the thing I love the most about New Alternatives and truly appreciate is the people--so friendly, so helpful. That's why it's my favorite cafe in SF!
no thanks!
New horizons.

friendly, comfortable, and reasonable (SF) prices.  I got a Santa Cruz bagel and they really piled on the veggies, which was great especially for the price.  I will definitely come here again, and the wifi works great.

This is my neighborhood spot. It had a bunch of turnover when I first moved onto 28th Street, but Luz has done an amazing job of transforming it into a cozy, personal spot with great food and drinks. Really hoping this one sticks because it's so much better than anything else available in the neighborhood for a quick coffee and bite.

New Alternatives Cafe is perhaps one of the best kept secrets in San Francisco. It has some of the best coffee and food in the city, and it's super cozy. There's couches, comfy chairs, outdoor seating perfect for the sunny Mission district, and computer to use / internet (with a purchase). There's even a book exchange! The owners are incredibly friendly and remember you if you come regularly.
The best huevos rancheros in the city!!! Very nice people :)

Such friendly people with warm smiles, they know my order before I say it, so warm cozy and inviting , a cool place to hang out in the mornings !  The breakfast is good , I love this small business and would recommend it to any of my friends:)
I actually meant to go to a cafe around the corner, but lucky for me they didn't open up for another 2 hours.
Popped in for quick latte to go during a walk of shame in Bernal Heights. Don't judge me. You've all been there.

Friendly service and homey atmosphere.  All the food I've tried has been delicious and ditto with the drinks.  The espresso drinks are perfection and the smoothies I've had very tasty.  This is a coffee house that really comes through in every way....they make the extra effort and it shows.  Even the music level is right on.  I appreciate people and places like this!
Great Food, smoothies and fresh squished juices. I also like their coffee and egg bagels.

This is my favorite breakfast and lunch spot between Noe and Mission, on Guerrero and 28th St.  Restaurant/cafe has high quality food and drinks. The place is very clean with a clean bathroom.  Never dirty. It got a rating from the city inspector of 100 out of 100 points. Many items use organic ingredients and still cost the same as other cafes.
just came here for a cup of latte.

Weird that this nice little spot has so few reviews. Guess it's off the beaten Mission hipster path. They have a great menu, with sandwiches, salads, bagels, omelettes, smoothies and coffee. Everything is fresh and the staff is friendly. It's got the standard small-cafe vibe, with people on their laptops and a book-exchange shelf. Even a few toys for kids to okay with in the corner. The omelettes come with toast and a nice ramekin of fresh fruit. Overall it's a good example of a local independent cafe. I'll be back.

They were friendly, Solid Smoothy! real good, fresh squeezed orange good, real good. Service, real good. Chicken Ceasar Salad, eh. Lids for cups, No bueno! The whole way home I had orange juice leaking all over my hand, lids don't fit the cups at all.

I love this place! whenever I am able, I go to this place for lunch. If you are tired of the wanna be "authentic" places on Mission, this spot is the place to go. Friendly ladies who remember you by name, CLEAN environment, and best of all...delicious food!!!! I love their menu and the Nachos #2 are my favorite.

New Alternative Cafe has everything a local spot needs: comfy seating, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, good coffee and tasty sandwiches. The owner is very sweet and knows all the regulars. An excellent place all around for getting some work done, reading a book, or just socializing.
This is a great coffee shop if you want a really nice place to go that isn't overcrowded and isn't some starbucks (no capitalization on purpose, son!).
Incredible tuna melts. I literally haven't had anything else there because every time I go I get the same delicious thing. You can add avocado. Also good coffee at a good price.
Small and cozy inside with outdoor seating options. Really enjoyed sitting down for two hours of surfing, eating, and coffee. Power outlets are available.

This is a great place to spread out for a remote office for the day. I spent four hours here working. It wasn't so busy that my meeting was interrupting people, nor was it so loud that you couldn't make a phone call. I had a lovely spinach and mushroom omelet here and a couple cups of java. The owner was so sweet she said "goodbye nice to meetcha" when she left.

Quiet and spacious, with a standard cafe menu. I'm granting five stars for the copious parking -- very unusual in the city -- the corner location with wide views of the parklet across the street, and the absence of idiots and scam artists.

Luce is a sweetheart. She owns and operates this coffee shop. It is clean, comfi (new leather couches and several tables and chairs), has some outdoor seating, free wi-fi and even 2 PCs and a printer - available to guests free of charge.
A new owner and a bright new outlook. A welcoming, friendly place that serves good coffee and a tasty range of food. My daughter is a huge fan of the jello with strawberries.

This place was great, with one exception. Loved the ceviche, LOVED the dessert. All the food and drinks were excellent. Pisco sours = yum! The one complaint I have is the hostess (Nadia, I think). She went out of her way to be rude. It was my mother's birthday and when my mom sweetly thanked her for delivering a plate, this chick rolled her eyes dramatically. She continued this behavior from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Not a hint of politeness. It really soured the mood for our entire party, which is unfortunate. We enjoyed the experience
Tapas place. You walk in and it's a totally different aura from wherever you came from. Given we came at night time, it was a different world in there.

I am Peruvian and, thus, I know a lot about my country's cuisine. First, Destino is not a Peruvian restaurant; it is Peruvian fusion. One look at the menu and I only recognized three to four dishes that are typically Peruvian. Besides that fact, the food is delicious and props for presentation. However, I am giving them a one star for the way the servers handled my friend's vegetarian needs. This was specially surprising considering the many vegetarian options on the menu. As we were about to order our many course, my friend asked server #2 to please let our main sever #1 that we are ready to order. Server #2 said that it is fine for him to take our order. My friend asked about the ensalada de Destino as the ingredients were not clear and the room was dark. He especially asked if there was meat in the salad. Server #2 confirmed to him that the salad was meat free. Half an hour later we get our meals and we realize that salad had bacon. I looked at the menu and noticed that one of the ingredients was "jamon". How could a Spanish server not realize this? When my friend asked the server #2 to explain himself, the server #2 was apologetic and summoned our main server #1. He was also upset and took off the salad from our bill. However, server #1 had the nerve to remind my friend that the menu strictly states the ingredients of yhe dish. That is when my friend blew up and said that the severs should take responsibility for their false assurance. He then asked to get his whole meal comped but the server #1 just laughed and walked away. This was ridiculous! So everyone at that restaurant is expected to know what "jamon" means? Also, should we not be able to trust our servers recommendations? This place needs an attitude adjustment and realize that vegetarian eaters take this very seriously. I won't be coming here again. I hope the owner reads this and ensures that his severs learn the menu and also learn how to properly rectify a disastrous mistake as the one that happened to my friend.
Tiny portions, average tasting food, high prices--typical for SF.  Service was really good though.

Reservation was made for 7:30 for a Sunday, Arrived at 6:30 and the place was dead. Ordered the house salad and meat sampler. Food was good, place was dark... But music in the background. It more South American than Peruvian. I will not pay more than $18 for lomo saltado (beef with french fries) let alone their $20+... Crazy.

Overpriced, small portions, food is not good.    We went with a large group, so we tried a large variety of dishes. The bass was smaller than the palm of my hand, served with 3 cherry tomatoes and some green sauce. The lomo had a few pieces of sinewy meat. These were listed under "platos grandes". My friend paid $17 for a plate of raw veggies. The only redeemable dish we tried was the ceviche, which was fresh and tasty. Skip this restaurant - you'll leave feeling ripped off and hungry. There are plenty of better places in this city.

Amazing food and drinks. I had the Pisco sour and it was delightful. Can't wait to go back again! We had the pork starter - I can't quite remember what it was called - but it was so good, we ordered a second. Fun place for a night with friends or as a couple.

I really wanted to like this place but sadly was not impressed.  The food was mediocre.  From the brussel sprouts to the ceviche, it was all just meh, left me wanted more.  The best dish we tried were the empanadas, which the server brought out complimentary (silver lining of the meal).
Such a cute place! The server was very nice and knowledgeable about the food. I would definitely recommend the quinoa balls and ceviche platter
Consistently delightful is how I'd describe Destino. I've been with my wife and two young adult children twice this year and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves on both occasions.
This is a hidden gem.  I had never been before, but I will definitely go back again.
This place is awesome. My boyfriend and I ventured here the other night (looking for something different) and we are so glad that we made the trip.
My friend ab di went to Destinos  a Thursday happy hour. Ambience very nice, amazing staff, unfortunately not that good. We tried most of the little plates in the happy hour menu, and none of them

By far, the best gluten free restaurant in San Francisco.  My party of 4 enjoyed a very nice dinner Saturday night.  The Beet and Strawberry salad has me dreaming for more....it reminds me of a bit of sunshine.  The pork entree stands on its own.  The green sauce served with the plaintain chips is amazing.  I will lust for the green sauce alone!  The ribeye is authentic.  My friends are very strict gluten free.  I was a little nervous because my friend is deathly allergic to gluten.  This place has such high standards of gluten free that I highly recommend it.  My friends were very impressed.  we will be back!
Great, friendly customer service, very nice ambiance and decor and above all really yummy food :) We'll be back!
This place blows so many places out of the water. I decided to be a little adventurous and ordered the chicken hearts. They were so delicious.

Nice ambience. I didn't get to have drinks there, but their gnocchi de yucca was good (but I would not say great) and their arepa with polk shoulder was pretty good. Over all, I thought the place was pretty great for the price!
One word.. EMPANADAS!! The best I've ever had! I also tried the Lomito Saltado and sangria and they were both just ok! I'd go back just for the Empanadas!
good food but too expensive for what you get
Great atmosphere, delicious food and drinks - the chile relleno is incredible! The lomo saltado is so good too, but seems expensive for the size served. We had great service too.
Nice place with a good waiter. He hooked us up- free dessert and 2 glasses of wine on  the house. Small venue, prices are slightly over prices but it's worth it. Enjoy.
Love this place, Juan is the best, he makes you feel at home. The wine list is to die for!
Nice place to go if you want to try Latin American food. Small tapas are well made especially the scallop.
I have been wanting to try this place for a while.  We've eaten at the bar next-door a couple of times (tapas and drinks).
Great place! Both service and good were 5stars!!
Nothing but I was satisfied with the perking here. It was excellent experience for me to be here with my boy friend. We came on time getting the guys active and helpful.

This is time to expose the really thing to my friends and help them to be informed such a good place. This is not for the first time here but for the first time I am writing this. First time I have come here with my friends who were exclusively helpful to me always. Coming here I have been proved the real great place for foods having.
I love the drinks at Destino--you can tell they make them with care.  My favorite is the Pisco Punch.  And the food is good too!  Have a empanada -- you'll be glad you did.

This place is wonderful the food was perfect and the waiter was very attentive. We arrived late due to the rain and still there was plenty of space. I am going to recommend this place to all my friends and will be there again. The only problem
Great food! Great service! Every dish was delicious! It' s best peruvian cousin where I've ever eaten!
Tasty food - get the pork meatballs.  Bar service can be super slow but this is a good go-to if you need last minute reservations.
One of my favorite tapas restaurants. Great tapas and wine.  The waiters are always friendly and helpful. I always end up here when I'm craving tapas.

Made a reservation a few hours prior thanks to Yelp!  Arrived and seated within minutes.  Host was also the server, seemed to be a slower night.  He was quick to get our drink and appetizers order in.
This is okay. I gather it used to be better, but now it's just okay.
Yum - was craving Peruvian food and Destino delivered!  We easily made reservations and were seated right away.

Dined here on a Sunday night with high hopes but were quite disappointed.  Dinner started off well, but by the end we were over this place and couldn't wait to leave.  Our server was Rodil, and we felt neglected for much of dinner.  In fact, it took him 25 minutes just to get us our check.  We ordered 7 small plates to share and the bill was $75 (no drinks).  The only highlight was the plantain chips with dipping sauce and the veggie empanada.  The other 5 plates were not impressive or tasty to us (quinoa salad was super plain I could've made it better myself, the gnocci was so salty that I might as well have bought it frozen at Costco and heated it myself).
Destino has some great cocktails. I had the Caipirinha, and other people in the group had the pisco sour. They have a good wine list and some interesting Spanish and Italian wines.

I had such hopes for this meal, but it ended up being a very disappointing date night.  The space is decorated very elaborately and the bar pisco next door looks pretty nice.  We ordered a bunch of stuff since it would be small plates to share.  The plantain chips and dipping sauce were awesome and the hamachi ceviche was perfect.  The veggie empanada was pretty tasty too.  I would come back to just have these dishes with drinks, but unfortunately we ordered other things as well.
If I could give this 10 stars, I would. Definitely the best food + service combo I've had in the city.
Yes.

I came here for happy hour with my colleagues recently.  The prices for happy hour drinks and snacks are a fantastic deal.  The service ranged from mediocre to subpar.  The person who took my order made a mistake and ended up bringing me an additional order of food.  When I pointed out the mistake, she nervously said sorry and shrugged.
Stumbled upon this spot as a pre meal venture before going to a concert down the street. My friend and I came in and got seated quite quickly and luckily we made it in time for HAPPY HOUR!

Two blocks from work so it is always on the radar for dinner.  Guacamole and chips are great.   Great variety of drinks.  Nice choices of small plates and larger ones.  Friends on diets order salads and small plates.  Fish tacos are great, burger is good though i don't like the bun seems too chewy like it was microwaved.  Service is good, nice to see hardworking latinos being hired in the kitchen and as wait staff.  It is a tex mex or new mexican inspired restaurant so it is only fitting.  Very well run. Very seldom didnt get in in a reasonable amount of time.

The queso is an addictive drug, so delicious. Service is still awesome. 2 things: Please bring back that delicious frozen sangria/margarita like NOW , and that lobster enchilada maybe needs to take a vacation and try something else in it's place. The flavor profile was meh. But I have had so many YES moments at your establishment I ride hard for West of Pecos
The only reason this place is receiving a star is because of the waitress who was extremely helpful.

I should have written this update in a timely manner. The owner had read my previous poor Yelp review, and offered a $25 credit to come in and try them again. So a friend and I returned, on a weeknight, and had dinner. The service was much better. The guacamole and fried chicken we ordered was good.
West of Pecos is a stand out in the Mission!   The food is delicious and the service is outstanding.
So I have been here on many occasions before and have not had problems, but this last time I went in was far from what I was expecting.
Can I get a HIGH FIVE for West of Pecos?! You bet! My experience at West of Pecos in Mission was awesome!

The very first time I had dinner here is was amazing!!! Second time around, huge disappointment. My boyfriend and I showed up at 7pm, got seated and never saw our server again except when she brought the check.
Enjoyed my brunch.  Had a Chile with eggs and corn dish with potato fries and veggies.
I ended up here for dinner shortly after my last review of the bar.
This weekend was my second visit and it was just okay. Unfortunately it wasn't as great as the first time.

Queso and chips make for a great appetiser. The lobster enchiladas are full of flavor, but not enough to share around the table. The Great Pork Trio has 3 cuts of pork with an amazing garbanzo sauce. Go for it. Also, if you are fan of mojitos or caipirinhas - order the "Faith Healer" as the cocktail of choice - it's refreshing and smooth.

Simply delicious food and desserts, like an upscale Mexican restaurant. Cool atmosphere, friendly staff, and again, fantastic food. If you get the chance to meet the owner, Tyler, I recommend it. The guy's a character and everyone seems to know him.

Great food, really nice service. Had the chips and guac. Really yummy, fresh flavor, followed by fish tacos. They are fried- I should have read the menu ( as I don't eat fried food) so I took the battered part off. It was still super delicious and the slaw under has a great lime flavor. Great overall!
One of my new favorites!

Rolled into West of Pecos. Little lady at the hostess stand wrangled us some seats. The grub. Brothers and sisters, the grub. Mountain of alligator pear dip. Tacos with a fried hunk of fish. Shrimps on a stick. And enough liquor to steel us against that mouthy broad at the table over that preached about juicing for an hour straight. Sometimes, a girl's just got to put up her boots and enjoy a little agave.
Wonderful food and drinks!  The devil tooth is the best!!  Chips with melted cheese surprisingly unique.  We had the sliders, fish tacos and the mango and harvest salad and everything was very tasty!
I went here for the Bar:
we got to Sunday Streets early, this time it was in the Mission. Naturally, we were hungry so we made our way to West of Pecos... BEST DECISION everrr

So so good! I came here for a dinner with a couple of girlfriends and was pleasantly happy! We ordered the roadrunner margarita which was a balance of smokey and sweet with every sip! The guacamole was fresh and great (chips not so good kind of stale.) We also ordered the pillowy dough appetizer dipped in honey - holy shit duck fat is amazing! My fried chicken sandwich was sooooo fufilling and I love every bite. I'm scared to come back because it probably won't be as perfect as this time! Highly recommend for a dinner with friends with a great ambiance and super yummy dinner.
Kelsey did an amazing job! She was also such a pleasure! I will definitely come back soon!
Loved the food, drinks and ambiance in the bar. Service was excellent, too! I'll be back next time I'm in San Francisco!
California style Tex-Mex, don't ask, just try it. Who knew CA could do Tex-Mex better than the Everything's Bigger state.
Great food and drinks and a fun place for a girls night out! Would definitely come back again

Just had lunch here yesterday and we were very underwhelmed with our food. My husband ordered the pork flautas...what a disappointment on the easiest food you could serve. The menu just said slow roasted pork yet they threw in kale and onions and drizzled honey all inside. I even told the server he doesn't like veggies so not to add lettuce or guacamole on top but she didn't mention the large amounts of kale inside each of the two flautas.  Menu needs better descriptions of each item.
All Hype, No bite

The hipster bartenders at this place suck. They totally ignored our order for a pitcher for 30 minutes. When we told our waitress- she reordered it and then nothing. Came out. She reordered it 5 minutes later and they finally got to us - 45 minutes after we entered. There are much better places to go within the block then this lousy bar.

West of Pecos has HUGE portions and good food, although it is a bit on the expensive side.  The service is really friendly, and they have mastered the balance of checking in with you enough so you don't feel forgotten, but infrequently so you don't feel bothered or rushed.  The restaurant is large and has a steakhouse vibe, which is great for getting a last-minute table (we made a reservation a few hours in advance, but I don't think the wait would be too long without one), yet it still doesn't feel like a chain.
The food and drinks here are excellent. Whereas most mission establishments have a long line, I never have to wait more than 10 minutes here.

Other restaurants for brunch were about a half hour wait so my boyfriend and I happened to try this place out. It was surprisingly not crowded, we were seated right away, great atmosphere, quick and good service and the food was one of the best brunches I've had in SF. The maple pork belly side was so delicious!! I ordered the Austin style tacos and my boyfriend ordered the carrot cake French toast. It was really unique and amazing food and not even that expensive. Good quality and price. Definitely recommend this place for brunch. We left super full and happy!!!!

I have eaten here before & loved the old menu!!! My fiancée & I ate there last night and thought our meal was horrible & that the new menu was not a great selection at all. They are trying to make it a cowboy type food selection & took away the best selections which were Mexican dishes. As much as there are taquerias everywhere people come to the mission for Mexican type cuisine hello???? Anyways I hope they change it back to the old menu for new & old patrons that frequent the mission as myself!!!!!
I came here for weekend brunch with two of my girlfriends right when they opened, so it was really empty.
Been meaning to try WOP for some time now but only got around to it the other night.

Ambiance was cozy, great loc, and no wait. But the pork trio I ordered was possibly the worst pork dish I've had in a restaurant setting--flavorless, dry and flavorless. Hopefully it was just a one-off!

Great patient service. I had the harvest salad and the crudo tacos. Ahhhmazing. Their mixed drinks look out of this world! We totally panicked and chose this place because it was near our air bnb rental. Sooo happy with the decision.

Ended up here when tacolicious had a 2 hour wait, and SO HAPPY I did!! Margarita pitchers and queso with chorizo are a great start taco Tuesday. My friends and I were impressed with the service and the food. The food isn't your typical tacos and burritos, but was amazing! The chile relleno was to die for- I barely got any because my friends couldn't stop stealing bites.

Decent people.  Clean. Friendly but non existing service.  The vibe was nice. One nice sized TV placed very oddly, you'd have to be sitting in one of 10 seats to have a clear view. Fun spot if just lazy day strolling. Food looked & smelled good. We only had drinks and guacamole with chips and enjoyed tgem.

We were tired and hungry and all the places we wanted to try had long waits.   We saw an empty outdoor table in front of Pecos and we went in to see if they had space.  it turns out that there was a 45 minute wait for a table outside and a 30 minute wait for an inside table BUT we could eat at the bar with no wait if there was room.  Tonight was our lucky night - we popped our heads into the bar area and got a high top table right by the open window - almost as good as the table outside. Our girls night out was getting even better.
Decent place to relax.  A little dirty, tables are sticky and disgusting.   No one that "works" here seems to give a shit.

This place is just one dude, a grill, and a million sausages.  It gets mad busy and the line goes out the door, so don't expect this to be a quick pit stop.  There are a dozens of customizable topping options so you come out with a sausage that really represents who you are as a person, provided who you are as a person involves a lot of grilled onions.  You'll pay a premium for the more exotic kinds (boar, duck, ostrich, unicorn, etc.) but you're really paying for the care that this guy puts into each sausage that he grills.
The more I go, the more I love it

Sausages are ok. The fries were bland and under seasoned and it was very underwhelming. Service sucks. The people here are really rude. I was waiting in line and there were also people waiting behind me. The cashier finishes up the order in front of me, doesn't acknowledge me and immediately just turns around and starts talking casually with his coworkers and laughing about personal stuff- mind u I was just standing there and there was a line building up behind me and neither he or any of the other employees acknowledge anyone in line or even looked over. They continued talking for 5-6 minutes completely ignoring the line. Tables are first come first serve.

From what I can remember about the night I came here, whatever sausage I got was really great but for some reason I remember them not having a wide selection of drinks. On the other hand, their sausage selection is out of this world. Well, not really. But it's expansive.
Thai chicken sausage is awesome! Fries crispy with curry catsup really good!  Friendly staff and great beer selection! Great place to watch a game as well!
Good luck trying to order delivery. You can't call it in and the website blows and you can't pay cash.
Thank you to Rosamunde for making eating gluten-free an enjoyment -- and *not* a nightmare!
Hooray for delicious sausages!  Hooray for an extensive beer menu!

Figured it was time to update my review of Rosamund, considering I have returned a few tiimes. It would be great if they allowed payment by card. Though there is an ATM next door the $3.00 (which will turn into $6.00) is a bit of a turn-off. Alas, I had a craving for their Andouille since last night, so to the ATM I will go.

Food is good but the service speed is unacceptable for a sausage on a bun. My friend and I ordered at the same time. Mine was out in 10 minutes. His took a half hour. Unbelievable. It's just a sausage on a bun. ....
Terrible. Terrible. Service.
Super tasty food and great beer selection weigh it at a four. Expedience, friendliness and portion size get a two. All things considered I would come back and try it all again.

First time visiting this establishment. I came for dinner on a Thursday evening. Easily accessible via Bart which was great! I had the "Rattlesnake" sausage and it was so tasty! I enjoyed the wide selection of beer. Great location and atmosphere. It is odd to see 24th & Mission starting to become so hipster-esque. Nevertheless, I was highly satisfied and will return soon!
I love the beer selection!

So what if I told you there's a hip and fun Resturant that caters to selling exotic sausages as well as other fantastic foods, in a mellow environment. What if this place plays throwback hip hop classics as well as other numerous hits. No this isn't a new club or lounge. It's a Resturant called Rosamunde sausage Grill.

The bf was craving a hot dog so we found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out on a Friday afternoon. Surprisingly, it wasn't busy at all around 3 pm. This place is located in the Mission, so all street parking.

best hotdog place in San Francisco! sometimes i get too many different toppings and everything just falls apart but it is soooooooooooo good! they have homemade potato salads and it is also soooooooooooo good, haha. this place is a must! the mission location is a dangerous but the food is still great. service here was excellent.

My parents were coming for a visit & my dad had his heart set on having lunch at Suppenküche. Unfortunately, why we got near, the entire block was roped off due to some sort of police activity (rumor was it was a man hunt).
My wife Margaret and I ventured over from the East Bay to eat some sausage for a dinner date.

This is my first review for Rosamunde? Cannot believe it! Since the moment I discovered this place I fell in love with the combo of sausages and beers! Every friend that visits me, gets to discover it as well. After living in Prague, sausage and beer have been my thing! and this place makes me happy every time I come. I like it even more than the beer garden down in Hayes, at least the sausages selection.
Sausages have gotten less meaty and more watery from when I last had it.

Never been to a place before where you order take out then when they five you tons if food they ask after the fact for 10 cents. I understand the law you just don't set people up like that and then act haughty about it. Awful attitude.
Gourmet hotdogs?! Yes please!

Man, I do not make it here as much as I'd like! The sausages are so frickin' good! Whether you're looking for a classic brat, trying to spice it up with a habanero sausage, or change it up with a bison and apple - each sausage is expertly crafted and seasoned.
This place is incredible, enough different kinds of BEER to make your head spin and I love that they have veg and vegan option with their sausages. You don't find that every day.
Excellent brats, and a nice selection too! It's definitely among the best German food I've had in SF.

Some pretty good specialty sausages, but you're paying a pretty hefty price at $7 and upwards for a glorified hot dog. Plenty of good beer on tap so not a bad place to grab something to eat while you drink. But nothing really here to entice me into seeking this place out again.

Had the absolute worst experience with Anthony.  Called because I was shorted a couple items from my order and Anthony told me it wasn't his problem.  Did I hear that correctly?  Unfortunately, yes.  Really disappointed and frankly quite appalled that he's interacting with customers.  In any case, I will not be ordering again and will be sure to share the experience with my friends.   Would advise you to stay clear.

Came here with my wife and daughter and we all left stuffed!  Amazing sausages of all kinds, a great beer selection - I got the wild boar sausage with a Kellerweise which was a perfect combo.  My wife got biscuits and gravy and my daughter got waffles, both excellent.  We will definitely be coming here again!

Loud rock playin, at times could barely hear myself think. The andouille was good but the truffle sausage just tasted like a white hot (white hotdog), blah texture and taste, not a hint of truffle at all.

I'm not sure what vibe is going on in this place but I loved it.  It is in the heart of the mission, but from what I can tell is a german sausage and beer bar.  Easy to find location with a good sized TV at the bar and a big TV in the seating area.  Pricing is cheap for food and beer and there is a massive selection of sausage and beers to gorge on.  The server and cashier were super friendly and even though it is cash only, they offer paypal randomly.  Gotta get that Venmo!  I had lamb sausage and a brat and both were served on a good roll with fixings and put me in my happy place.  Great spot for an afternoon brunch and lunch.
Office catered lunch from here. Sausages, yum!!

Ate here a couple of times. They accept paypal, which I was able to get $10 off each time, which practically paid for my meal. They have various flavors, some very exotic like snake and alligator. They also have a big selection of beer. It's self service basically. You order at the counter, and wait to pick up your order when your number shows up on the screen or is called. You get your own sauces, my favorite is the wasabi mayo and curry ketchup. It could be a bit messy eating so make sure you get a lot of paper towels. Service is a bit slow after you order.

No complaints. I met up with some girlfriends after a long day for drinks.. a lot of beers I didn't know but when I was talking to the bartender and requsted a "run of the mill" beer she suggested one what was very close. Prices where normal and the atmosphere was nice. A little to loud, but only because we where gossiping and really wanted to hear every word ;)
Nice bar close to the 24th Bart station
Awesome place in the Mission. The Hot Dogs are super,  my favourite is hungarian + grilled onions and beef chili. One of the best beef chili i've ever taste.

Get ready to wait a while for a sausage. Rosamundes is there for me when I get that craving and for some reason can't make my own sausage (for half the price easily.) They have a good atmosphere, especially if your a frat boy looking for an alternative to pluckers. I got the mission street a while back, which either had bacon or was the classic beef. One thing I can say for sure is don't get your dog toped with the beef Chile. Just because it's meat doesn't mean its going to be better. Also, they have thick fluffy buns. I suggest being adventurous. Try try something that you couldn't make at home.

The sheer number of sausages and draughts will leave you staring, mouth agape, for a solid ten minutes after you walk in the door. My compatriots and I finally settled on a round robin approach, and basically ordered everything to share.
Babies, beers, and World Cup on the big screen!
My all time favorite taqueria!   Been going here since I was young, for over 20 years.   Although I have been living in the East Bay for almost 10 years, I alway make time to come back!!

This true SF native has been hitting up this spot for over 20+ years for the scrumptious big ole burritos, quesadillas and nachos carne asada drenched in that famous salsa verde with a touch of fresh squeezed lime every time. WATCHU KNOW ABOUT THAT!!!
best mexican food ever lol been eating here forever been to their other locations throughout nor cal and each one is great and affordable...nothing fancy just good.
oh Farolito, what must I say about you!!!
Amazing food... Not too many seats and the bathrooms are disgusting. If you're getting take out or stopping in for a quick bite its perfect.

While this isn't my original El Farolito location, it's now my favorite and the one I frequent the most.  It seems a little cleaner, brighter, and has more seating than the location that's actually on Mission.

Avoid. They tried charging us $40 for a $25 bill and, argued with us to the death when we pointed it out. We paid 2.50 per beer, and under $10 per entree per person (2 of us), so there was no basis for them to argue. We called ahead and they screwed up our order., even given plenty of time. Normally people get chips while they wait. We didn't.

I love the food here but I'm so tired of being harassed by two particular employees. I'm a 20s white female and I usually go there alone, and these two guys will always find a way to touch me. Like they will walk by me and grab my shoulder, or they grab my hand as I try to take my meal. Or they will wipe down all the tables near me and really obviously stare at me the entire time.

Hair. Two times. Once in a burrito at a different location. This time in a steak taco. Gave them another shot, thinking this location would be better. Mistake. The only advantage is that it's open late, but you're better off going anywhere but here. Tacos and burritos are only average compared to all the other options in the city. Try La Corneta or La Taqueria.
This is the best taqueria. For sure. The service is great. The food comes fast. And every burrito leaves you with a deep pleasure and desire to return. 538 doesn't know anything.

This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant ever!  I spent my formative years living in this neighborhood, so I have been to this place countless times. The food is very authentic (i.e. no refried beans), the staff is all Latino, and the jukebox only has music in Spanish. All the burritos are great (even the tongue and brains). Prizes have gone up in the past few years, but this is still a pretty affordable place. They have a good selection of Mexican beers and Aguas Frescas. Eat here, then go across the street to the Mexican bakery and get yourself some dessert. This is the place where we always take out-of-towners to experience real Mexican food. Excellent place!
This is the third L Farolito restaurant that I've tried just as good as the other two and if you get there around 1 AM there's no line :-)

My favorite burrito place in the mission, authentic taste and at a great price. I get the carnitas super burrito, but have had all the meats and none of them have been sub-par. Wish I could eat here more often.

Tonight I ordered my burrito over the phone and the guy said it will be ready for pick up in 5 minutes. I got there in 10 minutes and the cashier said they don't make the order until you come in and pay for it. So why wasn't I told this over the phone? I now see why they didn't win best burrito place in the country. That goes to La Taqueria on 25th and Mission.

This place is slightly more than all right. The line forms outside the door, and the food is just meh! I would have to say that if the  El Castillito by duboce triangle closes down this would be my next choice on burritos ! P.S. i still have to try La Taqueria in the mission to have an overall comparison.

I had high expectations of this place after my friends kept talking about how good it was for late night drunk food.  Tried the Boss's burrito which is super burrito with big shrimp and al pastor.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly, that was the highlight of the burrito.  Also this burrito was huge, you can split between two people.  The flavor of the burrito overall was a little bland.  I also tried a bite of a carnitas taco, the carnitas was soft, but not crunchy like i like, lacked seasoning.  It was an alright experience.
I am so happy to have this place near my home for late night eating.  Always hits the spot at 1am.  Its very low-budget, but I have never had any problems with the quality of food served here.

I have been swinging by here the last couple days (temporarily staying down the street) and have thus far had the Suiza and the Burrito Al Pastor. The Burrito, which I am currently consuming, is giving me an out of body experience. It is so perfectly designed for this moment.
