This place was good, but as a someone who just moved to the city I'm not sure what all the rave reviews are about. If you head down 24th a bit more towards Potrero there are tons of small Mexican restaurants that I feel are both more authentic and just plain better.
Over all we really love to go here.  Sometimes being a vegetarian is difficult because you're limited to only one menu item per place.  That's how mexican food saves the day!

This place has great food, and at a very reasonable price too! My friend was raving about the shrimp burrito so I gave that a try. The portion of shrimp was generous and the shrimp cooked really well! However, the shrimp burrito was also over $3 more expensive than the regular carne asada burrito, so that was kind of a bummer. If you're willing to splurge, the shrimp burrito is great! Otherwise, the regular burrito is delicious as well and a really good value. Will definitely be back for more!
I love the quesadilla's here and haven't had any other places that makes it like theirs. The portions are pretty big and is pretty cheap. The food is good sober or drunk.

This place was so dirty I could sworn I saw and heard a supper Rat enter through the back door while saying " nobody move and u won't get hurt I just want to bag up all of this garbage from the isles of this Dump." O by the way the burritos That we ordered were to go. Whts good about this place is the free bag u get to take the garbage with you.
Best spot on 24th and Alabama guaranteed. anything with al pastor is good. burritos are bomb. beer and sodas with real sugar, what else could you ask for!

I always went this El Farolito location when I lived in SF to avoid the lines like the ones at the El Farolito on the corner of 24th and Mission. I got so many burritos from this place and they were all amazing. I wasn't into the chile relleno option, but other than that these guys pretty much have burritos and quesadillas spot on.

One word to describe this place.       amazing....    You have to try the beef vegetable soup! Amazing! I recommend it!! Also the quesodilla is to die for! Next time we go to San Fran we are totally free coming back!!!

Hands down, this is the BEST burrito we've have ever had (granted there aren't much authentic Mexican restaurants where we're from), and it comes with such a reasonable price tag ($8)!!  If you are in SF and are looking for some cheap, authentic...not to mention tasty Mexican food, El Farolito is a "must-go".  We tried the Super Carne Asada and Super Chorizo Burritos.  Both were delicious and extremely filling (no chips and salsa needed)!  We went there around 9 pm for a late dinner and this place was booming with business, but they had enough staff to quickly pump out food without having their customers wait longer than 15 min.  Seating does seem to be limited but most of the time people are coming and going at an even pace, freeing up seats and tables for those needing them.

Always a great choice if I want some mexican food while drunk, lazy, tired, or just in the mood for mexican food. The place always has people in it (even late at night) and there's always some sort of weird event that keeps me entertained while I'm there.

Awesome place, if you're feeling the whole authentic Mexican street food scene. I got the Carne Asada torta, tasted amazing!!! Went there on the 4th of July night it was packed and it was already like 11 pm. The area can be sketchy for some but I don't mind. Overall, the food is great and worth the wait.

As recommended, I got the super quesadilla with al cantor. Man, that meat was great--and so cheap! They gave me tons and tons of meat on my quesadilla. I wish they had given more avocado or included other vegetables though. And get ready for the oil! It will drip everywhere; do not wear any clothes you cherish here, just in case.
This is another great taqueria. They don't have much seating but if you need to get something quick to go this is the place. The food is great for the price.

This place was majestic. When I entered this facility, which looks like any standard hole in the wall Mexican taqueria, I didn't expect much. Yeah, my friend kept telling me that she heard that "El Farolito" was good, and the yelp reviews seemed pretty good, but still... how good could a taqueria be. Until... the Super Burrito con Al Pastor... holy shit, it blew my mind. First of all, when they super... it doesn't mean they add guac or whipped cream like Taco Bell uses that term. It just means that it's hella big and hella loaded. I mean... holy crap it blew my mind. So, remember when you buy the super anything... if you're not a large eater, you could probably make 2 meals if you're not looking to carry it out to-go

Gotta admit, the food quality is going down and the prices are going up.  On my last visit it certainly wasn't as good and the carne asada was quite chewy.  I'll be on the look out for a better spot in the mission district.
Great place to catch a bite after work.  open late is a plus.  Bistec is delish! Quesadillas are amazeballs
If you don't like El Farolito; consider the possibility that you just might be a hater.

I'm from SoCal so I feel like I know my Mexican food. I'm not really into the trendy, gentrified Mexican that has been popping up everywhere. I just prefer to have the good flavors of the places back at home.

I am very picky when it comes to burritos, but El Farolito took me by surprise. Not only do they have a variety of options including Chili Relleno Burrito, Vegetarian, & the bosses burrito, they are they fast and friendly. I had never had a Chili Relleno burrito, and I am so glad this one was my first experience. It was so cheesy, it could have clogged an artery, in the best way possible. Then the "Bosses Burrito" was not on the menu, but advertised next to register. My friend decided to splurge on it, and was stuffed and happy for two days. However, despite being called the Super Veggie Burrito, it was almost entirely rice. So I was a little unimpressed there. However, they made up for it in customer service. They were so polite and got our orders to us very quickly. We were even lucky enough to score some free chips!

I went here with my friends after a night at the bar. Super packed, but got my order in a timely matter. The super burrito was really good, but even I couldn't finish this with a drunken stomach haha (which is a good thing). The restaurant is really tiny with little seating, but the staff was quick and welcoming.
Mission always got the best burritos and El Farolito is hands down #1.
I love this place. Not sooo clean, but the best burritos in town! And there are always so many people, that the food is always fresh!

I love their sandwiches! And the asian ladies upfront are always so happy and sweet. This is less than a block away from work and whenever I'm stressed out at work and can't handle it anymore I go here and get some spicy instant ramen LOL to calm me down
I crave this place all the time.
Coffee was super good. The breakfast sandwich especially are large and filling! A little greasy but definitely worth going back.

I work down the street and frequent this place all the time.  It's a great go-to for sandwiches and I especially love their breakfast bagel sandwiches and can eat them anytime of day.  Smoothies are pretty darn good as well for the price; the Banana Lover's is a nice treat on a hot day or for anytime really.

This little shop has really awesome service. I like it when you walk through the door, they greet you with a smile and a hello. They really look like they enjoy their job. I tried the nachos and it was good. I'll be coming back to try the other items in the menu! Thanks for the awesome service.

The sandwiches are very traditional (or some might call them boring) with their ingredients and the service can be a little slow, but the meat is great quality and you get a dangerously large sandwich for the price. Also, they have a huge selection of snacks, drinks, baked goods, ice cream, you name it.

This is my favourite place that i love to get my hot chocolate in the morning with a lot of S.F.P.D officers in the line i fell like its the hot spot approved by not just me but the officers as well. I am in love with them they know my order even before i told them. I love chrystal she is awesome and my co-workers gets all our lunch here in the office. I am so happy with their ice cream and their fresh juices is the bomb! how i love thee fresh lemonade! very afforadable! =) my boss love their fresh orange juice! =)
Food was good, not too expensive but service was slow.
If you order the large version of your sandwich, expect to have food for the whole day. The sandwiches here are super delicious and super big. Great taste and great value.
Great neighborhood sandwich shop. And they make a great cup of joe!

This place makes good smoothies better than jamba...also excellent sandwiches made with Boars head brand meat..if you know your brands that is top notch deli meat......also great salads as well....the ladies that run this place are always smiling, friendly and courteous. ...excellent job
I happened upon this place with a friend who knew the area so I decided to give it a shot for lunch.
Ice cream review only - the huge one scoop is $1.75 and they have chcolate, mango, green tea, vanilla, coffee, strawberry. The ice cream was ok.

Been here once and it was delicious! I got the tuna sandwich and loved it!! You can get it with avocado, and toasted, so that the cheese melts. And it comes with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles and jalapenos. NOM. The service was also fast and friendly!
I come here for coffee.
Crystal, the owner, is the sweetest person around. She makes yummy sandwiches, is always friendly, and keeps her shop spic and span.
Great Pastrami , friendly service, fast! Love this sandwiches!!

Their sandwiches are super delicious. I particularly love the pastrami sandwich. And for the price, you can't really go wrong with this place. It's clean, organized, and well-stocked. The service is excellent.
very solid turkey with avocado sandwich on a dutch crunch, good quality fresh ingredients

This is the kind of corner deli that is the best possible version of what it is.  They're open REALLY early (like 5 AM or before) as well as relatively late at night.  Their deli sandwiches are massive -- like, competing with Mission Super Burritos for "most food for your dollar", and really well crafted and really tasty.

Best hole in the wall EVER. The people that run this place are so sweet. And Chinese apparently. Haha. I had a really good milk tea (that they brewed fresh on the spot) and an amazing amazing papusa. I love Mexican food in the Mission! Not a lot of tables to sit and enjoy but I don't mind sharing. I will be back for the sandwiches and coffee, everything looked so good!
Believe it or not Sweet Chinito actually has sweet Chinitos.

Great sandwiches and great staff. I work nearby and am always satisfied with my food. However, I just learned today that I have been getting charged 50 cents everytime I use my debit card! From now on I will be using my card as credit to avoid getting bent over. Overall, it's a great place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch.

I went here to grab my usual morning sandwich & coffee and Araceli said it's her last day due to an incident her son got into so she had to take care of him. It's simple here, make your own coffee, you have flavors to choose from already brewed and you request what sandwich you would like. It's perfection each time! Araceli is such a sweetheart! Always friendly, smiling and remembers what you, how you want it.

.....because sometimes you want more than a torta, there is sweet chinito's!  I like that its just a walk from work so I can take in the sunshine in the mission and grab a sammy at a real good price :-)
Love and simplicity at  their finest.

I remember when this place was a Baskin Robbins back in the day. Now it's Sweet Chinito, my go to place when I need coffee or a bite to eat while doing my laundry nearby on Sundays. Owner and workers are really nice. They usually know my espresso drink I order when I come-in Sunday mornings. I've had their huge sandwiches...yeah, they don't skimp out!! They'll also sell, when available, pupusas, tamales, and now empanadas. They have a soup of the day, ice cream, donuts, bagels, etc. It's a good place that has everything you need for a snack, lunch, and sometimes in my case, dinner,  when I know I have no energy to whip something up at home after getting off from work.

What others said. Walked by because it's close to my home and because I was craving a sandwich. I usually like complex sandwiches: fancy meats, adventurous aiolis, etc. What you get at Chinito's is very simple: a sandwich with your choice of meat, cheese and toppings. But it's heaping, carefully made, and very fresh. The brilliant execution will have me coming back for more!
Something about a book and it's cover...

On my way to the BART station, I always walked by this place and deemed it dirty and a place that I would never buy food at. Then, I actually yelped it to see if there were any reviews on it and, lo and behold, there were.
Variety in terms of bagels and sandwiches... Quick n friendly service.

This is hands-down the best sandwich shop in the SF area.  Forget those chain "fast-wich" places:  you'll never go back to them after eating here.  My mother had traffic school around the corner, so I ate here while waiting.  Flippin' BEST pastrami ever!  They're so organized, too-little Ramen noodle cups all neat & tidy, near the TV.   Oh, and the bathroom is sooo clean, especially for the city!  (you must go behind the counter-just ask).  The owners are very nice, too.  Fabulous & yummi & clean-what more could you ask for?

$6.30 for good turkey sandy on crunch roll.  lots of fixins' come with.  nothing to run out to if you have never been here before but solidly OK as a lunch sandy option.  would maybe like to see tastier sauces, more meat on the sandy, a side of some kind....

In the mood for a regular sandwich last week, I found Sweet Chinito on Yelp with every review consistent and good. I'd been in there once for coffee while upstairs for traffic school (comedy and ok) but had no food.

My favorite thing about these sandwiches is that not only are they loaded with your choice of meat, but they're also loaded with a bunch of toppings.  Lettuce, red onions, tomatoes, olives, jalapenos, pickles...avocado if you choose (at an extra cost of course).  And the sandwiches are huge and inexpensive!! I split the regular with 1 other person, and the large between 3 or 4 people.  I always get the turkey on a french roll with pepper jack with everything...yum!

Wow, this place is great.  I didn't expect much at all but the sandwiches were absolutely excellent.  The atmosphere is weak, they don't have fountain drinks, but that sandwich was absolutely delicious.
It's always nice to walk away from a place where you thought it was way better than expected and come to find other yelpers feel the same way. Such is the case with Sweet Chinito.
Good sandwiches are shockingly hard to find in this city. Common problems are that they are expensive, small, bland, or overly fancy.
Here is the deal with Sweet Chinito:

I finally got around to trying this place, largely motivated by the strong Yelp reviews. First impressions were not great. No ambiance, smelled like Pine Sol and slow service. I ordered a tuna sandwhich on wheat, to go as I had a pooch with me. Now, I have probably had thousands of tuna sandwhiches in my life. It's my standby comfort sandwhich. And this one was possibly the best ever. Exceptional wheat bread, not the typical sandwhich sliced bread, but something more rustic in texture and whole grain. Perfectly toasted and delicious. The tuna salad was also fantastic, lighter than the norm, seasoned and not smothered in mayo. Chopped lettuce, thin sliced tomatoes and qalitity dill pickle slices.  The kind of tuna sandwhich you expect at an expensive cafe, but rarely actually get. I may go back for another today. This is now my go-to sandwhich place. All hail the Sweet Chinito!
Love this place. Great food and great staff. Shane, the owner, is an absolute dream. Gotta love the Irish
Amazing food. Incredible dirty martinis. Definitely a great vibe for chats, chill and good times. Thank Shane & co.

great new-ish bar on 24th st.  Great food menu, flexibility to accommodate weird bay area diets, I know, I am on one, and pleasant, welcoming staff.  The chef even came out and chatted and checked on us.  We shared tips for gluten-free baking.

I went to Zoe's last week to watch the Giants game with one of my friends. The bar has a chill, relaxed atmosphere and friendly bartenders. The drinks are top notch, but I found the food to be sub par, especially the burger.
The poutine is worth the calories! And great cocktails.  Our waiter was great; gave us enough time in between our cocktails to ask for our orders and checked in with us throughout.

What a pleasant surprise this place was as we stumbled in on a Sunday evening stroll. Generally quiet neighborhood bar with a friendly bartender, great drink specials and what appeared to be really good burgers.

This is my home away from home in the mission.  The comfort food trumps every other comfort food place in SF.  The mushroom poutine is amazing.  Love it.  But shhhhhhh don't tell anyone because I don't want this place to get too popular.

Great local bar, says this out-of-towner.  In town for the wedding of Mission residents, D + M, I enjoyed the libations and conversation at their after party so much that I left my ATM card behind. Not only did my new friend, Shane, mail it back, but he comped some of my drinks!  I'll go out of my way to visit Zoe's next time I'm in town.
Awesome bar, worth your time.
Great local joint with attentive staff! This place is perfect if you want to escape the overrun and overhyped joints not too far down the street.

Hanging with Shane (the owner) on a Saturday night makes this place. The cocktails were delicious and he has fantastic stories to keep you entertained all night long. I had the Trouble and Strife and it was perfectly balanced, not too sweet and not too citrusy but enough of each. And I got the occasional taste of the juniper which is half the fun of drinking a gin cocktail.

Tried Zoes for the second time for the food which was excellent. The wings, and pulled pork sando was amazing. The cocktails like the Gold rush were well mixed and out of this world! Shane the owner was kind courteous host.
I love this place!!! Great Mission bar... Bartender is super friendly.. great music.  Will definitely be back this week!!

The three of us were actually in the mood for Asian food: I, personally, wanted Korean. Given that it was Outsidelands weekend though, we wanted to avoid that part of the city at all costs, so we came to Zoe's for burgers instead. Yeah, perfectly sound logic.
I overate.

Fantastic neighborhood spot. Shane is the owner and goes out of his way to introduce himself to everyone. Draught selection is solid - a nice variety of types which is good for me since I don't love hoppy IPAs.

Extremely disappointed. My boyfriend and I were very excited to try Zoe's last night and went in pretty hungry. We ordered immediately-- a bacon mushroom burger, Mac & cheese, and the salad special. We tried to order 2 of the beers on tap but both were tapped... Not ideal but it happens. Instead, we ordered two mixed drinks... Both of which were pretty good and proceeded to slowly sip on them as we waited patiently for our food. Almost an hour later, when every single other person in the bar had received food and a whole new wave of people arrived, I stopped our extremely busy bartender to kindly inquire. He was extremely apologetic but we ended up waiting another 30 min for our food and ordered 2 more drinks to ease our wait. The bartender offered us a free shot to take with him... Kind but not enough to make up for the experience. By the time we received our food an hour and a half later, the place was clearing out, I'd lost my appetite and wasn't impressed enough by the food to make the wait worth it! Our tab was almost $70 and when I asked the bartender to comp at least the 2 beers he said he couldn't because he'd be fired. Moments later I heard him introducing himself as the owner... UMMM ARE YOU JOKING? I'm typically the easiest person to please service wise but after patiently waiting an hour and a half for our food, comping two beers on tap is the absolute least that could be done. When I heard that our bartender was the owner and still refused to make up for the abysmal service, I lost the empathy I'd maintained through the whole experience. Every other person in the place was empathizing with the fact we'd been there so much longer than them and they already had food!!!

ooOoo yummmmmm I was a huge fan of the mushroom poutine! It's completely vegetarian btw. I called ahead to make sure since we originally were going to have a vegetarian in our group. The mushroom gravy is nutty, earthy and delicious while the 'shrooms were meaty. I didn't miss meat at all.

Most New Orleanian place in SF.  And that's the highest praise I give!  I don't know how these guys pull it off but they've got gorgeous, friendly staff who really want to talk to you, the best vintage cocktails by far in the Mission, delicious, affordable food, a super cozy atmosphere with always enough extra spots to grab a seat (although now I'm second guessing writing this review!), AND zero San Francisco attitude.  In other words, all these glowing reviews are true.  And, for the one or two meanies who wrote such weird things and make me think you must have been at a different bar, I'm happy you are headed somewhere else - more ginger slices for me!

We had a great experience here on a Saturday night.  My fiancé and I popped in for a drink around 10:00pm, and were greeted by a welcoming, friendly bartender.  He handed us a drinks menu and told us we were welcome to sit wherever we like.
I heard some good things about Zoe's and decided to check it out for myself.  What  a great find!  The food was excellent, the service was great and the beer cold!
Good food. Great drinks.
I like Zoe's because they have really good cocktails and delicious food. When I come here, I can expect it to not be really crowded but just enough people to allow for a little people watching.
Experienced mixologist and excellent food. Well beyond my expectations and good prices !
Zoe's is one of my go-to's with the gf.  We frequent this spot, and have been there probably 7 times in the last year.  Of course, it helps that it's walking distance.

My brother and I wanted to come here when we heard they made poutine, which neither of us has tried before. The first time we tried to come, the kitchen had already closed, but we finally showed up at dinner time and were able to order the poutine. It was soooo worth it. Let me put it this way: aside from garlic fries, I don't like fries covered with anything or inside anything (like burritos) because the fries are almost always soggy and lose their flavor). This poutine is the exception, the only sauced fries I'll ever eat. They stayed crisp on the outside and tender on the inside all the way through despite being covered in way too much (aka the perfect amount of) gravy.

More of a drinks place than food--only two real entrees on the menu. But two entrees that are awesome! Burger was extremely well done (medium, actually), and the bacon sandwich was incredible. Great service and great food.
I was in the neighborhood with a couple of friends and I used Yelp mobile app to suggest a nice place where we could sit and chat. Zoe's was one of the recommendations and we decided to try it out.
Update over an update... If it's not obvious, this is an update.
Came here on a whim.  Wanted to bond with my eldest bro.  He sure knows his neighborhood well! Came here on a late Saturday night.
I'm rarely inspired to write reviews these days, but I loved this place. Great vibe, fantastic cocktails, tasty food, and super-attentive service (at least on the Thursday night I was there).
Just had a beer, but this could be your new favorite spot.

If you like douches this is the spot for you! Food is mediocre at best, ditto the cocktails, the wine list looks like the top shelf at the corner store at a cost per glass that you could pay per bottle there. Oh, but the decor is tailor-made for hipsters and they do flock. So if you're a flocker, come here. Or better yet, stay in the Marina where you belong.
Great little spot in the mission. Definitely recommend! Staff is friendly and outgoing. Pretty attractive too!
I had my baby shower here!!

This hip new bar is an awesome addition to the area. The best part--the food is as good as the drinks! I'm of the opinion that you can always judge a place by its fries and Zoe's are out of this world. Of course you got your burgers and wings, but they also have more unexpected choices like poutine and mussels, all with gastro-pub flair.

Zoë's is one of the best bar/restaurants in San Francisco, but don't tell anybody, it will get too crowded. Chef Cherie, just came on-board a couple months ago and I must say WOW, her food dishes are phenomenal...From the Drunken Mussels, awesome Lemon Pepper Chicken Wings, Triple Decker Burgers with Bacon, and her new addition the scrumptious spaghetti clam sauce with garlic bread. The drinks have a fantastic punch to them. Nevertheless, it's the people who work there that set the stage for a high-end, yet down to Earth "Cheers" type of bar and restaurant in which they play awesome tunes too...Kudos for Zoës'!!!
Cool Vibe. Good music, and great poutine!

Bartender/employees were more interested in playing with the music and making drinks for themselves than taking my order. The bar was mostly empty and I waited about 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledge me. After taking my order, the bartender continued messing around with his computer another 10 mins before making my drink. Another employee walked behind the bar and made himself a drink. All while I was waiting. I was probably there close to 30 minutes before I got a drink. Really disappointing service.
If you want to be called "Darlin'" and "Sweetie" by a 20-something snide bartender, go to Zoe's.
What a surprise!  They sell the best boba I've ever had. Small place, friendly staff.  Mission district has great boba and crepes in this place.
Talk to god.

This is a little and great spot , very convenient , inexpensive place and Friendly people. I had the Baja Crepe ( shrimps & mushrooms ) got lot of shrimps . So yummy .  Complementary hot chocolate with marshmallows was delicious.  I really recommend this place.
This little restaurant is a easy drop in spot for a meal.  I had the Mexican crepe which was tasty. The homemade salsa and guacamole delicious.

Really little spot with 4 tables inside. Really friendly staff that gave my friend and I free boba. Got the cookies and cream crepe and it was solid. My friend got coffee and said it was instant so maybe avoid that.

This place is mostly know for crepes, but I decided to stop by at lunch for a quick takeout sandwich. At first I thought $7 was a little steep for a chicken club, but the sandwich was huge and came with some delicious chips on the side. The people working there are really down to earth, I was brought out a much needed glass of ice cold water while waiting for my takeout order.
Shrimp and mushroom crêpe with canned mushrooms? Are you kidding me? I didn't even know canned mushrooms still existed!!
Best place ever !!!!  I had a crepe with strawberries Nutella and much more and it was best . Gave us the best customer service !!! Lol
Loved this place! The food is great and the customer service makes it that much better. I will be eating here very often and very soon.
Small restaurant, friendly owner.Very good crepes, can be made gluten-free, and also gluten-free / dairy free.

Stopped by a few days ago with some friends while exploring the city and all I can say is wow! The customer service was great and the food was absolutely amazing! It may not look like much from the outside, but believe me it's great! I'm already ready to go back for some more!

I had never had a crepe in my life and I'm so happy I chose here to pop my crepe cherry here. DELICIOUS!! And the employes/owners are so nice! They brought us complimentary hot coco after our crepes and ice cream with by the way was also AMAZING. And they have a rewards card which makes you wanna go back for more and more. Unfortunately, i don't live in the city but when I return in a month or so, I'll definitely stop by Little Heaven again.

This place is a great place to eat at, and they make your experience there a great one. Not only is their food amazing, but they were both so sweet to me and my friends. The crepes were delicious and healthy and the ice cream was great. They also gave us free hot chocolate in a cute heart shaped cup! Great service, can't wait to go back !

Fantastic gluten free crepes....we tried the Mexican crepe & a sweeter variety with nutella, marshmallow, & whipped cream.  My 9 year old daughter asked if we could eat there everyday.  Great hot chocolate too.  The owner(s) was very hospitable, giving helpful tips about the city.  I wish we had a Little Heaven Deli in Minnesota!
Good coffee, and gluten free sweet and savory crepes! If I feel like gluten free pancakes and Radish has a stupid long line, this is my plan B!
I had the strawberry Nutella crepe.  Absolutely delicious.  Well balanced, priced well and the portion was generous.  I'd definitely do that crepe over and over again.

Great crepes! They offer buckwheat and rice flower. They savory crepes are very filling. They offer vegetarian and meat filled savory crepes, as well as sweet crepes with various fillings. The owner was very nice and friendly. He made us feel right at home. It's a small place, only 3 tables. Best if you keep your party 2-4. Very cute, cozy, and welcoming. Highly recommend!

This place is an amazing little hole in the wall with cute little clouds hanging from the ceiling.  They make delicious gluten free crepes out of rice flour. My friend and I had a vegetarian and mexican savory crepe, they ordered a peach slushy and WOAH! The food really strummed my heart strings. Also, the folks working there were very kind and thoughtful. At some point they gave us hot chocolate in heart shape expresso cups with a plate of little marshmallows on the house and woah again, their hot chocolate has such a distinct and rich taste. The experience was utterly divine.

Really tasty crepes! Some of the softest, thinnest batter I've had outside of France (though they could be a tad crispier). And a homey atmosphere - the place is tiny and run by a boyfriend / girlfriend team.
Wow!! This is what I want!! All the ingredients fresh! Creeps are delicious!! This is real 5  I've been trying creeps everywhere, but this one is so perfect!!! Best place!! Definitely recommend it!!

Gluten free people: you must try this breakfast place! Amazing crepes and super nice friendly staff. They're really careful and make sure that no cross contamination happens. I had buckwheat crepes with eggs ham and cheese. Sooooo good. Super small place, only a few chairs, but worth getting a seat if you can.
Amazing Crepes. This is a small hole in the wall place which serves really good Crepes.

This place is a diamond. Allow me to editorialize: some places in SF have this attitude where "You have the privilege of eating in my amazing establishment." Other places, like here, take pride in their work but with a very important differentiation: "It is our privilege to share our wonderful food with you." The owner and staff are a pleasure to be with. The place is unassuming yet clean with a perfect health score. What about the food itself? Fantastic. Some of the best crepes I've had anywhere. Try their spicy salsa if it's appropriate to pair with your selection. Try the Mexican hot chocolate--truly heavenly. The only critique I had was the regular coffee was sub-par, so I might recommend avoiding that and instead order an espresso drink or a Mexican smoothie. I will definitely be coming back again.

I have never had such an amazing crepe in my life and it's gluten and dairy free special made!  He makes this batter fresh, they have only been open for 6 months come here for amazing crepes both gluten free and normal, we got three different ones all amazing the mexican, nutty banana, and the fruit marvel all exceptional!  Get the mexican hot chocolate too

These are some damn good crepes made by some really sweet people. I had the sweet tooth gluten free crepe and my gf had the regular heavenly delicious crepe. We literally tried to go back the next night to get the same ones again, but didn't make it in time, so we went the following day. I called in a half hour after closing (not even realizing) and they still made our order for us! I have never had a regular crepe but when I'm eating the gluten free one I don't feel like I am missing out on anything, it's phenomenal. They have given us free Mexican hot chocolate every time we have gone in and that's also really tasty. I do recommend calling your orders in as they only have one grill and the wait time can be long if you don't, especially when the grill needs to be cleaned for a gluten free order.

Gluten free crepes! The texture is different than regular wheat crepes but still so yummy, especially for the sweet ones. Try banana & strawberry with Nutella. They make the GF crepes to order so they're really fresh. Really friendly owners, nice mixed crowd, casual spot, free wifi, very affordable, right on Mission Street so a very convenient location. The kind of small business you want to see more of in the Mission. The owner said he is trying out a buckwheat gluten free crepe recipe, so hopefully that pans out too, I miss my crepes since Ti Couz closed!

OMG!!! This place is an unqualified little gem. Something about his batter makes the most delicious crepes. The breakfast savory crepe is to die for but even just a cinnamon and sugar crepe, so inexpensive, totally rocks.

It doesn't look like much from the outside but the Little Heaven Deli is AWESOME.  The owners are so kind and attentive.  The gluten free savory crepes we ordered were delicious and they even threw in a free dessert crepe along with Mexican hot chocolates.  So unexpected and unheard of in this town!  Don't be put off by the location.  You won't regret it.
Fruit marvel crepe - 7$
Amazing service, amazing gluten free crepes, excellent hot chocolate! New favorite spot in the mission.

I was aimlessly walking on Mission and i came across a sign that said Crepes. I had to stop, walked in, smelled the savory crepes and ordered the Nutella and sugar crepe, with some whipped cream. It was cheap, only $3, but the taste wasnt cheap, rather very rich in flavor... kind of had a 'Meg Ryan moment.' The owner gave me a free mexican hot chocolate. If your ever in the area, do yourself a favor and stop in.
A friend and I were looking for a gluten-free place and yelp recommend it.

Anytime someone comes to visit, I take them here for a locals breakfast.  This is old (authentic) Mission, not new (overpriced) Valencia.  The owners are the nicest people ever, and follow up with delicious food and drinks.  My favorite is the banana nutella crepe, my partner gets something new every time (bacon/cheese/egg/turkey/ham/etc).  His favorite are the sides - homemade guacamole and mango salsa.  We hang out and drink coffee, and always have a great time. Last time we got hot chocolate and whipped cream, delicious. The prices are insanely cheap.  Great way to start our weekend.

My friends and I came in because one of us has a gluten allergy. The food was great, and my friend said that her gluten-free crepe was delicious! In addition, to great food, they offer great service. We even received complimentary samples of the Mexican hot chocolate! Next time we're in town, we'll definitely be back!
A great little place.  It pleasantly surprised us, particularly, their gluten free option.  I've taken them our kids.  They liked it as well.

We had the Mexican hot chocolate and 2 Vegetarian crepes: one flour and one gluten free. Both were excellent. The mango salsa, guacamole, and salsa picante were delicious additions to the crepe. The owner was very friendly and attentive to our meal. Great experience.  We would definitely return.
Love this little place. The presumed owner is lovely and clearly cares a lot about his products. Tasty hot chocolate.
Little Heaven has only crepes post on the sign board with no pricing. a tattered plastic menu has some sammies on it so went for that.

My husband and I happened upon this place and were pleasantly surprised they made gluten-free crepes!  We both eat gluten and dairy free, so it was such a treat for us to enjoy crepes!  We ate a delicious savory Mexican crepe with chicken, quac and they happily substituted mushroom for the cheese.  They Sweet Tooth simply  filled with Nutella and topped with chocolate sauce and a dusting of powdered sugar also did not disappoint.  It is such a treat for us to be able to enjoy dessert since desserts at most restaurants contain either gluten or dairy.
Seriously awesome creeps!! Great staff, great manager!

Not sure how this happened, but one sake each for three people and just enough small plates to still leave hungry somehow came to a whopping total of $200. I would have been hard pressed to spend $60 for a similar order at another decent izakaya. No wonder this place was empty while neighboring establishments had lines. Nothing was bad, but everything except the Dashi Maki Tamago was surprisingly (at these prices) unmemorable.
An upscale alternative to the loud (oftentimes greasy) izakayas, serving up Asian-style bar food! Yuzuki shows that it's possible to prepare healthy, organic Japanese cuisine for sharing. Who knew?

Consistently great food, beautifully presented & full of authentic, subtle flavor. As someone who has lived in both Kansai/Osaka and Tokyo, I really feel transported when I eat this food. I always appreciate their efforts.

Wait staff was weird and basically creepy, but mostly friendly. They actually corrected my date's pronunciation of his own name. The sake selection was fun and impressive, but I couldn't understand the wine-guy's explanations. There was a kebab/meatball that was really good.
What an absolute treat. This is real Japanese food, simple but umami flavor-packed, beautifully presented, and meant to be enjoyed slowly.
Pretty tasty skewers but very pricey.

So I had the opportunity to check out this upscale izakaya last night that is located in the mission next to one of my favorite bakeries; Tartine. When I heard the term izakaya I envisioned multiple skewers as that term has been drowned out with that concept. This place is serving up true obanzai cooking and offers dishes that are not commonly found in the US. The décor of this joint is simple but classy and im not sure what it was, but it felt very comfortable and "home like." Not that I am Japanese ... so bit perplexed but no complaints. The servers were extremely helpful and were able to explain the various items on the menu with great detail.

Yeah I'm a  round  eye , gaijin dude who has been around plenty of Asian cuisine,  IN  Asia, but didn't know squat about Izakaya, until now. This particular Izakaya specializes in food prepared using Koji,  " a process of natural fermentation that makes food more palatable and easier to digest, with a mild flavor enhanced by naturally-occurring amino acids" I guess that explains the propeller butt a few hours later.

The name is actually quite misleading, this is not the kind of izakaya you had in mind. but if you are familiar with Obanzai cooking (aka Kyoto cuisine) then you are better prepare for what's on the menu.

One of the best Japanese izakaya places I've been in since Tokyo. Everything I ate was exceptional, and I enjoyed chatting extensively about the sake list. Definitely on my list to try again when I'm back in San Fran.

The food is completely average. We didn't really enjoy anything and we ordered a variety of dishes since we were 6 people. The service is not good, the server was always in a hurry. This place is really expensive for what you get, and you will leave hungry! We spent $65 with tips per person, and left hungry. Very disappointing.
New owner. Very different from before. I ordered two chicken skewers, they forgot one, and unapologetically said "there was only one." Lameeeeee.
one word: amazing!

Such a beautiful room. A real gem with perfect service. Steam Chawanmushi with uni, Kakiage with shrimp tempura and root vegetable & green tea salt, sunomono with Dungeness crab, Satsuma age dumpling of rock fish & shrimp all make for a perfect meal shared.

We had lunch to anjin two days ago with prime rib and rice bibimbap. They are really tasty and delicious. But their service was just like a tortoise to me. Pricing seems more than other Japanese. Overall service is good because their dessert is ----appealing.

This is really a disappointment. Visiting sf and decided to trust yelpers for a good place to have some solid yakitori. Came here around 8:30pm. The menu is very limited and expensive. The decor is fairly simple, nothing fancy but it was not bad. The server made a few recommendation and we decided to get the meatball chawamushi and a beef takaki. The food comes in very small portion and it tastes... Below average. The sever spends forever to explain what they are serving (always a bad sign). & not to mention every dish is about $15-$20. We end up spending around $65 w/ tips. Had 3 small bites of food... Left hungry and $65 lighter...
None of the supposed, grungy hole in the wall style atmosphere, but more of an authentic Japanese Izakaya upgraded with high end service, fresh foods and sake.

Sunday night with my girl, easy to get a reservation even though the restaurant is pretty small. Service was excellent, the servers did not miss a beat. Recommendations when appropriate, clearing dishes on cue, explaining the more esoteric elements of the menu.

the cuisine looks beautiful but doesn't come together for me. while it's not a bad idea to be schooled in the finer aspects of japanese dining, the experience must be pleasurable to us locals, not rigorous. I think this is what japanese restaurants like yuzuki miss. the drinks list features good sake but lacks imagination to feature wines like champagne, Jura, and fino sherry that would go very well with the food.

This is an upscale izakaya izakaya. They have a good selection of sake and small dishes, all fresh and with good quality ingredients. Start your meal with the Obanzai.. Its never quite the same and always a good mixture of ingredients and flavor. The grilled tsukune (chicken meatball) and negima (chicken) were both very juicy and tasty.
Fancy izakaya place in the Mission
Tasty and good service!
The best Izakaya in SF, hands down. The food is simply fantastic, the service warm and friendly.  You can't go wrong on the menu; currently this is my favorite restaurant in the city.

I arrived in SF earlier in the day.  I knew of several izakaya style Japanese pubs in SF and decided to try this one.  After a little exploring around earlier in the late afternoon/early evening I found Izakaya Yuzuki.  I was greeting by the manager as soon as I walked in and took a seat at the bar.  Bartender was right there to take my drink order and ordered a pint of Asahi.  I started with a couple of orders of yakitori to have with my beer.  After conversing with a couple other people at the bar they recommended the beef wagyu and chicken katsu.  I took them up on that and it was the perfect thing I needed to end my day.  Not too much, not too little.  I will definitely go back to Yuzuki on my next visit.

Very good for ordering many small dishes to be split between everyone. There are tasty simple items like fried chicken and skewers, and more elaborate dishes like home made pea tofu. We were able to get a walk in table for five on Sunday night no problem, but others were turned away as we ate. The dishes are moderately priced individually ($9-$22), and our over all check ended at $30 per person for a nice light dinner.

Folks who are accustomed to the standard Japanese establishments, will be surprised to see that this menu's offerings are quite less numerous in comparison. You won't really see any sushi, teriyaki, ramen, or udon here. But what you will find are smaller plates (Japanese tapas if you will) that are perfectly executed and elegant in their simplicity.
Came here as a surprise.  Short, but sweet light dinner.
Too bad, my the time we arrived, they had run out of the zaru tofu, so I can't really say my review is complete. I'll have to write an update the next time I try it.

This place is pricey but you can expect excellent izakaya food. We really love the chicken meat ball skewer and the house made tofu. Uni and Custard matches perfectly. Kara-age Chicken was above average. Eel tempura is surprisingly tasty. Green tea ice cream was to die for.

Small, minimalist Japanese "izakaya" in the Mission. I put the "izakaya" in quotes because it's nothing like a normal izakaya (no grungy, underground feel; no large menu of grilled meats; no fun environment where it's socially acceptable to do sake bombs). It's more like a toned-down, hipster Japanese restaurant that serves a few izakaya-like items at quite-expensive price points.
Visits: 1st

This was my first time coming here and while the food was good, the whole experience was underwhelming. My brother & GF were visiting from out of town and I was excited to take them to a well-known restaurant here in SF. Unfortunately, the night didn't end up in our favor. First, we were pretty hungry and even though we were the first to be seated, it took them awhile to get our orders in. And then there was a long wait for our dishes. I mean, waiting was one thing, but when we discovered the size of their portions, our hearts sank :(. They're small. Really small. And while it would normally be okay it's definitely not enough for a party of 3. Needless to say, while the food was good, we left hungry. So much so, I actually went home and ate more. A girl's gotta eat!
This restaurant was great!  Most items were really tasty, though the portions are tiny and the acoustics aren't great.  Don't recommended for more than 4 ppl, especially since most items came in 4.
why 1 star?

We started with the sunoumo which was outstanding. Then we had the mackerel which was a bit fishy for me, but what we expected. The Kobe beef tataki was really really good. The yakitori was delicious. The special rice was super yummy. The karaage chicken could have been better. My favorite sake was Hakuro Suishu Take no Tsuyu Brewery, Yamagata (junmai daiginjo) after tasting 6 others.

I spotted Izakaya Yuzuki while walking around the Mission, and it was also featured on Check Please! a few months back - so when I saw an online deal for their 8-course dinner, I jumped at the chance to try it.  What a wonderful dining experience Izakaya Yuzuki is!!
i bought a gilt city deal for 2 and enjoyed it here w/ my friend last night.  for $75, we got a ton of food, so it was a great deal.
Came here on a date because she wanted a unique Japanese restaurant, and my friend recommended this place to me.

I think this place is overhyped. I had high expectations based on all the other yelp reviews but I was a little disappointed. The portions are pretty small and there aren't that many options on the menu. I thought it was interesting how they serve sake with wine glasses.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF. You have to go with the mindset of delicate food that's to be enjoyed bite by bite. The goal isn't to leave with a full stomach for less than $40 in 30 minutes, but rather after having experienced amazing flavors that demonstrate the careful preparation that goes into it. Everyone I've taken here has been amazed by the food. I recommend the Zaru-tofu to "cleanse" your palate, Chawan-mushi, Aji no hiraki, Daikon Salad, and the seasonal Koshihikari rice.

This place is just solid homemade Italian food. Fresh inhouse made pasta and a great wine list, with personalized recommendations. The owner is available for insights and will let you order off the menu (they had a pappardelle dish which we swapped out salmon for a ragu sauce).
The negative reviews brought me to this place. Thank you to everyone who complained about the service they obviously did not deserve. I love this place!!!
Il Caffè Fiore is Fabulous! Delicious Food, Lovely Decoration and Super Friendly staff! I would recommand the "orecchiette alle cime di rapa", delicious...!
For the longest time, I thought this place just served coffee and pastries. Turns out, they serve dinner and their food is all amazing. They have a great selection of vegetarian items too.

I liked the ambiance, the waiter and the hostess. Everyone was really pleasant and the food was pretty good. I had to knock a star for my risotto, it was a little bland and didn't have anything besides cheese in it. Also, the waiter, although pleasant, was over-whelmed by the number of diners. We came here with a Groupon and I presume some of the other diners did as well. The fettuccine, I'm told (I have celiac so couldn't try it), was great.
I have been a fan of Fiore Caffe even before they opened! Especially for lunch. Luis and his team are amazing and the food is great. Especially the Tuna Sandwich!

It's disappointing to drop $120 on dinner for two with wine, and have everything taste mediocre, including the wine. Appetizers buried in arugula. A shrimp pasta dish containing only three shrimp. An overpriced Italian wine with very little character. Even the sauce on the skirt steak tasted uninspiring.
Great service and great food. I've been for both breakfast and lunch and cannot wait to return for dinner. So good!
I've come here on a few separate occasions, and I keep giving it the benefit of the doubt because it's so conveniently located.
Love this place - it's our neighborhood default lunch place.

We had 2 pasta pomodoro and 4 different flavors of crostini. They were all delicious. The crostini are like buschetta but you get to choose different toppings. The gentleman serving us was also very courteous. This will become one of my regulars for sure!

I stopped by for an afternoon coffee and snack midweek because I was drawn to the lovely decor of this corner cafe. I was served by the owner and learnt that he had done much of the decorating work himself - including making the beautiful handcrafted tables.

Pleasant, bright space. I went on a Saturday morning, and there was plenty of available tables. The guy behind the counter was a little gruff to me, but he was polite enough, and he was more friendly to the regulars who came in. My waitress was very nice and polite, and another girl who was also working there seemed friendly too. I had a smoked salmon omelette with red peppers, which was delicious and looked like it was made with high-quality ingredients. I also had a cafe latte. I'm not a coffee connoisseur, but it seemed to be of good quality. If I lived more close by, I would definitely come here often.

We came here after dinner awhile ago, and the staff was pushing us out, soon after we were served our dessert. It was very rude to allow us in the restaurant, and then make us feel guilty.  We were in there at most 25 minutes. The food itself was very forgettable.
Tried Fiore Caffe for the first time early Sunday afternoon.  Quick summary:
Cute, Informal, unpretentious; to my unsophisticated palate, nicely prepared cuisine.  Very good value value in terms of bang for the buck.

TERRIBLE service, very rude owner. When I opened my Togo food and found it incorrect the owner said "well this is Togo food". When I asked for the dressing for my salad and the salmon I had asked for he became extremely agitated and just have me my money back! I will never go there again really made me feel terrible for asking for what I ordered. Also everything else was gross.
Came during lunch on a Monday, was pretty empty but I like cafes all to myself.

There service is horrible the coffee is bad there food is garbage would never step back in tonthis place the staff is rude unless your white and wearing a suit and tie  and look like you make 6 figures a year

We went for a stroll down Guerrero for brunch and ended up at Fiore Cafe sitting right at the corner of 24th.  It's a charming little sunlit cafe, lots of bright light bursting through the broad windows and bouncing of the modern decor.

Really cute spot! Went here for dinner on a whim while walking in the neighborhood. I think the owner is Italian - the waitress, who was incredibly nice, definitely is! My husband and I shared a four crostinis, I had the insalata mista (I wasn't super hungry), and it was really delicious and perfectly balanced, and my husband had the pasta with eggplant (i forget the real Italian name) which was amazing! Will definitely come back here as we are moving to the neighborhood soon!
I stumbled upon this cute little place with a friend. We shared a bottle of wine and the panna cotta for dessert. The service was friendly and panna cotta was awesome!

Had dinner here with 4 other ladies on a Saturday night and we could actually hear ourselves talk.  Owner was super friendly.  Portions were more adequate than restaurants in the area.  We shared the carpaccio, brussel sprouts, and a salad.  Each gal got her own pasta.  I would order the tagliatelle with salmon again, but will ask for light cream next time.  Tiramisu and panna cotta could have been better presented but tasted great.  Wine list was good and fairly priced.  Will definitely be back.

The food is so good here. Its a bit pricey and has slower service  (note - not slow just a tad bit slower) ... but given the location, the outdoor seating, the quality food - it makes sense. Basically - dont come here if u r in a hurry. Gotta enjoy the experience.

Not to be confused with Cafe Fiorre, this place is seriously underrated for brunch, lunch, and dinner. It is between Noe Valley and the MIssion, so it doesn't get very much foot traffic, meaning I've never had to wait for a table.

I had dinner here a few months back and I have to say it was down right amazing! The food was great, wonderful wine, and the owner and waiter made sure every need my friends and I had was taken care. Great place to dine, I defiantly recommend this place!

I would give it 0 stars if it that was possible. Went here this past week for a birthday dinner with 12 people. The place is cute- I will give it that. The menu is very limited and I was not impressed with any of the food we had. We started with a meat and cheese plate which was typical, arancino- which is normally creamy, almost risotto like- these were dry and over cooked. The salads were fine. I had the capellini pommodoro- which is very typical- fresh tomatoes and garlic- no brainer, right? Wrong. The sauce consisted of canned, stewed tomatoes with absolutely NO seasoning! Then they through in some fresh tomatoes to make it look like a homemade sauce. It was terrible. I loaded it up with pepper and asked (3 times) for parmigiano reggiano to help add some flavor. What made this experience the absolute worst was that the had a live jazz band with singer (very loud). I am a huge fan of live music, so thought maybe this would be a nice touch. We asked the band to sing happy birthday to our friend. The band said for us to write her name down on a tip and put it in the jar. Quite rude. The then proceeded to hound each patron, multiple times for tips. It was very uncomfortable. I felt like I was surrounded by gypsies. If you are going to perform in a restaurant while patrons are dining- it is one thing to have a tip jar, another to announce the tip jar while going around the restaurant with said tip jar and begging for tips. At one point the singer actually dumped the tip jar over her head and pretended to shower with the dollar bills. I was horrified. Fiore Caffe- you should be ashamed of yourself to let this type of behavior happen when people are trying to enjoy a good meal with good company. Shame on you. I will never return.
I feel bad giving this place 2 stars, because it really is cute and cozy and the staff are friendly enough...but it just doesn't make up for the bad food that we ate.

Wow. I went in to get something quick and on-the-go for breakfast because I had very limited time and I'm so glad I did. Their quiche is one of the best I've ever tasted; crispy and fluffy. Their empanadas are so tasty, too. Both come with fresh salad with a hint of citrus. It's also a nice looking place and the staff is friendly. Will be coming back for that quiche and more.

Just finished a superb pasta pomodoro with basil and was inspired to offer a brief recommendation.  Perhaps most compelling was the welcoming wait-staff and the thoughtful attention of the chef/owner.  On a SE corner with wide windows, the resturant glowed with the hues of the setting sun. Enjoying the relative shelter of the Mission micro-climate, I bet the sidewalk tables are a pleasant place to dawdle in the afternoon over one of their espressos or diverse, mostly Italian wines.  Authentic.
Excellent European style cafe.  Literally...wine, beer espresso, yummy food and all.  Felt like I was in Paris or Rome :)

The food and wine were really delicious, but the wait staff kept bumping into us then while we were signing the check told us that people were waiting for our table so we had to leave (we weren't there that long so it's not like we were being unreasonable).

Fiore cafe is a great place to go. I went there for my sisters birthday yesterday with the family and this place is amazing. We had a great time and food reminded me of going back to Italy and eating at those great dinner cafe's in Florence. Amazing!!!!

Went here for dinner with friends.  The place is deceptively small from the outside, but can still seat a decent amount of people.  I recommend having reservations, especially if you plan to eat there at dinner time on the weekend.  We did not have reservations, but got lucky and only waited about 5 minutes (got seated at the high table near the door however).

Just had Valentines dinner with my wife. Outstanding in every way. And we're pretty picky. Their house red wine which I had is a Moltepuciano which was bold, yet smooth. We had the arugula e finocchio salad and the ensalata di mare which were both fresh and tasty. Then for antipasti we had the vongole and the Brussel sprouts which we ate to the last bite. We were too full to order main courses by this point but the gnocchi and the other pastas looked very appetizing on the other tables. Main courses such as skirt steak also looked beautifully plated. For dessert we shared a huge serving of house made tiramisu which was superb along with rich tasting authentic Italian espressos. And if  the food wasn't good enough, the service by our Russian server and the owners was just right. The frosting on the cake was when the bill came and it was less than $60. Anyone can get a great dinner for $100 a person these days, but to get this quality of authentic Italian food (we've been to Italy) along with great service and a hip atmosphere for less than $60 is really something to crow about, which explains this glowing review. Get in there soon, because in the Mission, this place is destined to be swamped very soon.

Walked in. Only 1 other person in the entire restaurant. Sat down to have dinner and was pulling out my computer when I was told by the server that I couldn't use my computer, "otherwise this would become a cafe."  Have you checked your name bro?

I would go back to Fiore to try their paella. Their coffee and pastries were incredibly good. They have a lot of authentic Mediterranean breakfast and dessert pastries. The customer service leaves something to be desired. My boyfriend ordered a piece of frittata to go and we waited 15 minutes for it to be boxed up. The place wasn't that busy. However it was worth the wait. Delicious food.
A great a neighborhood gem great space great food , this coming from an italian  check it out.

I wish I could give 5 stars and 1 star at the same time. I visit the cafe almost every day of the year for my morning latte and occasionally for lunch/dinner. The morning team knows me well and I love the atmosphere and welcoming feel. Makes my day!

I went for dinner- food was okay- but I wasn't that impressed. I ordered roasted veggies with a balsamic reduction as an appetizer- and they were chewy and dense instead of the normal caramelized, yummy, thinly sliced veggies I've come to expect.

I love this spot, which is just across the street from Alley Cat Books. I've been with large groups, with many newbies, and everyone loves the food. I always order from the grill near the door, where you get small soft taco shells and choose your meat; then you add lettuce, onions, lime, and different salsas as you like. I recommend the carne asada with lots of lime and the green salsa - so good! Some friends have ordered from the larger menu, which includes burritos and quesadillas, but those orders take much longer. I only wish the restrooms were a tad tidier, but of course I'm not there for the bathroom facilities. If you're in the area, check out this taqueria!
These are the best tacos in San Francisco. Period. Full stop. I've eaten at dozens of different taco spots, and while there are many that are great, none are quite as great as Vallarta.

A taqueria that's open late & serves fresh ingredients in all there food and has an open taco bar is always a win. But when there entire menu is filled with awesome tasty meals and takes you on a trip to flavor town the you're winning all around and taco Vallarta has all of that.

Dissapointed.  Lengua (tongue) is NOT supposed to be chewy and cut into little squares as if it were tofu.  Meat itself had no flavor.  Granted, Mexican food when it's greasy can be yummy, but if they managed to make the meat more flavorful mines the grease, then it would be much better.  We were VERY surprised his place had such high reviews.
The taco bar here is great! Relatively inexpensive, tasty, and fresh. Staff is friendly too. The lines can get long around lunchtime but that's my only complaint! I'll be back for sure.

Probably the only food place open late on weekdays in the area. Very suitable for those late nights after coming home from a party, concert, etc. and you need a cheap little snack (or 2) to complete the evening.
Tacos are the best. Al Pastor is the best.

The place is really big. I didn't like how the taco line was set up because it was split... half of us was inside and half of us was outside... so it didn't make sense. definitely get the carnita taco.. it's way better than the one that said tender beef... You'll thanks me later. Other than that, it was pretty cheap 2.25 a taco and they had the world series on.

Everyone (should) have their 3:30 am taco place. It may be close to home, or on the way back from your favorite bar. Ideally it should be cheap, appealing to the drunk palate and a fun place to bring friends. Taqueria Vallarta hits all of those notes.

I ordered a shrimp burrito and my boyfriend got four tacos and a horchata, then I asked for a horchata too. We paid. I asked the drink girl for a horchata. She told me to wait. She seemed quite rude. Another couple asked for one as well. They added more ice and condensed milk and mixed. When they were done, the girl gave the other couple their drink first, although I asked first... When it was my turn, she asked me for money for the drink, but I told her I already paid for, so she handed me the drink. I don't know what I did, but she rolled her eyes at me. The horchata tastes way too grainy, I ended up drinking water instead. One of the people I was with ordered a chorizo burrito and they some how didn't get the chorizo in there...
This is my go to burrito place, and luckily its just around the corner.

We came here for a quick bite after touring Balmy Alley. This is a no frills taqueria that reminded me of those cheap taco stands in Mexico. The tacos were cheap (a little over $1), delicious, and fresh. What more do you want????

Their hours omg... not sure it's the best idea to be wolfing down fat burritos at midnight (or later), but it hits the spot to have non-Taco Bell delicious Mexican food when you have the munchies, or even more so, the drunchies.
We had a quesidilla and a super burrito el pastor. The meat of the quesidilla was OK but the dish in general was not fantastic. The super burrito was rather small and the sauces werd not inspiring.
Some of the most delicious tacos I've ever had. Easy and quick to order. Authentic feel.
I don't see how you can get better than this.

Went with a buddy because he had a Groupon.  As mentioned by other Yelpers, I thought it was only us but the lady at the cashier is horrendous.  Super rude, mean looks, attitude.  Its like she's bipolar or something.  One minute she's smiling, the next minute she's giving you dirty looks.  I asked for a sprite and she gave me a 7-up.  The taco guy isn't any better.  I noticed he gave more protein to the hispanics than the non-hispanics.  He also gives attitude and dirty looks. Maybe he and the cashier are related?  Go figure.  This place could be great but they choose to run it run down.  The prices on the to-go menu are different from the restaurant menu.  The prices in store are a bit higher.  They even got my order wrong.  I got a super burrito and it was missing the guac and sour cream.  The salsas here are very down grade and they use a lot of preservatives.  Eat at your own risk.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.  My first and last time.  Below grade service and very divey.  Someone from the health dept. should inspect this place.  There's a notice on the window that they can't sell alcohol.  A guy sitting next to me says they used to sell to minors and fights used to break out because of it.  This place is a has been!  I'll stick to Pancho Villa and Faralito's.  Next place would be La Taqueria who just got voted best burrtio in the nation!  Just saying!

I came in here starving after working a 12 hr shift and about to start an extra overnight shift and I was so hungry I didn't even know what I wanted. The guy was super helpful and set me up with a big carne asada plate and chips and a pineapple drink and I think I'm ready to tackle my next shift!
AMBROSIAL TACOS!!!!! Live, love, Vallarta. Tacos are sublime. Haven't tried anything else there because I always get sidetracked by the tacos.
To the owner(s) of Taqueria Vallarta,
Best place to get tacos in the Mission. Cheap, quick, authentic, open late. Colorful decor is a bonus.

I was not feeling the food here at all.  Not sure if I ordered the wrong thing since most people here seemed to rave about the tacos, but I got a taste of the chicken burrito and carne asada con camarones and neither left me with a lasting impression that would make me want to come back.
OH MAN
A mission treat! Gotta say I'm happy to have gotten some good Mexican food while visiting my family. :)
This place is overhyped.

This place does not only have one of the best salsa bars, they actually have some of the best tacos in sf.  It's like walking into the outside when you see the taco stand inside up front.  The only problem with this place is I can never make it past that delicious taco stand and order off the main menu in the back.  i think i would actually have to eat here 3 times in a day to get over my craving for those amazing tacos and finally order off the main menu.  until that day comes I can only give this place 4 stars, as i haven't been able to yet give the menu full enough scrutinity to award the coveted 5 stars.

My new favorite place to get burritos. Though I usually get the super burritos, I like that they have the taco stand inside and on weekends they have tamales. There's something about the al pastor thats marinated with pine apple that makes it stand out.
place is a little dirty but the tacos are amazing.
Today I had the most pathetic al pastor burrito in my life!  Growing up in the heart of the Mission, I've had a many burritos and today's burrito wins in the MOST PATHETIC award.
Since you can both load up on a burrito or plato, OR nosh at the taco bar--or both!--I say yay! for this place. The taco bar man is always nice, and their food hits the spot.

I cannot even begin what to say about Vallarta's. This is by far the best taco shop in SF hands down! My boyfriend introduced me to this place. And ever since, no other tacos compare. So fresh, so cheap. Can it get any better? YES it can, they also sell elote. Not just on a cob either. In a cup!! And this place is open late. Yes it's pretty corwded at times. Yes it has bums walking in and out of here. But oh well, they're tacos are worth it! Carne Asada and al Pstor are my favorites. 2 of each and a cup of elote please!

Shot over here to knock it off my bucket list. The ambiance is large and open, with lots of seating. The salsa bar is a turn off next to the bathroom and the register is small with no real line order. But fuck it, it's a taqueria. I came for the carne asada burrito which was big, hearty, and had a shit ton of protein in it. So if I'm ever in the area again, I would come back.
Hands down best tacos in the city! Try the barbacoa! dear lord, AMAZING!
This is real Mexican Tacos!

Tacos! The tacos are $2.25 each and they serve all kinds of meat. I ordered tender beef and al pastor then I layered it with onions, cilantro, lime juice and salsa. I've had better from a food truck and I'm totally judging by the meat quantity. I also ordered elote in a cup. It was decent and there was nothing to rave about. It's a chill spot and food always comes out fast.

I live a few blocks away and have my pick of great taquerias in the Mission. While I sometimes mix it up, this is usually my "go to" spot where I find myself 90% of the time I want a burrito. They have several different veggie options (probably more than is necessary, really...). My favorites are the Grill and the Nopales burritos, both delicious. They have a nice selection of tasty salsas salsas, and my meat eating friends all seem to really enjoy the taco stand. I also have a little place in my heart for the mural on the wall with the 49ers frolicking with dolphins under the Golden Gate. The people who work here are super nice as well.
This is my go to taqueria. I live right around the corner and eat there at least once a week. They have great food at great prices. Plus they have esquites.

Best taco place in the city!!! You walk in and immediately order from a menu of 12 different meats. I highly suggest the al pastor and lengua. There are unlimited amounts of cilantro, white onions, turnips, and salsa! $2 per taco!
Going again and again for the street food style taco cart!
Oh my god, this one is way better than the one on 16th!!!
Love hanging out in the backyard!
I come by here for a coffee and sandwich every once in awhile. I have to say that Atlas has all the right parts for me to enjoy it, but it doesn't quite work out.

So it is now well over a year since I posted my last review.  And guess what?  I had the EXACT same experience.  People taking orders appeared incredibly bored.  People making the orders, appeared to be working hard, but I don't think there is a process or structure.
I love atlas. But today they put the rind of the cheese in my tuna melt instead of actual cheese. Bummer. :/
We only moved to the neighborhood about 3 months ago (previously lived in Russian Hill), and this place has already become our "go-to" place for an easy, but yet very delicious, meal.

What can i say - it's the beat loaf. Take off the cheese, switch to the whole wheat bread, change the aioli for avocado - and you have a great healthy lunch! I love sitting outside on a sunny Mission day.

I used to like this place but now I LOVE it, since adding a toddler and a dog into my life. I've always loved their delicious food an beverage options, as well as their rack of magazines and comfortable seating options. But now the patio offers a place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or cup of coffee while my toddler plays with the chest of toys and little picnic table as our dog watches. I've even seen the owner cleaning and replenishing the toy area on a couple occasions. I'm so happy Atlas has stuck around in the face of all the "trendier" coffee spots cropping up - it's a happy reminder of how SF used to be.

Yesterday at lunch, I had one of the worst experiences at Atlas Cafe. The service was very poor, and the food was terrible. First of all I ordered to eat in, they packed the food to go. The busboy didn't clean our table when we sat down, I had to request it. I got dirty silverware, the soup was warm not hot, the turkey in my sandwhich was dry. Overall, my experience was bad, and not once did we get an apology. They seemed to be bothered when I pointed their slips. I'm definitely not going back!
Surprisingly friendly staff with excellent coffee, a solid espresso and steamed eggs that don't make you want to bring a strainer.

Just wanted to give a nod to the ladies working Sunday morning. The place had just opened, there was a long line, and those two moved super quickly and were professional and friendly. I was surprised to see that they do the coffee AND food in the morning, and they were on top of it. So much entitled, boneheaded customer service in SF right now, but these girls rocked and the coffee and sandwich made my Sunday morning work training way less painful.
Gréât coffee and  food, besides the weirdo barista, all the cooks and staff were pretty awesome.  Got an almond latte and a Cuban sandwich, off the hook, all sandwiches look vey good!!

Great outdoor patio with plenty of seating.They also have live music at certain hours which keeps this cafe interesting. Definitely a place with fast and clean service. I went here for coffee and stayed a bit to enjoy it outside.

This is one great cafe. On a warm day the outside terrace is great. I've happened on some spectacular music; I don't know how often they bring it. I love the roasted beets. The crowd is quite varied and always fun.

Love this place. Staff are friendly and personable, coffee is legit, and this is an amazing place for work meetings. Highly recommend Atlas if you are wanting a taste of a cafe that feels like you are in SF. The food is solid too if you're looking for something a step above your standard cafe menu.
Been a regular since it opened.

My experience, unfortunately, was not very good. I bought two sandwiches and my turkey, avocado, bacon was  pretty terrible. I ordered extra pickles, tomatoes and light mayo,  and I got very dry turkey on burnt bread with arugula. My friend enjoyed her Cuban, maybe that's what I should have gotten.... But for $30 - (2 sandwiches,  2 lattes and small oj) I expected a wow sandwich....;(

Great place!  Friendly atmosphere, good service, good music, good food, free wi-fi, extensive outdoor seating with umbrellas, and super dog friendly. (Love that!!!) You can get anything here, breakfast, lunch, coffee, baked goods, and beer and wine. My go-to for working from home.
This review is solely for ordering food. I live a block away so come here sometimes for lunch, dinner, etc. and take it home.
go to get a coffee and play on your laptop. stay for lunch (the grilled cheese is amazing)!

Drawn by the interesting menu, I came back. Service remains same. Seems it wasn't an off day. The cashiers just seem easily bothered and don't seem happy. There also seems to be a lack of camaraderie between the workers. Perhaps it is a management issue. I will rarely come here - just when the menu teases me back. I prefer happier customer service.

My go-to salad for Atlas is the beet salad. I appreciate the amount of beets they give and love their dressing. Also, major kudos for having free wifi without the hassle of special passwords and such. So, I can plop myself down, open up my laptop, and start working. Thanks, Atlas!
Very good espresso and espresso drinks. Good enough coffee. Good food. I wouldn't go out of my way for this place, but am always happy when I end up at Atlas.
Heavy lifting.
Really enjoy the patio and like that they serve beer. Tasty craft sandwiches. Open kitchen, cooks are nice.

Cute coffeeshop with an indoor space as well as an outdoor patio.  We got a smoked trout salad and a cuban sandwich.  My bf said the trout was tasty and the salad was ok overall.  My sandwich was expertly toasted (it had that nice crunch sound when you bite into it) and full of yummy flavor.

Had a turkey, avocado, and bacon sandwich, which was very tasty, with a side of the roasted potato salad--unusual with pecans and blue cheese--but also good. Nice that there's outdoor seating out back.

Surprised I haven't written a review yet. Atlas Cafe is probably my favourite cafe in San Francisco. I've come here multiple times at all hours of the day to get work done, and 99% of the time, I'm able to find a table indoors. I've also come here to NOT study and just chilled out in the back patio.

Came here for some work meetings. Great medium sized cafe with plenty of seating and even an outdoor patio!! Their service was prompt and reasonably friendly. I ordered the bagel with smoked trout and pickled red onions and actually got compliments on how "pretty" the food looked.
Udi's gluten-free bread and a friendly staff. Prosciutto pizza is pretty good as well.

Great location, great beverages. I love that it's so close to work, and that there's ample seating. While I try to order different beverages from their menu every time I'm there, I gravitate towards their oh-so-good cappuccino and Pangea chai latte, which is a mild, sweet concoction of tea, milk, and spices. Only complaint: the cafe tends to smell of burnt/fried garlic every now and then, and I have no clue why!

It's too bad I live in the Marina area, or else this would definitely be my go-to coffee spot. It's a big place with plenty of seating. They have a pretty large and affordable menu as well, although I didn't eat on this particular day. The food I did see looked pretty good though. I got an Americano with soy and it was really, really good. Also, they didn't charge extra for the soy like most places.
The Golden Beetloaf sandwich is the best sandwich I've ever eaten, vegetarian or otherwise. There was some sort of lightly charred gouda wafer in it that just blew my mind.

I am a vegan and there are a few options for me at the Atlas Café so I have returned to this place many times.  Okay, it's a little on the hipster side, but they are still nice to everyone.  I usually order the Beetloaf sandwich.  They also have a good Tofu sandwich.  Lots of vegan cookie options and they do have soy for your latte too.  It's hard to find an open table, so one person scouts for a table, while the other orders.  there is seating and friendly dogs on a very pleasant patio.  Loads of people sitting with their laptops.  Ugh!  But as MacArthur said, "I shall return."
Atlas Cafe didn't have the right vibes so 3 stars
