They seem to now filter their wifi to streaming content sites like YouTube and Soundcloud. Since I work in media, that means I can't be productive here anymore. Add in the lack of plugs and small food portions, and I can't give more than 2 stars.
Spacious/airy and their kitchen is in full view.

THis place has some great sandwiches. The seating is pretty cool too, They have plenty seats if you wanna be all out in the open or if you wanna be all the way in the back an just hide away.  The coffee here is pretty good too. I was supposed to meet someone here but she gave me totally wrong directions , so I checked this place out solo, I dig it, cool place.

Little hole in the wall in the mission, the only con here was the coffee choices, the only have one kind of drip coffee choice, for a coffee specialty cafe, I would expect more choices. Good seating space with small outside patio when the weather cooperates. Parking is always a pain in the city, but expected, you are in San fran. Staff was friendly, good and fresh pastry selection. Need to improve on the Italian soda recipe, my Italian Soda had so much syrup which made very sweet and hard to drink. Support your local cafe's and stay away from national coffee chains.

After coming here 2x. The food is great, healthy and filling that I've had so far. They have gluten free bread for sandwiches and a decent amount of options for celiacs.  This is pretty rare for a cafe.

I really love this spot. The food is great. I'm a HUGE fan of the Golden Beet Loaf sandwich. They serve beer, coffee and tea as well. It's clean enough (this is SOMA after all). BUT, they really really need to up their wifi game. A good Internet connection is as necessary to a cafe these days as are chairs, tables, coffee and tea. If you want me to pay $, I'm ok with that, just please give me something I can use.

Cute little pizzeria with dim lights and cozy atmosphere. The deep dish pizzas are great and personal sized. Wings here are amazing too. Full of flavor and just the right amount of spice. I might have enjoyed the wings more than the pizza!

This is my favorite pizza in San Francisco. I live in Los Angeles but when I visit my friends in San Francisco, 2 or 3 times a year, this place is always in my top 5. Get the Little Star deep dish pizza. The crunchy crust is perfection, the tomatoes are a perfect balance of sweet and acidic and the amount of spinach and mozzarella is perfect as well. The small has 6 hearty slices so that with a large mixed salad is good to feed 2-3 people. The sourdough bread with the blow your mind roasted garlic is also crazy good. Do it!!!

Delicious pizza. Went with a large group of 8, and everyone so enjoyed their pizza. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is bc the garlic bread was a farce. Instead if delicious sour dough bread baked and dripping in butter and garlic, we got a loaf of bread with a side of butter and a side of roasted garlic. Not okay.
Tried the mixed salad and the vegetarian deep dish. Both were well done. Service was gracious. Tables were really close to each other though.
Atmosphere: 5/5

Usually this place is great but little did i know about their delivery service.  I ordered 2 pizzas and ended up paying over $60. Wtf? $20 delivery fee? ? And i waited over an hour plus when it finally arrived,  it was fuck8ng cold! ! Horrible delivery service. Guess it was my own fault for  being lazy and not going in to pick it up. Now i know! !
Personal pizzas!

I love pizza, but I finally got to try the place everyone's been talking about (Little Star). The place where deep dish pizza is supposedly identical to Chicago. What's my verdict? Well bud, you guys are awesome, but you're no Chicago.

First time visiting. Recently moved here from Chicago & a friend recommended. Had the artichoke, ricotta, & garlic thin crust pizza....soooo good!! Service was fast & friendly, good beer on tap although not too big of a selection. Great music too!! Loved it will definitely be back.
Deep dish pizza in one of my favorite parts in the city? Fuck yea!

Little Star Pizza at Valencia Street. I asked them where they get their cheese. They wouldn't tell me. So, I had to order a pizza without cheese on it. The pizza took a very long time to come. Although I had ordered the pizza to go, I got so hungry that by the time the pizza got there, I ate it at the bar. I was chided by the waitstaff for 'being unprofessional'. I was just trying to have some pizza. I spent 30 dollars for a pizza and a glass of wine, and was scolded for eating it out of the box.
Amazing pizza!!  Its so freaking good!!  I'm a lifer as long as I live in the bay.

If you're in San Francisco and looking for really good pizza this is the spot! I have to be honest I wasn't that excited to come here because pizza is pizza... With that said this pizza is unlike any other pizza I've ever had. THE CRUST!!! Holy crap. So sooooo good. You just have to try it yourself I can't exactly describe it.

Ok, not a bad pie, no doubt about it. But...BUT, to charge $2.50 for a side of dressing? Two-fifty? C'mon guys. Really? Like, for real and seriously? Man, that's criminal right there.  I'm so bent out by that, that I took the time to write this very review. Not impressed.

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? I was recommend this place by my brother about 6 years ago and I haven't missed an opportunity yet to come here and enjoy some delicious pizza (and beer, at least for me). Ever since Pizzeria Uno's has gone out of business (at least in SF) I needed to find a place to satisfy my chicago style deep dish pizza cravings. Look no further, I have found the place. It may be a little pricey ($18+ for a pie) but it is well worth it! The ambience is amazing too, it feels like you're in a secluded little area in a hole in the wall. The lighting is just perfect for those romantics out there and the service is amazing and the staff is very friendly. I have yet to find a problem here and I will be coming here until the day I die (or can no longer afford food).
LOVE LOVE LOVE. There is no going wrong with Little Star Pizza.
This is San Francisco's answer to the East Bay's Zachary's. The crust stays crunchy on the bottom and soaked with all the pizza goodness on the top.

I cannot say enough good stuff about these guys.  I've been here three times, and their deep dish pizza is, in my opinion, the best pizza I've had in the bay area!  The tomatoes are fresh.  The crust is incredible with a good bit of corn meal to make is hearty.  Everything just tastes incredible.  Now I used to think Patxi's was the place to go for deep dish Chicago-style pizza, but I have to say that even though Patxi's offers a great pizza too these guys are a lot better.

I ate at LSP yesterday for lunch. The deep dish pizza was inundated with tomato chunks and sauce. All I could taste was the tomatoes! The menu listed through the Yelp link is old or not updated apparently, because the lunch menu in the restaurant listed some expensive prices than online! Aren't lunch menus supposed to list cheaper prices than dinners?  Our 12" ddp was $46! A personal 10" ddp was $26!! All of them gross, salty, and tomato'y!!! It took forever to be served but the service was good.  I can buy a 20" combo pizza at North Beach Pizza or some other quality pizza place for only $25!!!! Never going back!!!!!
San Francisco is no Chicago or New York when it comes to pizza, but Little Star does a decent job tackling both the deep dish and thin crust arenas.
This is a tomato and vegetable stew.  It isn't pizza but its delicious.
Came here after HH since we were still hungry and Little Star was just around the corner.
This place is amazing!  After countless recommendations from friends, I eventually had a chance to make it out here for dinner.

A little disappointed. The pizza is OK but not amazing. The ingredients are fresh, but there just wasn't much flavor. Nothing distinctive. And maybe it's just me but I didn't really enjoy the corn meal crust.

First time here and honestly not very psyched ... The place is small and you have to listen to other customers conversations (the one on the left even talks louder than me ... And I talk veeery loud)... The servers only really care about bringing the food and that's it (or at least mine looked like it... Not even dessert she cared for) ... Just like a normal pizza place... Just fancier ... Oh!!!.. don't even think on taking your time eating here .. they want you out as fast as possible (even stated on their menu... Aren't they supposed to be a restaurant t rather than pizza-by-the-slice place?)
You can't be disappointed with this place. Really great deep dish pizzas, the ingredients are always fresh. It is a great way to feed a crowd for not much money

Usually, this place is great. Unfortunately, I ordered through a delivery service once (Caviar) and the order was wrong. They made good on it with a $5 refund (and the delivery service provided us with credit for free delivery on our next order).

Definitely above average pizza- really enjoyed it. Nothing all that special in terms of the actual restaurant, but the service was good, no wait on a Saturday night at 645 and the pizza was damn good. The sauce on top of our Chicago deep dish was the best part- extremely fresh, thick tomato sauce. I think the crust at Patxi's is better but gotta try Little Star too.
Little Star for sure earns 5 little stars in my books. I have nothing but overt praises!

Awesome chicago style pizza. I have been to Zachary's and Patxi's numerous times but this is my first time at Little Star. I'd say all three pizza's are quite similar with the big difference being in their crusts. Little Star has the most semolina/corn flour which many think is authentic to how it's done in Chicago. Zachary's on the other hand doesn't use any semolina and it's just a flour crust, and I'd say Patxi's in right in the middle. I like all 3 versions, but it's awesome the Bay Area has so many great Chicago style pizza places to choose from!

This was an excellent choice for pizza on a Tuesday night. We had perhaps a 15 minute wait as some tables were seated just as we walked in; but we did a quick walk around the block to get the appetite going. And I'm glad I did, the large deep dish is a LOT of food!

My favorite deep dish pizza in the city. Tip, you'll have to wait to be seated even if your party has a driver looking for parking. Ps parking sucks, no fault of Little Star Pizza just the neighborhood itself.
Damn, yo.

As I write this review I imagine eating a sweet succulent piece of Little Star Pizza's pizza. I had the deep dish Little Star Pizza and I'm pretty sure my life has been changed forever. My pizza standards know no boundaries now as Little Star Pizza sits at the top. I highly recommend this shop to anyone with taste buds. You will not be disappointed and you will probably want this pizza at your wedding if you're not married yet. The customer service was fantastic as well. I cried tears of happiness after a long walk through San Francisco and having my stomach needs fulfilled. Thank you Little Star Pizza.
Little Star is deep dish perfection. Nothing else in the Bay Area comes close for deep dish.
Always great pizza, but they need to Bring back the PABST BLUE RIBBON BEER!!!!!   (or equivalent)
stretchy cheese?  I've been to little star twice and have tried their salads, thin, and deep dish pizzas.  I love their classic deep dish for the amazing cheese and the white thin crust pizza!

Delicious cornmeal pizza! I'm a huge fan of thin crust pizza and this place has one of the best that I've tried. My table ordered a large thin crust and did half & half: a white pizza and the meaty one. I also tried a piece of the deep dish cornmeal pizza (the vegetarian one) and that was good as well.

Since my boyfriend and I first tried Little Star, we really can't bring ourselves to try any other pizza joints in SF.  We also can't seem to get past the Little Star (specialty) pizza!  YUM!  We always visit late afternoon/early evening (btwn 3 - 6pm) and have always been seated immediately.  Service has always been prompt and friendly.
Surprisingly first time I've eaten pizza in SF, despite living here all my life and my lifelong love of pizza! Costco doesn't count haha!
Haiku for Gestalt:
Another great dive bar in the plethora of dive bars in the Mission. With pinball machines. And snausages.
Totally mind-boggling selection of beers, both on draught and in bottles. Tons of stuff I've never heard of before and that's the way to my heart.

Iiiii think this place is great. But then again I'm a sucker for arcade games and salty pretzels. Hopefully one day I have one, because they ran out of pretzels and it's not even 11 yet. Spacious, great vibe, great music. I had the vegan smoked apple sage sausage - it was okay. A solid 3 star sausage. Mmm sausage.

A year ago, I would have doled out a 5 star...but how things change.  The sandwiches got smaller, the menu got more expensive and what used to be hop heaven feels more like they selected the beers from the discount list.  Cash only, one single person bathroom, plus the aforementioned adds up to a solid 2.5 stars, but couldn't bring myself to round down.  I previously would make the trip here when I wanted a great sandwich, but now only if I am in the hood and there is nothing else that interests me.

I have ulterior motives for writing this review. I'm hoping someone can nicely tell me the name of the beer I had here recently, because I very much remember asking the bartender TWICE what it was, and obviously I have already forgotten. Here's what I know: (1) It was from a brewing company based in Michigan (Minnesota?). (2) It was in a bottle. (3) It was suggested to me because I like Drakes Brewing's Aroma Coma. (4) It was delicious.

Never disappointed when I come here! Ryan is the best bartender he serves up a nice pour every time! The pretzels although I wish were more fresh are still delicious! I must try the other foods they have. They also would play game of thrones every Sunday night! They have games and a giant pacman machine! The draft beers are why I really come here though, and the list is always on point and extensive! Come here and you won't be disappointed. :)
Fairly chill bar in the mission

pinball machine heaven(they have 4 including medieval madness), good wide spanning beer selection, and warm pretzels. what more can ya ask for? walk in to the fresh smells of fluffy pretzels. they sometimes have a few dogs hanging around. they carry tons of craft beers so its a little on the pricey side.
CASH ONLY!!!!
Wonderful draught and bottle list. Great for watching sports. You have to try the pretzel and nacho cheese! Great crew behind the bar.
This place has amazing service and amazing pretzel buns. It could use more seating and a bigger bathroom but it's a quality establishment as is.
I came here for the first time on a Wednesday night, and had a good experience.

I'm gonna go ahead and bump up this one to a solid 4. A few years ago (in 2011!), I wrote a less than stellar review about this place. However, after wrapping my lips around one of their vegan sausages, I have to give them credit. They do offer some solid veggie noms.
So I really should have reviewed this place a long time ago, but I've only now gotten around to it.
This place is actually really cool. We only wandered in because a friend wanted to grab a drink, and Monk's Kettle is, alas, not a casual drink sort of place, so in we walked.

Excellent selection of beer and vegan sausages. I don't know why there aren't more really good beer places in SF with vegan options. We all know vegans love eating, especially drunk vegans. Give me all the vegan bratwurst and all the IPAs.
Who doesn't love beer and weiners?!?! Those are my two favorite things in this world.
Justin is a great bartender! Very cool place, the best beer selection, & friendly staff. Cash only

I can't believe it was 7 years ago that this place opened, time flies.  I used to be a regular at this place when I was, you know, young and fun.  It was like a mini-Rosemunde, a cool bar to gather for beer and brats with friends mid-week.  Back then, it wasn't clear that this place was gonna make it though, it was empty a lot.

Not my favorite spot in the Mission, but solid.  Good beer selection, you can get some random eats (like random sausage/hot dogs.)  Cool place to bring beer enthusiasts and have drunk debauchery, but I do recommend bringing your own quarters if you want to play Pac Man!  They don't have a change machine so you have to ask the bartender... which I'm sure they're not overly excited about either :)
Love this place. Great beers on tap with good craft options. The sausages are delicious too.
Came to this joint for the first time first off mad props to the bartender/dj LALO EXTREMELY cool n even suggested some awesome drinks n a mind blowing sausages THANKS YOU GUYS
Great place to watch a game!  Caught the 49'ers play the Seahawks here and it was all about that home city pride.

I'm from San Jose and I took my girlfriend there on her day off. She's is use to going to one part of SF (pier 39) when she visits. So I took her down mission st. The first place we walk into was this laid back and very welcoming place. Lalo the Bartender/Dj/Cook greeted us right away as if we had been friends forever. Gave us some samples of beer since most the beer they had on we never tried before. Made a good suggestion about trying the Sausages. N if you have a chance ITS A MUST HAVE if you visit. So good. My girlfriend really loved her visit and this place is going to be a spot to visit every time we goto SF. Big shout out to Lalo again thanks bro. Peace n blessing to you and yours.

Went here with my beau for a little snack and drink before a flick at the Roxie and what a disappointment.  The bartender/food prep, guy behind the counter pretty much ignored me while I stood there for about 10 minutes occasionally raising my hand to get his attention when he accidentally looked my way--he was apparently preoccupied with making the perfect sandwich for a customer but could have at least acknowledged my presence, apologized for the lack of service, tell me he'd be with me in just a minute, etc. etc.    Hipsters at the bar were equally smug and insular and made the overall impression of Gestalt Haus quite the negative one.  Will never go to this place again.

Spacious, clean, good sounds on the box. What more could you ask for? How about an amazing selection of brew! This is my second venture here with my friend. Tonight there was Artwork from local artists displayed on the wall - excellent exposure for locals. Great way for the pub to be actively involved in the community. Bonus star. We also noticed a small dog hanging out on a bar seat. His name was Taco.
Great beer selection and so many on tap! fancy glasses and great atmosphere! I didn't try the food but looks like a must! I will definitely come back for more!
Awesome beer selection. Menu isn't great and when I went some kind of South Park/ Simpson/ family guy cartoon was playing and it really killed the ambiance and was super annoying.
Lots of beer on tap, nice staff, plenty of places to sit, along with videogames-what's not to like?
WHY IS IT SO LOUD IN HERE?? WHAT?? WHY'S IT SO FUCKING LOUD IN THIS PLACE? I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE SAYING!!

Only 1 bathroom for everyone, but this place just rubs me the right way. Lots of beers on tap and in bottles, and the bartenders are nerdy, but in a good way. Lots of tables and space, too, so that you can dance around to whatever Pandora might be playing in the background. They also serve sausages, pretzels, and chips, so that you can nosh on something while either watching a game or some obscure movie on the smaller tv. Very friendly people and interesting arcade games. Cash only! Come prepared.
Lot of beer selection :) friendly service but 1 bathroom. Holy moly guacamole!!!
Decent selection of beers, but it was very loud and dark, which I shouldn't have been too surprised about. There were some tables and a dirty couch, but most people were standing.

I was hoping this place to be more lively on a Friday afternoon but it wasn't. They had good beer, but it seemed like they didn't have a good selection when we went. I wanted to see beers that I've never heard of before or at least breweries from the area but didn't. Honestly I was looking more on the Russian River end but not even one single beer was on tap that was from Russian River. The decor was a nice little Dive Bar ish kind of place, I would like to come here after work or watch a game.

Great music blaring, retro arcade games (4 player pacman anyone?), grafitti art bathroom, and beers in "dass boot" serving make this place awesome and quirky. For those brave enough to try the boot, there is a deposit to prevent breaking and return of the glass. Not all beers are available in the boot either. Specifically the ones with a higher ABV %.
I came here to drink beer. With my friend. Real beer. With a real friend. Good beer. Perfectly poured in the right glass kind of beer.

I like to get drunk here and read books here on my Saturday afternoons. Still pretty new to the city, but this is my "go to" bar as I feel pretty comfortable here. Moose Drool on tap is great when they have it.
All around nice: ppl, food n ambiance, vegan options, yay, recommend for semi mini trip to Berlin type place :)

Didn't like it except for the Pacman machine and beer selection. As soon as we walked in everyone knew we were out of towners! The bartender was rude to us. I get the whole local bar= local people, but really. No need to look at us all crazy when we walk in. Disliked

This vegan whole foods Mexican spot is delightful.  Vegetarians and vegans and celiacs have a hard time find lard-free Cal-Mex and Tex-Mex, so it was a treat to eat delicious versions of those dishes we haven't had for years.  The salads and appetizers were substantial and delicious:  the squash empanada was divine.  The wine list was respectable, and the service attentive.  I recommend it to omnivores as well as GF and vegan diners.
Seriously love this restaurant.

First time at a vegan restaurant and I really enjoyed it! Great variety of food that encompassed many different flavors. I got the sangria to start of my meal, great flavor and not a bad portion for the price. The salsas (red and green) have a unique flavor to them, really complimented my appetizer and meal well. I had the daily special which was a torta, really impressed with how it turned out. I was really skeptical about a vegan restaurant but I am glad I tried this place out! Would definitely come back again.

This is the best Mexican restaurant in S.F. Unless you go to Oaxaca, Oaxaca, Mexico, you won't get better food. They serve delicious, authentic Mexican food the way it is made in the pueblitos of Mexico, using fresh, locally grown ingredients. Yum! Delicous, and so healthy too. The place is quiet and clean, despite the still seedy surroundings. The mission is gentrifying, but not so much yet where this restaurant is. If you are looking for cheese and meat Mexican (American) food, this is not the place for you.

Quite possibly the best mexican food I have ever had. I have driven past this place a million times and had no idea it was vegan! I am so glad I came for lunch today. I had the tacos - broccoli (to die for and a little undercooked so they are crunchy), mushrooms (bartender suggested this and they were to die for - so flavorful) and the greens taco. The cashew cheese is thinner than I am used to and is the consistency of sour creme. The salsas are great (red and green come with your meal) and finally the black beans on the side are maybe the best i've ever had. The tortillas are thicker and you can tell totally home made. The bartender recommended the mojito and it was also maybe the best i've ever had. Finally, service is quick and I will definitely bring hella fam and friends here. So glad I came in! Life changer seriously - I might have my birthday party here or other celebrations.

Recently met a friend here for lunch. The food is ok the service extremely slow, the service was not good as you'd expect for such over priced food. This was my second time here, wanted to give it one more try, not impressed.
The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars? I'm not a fan of kale! Oh, and the price...

When your friend says the words "vegan" and "Mexican" to describe a restaurant, a small panic alarm goes up in the back of you head. "This will be crap", your brain says. Fortunately, for Gracias Madre, you're wrong.

YUM. This place is definitely a new fave. The food is amazing. The service was also great, shoutout to our server, her recommendations were on point. We had Quesadillas de Calabaza for an appetizer, Enchiladas con Mole and the special for the night which were Flautas stuffed with sweet potatoes as entrees. Sooo gewd, all of it. Lastly for dessert the seasonal pumpkin spice cake with coconut ice cream, yummmmm. The pumpkin cake was so moist and delicious and the ice cream so creamy, all of it in conjunction so fucking good. Currently in a food coma, but it's good I'm embracing it. Check this place out! P.S. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated.

My cousins took me here to celebrate my move to San Francisco. It was my first foray into the food scene here and I was very excited to be eating at a vegan restaurant. My one cousin, who is vegetarian, loves this place. Being in San Francisco, she has many food choices and this is one place she keeps coming back to. I am a very picky eater but decided to try something I would never get (which was pretty much everything on the menu!)  I can't remember which entree I tried, however, I do remember perusing the menu with wide eyes- as I tried to decipher a menu that was so unique. I did have to ask my cousin several times what certain things were. Knowing my palate and my finicky nature, she suggested an wonderful choice (I wish I could remember what I ate!). The presentation of the food was good. The service was excellent. I was so happy that my cousins took me here. It was a perfect way to begin my San Francisco adventure.

I am newly vegan and was SO excited to try this place on a recent trip to SF with my (meat eating) husband. We didn't have to wait long to be seated but I had no idea this was a "community" seating restaurant - not my thing. But it's okay, the people at our table were friendly enough.
This is the letter that I wrote to the owners of this company about my bad experience.

This place has an interesting menu but a little over priced for what you get.  If vegan is the only thing you do the. I guess this is okay.  So so.  The problem here is the service.  I came with a large group and the waitress missed a few orders and then took a long time to clear our table.  Btw they insist on large parties outside.  So the sun is in your eyes.  Then there is the Cakage fee of 4$!  Why would anyone charge this.  I asked the manager for a deal on that ridiculous fee because we had a large party and he said four slices would be okay.  I took it to mean four plates.  So we got a few plates and shared a little cake.  The manger stormed out and yelled at the entire party and admonished the whole group.  Then he counted the cake pieces out loud in order the embarrass us.  Told us we would have pay for 9 slices! We threw our cake back in the box and left.  Really thank you for ruining my friends party.  Real class act!! That is 11 people who will never go there and of course their family and friends.  All for about 25$!  Bad management!! ..

I love the atmosphere, it would be a good place for big groups, but the food was pretty bland. I have had better vegan mexican food and there is certainly better vegetarian mexican food all over the Mission. The dishes all sound super tasty but I wasn't overly impressed. It was also pretty slow but took forever for the second part of our meal to come out. Overall definitely not a favorite.

We enter the restaurant and stand in front of the host for several minutes, she completely ignored us while chatting with her colleague. When we got enough, my friend asked her "do you know that we are standing here right??" She kept ignoring us and we left. The manager shoul do something about it.

Being Mexican myself and having tasted everything from the home cooked, to restaurants in Mexico City, this qualifies as California-Mexican as far as style. With that in mind, I still expected the food to be tasty. To be honest it kind of tasted like cardboard. Also, the restaurant was not even half full (on a Saturday afternoon) and the food still took almost an hour to serve. No Gracias!

You might think you'd have to be on top of your game to pull off vegan Mexican in this town. There are discerning, elitist tastes for each, though rarely combined together. And I had been wanting to check this place for years -- just that there's always been long lines/waits. With Mission St. emptied for celebrating the SF Giants' 2014 World Series victory, it was a prime opportunity.
A DIOS MIO!
Best vegan food in the area. I recommend the quesadillas and the pumpkin spice cakes with ice cream! Great drinks and service!

I feel I needed to update my review for this place since I have been here many more times. I kept my review the same amount of stars, because everything I have had has been amazing, but I am still not a fan of the communal style seating. Came here last night for my birthday we both ordered the special of taquitos they were stuffed with sweet potato and poblano chiles. They were great and I have had many of the other items on the menu that I am just as  impressed with. The prices are high, but they use good quality ingredients.

not great value for the money for starters.  the food was decent but the overall customer service was bad. we had a party of 8 and of course needed a table large enough to seat all of us. they told us they could not and the best they could do was to sit us down at two tables next to each other, citing "it was too difficult".  after sitting down disgruntledly, we moved two chairs that were in between the two tables away. we waited for the food to be served before speaking to the manager. i explained it was poor customer service to not have larger tables to seat larger parties and that it was very inconvenient and almost impossible to share food and conversation. "too difficult" did not cut it. the manager apologised stating it was her manager's decision.  They didn't even offer any sort of compensation for the inconvenience. Would not go back. Food was decent but not phenomenal.
Well. Hmm.

Fantastic food, great atmosphere, and convenient location near BART.  We ate there after seeing a show and had a wonderful experience.  The food was amazing and with so many different choices on the menu it was hard to decide.  Every plate we saw made our decision more difficult.  We are excited to go there again.

It hurts me how symbolic Gracias Madre is of the gentrification of the Mission. As a traditionally Hispanic district, the Mission serves up the best Mexican food I've had in Northern California, and Gracias Madre is a strange blend of this local cuisine + the ensuing mass of privileged hipster techies. It's pretentious, overpriced, and snooty, and caters exactly to the audience that is outpricing people out of the Mission.

Inattentive, inconsistent customer service. Some of their dishes are great and have an authentic Mexican flavor and consistency, while other dishes don't. The fact that the menu quality is inconsistent--some dishes have an authentic Mexican flavor while other dishes don't--and the fact that the place has a hipster, casual, pretentious atmosphere--pretending to be Mexican--is a reflection of the biased, cheap, and predictably preachy politics of the city: "we support Mexican stuff, even if we have no clue of what Mexican culture really is." But what turns me off about this place the most is its lack of customer service standards and etiquette.
Incredible dining experience! Loved the quesadillas and seasonal vegetables with tortillas. This is absolutely a new favorite lunch spot.

Me and my friend came here on a thursday night for dinner. Was around 8:30 the restaurant wasn't busy and the service wasn't good at all. The waitress wasn't nice, took so long to get our orders, after that she disappeared so I had to call for a help from another waiter to get the menu again to order my entree and a third waiter to make my order. After that she appeared and was pressuring us to leave. Wasn't close to the time the restaurant was closing and didn't have a waiting line. She asked if she could get us anything else so I asked for water than she got a half bottle of water from another table which just had left and gave us. She asked anything else? I answered: a box. Which took a long time again. Good food, pleasant environment but really bad service. Not looking forward to came back.

I am a huge meat fan, and was kicking and screaming when I was taken to this "vegan place"!!!  I was wrong for judging it, it is  an absolute delight.. The quesadilla is out of this world... We always come here when we can... The potatoes are solid too...
Very good food.

Before writing this review I researched Gracias Madre's previous reviews, not only on this site, but on other review sites.  I wanted to make sure my experience, on Saturday night, was not a unique experience and thus not warranting the following review.  Gracias Madre's service appears to an issue over and over on many different review sites.  I am giving the 1 star rating as they appear not to have acted on their service problem and continue to permit bad service to taint dinner's experience. On Saturday night I arrived with my girlfriend for an early dinner about 5 p.m.  No issue getting seated but then the trouble starts once we are seated.  It took the server a while to come over and greet us.

I've eaten here once before, for dinner, and the food was great. I was with a group of friends and we ordered nearly everything on the menu - and did order everything on the dessert menu - and all agreed: it's delicious.
Food is pretty good. Its completely vegan, so everyone has something to eat. Service is little slow, so keep that in mind but waiters are very polite. Also its very busy, make reservations in advance

Stopped in for a bite with the boyfriend. This place was very lively and entertaining. It's a great place for vegetarians and vegans to go and get something other then a salad. The wait staff is always friendly and knows the menu. We decided that a pitcher of margaritas would make a great choice and oh wow, they were better then most as we left feeling alittle tipsy! Then we continued with some guacamole which was super fresh! For the main course, I decided to go with the enchilada con mole which was defiantly out of this world and then to finish it all off we had dessert, Chocolate cake with coconut ice cream. I never thought that a vegan/ vegetarian menu could leave me with such a satisfying sense of fulfillment, but it did. Seems like I've found a new favorite place to return to when I am back in the San Francisco area. I'm impressed!

Very authentic and delicious, I just wish this would come to nyc! The quesadillas, although different from any that I've had before, are a must-have. The desserts are amazing as well. As was the Sangria and Horchata.
Most delicious vegan experience in entire SF

Great, tasty vegetarian food. Full of flavor, nice ambience, good background music. I shared the Brussels sprouts appetizer and a choice of two taco dish and it was very filling. Just had to order another round tortillas. mmm cashew queso!
Love the concept, the dining room and the variety of plant-based options, but dishes were a little hit or miss (yes to tacos, no to Caesar salad).  Service friendly, but inattentive.

I had been wanting to go to this place for a long time now! Being a vegetarian, it's exciting going to a restaurant and having more than 3 options. What drew me in was the style, logo in general. My boyfriend said he'd take me to lunch anywhere in the neighborhood and I chose here. I loved the ambiance in its entirety; spanish tiled walls, wooden tables and chairs. It went from Celia Cruz to The Talking Heads with no warning, which I definitely vibed too.

When my friend suggested this place, I was stoked to try it out. It had good reviews, the menu looked promising, and as a vegetarian who can't imagine a world without cheese I thought it would be good to broaden my horizons.

love this place - this location has an incredible vibe and the food is perfect. I love the energy of the people here - from chefs to waiters to the customers in general. AMAZING vegan/vegetarian Mexican food. DELICIOUS drinks. I would come here again and again.
Came here with my girlfriend. The staff made us feel at home and were very welcoming. Awesome food. Awesome service. We'll definitely be back.
The staff here is very nice and they do some things really well.  It's a little pricey for lunch but you get quite a bit of food.

I've been to this cafe a half dozen times over the past couple of years, and I always enjoy it. I order something different off the menu every time, and the food is always very tasty and fresh. The family is super friendly. Good beer selection, good happy hour prices. Great place to stop for lunch, coffee break, or happy hour.

I just stumbled across this place after an event across the street at wag hotel. I don't know if I would go back for the food or the service.....ok....BOTH! This place is amazing. Probably the best burger I have ever had. And the service was just as good - everyone was exceptionally nice! And very sweet and accommodating to my dog.
Looking for a new place to try that was within walking distance,  I found CZ.

Had the cheeseburger and was amazed! Grassed beef really makes a difference and the yummy sourdough bread was fresh and held the burger, mayo and lettuce/tomato well! I cut it in half and planned not to eat the second half (it's pretty big) but couldn't resist and ate the whole thing! Salad was a great side choice- fresh and super yummy vinaigrette. Next time I'll come back for on of the great beer selections... Oh and Nick an his family are so nice ... You feel like you're having a burger over your friend's house ...
Phenomenal local lunch spot.

This cute and  quiet little spot is located in the Mission, off 14th street right behind Rainbow Grocery. I walked in before work, hoping to grab a quick bite. Unexpectedly, I dined in for one and ordered the chicken pesto sandwich with fries. I was surprised with how delicious it was - chicken was cut pretty thick and wasn't dry, the sauces and seasonings fit my taste buds perfectly, the bread was soft yet crispy on the edges, and that's most important part of a great sandwich in my book!
Sad service and sad food quality.

Chicken pesto sandwich was incredible - juicy, saucy, zesty garlic, sweet grilled onions, delicious bread. Cute & cozy place w/ bar. Staff was super friendly. I'll definitely be going back to try the burger and homemade potato chips.

Very small, but awesome offerings of grass fed antibiotic free meat.  Lots of excellent beer choices including Stone IPA by the pitcher.  The Nick's burger was fantastic as was the spinach salad. Some seating out front, but more enjoyable inside.  Service was great and attentive.
Awesome lunch today! Had a great cheeseburger, fries and a coke for 10 bucks. Service was amazing our server was so sweet and genuine. Great food good prices.

Took my girlfriend here for a low key lunch and was absolutely blown away. Ordered the nicks favorite with avo (always add avo) with sweet potato fries. Easily the best burger I've ever had. The best part about the lunch though had nothing to do with the food. The entire staff is so sweet and funny and just made lunch totally enjoyable.

It is very rare you find a delicious burger, one that is organic grass fed, home cooked right then and there, and to top it all off with very hospitable service. My mother and I have passed by so many times and have always been curious to see how Cafe Zazo's burger would taste. Today for some reason felt like a good day to try a great burger.

Good stuff. No cutting corners here on ingredients so you definitely get what you pay for.Super friendly staff . Good vegaterain options ,I usually get the veggie teriyaki on Dutch ,side of yummy fries. Cute and clean inside, 2 tables outside for the sunny days. Also the lattes are superb . Not a fast  food joint so take your time and enoy your food . Bonus : I work close by at the pound:)
Food is good but a little on expensive side. Usually not busy. Nice atmosphere and staff
Wow! I haven't had a cheeseburger and French fries THIS good in 10 years! And the staff are so nice! :-)

Three words, pesto chicken burger. I was amazed this place was not crowded around lunch time. A great hidden gem in the Mission. A+ on price and service. A family owned little dine in with a bar stocked for my next Happy Hour trip ;). Food was AMAZING and the price was great too. Our waitress was more like a friend vs. a stranger danger. I will be back to enjoy those amazing onion rings and house ranch sauce ;P

I love Zazo! Delicious veggie and vegan options. Mimosas and beer. Breakfast is served all day but my favorite is definitely the veggie cheesesteak. Made with savory seitan and lots of peppers and onions. So yum!

Tried here for lunch, not impressed. The people were nice, but the food left something to be desired. I had asked specifically for no peppers on my sandwich, I saw it come out of the kitchen wrong, the waitress saw it, took it in the back and two seconds later came out with my sandwich. It had pepper residue on the bread, gross! The fries were cold and mushy, after waiting 15 minutes for my door the first time I did not have the time to ask them to make it again. What a disappointment.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots. The food is delicious and the family who runs the place are always incredibly friendly. And this is the first restaurant EVER where I have liked the home-made potato chips, and theirs are amazing!

I've been riding by Cafe Zazo on my way to Rainbow for almost 8 years now and never once stopped in. I just figured it was another coffee shop and since I don't drink coffee nor frequent coffee shops I never gave the place another thought. Then it showed up the Chronicle's Bargain Bites last year and I finally stopped by a few weeks ago.

This place was having the dumbest problems serving us. If you order three shakes, they can't serve anymore to the entire cafe because they run out of metal shake mixers. The staff could pour the shake into a glass and serve it, but they don't.

Close to home and great mochas the size of your head! This is our favorite breakfast cafe on a Saturday. We are both gluten-intolerant and if they had a gluten free bun it would definitely be 5 stars. The owner is really nice and comes over to talk -- not just about the food but about anything. We have been here in full leather too and were welcomed. I can only speak to the breakfast food as its gluten free (yay for anytime breakfast!).
Friendly little place with great food and service.  I had the western bacon cheese burger with homemade onion rings.  Soooo tasty.  They also have a great selection of beers on tap.
Great breakfast!!!! And great hot chocolate
BEST X AARON'S EVER HAD AWARD WINNER: homemade potato chips.
Really yummy food, outdoor seating and good beer selection. It looses a star because I think it's overpriced.

OMG I LOVE this place. I don't know if it's because they drench their sandwiches with condiments or because the staff is super nice. I wish they were open on Sundays 'cause that's when I tend to crave them unfortunately. They are a small place, but I have never gone in when it's packed. Their food is delicious! Love love love.

First off, the coffee was either sitting on the burner too long or a complete afterthought. I am always surprised when a place known for breakfast and coffee has bad coffee, but maybe this was a bad day.
No complaints here! Varun B. and I came here after our 5K and got seated with no wait.
4.5 stars!
Never heard of or seen this place. I happened there yesterday afternoon because I was doing some business across the street and needed to get a quick bite before my afternoon work.
Cute, bright and homey little cafe with amazing service, delicious breakfast food and a great latte (with organic milk)! Perfect Saturday morning find.
30 minutes and still no food. Two tables have had to ask for their food Togo because they have to get back to work. Burger is good but the service or lack of service is not worth it.

Awesome spot we stumbled on after shopping at rainbow.  I had a great chicken Philly and OMG those fries!  Amazing.  I would definitely go back and check out their breakfast because the items looked awesome.  It's really well priced as well.  Such a hidden gem

This is a great family run restaurant. The food is delicious and they care about ingredients. Lunch is busy so call in your order! Especially a day like today where the sun is shinning and you can sip some fresh brewed ice tea and have an omelette  at 1pm. Don't forget happy hour and they just got pear cider on tap!
I've been eating at Zazo off and on for years now, and have finally decided not to go back (for several reasons).

A group of us from a local business came to Cafe Zazo today in search for what we were told, great burgers.  We seated ourselves as it appears to be the custom here and were greeted by a nice waitress.  We ordered our drinks which were served promptly and shortly after gave our lunch order.  Two of us ordered an "homage", one medium, one medium rare.  Another ordered a hot sliced beef sandwich.  After a wait of at least 20 minutes, our orders came.  Since the burgers were similar we asked which was medium and which was medium rare.  The cook came over and pointed out which was which.  Both of us began to eat our burgers which were really cooked well done!   When the hostess came over to see how our order was she was surprised that they could make such an error.  She found the order slip and proceeded to blame the waitress for placing the order for two "medium" burgers.  Again, they were cooked beyond medium!   She apologized and suggested that next time I make sure to specify my order correctly, as if I made the error!  Also, we were all served at the same time and the sliced beef sandwich was cold.  It seemed like that sandwich was made ahead of time and waited to be served when the burgers were served.  For an extra 3.50 you can receive a "full" salad of your choice.  I ordered Caesar which consisted of 3 romain leafs, a couple of shaved pieces of Parmesan and a very minimal dressing that was almost tasteless.  We shall not return!
My favorite burger joint in all of the Bay Area.

Had the corned beef hash and it was great! Sometimes places put too many extras or too much of ingredients such as bell peppers in the hash, but not here. I was going to have the pastrami sandwich but will just have to come back again! It was pretty crowded but the line and seating moved right along.
Delicious!! If you like pastrami, corned beef, matzo, and ungodly fabulous potato salad, you need to go here all day long.
Everything is awesome! everything has a very special flavor and specially when its smoked its delisous

OMG! What an awful experience .I would give zero stars if possible! I went there to try the Fries.  I ordered the Pastrami sandwich with  Pastrami cheese fries.  The fries were served cold and were stale. I sent them back and they just microwaved them and sent it back to me. The Pastrami sandwich was very small and mainly fat . The bill for Pastrami sandwich and Fries was 24 dollars!!!  A total rip off. I was charged 9 dollars for a side of Fries. The menu said 3.50 for a side of fries. The Cashier today refused to credit me the difference  Horrible service and horrible food. I will never go there again  I left without eating the stale French Fries. I will be calling my CC company to credit the difference.

I finally had a chance to check out Wise Sons.  What a let down.  Now, I understand why my east coast friends who had been there had little more than shoulder shrugs to give me when I asked for their feedback.
Never ending line of people out the door on Saturday. Their signature pastrami sandwich and house cut fries were good. The amount of meat was just right and the bread was fresh.
14.00 for a Reuben? - another over-hyped SF eatery.
I love pastrami.  A hot pastrami sandwich on a soft roll has been at the top of my salivating list since I was a teenager.  And that was quite a long time ago boys & girls.

Yummmmy all around. This place is darling. I will definitely have to come back on an empty stomach . The portions are great. ..food amazing... pastrami was so well prepared. Yum yum yum. You have to try this place.  My only concern was that the menu was way too busy but otherwise perfect place!
All I can say is WOO HOO! I had a taste for a corned beef sandwich and my Partner In Crime said this is THE place! OMG!
Wise Sons Deli didn't have a line so i went in. actually they did have a line  but everyone had a menu in their hand so i walked in front of them and ordered.

Definitely come here for the food, especially the Bialy Egg sandwich with freshly fried potatoes. But DO NOT order the orange juice if you're there for breakfast: they charge four dollars for a glass of OJ that is literally poured out of a store-bought gallon jug that the front-register person keeps down below in a mini-fridge. What did that gallon cost at Safeway? 3.50 with a coupon? If you're gonna charge four bucks for a glass of juice, that ish should be made fresh in-house just like your delicious food.

YUM!  I shared a plate of hash, eggs, potatoes and a sesame seed bagel with my brother, as well as a carafe of mimosas.  What a great way to start the day!  It's a little on the pricey side but it was a nice treat.

Just had the worst pastrami sandwich I have ever had.  It was dry, definitely not fresh, and consisted of a gob of pastrami on rye bread with a plastic gulden's mustard packet on the side.  There was a side of cole slaw (others also available) but for $12.50 I'd expect a decent sandwich.  And the slaw was slightly above Safeway standards.

I've had the pleasure to nosh at Wise Sons on a number of occasions, always leaving with a full belly and a smile from ear to ear (with possibly a spot of deli mustard in the middle). The Sons offer one of the finest Reubens on the west coast, a corned beef hash to plotz over and a Chinese chicken salad that would have brought tears of joy to my bobeshi's eyes. I hesitated to write the lads a review in the past because the lines are long enough as it is and it remains the Mission's worst kept secret lunch/brunch spot.
Happy they've come to our neighborhood. I go for the smoked trout salad every time. Served on yummy hard crust rye. My family gives high marks for the Reuben.

I had lunch here with my good friend, Linda the Great.  How great is she?  She's so great, she makes Alexander the Great, look like Alexander the Wuss!   Her Greatness had a turkey sandwich and I had a half chopped liver sandwich and a bowl of matzo ball soup.  We both had coleslaw.  Our sandwiches were good.  Was it the best chopped liver I ever had?  No, but it was OK.  When I go to LA, I always go to the Jewish delis and have chopped liver.  Nothing seems to compare.  The Matzo Ball soup was so delicious. The service was wonderful.

Damn this place is pretty bomb. I've only tried their pastrami fries so far, and I hope to be back soon to try more of their menu. We ordered the fries with extra cheese which were amazing; it comes with a dipping sauce that looks the in n out special sauce (some semblance of thousand island). The place has a very limited seating capacity so make sure you come in a small group. They also won't let you sit down until you've ordered, so no having your friends trying to save a spot while waiting in line. I'll definitely be back to try their sandwiches.

....this outfit has the stand at the Ferry Bldg,,,,I had the worse pastrami I have had in my life....a chincy small sandwich on Safeway sliced rye and the pastrami was lousy.  They charge $14 for the sandwich a real rip off...would you believe $2.75 for a dixie cup of mediocre potato salad and $2.50 can of soda....a sorry excuse for JewDeli...

Went there for brunch. The food was pretty good, but the quality didn't seem to justify the prices. It's also quite small and is constantly crowded. No table service plus the crowdedness makes cleaning up awkward at the end of the meal.
This is a great place. The people are nice, too.  It wasn't too busy on a Saturday morning, and the food came out quickly.

Dude. If someone orders a LEO to go, do not put an orange slice and a salad in the same box as the eggs. Heck, don't put the bagel/bialy in the same box as the eggs. Do you like eggs that taste like orange? Do you like salad dressing on your eggs? Do you like your bagel or bialy all wet? No. No one does.
I was randomly craving a corn beef sandwich today and I remembered coming across this spot on Yelp. It's walking distance from my house, so I strolled on over to check out the menu.

I can't believe I just paid $15 for this mediocre pastrami sandwich. It's a thin sliver of bread and layers of pastrami. For a light eater this unfortunately did not suffice my appetite. I realize we're not in New York but I think the price should reflect the quality. Boooo! I'll save my $7 pastrami sandwich craving for New York.

We absolutely love Wise Sons, and it's always a total treat when we get to go for breakfast or lunch.  I get the deli burger every single time, and am never disappointed.  It's delicious.  As are the French fries.

A delicious authentic Jewish deli in the deep Mission.  My wife and I decided to come here for lunch.  We got a bowl of matzo ball soup, a corned beef sandwich served on their double baked rye bread and the market scramble (seasonal market vegetables scrambled with eggs; served with rye toast & house jam).

Not easy to find a good pastrami sandwich on the West Coast, coming from NY and Long Island, but this place is definitely good.  The portion for the Reuben is large and the chocolate babka (which they gave samples out to people in line) was amazing.  However, the wait was horrible.  To be fair, I came on a Saturday around 1 and if you're not waiting outside on the sidewalk, you're waiting inside the cramped area between seating and the counter.  Parking is all side of the street but that's expected of the area.  Fortunately there's plenty of other stores to browse if you want to walk in and out during your wait -- Philz is also down the street.
Off the chains. Best Jewish deli I've been to. Can't wait to go back.

I was slightly disappointed, maybe because I had heard so many great things that it ballooned in my head. I had my mind set on ordering the salami and eggs - reminds me of childhood when my mom used to make that. Was very disappointed they couldn't do egg whites and that they put cream in their egg mixture. But since my heart had been set, I ordered it anyway. They use a homemade beef salami but I have to say I didn't really enjoy it. It was too strong for my liking. My coworkers all order sandwiches - two ordered breakfast sandwiches and two ordered lunch sandwiches. I guess that's the way to go here, they loved their food and it looked great. But I was definitely disappointed with the salami and eggs. I'd be willing to go back sometime though and try something else since I've heard such great things and there really are no other delis in SF.
I had a great breakfast at Wise Sons on Saturday morning.

I was a little hesitant when seeing some mixed reviews about Wise Sons, about the wait times and quality.  But my experience at around noon on Thursday was surprisingly good.  With a Jewish deli, I have one thing in mind usually and thats a Rueben Sandwich.  I love the combination of sauerkraut,  russian dressing, melted cheese, toasted rye, and corned beef/pastrami.
As a future Jew sister (by marriage), you can take my review for what it's worth. I found the food here delicious.
Reading other reviews I did not experience

After dabbling in the counterfeit pastrami sandwiches in North Beach I needed something legit. I came to Wise Sons with memories of Katz's Deli and my days in New York dancing in my head, which is admittedly a high bar. In all I've been eating Jewish food for 30 years.

I had looked forward to eating here for over a year.  Each time I tried, the place was packed.  Friday afternoon, walked right in to the register to place my order.    That was the end of my good experience.

Finally went here yesterday strategical around 1:30 as it was crowded but only about a 10 minute wait on line. I was expecting terrible customer service with all of the negative reviews. Perhaps the management made some changes as the women working there were very nice, competent and professional.  Matzoh ball soup was pretty good, excellent for SF. Pastrami sandwich meat was good/a bit fatty. I prefer thinner slices as they form a bond and stay in bread much better. Bialy and trout salad was ok.  The highlights were the Babka and Pastrami and cheese (obviously not Kosher) fries. This was the side I chose for my sandwich and it was enormous, salty, tangy, cholesterol dense and delicious.  The Pastrami was perhaps fried up as it was almost ground, but dense with flavor and went well with crisp fries, pickles and I think cream cheese and Russian dressing. Dee lish

The service was turtle slow. It took 30 minutes to get a sandwich. Once our food finally arrived the matzo ball soup was bland, the corned beef sandwich had 2 thin slices of corned beef in between the slices of bread and nothing else. Overpriced and poor service.
I loved this place - I know I know - its not authentic kosher askenazi New York style fiddler on the roof - and I wish there were more of that lid out here.

I came here for Food Network star Amanda Freitag's pop-up collab with this Jewish delicatessen. The menu was tweaked a bit for the occasion, but as far as I can tell, the dishes were a good reflection of the food they usually churn out.
Best Reuben I've ever had, no question. Great atmosphere and brought me back to the days when I grew up going to Jewish delis in Chicago.
All I have to say is ----- "Knock off peruvian restaurant".  Do not waste your money or your time.
This is the first time I'm writing a review on yelp when there is no direct financial incentive for me to do so, but due to the circumstances I feel compelled to.
SOLID cash only "fast-food" Peruvian  cafe.

Hands down the best fish I've have ever had in my life!! It's their signature dish and there's a reason why. It melts in your mouth and if you top with the green hot sauce - it's like fireworks - yummy, tasty, delicious fireworks  as a SF native this place is the spot to go to.
Best little place for Peruvian breakfast in town.

I decided to try this place out today. People seem to always have really good things to say about this Peruvian gem in SF. Literally, "A hole in the wall" the restaurant is really small, but there are tables and chairs for eating. This place gives you a family feel, home cooked meal, and intimate experience. I ordered the Steak Lomo Saltado! It was delicious, but for the price $14.99 I expected a bigger portion. They have the classic peruvian traditional plates and not to mention sweets! Inka cola! everything! Overall, the food is great and I recommend this place if you haven't visited. It is definitely pricey, but I really had no complaints except for I was hoping for a little bigger plate of food :)
5 stars for flavor and authenticity.

A hole in the wall in the sense that the place is small and the decor is minimal but it's run with a real family feel. You seat yourself where you can and someone will come up and take your order. There's only about 8 options for the day scrawled on a white board.

My cousin came up from the LA area and wanted to try this place.  He found it on yelp and was really excited.  So we get there and it looks like a hole in the wall and only one person is eating inside.  We went in and although the place is small, it was clean and orderly, so we decided to stay.
Homey and delicious food. Some dishes on the menu you would typically find in any Peruvian restaurant.  Some you would more likely find in your aunt's kitchen.  Tasty!

OMG. Delicious. The pescado frito and chicken soup and the seafood soup were excellent. This place was a little hole in the wall and I was very underwhelmed when I got there but don't judge a book by its cover. Oh and the cilantro dipping sauce: I want to make it and dip everything in it! The service was great, they were very busy but the food is fresh and same out quickly.
Unlimited bread and butter and spice cilantro sauce, the food it was so full of flavor and they cook fast!! Delicious ... I was  hungry, but not anymore :)
A great little restaurant! Food is delicious! Can't wait to go back to try the other dishes!

Really tasty! My boyfriend had the lomo saltado while I had the seafood soup, and they were both delicious. The total was about $48 (we also ordered another seafood soup to go and two sodas).  It was not the cheapest meal we've had in the Mission, but definitely worth it.
The ultimate Peruvian hole-in-the-wall.
I've been eating here 10+ years and I love it!! The bistek apanado is great and the the fried fish is off the chart!!!

It's tiny but a pleasure to eat in because you can see your food cooked fresh and all of the meals have a very homemade taste.  There are specials every day and when we have colds, we try to come in for the chicken soup on Mondays. Afterward, hop on over to Mission Pie!
this place is amazing, it has been my secret spot for years, every dish is amazing home cooked, and the saturday breakfast is always a hangover saver!

I have been eating at Rincon Peruano for 19 years now. I've been meaning to write a review but I've never made one before. All of their food is delicious, period. Pure, Authentic, Peruvian Cuisine with a pinch of home-made love in it. It has a real genuine family feel to it, many people know about it. It is also family ran and owned. It is a bit pricey, but I usually don't have to pay for our family dinners, so that's not one of my concerns. I love the "Pescado Frito" Fried Fish and a nice cold Inka Kola. Their salsa is one of a kind. That innocent looking green stuff is MEAN! So be careful. Check it out for yourself; the location couldn't be any better. You can take the 14,14L,49,27,or BART to 24th and Mission here. It's totally worth it !
Mmm...  One of my absolute fav restaurants!

I've always meant to review this place but never have. It's been well over a year since I came here ,but I remember how good this hole in a wall location is.I ordered the grilled chicken and it had so much flavor, I'm wanting it now. I will definitely come back here again if I'm in the area!!!!
The most delicious pescado frito (fried fish) I've ever eaten!!!

This is a hole in the wall, cash only, and not cheap yet worth every penny. I go here whenever I am in the Mission, and I am never disappointed. It is a no-frills dining experience complete with bread and the butter you can slather. The dishes (and there are only about 5) are all excellent. You can't go wrong with the fried fish.

Saturday morning breakfast dilemma? think no more, just walk over to Rincon Peruano and order the "pan con chicharron." This delicious breakfast sandwhich is filled with sizzling fried pork strips, fried yam (camote) and onions!! you will be full for a good part of your day.

Excellent food you will never be dissapointed... My parents are big fans of the Saturday breakfast... we have been coming to this place since I was a teenager. I love the couple they are very friendly ready to serve you and always make you feel very welcome... I will really strongly suggest this restaurant...
First time I went to this place was around 1993 I got hooked ever since So therefore THAT SHOULD SAY IT ALL !!!!!!

I LuV LuV LuV this place!!!! I have been coming here for years I always order the Pescado Frito: Crispy Boneless Fish Fillets Served with Rice and Salad with an extra salad on the side;). The green spicy spread is frikin amazing. I would also recomend the seafood soup and yelpers lemme just say OMFG it HITS.

If you only looked at the menu, you'd think this was a classy place that served a ton of different foods.  But once you get inside...there are 10 things on the board, and that's it...They just have a lot of different specials that change every day, so it looks like they have 30 things on the menu.
iPhone review

Yes, I do know my way around those fancy Peruvian restaurants with free flowing pisco and all sorts of raw fish.  While I enjoy that scene, I was craving something more home style.  Smaller than a hole-in-the-wall, this joint promised to fit the bill.  It was definitely not fancy, but I also felt it lacked that level of quality which would be served to other Peruvian family members.  Ok for a somewhat inexpensive fix.

Always an amazing place for lunch or dinner...today I got to try something new from there...their Seafood Soup (OMFG it is the bomb!) and the Helado de Lucuma (so yummy) which is ice cream made with Lucuma (a seasonal fruit that is similar to an avocado but tastes totally unlike anything I have ever had) and as usual I had the grilled chicken and everything was so damn good...this place will ALWAYS get 5 stars from me.

All I have to say is this is the best "hole in the wall" spot in all of the city. Don't let the looks of the place scare you off, this guy has been here forever! Food is great, service is right on, and they're sodas are the coldest, which is an A+ when your burning your mouth with they're salsa that seems to go well on everything, especially the bread! I noticed some mixed reviews on here, I dunno about them, but everytime I have the Appanado, I get every grain of rice off that plate!

My husband and I, along with our 1 year old son went here to eat after a day at the beach. the owners are very hospitable and friendly towards us, they even went out of their way to get a clip on high-chair for our son, a cup and utensils just for him. the food was divine and even the adventurous side of us dug in to the super hot green sauce along with the bread. it was addicting and went down smooth with a side of inca cola to drink it with. we had the lomo soltado, bistek and pesca frito, all of which go down as ultimate favorites right away. i couldn't possibly think of another way to end the day. if you want authentic Peruvian food, this is the place to go. it's not dumb-down to appeal to the "American" pallet, it's true to itself. The only other place I know that can compare to this is my Peruvian friend's mom's cooking.
Four stars for the genre -- hole-in-the-wall, homey, almost street food. Easily took me back to South America both in taste and atmosphere.
Tasty non-trendy Peruvian food. It felt a lot like eating at someone's house!

I've walked by this place many times and always wondered if this place was good.  Small, hidden, looks like a home kitchen.  It must be good.  I asked the owner what are they known for.  They recommended I try the fried fish, fillet of sole, rice and lentils.  It came with this salty spicy green sauce that was tasty.  I forget the exact price, expect about $11.xx.  There wasn't anything special about this dish.

OK folks....I finally tried this place after reading the reviews and I gotta say that I wasn't really impressed, especially the prices. I got the special of the day which was baked chicken.  The chicken was OK but nothing out of this world.  The rice was nothing special, it was actually greasy??? It came with a small side of what seemed like fried potatoes but they tasted like they were fried the previous day.  I went in there to actually try the lomo saltado but the guy who runs the place said that the baked chicken was good.

I felt I just stepped into someone's house. The place is tiny. Like, I'm making accidental eye contact with random folks cause I'm damn near sitting on their laps. Would I come back. Hell yeah. The food is really tasty though a little expensive given the location, decor and what I expect should be low ass overhead.

If you blink, you will miss this little hole in the wall...seriously...the outside decor is jail-central...I think it's to keep the smell of goodness in, and the crazies out.  My foodie group was hankering for Peruvian and I wanted to try something new., and yet put that 4 years worth of high school Spanish to use....que pasa?

I had the Friday special of some lamb dish. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. And for $12 (frivolous, for a hole-in-the-wall), I was hoping for at least a four-star (yelp-wise) meal. I'd probably come back and try their other dishes. The peeps who work here are pretty friendly, always a good thing.

"Where's the flavor?!" I kept asking myself throughout the whole meal. For my entree, I had the enchiladas; half with red sauce, half with the green tomatillo sauce. The major "spice" in the red sauce was probably paprika, because that's basically the only flavor I got from that, and the tomatillo sauce didn't really taste like anything. I had to slather on the habanero sauce to get some flavor out of it. I should have known though when: 1 - I asked the waiter which sauce was the spiciest, and he said, "Oh, you want spicy?" as if that was a somewhat unusual thing to ask for with this kind of food. and 2 - there wasn't a single (even slightly) brown person here sitting anywhere in the restaurant.

I am only reviewing the tamales.  I got one chicken and one beef to go.  Used a bamboo steamer to heat up the beef tamale, warmed up the sauce and dug in.  If I was lucky, there may have been 1 oz. of beef inside.  And half of it was big hunks of fat!  These tamales are 98% masa with just a smidgin' of filling.  And at $4 a pop?  I have yet to find a tamale anywhere in SF that isn't at least 80% masa.  Thankfully, the sauce was flavorful and on point.
Ridiculously good! Do yourself a favor and try their tamales. :) I have nothing bad to say about this place because the food is so on point. Seriously, try it!

My one visit was because I saw the name Tamale in the name and figured, this is a place I have to try, because I love good tamales.  But, there were problems. Even though the masa is made from nixtamal and comes from the well-known La Palma across the street, it is bland and dry.  I have had tamales in New York City with fabulous tasting masa -- chili powder or other spices -- and more fat.  I ordered three -- calabacita, beef and yam.  One of them was very dry and the others a bit less so.  That in itself is telling -- they are not consistent.  My sister, who lives in SF, said the same thing.  We figure that they are moist only when newly cooked.  They probably keep them in a steam environment and that dries them out.
The worst tamales I have ever had.  How can they call themselves a Tamale Parlor???  Maybe I came on a bad day.

weekend in SF & this was the first food stop. All I want to talk about is the greatness of their infamous chiva tamale (caramelized butternut squash & yams w/ goat cheese smothered in tomatillo sauce w/ cheese, crema & pumpkin seeds). Ummm amazing is an understatement! I loved how the subtle sweetness of the veggies are balanced by the distinct flavor & freshness of the goat cheese. The sweet, citrusy flavor of the tomatillo is simply icing on the cake. Excellent way to kick of this trip!
Came here for brunch/ lunch and was absolutely blown away! Greatly appreciated the charming decor and kind service, and couldn't speak more highly of the tasty food.

Roosevelts is a Mission gem. Let me start with the space itself. If I were to use one word to describe it, it would be "considered". They have made the best use of the space, and the interiors are simple, yet elegant. Full points awarded on this front.
I wasn't blown away but the food here is what you should get for the price.
My favorite for chile verde in town , and you get so much of it !
This place was fabulous! The breakfast burrito was incredible! We would defiantly come back again! Highly recommend !

Came here for breakfast and it was one of the Mexican breakfast places I've ever been to.  We got the chilachiles with red sauce and a breakfast burrito.  Portions were huge.  Waiter told us burrito was spicy so we asked for it without the spicy sauce.  It was amazing.

No wonder this place has been in business forever - the food here is damn good. Split the goat cheese/yam tamal and original tamal with some horchata. I felt like a beached whale afterwards (but in a good way, I think).

Made a reservation for a large group here for lunch and they were ready for us when we arrived. Really great service! Especially loved the freshly made tortilla chips and (hot!) salsa that kept coming out until we were done.
Really good.
I can eat those tamales by the pound!
New non-creepy guy for an owner.

Fast, quick classy Mexican food. The staff was really friendly and attentive. The waiter brought out chips and super hot salsa. I ordered enchiladas a la carte and they were more than enough for dinner. My dude ordered round tamales and he could barely finish the first one they were so big and delicious! The portion sizes were huge and i really got a lot of bang for my buck.

First timers, walked down the hill from Potrero with friends and had one of the nicest surprises in a while. Charming place to begin with, felt really clean and decor is very inviting. This is a sophisticated restaurant, so don't mistake it for a taqueria. The service from "the get go" was just really nice. As a mixed table with two vegans (us) and two carnivores, the server took extra care to walk us through the options and help us order a really terrific meal. There's kind of a vibe about this place that is just, warming.

Great place! We had the frijole tamale plate, chiva tamale plate and a side of the traditional round chicken tamale. I have had many many traditional tamales from many places, including the lady that is on the street corner, and this place can hold it's own!

Roosevelt has been around forever and remains my go to place for the standard Mexican fare pork tamal,rice and beans. I order the same thing almost evertime we go.Roosevelt is considered an "Upscale hole in the wall place" in the Mission in that it is relatively clean and they provide table service and complimentary chips and salsa. The chips could br better and the guacamole could be more authentic with less lime in my opinion.The service can be sketchy depending on whether the waitress is in a good mood or not and you have to ask for the real extra hot sauce because they don't have that special sauce tableside. Sunday lunch is a good time to go because it's never crowded The typical hungover hipsters are usually waiting for a table down the street!

I went there during Carnival 2014 and the masa and the meat in the tamale was dry and inedible. The tamales at costco are better than this place. Also the owner is very unfriendly.   To top it off, it was overpriced.
2nd time there for dinner. The chile relleno plate was tasty.  Freshly made tortillas made it even more authentic. Nice service. A little loud but hey, it's the CITY.

Most bland Mexican food I've ever had! Ordered the round tamale...I had to keep dumping the salsa on top. No seasoning or spice or flavor whatsoever. For Mexican food, we should have known better when we saw the clientele. Not your typical Mexican place in the mission.  everything about this dish was flavorless. So sad. That's what we get for eating at a hipster place. I'm giving it two stars because our server was nice and the salsa was good.

Came around 7:45 on Sunday and only had to wait for around five minutes, probably because they were about to close. The ceviche was reallllly good. So juicy and I loved that they added pineapple. The enchiladas I got were really mediocre. If I closed my eyes I would think I was just eating chicken or beef without any sauce. My friend got the butternut squash tamale and the zucchini squash tamale and they were both really hard. The flavors were interesting, but still not four star-worth.
Really great. Epic Mexican breakfast.  Cute, small  restaurant- chorizo and eggs were  so good.

Roosevelt's has been a fairly regular breakfast spot for us since we moved back to the city in 2012.  Tamale's are well made.  We mostly order their chilaquiles, with chorizo.  Half the family orders tomatillo (my favorite) and the other half orders their tasty ranchero sauce.

This place is not your typical hole in the wall mission taco joint. It's a more hipster/upscale place, but still serves up solid Mexican. They have a pretty extensive brunch menu on the Saturday that we were there, but we opted for more traditional dishes instead. We go a chicken quesadilla and a steak fajita plate along with strawberry agua fresca and horchata. I love me some horchata, I think it pairs perfectly with Mexican food and can't imagine a real Mexican meal without it. That being said, the Horchata here was really cinnamoney...like...cinnamon toast crunch leftover milk cinnamoney. It was good, but I actually preferred it after the ice had melted down into it a little more.
Really good food. Pretty bad Sangria.
Three of us went here for dinner.  This was our first visit since the new owners took over in 2012.  I wasn't impressed with Roosevelt on our last visit but was delighted with the upgrade in quality.
SHORT VERSION:
The food is good but avoid this place if you're Latino. They'll give you bad service!

Surprisingly, their namesake is the one item that doesn't fit in the 4-star category. My round tamale (chicken) was dry & hard & the flavor left an aftertaste that made me question its freshness. His regular tamale (pork) was a little better; moist, but flavor-wise, inferior to others we've tasted.

One star for location. The second star for a clean restaurant. The remaining three not earned at all. Lacking in the basic service methods. Letting the customer wait for a long time, never bringing water, ignoring said request for water. I am writing this review as a Latino who wanted to eat at a semi decent Mexican restaurant. I've noticed this trend of disrespectful service to Latinos in this gentrified food industry. I would rather go to the lil whole in the wall before they get bought out or evicted.
finally a delicious traditional mexican restarant in SF. with some twists to keep it interesting. we love this place. great mexican food without the hipster aggravation of places like nopalito.

I came here last week for Saturday lunch. Service was GREAT - the owner and waiter were so nice and knowledgable and had great recommendation. They constantly gave us attention. The atmosphere is really nice, quaint, cute, small place. Very cozy. House salsa was absolutely delicious - couldn't get enough of it. I ordered chilaquiles (tortilla chips with cheese and beans) but the dishes my friends ordered were just as good! Would definitely come again.
