This is one of my favorite places to eat on 24th after I'm cured of a hangover. Their tamales are amazing and filling. My favorite is the round pork tamal. It is reasonably priced and I can never eat the whole thing so it makes great leftovers. The staff are always friendly.
I first tried to come here on a Monday for lunch and it was closed. FAIL.
A deal and a gem. Sometimes with live music. Take the tamale!

This place makes me not miss home as much, as this is what authentic mexican food is! I praise the people at this establishment for there authenticity and second for such a great atmosphere! Well done- this will be my sunday dinner from now on! The handmade corn tortillas warm my heart.

My brunch here was rather an unforgettable experience! The 18 dollar brunch is carefully designed and to my satisfaction. We chose egg and waffle and both are good! And the yoghurt with granola us homemade and fresh!

Very sad to hear that the restaurant is closing.  I just got the email and it mentions that there has never been a steady stream of customers.  This is very surprising as I seem to never be able to get a reservation through open table.
I agree w Bob.
Cozy atmosphere, lovely service, delicious dishes. We thoroughly enjoyed the homemade sourdough bread, the brussels sprout salad, and the salmon. I will be back soon!
Overpriced, slow, smug. A waste of good real estate. I can't wait for this place to turn into something the neighborhood needs. Indian anyone? Italian?  Definitely not this.
"So overpriced" "Don't like it messing up our neighborhood" "It's frozen". "The portions are tiny".

My aunt really wanted to have dinner here, so she made reservations for 4 (3 adults, one toddler) on a Wednesday evening. Of course I saw all the postings about the discrimination against minorities, so I wasn't sure what to expect since my aunt and I are Filipino and her husband is Egyptian/Brazilian.

I tried to be fair and not pre-judge this outpost of cultural arrogance that is imposing a  concept foreign to this cultural mecca. It was hard because this neighborhood is known for the vibrant Latino cultural movement that developed here in the 1970's and the affordable restaurants that catered to local families and visitors.
This is a truly great restaurant and a hidden gem. The chef is a genius. Outdoor and indoor dining with a great wine menu. A small but lovely place.
Very good food.  Tried the small plates.  Seafood combinations were very tasty.  Enjoyed it and and would recommend it.

The concept seems so perfect that I was excited about just about everything on the menu.  But many of the items disappointed me and none of them impressed me.  I'm tired even thinking about recounting each of the many dishes individually.  I'll just say that overall the flavors rarely melded, the portions were tiny and expensive (even by San Francisco standards), and the best thing we had were the raw oysters.

There are a few places in the restaurant scene that are just very special- having the right combination of atmosphere, good food and professional service. This is one of the best I have ever experienced.

Great pre set brunch for $18 - granola, homemade bread and jam, fruit yogurt and amazing waffle and scrambled egg. Not overloading you with portion size either. Charming place with outside seating and great service. Coming again for sure.

Apparently, I've been living under a rock. It wasn't until yesterday that I learned of all the hate Local's Corner has been receiving because of alleged discrimination; specifically refusing to seat a party of eight minorities during brunch.

This is one of the best restaurants in SF.  As a native (and Latino), I've never experienced anything but the most professional service here and the food has always been stellar.  I read about the recent controversy and deem it unwarranted.  Keep up the great work guys!
Zero stars. Negative stars, in fact.

Local's Corner is a bit unusual; the menu is very seafood oriented and there is no dessert.  However, if you are in the right mood, it is wonderful.  All the dishes are complex and carefully prepared -- the melding of the flavors is excellent. The service and atmosphere make it a very comfortable place to eat.

We've been five times now, always sitting at the counter for the chef's tasting menu. Timmy is brilliant. His dishes are inspired, and always delicious. He knows how to balance flavors, textures, and temperatures like few other chefs. Everything is subtle. We got to chat with him about each dish. I would put his tasting menu up against anything I've had at Saison, which I've been to several times, as well--and for a fraction of the cost. Why his place is not booked weeks in advance is a mystery. This place is hands-down the best value in town right now!
It was very fun to sit at the counter and watch.  We are just amazed how they prepared everything in a small kitchen with an electronic stove top.

This place is so so good. Went here once right after they opened and wasn't super pumped on it. Went again recently and had so much fun. Girlfriend and I got to sit at the bar and watch all of the food get made; had the food handed to us straight from the chef (who is a badass - so cool); and had really good service.

This was our second visit to Local's Corner, and because we enjoyed the meal so much the first time on this occasion we brought guests. Embarrassment, to say the least,.  This is a restaurant where they suggest you mix and match, and share dishes, so that you may taste and experience a variety.  Well the variety we had for the most part left a lot to be desired. The mussels were small and did not taste fresh, the toast with pork butter was boring and flavorless, the abalone you needed a magnifying glass to find any in the dish, the steak tartar which when I had it previously was excellent, was now tough and lacked taste. On the plus side the pasta campagnola and duck confit were quite good, yet I am quite disappointed how this establishment in the last several months has significantly gone down hill. My hope is that this was an isolated experience, but for myself I will not be returning for a long while especially with guests.
Food is bland.. has no flavor... I come here after work and have not been impressed so far.
So cute and quaint. Food is clean and not over seasoned. Love coming here for a charming, cozy brunch. Gotta get here early unless you want to wait. Staff and chefs are top notch.

I'm really surprised that this place didn't have a line outside for brunch, so good! Different than the usual brunch options; they have a three course, fixed price menu for $18. Three courses sounds like a lot for brunch but the portions are just right. First comes toast served with butter and a preserve (not sure what it was, possibly rhubarb?). Second and third courses had 3 choices each. I went with a delicious granola and yogurt for the second and beef hash with a poached egg on top for the third - yum! My friend had a fresh pea salad that was super crunchy and fresh. All in all an excellent brunch. I'll hold off on the fifth star until I try dinner.

Love the brunch! The staff has always been amazing, Its simply adorable, There's very rarely a wait (and Im hesitant to advertise it for fear of everyone 'discovering' it.) The  perfect sous vide poached eggs are to die for... Everything is made in house, the toast, the jam, the yogurt!!

Sad. I wanted to love this place given its proximity to my house and the turn of the century vibe. Many complaints in the first visit though. While they were accommodating enough to get us a table on short notice, we waited for 20 mins for our table outside when we could see an open table through the window. Halfway though our meal that table was still open. Food was way overpriced and mediocre at best. The sourdough was hardly sourdough, and around here that's a crime. Asked for salt, expecting some nice fleur de sel or the like, pretty sure what was produced was Morton's ... The sous-vide halibut was unremarkable, and the tartare was overpowered by more of the weird, seeded, rye-wannabe not-sourdough. The sole highlight was the squid-ink pasta. Overall, felt overcharged for underwhelming fare. Writing this has made me sadder.
First time in SF from NYC. Came here from a recommendation, the food was great! Fresh and colorful---The portion was a bit small for my brother( he is 6'3, growing boy!), but is definitely enough.
I really wanted to like it.  The place had this " I'm-eating-in-someone's-kitchen" feel.
I wish I could give zero stars.
This place is bad, frozen seafood is served, Ive try it and got sick. Never go back here again.

The food here can be tasty, but after my second brunch venture on Sunday I see cause for concern. I had the chicory salad and brussels sprout/sweet potato hash. The salad was teensy and the hash was waaaay too salty. I tried my friend's oats and was shocked: I wouldn't serve that tacky, gelatinous glop to guests in my home.

I'm really torn here...this place reminds me of flour and water.  Excellent food, but not so great price tags for the portions.  My absolute favorite is the squid ink pasta ($20); al dente, perfectly flavored with lemon and uni.  Great dish, just wish there was more as I could eat this all day.  Overall great food, but small portions for the price.  They recommend ordering 2-3 dishes per person, the bill can definitely rack up.
3.5 stars.. rounding up.

If you ask me for the best restaurant in SF, my answer is always changing. But my favorite restaurant? It's always Local's Corner. My boyfriend and I frequently choose it for date night, because it's close to home, the staff is friendly, and the food is stellar.

On a mild drizzly weekend, Local's Corner is the cozy spot for a $18 prix fixe  brunch. Warm your chills with unlimited cups of locally crafted Sightglass coffee and savor an array of oysters. Artistically plated smaller portions to be shared while catching up with loved ones.

LOVE THIS PLACE!  I've visited each of my last 2 visits to SF and it is fantastic.  This time we sat at the kitchen counter and watched as the chefs put all of the food together.  We had lots of small dishes that we split and everything tasted fantastic.  Even the dishes I was sure I would not like, somehow the chef's magic made me love it.  This is definitely a place where you can eat things that you would not make at home (at least me).  We had a wonderful waitress who made suggestions to us on both food and wine and the music was nice.

Be prepared for a true food and flavor experience - the combinations are excellent, seafood really fresh, and everything well prepared. It is on the pricy side, and it's not a ton of food. That said, the atmosphere is intimate, service excellent, good wine/beer, and out of this world food. We will definitely be back.
I love raw food but the portions were far too small.
A favorite.  The food is well thought out.  Always changing and always beautiful.  Not to mention the kitchen staff is gorgeous.

There is no good reason to eat at Local's Corner. The space is weird. The service is appallingly amateurish. The food is not horrible, but it's not great. Go anywhere in the Mission but here. I've had a better dining experience (and tastier seafood) at Taqueria Cancun.
I think this used to be a caning shop that catered to a dying art form.

Just realized I hadn't updated my review of Clare's since I go there all the time and I love the French Dip!  It lives up to it's name and is pretty filling.  The horseradish is tasty and the bread is almost always just right.  Lots of meat piled in the sandwich so it's one of my go to 'back in San Francisco' meals :)

Came here for the first time today because the line at ikes was out the door. Cool little sandwich shop,  no line and smelled delicious inside.  As it was my first time i ordered the French dip since it said it was the local favorite, and i was not disappointed.  Very tasty sandwich on really good baguette with real horseradish.  Certainly one of the best French dips I've ever had,  i will definitely go back again and i can at least recommend the French dip!
Wish I could EVER say if this place was good or not. They're always closed long before they're hours say they should be! Done trying.
Perfect turkey sandwich.
Had such a good Roast Beef sandwich today. Super friendly guy working there. Nice and shaded outdoor sidewalk seating. Quiet neighborhood. Ideal lunch spot on a nice afternoon.

Wonderful caprese sandwich. Delicious. They deliver sandwiches and meat and cheese plate spreads to the bar next door. They also have a $3 bologna sammie, which I have not had, but seems like a great option if you're pinching pennies.
Fantastic sandwiches!  Had the French dip & B.L.G.B.T on sour dough!  Service was great - fast and friendly.
Great sandwiches, great staff.  What else is there?
I had one of the most delicious pulled-pork sandwiches here!

The 500 Club Sandwich is the way to go. It's layered with cheese, bacon, turkey, salami and of course mustard, mayo, tomato, lettuce and onions. My personal preference is asking them to put the jalapeño mayo on my sammy. I am obsessed with the Broccoli Cheddar soup - it is to die for. I have it at least twice a week! Grab a cup of Tang while you're at it it's free!
Always something yummy!

Clare's gets better each and every year it's been open . They have went from a mostly sandwich oriented spot BRILLIANTLY adjacent to the 500 club, to a full on dining establishment with daily delicious specials of all sorts . I'm a creature of habit so I usually get the Fuggetaboutit and have them use their delicious jalepeno spread , but I've tried a lot of other sandwiches and they're all great. Special shouts to the BRYCEYCLE , in honor of my favorite member of the staff the sweet Bryce . Sometimes Clare just brings in random appetizers into the 500 Club for free ,super cool. This place is cute inside , and you can always eat next door if it's crowded.

The Wednesday Ruben with homemade corned beef is to die for.  The French Dip is amazing as well.  You really can't go wrong with anything at Clare's. Order at the deli and deliver it next door to the 500 Club for a beer and sports with your sandwich.

Annoying hipster cafe has awesome dinner specials and THE best spaghetti and meatballs I have ever had. Rich sauce and a very strong taste of olives. I almost had the "loaded" macaroni salad but they were nice and honest and told me it would be too much food. Almost no seating but great if you show up an hour before closing time.

Stopped in on a nice Saturday afternoon. Only 2 folks in line so the wait was short. Ordered the french dip to go. It was pretty good. One suggestion:  smile and act like you are appreciative of the customers!  At least the folks at Ikes are happy, smile and engage you in some type of interation. Not a deal breaker here but if you want return customers, act like you care that they patronized your business.
I got the pulled pork sandwich and it was yummy. The decor is entertaining in that morbid haha way.
The meatball sub is so good! It's slightly bland but the bread and meatballs are delicious! Perfect for lunch.
The Mission is definitely the place to be these days.  Clare's deli is an absolute must if your in the mood for a good sandwich.  Seating is limited, so I would plan on the togo mentality.

Pretty tasty sandwiches. I got the 500 club sand and my friend got the pulled pork. The club was nice and crispy, very flavorful and didn't have tons of condiments squirting out when biting like some other sandwich places do when they overload the mayo. Te pulled pork was quite good, not super smokey like I like but that is fine, still had quite a bit of flavor.
Great sandwich! I had the "light guy" on french roll. The ingredients are fresh, complimentary and the bread is delicious!

The 500 club is perhaps the platonic ideal of a club sandwich. Meticulous layers of the key ingredients with plenty of mayo to tie it all together. The sandwich in form, and perhaps even in function recalls the flatiron building. I don't know what I mean by that either.

Clare's was featured on Serious Eats' "The Nine Best Sandwiches in the Mission," so during my most recent excursion for a chill Dolores Park Saturday, my friends decided to pay a visit to Clare herself and see what the hype is all about.
$2 Taco Tuesday. Bomb dot com. Must get pork. Cash only.

Pretty much ended up here by accident.  I was heading for something else, but got drawn in by weird outside and inside decor.  A place looking this "eclectic" and having quite a few customers - a must try!

Came here on a Tuesday at 6:20 p.  I tried to order the pork sandwich, but they were out of pork.  Then I tried to order the chicken sandwich, but they were out of chicken.  I then asked if they had the Front Beefy, which finally was available!  (Apparently, I got the last of the roast beef).   Ding #1.

Clare's Deli is a Mission Dolores staple, connected at the hip with the 500 Club.  More often than not the staff is working through some stage of a hangover, but that doesn't mean you won't get a great sandwich.

Amazing food in wonderful, unassuming, quaint atmosphere. Their sandwiches are out of this world! As a person who frequently dines with friends with gluten sensitivities, I love they they have gluten-free bread available for their sandwiches!
French Dip is delicious. I can't order it at other places b/c it doesn't compare to Clare's. Horseradish for dipping it comes with is a nice touch.
Fucking awesome sandwhiches.  The ladies working are real sweet and nice.  French dip is the bomb.  Meatball sando is really good too.
French Dip Sandwich on this delicious, toasted white bread. Paired it with chips. I ate 2/3 of it there and took the last piece home. Still tasted good later that night!

Grubby little friendly local sandwich place. Cheap and delicious. Sandwiches served on a breadboard, a few tables and wall counter seats, random cleaver decorations...and everything awesome said about the french dip is true. Damn tasty.
Since they've grown busier they have a cook and a cashier now instead of 1 person handling everything. French dip never disappoints, plus the take credit cars now!

Service was not fabulous, but the sandwich quality made up for the longer wait. I ordered a french dip sandwich, and the bread was what made this sandwich delicious. Friends also loved their sandwiches.
French dip = off the heezy. That's all I get here.  Thanks Clare's for always treating us right when we buy some food.  This place rocks.
Best French Dip in SF.
I am so glad Clare's exists.  Super tasty sandwiches without the insane wait of the other local sammich joints.  Absolute life saver on sunny days, cloudy days, early days, late days, etc.
It is true; there is complimentary Tang...but I will return mainly for the tasty food.

Really good sandwiches, vegetarian options, soups are all vegetarian, free tang, nice outside area.. All around good. The people here are friendly, and it's a go-to for me when I feel like a good sandwich.
Amazing Crispy Chicken Slider Sandwich!!!

Great ramen spot....variety for the whole family....red meat pork ramen, white meat chicken ramen, seafood clam ramen, and vegetarian ramen.  Everyone should be happy to slurp down some soup.  Probably my fave in the Mission area right now.  Still waiting to find more Malaysian style curried soup in this town but whatevs.
It was probably 85-90 degrees outside in SF that day....and my sister was craving ramen...at 11:30am...on a Sunday....

Their vegetarian Ramen is the best I've had in the city. Ramen has a meat broth, so veggie versions tend to be uninspiring.  This one is so good.  It's my favorite on on the menu and I'm not even vegetarian.

I'm picky about my ramen, and I have a severe MSG sensitivity, so I can honestly say this place has absolutely legit ramen sans MSG. The tonkatsu broth is outstanding, and it's the only ramen resto in SF that I have returned to probably 10+ times. OISHII!!

Authentic Japanese Ramen/food..!!! New fave place! I had the Vegie Miso Ramen, it had tofu, spinach, soft boiled egg, I added chachasu Chicken... - my daughter loved their sweet and spicy chicken as her entree and ate it over rice... Son had Gyoza over rice.. Lol, hubby had their most popular Ramen.. Look for their red stars in the menu which are the popular ones to order...

Love, love, LOVE the veggie ramen!! Other vegetarian ramen I've had seemed to try to make up for "lost" flavor with salt, which I've found pretty unpleasant. But not here! The broth was smooth and flavorful without being as salty as seawater. My egg was soooo perfectly soft and gooey; just heavenly. The tofu "chashu" is a really nice touch - most ramen places just ignore that staple ingredient, but here they take the time to make a really tasty replacement.

this place was legit! so glad to have tried it, although it was our intent to go to orenchi beyond.  the wait was 1 - 1.5 hours though, so we yelped for a different ramen place and came across this one.  my friend walked righttt past the wait list which is by the door. wait for two was 20 minutes, much more manageable.
Game 7, World Series - SF vs KC, surrounding bars were packed and I didn't want my personal space invaded, so I decided to get my grub on.

I am convinced that if this place served nothing but their vegetarian ramen they would have a solid five stars. I ordered the vegan ramen, which is the same as the vegetarian, but without the egg. It had a miso base and a ton of flavor. More than I think I've had in any ramen before. I've had ramen with a miso base before, and didn't like it. This was the first exception. The dish was possibly the best ramen I've ever had, vegan or otherwise. The noodles couldn't have had a better texture, and the ingredients worked together well enough to provide a of variety of textures and flavors in each bite.

Just came in with my son for some tonkatsu ramen.  It was delicious.  We had Kobe short rib as well which was tasty but the star of the show was the delicious ramen.  Beautiful depth of flavor in the broth w perfect noodle.  My only disappointment was that I didn't read the menu close enough and didn't get the pork belly.

Only tried the clam ramen, rich tonkatsu (sp) ramen and monkfish liver appetizer. Loved that the portions were just right (not super sized like most places in the US) and that the ramen broth was not too salty. The Tonkatsu (sp) broth was excellent - very unique flavor. Service was just right - not trying too hard to remind you they're there (eg incessant "is everything ok?") and they let you enjoy the food. Would love to come back!

Shoutout to Goku for having me write my first every bad review.  The short of it is this is not a good restaurant.  Interesting menu and a chance to be great but not worth going to, let alone waiting on a line for.
I'm a big fan, have tried lots of menu items here. I always leave impressed. Once my garlic clams were far too over-seasoned  by the raw acid of the garlic but I'm happy to forgive.
The best Ramen place in the city to me. They also have gluten-free noodles which is a total plus for anyone wanting Ramen, but not wanting to eat wheat based noodles.
I think 3.5 stars is about right for this place right now. There were some misses, but ultimately I had a good meal and want to come back.

Two chefs trying to do too much. Making appetizer, Ramen, and desserts? Maybe if they pared down the menu and concentrate on making Ramen it will taste a lot better. As we were eating dinner we saw the chefs trying  to cook many different items at same time, sometimes haphazardly. We saw the chef failed to make the Taiyaki the first time and tried again, 2nd time was also not too great but he still served it. We ordered the Tuna Sashimi, Wasabi Potato, Chicken Karaage, Kakuni Ramen, & the Clam Garlic Ramen. For dessert, we ordered the black sesame ice cream. The appetizer was lackluster, the tuna sashimi came out lukewarm which made it unappetizing. The Kakuni Ramen was very salty and lack any depth or complexity. We ordered the medium spicy and there was absolutely no heat to the broth. The noodles were not even properly cooked, the noodles some still raw were clumped together in chunks. The Clam Garlic Ramen was a watery mess. The redeeming item of the night was the Black Sesame ice cream. It was on the sweet side but was yummy.
I came here twice so far.  I ordered a chicken ramen the 1st time and Kakuni Tonkatsu ramen the 2nd time. I was very satisfied both times.  The restaurant deserves a higher rating for sure.

Their ramen is respectably, almost amusingly offensive - eating it is to be assaulted with an unbelievably excessive amount of sodium and god knows what kind of harmful chemicals they put in the broth. I almost wish whoever came up with the recipe was neurologically impaired such that he was completely unaware of the type of suffering a bowl of ramen at Goku would put unassuming consumers through. Otherwise, it would be worthy of an elaborate conspiracy theory.

I consider myself fairly knowledgeable about ramen, and I've been to almost a dozen different ramen places up and down the Bay Area. This place definitely lives up to the hype. It looks deceptively small from the outside, and it can actually accommodate a good amount of people.
Great Tonkotsu ramen and Kakuni!
I tried my first bowl of ramen at this place. I had the Rich Tonkotsu in medium spice, and it was yummy.

Yay! This is one of the few places that has vegetarian ramen, which is awesome, because my fiance loves ramen and I usually can't accompany him when he's craving some. The broth is super flavorful and the portions are pretty big.
Comparable to daikokuya in L.A., finally found something I like I'm sf. There was no wait, thick flavorful broth, many choices for spice level and the fatty pork melts in your mouth. Amazing!

This has become my go-to ramen spot. I love the creamy pork broth and they give you a good amount of meat and noodles. I've had the rich tonkotsu and the kakuni tonkotsu. Both are very good, but get the rich ramen if you prefer leaner pork, and the kakuni if you want a fattier more tender pork. The egg is cooked just right--firm on the outside, with just a bit of liquidy yolk on the inside. For appetizers, get the chicken wings or chili shrimp.

Waited over 30 mins for a table even though the waiter said expected wait time was 15 min. A party before us actually left without crossing their names off the waiting list. After finally being seated, it took 25 mins for our first appetizer, monkfish liver, to arrive.  It's raw, how much prep time does it take. After another 30 mins the first ramen comes out. Ridiculous and understaffed.  The ramen wasn't even that great,  it's just okay and definitely not worth the wait.  The boiled egg is sweet and kakuni was also overly sweet. Everything else about the ramen was average at best.
After giving up on waiting for a table at SO, we decided to head over to the Mission and get some ramen. It was getting rather chilly afterall...
I went to Ramen Izakaya Goku on Saturday, August 9, 2014. I waited approximately 30 minutes when I arrived at 7:30. I ordered the iced oolong tea and the veggie miso potage ramen at medium spiciness.
My friend brought us here for dinner tonight, and I was actually really impressed by both the modern, tastefully decorated interior and the food itself.
Wait, I don't understand the low rating.

When I get the hankering for ramen but don't want to wait in Izakaya Sozai's crazy line, I go to Ramen Izakaya Goku (RIG). The ramen is delicious, especially because I go for the Goku. The soup is just the right flavor and the noodles are never soggy. RIG definitely satisfies my (constant) craving for ramen! The appetizers, especially the Tako Yaki, is delicious as well! They give great proportions and the service is always wonderful. I really have nothing bad to say about this place-- which is why I give this place 5 stars!
Worst ramen of my life. Greasy and full of gristle. The sashimi was alright. It's much too over priced for how bad it is, though...
Just went here yesterday..wanted to go last sunday because of the epic failure of the Ramen Festival but it was very crowded...so went on a Wednesday at 6 and i was the only one there..

This place was a huge disappointment. The kakuni tonkotsu ramen came with a plain-old boiled egg (!), a big piece of too-chewy kakuni, and so-so noodles. It tasted as if the chef wasn't particularly familiar with how tonkotsu ramen is made (admittedly I have been spoiled living in Tokyo for the past few years - but there are more and more places here that know what they are doing). The soup was decent, but unfortunately the waiter spilled half of it on the floor when slamming the bowl down on our table. He apologized and mopped up the puddle, but made no offer to fill it back up or offer something to make up for it. Worst ramen experience in SF so far - very puzzled why this place is is usually full.

I love ramen. In fact I was brought up in the country of ramen, Japan, where most decent ramen cost less than $8(and yes, we don't have tip system). I'm not a connoisseur but I could definitely say this place brings the dishonor to the name 'ramen.' I have tried many of ramen shops in Bay Area too, and while they are ok taste if not so authentic, this place was terrible enough I wanted to leave a review.

Not great.  Bland tomatoes in a tomato salad are a big no-no, the ramen broth tasted muddy and lacked flavor, and the Kobe beef wasn't just overcooked, it was hard and difficult to chew.  I love the space, but the food was dreadful the night we went.

Delicious vegetarian ramen options.  The broth is substantial without being oily or too salty.  I've tried most of the more popular ramen spots in town, and this one and Underground have the best vegi options. imho.

Ramen here is good. It's neat that you can pick you level of spicyness, but the difference between medium and very spicy (there's no other options in between) are very different. Thought that was strange. The place looks nice though. I could see it as a simple date spot if you wanted to take someone out. Service is nothing amazing, but isn't horrible either. It's just ok. I'd go back, but I wouldn't say it's my favorite ramen place in the world.
Tonkotsu ramen = YUMMY!

I came back here a second time with the wife.  I had sung the praises of the kakuni so that's what we ordered.  Man, disappointment.  Unlike my experience during the first visit, the meat was not sufficiently steeped in flavor nor tender; it obviously needed to cook longer.  My guess is that they had not planned appropriately, run out of pork and rushed things or someone messed up somewhere.  Sad.

I sat at the kitchen counter to check out all the action, but it turned out to be not such a good idea, as it was pretty warm. An ice cold Sapporo helped. I got the basic tonkatsu ramen with a side of the karaage. Both were great, the soft boiled egg was tasty, the broth was so good and rich, and the chicken was great (if a tad salty). Nice, cozy atmosphere.
Mostly on Bar/cocktail menu!
Apparently, Chino is the sister restaurant of Tacolicious. My date had suggested to come here for one Sunday evening. Surprisingly, not much of a wait time for us. We got in pretty quickly.

I was a bit skeptical of this place because I knew it was a hip, trendy place with slightly over-priced and Americanized Chinese food. I knew going into this, that it wasn't going to be an authentic Chinese experience, and more like a fun, trendier PF Chang's, which I was okay with. It's fun to go with a bigger group (4-8 people are ideal), and share a bunch of dishes.

Chino is a really fun and hip place in the mission to have dinner. They play good music and I love the whimsical and playful decor elements like the Hello Kitty themed bathrooms and the colorful chopsticks. So entertaining.

Ribs and wings are great. XLB is bland. And you would want to skip the shrimp wanton in Chile oil. Waitress was nice but the food comes on very slowly. Waited 30 min for the XLB. And even drinks come very slowly. Overall,  it's an interesting try.
Ok beware, the service sucks.  It took 30 minutes to get our XLB.

Basically, if you want delicious Asian fusion, go to Mission Chinese. If you want delicious shanghai dumplings, go to Shanghai Dumpling King. If you want to spend more money on substandard Chinese food, go here. I'm pretty sure the dumplings my mom makes from Costco taste better than what you get here.
Simply said, a very good meal at the very reasonable price.

What a wonderful life it is when we can still be surprised by new, delicious and creative cuisine. Chino certainly fit the bill. They are a n Asian fusion/tapateria in the heat of my old hood at the corner Gruerrero and 16th.  Ii think we used to pop in for cocktails on our way home many moons ago.
This place has great ambiance, great music, and nice waitstaff.

I went to Chino shortly after it opened. I really wanted this place to buck the trend of so-so Asian food in the neighborhood, but it didn't. The food was so-so tasting for me. The food seems pricey to me. The drinks were good but slow to be made and served. The lines are probably still long, but I don't find it worth waiting for.

Really yummy!!!  Great design, fantastic service, and delicious food.  So glad I finally found a Chinese spot in the city that's made with high quality ingredients that leave you feeling great after a meal.  XLB was very authentic and probably the best I've had.  nom nom nom.

15% of Monday's bill goes to charity, and there's no line to sit down and enjoy some great grub. This local establishment has perfected old skool tacky mixed with bold Asian fusion. Hard to explain, but once you experience it for yourself, you'll know what I mean. Try the dumplings and the dry udon noodles!
Rarely do I find a restaurant that blows my mind and all of my senses.  Chino is one of those rare finds.
I think the food is yummy, quite yummy. Not cheap, but not too expensive. No shortage of spicy-ness. And there is a kid's menu that doesn't comprise of chicken nuggets.

Ive been wanting to try this place for ages & I brought a group of 10 friends here around 11pm on a Saturday night. We ordered a tonne of small dishes & were not disappointed. The standouts were the pork bao, pork riblets, dope ass wings, eggplant, cauliflower & of course the dumplings.
This is a beautiful and trendy spot. The atmosphere is fun, upbeat and lively.
Came here for XLB. They were a bit thick skinned for my preference and not soupy enough. Somewhat pricey at 6 dumplings for $9.
This place has super yummy, creative food! We ordered so much food--I couldn't even tell you what made it to our table, but
Overall a good experience with good food and service.
Love this place. only open for a few months, but you would never know it. Staff works together like a Swiss watch, and they all seem to actually enjoy providing top-notch service.

I give Chino 5 stars, for the food (which all was impressive, especially the Lamb Noodles and Skewers, and Bao Chicharones), the drinks (Boba!), but also for the staff who went above and beyond what I have experienced in a while. The staff was attentive, nice (incredibly nice), knew their food, ingredients, drinks, and seemed invested in making sure our experience was the best. Thanks guys!
Everything was delicious but the ceviche was the highlight. Absolutely flooring. Great atmosphere with some interesting lighting and a few shoes on the ceiling.
Can't be done.
DROOL DROOL DROOL

I'm not often in the city, and when I'm here and paying more than ten bucks for a drink I'd like it to be something special.  I came on a Sunday afternoon and ordered the 9-Volt which was small, weak, and not at all spicy, despite the pepper listed in the ingredients. My wife ordered a fruity special that wasn't on the menu yet which was also small and on the bland/weak side.  The slushy boba cocktails that our friends ordered were better, but I guess it's hard to go wrong with a splash of vodka on boba.

I've been to a fair number of trendy Chinese restaurants in the last year, with fusion elements, gastropub decor, and hipster appeal. I have to say, I'm susceptible to their charms, and I loved my dinner at Chino. The atmosphere and decor were vibrant, befitting a swanky restaurant that might serve $14 shared plates. We feasted on innovative Chinese fusion for two hours, and the damage was under $40 a person. Great value for a leisurely sit-down meal with good food and fun atmosphere.

I've been here now twice in 2 weeks. We brought some friends today. It's sooooo good!  The wings are to die for for and my husband and son can't get enough of the lamb noodles. Love love love the XLB too. The decor is fun and the service was excellent. Everyone was so friendly. Can't wait to come back again soon. I need more of those wings!

Delicious food. And good service. I have been here five times; unfortunately, the last three times, the music was so loud as to make it unbearable. If you plan on dining with anyone but you and your ear plugs, you should consider somewhere else. But if you want to test drive your new noise canceling headphone while eating some "dope ass" food, Chino is your place.
With Andalu gone (good riddance!) the mister and I were eyeballing this joint for a bit as it got redone. In comes Chino with its Asian fusion blazin, food blogs ravin'
Honestly?  Not a huge fan.  I went in because it's been on my list since before it even opened.  They're listed on 7x7's big drink list of 2014.  Seems to be pretty legit.
Sorry Chino, I thought I would love you because you took over an old restaurant favorite of mine (Andalu) and made the space look so much better, but I was a little disappointed in the food.

Will was an amazing bartender. Great service and recommendations that fit my palate. I loved the so strawberry because it wasn't too sweet. He also can custom cocktails to fit your taste. Great place to stumble upon with TVs and a great atmosphere.

Omg, where do I begin?   I had the Lady Boy Boba cocktail first. What a waste of $12. Thanks for the cheap rum, disgusting and not worth $12. Then I had the XLB dumplings,  BORING. Had to drown them in soy and even that didn't help. Then the cold sesame noodles, sooo  BLAND. Go to Mission Chinese Food.  Their food is bomb. By the way, where the fuck did my waitress go lol? Haven't seen her since I ordered my food 20 mins ago  DONT COME HERE. While we're on the subject stay away from any fusion restaurant in SF that isn't Chaya or Mission Chinese Food. I've been here 7 years and they're all overpriced with contemporary decor and piss poor food.

Would totally go again...good addition to the over populated Mission because it actually delivers on food.  Shocking.  Tasty dumplings, chill atmosphere, and we were decently full with a couple of drinks, and a few small plates running about $90 (little pricey but the quality was good so whatevs).
Love love love!  XLB to the Nth degree.  Dope ass wings.  So many other things I wanted to try!  I'll be back!

I went in mourning the old Andalu, but left so incredibly happy. I've been back twice, and each time my dinner companion agreed that it was an amazing meal. The two stand outs were the XLB and the Korean Rice Cakes-- both make me want to lick the plate. I loved the wings, whereas my partner loved the pork belly bao, and my friend loved the lettuce cups. Two thumbs up.

Meh. Overpriced and with tiny portions, at least the food could have been good to offset those minus points. But alas it was not. Honestly my impression was that this is what happens when a non asian chef makes asian food. (I don't even know if the chef actually is asian or not, but that's at least what i walked away feeling.)

Super delicious food, great ambiance, affordable prices, creative recipes, quick and friendly service. Had the shrimp dumplings, extremely tasty! This new restaurant is something you guys definitely want to try! I will come back to try the matcha ice cream, looks yummy.
I liked it. The service was good, but it did feel a bit rushed. It would be good to slow down a bit!
I work near here and usually don't have a chance to leave the office to grab a bite.  That has all changed since finding this fabulous dining experience.

It's one of those places. Have you been outside of your usual neighborhoods. You find a place to have coffee and fall in love with everything about the cafe... To the point you start to get excited every time you have an appointment in that part of town - so you can go back, try something new and love it all over again. This is that place.
Decent. I've tried their pastries, salads and sandwiches-- all were average. Nothing was bad, but nothing stood out either. Service was also on the slower side.
This place is good and has an awesome outdoor patio, but good lord what is with the attitude from employees?
I had the Yomba and sat in the sunshine in their gorgeous courtyard. Food was delicious and the setting was perfect!

Needed a place to grab a quick snack and coffee before an event. That's when I remember there is a cool looking cafe nearby! Did a search and *gasp* closes in half hour. Rushed over. Got cream cheese bagel and coffee. Price good. Bagel is heated just right, and coffee is good even around closing. Nice barista and environment. Didn't have time to check the succulent garden, but it looks nice at the distance. Will revisit!

What a wondeful and peaceful place. Sitting out in the garden under the trees, wifi available, very nice people all around, its just fabulous. Also Thomas and Malcom are the heads of Mission Creek and the Stable collective, a culinary incubator that is supporting the local food scene and organizing events. You should check them out. Lovely people with a great mission!
Came here to kill some time before an appointment.

I visited this little spot and met up with my cousin here about a month ago when touring SF.  I'm a sucker for plants, for the outdoor garden was a nice little touch.  I had the quinoa which was light and refreshing, yet filling.  It's only a couple minutes walk away from the BART.
A cute, cozy spot in the Mission to grab a cup of good coffee and a pastry.

Stable is currently my favorite place in the city. Their coffee is great, and their soups and sandwiches are always delicious. Recently had an asparagus + goat cheese panini. Yum. In addition to the great food, the design and layout is beautiful. The back patio they share with Lila B's is one of the loveliest places in the city.
Nice place to work on your computer or just chill and listen good music. Nice backyard to enjoy the sun.
Brie Bacon panini with a side salad is a near perfect lunch.  Outdoor garden is great.
My bf likes to show me all his new finds in the Mission and one Thursday morning before heading up to Yosemite to hike Half Dome that weekend, he took me to Stable Cafe.
Good food and super cute outdoor garden space spoiled by rude service from two of the three staff members there today. Not cool.
140711.       1st of many
Lovely! Stopped in for fresh fruit and oj after yoga. Perfect outdoor garden w lots of greenery.
I loved everything about that place. The employees were super friendly and nice, food was even better and the sitting area in the back was the only way to enjoy a decent meal.

I love this place.  I've been coming consistently for 2 years.  The indoor and outdoor seating is perfect for whatever you're looking for.  I love working here during the week,  and it's a great brunch option on the weekends with a cafe vibe so you're never waiting weekend brunch times. And... the staff rules.

I have never had such an amazing panini! But, I've also never had such Terrible service! My boyfriend recommended we come here for a quick bite to eat but he told me "you have to order, I can not Stand the woman behind the counter." I of course rolled my eyes, thinking he was a bit dramatic but after meeting him post-order I cried in agreement! Now let me get something straight, the food, coffee and interior (as well as exterior) was phenomenal!! And would give five stars had I not ordered..
I love the fact they have a patio and an upstairs area. Every time I've been here it has been empty and I always find room to sit. Upstairs can be stuffy, but overall love it
Perfect for a wedding in the city.

Quite good coffee on the expensive side, stepped in on a cold day for a coffee & I liked the hard wood-pub feel atmosphere. The food is quite expensive & if your in the neighbourhood and have some money to dish out then this is a fast style interesting place. I think there is free wifi. The upstairs is quite nice.
Yummy place to have brunch!

Beautiful space and decor, featuring and promoting local artists and nearby businesses. Good coffee. Nicely tucked a little off the mainstream. However staff are a little unprofessional, not friendly and forgetful--if that could be fixed this place would be practically perfect. $5 minimum...sigh. Also no trash can anywhere in sight?

I went there for breakfast one day and had just simple scrambled eggs and toast - awfully disappointing... not tasty at all, cheap bread and jam... eggs were ordinary... I still go there for lunch - there's this mushroom/goat cheese sandwich that's delish - but breakfast no more!

Stable Cafe is a good place for breakfast, brunch, and lunch. It's located near Folsom and 17th so a bit off the craziness on Mission. Maybe that explains why this place isn't too overly busy at times where you have to wait 30mins plus elsewhere to get a table.
Gorgeous design, a lovely garden patio, food looks great, coffee is terrific and of course they use all the best milks & milk alternatives. Will definitely be back.

Standing in line to order is so worth it at this place! Great coffee and amazing pastries. They serve breakfast and lunch and the food is delicious. Hands down favorite treat here is the bacon and Brie scone! The outdoor patio they share with The Cheese School is gorgeous and a great place to relax while dining. Great service too!

Really awesome breakfast! I got the Nono, which is an open-faced sandwich with eggs, cheese and tomatoes. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the cheese was melted on the baguette. I enjoyed the coffee here at well- I got a black coffee and it was delicious.
I stop by every morning on my way to the office. Great coffee, great b.fast.

It's a nice space.  As others have mentioned, the food and service is inconsistent.  The menu is balanced and the ingredients are quality; However, the menu isn't consolidated anywhere, the food prep is hit or miss, and the portions vary with each visit.  That would all be a bit more tolerable if the people that worked there were friendlier.  In the dozen or so times I've been there, the staff has been unfocused and indifferent at best.  On a few occasions, they've been outright rude and mocking, with an unappealing sense of entitlement, and as if they'd really rather you not be there.

Low flavor. Got the Nona (egg, tomato, cheese) but just had very little other than throwing those ingredients together. The music was pretty loud for working as well. Cant judge the coffee but was a bad fit to grab breakfast and start my day

Great space and location, but the quality of food leaves something to be desired.  It's mediocre at best.  Both my friend and I had panini sandwiches which were supposed to be accompanied by a side salad - all for $10.  Food arrived and consisted of approximately 5 pieces of lettuce and a drizzling of olive oil along with a costco food-court quality panini.   Ciabatta roll, slice of provolone and a slab of deli chicken.   Very unsatisfying and unappetizing.   The leash less, unattended dog that was allowed to run free in the outdoor patio seating area taking a crap right in front of our table didn't quite help to improve the quality of the experience.   Needs a lot of work and won't plan on returning.
One of my favorite spots in the city. Love the atmosphere, food is great, and so is the coffee!

What a gem.  I found Stable Cafe by chance - just driving by.  It has an awesome patio - super large with a mix of 'shade' and 'sun' seating.  Inside the cafe is equally as cool, with a loft-style hipster vibe.  I liked it.

Really cool cafe... like "hipster" cool cafe. But definitely everything I've had there has been quality and delicious. Plus they have a very pretty and spacious outdoor patio that's shared with a nursery - something that looks as if it should be in the Magazine Sunset. It's definitely pricier than most cafes, but once you're there you'll understand why. It's a mix of chic - hip - modern - urban - and  progressive. But for sure, the food and drink are downright excellent. Plus the weekend morning workers are always very friendly and supercool. Definitely thumbs up for me!
Love this place. Very simple menu but nice staff, great coffee. The cafe is super cute! The top / loft area is perfect for working and they have a beautiful outdoor area.

Since I thought I'd gotten a pretty tasty sandwich here in the past, I opted to give it another try. I chose the chicken panini and waited for 30 minutes for my take-out to be done. Once I returned to my office, I opened up my little package to find a dry baguette, a slab of dry chicken breast and a slice of provolone...and that's it. No condiments and no veggies, not ever the roasted peppers that are supposed to be included...and that for over $8. I know the prices have gotten a bit crazy in the Mission over the last couple of years, but at least you usually get a bit of quality to justify the increase. Here, you just get an expensive sandwich that leaves you wanting for taste. I guess I'll nibble on my snickers bar.
Staff was super friendly.  I had the Mixed Green Salad which was huge and great!!!!
If you want a good, quick, cost effective meal on the run, these guys are great
I am definitely not a picky eater by any means, and that's why I try to refrain as much as possible from writing reviews.

If you're at your leisure enjoying a nice stroll with your book and work up an appetite, have your feet take you here, a charming hole in the wall where you can fill your tummy and read in peace and quiet.
Pupusas weren't that great. Plain with no flavor. The place decor is dull. Customer service is great.

My sunday strolling place...Located on a sunny corner in the hidden nook of treat is this wonderful authentic mission brunch joint. Hands down best torta I have ever feasted on and with a side of fresh squeezed juice is just fine and dandy. Now back to my roof location to sunbathe. Ahhh.
EL Paraiso has breakfast, mexican entrees, bagels, sammies. small informal seating area.
One of The Mission's bet kept secrets. Where else in the city can you get egg and cheese on a bagel (with a side of salsa) for less than $3?
Been going here for years since they are a neighborhood cafe. I think its a mama-daughter business, and they are super nice folks. They are a bit reserved, don't mistake that standoffishness.

I live next door to this place. Their breakfast sandwiches on a croissant are super delicious. Their lattes aren't very good though, and sometimes they are slow. But those breakfast sandwiches rule. Four stars for the breakfast sandwich.

Been here twice now, and am lovin it!  So far, I have sampled a veggie sandwich with avo on a bagel, and a breakfast burrito with avo.  Both delish.  Prices are great.  My Mom and I shared one BLT and a breakfast burrito and walked outta there with spending 10 bucks including tip.  Sweet local joint.

1st time ever coming in this place... very clean friendly people.. i ordered a salami and roast beef sandwich.... it was good and all but honestly no meat at all.... seriously all bread and veggies just a few slices of meat... i had to order somthing else so i went ahead and ordered me a hummus bagel.... =( not what i expected... i have worked at delis and i know how to make hummus so i look for good hummus anywhere.... unfortunately this place does not have it... it was way way way toooo salty..
Love this place. They have the BEST breakfast & the ladies there r so nice. Definitely a takeout place do due the location, as well as difficult parking. $$ could b better, food I'd De-lish

This is such a wonderful pupusa spot to roll to on a saturday morn!  I get a couple of beans and cheese ones and their salsa and slaws are just the bomb! They also have lots of other stuff including good coffee and a great atmosphere.

I'll admit, I've been jealous lately because this place has been one of my favorite local places to come relax and grab a quick bit to eat for a while and now there are more and more people coming to it.  But this just shows that this place is a hidden gem in the mission and is worth venturing off 24th street for.  The pupusas are really good and they have some brunch plates with lots of variety (eggs w/ peppers, beans, chorizo, plantains, crema, etc).  You can sit outside and watch the soccer game across the street.
Was in here on lunch break. Its a block from 24th and I feel 'Ive eaten everything there is to eat on 24th so went south in search for sandwiches.

I stumbled on this place during dia de los muertes parade last year and needed some substance. I'd never had a papusa before but had heard of them. Zuchini and cheese papusas are fabulous and I'm so glad I discovered them at this place--- put everything on top, cabbage, hot sauce, yum!
Come across this place on yelp and found recent reviews sporadic at best. I was primed for an adventure to see if they still existed.
Had a bagel sandwich here that was as tall as it was wide, for only $5. The inside was a little too warm to sit in, but fortunately there is a few tables outside as well.
One of the best drip coffees in this area.  I always get a cup en route to work - fast , inexpensive, strong and fresh.  Check it out!
Good plain cooking, really nice pleasant atmosphere if you like a nice street corner by the park.  I had platanos with beans and crema. Really nice crema!!

nicest people, most amazing breakfast.  get the platanos, get them with real cream.  and you know what they also have?  a 94 health score, proving for perhaps the first time that mission delicious does not have to equal dirty.

El Paraiso is the most perfect corner cafe I have ever come across.  It doesn't have trendy decor or hipster baristas, and that's part of its charm.  But the real point-scorer is the deliciously healthy and muey inexpensive food.  We're talking 16 ounces of fresh-squeezed OJ for $2.50.  They also have killer breakfast burritos, delicious homemade hummus for their veggie bagel sandwiches, and just about anything else you could be craving for breakfast or lunch.

if El Paraiso was right across the street, i'd wake up every morning and amble over so I can ask mis mamitas to cook me up a plate-ful of platanos (fresh fried, lightly sugared, if any. slightly burnt but crisply yummy edges) served aside some frijoles, crema mexicana, queso y huevos con chorizo with some warm corn tortillas and fresh salsa and wash that all down with a big glass of pulpy freshly squeezed oj. but unfortunately for me, they're a few blocks away from mi casa so not only do i have to be in non-sleepwear attire, but i won't be able to satisfy my cravings quite as swiftly as I'd want. i wasn't feeling caffeine-ish this time, but I predict another foray where I will try some coffee bevvies or perhaps their other breakfast offerings (tamal de elote con crema, anyone? anyone?). kinda cool too, they've got internet connection (not sure about wi-fi) so a definite possible lazy afternoon of internet surfing hangout.
I just wrote the funniest review ever and then pressed the wrong button, which of course wasn't my fault, I blame that crazy mouse, it's out of control srrsly, and anyway my stupid review was gone.
This is a hidden gem in the mission.  From all appearances, its just another dodgy taquireia.  I happen to enjoy taquerias, but this turned out to be something else altogether.

I love this place. From the super friendly bartenders (wha'd up Christopher and Randy!) to the awesome projection screen(s) to watch a game, to the food and drink selection, this place has you covered. It has a neighborhood feel with an elevated look. Lots of potential here to turn into a jam-packed hangout, but for now, I like to think of it as my hidden gem in the neighborhood.
Delicious grayhound and yummy, yummy, generously-portioned shepherd's pie. The mashed potatoes here are something special. I hope to go back!
Awesome!  Nothing wrong and all deliciosa!  Ian at the bar and serving will be your favorite anywhere!  I'm gonna move IN here!

Came here today for my first time! My boyfriend lives close by and has been talking about it for weeks. He said the mushroom soup was bomb but when we got here they had switched it to chicken noodle curry, ok whatever not mushroom but we got it and boom it was delicious and not too heavy!

Walked past this pub and decided to walk in to have a happy hour pint ($5) and watch a little Thursday night Football (projection screen and tv's). Bartender was great and primed us with a Jameson shot. Wasn't too crowded on a Thursday.

Came here with the living social deal for brunch on Saturday.  I liked the atmosphere. It wasn't too busy around 2pm. We ordered the Full English breakfast, which had banger(pork sausage I think), black pudding ( not as bad as it sounds), 4 pieces of bread of your choice (white or wheat), bacons, eggs, beans and potato fries; and the egg benedicts. The portion was huge. Food was above average. We also had the hurricane and the gashead Shandy. The hurricane was little strong for my opinion. The gashead Shandy is more for people like lemonade or sour drinks.  I personally liked it. The deal also came with 2 non-alcoholic drinks! We had a great time there enjoying a lovely Saturday afternoon. I'm planning to come back for a dinner and their other drinks. The service was great too! Btw, the kitchen looks really clean as well.

Awesome!  Came here for brunch this morning and had a blast.  The music was fun (grunge from the 1990s), football games were visible, and the food was excellent.  The eggs Benedict with chips were truly fantastic.  Our cocktails were also delicious.  John, who was our server (and maybe the owner?  I'm not sure), was incredibly friendly and hard working and really made the whole experience complete.  Tons of coffee refills, they kept coming.  We will be back for sure!

Came here for brunch with a living social deal and it was amazing! Such good service, drinks and food. We had the cheese sticks, sliders, and the full english breakfast. You will not leave hungry or thirsty. Definitely go check it out!

We tried this place with the LivingSocial brunch deal on a Saturday afternoon.  Overall, it was an excellent experience.  The food was top, and the breakfast cocktails fresh and delicious. The chips were plentiful and perfectly textured. The English breakfast was proper, its sausage and blood pudding were the best I've had (including those I've enjoyed in London).  Even the "English muffins" were a delight. The best part of the meal, however, was the unpretentious, attentive, and incredibly warm service we received by the British gentleman (presumably the owner).

If you like exploring new places in the city, you might want to add this bar to your list! This new spot is still working on its British pub vibe, but has good potential to become a well visited bar in the area. Parking around here can be very difficult, but this is no novelty to you if you are familiar with this city. However, it is very easily accessible via public transportation! The service is good, the bartenders check on you regularly. The ambiance is vintage chic with architectural lighting, beautiful brick wall and antique looking mirrors made out of steel.  The drinks are average bar drinks, but apparently the food is really good! So definitely try it!

I initially came here because it's like the only legit English bar I know of in my neighbourhood, and it's comforting to have a piece of home here. Then I had the food, and chatted with some of the bar staff and on top of it offering some of the beers from the motherland that I'm in to, I now have a new local.
I want to preface this review by stating that I feel pretty bad about writing it.  I prefer to write glowing reviews.
Really not very good.  Not very good, really.  Really.  Not very good.
The gal working was really nice, fancy drinks and cool interior but they gotta get English beers on tap!!
Still working out its British pub vibe, I can tell - but definitely potential to be had with this drinking establishment.

Fish and chips A++ server was nice - enjoyed snagging one of the little tables outside in the mission sun. Champagne cocktails yum bet eh don't know that I would pay for it if it wasn't part of my living social deal- but oh so refreshing. Loved the coffee too.
Came for a drink at 10:40 on Saturday night. LOts of seats open at tables and the bar. Yet, was served the drink at 11:10!

I've been wanting to try this place ever since I read it opened (on yelp of course), and it did not disappoint.  I saw pictures of the cheese sticks and knew I had to try them! They were to die for! So fresh and cheesy and just perfect, so I highly recommend ordering them.  I love mussels so I wanted to try those as well and they were solid.  The hubby wasn't that hungry but couldn't resist eating like half because they were so good. My only complaint is that there wasn't enough bread for the broth at the end, but I'm sure we could have asked for more.
I got yelp deal and the fish and chips are amazing.  a neighborhood gem.
Came for brunch on a Saturday and there was only one other pair there. Since it wasn't busy, we received our orders fairly quickly.
The food, holy crap. That is some really damn good British food. My mum's English and I have family in London, I have a decent-enough idea of what i'm talking about.

The fish and chips is quite good. The server curiously provided a bottle of Worcestershire sauce for the fish... wasn't into it. Yes, its main ingredient is vinegar, but I would've preferred old school malt vinegar. I also had a crab cake slider, which was also good. Good, attentive staff. My only wish is that they had actual British beer on tap (Boddingtons, for example), though they had several good ones bottled, including Old Speckled Hen (which, by the way, is available on tap elsewhere in the Bay Area).

Gashead is a great place to be at in the Mission district, the staff is great and the bar is obsoletely amazing. If your looking for a nice place to enjoy a drink and some delicious food  Gashead is the place to be at. If your around the Mission district I highly recommend stopping by and grabbing a drink or two!

I was very happy to see this place open up in the neighborhood. It is something different with a great vibe. I look forward to coming here again for some other than drinks next time;) The food looks great!

strong drinks, but at $10 a pop. not especially well mixed. the food menu is pretty awesome and decently priced. had the fish n chips, very good with thick fries but a little on the salty side. very new and very relaxed atmosphere with an english/grungy feel. I'd say its a good place to meet with friends casually and hang out for a few rounds.

Had a great night at the Gashead Tavern with my friends. We were able to bring the kids and they enjoyed themselves too. The food was excellent- I had the bangers and mash and they were the real deal. Also I recommend the fish and chips.The chips were also delicious and very authentic! They are double cooked in lard but they did a vegetarian version for my friend. The drinks were also great. They have different drink specials everyday and as we were there on marguerita Mondays we got 2 for the price of one! Good food, service and atmosphere:)

I went for dinner last evening and I was unfortunately not impressed. The potato soup was ok, the deviled egg ($3) was dry and not that tasty, and I could have made the bangers and mash better, at home (they used frozen veggies too)...and charged $18.

Great new addition to this neighborhood.  Stopped in on Sunday afternoon for drinks and a few snacks.  It's a beautiful space with good lighting with a nice looking bar and tables and even some outdoor seating. There are also TV's to watch your favorite sports team.

Super excited for this new spot!  I have been waiting for Matt Nudelman to make delicious food again.  I have been to Gashead three times now.  The food has not disappointed me one bit.  I have had the Fish and Chips, Bangers and Mash, as well as the Sliders.  I tried all three sliders.  I would say my favorite was the burger slider.  I do have to say  that I wish they just had a full size burger.  I don't need to be eating three little ones.  Whoever reads this, please make a regular sized burger!  I almost forgot, the desserts are not to be missed!
Fun, funky music. Great liquor selections. A bit small but is decorated well! I'll probably be back soon to try the food!

They have a good selection of beer, a decent variety of booze, and the food is excellent. The atmosphere is very laid back and friendly. I went here by chance with a friend of mine, we ended up staying for several hours to watch a hockey game on the overhead TV, chat with the staff, and enjoy some mussels as an appetizer. I had the fish and chips, which were quite tasty, and my friend said he really enjoyed the bangers and mash.

It was lovely Sunday afternoon. I was walking home from work and noticed Gashead. I remember it showing up on a Thrillist or 7x7 email as a British place worthy of checking out. I wish I remembered which email list it came from, so I could let them know it is not worth checking out. There is nothing British about it, besides a few subpar food items. It doesn't have the feel of anything British nor the beverage selection. What it does have is $7 Anchor Steam and $18 fish and chips, which were way fishy (my bad for ordering fish on Sunday) and very small portions for the cost. This is not a destination spot, and if you live in the area, you probably know of a spot with better food and prices, albeit Irish.

The kitchen at Gashead produces really good fare.  The Bangers and Mash was perfectly executed and met the high expectations of my British husband, who is picky and opinionated when it comes to sausages.  The Sliders, which include three options - hen, traditional beef burger and curried pork - are delicious and the fries, which are cooked in lard(!) and available as a side dish, might be addictive.
After Matt left Greenburger I was in anticipation for his next project.  He's now cooking at Gashead and doing a great job.

Great new standout spot in a neighborhood full of options.  The food and the drinks were absolutely delicious.  I had the Bangers and Mash, and my lady had the Fish and Chips.  Both were out of sight and perfect portions.  The double fried chips were the real deal.  Service was excellent - but the music was a bit too loud for dinner conversation.  Since they're new, I'm sure they'll work out this minor kinks and find the right volume for the place.  It would be nice if they had a wine list, but my wife ended up LOVING the Paloma cocktail.  After seeing other patron's food coming out of the kitchen, I'll definitely come back to try the rest.  Looked amazing.
3.5 STARS
Food was really good. They kinda made a scene when we decided to split the bill four ways.
Great beer selection. The atmosphere is casual and nice. Pizza was delicious.

awesome chill place. Great pizza, lovely bartenders. We just moved to the neighborhood from Baltimore and have been looking for low key non tech bro spots - this bar is great. Can't beat the happy hour pizza +brew deal.
Love this place. Cute n cozy. Neighborhood bar, they have pretzels. Good atmosphere and definitely the place to drink beer in the mission / SF. Go try this place, you will like it.

This is  a great place.  The pizza was delicious, and the beer selection was amazing.  The bartender that helped us was laid back and really cool.  But the reason for this review is for that amazing spinach salad with the housemade sausage.  ($14).  It was now on my list as one of the top salads in the city.
What's with the shade, Yelpers?
First of all, I would add another half star if I could - just for their logo.
For pizza and craft beer this place is great. Don't expect any fluff. It's great for what it is.

If this review was based solely on how tasty the food was, I'd have to give a five star rating but $7 for the Stromboli appetizer (which I thought was delish!) last night was ridiculous. The portion was three strips. That amounted to three bites, albeit big bites but still... Felt ripped off. (Pizza was priced right though.)

My boyfriend and I ordered a cheese pizza and side of garlic bread for more than $30 and both dishes sucked, to put it bluntly. Pi Bar is where I recommend you take your worst enemies--as long as they're paying. The environment is torturously loud, full of San Francisco Silicon Valley wonks. We were forced to move tables to allow a party of the aforementioned wonks to get sloppy drunk six inches away from us and were bordered on the other side by a man who spoke loudly of his sexual relationships the entire time we were there. No way could we understand anything we were trying to say to each other on our date night! What a horrible restaurant. One star for the bearded bus boy, who was the only person in the entire place to treat us with any sort of humanity.
Good selection of beer but very slanted towards IPAs. Had the pretzle and sicilian and both were quite meh.

My husband and I love this place! It was our favorite place for a dinner date in the neighborhood before our daughter was born and now that she is a toddler, we are happy that we still feel welcome back. There aren't many places in the city that are family friendly and that we also would opt to go to on a date night out. We don't feel doomed to dine at cheesy restaurants just because we have a baby. The staff is friendly, the service is great and the food, beer and wine are top notch. Highly recommend!

Pi Bar is a nice, small pizza joint located near the Mission. I came here on a Saturday night with two of my friends and was very amused by how this restaurant plays up their "pi" theme. (For example, they open at 3:14 pm everyday.) The interior is pretty dim and what you expect from a bar. We were seated pretty quickly, and the service staff was very courteous and attentive throughout our entire stay. We ordered two pies: mushroom and pepperoni. Despite the pizzas being very greasy, I thought that it was pretty standard and what you would expect -- nothing too special. For the reasonable price and decent food, I will be back next time I am in the mood for pizza.
Tasty thin crust pizza and a revolving selection of craft beers like O.B.C. Sticky Zipper? Oh, don't mind if I do.

Finally time to express my appreciation for this place. With a constantly rotating tap of craft beer from local brewers, a great slice and beer happy hour deal, friendly staff, and accepting of children; for a couple of beer-drinking parents, Pi Bar is a godsend. Thank you guys!

Came here for Russian River brew day on beer week.  It's well located in the Mission, relatively clean, and has great service (unlike some of the other spots in the Mission who think they are doing you a favor when you give them money for a drink).

I came here yesterday with a friend for the Deschutes Brewery event for SF beer week. We first stopped by ~ 7ish, but could barely get through the door, so we ate dinner elsewhere and came back for beers.

Saturday February 8 was beer week and Pi Bar was pouring Deschutes Brewery's beers. Never been to Pi but was very familiar with Bend brewery Deschutes excellent beers and looking forward to trying a few not normally available. Arrived shortly after 3pm....3.14...how cute,  and was shocked to see a "pour" of 6 ounces priced a $6. That translates to $16 per pint!!!...we left and went to Beer Revolution in Oakland which was hosting a Sierra Nevada tap takeover of 58 taps and priced pints were a very reasonable $6. Won't be back to this place.
Slice of pizza + pint of beer for $7... count me in!
I love, love, love this place. Where else can you get a slice of really good, sit down pizza for $3?
So nice. So good. Real nice. So good.

This place gets a gold star for being awesome. The menu is short and sweet. The waiters are laid back. The beer list is always changing and always good. The pizza is unique and really fuckin good. It's better than delfina for sure, fuck that place.

Went here last night for the first time after recently moving to the Mission and loved it! Started with the pretzel which was smaller than i would have liked but tasty. Then I had the spinach salad and the bf had the lasagna - both were awesome. I definitely am coming back for the pizza but its awesome that they have so many other great options. The beer selection was good too - Russian River Blind Pig never disappoints. It looked like there was a decent bottle selection too.

It's okay, but a bit of a rip-off when it comes to value.  Some of the beer comes in a smaller glass that should honestly come in a pint.  I realize that some beers come in specialty glasses, but they just do it to rip you off here.

My boyfriend had his first Delirium Tremens experience here the other night while we were entertaining some out of town guests. I can't tell if it was Pi or watching him pound through the 22oz bottle, only to realize how strong it was 20 minutes later that made the evening a success. Either way we had a great time, and the beer selection did not disappoint.

I mean, this place is dirt cheap and huge....also they have Delirium on tap. Brilliant. I've never crowded and is super easy going, lots of space to sit and tastes similar to pizza I'd find in NYC. Service is lags a little but hey, it's a bar...who cares.

Nice spot to meet up with people. Service was slow - I imagine if we sat at the bar it would be better. The server tried very hard to get me to order beer instead of wine. I don't like beer - after explaining this a few times he brought me a taste of one he was sure I'd like. I didn't like it -but I give him props for trying. I did like the wine.

Reasons to go here: not crowded, exciting beers with a bent towards IPAs, pizza pizza pizza. The Death and Takes mushroom sauce pizza is amazing; add some caramelized onions and olives to that and it becomes special. It's good stuff so is a hair more expensive than I'd want, but that's ok. The bartender also said he'd charge us $0.25 / second to do a keg stand if he could, but that we couldn't do that.
This place is ok. Kind of a 50/50 cross between a bar and a restaurant. Pretty casual place to hang out.

The pizza here is ok ~ the atmosphere  always seems to be loud n noisy due to all the noe valley people who bring their noisy kids along~ but for the area it seems to be the best pizza. I guess I would recommend this spot to parents with noisy kids.
Pi bar has authentic New York style pizza--a rarity for the West Coast. Ingredients are fresh, and the dough is amazing. Get some polenta fries alongside your slices.
They have great pizzas and an ever-changing list of great beers!
What made me fall in love with this place?

Pi Bar is a cool hangout, with a manageable selection of good beer, and a kitchen that turns out tasty pizza.  You can order by the slice, which is nice if you're not too hungry.  I recommend the polenta fries if you're looking for a starter.

I really want to like this place.  The bar is nice and the beers are good.  But if  a place is going to tie its fortune to pizza and beer, the pizza better be really good, and in this case it just isn't.  I agree with the Girlish M. review here.  Who cares about organic this and that if it doesn't actually taste good.  The crust just does not cut it, i's like bread rather than crust, and too dense.  The cheese and red sauce are just meh.  It is not that hard to make a nice pie.  If they could figure that out, the place would be jumpin.  Til then, there are loads of better options.

$40 for a large pizza with 3 toppings takeout - we picked it up promptly as we live around the corner. The pizza was super oily, sloppy and mushy. Never again. Giant rip off. Disgusting. This Jersey girl will go elsewhere.

Had the mushroom pizza (and don't remember the other), but they were really fresh. The beer selection was pretty good. I suppose it changes frequently since it was written on a chalk board. Street parking is available. Staff are all pleasant to deal with.
Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.
I'm changing my rating from 2-stars to 3, because I actually go here fairly often for their great beer selection.  I don't feel right frequenting an establishment that I've only rated 2-stars.
I guess I should have known better than to go to a bar for pizza....

Great tasting food. Kind service staff. All food is home-made. I'm been here several times. Taste of food never disappoints. Colombian classics such as empanadas and the famous Bandeja Paisa are popular. Come to this place if you have want good affordable home made food. However, there is only one person acting as the server, so it's does take time- very latin! Come here when you are NOT in a hurry.

Top five favorite places to eat in San Francisco because of the quality and deliciousness of the food.  The atmosphere isn't the best and there is an annoying TV on all of the time.  Regardless, I gave it five stars because I really can't get enough of their plantains, papusas, soups and their beans that taste like they have an ancient recipe from the bean-gods.

I cant complain at All!!! Nobody can cook better than them!   I love it    Trust me thewaitis worth it!   The food is Delicious. I travel miles n miles just to go eat there!!!!   Enpanas n pupusas and jugo de mora que delicia.   An lets not mention the pan the bono!  Que rico

Great food with ranting reviews by my Colombian husband. The juices are addicting...try guanabana con leche. Large portions. Small place, but great if you can come in a group to try a little of everything. Don't come here in a hurry (service a bit slow) but if you have time enjoy! Metered parking on the street and we haven't had a problem finding a spot nearby.
Cheese, cheese, cheese. So much cheese.
Pupusas, tamales, pandeja and "kimchi" are quite good. I'd love to come back and try more especially the ajiaco.

U ever eat something so ridiculously delicious that you start dreading death because that will signify the finality of your ability to eat something? Probably not but that's where I'm at after having the PEPPERJACK PUPUSAS at El Majahual in the mission. Any wait is worth it any compromise would be worth it I'm in love with this dish. Absolutely one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten.

Just walked in off the street because pupusas sounded good. The wait was a little long and we started getting antsy, but they brought our beers right away so we were OK. When the food came out it looked delicious and smelled good too. Then I took a bite. OMG, all I can say is so worth the wait.
