The pupusa was moist and delicious, plenty of cheese in the pepper Jack one I got. The pork one was also moist and flavored well. Will definitely hit this place up again when I'm in the Mission. They say the pepper jack was a special item, I sincerely hope it never goes away.

Wonderful Colombian food! I highly recommend sancocho it's so delicious and Bandeja Paisa! It's difficult to find Colombian food in San Francisco but  fOUND IT! nice food, really clean, friendly staff! I definitely will come back!
One star because the food was good once it *finally* got to us, and one star because of Yelp obligation.

Terrible customer service.  But decent food and cheap compared to other restaurants in this hood. Tried chicken soup and it was delicious. Won't come back unless am ready for another rude treatment from the server.
Good food but HORRIBLE service. Not only are they slow, but they're incredibly rude. Such a shame this is the only Colombian restaurant in town.
Best Colombian restaurant I've ever been to outside of Colombia. The empanadas rival even my grandmother's. It is that authentic. The Salvadorian pupusas are also top notch.

Picture it. Months of having the 100 members of my entourage packed and awaiting transportation to our new home in Cambridge, the endless packing and cleaning of the house in St. Louis, we finally arrived in San Francisco for our 6 week stay. I am not ashamed to say that my paws were dog tired. Luckily one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco is only 4 blocks away, El Majahual.

I absolutely love every single thing I tried in here but my favorite is the pusas either with meat or spinach. Their drinks are equally delicious and generous in size. There are so many things that you will only find here and do not hesitate to try those.
I'm Colombian but I tried the Salvadorean food, very tasty. Plates are large, much like in Latin American countries. Arrayana juice, very good.

on weekends this place is packed, the service is excellent ! the food is all prepared the way they prepare it in Colombia and El Salvador. of course if your from Mexico, Honduras, all those other countries, the food might be a little different but it's good ! I definitely recommend going here on weekends because I think the owners son is the one who works as waiter Saturdays and Sundays and he speaks perfect English and Spanish and explains to customers what Lulo is or the lorroco in the pupusas which by the way are the bomb ! the only thing though you gotta have time to eat because if it's packed you gotta wait. the longest I waited for my plate was 25 minutes. for the Bandeja Paisa ! typical Colombian dish, full of flavor ! y'all have got to try it ! and the Guanabana juice it's amazing ! if I were you, I'd pick up a to go menu and call in 20 minutes before going so that the food can be ready once you walk through that door and let your tastebuds go to heaven ! :)
The Colombian chorizo & arepas,  Colombian empanadas are all good. Try the juices for something really special; I did the Lulo con leche - really good.
My first experience with Columbian. I thought it was good, would like to try more. Small place but the inside is one giant fresco from wall to ceiling. Great service.
good food, I like it

It was great to have Colombian food because it has been so long since I've had it. We ordered only one item from the Salvadorian menu, una pupusa de queso, and then we got empanadas Colombianas and el sudado de pollo. My friend ordered a Colombiana to drink and I got jugo de lulo- my favorite! By far my favorite part of the meal was my juice, it really brought me back! They also have all the other juices that are common in Colombia- guanabana, guayaba, mora, and maracuya. We wanted hot chocolate with un pandebono for dessert but they were out of pandebono so they gave us little cups of arequipe that they had. I would like to go back and try their ajiaco.
first colombian restaurant ive been to in california and it was an absolute success. their carne asada was amazing.
"A comer se a dicho!"

I came here with my SO this weekend and it was fantastic! I had never had Colombian food before but my SO is Colombian and has high standards for authenticity. He said this place's sancocho and tamal remind him of his grandmother's back in Colombia. So that is pretty damn authentic if you ask me.

Great Colombian style empanadas! I've been searching for these since I came back from Miami. They are different than your average empanadas these are made with corn flour and the texture and flavor are much better. I didn't try anything else here yet.
DON'T GO HERE THEY WILL CHARGE YOUR CARD MORE MONEY IF THEY ARE NOT SATISFIED WITH THE TIP!!!
This is the 3rd in my list on Vegan the Mission.

They definitely deserve these five starts. If I could I would give them ten! The food is absolutely delicious, I always order from the Colombian menu and I have to say I am always 100% satisfied. Hernando and Regina are always here to make sure all food is hot and delicious! I love them, and their pollo sudado! The best! :-)

Salvadoran food is such a great way to get in a good, inexpensive meal.  Fresh curtido and sauce for your veggies, and pupusas for your protein and starch.  Pupusas were stuffed with cheese and not too greasy.  I wish the curtido didn't have such strong onion flavor.

The stars totally mischaracterize the proper rating this place. Stellar pupusas with coleslaw, vegetarian tamal, & fried plantains. And you better get out of my way if you are blocking access to one of those mango or papaya shakes.
This is a great place in the mission to great authentic Salvadorian/Colombian food. I would highly recommend anyone to go here if you like papusa.

Not good at all. We should have left when we had to wait 15 minutes just to place an order. This place is VERY small so we were seen and there were 4 people working. Food quality less than poor! Bistec a caballo was awful!! Bandeja piasana was supposed to have a sausage on the side but what we got was something that didn't look edible at all. And the meat served was no bigger than the palm of a 6 year olds  and soooo over cooked. After we finally had our order taken we waited another 30 minutes or more to get our food while others were being served their appetizers and drinks. Oh and we didn't get our cans of 7up until just before our food came out. We should have walked out but we were starving.  Bottom line DON'T WAYSE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.
Not worth your time,tastebuds, or money.

I love El Majahual. Go for real Colombian food, including really hard to find fresh fruit juices. This is a small, family owned restaurant that makes everything by hand. I just wish they would play some Colombian music and it would be perfect  :)

So. So. Good. I've somehow managed to have a lot of mediocre to downright bad pupusas in this city, but these don't disappoint. You can see them being made with love and they are amazing. The owner and his son are sweet as well. There is a wait for the food, but it is being made fresh for you to enjoy! So enjoy!
The food was tasty and well cooked but it was not proper Colombian Food.
AUTHENTIC! Love this mom & pop place. Slow service, but the food is legit and the owners are great. This was the first place I tried when I moved to SF, and the last when I left

Don't come to Majahual if you are starving; the wait - for the Colombian dishes, at least - is consistently long.  Don't come if you require attentive, or even warm, service; consider yourself lucky to be offered a glass of water.  Come if you enjoy food that is as straightforward and it is elegant, like the satisfying sancocho with oxtail, the meat not quite fall-apart-tender but delicious when chewed off the bone.  Come for the petite empanadas, their crisp corn casings filled with potato and bits of stewed beef, and for the watery but refreshing chimichurri, a well composed counterpoint to the hearty fare.

This place was pretty delicious. I ordered "caldo de res", which is beef soup. Recommend this place if you are on Valencia. We also had a few of their papusas too, that was really delicious. The size was pretty decent, so i don't think it was that expensive.
So far these pupusas are the best I've had. They are fully stuffed, I got cheese & that cheese was yummy alright. Definitely coming here again.

I really enjoyed their French bread and sauce. Idk what the sauce it but I liked it a lot. I ordered the tortilla de patata which is basically eggs and potato. And as basic as that is, it was really good. The garlic chicken was a little dry but I liked the sauce. The grilled muscles were really fresh. I've never been to a tapas place but I really enjoyed the different plates.
I think it was really good, the food, the ambiance and the servers. Yes, we had the Paella, we want to go back again and again. Fortunately we didn't have to wait.

Excellent Sangria and an even amazing happy hours(like my lady says.  Lol!!). Food was great and it took no more than 15 minutes to come out with half the restaurant compleat full. Maria Jose was amazing. At one point(for a long while) it seemed like she was the only one service the entire place and was as cordial and smooth and cool as ice. Great job!!!
Great great food. Horrible service. We were there for almost 2 hours waiting for lost of the time. Good thing we weren't in a rush!!

good prices and awesome variety of tapas. loved the sauce offered with complimentary baguette! the oxtail was excellent. lobster tail was overcooked :/ the combo plates we chose were really yummy - snapper, and husbamd had the beef/pork/chicken stew. we especially appreciated the portion sizes/prices.
Came here once before and am in love! We ordered the clams, garlic shrimp, grilled salmon, oysters and muscles, bomb!! $44

Mmm Picaro! I'm itching to go back just thinking about it. The boyfriend and I double dated and our friend chose this spot. The ambiance was very relaxing and had that Latin vibe. I think its best to go as a group so you can order lots and share the tapas. And ost importantly- the paella!
Paella de Langosta with lobster was delicious. Will need to go back to try their sangria!
SANGRIA!
I took my parents here for lunch and as usual we had great service. Our waiter was very nice. It was my dad's birthday so he got a complimentary flan dessert :)

My friend and I stopped here for a drink and a bite and couldn't have been more delighted. We thought all the outside seating was taken, but our server took the initiative on our behalf when we mentioned our previous desire for outdoor seating and very graciously separated a couple two-person tables and made us our own table.
great paella, tortilla and sangria

Younger cousin is a foodie so I told her to join Yelp!  well sorry but wasn't impressed it was too loud couldn't hear yourself talk the food was mediocre was not impressed with the food only thing. t I really like was the shrimp garlic, bread with the garlic sauce ox tail soupwas so tender and flavored.
I wish I could remember all the food that my party ordered, but man that sangria gets you.

I love this place.  I've been going here for years and the food is always consistent, the service friendly, the prices reasonable.  My favorites are the $10 pitcher of Sangria, the Gambas al Ajillo, Grilled Asparagus, Papas Bravas, and Garlic Chicken in Red Sauce.  The bread and spicy dipping sauce they serve you is super addictive.  Highly recommend this place for a casual and fun dining experience.

Oh, so goooood! We live close by and like going here, but tonight was even better than usual. We sat outdoors in the back patio and the evening was fantastic: warm and pleasant, very un-San Francisco. We were there early, so the customary pitcher of Sangria was only $10 -- and very tasty (as usual). Our selection of the evening consisted of:

I found a cockroach in my Parrillada....it was a mid size one, blended in with the onions and potatoes....and I found it in the last bite after I took it home, so I couldn't even express my madness to the server...and who knows if my friends and I have eaten the other cockroach or not, since it was dark in the restaurant. I mean I liked the food there. Everything I ordered was tasty. But this is just ridiculous...I'm still feeling sick for what I just saw.

Other reviews have mentioned poor service but of the 5 to 6 servers I've met all of them have been friendly (making eye contact) and on point.  They are pretty busy all around and the restaurant is pretty big so no surprises it took longer than 2 minutes to get our bill.

I really love this place! So much less pretentious than much of what you find in the mission these days: good, solid menu + laid back but lively atmosphere + very affordable makes it a great deal in an area increasingly lacking great deals. Recommended: gazpacho, patatas bravas, garlic shrimp + the fried artichoke hearts. Plus they have Estrella, which is a killer beer from Spain that's generally hard to find.

I think since my last review I've really come to like this place. They always have miyagi $1 oysters, and I love their anchovy stuffed olives! They have a variety of things I've tried and haven't been disappointed. It's actually become one of my go-tos over cha cha cha.

I'm not really a huge tapas fan and I was very impressed with Picaro. The bravas sauce was full of garlic, and went well with their potatoes and bread. The ham and toast was on point. The star of the night was the tiny chorizo, we couldn't get enough of them. This place is very affordable given the quality, and I highly recommend it.

Loved this place, can't wait to go back. The dipping sauce they give with bread is to die for! Perfect amount of spice. Patatas bravas are highly recommended. Sangria was really good to. Mushrooms could've used a little more spice. Good sauce on the Spanish omelette. Croquettes were good. One of the ham entrees were dry.

Picaro is one of the best authentic Spanish restaurants in the area. They have one of best sangria and tapas of the area! Not to mention, you can never go wrong with their fresh Oysters! I would recommend this place any day! Happy hour is the best!
for such a busy place, I would expect the food to be better
In the mood for good tapas and EPIC sangria? Stop by Picaro!

Totally disappointing. The emplyees are rude and don't seem to care much about the guests. I have emailed the owner in several occasions and he has not bothered to reply. The food is good and unexpensive but the lack of service and rudeness by the staff members are too much to digest.

If you are craving for a good paella, this is the place to be.. looks like this a regular spot for my family now.. love their food, very cheap and the service was super awesome! We've tried their paella, Grilled Vegetable Salad  (my fave), Paella de Carnes y Mariscos ( super good), Repollo Rehogado ( this is one is just so so) Trucha Escabechada (not a fan of this marinated trout) and last time we tried their combination plates... the salmon was good, though the spinach beshamel was too rich but I think it went well with the grilled salmon.. stewed zuchinni was good.. just a lil bit disappointed with the stewed rabbit, wished that there was more meat in there but overall, its a good restaurant... parking was always a problem unless you already know your way around the Mission then there would be no problem at all..

This is one of my favorite go to tapas place! I usually always get the same thing gambas ala jillo (garlic shrimp), lobster or seafood pallea, patatas bravas, lobster tail, and of course the sangria! It's all so delicious! The complimentary French roll with the special sauce is amazing! Overall, this place has great selection of tapas!
I've been coming here for over 2 years, but I've never left a review for this place before. What! Okay so finally I'm writing one, but where do I start!
Met a few friends here for snacks. Decided to sit outside because it was a nice day and it was freaking hot and humid inside.
I love their sangria! Very flavorful. Great combination of wine and fruit. My number one spot for sangria. Try it out!

My friend and I came here for lunch and shared two tapas (lobster tail & garlic mushrooms) and a seafood paella. The lobster tail was cooked really well. I liked the way it was seasoned. The mushrooms were probably my favorite. Not too oily and perfect amount of garlic. Just the way I like it! The seafood paella was really good, too. I thought it was so much food! We couldn't finish it all. The paella came with the perfect amount of seafood. My friend and I were so full by the end.
Amazingly fresh and flavorful spanish tapas!

Solid spot for tapas, and now that Andalu is gone I'll be visiting more often.  I've eaten here several times and always try something different.  Standouts have been their sautéed calamari, garlic shrimp, and grilled artichokes.  The complimentary bread and dipping sauce is also really tasty - somehow we always finish the basket no matter how stuffed we are. Tapas prices are really reasonable ($5-$7/plate), and during happy hour (lunchtime and 5-7pm) you can get a whole pitcher of yummy Sangria for $10!
Amazing place for groups and tapas. Peculiar, interesting yet delightful tastes all over your plates. Live mariachi and the best sangria yet!

This is rating on the food and service.  The interior design and decor does not give justice to the food!  The bread baskets with garlic sauce before the meal were sooooo good.  We ordered a seafood platter and couple of paellas to share with the group.  All the food was very delicious.  I also enjoyed both the white wine and the sangria.   The food here is highly recommended.

Went here for a friend's birthday dinner. The best thing about the food was the dipping sauce for the bread, which at best could be described as chipotle mayo. The sangria was WAY too sweet. Later I discovered that they increased the tip I wrote on the receipt, which was already satisfactory (I'm a student but I'm not a jerk). Mediocre food, cheap ambiance, overworked waiters, futzing with the receipt - will not be returning.

Pretty good Spanish food...Ordered the croquetas and patatas bravas for Tapas. The patatas was great and tasty but the croquetas  lacked flavor. The Meat and Seafood Paella was good, just lacked a tad bit of salt to bring out the flavor. The samgrias were perfect to drown the food down. The sangrias were perfect- fruity and so flavorful yet there is a yummy alcohol hit  The ambiance felt very Barcelona. Overall, a nice quaint place!
The cheese plate was not nicely presented and only contained few nuts. Liked that you receive some spicy sauce with the bread. Friendly service.

Great food in a great location. My friend and I got a bunch of appetizers to share so we can try numerous things.. Oo man they were all so good! And that orange spicy sauce  they give you with the bread, amazing! And chocolate mouse, just yumm!
We have been dining at this place for many years.

Best burrito I've have in a long time. I got the carnitas burrito and I would probably get it again. I could only eat half of it but I ate the rest of it cold later that night and it was still delicious. Also very fast service and really nice servers/cooks. I will make the trek to the city again just for this burrito.
Cash only. Their chips are incredible and they give you a large jar of yummy fresh salsa. I ordered fish and Al pastor tacos. 3 tacos was way too much. Very spicy.
I think this is one of the best taquerias on 24th st. The only downside is that it's cash only.
Got a lengua burrito and a couple tacos to share. Everything was unbelievably bland. Everything needed salt. I've never been bored by a burrito until now. This is the Ben Stein of taquerias.

So, I've decided to embark on the true San Francisco pilgrimage: the search for the best super burrito. Sure, there are a handful of go-to places in my own neighborhood, but I'm starting to tire of them. Also, I have to wonder, is there a better burrito out there? First up Taqueria San Francisco.

$14 for a legit set up of beer chips spicy salsa burrito and tip.  Salsa is actually pretty spicy and has a nice kick to it.  I have been used to seeing either salsa bars or places giving you small cups of salsa but Taqueria actually gives you a jar of salsa.  Such trust that this establishment has and as a huge salsa fiend, I was careful not to breach this trust and go ham on their amazing salsa.

When first moving to the Mission 2+ years ago, I put out the word that I needed knowledge of at least five decent to great taquerias that would satisfy my constant and unquenchable need for Mexican food. Mexi food has been a staple in my diet since I discovered that my young and very picky pallet enjoyed very spicy food and the option of only refried beans from my hometown favorite burrito place, Guerrero's (
A City native said it was the best taco in San Francisco. It was. Maybe in Northern California, too.

Walked in here on a whim after reading some reviews and was pleasantly surprised.Went back one last time before leaving SF to Miami. The tacos were really tasty and a great bang for your buck. Items came with sides of chips and amazing house-made salsa. Don't waste time at any of the surrounding taquerias/Mexican restaraunts!
Super Veggie Burrito is really good and too big to eat in one sitting.  The service is fast and the staff is very friendly.

I live about 5 mins away from sf taqueria and come here often. Their burritos aren't mind blowing, but definitely one of the best in the city. What really makes this restaurant stand out though is their salsa, both the pico and guacamole based. I recommend their al pastor or grilled chicken burritos, and the burrito mojado which isn't something that can be ordered at the comparable burritos places surrounding it.
Great Mexican takeout. They make all their own tortillas right there!! Not expensive either.
Place suck dont belive reviews prices are.high 4 blocks up the.best burrito spot on 24th these guys are crooks they see.Latin community is almost gone.n mission n want to raise price lol

Do NOT go there for the nachos-- they charge $10.50 for the meat super nachos but they use that disgusting cheese sauce out of a can. You can get far superior nachos from El Metate for only $6.50. I had their carnitas nachos and an al pastor taco. I wasn't impressed with either of the meats. The service was slow because the workers were too buy talking to each other.

I had the Menudo and I did not like it. It was very heavy and the broth was not very tasty. I came out with all the ingredients to prepare the Menudo. The staff was really friendly and nice. the melon fresh water was amazing. I expected a little more from this place in general. I don't know if it was just not a good day for menudo.....

Al pastor super burrito with black beans is all I ever get here. It is darn good. Not the best I have had in my life, BUT I live close and I eat this burrito once a week and it makes me happy. They are usually quick and their burritos are cheap. Cash only.

Best taqueria in SF!  High quality meats, fresh ingredients - and their burrito is always perfectly proportioned. Al pastor, carne asada, carnitas - all great. El Farolito used to be our favorite until we found this place.
Tacos are incredible.  Fresh, spicy, hot, delicious.
Mmm... These tacos are pretty darn good!

i was reallllly craving street tacos, and used yelp to find this place. i got two al pastor tacos, which were solid but not like blow my mind away amazing. i still think that tequila bar next to tacolicious wins that award.
Not the best nor most ample quesadilla in the hood. No salsa bar but their table pico de gallo is on point. Overall, good but not awesome.

Don't confuse this with that other place. You know, that overrated place located about ten blocks away? This, ladies and gents, is my go-to joint for a super vegetarian burrito. I can't believe that I'm sharing this place with you. I don't even know you and now you know one of the best kept secrets in the City. This isn't a big hipster spot. You'll find at least one person in scrubs and one person freshly discharged from the General either loitering on the sidewalk or inside ordering food. The guy at the counter is super friendly. He can look a bit intimidating at first, with all those tattoos, but he's nice. He always gives my sister and me extra guacamole.
One word: Guacamole.
The carnitas is good. Tasty and juicy.

I've come here a couple of times during my lunch break and ordered the super vegetarian burrito and its been pretty good both of the times. I haven't tried anything else on the menu but there are a good number of vegetarian options. I love the two salsas they give with the chips -- its spicy and so flavorful! The service is pretty fast. Only downside, cash only!
beef burrito ot shrmip burrito thats all i want from here,I love this place its one of my fav work lunch spot...SO GOOD!

Attempted to eat here again on Jan 21st and ordered 3 tacos (lunch) and 1 burrito (for dinner). A few hours later, I was on the toilet reeling in pain and felt like every organ in me had failed. It is now Jan 24th and I STILL am sick. I do not know if it was food poisoning, or lack of them washing their hands (to date, I have NEVER seen anyone there EVER wash their hands, ESPECIALLY NOT THE COOKS!) And I am thinking about calling the health department and seeking medical treatment as I wonder if I caught some disease from them not properly storing the food but NOT WASHING THEIR HANDS!

Meh. I was really excited to try Taqueria SF but was sadly disappointed.  I ordered a super carne asada burrito without sour cream and took it home to eat. I thought the tortilla was good, nice and soft, but as soon as I bit into it I was so bummed! The flavor was lacking because the carne asada consisted of teeny teeny tinsy little particles of meat that tasted nothing of carne asada. No juiciness, no yummy meaty flavor, just one sad burrito-file   :(

Best al pastor tacos in the city! perfectly seasoned pork and a great combination of crunchy and soft pieces, the people work there are very friendly, everything is fresh and it's even pretty clean. This place puts some of the big name taquerias in the Mission to shame.

better than many overrated taquerias in the mission , when you see people latin people there you can already tell that this place is pretty authentic , pastor super taco was amazing, and the burrito did not fall apart for once they know how to put the right amount of things, overall good experience , oh and that salsa verde they give you with your chips Soooo goood ..

BEST Burrito EVER! I love their burritos, I live on 17th and always go all the way there when craving Mexican and get the regular with sausage and lots of cheese, the flavors are clean, Hands down my favorite Taqueria in town. Quick and cheap and delicious!
Super authentic, best taqueria in the Mission for my money.
2 burritos $15 bucks, terrible.  It was dry AND greasy with day old rice, i got ripped man.
Best Taqureia in SF. Everything is fresh hot  generous and cheap! I love love love them. Their Fresh Fruit Drink and a Taco can't be beat. NOM

Just had 2 veggie tacos for $2.25 each and was blown away. It didn't come instantly but I saw why when I saw that each fresh taco had 2 corn tortilla with melted cheese between. The taco was piled high with Spanish rice, pinto beans, and pico de gallo topped with perfectly ripened avocado strips. It was so filled, I could barely pick it up and needed the assist of a spoon. I was hoping for a light lunch and was rewarded with a nice filling meal. They also have table salsa & pico de gallo on request, which is a plus. The ambiance of local guys hanging out and chatting about soccer over their Modelos makes me want to run back to join them after work.
Taqueria SF: So close to being right.

Quick, cheap, and on the way home. That's what I like about my burrito. Also it was the only thing open when I was walking home from the gym and everything and their mama is startin to close at that time.

Randomly found this place and wanted to try since it seemed like a hole-in-the-wall mexican place. Thought the food would be good but was a bit disappointed. Carne asada taco - meat wasn't great and the corn tortilla was soggy. Carne asada burrito - same meat as the taco but at least the flour tortilla was pretty good. Tamale - Not fresh and was dry. Good friendly service, but will likely not return as there's way too many other options in SF.
My reviews are based on the following premise:
Bounced off a 29 year old because a driving license is not acceptable ID? While all my friends are having a birthday inside. Had to wait in the rain for a cab, wouldnt let me stand inside. STAY AWAY!

Doesn't allow tourists unless they have their passport. Don't accept drivers liscense. A**hole bouncer even let us wait in the rain while waiting for a cab. Shocking! What is this? Casino Monte Carlo!? Only place in SF, stay away!!!!

This place is awesome. The food here is amazing, there's a great beer selection, and it's located in a humongous two story warehouse that has indoor and outdoor seating and giant projection screens! My friends and I came here to watch one of the World Series games so it was pretty packed, but not as bad as I expected. There are two bars - one upstairs and one on the main floor where you can order food as well.
Came here with a friend to throw back a few craft beers one weekday night.  I didn't try any of the food, so this review apply to that.
This place is the epitome of what I expect the San Franciscan nightlife to be like. Old warehouse turned brewery, local craft beers, bar food, and lots of seating.
Good spot to meet with a big group of friends. The beer selection is great and the food is ok. I also liked that they had background music but not too loud so you can talk without screaming.
I thought I would really like Southern Pacific. But it was only alright.
Pros

So the first time I went here was kind of crazy and all. I thought that I wouldn't come back to this place but unfortunately I know people who still like to go this place! So I've been back here two more times.
What a wonderful venue. Came here at night, so I missed the natural light that floods in from the huge windows.
I come here every Sunday night with my volleyball team because it's half a block from our gym.
Great beer and reasonably good food, including nice fries with a good aioli. The space is a plus too, including a big outdoor patio and large interior.

Southern Pacific Brewing has the one of the worst service I have encountered. We brought a group of about 60 people here and we expected for them to be welcoming since the place was empty. What we received was quite the opposite experience. Management was very rude and not hospitable.  We will definitely look for another place to host our large team events.

Southern Pacific is an odd mixture of hipsters and bros. Interesting to observe these two species together in the wild, I know, but that's just the way it is. To paint a picture of my few experiences at this establishment: I've only ever been there with Coast Guard bros and they often comment on their hopes of finding a techie hipster chick to be their sugar mama. Classy.

Great place. Good atmosphere. Very large place. Drinks are not too pricey and staff is really great. There's loft, indoor, and outdoor seating. The place is very spacious which was great. Not a crowded bar where you have to push your way through people. Very just relaxing place to grab drinks.
Great atmosphere; what an excellent and inviting place to hang out with your friends and enjoy a Saturday or Sunday afternoon!

I spent a pleasant hour at Southern Pacific Brewing, drinking beer on a patio next to a very cool dog. We wandered over from a block party in the Mission, and it was nice to have somewhere to sit and relax.
Converted warehouse serves as an extremely cool venue to have drinks. One of my new favorite spots in the city.

Was there on a Friday night. Bartenders were clicky (reminded me of high school, actually), I guess I don't look like a good hipster or a typical tech bro, with 3 - 4 bar tenders, it took me over 10 minutes to get a drink. Two women behind the bar looked me in the eye a few times and walked away to other groups of bros (gasped) that literally had just walked in. When a man finally saw me and asked what I wanted, he mocked me for asking for a Jack. My mistake, I don't know enough about the beer nor would he have the patience to make a recommendation, anyway. And why do I say that? Because they don't even have the patience to understand what my friend from Italy was trying to order. All they said was "I can't understand you" and she as served some light beer.
I am signing up on Yelp just to leave this review. I would not recommend anyone bother going to this place.
This page is fraught with lots of whiny bitchy Yelp reviewers. Typical entitled techies that have infiltrated and corrupted the Mission District.
Great beers and atmosphere. Wish this existed in NYC. Staff are super chill/nice too. Oh and the fries are insane!
I wish they have more TVs for sport watching! That would make it THE spot to go to!

I love that there is a bar in this neighborhood with a big old fat back yard patio! The fries are good. (Stop eating fries! The sage doesn't count, nutritionally!) The rest of the food I had was pretty much greasebomb crappy bar food. (Wait, the fries weren't as greasebomb as the veggie sando??? ok haha gff ha ;)
Great for a big group.
I love patios and beers...simple, the best place to enjoy some beers and a good time with your friends in the Mission.

Didn't have any complaints about the food or service (sage fries are great, bartender makes a solid Irish mule) but three days later, checked my credit card and realized they had overcharged me by almost 25%. Hoping that gets sorted out soon :( It could easily have been an honest mistake -- just be careful if/when you go!
I had never been here before, but I'll be back. The beers weren't incredible, but they were solid. At $11 for a pitcher of their house brew, there's little to complain about.
A huge industrial loft warehouse brewery and outdoor patio - in the Mission?  Yes.  With a half dozen beers they brew themselves on tap.

It's a beautiful space but, the service is average (staff, it's ok to smile!) and so is the food. If you don't have a US ID, beware, you will need your passport or they won't let you in. I went with a group of Australians in their 30's who only had their Australia driver licence and they wouldn't let anyone in. Never had this issue anywhere in the 3 years I've lived here.
Beer average...food decent...service- terrible. Rude bartenders who basically serve you a beer with a side of hipster bullshit.
Love the ambiance and use of the space. Big, empty warehouse turned brewery. Indoor trees. One face is all window. Plus theres outdoor seating.

It started out great -- five of us taking a long lunch to get away from the annoying politics at work. We needed beer and food, but nothing fancy. Southern Pacific is in a great location in the middle of nothing: the building is cool; the beer list is long with a half dozen or more brewed on site and lots of good guest brews like Trumer and Ninkasi and Ballast Point. But beer is a no-brainer and they've got that angle covered.
SKIP THIS PLACE - BETTER FOOD/SERVICE ELSEWHERE

Good burgers, amazing sage fries, patio, tons of space. Seems like it'd be good for groups because it's so cavernous. The bike racks are directly across from where the bouncer guy stands, so it also seems like a safe place to lock your ride.

Venue? Mediocre at best. Service? Good lord. I don't know where they find their bartenders but those folks should NOT be working in the service industry. Rude would be an understatement. I'll NEVER go back simply because of the people. Yikes. Stay away. Stay far, far away.
Didn't spend too much time here, but seems like a cool place.  Lively with a nice vibe.

Great brewery tucked away that you'd never imagine such a huge place existed! There's two floors with tables all over the place and a patio out front, on each floor is a bar where you can order food, drinks etc then you get a number and it's brought to you. I came to celebrate a birthday and I ordered the BLT and i don't know why but the bacon had a strange flavor to it so i only ate half, it wasn't bad without the bacon that is but the winner was the garlic sage fries.

Bartender Nate was beyond rude.  My group of friends ordered several pitchers of beers and a round of shots.  On our final trip to the bar, my buddy and I asked to split a round on our credit cards and bartender Nate goes "seriously man?!?"  We ordered 12 shots that cost $108. How would this be any different if I ordered 6 and someone else ordered 6??

After having talked to the manager during the day explaining that my group of 20 people included two people with valid international licenses and told it was fine, we were just turned away at the door, very rudely - because two of our party did not bring their passports. Everyone in our group was clearly over 30. I asked for the manager and was told 'no' i have explained it to you by the doorman. This kind if behavior is unacceptable.
Nice
This is ACTUALLY the best burrito in San Francisco.
Got the carnitas regular burrito today. The burrito as a whole was on the dry side, and the meat had definitely been pan fried twice. Wouldn't go back.

The quesadillas are alright, I didn't buy anything but still got free chips and their salsa is pretty bomb. It's alright I guess, more of a cheapy hole in the wall place. This one girl fainted and like freaky shit went down but besides that it was pretty good, I'd stop there again if I had too.
Yum!!! :-) I just had the best super taco here. Can't wait to come back. Hot, super fresh, lots of flavor, friendly service.
Whenever I am in the mission running errands, I stop in here for take-away tacos.  They are great.  The service is good and the folks working there are very nice.
Check out the review that was given to Taquerilla castillito in the national blog

After a night of drinking at Zeitgeist, we were desperate for some cheap, late night munchies. Thanks to Yelp, we found El Castillito and made the trek over (at 2am through the Mission...yeah, we were really hungry).

My friend and I went here last night and I am still nauseous thinking about the experience. My friend wasn't eating so she ordered a large fresh squeezed orange juice. As she was drinking it, she kept sensing that it had a lot of pulp in it. When only 1/3 of the drink was left she opened the lid just to check it out. I kid you not, there were 4 dead fruit flies chilling on the surface of her drink. Not to mention how many more were in the drink itself (and how many she ate prior). This is DISGUSTING and this place seriously needs a health code check ASAP. I am beyond appalled that a SF establishment (with semi good reviews too) is a joke.
Chorizo was delicious and worth a visit, alone.
Came here only for the horchata as a dessert after eating at Yamo down the street and it was too watery, not really grainy cinnamony and thicker almost as if it was not authentic.

You go here for the food and not to see the drug addicts and prostitutes this place has been around for over 20 years. This place is a classic taqueria which is over shadowed in a two block radius from places like La Cumbre, Pancho Villa, El Toro and every other Taqueria in the Mission District. Do not bring your date here.

Went there today as I was strolling through San Francisco and got the veggie burrito. The burrito was tasty, tightly rolled and the red chunky salsa I got was hot and flavorful. Definitely beats Chipotle haha
**VEGETARIAN REVIEW**
In my opinion, best Al Pastor in SF. I like the all meat burritos and nachos.
Really mediocre. Just bland. I had the wet burrito with chorizo, which at most places would be an intensely tasty item. It wasn't wet, it wasn't tasty - even after I added salsa.

I love this place! It's at a great location, it TAKES CARDS (Taqueria Cancun's greatest weakness), and it makes great al pastor burritos! The staff are also very nice and friendly to me, and take the weird, intense area in stride! It's also usually not crowded and the service is very fast, which is great in contrast to the insanity of Cancun.
wOw.
The place was busy and service was horrible. I waited 40 minutes for my burrito because they lost my order. When they finally figured it out, no apologies. Just a mediocre burrito.
I'd just finished a 6pm yoga class at sunroom yoga, and was dreaming of a delicious burrito. However, walking down Mission st, the first 2 taquerias I passed had very long lines, and no place to sit.
Everyone has their personal burrito preference in the mission and these guys are mine.
Great food and great value
Looks & smells like little Mexico. Hot like Mexico. Nothing fancy but if you enjoy hot Mexican food for easy cash come here. Salsas are delicious.

This is best Burrito place in USA. This place still stands the hands of times and Hipsters and Prostitutes. This is a Mission District Landmark. This restaurant is the genesis of the other El Castillito all locations SF.

El Castillito makes both the vegetarian and non-vegetarian in the party happy. Went mid-day, so I can't speak to the noise,  but the veggie burrito was way better than El Farralito's  (yay avocado on the "regular"!) and they actually had a non-scary food safety score. That was a refreshing surprise compared to several of its Mission competitors.

El Castillito has excellent super carne asada burritos.  I feel like their asada is more consistent than Cancun or El Farolito.  Having lettuce and tomato on a burrito is hit or miss, but El Castillito has been consistently good with fresh veggies.  Another plus, they have fresh avocado slices instead of nasty quacamole!
Open late, clean, fast, cheap, and not a burger place. Full salsa bar and bright setting. Worth a try for Burrito lovers.
Taq. el Castillito is an old fashioned typical hole in the wall. open-grill taqueria
Came to this place after having a few tacos elsewhere.....
The cliche should be: avoid plagues like the Castillito.

Weird, thought I reviewed this place already. I go there once a week! I love their chicken tacos and my man always gets their steak or carnitas quesadilla or burrito. They take credit/debit cards too and have a good beer selection. Plus their salsa is tasty. Please not that they do not have guacamole! Only avocado!
This place is deceptively delicious - best burrito I've had in San Francisco by far.

This place puts a lot of chopped onions that are small enough to be a big pain to sort through but big enough to taste and bite into.  Remember to tell them no onions if you are not a big raw white onion fan.  Even though they do put fresh avocados in their burritos too, I prefer El Farolito over this place.  The green verde sauce was not bad but not as spicy as I would like.

Good place if it is after midnight and your in the mission and want decent food.  Beware the falling down drunks or at least plan on assisting said drunks with menu selection (It's hard to read when you have the spins).
This restaurant is in my old hood, and I was a regular before departing for Paris.
Eh. Was super hungry tonight, and didn't want to walk too far. So, I decided to give it a try. Order carnegie asana super nachos and they were OK. I've had much better. Next time, I won't be so lazy.
Disgusted on multiple levels with this dump.
Castillito

Holy crap this place was loud. The moment we stepped foot into the door the jukebox was blaring music as if it was happy to see you. The music stopped for some intervals, but it was playing loudly for the most part. Don't come here if you're trying to catch up with a friend. You might not even be able to hear your friend speak.
Fast, friendly and yummy! I'm easy when it comes to taquerias.

Pho is probably one of my top 5 favorite things to eat and it's genius that Rice Paper Scissors put it in an easy to eat roll! I tried a pho roll at Eat Real Fest this year and was a fan. It tasted pho stuffed in a spring roll paper! The meat was flavorful but the rice roll needed some flavor, which I guess is where they're fish sauce comes in.
Special announcement.
I had the Banh Mi Steak sandwich and it was good. The waitress was super cool. it did take a while to get our food but its a good atmosphere to hang out in.
If you're on this end of the Mission and in a pinch (or just extremely hungover), RPS will get the job done. It's not the best of the best, but it's decent.

Rice Paper Scissors was at the 2014 SF Street Food Festival and I needed a dose of caffeine so RPS was where I went to order up a $3 cup of Vietnamese iced coffee. To clarify ... The cup was no where near 8 oz. it may have been 6 oz but even that might be an overstatement given how much ice filled the cup. Given the price it would have been great if the serving size was larger. Regardless of the size, it was still a good Vietnamese iced coffee. Next time ... I would probably be better off getting coffee at Philz but the line there would be unbearable.
Food was reaaally good and service was great.  Prices are way too expensive, but I guess that's what you get in the neighborhood right now.
Super chill spot. Very friendly and good food. I love the seating out front, like eating on the street in Vietnam.

Went here for brunch today, and got there shortly after opening, around 11:10. Was fairly empty at the time, with one or two groups ahead of us. Thankfully, the 'rush' came after us, as they were fairly slow with the food, with maybe 2 people in the kitchen, one woman taking orders, and one woman delivering food to tables. Very casual place, which is actually a concert venue, and nice and chill, so decent ambiance, which is good, as there's a bit of a wait for the food.
Just ordered a chicken Bahn mi at the Sunday brunch. The chicken was refrigerator cold and the bun was cold, not toasted.

One of my three favorite Vietnamese places in SF (Co Nam and DragonEats are my other two). I wasn't into Vietnamese food as a kid. Their beef banh mi sandwich is filling but not greasy and has some definite quality. The bread was solid!

This place is amazing. The pho broth is probably the best (most flavorful) I've had in SF.  Their Banh Mi is unconventional but also delicious. Highly recommended this new addition to the SF food scene.

Rice Paper Scissors doesn't have a sign outside, just an hanging pic of a red stool on it. outside this corner premise are small tables with small red stools. no doubt venue is someone's else's (name on building:

Stopped by for brunch today. We got a booth by the window inside so we could get some light in an otherwise pretty dark building. The food was fresh, light and delicious. We got the beef pho rolls, beef bun bo hue, beef banh mi and goi ga. All were good but beef pho rolls were my favorite- soft homemade noodles on the outside and beef on the inside. One of the owners said they learned how to make them on a tiny street in Vietnam that specializes in these rolls. We'll be back!
Thu, Mar 20th, 1130am
The ambiance is great, dark but not too crazy dark. very few tables but it's not too busy. Food is pretty good.

Love this diner! Delicious food, generous portions, AMAZING service, reasonable prices--what's not to love?!? It's not "hip" and since it's a part of pre-gentrified Mission, I hope it manages to stick around.

Great staff, good food. I usually do breakfast at least 2 times a month here. Food can get greasy though depending what you order. But overall the service is quick, the cooks hustle. I do miss the 2 guys that used to cook Sunday mornings, but the new cooks are ok. Oh and the 2 beautiful and very friendly waitress's that "USED" to serve there. So guys no need to be running there now, them 2 women are gone!!!  lol

We attempted to eat here today and a very nice waitress took our order and drinks and did mention that it would take a little while for the food. After about 30 mins and our sons saying they were hungry about 15 times we decided to see what was going on. Meanwhile the two ladies that came in after us had their food and somehow ours was still two tickets away from being cooked. We decided to go elsewhere since most places can serve up an omelette in about 15. We will not be going back which is too bad because the food is good. We got our drinks for free at least.

I try to not leave a bad review . But some how  things came together. Coffee is great . Servers they try the best. But in bussiness specially ,food industry they are way back... cooks have no passsion for food.something really simple they make to complicated. Specially in  breakfast with over cook sausage almost chicharrones . Red new potatoes huge size, blend flavor. Where is the eggs disappear in the mix onions are same crunchy other to caramelized. Bell pepers where cut by knife with out been sharp.no matter if the place has no speciallity in burritos.they have to learn how managment a breakfast some many info out there to prepare a breakfast burrito, Even and starving person goin to relized isn't and spetcular breakfast burrito.
I have been going to Mission Kitchen since they opened ,  my family have been  loyal customers here ,  and havent had a problem until this past wekend .

I've been here twice now... And the food and the portion sizes are great.  The price is also easy to manage,  imo you pay about the same price for a combo meal at McDonald's that you would here.  But the service,  frustrating.  I usually base my service on my water... If it's empty and I gotta ask....  You've been ignoring me....  I had to ask here and didn't get it refilled until After I was done eating.  Not sure I'll come back again,  even with the delicious food they have.  If you go.... Expect tasty food but slow, unattenetive service.

Coffee and Huevos con Chorizo, $10.80 after tax.  Good serving size, and pure deliciousness.  It came with rice and beans, and a tortilla (I chose flour).  The coffee was alright, but the chorizo was pretty good.  Not very greasy like I'm used to, but great quality.
so this place is legit, my friend took me to this place and it was supper authentic hood breakfast. the price was great, the food was very homemade and fresh.
Love the food here. Will be coming back.

The food was alright. Nothing to drool over. The waiter had some complications and didn't really help until the end of the meal. Wish the service could've been a little better. Though I wouldn't let this discourage me but I don't think I'll be coming any time soon
Mmm...the breakfast nachos are "CRACKING" as my boyfriend would say. CHAILAQUILES is what I think they are called. BOMB.COM.
Fantastico!

I am a regular.  I love my amigo Chefs that always prep me a wonderful meal.  It is an old school diner.  I ordered many dishes from their burgers, breakfast burritos, Latin dishes -- they never failed me.  Every dish I ever had gave me a #mouthGASM

I have passed by this place several times before on Tuesdays before I go to Dance Mission to take hip hop dance classes. Last Tuesday after work I came here to eat for dinner. As you go inside the decor reminds of you diners in the 1970s and 1980s. I didn't want to have a heavy meal. I ordered two items: Queso Fresco and Mission Omelet. The first item is fried cheese similar to fried mozzarella sticks. It was sort of salty maybe because the cheese itself was salty. The second item omelet consisted of chorizo, mushrooms, and ground beef. What I liked about this omelet was it wasn't heavy as other omelets I've had in the past. Nothing spectacular about my meal but overall I had a fulfilling dinner.
On our stay in San Francisco this place was across the street from the place we were staying at. The service is extremely friendly and great.

One star for the steak sandwich I had a few months ago, and another one for the the chilaquile sauce that was actually spicy. It's a decent place to eat at, but maybe it's because I've always had the same server. I've enjoyed what I've eaten here before, but today there was an issue with the service.

From the outside it is nothing special but once you enter you are greeted by the warm and friendly staff. We sat at the counter for breakfast around 8am and there were only a few other patrons around. The server recommended I order the chilaquiles for breakfast and I am so glad I did. They are delish but fair warning: it is a heavy dish so definitely wear your stretchy pants and maybe take a spin class beforehand to offset some of the guilt :)
A lady that works there, be careful because she over charges. It's a good place to eat and ummm the prices are reasonable. Just watch out for your bill!
Love the waiters, the booths, the prices...usually the food but i ordered chilaquiles with mole and the mole was really bland...but still 5 stars!  They could use a busser during the busy times...
I've walked by this place a thousand times and never took note of it. Well, I should have.

The lines are too long & it's hard to find parking but the chilaquiles of mole poblano are delicious. The woman waitress Lolis or Lolita has no respect, she likes to caress mens face & play with their hair if she knows them & doesn't matter if their couple is sitting their.

This place is a great spot to have brunch with friends/family. The service is excellent. They're friendly and chipper, of course a bit slow when it's busy. The owner[manager?] is really friendly, he even gave us some quarters to put in the jukebox one time. The food is good as well. I really like the tiramisu that they serve. The omelets and scrambled eggs are on point. Might I suggest the home fries? Those are so yummy!
First of all parking is hard to fine.
love this place but they lost there touch and the service/waiters sucks now of days.....

My friend had mention to me this place for breakfast/lunch. She once brought me Chilaquiles for breakfast to work and they were soo good. I had to go and get some more. I have there chilaquiles and also there club sandwich. Friendly staff, good food and cheap :)
This place is tip top. To me it is one of San Francisco's top spots. Portions are good, large and excellent quality. Bilingual staff and the food is prepared right in front of you.
Went here b/c Pollo Campero had a line around the block. The waiter was so nice. Very homestyle food. Big portions. My salmon was tasty.  Sat at the counter like the old days.
Great lunkfast spot.  Half Mexican restaurant, half greasy spoon diner.
#Boom.  Great greasy spoon. Want St Francis quality without the handlebar mustache or the goat cheese scramble? Come on over, spend 1/3 less and leave happy.
Huge portions. Great prices. Great food. What's not to love?
its a decent place i like the sandwiches and the chilaquiles i would always go with a friend and we used to have a really good time i would recommend this for breakfast/brunch and lunch
good, clean , really friendly service, great for mexican and american breakfast at very affordable price.  great hash browns-crispy, not soggy.
Great local diner with a great staff. The portions are big and the prices are very affordable. I love coming here and ordering the mole chilaquiles, they are delicious.

Am I the kind of girl that will swoon and fall in love with the first diner that brings me a pitcher of sweetened condensed milk?  Yes I am.  They brought us an entire pitcher of sweetened condensed milk.  OMG.  I did not know you could put it in a pitcher.  Yes, I think I am in love.

The servers here are so friendly and have great attitudes. The food is always really good, with really generous portions.  I've tried so many things and loved them all. The Mexican omelet is like a burrito inside egg instead of tortilla- the beans are really good. The frittata is always super bomb. Sweet things like waffles, pancakes and french toast are great- they come with mounds of fruit on top and either syrup or yummy Lechera. I have no complaints about this place at all.  Oh and somebody said they use RC cola- I beg to differ, it's Coca-Cola. Come here for cheap in price, good in quality food, a fun atmosphere, wonderful service.

Understanding that this is a very casual diner, how is it possible to hate on this place? You've got comfortable seating, a very friendly staff, great food portions and extremely reasonable prices. A breakfast here will run you approx. $10 and you will be well-fed.
This was seriously awful.  I am a huge fan of mexican diners, obsessed with Red Cafe, and figured I'd branch out and try another spot.....

I'm giving these guys 4 stars because they're everything a breakfast place should be. This is not because the food is going to blow you away.  That said, I got a bomb waffle with fruit, eggs, and bacon, and it was all greco.
We love Mission's Kitchen.

I love Mission's Kitchen. They're not overpriced, they have a nice array of breakfast foods to choose from, and the service is great. Everyone's really friendly and the food is served relatively quickly for a busy place.

Overpriced. Not a bad waffle egg sandwich, but considering it's literally about four bites of food, there's better things to be done with $8. Same goes with the $3 coffee. Be careful cutting your waffles on the flimsy tables outside, because your coffee will spill and the chair may collapse. Nice vibe and friendly service, though. Also like the paperless receipt.
A cute little cafe with some really good latte. That's all I need.
I was drawn to this spot after drooling over waffle photos on Yelp.

Yikes, I feel bad writing this review but not as bad as my wallet felt after trying this place today.  Steer clear!  We got off to a great start - the atmosphere is bright, clean, pleasant and oozes that cool, casual Mission vibe most of us love.  The barista was also very friendly, engaging and helpful with suggestions.  We ordered a cappuccino, an americano and two of the Belgian waffles - one waffle breakfast sandwich with eggs and bacon, and one with yogurt and poached pear.

The waffles are so good. No really, they are freaking good. Okay you don't want a waffle cause you think it's bad for you and you don't want to get fat. Well they got tasty salads too. Or you could eat the waffle and then the salad to make yourself feel better about having a waffle. Which totally makes sense to me. And don't forget to have a latte with your meal and sit outside if it's a nice day. They don't do soy milk, only almond.
Great salads, sometimes a bit salty though
Linea Caffe apparently specializes in waffles and salad. I don't get it either, but I can't argue with quality.
What a delight! Order at the register, grab a waffle and coffee and be served from the window right next to you. Adorable :) Perfect place to catch up on a sunny day.
Love the old age ambiance. very nice atmosphere, service is very attentive cozy dive bar, nice older crowd before the music starts. much younger then.

I can't comment on the quality of the coffee (but knowing who is behind roasting I am sure it is stellar), but I've gotten salads from here once or twice... every time I think, why am i spending $10 on a salad? Today was no difference - I got the arugula salad and it tastes fine. But $10 for arugula, a handful of cherry tomatoes, a slop of goat cheese and some very thinly sliced squash? This place just seems like ti falls in the overwhelming common pricing of SF "$2 too much".

Nothing spectacular, especially considering there are so many other nice coffee shops in SF (Philz, Blue Bottle, etc.) But I dined in Tartine and found that Linea was nearby, so decided to go get a cup of cappuccino. (Small for $4, which is a bit pricey).

Good mocha, yummy waffles (I have one with peach salsa and greek yogurt,) and friendly service. It's a low-key hole-in-the-wall cafe with 4 small tables outside. A good quiet brunch alternative in the mission.

Aside from the coffee, which was good but unremarkable, I had a terrible experience at Linea. I will definitely not be returning. The cashier was completely spaced out and seemed incapable of operating the register -- as it turns out, he charged me twice. The two coffees that I ordered took an inordinately long time, because the person making them was more interested in talking to his friend visiting him at work than doing his job. The donut I got was greasy and flavorless and my companion's waffle was OK, but nothing special. I would not recommend wasting time and money at Linea.
I can't say anything about the food but the coffee was really excellent. Very nice barista,

What a wonderful cafe in San Francisco. Very quaint, with not much seating, but the friendly vibe and amazing coffee give this 5 stars for sure. I had a small latte, and was very pleased with both the smooth taste and the beautiful presentation! I must admit that I'm a sucker for good latte art. Definitely to stop by Linea if you're in the city!
The best cappuccino and the best waffle that I've had.

Literally unbeatable friendly service matched with phenomenal coffee and a unique food menu.  Try any coffee or any food item, or both, and let the satisfaction pour all over you!  The atmosphere is pretty cozy tight inside, where you most likely will stand to drink your coffee, but I like that.  The staff and owner really seal the deal.  Sitting outside you certainly get that neighborhood coffee shop vibe.  Hats off to Linea!

Tired of all that sour hipster coffee that tastes like lemon juice+cat pee? Linea makes a smooth, toasty, deliciously well-rounded roast, and their baristas do justice to every bean! The best cappuccinos I've had in the city, consistently, served with a smile and  no attitude. Plus, waffles and kale salad. I love waffles. I like kale salad. Linea sees into my soul (or at least my stomach) and makes me happy. My husband gets the "coffee subscription" (1 lb sent to our house every couple weeks) and while it's expensive, their exquisitely chosen and roasted beans make a damn, damn fine cup of coffee.
Good coffee and light, crispy waffles. Topped off with some friendly service. It's like the perfect place to go for a breakfast that won't totally slow you down the first half of your morning.

Linea provides good coffee on an unassuming street corner.  Try the waffles; they are not your run of the mill variety and surprisingly delicious.  There are also salads but I have not tried them yet so can't comment on the quality.  Technically I think the waffles and salads might be separate businesses distinct from Linea, but you order everything from the same person anyway.  There's no indoor seating and only limited sidewalk space outside... so I wonder how this will work when we finally have a rainy winter.  Bonus points for the bike rack out front.
This place is a total ripoff! First of all I pay 5 bucks for a tiny 8oz cup of latte and I get lukewarm coffee after mentioning I'd like it extra hot. Definitely not worth it!

A co-worker of mine has been raving about Linea for a really long time since she lives right around the corner, so naturally when the opportunity to try a new place for our Sunday coffee came up, I recommended that we try here.  I was able to prod Greg out of bed at 8am by telling him that you can get a waffle to go with your coffee, and after hearing that, we were out the door and on Bart.  I was expecting a huge line, but it was pleasantly busy, and we were able to snag two seats outside.  I had a regular coffee, which was served in these AMAZING mugs.  Greg typically orders iced coffee, but was feeling adventurous and ordered their Iced Homemade Almond Milk Latte.  And in tasting said latte, it was truly unpleasant.  The drink was extremely sour, and was to the point where drinking it was a huge task.  Thankfully, me and my hot brew sat and enjoyed the classic Belgian waffle on a beautiful Sunday morning.  I can't wait to come back here for the buckwheat waffle.  I'll most definitely be back!

Im a fan of all things Anthony Myint has done when it comes to food and drink. Linea has always escaped me as they're open very few hours during the day. In my rare instance being here in the afternoon I had to grab something before heading out of town. Got a very solid cold brew for the road. The people working are super nice and I chatted with one of the cooks while waiting for my coffee. It's a tiny space perfect for its little corner.
Love this place!

Top 5 favorite cafes in the city for sure. I'm knocking down one star because all the drinks are slightly overpriced compared to my other top choices. $4 for a cappuccino is a bit much considering all the other great options in the area - and the espresso drinks here are great but are edged out slightly by one or two other spots.

A sweet little corner cafe set up like a bar with bar like vibes. It's a grab and go place, which would be the only reason I'd give it a star less because I'm a huge fan of posting at cafés. There is seating outside and the cold brew (iced coffee) was delicious! Also loved their logo.
Not impressed.  $4 for a small cappuccino that had almost no foam and took 20 mins to make.  They are too hip for me.
I checked this place out when they first opened. It was awkward because at the time it was espresso only and no decaf. I know that has changed since.
Ordered a waffle, which took forever despite no line. Once I got it, definitely delicious. I just wish the staff would have been a bit more on point this morning.
$3.50 for twelve ounces of drip coffee is over the line. I admit that it tasted really good, though!
Best Belgian waffle I've had yet! Except for the ones in Brussels. Delicious. And my espresso shot was well done too.
Cute hipster location in the not so gentrified neighborhood of mission and 18th. Cute red mugs for coffee lovers.
Can't decide what I like most: the waffle, the hot chocolate, or the hilarious baristas. If this place were a woman, I would marry it.

This place is very cute. She makes Belgian waffles and even makes one with buckwheat - CELIACS BEWARE: she apparently only has one waffle iron and it's cast iron so she can't clean from the regular waffles. I didn't try it - too risky (and not actually gluten free at that point).
I ordered a buckwheat waffle and got a regular. Fail! You'd think that with such a minimal menu, they could get it right.
Best Gibraltar I've ever had.
Great espresso! Really smooth.

Its ironic that here I was just last week bragging about this cafe to friends that they did the best coffees in the city...& thats quite an endorsement as there are many great ones to choose from. Last time we were here and ordered cofee's and a bag of beans one of the coffee's was comped (#nicetouch) but our coffee's & beans on the weekend were the full price deal. The other major downer was the kale salad with a side of chicken...um, hello where was the chicken? It was there but blink and you'll miss it - #toolittlechicken  A really disappointing $46 experience and I missed not having my coffee made by the stellar italian barista from my previous occasion.
WHAT A CUTE PLACE! CUTE CUTE CUTE! and quaint.
So apparently I missed the memo that the thing to order, aside from their waffles, is their mocha!
This place is amazing and owners are incredible people. Their $5 pizza special is almost more than you can eat! Great deal and you can treat a friend! Pizza pizza!
This was for home delivery.

Wow! After reading the many reviews which were all over the spectrum, I have to say I was pleasantly surprised and my tummy is very happy after ordering online through GrubHub. The delivery arrived in 30 minutes hot and delicious. I ordered the eggplant sandwich on a roll with extra Jack cheese and mushrooms. It was double-wrapped in aluminum foil grilled with the cheeses melting perfectly. I added the lettuce, onions and tomato to make a huge handful of a sandwich. Also, the garlic fries are the thick cut potatoes and tasted better than those at ATT Park (they weren't swimming in olive oil). I'm very happy with my order and my choice.

Disappointing. Ordered thru eat24. Delivery was fine but the bruschetta that I ordered was swimming in oil. Had to drain it before serving. Pizza was ok. Second time ordering and sadly I'll move on to somewhere else.
Ordered from here on eat24.
Pizza tasted like it was frozen before they heated it. Slightly mushy crust. Also didn't seem to have slices ready to go (ever) so it took a while. At least they had a friendly cashier.

Really great customer service. Our waitress was extremely attentive and was very cheerful. I would definitely recommend this pizzeria to friends and family! The pizza was delicious and if I lived closer, I would be going there more often.
It might work as drunk food, but you're probably better off getting a burrito.
The pizza was pretty bad and expensive. Though it is in my neighborhood, I would not consider ordering there again.

This is a review for delivery only. I have never been inside the restaurant, although I drove by it the other day and noticed its location for the first time. I order from this place way too much, because the quality is just great and beats any other pizza place that delivers to Glen Park. Their pizzas are thin crust and have just the right amount of grease and flavor. They are surprisingly good quality for a place that delivers and the Chicken Bacon Ranch pizza is to die for (Although, your stomach probably won't be happy with you the next morning). I have had a bunch of different pizzas that they serve and I haven't been disappointed once. Their delivery is always quick and never later than the time they quote, which is great. For delivery in Glen Park/Diamond Heights, it doesn't get better than Bernal Heights Pizzaria (and yes, I have literally tried every pizza place on grubhub that delivers here. Sadly). Pricewise, they are a little more expensive than most other places, but what's literally a few dollars when the quality if light years above other pizzerias?
Great customer service Cute little waitress nice cozy atmosphere as well and very good pizza & Italian food  in Bernal heights will be back soon :)
We ordered via grub hub and the food arrived just in time based on the estimation but the pizza was of only meh, quality and the salad wasn't anything special either.
This review is specifically for delivery:

Very disappointed. Pizza arrived barely warm and lacked flavor. The meatballs were horrible, they weren't even "meatballs". It was basically ground meat in red sauce. Also, they for for the extra pizza sauce I ordered on the side.

We ordered delivery from here earlier this month and were pleasantly surprised.  There was no obvious way to order 1/2 and 1/2 combo pizza so we called them and they were super polite. They changed our order to exactly what we needed without a single issue.

I ordered 3 Pizza's f for a company function and they were horrible.  They tasted stale and lacked any flavor what so ever.  I ordered a veggie lover, meat lover, and cheese pizza, nothing difficult or out of the ordinary.  When I opened the boxes to see what my $85 had bought me I was severely disappointed and embarrassed.  The pizza at Costco is far better than the dried out, stale, sparsely topped pie looking back at me.  I will never give this restaurant my business ever again.

The Popeyes spinach salad is 4 stars!!! Delish and fresh!! Yum yum yum!!! Three stars for the pizza but it also had very fresh ingredients as well and great to satisfy your pizza craving. The place is very clean and the server was attentive to our needs.

Service was excellent. Pizza was disappointing. The slices are big enough and the deal is pretty sweet, but the pizza itself was just kind of meh. Not bad, not great. We also had the misfortune of coming on a day when they were in the middle of transferring their liquor license so I won't ding them for no beer/wine.

This pizza was just average. It's a slight step up from frozen but in a city like sf, I'd expect better. If it were a late night and my choices were this or pizza hut, I'd probably order here again but if the competition was open I'd choose the competition next time.

ordered on grub hub. Food came at the time quoted. Ordered the Greek Goddess. Pizza arrived luke warm, limp and soggy. Pesto barely had any flavor. The sauce makes or breaks the pizza, guys. Maybe they didn't put enough? I dunno. other ingredients tasted fine, I guess.
Came here with my dad the other night. They are pretty new, so I think they are still working out some kinks.

I give it a 5 because it is good and they have a very thin extra thin crust pizza. Many places have pizza but this menu is great. They deliver, have great hours and good coupons. Not cheap but worth it and fast. Better than most pizzerias in SF. So overall the food is great if you like gourmet super thin crust with delicious bread, the menu is ample if you lazy at home their burgers rock, and their desserts are delicious. So yes 5 stars for the overall product

It was OK, but if it were my last night on earth and I were craving pizza for dinner, Bernal Heights Pizzeria would be the last place I'd have on speed dial. The crust is OK, a little bread-y for my taste, but nonetheless OK. The toppings are another story. We ordered a cheese pizza and built our own combo with six toppings. For a large pizza, they charge $1.75 per topping. Fair enough. The problem was that the toppings were too few and far between with huge empty spots on each slice. Only three pieces had broccoli on them for a total of six miniscule (and I mean miniscule) florets, and the other toppings were really stingy as well. I'm not one to quibble over price, but seriously, whatever amount they decide to charge for a topping, there should be enough of it to be noticeable. We won't be ordering from them again.
Just received our delivery after waiting 1.5 hours and the pizza was cold! Terrible service!
Just ordered a chicken philly and some nuggets...just threw up 5 timea. Don't think I'm gonna order from here again.
DELICIOUS Pizza! I really wish I didn't have a complaint. It is flavorful and the crust is good.

Not gourmet,  but good!  Good crust,  friendly folks, good price,  let me bring in my bottle of wine in since they were still waiting on their license. Great folks, good neighborhood pizza... giv'em a shot.

Good pizza; not the best pizza I've had by any stretch. I had a salami, sun dried tomato, and Feta Cheese pizza. The crust was a bit soft and could've benefited from being left in the oven a bit longer to give it a crispier texture.  The service was great ( Camille was awesome over the phone!) and the experience overall was a good  experience.
I have been here for long time and each time got very perfect treatment in that place. The location is good and very perfect.

Very disappointed. Ordered a calzone through GrubHub. Delivery guy showed up late. Apparently the restaurant did not relay my room number accurately. The delivery guy argued at my door about how it was my fault.
Bernal Heights Pizzeria is a relatively new spot, and I'm very happy to have it in my neighborhood. The pizza is incredibly tasty and flavorful -- thin crust with good quality cheese and sauce.
Really good pizza. We had a custom pesto, clam and garlic extra thin crust and a regular crust mushroom and anchovy and both were great. Tasty dough and toppings and of course super fresh.
This is for home delivery.

I was very disappointed in my 4 Cheese Pizza. Along with arriving long after the suggested 45 min time frame I paid for kalmia olives and got none. This is the first pizza I ever threw out in my life.
My new go-to delivery pizza pie spot!
Very good pizza and fast delivery. Online ordering as well. This will be my new pizza delivery spot!
The pizza here is very good and I'm very pleased with their kids menu. My son LOVED his chicken nuggets and devoured the steamed vegetables. Highly recommend!

Our friend Marvin introduced us to this pizzeria at his birthday party! The hosts were lovely and the food was really tasty. He did a take out order for me and my fellow co-workers a few days ago and the pizza was as good as I remembered it. :)

The pizza here is great!  The staff was super super friendly, especially to 3 moms and 3 toddler boys trying to enjoy a nice lunch.  We didn't hear any complaints from the kids who ordered off the kids menu.  And the price is perfect!  They have a $5 lunch special--a pizza slice (which is a huge portion) and drink!  We will definitely be coming back here more often after our playdates at the park!!!

This is a great pizzeria especially for delivery! I believe they are brand new also. I've tried practically all the pizza places in bernal heights and this place has to be my favorite. The ingredients are high quality and fresh. Can't got wrong with a meat lovers pizza. They came in clutch when I was hungry for dinner. Was thinking of dominos but this place beats dominos hands down. Fast delivery also

Service is great! Bottomless mimosas were mostly champagne....Perfect. I had the balancoire scramble and it was delish. If you are looking to have a solid Saturday or Sunday brunch without the crazy drunk busy atmosphere, this is your place.
Love this place. The food is superb. The service can be slow if there are a lot of customers due to the complexity of the food, but definitely one of my favorite brunch places in the city!
OMG I LOVED the #niccageparty! It was just a great ambiance and so much fun!! The owners are so sweet and just great guys!!
This place rules. Great food and a chill staff.

oh my, oh my, oh my. not to bash this place completely because I think they have potential, but to be served raw potatoes which were grey in color is just a no no. the place has a fun atmosphere but they need to step it up on the food. they said they were training a new cook....but anyone knows you don't send out raw food.

Got to check this place out really quick today.  Very chill environment.  Music was a little loud, especially for conversation.  However, the owners are some of the coolest people ever.  My brother and I even got treated to a drink each.  The bar is very well stocked and the place was not as small as it looks from the outside.  Definitely looking forward to stopping by and having a few drinks on Karaoke night ;)

Balancoire, what can I say. You won my heart and I can't wait to be back again to perform and bask in your ambiance and great atmosphere. Delicious mozzarella sticks and creole gumbo, ice cold beer...amazing bar, and beautiful art lining the walls. Even the bathroom doors make you want to keep coming back. This place is spacious, clean, classy, and comfy, especially from the view and feel of every one of those leather couches.

Came here for dinner twice and both times the food was excellent. Once I had a burger and it was to die for...one of the best burgers I ever had.  Right up there with Joes Cable Car. The bartender was a real D@%k though...seemed drunk or stoned or both and thought we owed him something.. barely took our orders and we had to almost beg him for a second round. Had a great time other than him though and the music was awesome.  Everyone was dancing.  This place is a real gem!
First time at this place was last night and I had a ball!
Its a shame this isn't more busy, they have awesome food, really attentive staff, bottomless service at brunch, killer cocktails and live jazz.
