Talent tonight and people are nice but the bar is poor poor poor.  It's not even that busy and to actively ignore people is rude.

Had not been to this place since it was called 12 Galaxys, a few years ago.. Decided to step inside after work a week ago. I was shockingly surprised! New owners have done an amazing job fixing this place up. Ordered some food and beer from the menu, both were pretty inexpensive and they have really good happy hour prices. The staff was nice and friendly. Hard to find places in the Mission where you can actually enjoy watching a sporting event during happy hour...Definitely recommend this place if you're out and about in the Mission during the evening.

We came upon this place after carnaval and decided to check it out. Our experience was great, we got some margaritas which were surprisingly delicious and not too sweet. The dance floor was full early in the night and the chicken wings were uh.maze.ing. And I don't even like chicken wings but they were to die for.  The staff treated us great. It is definitely a more dive bar vibe but good people with great attitudes. I will come back to try the bottomless mimosas.

Brunch here is amazing! It's never too crowded and the food is delicious. I ordered a crab Benedict type dish that was decedent. My boyfriend got a burger that he said was one of the best he's ever had. I highly recommend this place for brunch. I remember coming to this spot back in the day when it was a hip hop night club then later a concert hall. It brings back a lot of memories for me. I am very happy the space is still being used. They host
This place is the definition of CLUSTERFUCK. Do not attend an event here.

My friends and I decided to go to an 18+ night here. We had bought our pre sale tickets online and were waiting in line for an over an hour. The club was supposed to open at 10 and we were far in the line but we didn't get in till 11:40.
This was such a great little place. Everything looked amazing and tasted even better! Can't wait to go back.

Crazy to think how this used to be a nightclub, and now it's this cute little spot to have brunch. The food is really good. I had the Eggs New Orleans ($14), which included crab cakes on top of slices of toasted baguette with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce, a small spring salad w/ tomatoes and apples (not sure the dressing), and golden potatoes = YUM! I also had the bottomless mimosas ($12, only orange), and a friend sent over a pitcher of the mango flavor ($12) that was super tasty. My boyfriend had the Louisiana cheese burger, which basically is a typical cheeseburger but had more meat then most I've seen and the pomme fries were delicious (I stole a couple). Surprisingly this place is decently priced, as some places in the Mish tend to be super pricey these days. Definitely will go back :)
The service was amazing, the staff was so friendly and attentive. One of the owners came up and introduced himself to us.

Had a pretty solid brunch, but not stellar. The band was a little loud for the number of people who were there, but was of good quality. The waiter did a good job of making sure our mimosas remained bottomless.

In the beginning this place was a little rough around the edges. But now this place rocks!!! Angela makes the most amazing drinks and rocks the shows. I go just for her!! Give this place a chance now. Its so much better than before. And go when Angela is working! She makes the best drinks!
Wait staff was excellent
the food was delicious and the service was great. our waitress was so nice and on top of it!

My friends and I came to Balancoire for Sunday brunch. We were all pretty hungry, and every brunch place we tried had a huge wait. Typical. Lucky for us, it seems like Balancoire hasn't quite been discovered yet. We were seated immediately. THANK GOD. The food was awesome, the staff was super friendly, and they were very generous with the mimosas. All in all a great experience. I'll be back!
Okay...been here for over 30 minutes and haven't gotten our food. Had hair on our bread. So my review is based on the fact that things are going real slow. I hope that that food is worth the wait

We are sitting at our table and my husband is finishing his 6th mimosa (bottomless!!!) our food; croque Madame and eggs New Orleans, was fantastic, large portions, and very flavorful ! The service was super friendly and attentive. The live band was bad, but in a super fun, crowd pleasing way!! We will return!

The bar manager was awesome and also the owners. I recommend this place too anyone. Was there on a Sunday night with some of my crazy friends and they where not bothered and let us party it up. Will def come back.
I'd offer less than one star if I could.

I attended an event here this past Sunday, I enjoyed great music, had some great drinks that were priced moderately to a bit less then the average. I think a lot of the reviews this place is getting are just incorrect.
Wholly disappointed. Not cheap, not good (drinks OR food), overcrowded, bad distorted music. Avoid.
The bartenders were so slow, and they acted like they were doing you a favor by getting you a drink.
I know nothing about the restaurant here. Came at night for the music of Kafana Balkan, and was just served appallingly bad, watered down mixed drinks. Uzhas!!

BAD! Bad bartenders, slow as could be. Not nice at all. No seating set up and when asked for more chairs all we got was bad attitudes. Bawdy storytelling has been there for a long time and to be treated so poorly. I will never go back. They turned on the music in the middle of our show and then turned it up louder and louder till we left. You suck.
I've never written a one star review before!!
If you want douchebag bar staff then you have found your place.

I am really disappointed in Balancoire. I've been to this venue many times over the years, and this is the 3rd owner/management team I've seen. They provide the worst bar experience - can't seem to handle any sort of crowd.  And to have just cheap Chardonnay as the only white wine choice is just lame these days.  Especially when you are serving food.

I cannot believe this place. It really is cursed. Like others have mentioned, they have bad business practice. Period. I would NOT schedule an event here. They booked another event at the same time as bawdy (a very popular, fun, SIT DOWN event with patrons who bought hundreds of drinks last night).

I was there for the Bawdy Storytelling event the other night.  It's true that the bar management started the second party far earlier than planned, completely disrupting our event, which was completely packed, standing room only of about 200 people.

Turns out it's their practice to book two events a night, one after the other. I went to an earlier show which was set to go til 10:30, but they let the people coming to the later show in 45 minutes early and allowed them to disrupt the first show, which was a storytelling event.

I can't believe that the staff double booked an event (BawdySlam Grand Slam) with some party upstairs. The final storyteller had 5 minutes left in her story when they turned on the loud music drowning her out while she was performing to a crowd of 200 fans. The music wasn't scheduled to go on for another 40 minutes. That was incredibly rude, unprofessional, and disrespectful of a widely popular storytelling show! If the rumors of the management I've heard are true, this place should be shut down for a lot of really sleazy stuff. Take your business elsewhere!

Their pizza is koo but I don't really recommend their salads. The Caesar dressing was too sour it doesn't say an expiration date on the packet. Their croutons were SOOO STALE!!!! and they put the Parmesan cheese for the pizza on top (powder-ish) not actual Parmesan cheese. I don't think I'll ever get salads from there again.

Thee worst pizza ever!! Ordered at about 1am and honestly the cardboard box probably taste better than the actual pizza.. Sausage was made from ground beef (which is gross) they forgot to bring a side of ranch which they charged me extra for.. Neeeever order here.. What a waste of money...
Had to wait 2 hours for a bacon cheeseburger that I never received, called back and they said driver was near the area had to sit in the cold for nothing .... Called back to get my refund! Weakkk!!!
This place has a yelp check in special which is NOT honored here its 4.50 INSTEAD !! Also .75 refills. .cups offered are only 12 oz Reheated pizza spot. .!! First and last time here.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a bite to eat at 11:30pm on a Sunday night. This place popped up as being pretty close, so we decided to go for it. The wait was pretty long, but Martika (the cashier) was hustling as much as she could given the fact that it was only her working the register, 1 cook, and 10 people in line. She did a great job with being on top of the orders and taking as many as she could at once, while simultaneously making pizzas and taking phone orders. She also washed her hands repeatedly after each time she'd deal with money/the cash register and then shift to pizza making, which is a HUGE plus in my eyes. Thanks Martika!

In SF for Outsidelands. Staying nearby and wanted to eat something. This was the only open place. Walk in and order a cheese pizza, the lady was nice enough to cheapen our pizza by making it appear as a takeout even though we were dining inside. Unfortunately she forgot about us as dining in and our pizza sat in the takeout spot for 10-15 minutes til she realized and apologized. Meanwhile we waited i also ordered mozarella sticks. When they first came to me and took a bite. The center was completely frozen. I sent it back for hot ones. Avoid this place. Long wait and too much bullshit.

Horrible service, too slow, over priced. Ordered a cheese steak sandwich for $10+. Took about 45 minutes, the woman kept saying it would be ready soon, but instead she waited on her friends while the male possibly the manager was outside sitting in a car puffin away. This place is shady.

I'm eating a pepperoni slice right this second. It's not gourmet pizza but it's ok and is meeting my short lunch time craving for pizza. Folks are pleasant, slice is tasty and hot. This isn't one of the great pizza joints in San Francisco but satisfies the basic need.
It looks sketchy as hell but why should you care if all you've been dreaming about is pizza, it's 2am, you're in stilettos so your feet are killing you and you've been drinking?!
Burgers are yummy and great combination as well. The decoration is great and highly helpful location. I have my improtant meal with some foods.
Great burger!
This place has terrible pizza. It 's like eating cardboard with cheese on it.
Another one of those rare gems in SF that's open after-hours! It was fairly empty ~2am on a Saturday night, no wait but a few pretty rowdy groups.
Bang for you buck.  Not great pizza, but good enough.

food is pretty good.  but every time I have placed an order for delivery what arrives is not what I ordered.  most recently instead of a burger ordered we got a chicken sandwich??!!  another time I ordered two cokes and a ginger ale and all we got was a can of 7-up.  almost like they're fucking with your head.  but otherwise the burgers are really good, the wings are also good, fries, onion rings not too greasy.  delivery time is usually a little more than an hour.  no complaint there just wish they would double check the orders.

Decent food, decent price and open late. Other reviews say delivery can take a while but I've never had a problem as a walk in. Sandwiches are hit or miss but the pizza (sold by the slice) is actually not bad.

I've held off writing this review for a while. The food is usually ok but after several regrettable trips to this place, I have to do this. THIS PLACE IS AWEFUL. Terrible, horrible, no good, very bad place... If you get your order correct, consider yourself lucky! 9/10 times, the food is cold, your order is wrong, and the service is TERRIBLE. Actually 10 times out of 10 the service is HORRIBLE. Wrong order? Your fault! Cold food? Not their problem.. Ask for the owner Sam, he'll pretend he cares but does he talk to his employees? I have to assume not since the newer employees mirror the AWEFUL behavior and customer service as the rest... Avoid. Save you heartache and walk 2 blocks to Pauline's . Consider yourselves warned.

This place is horrible.  We ordered 2 extra large pizza (one vegetarian, and one pepperoni) with a liter of coke, and garlic bread.  We ordered around 2:45am to have it delivered to the Hotel Zetta, and did not get our order till 4:30, and they came with the wrong items.  By that time the delivery guy came our whole group had fallen asleep hungry.  Our order cost about $60, and they did not even deliver our whole order.  We got one extra large pizza, and the garlic bread.  We were so upset with our order.  At 4:45 am they delivered the additional pizza and 3 cans of Coke instead of the liter of coke.
Awesome pizza... wings and customer service... meat lovers pizza is what I ordered... that with wings... pizza zone has me hooked

A pizzeria in the city come a dime a dozen but with a menu the size of a flag with so many options is a plus ! Pizza by the slice that can be split for two is thrifty if your trying to stretch the dollar ... Employee Martika was not only sweet friendly and a delight to talk to but gave us more suggestions and descriptive explanations of selected menu items .... All her choices were not to be questioned ...yummy !! Thank you for the excellent service Martika and the cooks know what they are doing !

I've been by a few times, but never thought to eat here.  I was pleasantly surprised - I ordered a chicken parm and it was tasty.  Also, double bagged, and included fries.  Not too greasy and didn't seep through the wrapping when I got home.
Im the only one here at 11:30m. ordered a philly n fries, half hr later, still no food.
It's not the best food, but it's open til 4 AM!!

Not bad for late-night munchies; however, it took over an hour to deliver and the pizza was cold and they did not bring any plates or napkins. But really, can you complain about free delivery late at night? Decent pizza for those drunken, late-night cravings.

I ordered from them online through grubhub at 5:30.  I ordered 2 Philly Cheesesteaks, fries and a drink.  The food arrived at 7:45.  When I asked the driver why it took over two hours, he responded, "Sorry, I know" that's it.  That's all he had to say.  If I hadn't asked, he wouldn't have apologized at all.  My coke was ice cold as were the fries.  The sandwiches were lukewarm at best.  I don't think I will ever order from here again.

Whenever we're in a hurry and in the neighborhood my boy Scuba always suggests we come grab a bite to eat here. They have a huge menu and so far everything I have tried has been delicious. I typically get a slice of the Philly Chicken pizza. It is super convenient that this place is open til the weee hours of the morning for those of us raging it up in the Mission District. My friend also let me know that the employees don't trip if you bring your own drink to accompany your food. Overall, if you're looking for a cheap and fast meal then Pizza Zone N Grill is the place to hit up.

Pizza Zone is a staple for late night drunken munchies in the Mission.  I'd like to assume the 3 star rating they receive on here is from people reviewing them against other restaurants that close at a reasonable hour.  For the simple fact they are open when I get out of Public Works at damn near 4am, they get some serious bonus points.
DON'T ORDER THEIR PIZZAS!!
My sandwich was disgusting. His pizza was flat and gross.

It's late. You're a little sauced. You need food. You wander in to Pizza Zone in need of dough to soak up the booze. You are greeted by a cute lil' mama wearing a necklace that says "Oh Shit," You are smart. You realize quickly that her necklace should say "Takes No Shit." You order. You wait. Your first slice comes out of the oven. You start munchin.
second time back, much better. huge slices and staff was really nice!
Real talk, I think the delivery guy farted as I was signing for my pizza. -1

I order from this place every now and then just for the simple fact it delivers and is open until 3 a.m. I would rather not give my money to these douchebags but with that being said...here's the skinny. This place blows for customer service. Usually if you order online, they will call you about 25 minutes later when your order is actually processed to tell you your shit is out and to exchange part of your order with shit you don't want. Then it takes them a good hour to deliver your order. Also...if you get things with fries....count on them to just give you one set of fries to be cheap fucks and say it was for both orders...not to mention....the delivery charge they tax for their shit service.

San Francisco has terrible thin crust pizza.  Going from NYC to San Francisco has been rough because of this.  I just want a good slice of pizza.  I got a buffalo chicken slice, but it was only ok.  The slice is really two super long slices so the portion is good.  But nothing special.
AVOID. Why?

So disappoint about this place! I orded a pizza and it took forever to arrive that I felt sleep, I called the next morning to either get a new order or get my money back. The lady was nice and told me she would fix the problem but 2 hours later she called to tell me there was nothing they could do according to her stupid manager...wow really? Talk about Customer Service! I buy from them often as well as my roommates but is time to find us a new pizza place! Lost 4 customers  for a stupid pizza! :(
$9.99 large cheese pick up special!
Good fun but issues ordering.

My pesto burger was a bit dry at first, but the onions were grilled to perfection. I wish my food was hot but although this place is 3 blocks from me ... It was warm. My fries sucked and i wasnt a fan of the Tiramisu , but because their food isnt all bad and they are so polite I am willing to give them another try.
Decent last stop after a night of partying! Huge open space with plenty of seating inside.

Reasonable entry to an informal bite on Valencia deep in the Mission. Great location on the corner, bike parking right in front, easy to order without huge crowds or lines, get in and out quickly, takes credit card payment. Under $10 you get an awesome falafel sandwich wrap and a bottled drink. Sizeable and filling, and the french fries appease the frites-in-my-burrito "California" novelty.

This place is amazing the food is really good and much healthier than most food places now days! For the price you pay here, you will not find a better and healthier eat out place! I would reconnect to try chicken Shish Kebab, it is very tasty and freshly cooked right in front of you! I would defiantly recommend Ali Baba cave to anyone and everyone that wants to get the best lunch for the buck!
This place is great! The a super Falafel is where it is at. Best in the city. Get it extra crispy and spicy!

Halfway threw my meal I seen a mouse run across the floor!!! Didnt get a pic so I did not want to deal with asking for a refund. My mistake for not leaving after seeing a 88 health rating! Stay away!!!
As a kid, my family had Mediterranean restaurants. I grew up eating a wide variety of food, but I had yet to find falafel as good as I remembered until I ate here.
Chicken Shawarma here is some of the best in the city. Coupled with the hummus & tahini platter is a good combination for the middle eastern palette that you must entertain from time to time.

Ali Baba's Cave is a comfortable place, I had the chance to eat there with a friend of mine and both were agreed that the food was great; beside the people working in there are friendly and asking you all the time if you need something. When you get there ask for the special of the day, and if you like it you won't spend much money, in fact you can eat there with $12.00 or more but it is an affordable place.

Absolutely awesome shawarma! Alibaba just opened and I've gone in multiple times every week, all the guys go above and beyond to make you affordable, delicious food. If you go in once, you'll keep coming back. Try everything, it's all fantastic!
really great local find. thanks food tours!
It's alright, the wrap was a ok. had the lamb and beef one.
I like their falafel for lunch. Fast and cheap. Also, the staff is gentle. Even regular falafel is very long for Japanese, although they have "super falafel."

My friend and I stumbled upon this hole in the wall late at night after having realized we had not eaten dinner yet.  We both ordered falafel sandwiches, which were chock-full of vegetables such as fried egg plant, potato, onions, and cucumber salad.  The sandwiches must've weighed 5 pounds each, because they were huge.  Definitely yummy and satisfying.  I would have given more stars if the place were cleaner.  I was little concerned by how the person making the sandwich went to the stockroom to get something and came back to continue making sandwiches without washing his hands first.

Ali Baba's cave was exactly that. A cave. I stumbled across this place because I was very hungry one night and I thought I may as well give it a go. Dont forget, I usually go to a place twice to give the food a second opinion. But not this place.
Mmm....shawarma. The hamburgers of the middle-east (or the burritos of the middle-east -- take your pick).
Best lamb/beef shawermas!
Awesome Shawerma, tabbouleh fresh and not overwhelming with parsley.   Will gladly go again.
fine but not great. got a falafel sandwich. probably won't be going back. pretty bland and dry.

I ordered a falafel wrap here and the service was friendly and nice.  However, they always seem to automatically charge an extra 50 cents for extras I did not have added.  I have corrected them every time at the register!

Not only was this incredibly flavorful and plentiful, but the next day my scale, which does percentages, was very happy. Nothing was soggy with oil or overly salty like many Med/Middle Eastern places. There are lots of options, not just the standard ME mall fare. We had grilled sandwiches rolled in Lavash the way that Lavash bread NEVER IS and should always be--like the most delicate part of a dutch crunch maybe. Filled with crushed sesame-filled falafel, fried eggplant, a tomato mixture, french fries (which I skipped), etc. Another friend had a combo plate and was entirely happy. The sandwiches and plates are big enough for a large man's appetite and if you are a smaller eater, you can take half home, and they heat up nicely on a pan or in a microwave.

I got the chicken platter and swapped out the rice for falafel. I had a favorite falafel wrap place in college and this place comes close in terms of falafel. I also got the yellow dough wrap with lamb, rice and vegetable that was good. I don't remember the name even though the server politely explained to me what it was and how to say it! The service is awesome and the people who work there are very friendly. If I didn't live so far, I would be back here more often. I plan on going back to try their falafel wraps (sandwiches).

I was really happy to discover that there is still an affordable restaurant that is good on Valencia Street in San Francisco these days. Ali Baba has been a staple for years, and it is full of regulars, not the gentrified cocktail and tapas crowd. Felt like a little bit of home and friendliness held over from the '90's before the all-good aspect of SF was dot-commed out of existence. .
This is the spot for my quick food if I find parking, their food is awesome, and the guy working there is cool.
The food was ok, but this place was dimly lit and that's because this place is dirty.
I haven't had falafals like theirs before...crispy and moist....with combination of roasted eggplant.....interesting. I enjoyed it
This was the best falafel I have ever had. Seriously delicious. You'll miss the "cave" if you don't visit the back of the restaurant so stay awhile and get comfy.
This is the BEST SHAWERMA/falafel place I have been to in the San Fran area. Must try.
It was getting late, and other places in the Mission were getting too crowded so my friend and I just decided to get food to-go from Ali Baba's and head over to her place.

I love their shawarmas! The flavors and combinations are delicious. To be fair I have only ever had the lamb or chicken shawarma, but every time we stop by I can't help but order it again! Any time I'm bumming around in the Mission I love to come here to grab some food and take it to Dolores Park.

OMG based God, thank god for this place.  I've been going to this place for over a decade and it's the best falafel in the world. Those of you giving the place suspect reviews because of the meat, well, that's what u get for eating shady meat on a pole you know what I'm saying?

You know upon coming here more times after writing it off a while back , its vastly improved and I prefer it over Truly Med even. You get more of a choice and variety in dishes , and the quality of the food feels more traditional . Truly Med is like a middle eastern burrito joint, whereas this is actually a Middle Eastern restaurant. If I were the owners though I'd maybe think about getting some new furniture , a lot of tables are wobbly and old.
Check out the shag room in the back of the restaurant.  The food aint half bad, but the shag room is amazing.
Great falafel's! Fresh and pipping hot!
Great shawarmas!
amazing fresh wraps (huge), fast service. cool seating area.

People say their falafels are great, but I found it average. Their menu also had less selections, though vegetarians might like it better. There is a small cave like area which they call Ali Baba's cave.
Best french fries in the city! Been getting them for more than a decade and you get a full paper bag of them for a great price!

Everything had a slightly burnt taste to it which I did not appreciate at all. I had a chicken shawarma and it was ok. The baba ghanouj was disappointing as well. My friend had a shawarma plate and it too had the similar burnt taste. That completely ruined it for us
ALI BABA'S CAVE
Some of the best hummus I've ever had!! I really recommend it!
I'm in the middle of the worst Chicken Shawarma ever.
4.5. Great tasting food. Dont let the environment fool you.

Our waitress was very friendly, and my huevos rancheros and chips and salsa were fine. I don't think I'd go out of my way to come here again, though, especially after seeing the place's most recent health score report and the cleanliness concerns voiced in other reviews. The restaurant isn't super clean, although I wasn't struck by anything noticeably gross when my friend and I ate there one night.
About 10 RAT POOPS at the bottom of our tortilla chips. Need I say more?! EW!!!!!! This place should be shut down.
Should you ever be tempted to eat here, first go to the restroom before ordering. You'll run screaming out the door! This is the dirtiest restaurant ever!
Service was fine, atmosphere was decent, but the food was just bland and unappetizing. I won't be back.
Great food, amazing value, and a cute waitress. I could not ask for more. I'll definitely be back but I probably won't order as much next time. I couldn't finish it all!
Went there for the chilaquiles but was not impressed, and neither was my other half. I'd give it 1 star for food, and an extra star for friendly service.
I used to live right above this place, but haven't been back in years until today. Their super burrito with chicken is probably the best burrito in the city, IMO.

Hands down THE BEST birria I have ever had in my life. I'm Mexican and my uncle used to make this on the regular and Chavita's beats it all to hell. Plus, a half dozen or more freshly HANDMADE tortillas. OMG. My boyfriend and I ate two entrees and had a beer and it cost us $25.
I feel really lucky that this restaurant is right by my apartment.
The nachos here are just awesome. Huge helping of chips, salsa, buried in cheese with a pile of steak on top.
"I'm never eating here again."

Note, I have been here a lot and often after a night of drinking so my check in level is not accurate. What is is the jevous rancherous ( maybe not spelled right by me). The bf swears its as good as his grandma's. Mmmm hmmmmm mmmmmm
Mellow atmosphere, usually a game on and really good comfort food!  We like to go here on a random weeknight as well as on a weekend before going out in the Mission.  Delicious!
Good food
Delicious Huevos Rancheros. Inexpensive. Eat at the Bar, a real taste of Central America. No worries about the way your dressed, come as you are.

0 stars! i can't believe the good reviews for this hellhole! my friend suggested this place last night for tacos. she said "they're so good and they make their own tortillas and the chicken is great" so i said "OK, we can get tacos there". 4 of us got tacos to go and half way through mine i discovered a waded up used napkin!!!!!!! WTF?????Under no circumstances should there EVER be anything inedible in my food, no matter what kind of shit hole restaurant it is. Does this mean that my taco was filled with other patrons leftovers? or did my taco topping fall on the floor and get scooped back up only to be served with some extra garbage? or did you simply miss the garbage can after taking a giant shit and the dirty rag landed in my taco? Absolutely miserable!

I am completely addicted to their chile rellenos.   $5.50 for a half portion (which is still really big because it comes with chips, a little thing of salsa, four handmade tortillas, and sides of rice and beans).  And the chile relleno is SO GOOD.  I also like their nachos.

We came here during the later part of the afternoon today after scanning the Street Food Fair and deciding that we'd really rather sit in a restaurant and be served.  I've been dying to try pozole after seeing it at the Food Channel and they serve them here on the weekends!!  We ordered that along with a bowl of menudo.  They serve them either in a small or large bowl.  We ordered the small bowls for each and were both very happy we did.  The portions was pretty good sized and enough for us.  The pozole came with chunks of pork and hominy and the menudo has masses of tripes.  The food was simple and down to earth.  The server was sweet and friendly.  Next time, i'd very much like to try their goat soup.

This restaurant is literally in my building... a three minute walk... and man o man is it good! I LOVE the chicken enchiladas, comes with rice and beans... And chips and salsa of course! Place is always busy and the best party super cheap! $7 bucks for two chicken enchiladas. $5.50 for a fully loaded burrito. Great service and great food! Worth a shot if you are nearby!
I love chilaquiles here, and they have the best hand made tortillas in toda la misión!

Had some of the most delicious Birria de Chivos in the universe here. The soup was hearty and I seriously thin they put half a goat in my soup. There was that much meat. The taste of the goat was gamey so if you don't like that don't have it. The portions were well sized for being 7.50 and I was left feeling extremely stuffed.
3 stars for the big food portions , food is just ok , tacos are huge i thought it was a F burrito at first , the milanesa de res was ok nothing too special to explain about , cheers

Oh, chicken and carne asada tacos, with your fresh cilantro and onions, sour cream and guac.  How I miss you re-fried beans, better than any fancy restaurant.  And you homemade red salsa, how could I forget you.  You're actually spicy!  YES! YES!  I'll have a little chip with my salsa!

HANDS DOWN the best forget the REST! Remember that place on Shotwell and 18th that burnt down some time ago, well they don't have anything on this place.   Ricardo use to be the cook at La Quinta on Mission and 21st and when we found out his brother bought a place, we followed him here.  You want home cooking, you come here....well its the closest thing at least.  The hand made tortillas..must i say more. My dad always goes to the back to tip her, why does everyone forget about her.  Her hands make the best, soft, airy tortillas.  Where do i start on the menu?...how about with the Caldo de Res on the weekdays..BOMB! The menudo, pozole and birria special on the weeekends...one of a kind. His other plates like chile rellenos de papa, costillas en salsa verde, lengue en chile, mole and goes on and on! If you want real mexican cooking come here, you won't be disappointed!  EXTRA BONUS...Ricardo and his FAMILY are HUGE CHIVAS FANS. ARRIBA LAS CHIVAS!!!!!!!

I've been to Chavita's on several ocassions.  The food is always consistently good, homestyle mexican cooking.  The tortillas, I think, might be handmade. Get there before 10:00 AM, and they offer breakfast specials for $4! I like their Chile Verde (yummy tender roast pork in a green chile sauce).  The waitresses always give great service.

This place serves good food and the people are nice.  I've only tried their enchilada plate with carne asada, but it was very good.  The carne asada was tasty and fresh, even though it was late at night.  The beans were great.  I had to channel my high school Spanish teacher to help the waitress understand that we wanted to share our food, but she was very nice about it once she understood.

I roll past this place back from 24th St. BART to my humble abode.  Well, sometime I saunter, or stroll, depending on my mood.  But I sort of dragged myself there this last Saturday after a healthy dose of inebriants the night prior.  And I ordered something that has always been a curiosity---menudo.  The soup that, basically, is a heap of chopped up cow innards that supposedly has restorative qualities after a hard bender.

We went in around 9pm on Wednesday night and were welcome right in.  We sat at the bar and the whole staff was extremely friendly.  As the time passed we continued to chat with the servers and sushi chef (John, also the owner) and they were just soooooo nice!  The food was great, I really enjoyed the hand rolls and you can't beat the deal (3 for $12).  Anyway, by the end of the meal we were enjoying this delicious sake with chef and the servers.  It was a really pleasant experience and we will definitely be back again soon.

My family and I have had a great set of dining experiences here, even though they are still relatively new to the scene. They have some inventive and affordable rolls and their nigiri sampler had some great selections that one might not normally expect. The customer service is what gives this five stars, however, as the proprietor made us feel at home and I hope that others will come to experience the same welcoming vibe (in addition to the great food!).
Ehhhh- it's ok

Dropped in on a Sunday night.  First time here.  Extremely friendly staff.  Was seated right away.  The menu is great.  They have a good mix of small plates, entrees and various unique sushi rolls.  Tried the salmon, sesame chicken and mixed veggies plates.  All were excellent.  Food service was quick.   It was not too busy so that may have helped.  All around, great food and service.
Kazan was a brilliant experience.

Definitely not Sushi Bistro. It was ok, but we had three different waitresses that kept coming by our table over and over to see if we were ready to order, they were really overbearing. Nigiri was good, but arent you supposed to use real crab in your Cali roll if you expect to stand out in this city?

Went here on our last night in sf. The food was absolutely delicious and service was xcellent. We had the maki rolls, the last samurai and mixed nigiris and was about to order some more when the chefs suddenly prepared a salmon sashimi dish for us on the house, very appreciated:) we thereafter ordered the dish three some, which had the ingredients "secret" all I can say it that we were very pleased with this aswell :) this place is a hidden treasure in mission district. We sat in the bar and watched the chefs work while we ate. I choose to give it 5 stars for the combination of beautiful tasty dishes that didn't cost us more than 30 $ a person

Headed here with my girlfriend and her dad. We had a blast. Service was great. Sushi and sashimi were top notch. Bear with them they are still building their sites and menu. I will definitely go back!

The nigiri here is great. Fine quality fish in plentiful servings and great small plates. Also, love the owner, John. He's everything I want in a chef. He's fun, personable and just a good personality. Great neighborhood spot.

The Kazan is great place to enjoy the fusion japanese food. It was fun to eat(?) to here. Not a sushi roll place, not an izakaya... I really can't say this is what type of japanese restaurant is. But The food was delicious and  authentic. Also they still have good selections of wine and sake as Sushi Bistro. I love here. I absolutely recommend this restaurant for the perfect date.
So glad they reopened, it's nice to have a Japanese option in the area. Came with a party of 2 on a Friday night. It's surprisingly not busy, but probably because no one knows about it yet.

Wanted Sushi Bistro, but end up with this place, guess they took over. Not impressed. The ramen I ordered for my daughter was soggy and clumped together; broth was somewhat tasteless. Their sashimi was ok, but nothing to brag about. Added tempura, but ended up getting deep fried onions and jalapeños and she insisted that was it...c'mon!
Friday; 8:45 pm; party of 3
Had a great meal here on Saturday night.  Fresh fish and a great wine list for a sushi spot.  The Chef/Owner was very nice and recommended some good rolls.  I'm putting Kazan on the regular rotation.

Most importantly, the sushi is super fresh. There is a great selection of creative rolls to choose from... But not too many to overwhelm you when picking some out while you're hungry! My group had gotten sashimi, nigiri, a couple rolls and appetizers, and katsu over rice, and everybody loved it all. I had a sashimi salad that was best I've ever tasted... The dressing is tasty and unique!

Cake S. left before getting his food because he wasn't open minded? What a priss. Kazan is great! This is the place where you can get your traditional nigiri as well as innovative and delicious rolls. What's more, the fish is fantastically fresh. When I feel like challenging the capacity of my stomach, which is all the time, the Last Samurai roll is perfect! It's huge and, well, delicious. I do err on the side of nigiri, but dabbling with the rolls is never a bad decision.
Japanese small dishes. sushi.and iced cold sake!!!!
Left before getting our food. Here's why:
the chicken remember me at my home town el Salvador and so yummy the customer service is good and real nice people thank you
the chick is good, the one star review is for the service/policy/overall experience.
It was. Great food , but it has bad costumer service , tables didn't even have napkins. I had to ask them while I was eating.

The fried chicken is good and I actually prefer it over the grilled chicken.  It's doesn't taste exactly like the original recipe from Central America but close enough.  The empanadas and yucca fried are also good.  The staff is friendly, in particular David  (the hostess) always has a smile on his face.  I don't always eat fried chicken but when I do its Pollo Campero.
Hipsters your not welcome here, it's for normal people, you have plenty of restaurants serving food on square plates thru out the mission, go there instead.
Pollo Campero feels like a chain. Is it a chain? I think it's a chain.

$25 for a non organic chicken?!?!?! This chicken is good, but not all that. Skip this and go buy 2/$15 at whole foods up the street. Add better tasting sides and you have a way better meal. Good fricken chicken and safe way are better too. Don't listen to the hype!

The fried chicken really wasn't as good as people made it seem to be. It was fried to a nice golden brown, with a slight crunch but the white meat was just too dry for me. I made a bad choice of ordering the roasted corn which basically tasted like corn from a can that was roasted until some of it turned black lol weak!

Pretty decent chicken, though I only got one piece when I ordered 2. But that doesn't affect the score. The plantains were good but not really my style. The best thing was the tenderness of the chicken and the amazing citrus herbal rub.
I love this place, its great to eat the chicken! friendly staff, good price, clean and if you want to eat a lot go there!.

We traveled to Peru last year and flew through San Salvador. We were told to find a chicken place called Pollo Campero in the airport. We were told that everyone on the plane would be carrying bags of chicken with them and that it was delicious How true this was! While visiting the Mission district, I saw Pollo Campero and asked if it was the same restaurant as in Central America. It was. My mom and I ate there and had a great experience. She is in a wheelchair and the staff helped us find a comfortable place to sit. Immediately, David and Oliver came over and brought us water and chips. They were very friendly. Elsy, our server, came over and asked if we needed the menu explained or had any questions. Jose, the manager, also came over and talked to us. Throughout our meal, the staff kept checking on us. I watched both David and Oliver hustling around, helping customers and smiling, obviously enjoying working there. This made the lunch experience so pleasant. Also the food was delicious. My mom had the typical fried chicken, which she loved. I had a spicy empanada and the chicken salad. Both of us needed a doggie bag because the portions were generous. Normally, we like hole in the wall local places rather than a "chain" but this is a great addition to the Mission. When the staff seems to truly enjoy their jobs, it is the sign of a successful business that makes people want to come back.
This I have to say is some awesome fried chicken......usually not a big fan  of it but it got me

The service we got the minute we can in the Door was amazing the lady gave us a table, our server was extremely friendly the food was delicious!  I will definitely come back to this place anytime!!!!!
This is my second time eating here and I swear the chicken gets darker and darker.
This place truly deserve the 5 star for its cost, great service, cleanliness and delicious food.  Pollo Campero serves fried (n'Juicy) chicken or Peruvian (rotisserie with orange and lemon herb).

My BFF suggested we tried Pollo Campero because she heard it was good. Wrong. The chicken wasn't all that. I was going to give it a one star but the waiters and waitress were really nice and patient. We were really loud and annoying, but what can you expect when we had just left a big one year anniversary party. We ordered the mixed 16 piece chicken order with our sides, fries and coleslaw and both dinner rolls and tortillas. The sides were good, I liked them better than the chicken. This was my first and last time. I will leave the chicken in the field. Lol. Pollo Campero

The food is pretty darn good. They have a lot of Caribbean/South American classics. Atmosphere and service are not highlights. The lighting is bright fluorescent but they do play a lot of good Salsa. If you speak any Spanish, stick to Spanish because it helps with service. Must haves: fried yucca, empanadas.
had the grilled chicken and my GF had the chicken soup. very tasty and cheap ! will be coming back to try more stuff.

Years ago when I was little my parents warned me specifically not to go to Mission St. or the Mission District. I was never good at listening, especially when there is fried chicken involved. As I type this I realize I have fully become a geezer.

I dropped in here the other day having been refused service at multiple taquerias because I forgot to bring cash.  I meandered down Mission Street looking for someone to please accept a VISA or MASTERCARD!  I was really happy I found this place.  This is an inexpensive place with an ambiance typical of a fast food joint - except for the two large screens showing "futbol" which I know as little about as "football".  It is all the same to me.

Wanted to pick up some food before a march madness game (Go Card) and decided to see what folks have been yapping about.  Awesome, awesome awesome.  Great service and folks, super cheap, and I'm not sure I know anywhere else I can get fried chicken and rice & beans at the same time, not to mention some solid horchata.  I am a happy camper, and I will surely be back to this place again and again as I look for "spots" in the area
Like everyone said.. the Chicken was good..I had the Fried version and my Wife had  the lime.

I would say the fried chicken is as good as Popeye's and better than KFC. Even the white meat was moist. Yucca fries, cole slaw and corn are okay; the chipotle fries were tastier. I love the free tortilla chips and horchata was okay. The rotisserie chicken is good too; add lime and it's even better. Service was really great; we were a party of 8 (the only non-Hispanics in the restaurant) and they were attentive and accommodating for our big group. Everyone was absorbed into the soccer game that was playing on the TVs. Not a bad place for fried chicken with a Spanish twist.

my friend really likes pollo compero so we came here today for lunch.  we got the chicken, rice and black beans,roasted corn, plantain fries, empanadas and I was impressed.  the food wasn't too salty and tasted great for fast food.

I was, ultimately, mad at myself after spending nearly $22 for 8 pieces and 2 sides of take out from this restaurant during the third week of February 2014, just after 5:00pm.  I was mainly mad cuz I'd intended to go to Popeyes, but getting off the 14L at 24th Street, I had to walk by Pollo Campero...  Maybe I was being lazy, but I decided to buy some of their chicken rather than walk another block or two...  my bad.

My first time going to Pollo Campero was AWESOME I celebrated my birthday and I went with my friends best experience ever. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE and OMG THE FOOD IS THE BOMB! Too bad I live in San Jose CA or else I'd be going there everyday no Joke. This is my personal opinion.
Not only was the chiiiicken greasier than any other chicken joint, it had no taste. I do not recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!
I think this is a solid and very reasonably priced place in the Mission, which seems to be pretty rare these days with all the new restaurants popping up.

The citrus grilled chicken combo is quite good for being "fast food". We have been here several times since they opened and the food is consistently good. Waitstaff is attentive and genuine. My daughter was refusing to eat one day and the manager noticed and came over to our table and offered her a Pollo Campero Kids pin if she ate. She still didn't eat, and I returned the pin (she didn't follow through, so no reward) but his kind gesture was much appreciated.
KFC sucks compare to this place, best Guatemalan chicken sides are amazing and has lots of variety
Fast food with table service. Came here on a Wednesday night at 8:30, no wait! I actually try going for lunch before and the line was about 30 deep. So this was a total score!
Campero's the reason so much of Central America is getting chubbier.  We don't need it here.

Yay!  I'm bummed I wasted a year of Pollo eating not realizing the Guatemalan deity had opened a location right in my backyard!  This place had me at the first bite years ago in Guatemala and I am thrilled to find it's just as delicious here. Do you think they take Quetzals?  I still have some left over....
Even though this place is marketed as a family restaurant, in reality it feels more like a fast-food joint, except the food is actually quite slow instead of fast.

Love it! Really great food. But remember, this is really for fried chicken, not healthy food. If you want to eat something healthy and or wholesome, this is not the place for you. But if you want fried chicken, then you can hardly find better.
I ordered the ¼ Grilled Peruvian Chicken Meal Includes my choices of a Leg/Thigh combo.

The service was excellent. Several managers walked through the restaurant checking on their customers, The food was decent considering it's a sit down, fast food restaurant. My only concern is that they use Mazola corn oil which is probably Genetically Engineered since 90% of U.S. grown corn is GMO. Right now, rice bran or coconut oil (large tub of Nutiva at Costco) is the way to go for frying. I would go back to Pollo Campero for the service and the food if they switch out the GMO cooking oil. I'm giving it one fewer star for the GMO cooking oil.

I had no idea this place had table service at first. The greeter rushed me to the take out cashier. I ordered and said it was "for here" then picked a table. That's when I noticed new customers were being seated and offered chips & salsa. Hmm. My receipt says "dine in" so I wait for my order to be brought to me like everyone else. A worker holding a giant paper bag finds me, annoyed that I hadn't heard him call out my order #. I said I was eating here and drops the bag on the table. Everyone else sits there with their dine-in plates and real utensils and I'm feeling embarrassed, unloading this giant bag, eating out of to-go containers. I watch how the other customers get a lot of attention and super service while I'm ignored by everyone but the manager, Robert Delgado. He was the only one to check in with me after I was seated, but I didn't want to complain to him since damage had been done.
Excellent grilled chicken and sweet sticks. Good plantains.

I highly recomend this place for anyone that wants to eat some delicious chiken. This a great place to eat. The set up of this place is very nice, there's a long corridor you walk through to get seated by a host, and an 'exit only' door by the end of the tables. The interior is modern, very clean, and a huge window in the back by the kitchen so you can see your food being freshly made which is always a good thing. This is the best chiken I've ever tasted "exquisite"

Cozy little wine bar. Might be hard to find a sitting area because its small. Good selection. They have champaign too. A bit pricey when it comes to cheeses and snack plates. Occasional live music. They had jazz when I went with our group. Groups are ok if you go early!!!
Really nice vibe, nice music, good cheeses. Definitely on my list of places to go to again.

Love this place. It's small, but very cozy, and the staff is super friendly. Go with a small group of friends or an intimate night out. Wine list is not big, but the staff know their wines well. This is a place to sit, relax, talk and take in the atmosphere of the Mission District. Desserts and tapas plates looked good too, but did not get to try them.
Never go there!

French, I mean really Frenchie....I had the luck of catching up with one of my dear friends, so that set the vibe on a smooth drive down Lovely St. We got seated right away in a nice spot towards the back. Now, I am no sommelier but I know some what about wines but this list was so extensive I did not know where to begin. We asked for a recommendation and it was perfect. Now let me sing a song about the french pizza, it's simplicity is beauty in itself. I've never had one of these nor have I travelled to France. It's divine. We had the one with prosciutto, tomato and mozzarella. There is no sauce for the sauce is that of the creme fraiche gods, now tomato sauce seems so over-rated. I fell in love. The owner was really great and gave us a great bottle of wine.
If it was only for the food and wine, I would give this place 5 stars.

I came to this wine bar multiple times and so far we have not had any issues. Servers are very friendly and knowledgeable about their wine. I would definitely recommend their happy hour because their tapas are really good and affordable.
After filling our tummies with the tasty treats of Hella Vegan Eats,  Laura C. suggested making a stop at Etcetera.

Great food, great service and really nice setting. We ordered from the tapas menu and everything was amazing and really worth the money which was ridiculously cheap considering the quality. The wine was so good too! We'll be back! They offer wine tasters so I really want to come back and try that. Also the music was really good.

Cozy atmosphere. Great wine selection. Solid brews on tap for the non-wine drinkers. Great service and beverage knowledge behind the bar. AMAZING small plates! Eclectic music (both live and through the speakers).

Second time was even better. Went for the happy hour on Sunday -- $10 house wine and a tapa. The melted brie and dates flatbread was ammmaaaazing. Salmon blini was good, too. Also ordered the "French pizza" with mushrooms, truffle oil, arugula, pecorino. Delish. Matthew offered great recommendations and was very kind. Excellent service, food, wine, music, and ambiance. What else can I want?!? I'm a fan and will be back. Try their Argentinian Bordeaux blend. Yummy.
I really enjoyed the wine BUT the seating was really small and uncomfortable. Don't know where to put my coat.

This is an awesome wine bar. The manager of the place is really knowledgable about all of the different types of wines. When you try to order something, they will help you select the best type of wine possible for what you are looking for. Their food and wine is on the pricer side with the starting price of cheese of about $6 for one type.
Ordered a bottle of wine, cheese, and the banana bread pudding. The little window nook was a nice romatic place to sit but the lighting was too bright.

I came here last night, Monday, for a first date. I picked out a bottle of wine to order and the server then related it was Monday, which meant it was 20% off all bottles. (makes me look cheap for taking her there!) He then told me that I should try exploring a different type of bottle (I.E. more expensive bottles since I was getting 20% off). After he spoke about these various bottles, I kindly said give us a few minutes. I then had to order my original bottle request from another server. As the night went on, a fruit fly flew into my date's drink (not a huge deal). Expecting the server to pour another glass, he said he could filter the wine for her. After I requested he pour a new glass, he gave me a disheartening look and made me feel awkward for asking for a new glass. He then related fruit flies are common at wine bars and there is nothing they can do about it. Ive been here a few times but service this time was very out of the norm and don't think ill be returning. Thanks!

A friend who lives in the neighborhood suggested we meet here for wine and snacks after work Friday. I'm not a wine connoisseur, but I certainly enjoyed what I had. The staff was very nice and helpful as we dithered over the wine list and the menu. They get an extra boost to the rating just for being patient. We had a selection of tapas with our wine; the veggie rolls and the mini brie and date Flammenkueche won the day. Also the molten chocolate cake is sinfully good.
love their chocolate lava cake, beef empanada, and spanish tortilla! Great selection of wines and the ambiance is very peaceful.

I went there on a Sunday night while I was visiting San Francisco. I went primarily for the music which was wonderful. I ordered a charcuterie plate which was pretty good. My glass of cava was average.  There were two male bartenders/servers I interacted with that evening. One man was wonderful. He was very attentive and nice to me.  The other man wore glasses, African-American and was quite defensive when I mentioned I thought the bread was the previous patron's. Perhaps I was wrong, but I was quite nice when I said it and was not accusatory in my tone.  Very curtly told me that this was not the previous patron's bread. Afterwards, I was ignored the rest of the evening. It was obvious that it was as a result of my mentioning that the bread was the previous patrons.  Oh well. I wouldn't have even mentioned this incident if it weren't for the fact that two nights later, he was having an ongoing screaming argument with somebody on the phone in front of a different restaurant on that street. He was screaming at the top of his lungs and commenting how he has a short temper. I laughed because I thought to myself, now I understand his reaction to my bread comment!
Nice little place.  One guy, super nice and super helpful, does all the work.  Another guy totally useless, doesn't seem to do anything, and way too old to be pulling his jeans below his butt.

As an avid wine drinker (though not yet a connoisseur) my eyes probably light up whenever I remember I am close to Etcetera.  My fiancé and I go through periods where we are there like, literally all the time to times when we have not been for a few week or a couple months.  However my favorite fellows there, Fabian and Chris, always remember us and say it's good to see us, give us service and great recommendations.  The one called Chris helped me to first appreciate a white wine.  I had only ever enjoyed reds, and when they started to give me terrible headaches I was forced to switch to whites, though I never enjoyed them.... and had to stay on wines because I do enjoy the wine drunk!  Chris, who is great with describing the wines, picked out a wine for me and described it as 'waxy' which, for some reason, really piqued my interest!  Ever since, I can taste varying lovely waxy qualities about white wines that I taste.  And now I LOVE whites!  He solved my biggest problem and turned it into a joy.  YAY!

This is so far, my favorite wine bar in the City. The wait staff are always very friendly and the food is consistently good. Of course, their wines are also wonderful. This is a great place to bring someone visiting from out-of-town, or perhaps a first date.
We found a table outside for all 5 of us. It was a little small but we made it work.

great casual but cute ambiance, good location and really good service...but out of the handful of times I've been here every single glass of wine I have had has been VERY mediocre. picking blindly at district has led to much better results. just not worth it for me.

I challenge you to find a better spot to spend a Sunday evening in San Francisco. Awesome, quality live jazz music. Wide variety of wines by the bottle and glass for very reasonable prices. Great tapas and flatbread pizzas. Friendly, unpretentious staff and cozy seating. You can't, so don't try. Just go here.

Exceptional service. When I go to a wine bar I expect the recommendations of our server to be the best option. In this case, we were so happy with everything that our attentive, knowledgable and obliging server chose for us. The flammekueche was delicious, and the wine was perfect for what we wanted on a hot afternoon. They are also dog friendly, which is a great bonus, so we will certainly be back. They mentioned they have a great happy hour, and also live music some evenings, so I want to go check that out as well. HIGHLY reccomended, and 5 stars, which I don't often give!

Came to Etcetera for a few glasses of wine and immediately found seating at the bar. The staff were friendly and courteous, and offered descriptions/opinions on the wines available to help us make our decision. The wine was delicious (with a wide variety available) and the food was very fresh and tasty. No complaints about the price given the quality!

Just realized that I never wrote a review for this place :/ Went here for a (first) date on Valentines day...long story, over-the-top cliché. :P But this meal was part of one of the most memorable nights I've experienced.

Very good wine and the food was excellent.  Went for Valentine's Day, without a reservation, but they were accommodating,  We have gone back another time since then and again, the service was excellent, the food was excellent.  Might be one of my new favorite places for small plates and good wine. :)

Intimate and fun. Perfect place for a one on one get-together. Awesome selection of high quality wines from all over. Go for a cheese plate -- the Midnight Moon goat cheese is heavenly! The bartenders are super knowledgeable and friendly, and once you're all set with your food and drinks, they don't bug you.

This is a great wine bar. My bf and I had their charcuterie plate and their caprese pizza which I must say is to die for! Yummy!! When we went they had live music which definitely made the ambiance chill and kind of romantic. I don't remember exactly which wine we had I know it was a rose but I don't recall the name but that was yummy as well. I would definitely be coming back!

Best wine bar in the city. To me, nothing else comes close. I just love this place. You have to try this place. If you are willing to drive all the way to napa, you don't have to because Etcetera is right at your backyard. For those who live in SF, this is a hidden gem. This place does not scream fancy or marina yappies, this is why I love this place. Down to earth, warm and friendly. Nothing but great selection of wine and amazing food to compliment. This place is amazing. I look forward to my next visit.

My husband was invited to try this restaurant by a friend of his in France. Apparently this friend knew the owner and told us that she started an Alsatian restaurant in the States. She was on her way out when we arrived, but I suppose the waitstaff told her about us and she returned just to say hello and offer us a verre du vin on the house. It was awesome. The tarte flambee (or French pizza) was just as I remembered it from Alsace. Hoping to come back to this little eatery when we return to San Francisco. The scenery was nice, the food was just like Alsace and the staff were very kind.
My favorite wine bar in the city. Great wine selections and the flammekueche / Alsatian pizzas are amazing, they take me back to great memories from Strasbourg. The owner is very nice and personable.
Good live music on Sundays. Excellent tapas. Pleasant staff.
Etcetera is the best wine bar on the Valencia corridor. The atmosphere is casual with a nice big bar and table seating.

No complaints on the food or the wine. But the service was reprehensibly inattentive and, at times, intently negligent (or so it seemed). Flagging down a server proved a task for only the most patient and tenacious. This was not true for everyone, granted, but it was for us (the only apparent gay couple in the restaurant) and a second gay couple who arrived after us. I do not want to commit to a statement about Etcetera's possibly homophobic stance, but this evening led me to wonder.
great place for wine! great dessert for gluten free diners, great ambiance, but no vegan dessert choice for vegans. Hopefully they'll add it one day. Hopefully they'll read this :)

Such a fun and great little spot in the Mission! I was planning to go out for a night of dancing, but needed to grab some food to start the night off with energy. It was the perfect spot for a pizza, glass of wine and dessert. Be sure to get the mushroom pizza and the chocolate molten cake - delish!

Adorable wine bar with fun decor and very friendly service. They have an awesome happy hour special where you can get a glass of that day's house wine with a tapas for $10. And to top it all off, they have FREE wifi! I'm wondering if I should even be revealing that fact... I just wish they opened earlier in the day.

I'm by no means a wine critic. Nor an expert. When I was a kid, wine to me was the stuff the Frenchies drank to every meal, and it was something my mom would use occasionally for cooking. And it was also something you could get for EUR 2.99 at your neighborhood Lidl supermarket.
Great pizza. Not to doughy, not to cheesy. Just right.  Fort Point Beer Kolch is great with their pizza.
This is, without a doubt, the best pizza I've ever had in San Francisco.

I'm 99% sure my family and I were sitting next to Yelper Nina B. and her dining companion on this, the first night of Pizza Hacker's "soft opening" at his new brick-and-mortar location on Mission St. I second Nina's experience. Jeff (the PizzaHacker himself) makes a fine pie, and I say this as an admitted NJ-born pizza snob. I had a margherita, while my wife got the "Get a Room" and the menu's lone (enormous) salad. We were equally impressed. The cheese is delicious, while the crust has a wisp of salt on it that really goes a long, long way towards punching up the flavor. The pizzas are all of good size, too.

Some said this man was a myth because i tried countless of times to find him until he found shelter at vinyl room. I went here twice. The first time i went there it was great i dont know remember the name of the pizza, but its the one that has lemon and arugula. That was one of the best pizzas i have tasted. The second time i came i ordered my favorite - Mergherita. This one was a fluke, The sauce was tried out and the cheese was scarce. Note, i did get the last pizza available for the night, so maybe that was the reason.
Really good pizza!

Growing up in New Haven, CT, I feel I am qualified to review pizza and Pizzahacker is by far the best pizza I have had on the west coast. I tried three different pies, and all were good, though my favorite was the Yo Vincent...I highly recommend Pizzahacker, particularly for east coasters looking for a taste of New Haven.

All the ingredients are extremely high-quality, the sweetness of their sauce reminds me of the pizza I used to get back east. Definitely recommend the Yo Vinny and the Spancholive, though I am petitioning for them to change the name to something cool like "The Don Quixote".

Oh man. I went to PizzaHacker's Thursday nights at Vinyl wine bar, and I was in heaven. The perfect crust, the delicious cheese, the salty meat, and the rich sauce with a glass of wine. What could be better?

Probably 3.75 stars and I'm writing this at Vinyl while I'm staring at the last two slices of my delicious pie. It's tough to really get me to rave about something in this neighborhood when you consider that the ambrosia that is Little Star is just a few blocks up the street but this is worth checking out.
yumyum

I think PizzaHacker is hit or miss. Returned to Vynl and ordered 2 pies (a Margherita and a white pizza with mushroom). The crust was terrible- way too sour (tasted like sourdough) and too thick. The crust on the Margherita was completely burnt.

So I saw this guys frankenweber sort of device, and thought I would support his endeavor to monetize it.  On his website, he says he'll be at Vinyl Cafe.  After ordering, I settle in, and look around for this awesome brick oven device, and don't see it.  I'm horrified to scan behind the counter and see that the guy is using a standard restaurant pizza oven!  Those things don't get any hotter than 550 degrees F, and the "brick oven" pizza is only achieved when temperatures approach 1000.
Best pizza in the world.  Try everything!  I have not been disappointed by anything yet.
It is super delicious pizza place . I love it with pineapple  mazzarelo chease MMMMM.... CHeck this ou , It is not that healthy ,cause it is pizza but i  do it once at a time.

To call this masterpiece mere "pizza" would be an insult. Defina? Little Star? Flour + Water? They can't hold a candle to PizzaHacker! After the first bite it is incredibly obvious that the highest quality ingredients have been used for the dough, cheese, sauce, toppings, etc. We had a margherita pizza and Jerry's something. Both were very different, but equally outstanding. The little tomatoes on Jerry's are literally explosions of flavor in your mouth! Although one pizza could technically feed two, these are so amazing that you'll want one pizza each.
Surly?  Sure.

Finally got to try PizzaHacker's margherita pizza at the Vinyl Wine Bar. Definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had. What particularly wowed me was the crust: it has a beautiful sourdough taste that's brought out by a light sprinkling of smoked salt and a thin layer of olive oil, crunching delightfully with every bite. This isn't the kind of crust you want to leave behind on your plate! My only question is whether the more traditional ovens at the Vinyl Wine Bar create a different taste than PizzaHacker's usual franken-BBQ. In any case, I definitely look forward to having this pizza again!

The neighborhood listing is deceiving. I don't know when or where else the Pizza Hacker appears, but he's in NOPA at Vinyl Cafe on Thursday evenings. Absolutely the best pizza I've had, and I have had a lot of pizza.
super yummy pizza
Good, slightly crispy, chewy smokey crust check.

Oh man - the Pizza Hacker makes some of the best pizza I've ever had.  He spun for a holiday party that I attended last year, and I was amazed at his assortment.  Even though some may say that the PizzaHacker is a Pazi (i.e., pizza nazi), he really is just very dedicated to his craft in an uncompromising way.  What is wrong with that?  Recently, he gave me some frozen pizzas to try.  These were also excellent.
real exceptional pizza. worth the price. people who know pizza love the pizza hacker.
I really loved this pizza., it's a little expensive but you pay a premium for quality, salt on the crusts is an inspiration
I agree with:
not bad! crust was chewy, but not crispy. some combos (cherry tomatoes!) work really well, others just okay.
Best pizza I've ever had - and I make a darned good pizza myself
I died.  Truffle salami, burrata and radichio pizza.  yeeeeeeeeeeeeeeees please.  reminds me of delfina pizzaria but better....

It's my birthday.  What better way to celebrate, I thought, than a picnic in the park catered by Pizza Hacker.  I couldn't have been more right (do people say that? Probably super annoying overly self-confident people).

My girlfriend and I checked these guys out last Thursday at the Bloodhound Bar.  We recently returned from New York City where we had some killer pie.  The taste of San Marzano tomatoes was still fresh in my mouth as I returned to the Bay so I began a search for some quality classic pizza around here.  I've been widely disappointed in the pizza in the Bay.  Nothing too horrible but nothing too great either.  After searching for some classic Italian spots in North Beach I came upon the yelp review for Pizza Hacker.  After seeing some nice Margarita pizza pictures and checking out the video about how the baker from Cafe Tartine is involved, I thought I would give it a try.
Whoa.
One of the best crusts I've ever had.  Dusted with Alderwood smoked salt, it had an excellent balance of crunch, chewyness, charring, and fluffy dough.
Top notch pizza. Pricey.
Tasty pie indeed, but he charges extra for cheese. WHAT ? I THOUGHT ALL PIZZA comes with cheese unless otherwise specified ?

Great selection, service and damn tasty. Wish I could get up to the city more to have this delectable dish. But when I do, it's totally worth it.  If you see him out and about (or on Twitter @pizzahacker), give a follow and stop by for good eating.

Mm Pizzahacker was tasty!  I had most recently been to Zero Zero so when I was offered three options, I went with the Margherita since that's usually my standard style to taste.  I also checked in on Yelp and found a coupon - apparently I was only the second person to ever use one.

You smell the deep smoke from the frankenweber from a block away...then you get close and see the ember light glowing from the dome, fresh ingredients being sprinkled on the next-in-line pie, and you know yours will be in or around your mouth soon enough.
Hot damn, the margherita pizza ($16) was delicious. Oddly enough, the most memorable touch was the sprinkling of salt on top.
Great Pizza...Great suspense.  Support your local hacker!

Jeff and his portable Frankenweber make A.... MAZ..... ING pizza. No doubt this man's got the mad skills with the handmade dough, the organic self-harvested tomato sauce, and the tasty herbs and cheese. Every time I've tasted it I've been blown away by how he knows his way around the port-o-kitchen. Most definitely worth the wait, especially as you can always go to any of 20 fine drinking establishments within a stones throw while you're waiting for your order. Find him wherever he may set up in SF! You will make yourself happy.
Let's put it this way you yelpers. If you aren't eating Pizza Hacker's pie you are not eating pie at all.
Ordered the burger and it was overcooked and the bun was stale.  Even though it's right around the corner from where I live, I won't be coming back.

Horrible horrible service. I was yelled at for throwing away my plate in the wrong trash, then violently confronted. Even after stepping outside these guys kept trying to start a fight with me. One of them even raised his hands at me in a gesture to smack me. I have been going to the Nizarios in the Castro for years, and was happy when this one opened up. I have even brought many people that have never had Nizarios to this location. Worst service industry interaction of my life. I cannot believe that this type of behavior is allowed.

F this place. Bad food and worse service. The idiot cook made my food shitty on purpose because he's a bitch that doesn't want to work after 12. I even tipped like 30% and I still got screwed. No mas guey.

Terrible. Screwed up my order, gave my slice to someone who ordered after me, then when they realized it was the last piece of that particular pizza they told me that I ordered something else. Excuse me, I know what I ordered, thank you. On top of bad service, the slices were incredibly bland. I used to love Nizarios, guess I shouldn't come here sober.
Great service, fast and friendly.
This is the worst pizza I've ever had.

I am surprised that this place does not have a lot of reviews. Located in the heart of the mission district surrounded by a ton of bars this is the place to go if you want a late night drunk snake. The pizza is reasonably priced and maybe it was because we were drinking it but the slices were really good. I am sure we will be back since we are in this area quite a bit.
Minus one star on a count of you have to catch them on a good day but other than that this place kicks ass :).
I've come here for a Philly cheesesteak and pizza a few times. It's in a nice spot on Valencia, so if you want a snack, it's good.

The pizza isn't bad for a late night stumbling out of the Mix, but often the employees are rude, the pizza isn't fresh, and overall the experience is bleh.  The reason it gets three stars instead of two is convenience.  Sometimes, when you just want to cross a street, eat a slice, and catch a cab, you take what you can get.

I passed by with my boyfriend and we both stopped when we saw some guys eating pepperoni slices next to the window. Went inside bought a pepperoni slice and it was delicious. It was a pretty big slice and the pepperoni was crispy and very tasty. Also it wasn't super greasy. Will come back for sure.
Pizza = yummerz! I just don't like being bothered by the bums that come inside smelling like shit asking you for money. It ruined my experience.

So I'm standing in line at Arinell Pizza a few doors down (because my cousin had just raved about their slices), when the pizza dude gestures with one finger in the air, as if to say, "that's a wrap!" No more slices. But it's only 1am *sad face* The lights are turned off on us (surreal...can you imagine?!) & I'm forced to drag my quickly-sobering-up ass over to Nizarios, who by the way does not offer the Greko. I opted for a slice of cheese pizza & a root beer for the trek back to the car--so nasty I barely ate half (& I was hongry, too.) I really enjoy the Nizario's in the Castro & expected the same menu & friendly service at this Valencia location.
Best Philly Cheesesteak I've tried in the city BY FAR.

late night spot only. pizza was ok. thick slice. did not like the taste of the hawaiian. gave my slice away which is hard to imagine for drunken eating. liked the pepperoni more. only if drunk across the st.
Con: Not all that good.  Pro: Open.  You may also get to see a drunk being arrested. You can decide if that's a pro or a con.

Not a fan of the sketch mission (especially on a stormy night via BART (barf- shoulda  taken my car) and getting soaked walking the dirty ass streets in search of some puky dingy dive bar. So, having a slice of this pizza @ midnight on our way [escape] back to BART was the ONLY saving grace of the evening.  Airy crust, freshly made. Buy by the slice. Only complaint: I wish places like this would wake up and realize it's 2012 and the Cash Only policy is becoming a thing of the past. Square it up or something. Cash Only is an archaic concept in this technologically-driven society. Won't be back in person, but would order if they deliver.
BEST PLACE TO FULFILL THOSE DRUNK MUNCHIES!
Ordered Garlic Chicken Pesto for delivery.
Came to the Sf food Festival to try out the Scotch Egg. WOW!!! Can I have another 5?? So, It was a Hard boiled egg wrapped in ground sausage, and breaded and fried? How can you go wrong.

Today, I checked out the second annual SF Street Food Festival and the first food stand I hit was Purple Hibiscus (they also appear to go by Chiefo's Kitchen - still finalizing on a name, I suppose), which specializes in Nigerian food.

went here last night for dinner. its chinese owned and don't be surprised by the outside. The interior is actually very nice and cosy. They have happy hour from 4-6 every day. I got Sunset strip roll sans ponzu sauce. I asked for real crab whch they can sub out for an extra $3. However, I'm not sure if the hostess wans't attentive or what but she asked me twice to repeat what I wanted and I still ended up getting fake crab meat. taste wise it was fine though but that was annoying...

After waiting 80 minutes I got a note from the restaurant that the order wouldn't be ready for an additional 90 minutes, because their driver did not arrive until 4:30PM. If you need delivery, use someone else.
Lost a star for having a (long) hair in my miso soup in today's lunch.

Meh Japanese place. The starter salad had some kind of dressing that definitely isn't Japanese. More like one of those off brand dressings you buy at Safeway for the company picnic that is charitably called "Creamy." Oyaku Don wasn't great, I don't feel great a few hours after eating it. Might have been the egg, but the chicken was pretty gamy. I would describe it as more connective tissue than protein.

We are true Sushi lovers. So yesterday, me, my husband and baby daughter stopped by this place after leaving the Post Office next door. We ordered a lunch meal, California rolls, beef teriyaki, salad, rice and miso soup. Additionally a side order of spicy tuna rolls. Prior to ordering the waitress was rude and not courteous at all. We overlooked the unruliness because we wanted to eat. When we got our order and headed to have lunch in the park nearby, after getting there, we realize there was no soy sauce, or wasabi. Both are my favorite, I was irritated and so we went back to get both, and they were very reluctantly to give us any. We also noticed there wasn't any spoons, forks, ect. We requested and they said they charge extra. On top of all that, the food wasn''t good at all. This place sucks.
