Mikado is a gem restaurant in the 16th St/Potrero/Bryant area.  If you're shopping at the Safeway complex here across the street or 1-3 blocks away from the SPCA, there is no real restaurant(not including sandwich places/fast food places) WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE to eat fine restaurant food like at Mikado.  I was served with 4 to 5 star friendly professional service all 4 times I've come here.  All 4 times I came here, it was for lunch on a weekday.  I'm not experimental and don't eat things like sashimi.  I stick to sushi/tempura/teriyaki.  I also have never ordered for delivery from them - I actually go there to the restaurant.  The last time I went there, I came in with a friend after 12 noon on a weekday and there were only 2 or 3 tables being served.  It was as usual a very small, clean and quiet restaurant.
I still haven't received my order I ordered an hour an a half ago.

I don't know.  Maybe I caught them on an off day but this place went down quality and service wise.  We had lunch on 8/19/14 @ 1150a.  I use to order here alot and will definitely have to rethink  that.  First the service, 6 adults in our group and we asked for the booth.  the jerk-off waiter, old skinny guy with glasses when asked if we can sit in a booth he screamed, "NO".  Note we were only 3ft apart.  he squeezed us in 2 small tables that sits 2 to a table.  Threw the menus on the table. We ordered bento boxes, when he realized he fucked up he takes 3 of our tea cups and drinks and places them on 2 chairs besides our tables.
Decently priced lunch bentos, decent quality, fast service.
Have ordered and ate in at this place MANY times and will go back.

The food is great. I ate during happy hour and I had a large $4 Kirin and a handful of rolls for $3.50 each. The rolls are on the smaller side, but at less than $4 a piece, it's easy to just put in another order.

Horrible food taste old fish taste and bad customer service they didn't want to give me the California roll that  came when you spend $25 or more without me asking and they still got a attitude about giving it couldn't even eat All the food because I started feeling sick midway thru ... Will never eat here again ...

Ambiance was good, service was fast, and rolls were good.  Hidden away in an area with little parking around, but i think it's worth a try especially if you're in the neighborhood and want something low key!

I no longer recommend this place to anyone, they've consistently screwed up my to-go orders by misquoting a pick up time of 10 minutes when in reality it's always 20-25 minutes instead, this really screws up a lunch hour right? I even overlooked the two metal staples I once found in my teriyaki chicken because they seemed nice and I thought it would be an isolated incident. Well I didn't find anymore staples in my food but I've also never found forks or napkins either, and they've NEVER had my lunch ready when promised

Stumbled upon this place as the BF and I were walking back to the 16th St Mission Station for BART. I ordered the Chirashi and the bf got the Sushi Dinner. The prices were reasonable: under $15 and the food was not bad.

I ordered take-out - but placed order at the restaurant. Staff wasn't rude but definitely not friendly. We ordered a fair amount of food but I was shocked at the final price tag. Over $60 bucks - this place doesn't have much frill so I was hoping the food would speak for itself.

The spicy and garlic chicken is bomb. Super quick service, lots of seating, and their happy hour menu is awesome - although I haven't made it in for happy yet. Prices are standard. It's a great place if you wanna pop in for a quick bite to eat after the gym because it's right across the street and it's open a little later than a lot of other spots in the area.

Really disappointing! We are blow fish regulars, but for delivery, we have been ordering from this place repeatedly and this is our update on our 4 star rating. We were really impressed when we started ordering via grub hub or eat24 from them the past year and a half, noticing their attention to detail from preparation to packaging. The order we placed last time was delivered without any of the sauces, no tempura sauce, no sauce for the soft shell crab, which itself was more breaded that the tempura style they did in the past, not good. The tempura they use to deliver crisp was soggy this time, (this is the second time, in the order before this one that made us wonder, we got a badly butchered sashemi, but we thought, okay everyone has a bad day now and again, so we let it go at that). The noodle soup they use to deliver was packed with the broth separately to avoid the noodle from over cooking during delivery, this time it was mixed and the broth was sucked up in the noodle that there was almost no broth by the time we got it. The soup was  bland and worse than the packaged soup sold at wholefoods or trader joe's. The grilled fish was burnt, oh! terrible, and again, no sauce. Really horrible to go from such great reputation to such a bad rating in about 6 months. We called them to ask if they were new owners, they declined to state and said, we may have ordered from somewhere else, after locating our order in their list of deliveries. 1 star for offering to have the driver return with sauces. The whole order could not be saved by a second delivery of just sauces. Even the packaging materials that mimicked Japanese sushi tray for rolls and sashemi have been replaced with Chinese delivery plastic containers. Even supermarkets package sushi in proper containers. Definitely different from before this change. Too bad we did like them when they were good, we ordered from them at least every month or twice a month. It had been a while since our last order and gave them a chance to make up for the last not so great products that showed distinct difference from what we were used to from this place, but this last one confirmed that it could not be the same business owner(s) and cook(s) that could have such drastic and negative difference. San Francisco has so many sushi restaurants, will not be ordering from this place again.
Worst customer service in town and the fish isnt fresh. Though it is a good way to lose weight by getting a bad stomach flu. Not sure to complain or thank them after getting sick for days.

The food was ok but couldn't help noticing how rude the hostess/waitress acted. Made faces for every adjustment to my order I made.  Sf is way to competitive on the food industry to pick this place again to eat.  Bye mikado sushi!!
I've been here 2 times. One with friends and the other for a random lunch stop.
Hubert Tang gave me a delicious and filling BLAST IN THE MOUTH!

This place is the worst sushi in town. I got bones in my sake sashimi, BONES. in all my years of eating sushi, i've never had bones. when i complained about bones the female sushi chef said that it happens sometimes and thats just how it is. I was appalled, I demanded a new sake sashimi and I demanded not to pay for it, they gave me a new order, but made me pay for both. I vowed to never come back. So i go back, horrible service waiting to sit, FILTHY TABLES, in fact FILTHY EVERYTHING. straight up sticky shit all over everything, yea, its one of those sushi places where they never really clean. i ordered an orange juice, and, they gave me a glass of that really cheap brownish orange juice that is just expired as all hell. the kind you get at a gas station or corner liquor store. lets see what else, oh, they only had the low sodium soy sauce at my table, when i asked for the other one they looked at me like im crazy, the problem with this place is that it is family run by a lazy dirty family with general all around low standards, i've been giving this place a chance about once a year for the past 7 or 8 years and it still hasnt performed, i dont think it ever will.

Their staff is absolutely horrible. The receptionist who answers their phone literally hangs up on your face without saying bye and cuts you off mid-sentence. When I asked to speak with their manager, she just lied to me saying that he/ she is not available and won't be there till midnight, so guess who answers the phone the next time I call? The manager! Which I thought was bullshit because she did not seem to give a damn when I wanted to talk to her about how I was not even allowed to place an order since she kept hanging up mid-sentence. They are a bunch of un-educated jackass, so I will never recommend eating somewhere where you'd get the worst service.
The food is a bit mediocre but it's reasonably priced and fast.
I have had definitely mixed experiences with Mikado. Let's start with the positives:

This is a great place if you want quality fresh sashimi. I came right when Happy Hour just open for my lunch break. It is really nice and cozy. The happy hour menu was not much but a few did caught my eye.
Stay away from the chirashi.  Sashimi are razor thin and it wasn't all fish.  There were egg pieces in there that takes away from the real estate that would be fish.  Not a great value.

Don't go for the service. Go for the food. If you want good service, go somewhere else that is more expensive. Had sashimi and nigiri. I was really expecting a lot worse based on the star rating but fish tasted fresh.

Like they previously  said... I truly believe they do an excellent job with their food.. I particularly like the "bento box with two items" .. I've been eating at this place for 15 years and I never never never never had any problems with my dishes...

Major props for the staff being friendly and willing to serve 8 people 30 minutes before closing on a Friday night and not having any attitude about it, with attentive service overall, although surprisingly we had to actually ask for the check at the end!  (I would have thought they were itching to kick us out, since it was way past their closing time by the time we finished)

There's better sushi places in SF. The place seems pretty clean (as opposed to Jade Cafe, the Chinese place next door, which is or used to be owned by the same people as Mikado). There's a couple of suggestions I'd like to give Mikado's management:
2 words--Mikado delivery!!! Always fresh amazing sushi delivered right to my door. They are fast and bring quality. I have also dined in their location and experienced just as good of service.
We go here for lunch often since our office is close by. I always get the bento box and am never disappointed. The udon is really great too, especially for the price!
I had the hamachi sashimi dinner and it was super fresh. Reasonable prices too.

This place gets a kinda bad rap, in my opinion. The fish is actually pretty high quality if you know what to order. Admittedly, the rolls are just OK, but if you're eating rolls you don't know jack about sushi anyway!

This place was the perfect spot to get a snack after unloading our Uhaul down the street. On a Thursday before 6 it was very quiet and we were one of two tables being waited on. The appetizers were great, I especially liked the V salad and the fish liver (I believe it's ankimo). The flavors were excellent and the atmosphere was perfectly serene.
We didn't have a chance to try the food. We made reservation and we waited another hour, there were two vacant tables, but we waited and waited.  At the end, we left to get food.
Good food and ambiance very casual

I find outside japan and vancouver, amazing Japanese food is difficult to find. At recommendations, finally visited this lone Japanese place in heart of mission filled with wonderful hole in the wall Mexican places..
Very nice....

Stupid! Stupid! Stupid!.  Small space with two waitresses and a single sushi chef.  My wife went inside to give her name, she told her 20 to 30 minutes.  My wife said, "OK"  I was parking, arrived and wait around 20 minutes.  My wife went back inside to ask the status.  I can see her in there for a long time.  I'm starving.  My wife comes out and tells me that we are not on the list. I ask what happened and she says when informed we were not on the list she said,  "Oh no, really, can you put us where we were?" The woman says, "No. How would I know where that is?"  When told this I think to myself, "Well, you only have 11 4 tops, and there are only 4 people on your list, it should not be that hard."  I went in and confronted the woman because my wife was upset.  I asked why she didn't put here where we should be.  She is completely incompetent or just rude to Chinese people and leaves us at the bottom because she can't draw a line on her notepad.  We wait another half hour and finally get seated to order the Sashimi Combination.  They deliver 7 pieces of sashimi.  Seriously, for $55.  It was mediocre.   Anyone that thinks this place is worth it, does not understand economics and I am more than willing to sell them some land in Florida.
Before coming here I read the reviews and wasn't quite sure what to expect. I really wanted to like this place . . . But I loved it instead!
Was a strange dining experience...felt awkward inside as the head manager made you feel a little uncomfortable. Food was good but way overpriced. 17 dollars for regular tasting ramen?!
This was the worst dining experience of my life - and I eat out 5 days a week!
My favorite sushi place in SF. Follow her rules and be polite and everything will be great!

This place is way over priced, which would be fine if they clearly marked their prices on the menu.  I ordered a special and it ended up being twice as much as I expected, which shouldn't happen.  The waitstaff is very unfriendly and completely unsympathetic.  Definitely do not recommend coming here, especially since the wait is incredibly long.
Tried to eat here on a Saturday evening as a party of two. We were quoted a 45 min wait time "if everyone returns"; there were 6 open seats (a 2 person table and a 4 person table).

Delicious food and great service - completely gluten free & vegan! Perfect amount of food; our server cautioned us from ordering too much and she was right! Happy tummy and wallets :) We got the vegan ramen with rice noodles & spicy green sushi! So pleased with both dishes - can't wait to come back!

Came here with the beau to get him some of the vegan ramen the other day.  I think that it was the perfect choice.  We came around 6 and they must've just opened because it wasn't too busy.  But within the next hour the place was full.  It's small to begin with, but I think there's only one cook in the back anyway.
Is Minako racist or a snob?

Great food. Really tasty. This is a family owned business. They're very particular about their business. You must follow some rules like the Soup Nazi and hadn't I have visited this place with a friend that knew the owners then I would have not behaved so well...
The spicy ramen is by far the best vegan ramen hands down.  Respect the rules and you will have a great dinner.  Don't go there is you're in a rush.  You have to take your time to enjoy everything!
16-November, 2013
The owner'a mom is the absolute best of the best. She pickles her own plums in different jars and some date back to 1964.

Hands down my favorite sushi in San Francisco.  It's one of those little gems that you come across occasionally.  It has somewhat of it's own cult following. You really can't go wrong with anything that you order...so order away.

The age- dofu and the special asparagus tempera roll w/ garlic eggplant will have my heart forever.  The vegetarian ramen bowl was a little peppery but had great depth of flavor. I can not wait to go back to try more!

For those of you wondering whether or not Minako is for you, consider... you are basically going to visit a woman who loves her mother's cooking so much, she decided to share it with you. There are rules, of course. For you are in her "house", where she is sharing darn good home cooking with you. If you are looking for polished white rice sushi with experimental flavors, well, that's not what this is about. But if you want the best homemade natto, spicy veggie ramen (on the specials board, not always available), brown rice shitake gobo maki... you must try! Be polite, and don't rush your evening... mama-san is doing all the cooking, after all. As others have mentioned, wait by the refrigerator to be acknowledged. You wouldn't interrupt friends talking amongst themselves, would you? With this perspective, you won't mind shelling out a bit extra to be part of Judy's family at dinner time. Those of us who are vegetarian dining with others that are not.. it is great to find a neighborhood restaurant that serves both well!

I've never been faced with such arrogant elitist attitude from restaurant staff as I did here. My girlfriend and I came into a place that was full except for 1 table. I realize there are a couple signs stating to NOT seat yourselves and go to other end of restaurant to submit name to be seated. There was no wait, there was nobody to be seated but us. One table available, yet they chose to ignore us without a single look if acknowledgment because we didn't do their rule of walking to the other end where your standing next to someone's table crowding them and in the way of the serving station/kitchen. My girlfriend said, "excuse me, may we sit here?" And the gentleman simply points at another sign stating, "wait here to be seated", without a word.

I finally got to try Minako!  I'm always a little leery of places that don't take reservations as I don't want to go there all hungry and then have to wait around for an hour all grumpy and starved.  We went in not knowing what to expect as we saw empty tables and thought we could sit down right away.  We were told to 'stand by the refrigerator' while they figured things out.  Ok...we had a 20 minute wait so ok we'll go walk around, they took our cell phone # down and would call us when our table was ready.

My mother is Japanese. Aside from the tasty udon broth, this restaurant offers over priced Japanese fare in a horribly stuffy (poor ventilation) environment. About on par with the average Japanese home cooked meal. There is nothing superlative about the food. I really hate restaurant owners that try to take advantage of being small and "authentic" and charging prices on par with restaurants with actual professional kitchens.

I wouldn't describe the service here as bad. Bad service to me is unnecessary rudeness, incompetence, laziness etc. Minako is not that, it just seems to operate on an intentionally slower pace. It definitely feels homier as a result which is great if that's something you appreciate. If you like me get anxious when you see scenarios that could use better efficiency, more pipelining, you might not want to go here. If you get "hangry" you should probably come before you get "hangry".

It's been awhile since I have last visited Minako Organic but I always have a great experience here.  Too bad it usually a last minute thing when I go, but if you call in advance, they can make you homemade ramen/udon/soba!  Making fresh noodles is truly an art and for someone that loves noodles as much as I do, call in advance!  I've heard raved reviews about it and I cannot wait to try it.

There seem to be two camps here on Yelp about Minako: the overwhelming majority of four- and five-star reviews who love the place, and a small minority of whiny one-star reviews who don't get it and never will.

Food here is okay, some of them pretty good. But it's not worth the prices. More importantly, their service is just terrible. The woman in charge treats her hispster regulars in a friendly manner, but we were there for the first time, and considered non-existent much of the time. In Japan, I used to frequent a place with terrible service, because the food was worth it and also there was something fun about getting scolded by the owner/chef, who had a whole philosophy and rules around his food. This is not like that -- just rude for the sake of being rude, some kind of power trip. No thanks!
I LOVE THIS place.
This is my go-to sushi place! Their veggie options (almond crusted tofu-- noooooom) are fabulous. I love the Reyes roll but I actually go straight to the nigiri.
Delicious, super friendly hostess, super kitchy background music. I ate the best tofu/vegetables gyoza and the maki was very good.
I think these five star reviews are a bit misleading. Minako isn't bad, but it's not the most amazing place either.

This is one of my favorite restaurants.  I like to come here with my boyfriend.  They always remember us which is astounding, since I don't go there super often and they must have tons of customers.  My boyfriend is "that guy who always tries to pay with Amex".  I've never had much of a wait to be seated, and often get hooked up with free snacks if the food is taking a little longer than normal.  It feels more like going to your friend's house for dinner than a restaurant, which I guess sounds maybe not good but obviously I like it. Lots of attention to detail, very personalized service, awesome food.  I like looking at the doodles in the back of the menu and the cute magnets on the specials board.

This place was a little too quirky for us.  The hostess is a bit controlling and awkward.  We were initially attracted to it because of something we read about it having a lot of gluten-free options.  The menu was a three-ring binder of assorted pages and somewhat confusing.  (The table that sat down just after us did not get a menu, so we shared one of ours with them.  We were reprimanded by the hostess for doing so, because she said that things needed to be timed properly and we were causing a problem by giving a menu too early to the adjacent guests.)  I can't remember all the items we ordered, but the food was just okay.  The prices were a bit high.  The Mission location is fun, but it felt a bit foreboding at night.  Parking was extremely difficult on a weeknight in Sep 2013.
Food was great. Service was personal and informative. Recommended!

If this is your first visit, let me take you by the hand and guide you through one of the best sushi dinners of your life. First off, this is Judy's restaurant and you have to follow Judy's rules. Prepare to be ignored if you can't follow simple written instructions.

This is a unique, family run restaurant, the likes of which you don't see anymore in SF.  And more importantly, the food is exquisite and delicious.   The specials change every day, based on what is in season.   Anything I have ever ordered is delicious.  Minako is one of those restaurants where you see something on the menu that you've never really heard of, try it, and it becomes your new favorite thing.  Last night I tried mushroom tempura with curry spice and it was divine!
I'm really torn about Minako. So many things were great, but at the same time, there were some serious shortcomings.

While planning a recent trip to San Francisco my wife and I did some reading about gluten free restaurants in SF and this one caught our eye. We are both fans of sushi but ever since she discovered that she's gluten intolerant we've had to limit our choices to avoid wheat.
3.5 stars for food - extra small portions, unique and homemade (pickles), mostly quite tasty, very vegan/veggie friendly (fry veggies separately from meat)

One of the silliest sushi experiences ever. The service staff was friendly and teased us about or orders. They also constantly were adjusting the plates on our tables so that they were neat. It was actually really nice to have attentive service from a sushi place, I feel like I am often ignored if I don't sit at the bar.

This is a small, family run sushi spot that offers great personalized service and options other than the regular boring items you'll see at stereotyped sushi joints.  We had a host of daily specials to choose from--everything's made fresh--and a tasty bowl of ramen too.  I'll be coming back for sure.

This is actually a very neat establishment and they play "hip" music. It throws me off, but it's cool. Perfect location (right outside of bart) and the staff are very fast. I should't even give my money to MCD'S but sometimes, I just have to.

This is the cleanest and neatest McDonalds I've ever been in. It's actually a McCafe. It's renovated and has plush seating. The menu is clean and new TV screens. There is a meeting with older gentlemen here at a long table; coffee and newspapers in hand. Large seating and multiple places for handicap/wheelchairs. Beautiful environment. Fresh food. Fast and friendly service. Nuggets and fries are fresh and there are healthy options for Happy Meals.
I am addicted to junk food, but is this a dog friendly place? I always see people brining in dogs and they sit with them at table.
Hopefully everyone knows what McDonalds is like by now. Food isn't that great, but I just am addicted to those salty and greasy fries no matter what. To this day there is no fry I like better.

Nothin is on the $1 menu besides cheeseburgers & hamburgers. This place got a facelift due to the shifting demographics involving socio-economical classes. It's more chic & less frumpy yet it's worth it.

Lucky it got one star! (That is minimum here on Yelp).  It happened for FOURTH time now!  I ventured out to break my record of never eating at McDiarrhoea (my new deserving name for McDonalds) as I had three prior bad experiences with this corporate food, BTW all in California, firstly when I was only 17 with my sister in San Bernardino, and twice right here in SF.  All three times I wound up with acute moderate to severe gastroenteritis!
Disgusting. Stay away unless u want food poisoning.  Bathroom didn't have soap, urinal was overflowing urine all over the floor. The manager totally dismissed me when I told him.
For the entertainment alone this place gets five stars.

Ok ok...what? a 4 Star review of a McDonalds you say? And located in the Mission you say? Now This place used to be a complete shithole...maybe a 1/4 star above the one down on 16th and mission or crack-head heaven. But, with the recent renovation I have to say...it looks nice in there. I ordered my breakfast to go...it all came quickly and hot as f*ck. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is for the new renovations, the hotness of my munchies, and the timely fashion of delivering said munchies to me. But in all honesty...The food will kill you ;-). Heyo GMO
breakfast ends 10:30?

I was at this McDonalds a little bit ago when I noticed the restaurant manager  on the phone talking to SFPD dispatch when three juveniles were drug dealing inside the restaurant and a green Toyota 4-Runner parked outside the  restaurant and they also were drug dealing since the remodeling of the restaurant management but step up illegal activity inside and outside the restaurant since then. My experience there was ok I guess with cashier or cashiers need to speak up more better and stop mumble so much I don't understand rubbish I understand English my Big Mac was tasty my French fries were fresh so I'm happy for now.
This spot has been renovated and looks swanky.
Has Egg McMuffin been priced up? I had 1 Egg McMuffin with 1 small Orange Juice for $8.03. It's so ridiculous such a small order beating lunch or even dinner price at  many other places.. amazing.
MacDonald's is a good fall back for their breakfast and coffee, not much else.
This mcdonalds rules
Lots of homeless and crack heads... and I'm only saying that because I watched a homeless lady smoke crack right outside their front door.

Today Me and my lil brother came up in here and ordered a 20-PC nugget meal and stupid Asian woman who was the cashier can't hear for sh*t what I told her she charged my ass extras stuff which it wasn't necessary and she charge me for extra fries which should be included with meal WTF!!! I ain't coming back here again. I they fuck up the orders and don't apologized for the delay in the order. This place is a joke and staff is stupid group of people, who need more training in restaurant management. Fuck this McDonalds
Review #1248. The fries were hot crisp and good with a coke on a sunny warm day in the Mission that feels more like Los Angeles
Seriously, the worst McDonald's I've been too.
Gayle and I, plus the Kid took BART into The City to see her Nephew and take him to Dinner. As a bonus, we also have the opportunity to see his shared flat and explore the neighbourhood a little bit.
This review is only of the food and service, not the decor or location.

Guaranteed diarrhea from the food, as with every other McDonald's, but this one has colorful crackheads just lingering and stinking up the place. But it has one of the few public restrooms in the entire Mission.

What to say about this McDonalds? As the stereotypical obese kid, I had to give it a try. Just came from El Farolito across the street, which was not as good as mentioned. Went to get a drink, and a shake. Walking in, it feels like any other Mickey D's out there, but a LOT of "sketchy" people around. I went inside to use the restroom, and was confronted by a lady I swear was on something... Following that was the line. Wasn't too bad, went through pretty fast. Reaching the register, I ordered a large HI-C orange drink and a vanilla shake. The drink as like any other place, but the shake was horrible. I guess I expected a lot coming from Torrance, CA where there are decent people cooking decent pre-cooked food. So i sat down, and got the drinks. As stated before, the milkshake was mediocre, tasting of too much vanilla and syrup. By the time I got home, it separated which looked nasty. I went to get a flat lid for the McCafe (I'm weird like that) so I could ensure safe travel of my milkshake via Bart. I waited and waited at the front expecting someone to answer my request for my lid. I asked someone, who said they "couldn't". Once the line finally died down twice, I went up to the lady, irritated with my experience, and ended up not getting one because they "didn't have one"... however, I saw the manager get a lid for someone else. Yeah, not going back. Bad area, mediocre food. Ayeeeee -__-
I'd like to start off by saying that I love McDonalds just as much as the next semi-obese American.
McDonald's is McDonald's... Unless you are in the Mission on a Sunday morning!!!
It's a McDonald's.  What do you expect?
not too bad for the filthy mission district
I couldn't believe I was at a McDonald's when I wasn't on some kind of road trip or starving while there isn't anything better to eat.
its nice to be back ;-)

I've been several times last year and this year. Two spring semesters in a roll, I've had a class at the nearby CCSF Mission Campus and that's why I come in here for a quick lunch before class starts. I also come in here upon getting off BART at the 24th Street Station. The services here are actually very good so it is worth making the pit stop here for a quick grub.

good place to hang out and chat with homeless folks.  i'm not joking.  they're actually pretty interesting if you get to know them.  they're people too.  as for food, it's like every other mcdonalds (impeccable).

Mickey D's. You know I love you. Despite all of the "fat is bad" fad stuff and the anti-McDonalds propaganda going around, I've stayed a loyal customer. But I seem to have a weird experience in this place every time I go (gone around 5 times).
Definitely the most interesting McDonald's ever for people watching.
I went to this McDonald's for a Big Mac with no nasty throw-up sauce and no pickles, What they did was give me this throw-up sauce, Ohh my gallbadder hurts. And they to take ESL classes seriously.
Okay, I know I know, what am I thinking, right?

I miss going to this McDonalds because it was on the block where I used to live. The only parts I did not like is sometimes long lines, pan handling crack head addicts. Wish there was better security there. No peace to eat in or wait in line taking out what you are paying with. Sometimes using credit/debit card machine does not work. I do not like carrying cash because of what, pan handlers asking for money. I hope by the time I get back to visit. Should  be more restricted.
I came here for a break. McDonald's, you know the place that always brings you a smile ever since your days of young.
I bought an orange juice so I could use the (surprisingly clean) restroom.  There was a used pregnancy test in the wastebasket on the floor of the stall.
That art on the outside is so dazzling and eye popping and eye catching, who CAN resist crazy corporation sneaky marketing schemes?!

When Matt was in High-school, he must've been out of his mind and would hang around with the wrong crowd and neighborhood, in the outcome he would end up being barely getting hurt or being handcuffed by the authorities. (Knock on wood). One of his hangouts back then was the dangerous 24th streets and this McDonald was one of the places that we would engage into gang and possible criminal-activity.
Good breakfast, really good prices and convenient location.
This is a super old school diner, with oversized black leather booths and a bar to sit at. The food is good and reasonably priced, and the service is friendly and efficient. No complaints here.

My Girlfriend, son and I loooove Jim's! They're food is great! Not only is their food good but they treat you like family when you're there. My 2 year old son is a super picky eater but at Jim's he eats everything because it's that good.
Keep in mind "greasy spoon".... But if you need delicate dining where your food looks like a van Gogh and everything comes with a side of air, go to a five star brunchery.

Has a real down home vibe to it and has had one since I've been a kid and even before that according to the mission OGs. Mornings and lunches here have treated me well throughout the years. It really takes you back to a simpler time. Sure beats the hell outta Boogaloos. Jim pimp slaps Boogaloos.

I had such high hopes for this place because I LOVE retro diners. In terms of ambiance, this place fits that mold perfectly. The diner-style counters, the old booths, being able to see into the kitchen... love it. The service was also great-- very attentive and very nice. Sadly, the food just wasn't up to snuff. I am no snob when it comes to diner food, but they really let me down.

Jims is disgusting. I thought this was really good until i came. The menus are stained this place needs a real update. I ordered a cheeseburger. The lettuce was  basically left out to rot. It had brown edges stating it wasn't even fresh. My friend ordered orange juice and she told the waiter it tasted weird. The waiter replied "I'm sorry but we just made it. I was disappointed since a regular restaurant would get a new cup of juice but she didn't . Never coming back after this experience. If there was a zero star i would give it that
Love this place!
Service here is a real treat. Nice folks!

One staff member took the day off because she was sick, sat next to me at the counter, and talked loudly to the chef about her symptoms. Another staff member eating on the job asked a co- worker if the green salsa was still good, she said she thought it was and asked that I hand her the green salsa I just used. My corned beef hash was clearly spam (gross) and the toast was stale.
The soup of the day is homemade/housemade and delicious.   Get that instead of a salad.
OK place to have a meal

Best place on earth! The meal proportions are huge! Their milkshakes are the most amazing thing ever, the food all in all is incredible. Great place to have a birthday breakfast or a get together. The staff is very nice, friendly faces. Though sometimes you do have to wait for a table, its worth the wait.
My prior review wasn't wrong, but it missed the big draw of Jim's that's kept me coming back for...oh god 50+ checkins. That's the staff.
Wait staff was very nice, tables clean and the food was ready fast, portion size was pretty big.

I been here few times; I usually like to get their breakfast platter with scrabble eggs, wheat toast and sausage the favor its "good" but its fair for the price $5.99. I have try their turkey club sandwich which comes with fries and a very small soup cup, which it also taste "good"

I've walked past this place a hundred times and always wonder about it.  Well wonder no more. Once you step inside it feels like you step back in time. Sat at the counter with a friend and within a few minutes we were greeted with a gracious female waiter that make us feel welcome. We were served coffee immediately. My friend ordered the Denver omelet and I the scrambled eggs with diced ham. Both plates were scrumptious and the hash brown were done to perfection. We both left our plates clean. Coffee was good but it could be a little bit stronger, but that is me. This review is only for their breakfast, but I want to come back and try their other lunch or dinner plates. Close at  3pm, dinner plates is part of their regular hours too.
Let me preface this critique by stating that I'm not the biggest fan of diners and hole-n-the wall's!
food is pretty standard. booth chairs are pretty worn and uncomfortable. bathroom is pretty small and shady.

Every time I walk in this place I feel like I'm in a Quentin Tarrantino movie, except with much more hospitality, not to mention the best homemade green salsa in a sawed-off squeeze bottle on the planet.

I love that this place has a homey feel to it. I feel like I'm sitting in my grandmother's dining room &all these latin people are my cousins. It's cute. Anyway, this is a nice place to grab a cheap breakfast at 2PM. The environment is very relaxed &the workers are very friendly. Definitely a great Sunday morning spot.
Had a great vegetarian eggs Benedict!

Kinda decent breakfast greasy spoon diner food. Just the type of food I love. Might find better tasting ingredients elsewhere but it wasn't really that bad. Just not outstanding. Might go back one day
Fast. Friendly. Freaking awesome!
I went here with my roommate for Saturday "brunch."

I've been curious about this place for ages since I'm hardly ever in the Mission when this place is open. I've passed by it many times, but they close at 3:30PM every day even though they sell Dinner Specials. Who eats Baby Beef Liver with Grilled Onions? Night watchmen just off their graveyard shift? Insomniac prostitutes after a slow night? Bulimic hipsters on a binge? I was just looking for some breakfast last Saturday after taking the car out to go to the post office. I'm amazed at the paucity of options in my immediate neighborhood, so I found myself in the Mission and got giddily excited to find a parking space at 20th and Mission.

Jim's is a perfect place to cure a hangover! The portions are generous and help soak up wine and gin martinis.... plus 20 mins. in. when you realize you spent  $$$ the night before, you wont feel bad at all b/c :  A.  You're drinking apple juice, and B. pancakes are coming! In conclusion, everything I've tried here has been great! I typically get the CBH and it comes out perfect--crispy and incredibly unhealthy every time. If you're a waffle person get here before noon, as they stop serving them after then. Lastly, dont forget to ask for the green salsa.
A damn fine diner.

So funny thing about this review is that I actually work at Jim's on the weekends only. But Im usually there the rest of the week eating breakfast as a customer. The food at Jims is good old fashion American dining. For people that are leaving the bad comments, I really cant understand it, Service is always friendly and the coffee refills are never ending. Its just a diner, not some fancy restaurant. So if your in the Mission and want some good  breakfast go to Jims. And dont forget to try the homemade green salsa!!!

Food was good. Service was bad. 1st lady that talked to us gave me wrong information about the menu. Other lady employee ridiculously loud and obnoxious. They dropped the bill in the middle of my meal and then a man started mopping the floor with BLEACH while I was still eating. I couldnt even taste my food yet and started getting dizzy. I paid my bill and left. Pricing was cool. I only go to this place once in a while,I think there needs to be some sense of order in this "restaurant." .......P.S. i work in a restaurant.
A-OK is right on.
Reasonable pricing.

Um okay not the cute kitschy experience I was hoping for but here's how my story goes. I dropped in for a late lunch at about 2:30ish on a Wednesday afternoon, I was alone but had high hopes because of all the intrigue of reviews on yelp. I notice their lunch special listed on in the window, Chicken Teriyaki, I know this is not a Japanese noodle house but my instinct just wanted to give this 'ole diner a try. There was only one other patron in here she looked like she had a decent dine, so why shouldn't I?
June 15 Breakfast

This is a classic diner spot in the Mission. The vintage booths and counter create a homey atmosphere which is perhaps the best part of the experience. The food itself is nothing elaborate but definitely solid and tasty american brunch. The food was a good value given the low prices and hefty portions.
Jim's is my family all time favorite family spot! I have been taking my kids here since they were born.  I used to live around the corner so I run into old neighbors a big plus.
Best portions for a great price. Love the eggs benedict with their green salsa. Always leave with a clean plate.

For a neighborhood greasy-spoon place, it's good. No fancy stuff here, but good and good portion sizes: good-sized pancakes and 4 (!) strips of bacon with their Country Breakfast. As another reviewer noted, the chicken-fried steak is also pretty good.

Jim's is your classic diner. And by classic I mean no frills great basics at a great price. The staff is the friendliest you will find. The clientele are pretty much the the people in th neighborhood. We roll into Jim's on a pretty regular schedule. And I have to add it is tough to even find a tuna melt on a menu anymore and the have it covered. Be sure to ask for the homemade salsa to top your eggs.

EXCELLENT service, actually GOOD coffee, and they serve your breakfast with a bowl of jalepenos and the most mouth watering, amazing, garlicky, homemade green salsa.  Like the review on the cash register says: You won't find any brioche french toast or fru fru cocktails, but you will get your basics served up HOT and fast.  Definitely coming back.

It still amazes me how poor Taquerias are in SF and how easy it is to make this California version of Mexican food. Where to start?  The wait, horrific on most days and only because they have NO idea how to run a restaurant, they need to go to the Google and search  "Henry Ford". No he is not a burrito expert but he did pioneer the assembly line, something these folks must not know exists. Imagine if you went to a  restaurant and the waiter took your order, bussed your table and went back and cooked your it in addition to serving you, well that is how it is done here. I have been here when they have 10 employees behind the counter and can't serve 3 people in 10 minutes. If they did a traditional (logical and efficient) service they could serve a min of 5X the people in the same time conservatively. You regulars know what I mean, it's almost entertaining to watch them run around bumping into each other, at least if you have time to kill. To give you an idea of how bad it can be, I have called in an order when in line and then waled to pick up and got my food faster. Little tip there.
Pretty big, pretty authentic Mexican cuisine.

The food from here was the bomb until I don't know I guess they change the cooks not sure but it got nasty... my mom and I keep on getting sick every time we order a burrito de carne . They either hire me so I can cook the meat we'll or I'm just not going to pass by .
Cool place, kind of reminded me of an island.
Rushed service. Ceviche was sad and dry. The cashier never looked up when she charged us. waaa waa waa

When every other taqueria has a line the size of a railroad, you can try La Corneta. This has a nice interior. It has enough space. It has a classic menu for Mexican food. Had a veggie burrito, soft shrimp taco, and strawberry juice. I would go here again and recommend this for a nice Mexican food experience on Mission.
Being extremely familiar with the glen park location, Mel and I decided to come here since El Farolito didn't accept cards.

I have been going here since it opened in 1997. I today I ordered the crane asada plate. The meat was dry and over-cooked. The pico de gallo salsa was all green tomatoes. Not good. My salad had 4 salad cores and stem bottoms in it.  I gave them to the owner and he just threw them away. I won't be eating here any longer.
This is NOT a great spot, in an area where there is a glut of great Mexican food. The only reason to go here is because the line won't be too long. And because they have a bar.

This place has the best steak and prawn burrito, hands down. When you're looking to get away from El Farolito's tiny restaurant and the huge line, head down Mission to La Corneta to sit down and enjoy that burrito.

I love the super prawn burrito. I always thought that seafood tasted terrible when mixed with rice and beans but this taqueria showed me that I  was  wrong. This restaurant and el farolito are the best places to get Mexican food in the outter mission.
Fast, friendly and tons of options!
The burritos here are tasty and filling. They're what burritos should be, but nothing more than that. I'm reserving my 5th star for more wow factor, but this is a solid place to duck in for lunch.
I've had tacos, quesadilla, seafood bowl, nachos, agua fresca.
Fish taco! with black beans, fresh and delicious

This is a great spot in an area where there is a glut of great Mexican food. The food is solid, flavorful and yummy, and best of all, consistently so.  Whenever I leave, I always say to myself, I should go there more often. Always leaving satisfied is a good sign. Some other perks are the space and set-up. They have a quicker and more efficient ordering system than their usually more crowded local competitors. And the space; it's huge! You can really relax and not feel as cramped as you would at other places. I don't mind rubbing shoulders with folks for a good meal, but it is nice to relax at your own table and have your own space like you do at La Corneta. Space is key with a baby too.

Super Burritto with grilled chicken, xtra jalep's. Huge portions, super tasty, enough salt in food to last a year in your body. This is my favorite taco place in the city. Not as cheap as some places but you get twice the amount of food for a buck more.
Whenever I feel like having an amazing asada and shrimp burrito I stop by this place.

The best burrito ever!!! Jesus!! These guys know what they are doing !!! I felt I was in Mexico watching soccer game drinking my corona extra and eating supper burrito ... I should order one more to go so yummyya
Dude, so we were roaming down Mission looking for a place to watch the Falcons vs. Niners game and the owners waved us in to watch. Oh, they're good...
Baby Burrito while good size is way to mushy and lukewarm to be enjoyable.

Yelpers, you really screwed me on this one! I was craving Mexican, so we made a special trip over here on a Saturday, had to park 5 blocks away, walk by the disgusting urine infested Bart depot (made me gag before I even got there). We walked in and there was a line at the counter, but we must've looked the type who were going to sit down, so the waitress came up to us and asked (in Spanish) if we were going to "eat here" and she told us to sit down and she brought us a basked of chips and menus. The salsa with the chips was pico de gallo. There were also two bottle of salsa on the table. NONE of these salsas had any flavor. No lie. They lacked salt. I have a heart condition, so I'm not a big salt eater, so that should tell you something. I ended up ordering the baby burrito with chicken and mole because of all the rave reviews. She brought another salsa (making it 4 total different salsas). Again, no flavor. I had asked for no rice in the burrito (doesn't belong there!). But, they didn't put any cheese in it like the menu described. My husband got the super baby burrito with shrimp and his didn't have any cheese either. I don't usually eat burritos in Mexican restaurants, I think of them as Gringo food because I've traveled all over Mexico and actually lived part of the year in Jalisco, and they don't serve burritos unless it's in an American style restaurant. But, this food so lacked in flavor that I would be afraid to try the tacos. I also have to say although everyone speaks Spanish there, I don't think the operators of this Mexican restaurant are Mexican. They sound Central American and the food is more Central American style. If I want that, I would go down the street and have a pupusa or nacatamal. Central American food isn't typically as spicy as Mexican so I think my assumption is correct. I'm really surprised that it's so hard to find good Mexican in SF, but I'll keep trying.
Bigger than the Glen Park location.  Its good food, clean, & will fry you a hard shelled taco when asked. What more can you ask for?

I'm biased, I love this place from the very beginning, I remember working with the brothers on their Mission location many moons ago and attending its grand opening too. Its a neighborhood staple at glen park too.
Plenty of seating, great prices, tons of options, and delicious food.

Last time I was in San Francisco, I ended up in the Mission district and with a ridiculous craving for tacos - turns out we were in the right spot for that feeling because there were seriously so many places to turn to! Naturally, we opened up the Yelp app so we could crowd source our final decision and - voila - we would up at La Corneta Taqueria!

Pretty damn good. Rolled through here on a Sunday night after a long, tiring day at work. Decided to grab a carne asada "super baby burrito." For being a baby burrito, it was a pretty good size. Everything inside tasted fresh and delicious.
Whenever I come to SF, I always make sure I stop by one of those great Mexican taquerias, something we don't really find in France.

Best place on the mission. Clean good food and are willing to make off menu items. I had them make me a steak and shrimp fajitas super burrito that was amazing. Lines can be long sometimes but well worth the wait.
Good chips - thin and greasy.
The Super Baby Burrito with Carne Asada is by far the best burrito I've ever had. I love this place!
I am pretty damn impressed.

The place was good but I would say that it is in the average of the Taqueria in this city. Located in the mission, it probably uses employee that are newly arrived from Mexico since the two women at the counter didn't seem to understand much english at all. A good way to practice your spanish.
Delicious tacos, and an incredible value. I got a corn quesadilla, a salad, chips and salsa for $1.96. Highly recommend it. There was great live music while we were eating
If your in the "mish" aka "The Mission" I believe that this spot is the old reliable joint for seafood, prawns, carnitas, pollo asado you get the picture.
this place has the best carne asada  plate in mission area
We had La Corneta cater an office party today and it was a hit! The party was too but you probably don't care as much about that part.
The burrito I ordered was big, meaty, and juicy just the way I like it. And did I mention it's cheap?
For the following reasons this place has become my favorite place to eat in SF.

Love this restaurant.  There are lots of options for Mexican in the mission, but La Corneta is right at the top.  Tacos and burritos are both delicious here.  And they accept credit cards.  Check it out!

Nasty ass chicken wings, I made the mistake to come to this place a second time after my first bad experience a few months ago, but I decided to give it another try since it's close to home. Pizza was mediocre, chicken wings ,nasty as shit. They looked really badly cooked. Me and my cousin got a 10 piece buffalo to share and we only ate one each because they just looked nasty. Don't get these, and if you do... Tell them that you want them cooked thoroughly.
this place sucks shady dirty n never wear gloves not trust worthy clowns scum bags low life's don't trust the comments or mrpizzadude if your  sober not edible
What are you people expecting from a late night pizza joint ?  I am in Hunters Point and nobody here delivers, some pizza and Chinese places even close at 5 pm.

I'll preface this by saying the food is actually pretty good especially the spaghetti and ravioli dinners with garlic bread.  But I won't be going back there for one simple reason and it's the customer service.  The two guys who are usually the cooks are really good and actually get orders correct.  But the kind of tall guy with the glasses is a mess to begin he doesn't know the menu when it's right in front of him.  He's rude and wears his headphones while trying to take orders when he can't even take an order paying attention.

When my roommates and I moved into Potrero, we ordered pizza from all the nearby options - Mr. Pizza Man was hands down the best! I'm not giving 5 stars because of Delfina, Una Napoletana, etc. but if you just want cheesy goodness delivered to your door, Mr. Pizza Man is great! I recommend.

Been coming here since I was a kid.. they use to be really good but for some reason the pizza is doughy and has no flavor. Just ordered a extra large fiesta with no  ground beef but I did add pepperoni... so the pizza was pepperoni mushroom and onion. This was a good pie and the delivery was quick. They usually take 1 hour to delivery. I guess they werent busy. The wings suck here not recommended they taste like they were frozen and oven baked not fried. The calzones here are good you just have to tell rhem to cool it with the ricotta unless u like alot of it. If u order an extra large three topping pizza they give u a small cheese pizza for free thats a good perk. I give them  Three stars cause the hours they are open and  u can get a good pie at times. The prices are fair.

I really have no idea as to why I ate here.  Oh wait, because it is really close and it was open late.  Place seems like a hit or miss.  I actually went here twice thinking that the first time was just bad pizza.  Second time I went, I couldn't even finish my meal.

Great food, I love the pizza and I pick up food for my sister from them a few days a week. A couple days I was broke and picking up my sisters dinner. I was thinking about asking if they needed someone to fill the cooler and sweep up in exchange for a pizza. I couldn't ask lol, but i will be back when I get paid this week. They have a big menu that has many other options for people who may not like pizza. Burgers and pasta, calzones, cake and more.
My work orders from them on a weekly basis. Fine food...great calzone.  Service is reliable. I've been through shit with other places and would rather have reliable, good stuff. They do their job.

Sometimes you just need a slice. Is is the best pizza in town? No. But it'll do just fine. It's hot and if you order a slice they'll actually cook it in the oven for you fresh (ish) not jus reheat something that's been sitting on the countertop. That's the late night deal at least.

Unfortunately just found a strip of cardboard inside the pasta.  With Italian pastas being so common at restaurants, we can't take the health risk of ordering food here again.  I have to assume it was malicious...most likely from a jerkoff cook.
Always late!!!!!!!!!!
I was starting to be a regular and then today after I ordered and went there to pick up, I find out they gave my order to someone else.
I WISH I COULD DO NO STARS!!

Love this place. I used to live around the corner and went there all the time for pizza. I was sad when I moved further away, but happy to find out that they deliver to my door!! On a busy day the pizza can take up to an hour to arrive, negative. Positive, the pizza is great! Specially if you add pesto to it. I usually get the family deal which comes with a large pizza, wings(YUM!), and a liter of soda. I think its totally worth it!!
Yelp, sometimes I really do wish you'd let me give negative stars (sighs) because this place is so bad I feel misleading even giving them one star.

I love this Pizza Place! They just don't make pizza like this anymore. They have the right amount of cheese and the crust is just the perfect consistency. This is one of my favorite pizza joints in San Francisco.

Never ever ever ever go here! They over-charged me by 5 dollars and didn't think that I would notice AND he didn't even refund the money. He also lied over the phone and told me that the food was a lesser amount that the price in the store. They are liars and thieves, spend your money else where!

I live three blocks away and it takes them an hour and a half to deliver an undercooked pizza, at $25 a pizza, I'm surprised they're in business. Next time I'm going to round table.  Don't waste you money with this place, food is disgusting.
MR. PIZZA MAN IS THE BEST. They're open late, they're really great, and they satiate...my appetite!

Ordered a large mushroom and chicken pizza at like 3am. It didnt come super fast, but then again, it was a friday night and everyone probably had drunchies. The pizza was surprisingly gooood! It was super satisfying, lots of toppings, lots of cheese, and all around decent pizza for a small corner restaurant. It was $25 I believe.

I LOVE mr pizza man! Holy bajeesuz their pepperoni is the single best slice I've ever eaten. Maybe it's the way they bake a single slice at a time. It's something about that crust... or maybe the pepperoni.. it could even be the cheese... but good grief that pizza is GOOD.
If you're into plasticky cheese and rubber foam this is the place for you.

No idea why everyone's so down on this joint. Best wings, best delivery, nice people. The pizza is 'eh', but I've never had to wait more than 30 minutes. Several other pizza joints have let me down more than once. Thanks Mr Pizza Man(s).

This place blows. The pizza is mediocre, though cheap. They're always so cranky on the phone too. The last time I called the woman asked me if I wanted anything else, so I turned to my friends to confirm that's all they wanted. She got impatient and started yelling. I told her to just cancel my order. I don't do bitches.
Decent greasy pizza.
So last night I was starving after I got off the late shift from work. Being super tired and hungry i wanted something quick and easy, so since dejavu was closed I settled on Mr. Pizza man.

Nothing was open late at night for food in SoMA except for, yes, Mr. Pizza Man.  We ordered a large pizza and buffalo wings for delivery.  The pizza was soggy and the crust was tasteless.  The buffalo wings on the other hand were quite good and hearty.  The meal was pricey ($37).  They delivered on time.  It achieved its purpose, which was to coat our stomachs with grease to counter the affect of our late night romp though the Mission.  Order only if desperate.

WORST DELIVERY EVER! I have never been so upset at a delivery service. They were extremely late, and the food didn't even make up for the fact that they were late. Since when does a bacon burger mean a piece of rubbery meat in between a piece of sandwich bread? HORRIBLE! And the guy even ignored my instructions to knock on the downstairs flood instead of the upstairs floor so he probably woke up my upstairs neighbors.

No, no, no! Pizza should not be like this! I love pizza, and I'd would rather eat a pizza pocket that pizza from here.  I'm almost embarrassed to say that I've eaten here, but in my defense I was starving and it was convenient.  Something is off, maybe the sauce and crust.  On top of that, my stomach does not feel good afterwards...I try to stay downwind from everyone, if you catch my drift.
$2.79 for a cheese slice.  It was thin and not a lot of sauce which is my preference but the sauce itself tasted "canny" and the crust was below par.
Very good pizza and they deliver to Treasure Island which is awesome! Thanks Mr. Pizza Man.
I have no idea how this place manages to stay in business.
It took a really long time to arrive, it tasted better once doused with copious hot sauce, the wings were pretty good.  For very drunk 3am pizza it's fine but only as a last resort.
Good: Good Pizza and good friendly attitude.
It was like a scene from "Lady and the Tramp"...
One word: Hair!

This stuff is shit.  I had it delivered to SF General Hospital while on overnight call.  It took nearly an hour (it's 3 blocks away) and arrived cold, soggy, greasy and incompletely-cooked.  Looked and tasted worse than something out of the freezer.  Multiple times since this particular incident, other unknowing staff here have had Mr. Pizza Man and the results have been similar.

I found this place by accident. I was walking home from the gym one day and I was wondering what am I having for lunch. There used to be one much closer to my house then they changed businesses. Their lunch specials are well worth it. I get the slice with a soda combo. One of the best pizzas I've tasted in the city and for the area. I've been there about 3 times now and never had a 'greasy' slice. It was a good size for the money. Toppings are plentiful and fresh. Great place for lunch, sunny and quiet.
me and roommate ordered here once.  greasy but tasted ok.  it was the aftermath that killed us.  it tore up our stomachs and we cursed havin one bathroom.

Rose Food Mart may have been the bargain that got ignored cuz i was looking for the alcohol they didn't carry.  sammie priced 3.99, salads, 1.99, ignored it. too good to be true? sodas, teas semi-pricey?

Rose Food Market is a very well-stocked convenience store right across from SFGH at Potrero and 22nd St. The family who owns and operates the store are wonderful--friendly, helpful, on the ball. They have great coffee, a deli counter, and all the other things you want in a convenience store. They also carry quality olive oils and other products from the Middle East.

Nice store located across the street from San Francisco General Hospital. The person on duty today was very friendly. Good customer service so I'll definitely make another stop here for snacks when I am in this area.

This Place is so Awesome! serves the Best Sandwiches at all time staring from 6 am everyday from Monday til Friday! The People working there are so nice and treat you like how you should be treated. This corner store has little bit of everything! Rose Food Mart Has the best coffee for a good morning! P.S. If you ever need anything or have any problem you can talk to the person behind the counter!
Andy is such a great guy. He is very generous and accommodating whenever I come in. He's one of those guys who you'd want to run for some kind of council, because he is so honest and fair.

Seems like there is more spring in everyone's step today. Whether it's because of the impending holiday, the chance to rock cold weather gear, the long weekend, or a bit of everything, peeps seems happy.
Okay okay... so I said I was never going back, but I did.

For the past 3.5 years, Rose Food Mart has been our corner store - the place you run to when your sweet tooth acts up, when you are sick and needs some OTC meds and you are unable to make it to Walgreens, when you run out of milk in the middle of baking, etc.

my sister was in the hospital so i went over here to get me something to eat, hungry... pick up a roast beef sandwich, they made it from scratch and cut the beef from the brick... for some reason the guy doesn't look happy i dunno maybe he had a bad day or something.... paid and left... the sandwich wasn't bad at all i like it, cheap and good price... well it got the job done! your typical corner store with a fresh deli, now that's a plus...

I have lived in this neighborhood for about 7 years now and I always say that the first thing you should do when you get a new place is to make friends with the corner store.  Well, they treated me like a friend the very first time I walked in and I'm so glad that they have this location.  I'm glad they do not serve alcohol because of the problems that come with it.  I respect Andy the owner for that decision.  Sometimes these "corner" stores can be a bit shady and sketchy and he has gone out of his way to not let that happen.  You can get your basics, a sandwich, cigarettes, and lottery tickets and my staple, Orange Gatorade!!
Can you take away points because the store does not sell alcohol? I suppose that's not really fair. This little neighborhood gem sells your basic corner store fare.

So the first time I came here, I was a little nonplused by the fact that they sold Muni fast passes but that they didn't accept Commuter Check.  I soon came to learn that many San Francisco corner stores uphold this same arbitrary policy.  So I duly ignored the Rose Food Mart and bought (and still buy) my fast pass at the California Fruit Market on 24th Street.

Rose Food Mart is a gem of a convenience store.  The people who work here are wonderful and their (non-alcoholic) drink selection is massive enough to quench any thirst.  Surprise, surprise:  they actually have pretty decent coffee at a price that beats local coffeehouses.  I can't walk more than a couple of blocks before getting my AM caffeine rush, so this place is my savior for quick coffee on the run.  If only they carried alcohol and could solve the occasional evening pre-party emergencies as well.

I thank heaven for this place. I can pop out of work and be back with my tasty beverage in less than 10 minutes. After reading the first review, I kept an extra alert eye (and nose) to the store front, but I can confidently report that it is odor and filth free. Well, as much as you could expect any place in this location to be. Unless they are very well-hidden, I'm pretty sure that this corner liquor store is liquor free, which is great because it leaves room to diversify the rest of their drink selection. Pomegranate white tea Snapple? Diet Cherry Vanilla Coke? Fuze Rejuvenate/Energize/Slenderize/Pulverize/­Anesthetize/whateverwhatever etc etc? They've got it. Its light and bright, I don't feel skeevy entering, and it's always the same friendly young WOMAN working the counter. I have seen very few women working in liquor stores around here, let alone people my age. Her manner makes me feel like I'm at a cute coffee shop, not a snack store packed with soda and pringles. If you work in the area, or if you're visiting someone at the general, I highly recommend putting this on your list. P.S. I haven't tried it yet, and I'm not sure if I should, but they have baklava. For some reason, I feel that could be significant.
If you can manage to get in the door without fainting over the stench of urine and defecation, you may not want to stomach the fact they actually prepare food inside.

Love this place! Just had my birthday dinner there and could not had been any happier. The owners were extremely helpful and accommodating making sure everyone was having a great time. Not to mentioned the food was delicious , wish I are ate more but I was stuffed! I'll definitely be back! Thank you so much!!

Spent many nights at the main Puerto restaurant drinking those lighter fluid pitchers of margaritas, lots of broken dreams at that other location.  It's always packed over there, I've waited well of an hour to sit there, too many times.

Consider this place 4 stars if you go specifically for their fried tacos and their heavy pours on margaritas. Not that the margaritas were anything special. They were a strange Ghostbuster (slimer) green that later got me highly in-toxic-ated.

what can i say, i like this place.  it reminds me of this bar i used to go to in rosarita when i was in college.  now, don't get me wrong, i like fancy schmancy restaurants like the rest of you, but i can also get down and dirty at a local watering hole.  i love to go to a place where there's no attitude, you get a feel for the neighborhood, you could wear sweats if you want, and wash down the ick of the day w/ a pacifico and a taco.  everytime i go in there, the same nice older mexican lady with the geniune smile is there, takes my order at the bar over the loud music (ai yai yai yai), and brings it over to my table.  and i always have to remind her that i haven't paid - total honor system here...
i think the last review is talking about PA1 on Valencia. This one is mostly neighborhood folk and i've never seen it crowded.
Much to my surprise finding good vegan spots in SF is harder than I would have thought.
The food was a pleasing temperature. The End.
I love this place. They have a big menu. The food is fresh and they have lots of vegetables. Their green juices are great too.
This is my first time at this location, though I've been to the one in Berkeley.
Orders are constantly messed up and they won't change it.
I've eaten here once. The rice and beans were delicious.
This place was so over rated and gave my friend the worst stomach ache never get the veggie burger unless you want fire ass. The red curry was decent but not authentic at all

What's going on? The macaroni salad tastes terrible now (was told they use grape oil mayo now) and the potatoes are chewy and hard now (the last 3 times). A first resort spot is becoming almost a last. Please look into this. Thanks.

Take my review with a grain of salt, but Herbivore is pretty solid. I mean, I only had a bowl of kale soup to go, so it's not like I tried any of the dozens of dishes on the menu (good or bad as they may be).

Why does Yelp bury this as the #30 listing when searching for "Veggie restaurants" in the Mission? Oddly out of synch with the popularity (its always got a crowd no matter the time of day) and quality of dishes. Kale salad is addictive, the cheesesteak is my vegetarian daughters favorite go-to. And me - a meat eater - I hit it every week to the near point of conversion ...
I'm not a veggie and love this place. It's affordable friendly and always delicious   My wife says their chocolate cake (gluten-Free?) is amazing.

I live in a town with very few vegan option so needless to say this place was heaven. I think I ate more than I've ever eaten. We went for breakfast after the candlestick paul mccartney show around 10 am and I didn't eat again until 6 pm. Ridiculously good.  Definitely get the espresso shake and savory crepes!
Was excited to try the schwarma as it is a favorite of mine, the waitress said it was popular so I ordered it with beef and avocado, my date had a quesadilla.

Another disappointing all vegetarian place. Nothing stood out to me. We got the ravioli "with seasonal vegetables" which just meant spinach. The sauce tasted like it was from a jar, and the garlic bread had a weird taste to it.

This is in response to Jose J.'s review below.  I had the same waitress and she was terrific.  I remember the date because it was my birthday (8/20) and I came with my husband, baby, and parents to eat breakfast before our flight out of SFO.  Yes, she was slightly older and white, but I thought she was very cheerful, pleasant, helpful and all around had a good service attitude. I grew up in the restaurant industry - my parents having managed vegetarian restaurants in London and Detroit - and worked in restaurants myself so I know a good one when I see it.  (I may have even seen Jose J. sitting in the restaurant as there was only one guy in the whole place when we arrived at 10 am-ish, and he left soon after we got there.)

I honestly have so much love for Herbivore. I've been coming here since I was a 12 year old twerp attending Horace Mann Jr. High down the street. I'm 22 years old now and still very much in love with the food here. Not once have I ever had an unpleasant experience until now.

I was pleasantly surprised at the vegan fare offered by Herbivore, being an entrenched carnivore.  The hummus was the best I've had, and my grilled veggies quite tasty.  My dining companion thoroughly enjoyed the Red Curry.  When I want to give my animal protein eating a break (or celebrate Meatless Mondays with some zip), I will definitely return.

Wanted a healthy breakfast with my g- daughter and walked Valencia from 16th to here, open and we're hungry! 2 other diners here @ 9:45am. Greeting, seating & a menu for eating, such healthy selections. Who needs meat? Let's eat!
okay service and my fajitas were a bit bland.
Food was a bit disappointing but service was great.

After a weekend of getting our to go order wrong two days in a row, we won't be going back to this location.  The young man "working" behind the counter never even bothered to apologize each time he got our order wrong.  These weren't just minor mistakes, he completely missed half our order on both days.  The purpose of calling in an order ahead of time is to have it ready when you get there, not to to have to sit around and wait for them to make the items they forgot in the first place.
Super friendly and fast service, breakfast was great (have tried several menu items) and the fresh juice (got a green beet juice) was excellent.

Amazing food at great prices.  Makes me want to visit San Francisco again soon just to come here.  If you are a vegan or vegetarian visiting San Francisco put this on your list along w/ Millennium, Rainbow Grocery, and Greens.
Easily one of my favorite vegan places--and I LOVE vegan places.
love it!  my first vege restaurant experience in SF back in March! never had vege food that is sooooo  yummy!
We actually went to the Berkley location.  Service was excellent.  Quickly seated and very attentive  waitress always ready to get us anything we needed.

Sausage biscuit is awesome don't get the bacon, unless you like the texture of Scooby snacks ! Fresh squeezed orange juice was also delicious. We had a bit of a long wait/service  which is why I knocked the place down to a three star but overall nice neighborhood pretty good place.

I try my best to shy away from places with only 3 stars and I should have kept walking  but I do try to seek out great vegetarian restaurants and this place actually looked nice. I had the breakfast burrito and my other half had the papaya salad with a green drink of some sort. My meal was good exactly what I expected from a tofu based burrito. The papaya salad was a bit sour but still pretty good The problem with this place was with the server. She was just plain rude and not nice. I don't expect white glove treatment from this place but I also don't expect to watch my credit card where people are just walking by with no one looking out. When I asked for my credit card she just slammed it on my table and said you're welcome. Anyone can serve up great food and not all can do great service and this place did not. Maybe people in the mission don't expect much in terms of service but if I am going to give my hard earned money to any place I would like it if they at least appreciated it.
I've been going to Herbivore in Berkeley since it opened and have been to this location about a dozen times.
Pancakes!

My go to restaurant for Vegan dinner.  It's always great to go to a restaurant where I can eat everything on the menu.  So I keep coming back to Herbivore.  The one on Valencia is the best one-- I like the atmosphere in the Mission more than Divisadero and Berkeley.  I usually order the Fajitas with chicken strips or the Kale salad.

This is one of my favorite restaurants! I love this location and the one on Diviz. The servers are really helpful, and if you are unsure of the menu I would definitely recommend asking them questions. They will be up-front about what menu items are best. The menu is a bit expansive, but there are a few standouts for me -
Love the ramen noodles, quinoa salads, and chicken fried rice! Cheap and they are generous with veggies.
I have been hesitant to go here after seeing such mixed reviews but decided to give it a shot for something different from my fav veg-friendly restaurants in the mission. I got four dishes:

I'd never been to a 100 percent vegan restaurant so I was intrigued at what Herbivore had to offer. First thing I had was the Cesar chicken salad and it was probably the best thing I had for the night, the "chicken" that they offer is flavorful and it complimented the salad well. Then I had the mac and cheese which turned out to be a disappointment... The flavor seemed salty and it looked more like a soup than anything else, I was expecting less of a liquid but that's what I got, the cheese was not gooey and sticky or crisp. Point is to avoid the mac and cheese if you can. I do have to say that the service was good, the guy serving us water every 5 minutes was awesome and the layout of the restaurant is comfy.
The best all-vegan restaurant in town in terms of both food and affordability. I tried their pizza and it was awesome.
Oh man I really really wanted to like this place and was hoping to have a healthy flavorful lunch and dinner spot mear my house but boy was I disappointed.

We strolled by and came here for lunch. My husband ordered the papaya salad and I got the pad thai.  There were only about 8-10 other tables in the restaurant and the service was horrendously slow.  Just when we were about to give up and leave our food came.  My pad thai looked like alfredo - since when does pad thai have cream sauce?? The papaya salad tasted like it was sitting marinated in the fridge for days and was losing its crunch.

Love, love, love! Becoming a recent vegetarian its been hard to find the dishes I love. This place is winning! Its my go-to for lunch in the mission! I love the seitan schwarma wrap. Love the potatoes but wish I could order w/o rosemary. The chow mein will turn a carnivore any day! Would have given 5,stars but the customer service isn't great. Lunch hours that is.

Had a delicious meal here last night.  I'm an omnivore, but am trying to practice meatless once a week at least.  Ordered the chow mein and I inhaled it! SO good.  Ingredients were incredibly fresh and it was served hot (despite takeout).  Last time I tried tofu was when I mistakenly picked it up at a salad bar thinking it was chicken.  Not a fan.  The "chicken" here actually tasted like chicken AND had the texture of chicken.  Major gains.  Can't say enough about how yummy this meal was.  I will be back!

We ate here on Sunday after church. Sat ourselves. Muisc, tables and decor were decent for a whole in the wall restaurant. Waitress/Hostess was fast and attentive throughout the meal. Three of us shared The Tipico Yucateco (I think it was called) a combo of tamale, salbutes,tostadas, empanadas and cositos. We also had an order of fried plantains with black beans. Everything was good a well priced. We are from Yucatán and recently were there for 3 weeks last December. Needless to say we know authentic food and good food from Yucatan and this was. The parking on the street may be a bit challenging with a busy mission neighborhood but the food was worth it.

This is the best yucateco restaurant in the Mission and possibly in the city, food is really fresh and taty and service fast, just like it should always be. Severs are really nice and quick. Place is clean (even the restroom) and music.... authentic
If I could give them a 3.5/5 I would. This was my first time at Castillito Yucateco and my first time dining at an exclusively Yucatan cuisine restaurant.
