I've been coming for years! Over 8 years and a review is due. I've always been satisfied b with their sushi options, and bento box options. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area, and looking to satisfy that sushi/bento box craving!
This place is AITE for what it is.
Good food and good service. One of our go to places in the area. Usually pretty quiet in there. I always get the combinations with the tempura and a roll or two. I have Never been dissapointed here.

Beware.  Their website does not say they close at 3pm.  I arrived at 2:59pm and my friend told me we had order quickly.  As soon as I sat down the waitress asked me for my order.  I asked her to give me one minute and she was not pleased.
We were in a rush, but what I ate was fabulous.  I cannot wait to try them out again.
Came here with a coworker to make a big lunch order. We used to come here at least 2-3x a month with fairly large orders. Pitty to write this review because the food is decent.

This is a place I occasionally come for the bento box with teriyaki wings and tempura.  The teriyaki wings is not on the printed menu but it's posted on the wall.  It's a little on the sweet side but overall (at least to me) enjoyable.  They give a pretty nice side salad to come along with it.
They wouldn't let me look at the menu at 2:55pm because they said they were closed. Their hours show they close at 3pm. Can't give a good rating if I can't try the food...
Good service, decent tempura, and amazing sushi. But the portions are too small for me.
They have a decent selection of rolls but not the greatest tuna by far. I was cheated out of a shrimp tempura today, my plate shoulda had 3 but only gave me 2.

Been here a few times mainly late evening but today I thought I'd try it out for lunch....wrong idea. Service at noon is no bueno . .. gals are pleasant but not attentive. We waited a while to order. I'd still come back for dinner. Maybe not for lunch.
This is my go-to Japanese food spot, been going here for years. Their food is so yummy.
My family love this restaurant and it's been our go to family dinner spot for over 10 years.

I've noticed this place doesn't get the love it deserves. The chicken teriyaki is hands down, the best teriyaki chicken I've ever had. The rice they use on the nigiri is so sweet and flavorful. Jay is great. The kitchen staff is great. Overall, I luv teriyaki & sushi.
Baseball roll - fried california roll with salmon and a crap ton of mayo on top.

Good spot for sushi! They have an expansive menu for rolls. I ordered the Dragon roll, 2 California rolls and a Salmon Tteriyaki box. The California rolls were tasty, not the best I've had but good. My friends Mom, who is almost 90, tore up the entire Dragon roll to my surprise!!!! She loved it...I didn't tell her what Unagi was (why ruin a good thing right)...lol. Now the Salmon Teriyaki had no teriyaki! So...it was really bland as was the salad they put in this box.
I love this place, and the food is great

I was here last week and was debating if I should write a review or not.  I was just not satisfy with their quality of food. I was there with my husband on a Thursday evening, almost 7pm.  I was debating on the regular bento which was $15.95 but I saw that for $4 more I get vegetables and the option of CA roll.
yum i LUV this place. they have one of the biggest selection of special rolls that i have ever seen. just reading the menu line by line my eyes would start watering.

Bento box with a combo of Teriyaki beef & Chicken was in generous portion with rice. Good aroma and charred broiled taste of both items was satisfactory.  I didn't like the very small sides with the bento. There were only 2 bite of lettuce salad and the same of the  bean sprout side, I also added a California roll which was standard. A OK place to go if you want a bit  of change in the area in Soma.
I had the chicken teriyaki.  It was pretty good. The food came quick. It was a lot of food.
Average sushi and bento boxes, I've had better chicken teriyaki at the local mall. Service is fast and friendly
I think this place has changed names (but same owner).  It now goes by Nama.  It is still really good, and now I'm hoping I can get their spicy crab crunch roll in the East Bay.

As a sushi lover I must say that I was disappointed. Ordered a salmon and unagi nigiri as a starter, it was less than impressive. My boyfriend ordered the hamachi kama with tempura and I ordered the Korean chirashi bowl. The kama was overcooked and not fresh, she brought orders in separately without informing us and the chirashi bowl was awful, very little fish, used imitation masago, and no sesame leaf. The waitress didn't check on us once, except to pick up the bill. I am never returning. Lunch ended up to be $50, that can buy a wonderful experience at blowfish sushi. Be warned, this place is no good!
I'm never disappointed when I come here. The portions are huge. My only complaint is that service can be slow when they're not busy.

This is my favorite sushi place in the area because the food is good and AFFORDABLE! My favorite roll to get here is the deep fried Cali. That alone is enough to make me happy for lunch and is priced under $6. My all time favorite though is their beef teriyaki. It taste like beef bulgogi that I used to eat all the time when I was younger. The nostalgic feeling, great prices and delicious taste of the food is enough reason for me to give them 5 stars!
Being that this place is so convienant to me, I've been coming here occasionally for a little sushi during my lunch hour.
Don't go for Sushi...stay away.....no sushi no....

Came here a couple of days ago with my boyfriend for some sushi after going to the UPS to drop off some packages. I ordered the Croquette (Deep Fried Mashed potato cake) and a Deep Fried California Roll. My boyfriend ordered a Bento Box. I'm giving this place 3 stars because I believe that they should change their deep fryer's oil because I can actually taste old oil through my deep fried foods; the tea they were serving was quite bland and watered down; and my boyfriend's Bento box was suppose to come with a soup, but he never received one. Other then that the place was clean except the bathrooms. The food was decent, and looked fresh. I do have to give them props on their rice, it was quite perfect, not too hard and not too soft (mushy).

Came here for dinner last night after getting froyo at Nubi. The special rolls menu is one of the most extensive I have ever seen on a menu. My friend and I walked in and was seated immediately. I was happy to see that we were not the only customers as 5 or so other parties were also patrons.

I work in the area and finally decided try out this establishment since I do love teriyaki beef boxes. I recommend going for lunch time which they serve until 3pm because the prices are less, yet the servings are large. The beef was cooked nice and tender in a perfect teriyaki marinating. The rice and salad served with it compliments the the meat and noodles. I was not expecting a sit-down type of establishment but was quite satisfied with everything. I would definitely recommend this location to anyone looking for a nice, and tasty Japanese meal ^.^
Great sushi but kinda expensive.  My Giant and I can easily spend $50 for lunch there.

After reading the lastest yelp on this place, I was worried that this place gone down the hill so of course, I felt compelled to go and try it again.  All I can say is to whom it said this place was a hole in a wall place, she is soooooo wrong.  Don't get me wrong.  This place is no 5-star restaurant but it is no hole in the wall place either.  It's just a place to go to eat great tasting food for less $.  I ordered their dragon roll and rainbow roll again.  It is consistently fresh and great tasting.

NOT pleased with the service or quality of food!! The waiter recommended the lion king and it taste like mayonnaise sauce and the rice started falling apart. It had a horrible after taste. I told the Manager and instead of him offering another dish. He said "no one put a GUN to to your head and forced you to order it, so you should pay for it!!" I told him I wasn't pleased with the dish. He said this is NOT a fast food restaurant and should pay for half. Of course, I'm not!! I guess that's what you get when you go to a hole in the wall sushi place. Never again!!!!
Fast and ok lunch deals.   Their teriyaki boxes are much better than their sushi, esp the spicy pork teriyaki.

Really really surprised to know that this small place exists. If you enter on the top where PetCo is you'll have to head towards ToGos, then head down the stairs, then walk along the car garage wall until you see an entrance.
This is a bit like fast food sushi. I went there because it was open for lunch on Saturday afternoon, and I probably won't go back. Service was decent, but sushi was just below average.
I love all their rolls here and their combinations boxes are so worth the price!!!

This place is the best. the teriyaki chicken is so YUMMY!!!! it has the best flavor i have had. I have not been able to find a place that tops this one. i dont eat seafood but my husband does and he loves there sushi here...i crave for there tempura you all have to try this place you will not be disappointed . the service is great they are always quick. i promise you can not find better.

I usually end up going to this place on any given Friday. The staff is very friendly. I don't know how to use chop sticks so one of the sushi chefs fixed a pair so I could use them. I love love love the Jason and Crunch rolls!!!
Best place to get a good portioned Chinese food in the area. Not the best tasting but also not very expensive.

4 stars for effort, carving out a niche in the no man's land of 13th/duboce/mission. They are in the big red building at 13th and mission, across form levende/woodward's gardens, on the 3rd floor. My company just moved here, so i had try the place. They are basically a Chinese counter with burgers, noodles, breakfast, and yeah,corned beef sandwich. It's cheap, the corned beef is $3.00.1 item combo plate - plenty of food,$4.50. There's a nice atrium to sit in, you can see it from the on ramp to 101. If you're looking for a quick easy cheap breakfast/lunch in the extreme inner mission, come up to the 3rd floor!

LOVE this place! Can't get enough. The food is delicious, the drinks are even better. Has a great atmosphere. Sort of have a tradition of watching Giants World Series here, and what better place to be at? The staff is all super friendly and attentive. I love that their drinks are reasonably priced and they are consistent with flavors. Great place to come and unwind after a long work week.

I love cava, the service could use some maintenance though.  Their slow and take a while to get to you. But other then that I have always had a great time especially when the mariachi is playing.  Food is decent drinks are great. we usually just have appetizers (oysters are delicious) definitely will continue to go for drinks and oysters.

What can I say about Cava 22? Only thing that really stands out in my mind is the festive and positive atmosphere! Great staff, great decor, great drinks, and great vibes from their clientele. It was definitely busy the night I went but unlike many other bars, everyone was polite about trying to get through the thickness of the crowd and one of the owners (young guy) actually took very good care of my group while we were there. He probably noticed we were new faces and wanted to make us feel welcomed. If you're in the mission, or in the city for that matter, slide through to Cava 22! Wont regret it!

I love this place... I usually come here for drinks after work. It's a great place to watch your sports. The crowd is a mixed variety. The bartenders and servers are always attentive and friendly. The margaritas are to die for. Ask for the raspberry margarita that's  my favorite but they also have a lot of flavors..

So it's been a couple of years since my initial review back in 2011... And guess what people? I love this place still! Lol... Their food is delicious and their menu tends to change throughout the seasons, although, some of their originals plates are still there and always on point! The shrimp ceviche tostada is BOMB!! Their chicken bonita plate, the cheese, spinach and mushroom stuffed quesadilla and tacos are some of my favorite. They also have $2 taco, Tuesdays and wings Wednesdays. Cava 22 is a definite trust try when in SF or for all the locals as well. I have had lots of great memories here and have made some good friends as well.

LOVE Cava 22. Don Amado, Jose or Omar at the bar are amazing! Im a Latino that lives in The Mission and this is my and my lady's spot all the time.  Not only do they have great Food but also a great pour on their drinks. And their people on the floor (Thalia, Cori or Angie) really take care of you. They have karaoke on Thursdays and Saturdays and On Friday's they have mariachi. Great spot!!!
I love it it's near from my house  this time I must try  the food  last time I just had chips and salsa  drinks  but nice place I love it.

Came in here on an early Friday night and there was no wait which was great.Loved the fact that they serve free chips and salsa!Who doesn't???!!!Lol.Service was okay.It was a little slow.Food seemed decent.We just had the super nachos so I can't say anything for the rest of the menu. We ordered the blue agave tequila pitcher and you can tell they are pretty generous with the alcohol mixed in it.So, the drinks are strong. They had a live mariachi band so it was really loud.I felt like I was constantly shouting over just to keep a conversation with my girls.Prices seemed fair to me considering we had three full pitchers of the drink we ordered and with the nachos.The bill also included 20% tip for our party which was nice and it all came out to $100!Overall,I may come back here but definitely when there isn't a mariachi band playing!

I went here again after not being in three years, just to give it another try. I was disappointed. The wait staff was probably slower than before and the noise was nearly unbearable but hey, it's a bar, too - what can I expect. But it was so loud it was difficult to talk. The food has not improved at all and seems to have gotten a little worse. My food was barely warm and non-descript. Meh. Would I got back? If I wanted to have a tequila party, maybe - and then only to drink with friends. I didn't find it inviting or even really welcoming - that was perhaps the noise. I really wish it could have been different but there it is.

Star-great place with some good job and friendly staffs are craving to satisfy and must make you happy as their great service. Chicken is fine and closing kind of highly justice as at the well verified place.

First time to this place was 12/13/11 and since then this has been my #1 spot to pre-game before the night at the club or just come to SF for some great tequila. For me, the service is always spot on and and the food has been none less than delicious along with the great variety of music that could range from Latin music to main stream Hip-Hop. Simply put, I love this place!
This is the best place in this area it is also my favorite place and I go there regular.
It's been a little over a year since i stopped going there. It used to be a good place with all the atmosphere.

After having such a horrible experience here with security, I decided to give it another try during a slow day. It went great, although I still do not think this place is great for full meals, I do love their new selection of bar food. It's delicious and fair priced. I have forgiven them for the way they treated me and I am happy to say I have not seen nor heard of such events happening again (nor have I seen that poor excuse of a security guard).

Was here on a Friday night to kill time so this review is just for ambiance and drinks. Location is prime and the restaurant it self was pretty large. Right when we walk in we were greeted by a mariachi band blasting throughout the place. The music was nice but boy was it loud and it didn't stop. This is the type of place that when you talk, you yell. lol.

The margaritas are tasty and the bartenders are the sweetest. A traditional Mexican restaurant with great ambiance. The crowd always depends on the time but even with a large crowd it's great fun. This is my usual sports bar or just come for a quick drink/meal. They have taco Tuesdays, and karaoke nights Thursday. At times there is also mariachi that comes I. And although I'm not a fan of the music they are greatly talented. I never pass this place down.

Great place for taco tuesdays! You really can't beat $1 tacos all night long. The margaritas are also spectacular - strong and tasty just like I like them. The wait staff is friendly and the tacos are delish! I definitely like the carnitas the best. The chicken is a close second and the carne asada is a bit bland for my liking. But for $1 I honestly would eat anything.
Good food, good drinks, fair prices, good atmosphere.
Cleanist silverware I've ever seen!!  Also fish tacos are excellent. EVERYONE must go here when in the Mission.
This rating is only for drinks.
Mariachi and tequila! I'm going back, Mariachi plays from 9pm - 10 pm on F-S-Su, their agave tequila is smooth and even for a non margarita drinker I found it delicious!
This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants/bars in the city.
Sorry Ass Security Thinking They Somebody Wait Til Your Shift Over....They Really Let Things Go To There Head And Can Be RUDE....
Please see my Nobel Prize winning theorem in the field of Quantum Restaurant Mechanics applied onto Cava 22, with direct mention of the Skirt steak, ribs, and chicken wangs:
bleh, a very dive like bar, very crowded, stinky, and dark. we came, and we left.

Cava 22 is the typical restaurant that make you feel like you are in Mexico. They have really good tacos and Mexican food, but the really yummy stuff at this place are their margaritas. Watermelon and pineapple margaritas are my favorites.

Came in around 5pm on a Thursday night for drinks and dinner with some friends and family. I was a little disappointed because it was really empty when we first walked in but it picked up later on once the live mariachi started playing have mixed emotions about the food and drinks because some days the food is awesome and other days it a little bland , same thing with the margaritas some days they are good other days they are just plain NASTY and watered down. I'm giving Cava 3 stars because it is a pretty chill spot it just needs a little more life, music and people during happy hour 4-11pm..
wow, much better food! i dont know what they did in the kitchen, but everything was fresh, on time and really good! way to step it up c22!
A'ight bar, but can be a bit hood sometimes. I don't think people come here for the food.
I don't come here to eat....chips and salsa are enough. Drinks are good...can't complain. It's definitely a "starter" for a night full of shenanigans! :D
This review is based on the bar and the restaurant.
Bartenders are the best.. But waittess very very rude.. Food fantistic only thing I would not trust oysters ..overall nice place for late night security are a lot better than the ones before

REALLY LOUD MARIACHI MUSIC. definitely should have read the reviews before coming here. Big Portions of their salsa chips and gauc. Their buffalo wings are pretty good. Honestly though the loud music will make it so hard to hear your friends it's an experience all in itself.

Food was ok.. but they made a mistake when I booked my reservation for 15 people... No mariachis until after 9 and our reservation was at 7 so it was pretty boring since they put us in a room all by ourselves! We asked if we could move to the main room since they screwed up on my reservation... They said no!!!Bad service!! It was a very unpleasant 30th birthday here!!! Will never come back!

This is a review of Cava 22 as a bar, not as a restaurant.  Based on the reviews I am reading here, I don't think I would ever come for food.  We stopped in, first time, prior to dinner down the street.  As a tequila lover, I am always looking for another place to wet my whistle.

Came here during the week for dinner and the place was empty, literally only the three of us , and even though there was nobody else there, the service was so slow.... Margaritas are okay, I have had better ones somewhere else, just around the corner.. Ehemm.. The food is alright, nothing special that I would have to come back or crave for.  The taquerias all around the area serve WAY BETTER AUTHENTIC MEXICAN FOOD than here.  I am giving this place 2 stars for the fun decor.

I love this place! I've been going for at least 3 years with my husband and some of his friends! Everytime I get the seafood stew along with 1 of their tostada de ceviche and sometimes the wings! Yes I like their food:) ..yumm!! The happy hour is very nice! $4 margaritas...Love it:)

Haven't actually taken time to 'eat, drink and be merry' here - so many restaurants, so little time..but will stop by just to say hi to Amado. No way to count the number of times over the decades that he has helped me get soused and stumbling. LA RONDALLA is gonna re-open soon, hope he comes home.
This place has great margaritas! Happy hour $4 margs. There food is fresh and different than most Mexican restaurants you'll find!
I came here once for the amazing happy hour margarita special (my one true love) but am afraid to come back because I may or may not have skipped out on the bill. But let me explain:

I love mom&pop coffee shops! This place is the epitome of family-owned businesses. Something about genuine friendliness really makes an ordinary cup of coffee that much more enjoyable. It's a very humble storefront, but it's the kindness of the owners that makes all the difference. I've only ever ordered coffee and haven't tried the sandwiches, but the coffee is good. I've ordered a latte and a mocha...I have to say, much better than corporate Starbucks and the like.
The family that runs/owns the cafe is incredibly kind. Interacting with these cheerful people while getting a cup of coffee is a great way to start the day.

I puttered over to this little coffee shop with my three-person writing group one recent Sunday afternoon for some drinks and a space to write collaboratively. I really (as in, really, really) enjoyed my iced almond milk latte. My friend's salad looked pretty amazeballs too.

The space was great.  Various tables, free wi-fi, outlets, great outdoor area.  Coffee was good, pretty pricey but standard.  The staff on the other hand was not friendly or welcoming.. in fact, the customers were more helpful than the staff.
Holy shit. Best chai I've ever had.

I'm not normally a coffee drinker but I was here at the behest of a friend who was raving about their coffee so I decided to order my old favorite - a flat white. Now, Americans aren't really familiar with them but my barista knew what it was - though for some reason served it in an espresso glass instead of a coffee cup. But hey, it tasted pretty darn good, considering. I got a blueberry muffin which was fantastic!

Love this little spot in the Mission. I searched for a good study spot near my work, and sure enough I've found my go to cafe! I went around 3pm on a Wednesday, not crowded at all, which I really enjoy. Feel good music whether you choose to sit inside or outside. Ordered a really delicious $4 iced coffee, and did my homework in their back patio where they beautifully set up some old restaurant booths and tables. I love that this cafe is quiet, yet cool in atmosphere. They have plenty of plugs for your electronic needs. Small menu, but the quality makes up for it. Overall, this is just an awesome place to head to in the mission if you're looking to get some work done, or if you just feel like chillin' in the back with a nice cup of joe, away from the city noise and ruckus. Thumbs up!
Solid spot. Except the black leather chairs near the entrance are awkwardly shaped--do I put my elbows on the "arm rest" and ending looking like a scare crow with a back problem.
This is a great spot for coffee!  The coffee is good, the service is friendly and quick, and the ambiance is warm and welcoming.

The inside is nice and great for doing work if you manage to get one of the tables. There aren't a whole lot. Some spaces have outlets, so seek those out. The high table does not have outlets. The wifi is reliable and free. The back patio is kind of dirty, not sure why there are big cushy pleather sofas because they get dirty easily and could use a wipedown. They serve coffee via individual pourover and french press. I liked their cold brew a lot. They use De La Paz beans. Good music and service. Pet friendly.
Stanza Coffee carries de la paz coffee as well as other beans. store length room for comfort, patio in the back too. relaxing atmosphere.

Awesome atmosphere, good service, and good coffee. I had a soy latte to go. It was yummy. It's also a good place to work for a bit or catch up with friends. I shouldn't tell you this, but when four barrel has 30+ people in line, Stanza is an excellent alternative (or my first choice.) The espresso is milder, closer to blue bottle than four barrel. I prefer my espresso less potent and more smooth, so this place wins in my eyes!

Great ambiance and friendly baristas. The space and design feels intimate even though it has tall ceilings. I loved the front door, grey walls and cool art.  The chai latte was delicious. I will come back and sit outside on a warmer day.
Stanza just oozes hipsterness from the moment you walk in. Plenty of vintage decor and huge cold drip towers that make it "IG worthy," haha.

This place is awesome - no frills fantastic coffee. Great varied selection of beans (last I went, Coava from Portland, and a roaster from Denver). Very fast wifi for free. Ample Seating. Totally unpretentious vibe.
Delicious pourover coffees and great seating. Awesome for getting some work done. If you want something a little stronger and cheaper than a pourover, try a french press coffee.
Pretty chill coffee shop in the busiest corner of Valencia.
Super friendly baristas. Great coffee, free wifi, outdoor front covered patio, bike friendly.  Need I say more..

Solid cafe with two cool Taiwanese cold drip machines. The place is small and was packed, including their small patio. The guy working didnt seem too enthused but still got my iced coffee right quick. If it werent stuffed id definitely hang outside if the weather was nice. Intellingentsia coffee is a bonus
This place is cool.
Wonderfully unpretentious and yet niche coffee shop. The folks who work here are truly enthusiastic about unique coffees and love to share without being condescending about it.

This place is pretentious hipster coffee shop as many  around. However, the quality of my dripped coffee was disappointing. The coffee came out so bitter that I could not finish it. They also run out of cream and said, well you have to drink as it is. Not coming back.

I prefer Four barrel since it is on my way to bart, but the line is always crazy long in the mornings. Stanza, on the other hand, only a half a block out of the way, has NO line in the mornings, which is awesome! Unfortunately, their lattes aren't as tasty and the service is slower since it's 1 man taking your order and making your drink. I ordered a pastry as well and ended up giving it to a homeless girl.
A nice cafe near bart. My home office is quieter but it's more fun to meet around fresh coffee so I meet clients here sometimes.
Cool little coffee shop with very nice ambiance. Nice place to hang out.

The coffee is pretty good but plan on bringing some noise cancelling headphones if you dont want to compliment your coffee experience with explicit rap music. It seems at least a particular barista doesn't care about what sort of music comes out of the speakers. My ideal coffee shop experience probably doesn't involve feeling the bass from the music either.
I like the atmosphere and the coffee.
Great find.  Pour over coffee and press coffee selections.  Pastries and snacks, including one of the best chocolate chip cookies I have had in a long time.

It started pouring and I needed shelter and something warm so I popped in here for a tea. When I asked what teas they carried the girl pointed at a sign and seemed bothered to speak, which was actually kind of funny. Anyway the tea was good, can't go wrong with a green tea but not for $4.

I love the design, layout and general ambience of this adorable coffee shop. It is very clean and a marked difference from the street outside. The staff are friendly and efficient. The pastries are amazing and I highly recommend the chocolate chip sea salt cookie! Coffee is good and prices on par with everyone else. Defiantly a spot to go for a coffee if you find yourself in this area.
Great coffee. Very comparable to Ritual, Sight Glass and Four Barrel. The ambiance is more cozy for sure with the booths.

These guys are great. Their coffee is delicious, with some specialties such as long-pull espresso, pour-overs, French presses, and smooth espressos for the discerning coffee drinker. Their prices are in-line with area coffee shops but the quality is better in my opinion. $3.5 for a cappuccino as of this writing, $4 for a fancy pour-over. Additional bonus points for having a friendly and chill attitude, which isn't as common in some of the other artisanal cafés.

Stanza is a great place to go when you want decent coffee and have work to get done, but don't want to deal with crowds of hipsters flooding the more popular coffee shops (i.e Ritual, Four barrel, etc). Stanza is in a quaint little spot and has a lot of seating. I like this location more than the Haight St. location, but I've found that my cappuccinos have been a little too acidic for my liking. Will I return? Probably out of convenience but I can't say that it's up to par with its fellow Mission roasteries.
nice filter pour.  i'd go back
This past Saturday, after a bowl of Ramen from a joint up the street, me and my companion decided we really wanted a cup of coffee. It just felt like the thing to do.
3.5 STARS.

Coffee's totally A-OK, the vibe is awesome, but the service leaves me wanting a little more. It's been 50/50 with me-  great, friendly service with awesome recommendations on some occasions, and smug, too-good-to-acknowledge you super-hipsters the rest. Maybe I'm just catching the grumpy ones too early in the morning, but come on, crack a smile.

I feel kind of bad for cheating on my more local-er (ie, less than 2 blocks away) coffee shop, but I've been to Stanza twice now for a soy mocha and Oh. My. God. Just beautiful. I'm not sure I've ever had a more perfectly foamed espresso drink. Like sipping velvet. My more local-er place is lucky that I have to walk half a mile to Stanza; otherwise I'd probably be going here more often. Love the cute back patio area too!

The lighting is indeed cozy, but that was about it for me--pretentious expensive $4 cup of tea (and I'll pay good money for a good pot of tea), awkward bar stools and a too-tall counter, rave music that made me want to pull my hair out, and otherwise the place was completely silent--no one talking, everyone staring at a computer or book. Not for me.
Went there yesterday...here is what happened...

Stanza has great teas, heavenly pastries by Mr. Holmes SF and outstanding customer service. The cardamom scone is perfection...and if ya' get there near closing you might even get a special treat. Great neighborhood spot with down-home folks!
Nice place. Just around the corner our home. Some time there are too many annoying hipsters but most of the time it is pleasant. They have a very good coffee and pastries.

The food is definitely better than Las Tinajas but the place is so tiny it brings the rating down a bit...however the food makes-up for where the space lacks.  I agree that the food tastes like home made cooking and I recommend the following:
the family who runs this place is super friendly
Mission Creek has coffee, so it has that going for it. I mean sometimes you just need a cup of coffee, and they do have that here.
Cute little shop with good coffee (not great) but they get the extra star for having gluten free cookies. Saved my day having something quick I could grab and eat on my way to a yoga training.
This cafe is great for studying or work. If there was ever a place I'd recommend my friends to go and ACTUALLY get work done it would be this one.
This place is bad. It's super cramped and crowded and filled with bums. There's no wifi and the food and coffee are only OK. Don't come here. Go to Four Barrel or Ritual.
Great place to study solo or meet up with someone, laid back, plenty of seating, solid wi-fi, full coffee shop menu with food. It's a little divey but that keeps it quiet and accessible. My go to.
garbage on floor ,bugs behind counter,extremely rude servers,a man named Mr Lee was picking his nose and making food...much better places right in area with clean food

Great place to get work done! Chill, private cubbies, free wifi and QUIET! Most of all, I love the seating arrangements. Really great to see so many options for one or two people instead of these shared seating, which lends people the opportunity to converse. This is a place to get work done, plain and simple.

Fast internet, ample seating, quiet, calm spot with good bagel sandwiches, salads and great coffee. Definitely more friendly to the worker than Ritual which seems more like a social hub with no outlets and lots of standing space only. It's a little dirty, the cushions on the seats are clearly many years old, the bathroom was clean but very worn down. But, I sort of like a good old fashioned big open coffee shop. I'd work here often, I like it.

Everything is very okay and basic. The best part is the fact that there are couches and lounge chairs. Wouldn't go out of my way to recommend or go again, I've only been twice because I work across the street.

This is a great place to study, with plenty of seating and private tables. But holy hell, the prices are outrageous. A pretty substandard 16oz smoothie was almost $6. A small cup of drip coffee is $2.25 plus tax. The bathroom is pretty gnarly and the service isn't that good.

Mainly I'm writing this review because of the service. The cafe itself is good - roomy, has electrical outlets and nice tables, relatively quiet, etc. But the lady who works here!  I just don't understand the point of being so rude.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon. Was a fantastic place to do some work on my computer - the wifi is fast, there are lots of comfortable places to sit (with lots of variations including sofas, chairs, booths, small tables, large tables). There is lots of space and there are lots of outlets. The smoothies and sandwiches are really yummy!! Very pleased.

Seems to be a nice place to work but unfriendly staff ! This young lady sends too much bad vibes, she is aggressive and cold and this is not pleasant. She should leave her place for someone that really wants to work there ! Too bad.
bathroom lock has been unrepaired for over 2 years now but best wifi in the city, quiet, unobtrusive music, clean smart people hang out here, 5 stars for productivity

a nice, quiet place to work. awkwardly unfriendly owners and similarly uncomfortable staff (generally, though there is some turnover). nice staff doesn't last. food is generally inexpensive and pretty good as far as cafe food goes.was once haggled over being a nickel short even though i had left a tip in the jar for my previous order. i wouldn't bother with this place if it wasn't a great place to get work done. would prefer to support friendly, community-minded folks.

Mission Creek seemed like for a nice place to study, and I've recently taken a home schooled student here twice a week for quiet and motivation (he gets a kick out of the fact that he's studying just like college student).
The place is filthy. Bugs in the food. Avoid.
Nobody is here and if I were to guess it would be because the lady behind the counter is so unfriendly I almost don't think she likes her job one bit.

Really friendly waiter, brusque but excellent cook.  My BLT was an A- (just the sandwich but it was gooood) and the coffee was great.  I love the tall ceilings, plenty of varied seating (booths, comfy chairs, table chairs) and varied selection.  This place seems like a high quality mom and pop cafe and I can't over emphasize the joy of truly friendly service, just don't let the lack of hip polish throw you off.  Most relaxed brunch location I've been to yet.
Don't come here. All that talk about sanitary conditions and the bathroom lock being broken and crying to your mother about the gnats is true.

It was a cute place, full but not too crowded, which was nice, and it looked like there were plenty of small tables with plenty of power outlets for people to work quietly. I stopped here for a drink after walking around the mission with some friends so maybe it just wasn't the place for that, but they did have some games (we took out trivial pursuit) to enjoy.
five (5) stars ambiance- a cute little cafe you can read a book, surf the internet or just hang with a friend.  No frills just a comfortable clean place to put your feet up in.

We came to dine at Dosa across the street but there was a wait and it was chilly so we were really fortunate to find this coffee shop to hang out for 45 minutes while we waited for our table. It's practical but does not have much personality. There are tables and booths, a counter to purchase your beverage, a sugar table and a dirty bathroom that doesn't lock. If you're just looking for coffee and wifi, this may be simple enough for you. But there are time limits on booths and minimum purchase requirements to use internet. There is also a minimum transaction for credit cards.
Gotta try the breakfast sandwich. Had the egg, cheese, and ham. Thing was MASSIVE!  Never have I had such a large and delicious breakfast sandwich.

I worked here for an hour. It was totally bizarre. The owner doesn't speak English and the kitchen is filthy. There is food all over the floor and no visible trash can. Nothing gets washed. Very rude, and unprofessional. Hope you guys hire someone who can understand your native tongue to help out! Too bad, it could've been sweet if you were willing to clean up and be helpful.

I'm always skeptical when I see Yelp reviews mentioning bugs and unsanitary conditions, because I think people tend to be too prissy about those kinds of things, but yep, there were tons of bugs here. I don't know if it was unsanitary per se. but it's annoying to get swarmed by gnats when you're trying to talk with people. And mosquitoes! I'd never gotten a mosquito bite in San Francisco until coming here.
I walked in and they were playing Morrissey , sat down and had a plug right next to my table and couldn't find one hipster in the joint.  Definitely my favorite coffee shop on Valencia.
Tried the Italian soda and Chai-tea and liked them.
This is a great, hidden gem. Their sandwiches are good and their environment is ideal for heads-down working. I'm a big fan.

I really wanted to like this place. Ritual was packed to the brim with unfriendly-looking types glued to their screens, so I continued on Valencia until I passed Mission Creek and imagine my excitement when I saw all of the empty booths, a plethora of outlets located conveniently to the tables, quiet classical music playing, and even lower table heights that are more ergonomic for typing! Despite these great attributes, the cafe had enough mosquitos that I was bitten 6 times in a few hours. What?

This place is extremely underrated. I avidly frequent coffee shops for study spaces, and Mission Creek has one of the best. I'm a big fan of the personal booths-- I'm sold on any place that lets me prop my feet up!!

I'm a local and I really enjoy this odd little place. It's comfortable and the owner is super nice. There's wifi, plenty of outlets, and I'm always pleasantly surprised by the food. It's funky, yes, but for what it is it's a great place to get work done.

I really like the atmosphere of this place (low key, causal).  However if you are looking for a place to get some work done, then it would REALLY depend on who is working at the time: Sometimes, this place is a great place to get work, IF they are not blasting music loudly!  Their music range from very mellow music  (ie. Joni Mitchell) played at very pleasant volume level, to ridiculously LOUD, ie. blasting R&B music (Beyonce) that is too loud even if you have ear plugs on.  It all depends on who is working.
It is quiet here. But only come here to study if you don't mind being disturbed by the FLYS around you..
Let's start this with: I'm no coffee or tea connoisseur.
Glad to have found Mission Creek Cafe,

Ehh the bathrooms are absolutely disgusting. I give it 2 stars because the place felt like such a health hazard. There was a mosquito flying around and I didn't even know Mosquitos existed in San Fran and in the cold weather. It was my first time seeing one in the area. I got the green tea but nothing special about the order.
I know people are torn about this place, but I've really grown to love it. There were a few times in the beginning when I walked out swearing to never come back, but I'm glad I always did.
Everything on the menu is overpriced, but that's okay. This is where I go to work. There's usually somewhere to sit, with sufficient power outlets. There's a bathroom. The coffee has caffeine in it.

Mission Creek Cafe is like being in a terrible relationship: you don't realize how bad it really was until you've left. Then you wonder what the hell you were thinking and why you put up with it for so long.
My office had lunch catered from here and the carne mexican pot pie was delicious!

I had the dulce de leche crepe at the SF street food festival and it was such a disappointment for $5. The crepe was gelatinous in texture, kind of like rubber, and the filling tasted like melted caramel candy I can get anywhere. The only redeeming quality was the whip cream, which I'm pretty sure wasn't fresh. I would not recommend this particular crepe.
The dulce de leche crepe that we ordered had the consistency and taste of chocolatey pasta.
We had Delicioso Creperie cater the brunch after our wedding. We had the brunch in the garden at our home for around 60 people, with buffet soups and salads and made to order crepes.
Delicioso Creperie is a mixture of french, mexican and lebanese cooking.  Del had no lines the 3 times i passed them. no pics were evident of what they were selling.
Nice little restaurant. I've come here a few times and I always get panuchos. I've eaten them from a different restaurant but these one are better! I am definitely going back to get some more!

wow.  what a disappointment. Maybe it's a good Salvadorian restaurant. NOT for Mexican food.    We had a $25 off $50  Restaurant .com gift certificate.  Clueless server who wasn't sure what was available and was not helpful.  Strange mole, that appear to have no chocolate..just a tomato sauce.   Decent fresh guacamole. Shrimp in mojo de ajo..had no sauce, no garlic, no flavor. ceviche de cameron (shrimp) appearerd to have no shrimp in it . Chicken soup came as a big bowl of flavorless vegetables in broth, with a plate with a FRIED chicken hindquarter with rice and simple salad.  without looking at menu, we ordered 3 small fruit "aquas", and saw on the bill, they were $9.
La bomba new el salvadorian/ mexican food. Tamales , sopes , tacos , fresh n homemade tortillas. Chill atmosphere and authentic. Everything seems like it is made fresh. Highly recommend
Always make time to go to Chava's when in San Fransisco. Best breakfast and their chicken mole is worth the trip alone.
get the goat plate! really good.

My husband & I originally wants to go to a different Mexican taqueria which we heard from the news was the best Mexican taqueria, so we went & the line was out the door and we left and on the same block we saw this Chava's Taqueria it looks nice but not crowded so we went in & ordered fish burrito & crispy beef tostado w/ rice & refried beans.  The food was very tasty and delicious.  The place was clean and nice.  By the way, they only accept cash, give this place a try, you would not regret it :D

Where to begin, being Mexican I am quite opinionated on cultural foods, especially those whom try to mimick and Americanize food. However, chavas is as genuine as it gets. Their caldo de res made me feel like a 5 year old in my parents kitchen, the mix of kumbia-kingz and jenni-rivera took me back a decade. This place was great. Home made tortillas and the waitreses were exceptional!
This place was not originally on my list of Mission burrito places to try, but we decided to come here when we saw some questionable characters outside of a place that was on our list.
OK - so if you are a tourist, don't go here.
The owners are the BEST. They treat you very special; make you feel warm and welcome. The food is "tipica" and delicious, not like other Mexican restaurants whose menu is anything, but.
Had dinner here Saturday night. The food was generally good, the tongue was very good but the goat soup was mediocre, kind of tough and salty. Definitely not as good people other people said it was.
Tacos were all right, they were hella greasy. The lengua aka Cow tongue for white people was good. But I had better, only came here because La Taqueria was closed.

Chava's restaurant is great! They have hand made tortillas! I love ordering the chile verde and steak quesadillas. The carnitas tacos are delicious and the portions are large. I love the free chips and salsa too!

The first was that the guacamole wasn't that well prepared, not salty enough, kind of tasteless. the plate I had, the chile verde was also not that flavorful, one piece of the meat was just fat. But the serving size was pretty decent. Also there was a lack of napkins. There might be better dishes here but eh, could be better.

I've been here quite a bit and was there yesterday morning for breakfast. I'd have to say that the chilaquiles was not as good as it used to be. The salsa and chips are still my favorite here. Their stews and soups are good but they only take cash and the service is a bit slow.

We didn't like the feel of this place. Not that it was too sketchy, just cheesy. (Well, there was that homeless woman sprinkling her chips with beer and staring maliciously at me...) The birria, which we came for, was pretty good but not great. Ill stick to Gallardos when it reopens.
My go to place for Chile Verde. You gotta try it.

Chavas use to be the destination point when I wanted authentic Mexican food. I haven't been in over a year since moving to Concord but yesterday, I wanted really good menudo and posole for breakfast, but instead I decided to try their "special" beef soup. I should have stuck with what I originally wanted. The beef was hard and chewy, the vegetable weren't good and it was salty. My husband had a carnitas burrito with lots of fat and he felt it was old meat. The orchata, guac and tortillas were yummy but the kicker was, our bill was almost $30 with a soup that we misunderstood as being on "special" when it was the "special of the day" .  Disappointed.

Note: This review is based solely upon my most recent visit for breakfast (and that specific meal) on Saturday morning. I have eaten there many times before and if I had gotten their Chilaquiles, this would be a 4-Star review. I feel that their Chilaquiles are one of the best I have ever had, but I am partial to their version as those were the first Chilaquiles that I ever had (twenty-plus years ago now).

By far the Fish Taco that I had at Chavas was the best I've  ever had. The Talapia fish was grilled perfectly and each bite was delicious.  I normally order the Pozole with the fresh made tortillas. But I have definitely found my new favorite.... Talapia Fish Tacos!

Chava's restaurant is phenomenal. The food, service, pricing, everything. However, this review is only partially for that. I love the place, but even more often than I come here to dine I come to pick up tortillas to-go. They have some of the best corn tortillas that I have ever tasted in my life. I'm extremely picky when it comes to tortillas and just can't stand buying store bought impostors. Maybe it's the snob in me, maybe it's just because I just can't stand eating factory manufactured tortillas that don't taste good or authentic. Anytime I'm cooking food that calls for tortillas, or I'm just craving some torts I swing by Chava's and up at least a dozen... who am I kidding? It's always at least 2 dozen!

I had a Carnitas burrito and a horchatta. The burrito wasn't huge or even "regularly' sized. It would almost say that it was a little small. But when I was done, I didn't feel hungry. The carnitas was OK, maybe just ever so slightly dry. The fresh avocado was great, and a nice touch.

Best place to have a good Mexican lunch on the weekends (in SF). The Birria and Menudo here are amazing. They have had made tortillas on the weekends. Weekends are also busy but worth the wait. The two negatives are 1) they only take cash and 2) parking is hard, as it is in the Mission. Completely worth it though!
Delicious home style cooking yummy salsa guacamole and corn tortillas

Every time my wife and I want a real authentic Mexican flavor just as in the old markets in Mexico, we go to Chava's , it is the real deal , forget about La Taqueria or Chevy's or worse Chipotle!  that's not mexican they are  more like gringo/texmex/ mexican .
Got a wet burrito and there was barely any meat inside!! Waste of money and I'm still hungry!
I shall never, ever, come back to this place.

I needed some chicken soup today and found Chava's on Yelp.  I got some Caldo de Pollo to go and when I got home, put the chopped onions, cilantro and squeezed in some lemon juice.  Just what I needed.  The Caldo was rich and flavorful, big chunks of vegetables, 3 good size pieces of chicken.  All in all very satisfying.

Had an outrageously good bowl of menudo here a couple of months ago, so made a repeat visit. Unfortunately the second impression wasn't as good -- although well-washed (no wet doggy smell here) the menudo (callo only + plus a few small fragments of pato de puerco -- no libro or cuajo to be found in the bowl) Shorty's bowl been overcooked leaving it sort of flabby, and what was a well-seasoned richly flavored broth the first time around was muted and bland. It left me wondering if they prepared a large pot on Saturday, left it simmering all day, and then reheated it again on Sunday.

Chavas' ain't all that folks! Super cheap, lots of food but really dirty place. As a native SF'er and growing up in the outter mission, this place was LOUD - a junkbox spitting out of tune mexican rancheras. Glasses, plates, silverwear are dirty.  Took my dad there for breakfest - his pick, not mine - his drinking glass had lipstick marks around the rim. The table was dirty with greasy handprints.
Food that will make you nostalgic for a home you may have never had.
Monday my heart was in El Paso. I so badly wanted to be there so much that I spent the morning feeling sad and felt like crying.
Good, solid and authentic Mexican meals.  Sides of rice and beans have excellent flavor.
Certainly not top of the line huevos, but it cured my hangover after a fun night.  Cash only.

My boyfriend and I come here on Sundays pretty often for the birria. It is extremely good/crave worthy with chopped onion, cilantro, and lemon slices for toppings and a basket of fresh fluffy tortillas. We split one with a side of beans and rice and are very full. Its the perfect Mexican brunch for $20 (without tip)!

This place is pure math.  Somehow by adding chilaquiles/horchata to a violent hangover the hangover disappears.  Science is amazing!  Sadly I live in colder climes but when I next return I'm gonna eat the butt out of some chilaquilies/birria.

So I bought a flask. Yeah, yeah, big whoop. Everyone has a flask. But does everyone have an 18 oz flask? No, everyone does not. That's not even a flask - that's a party. Until the next day, anyway, because no one is meant to drink 18 ounces of vodka in four hours. And then: punishment. Headaches upon headaches. Nauseated stomach. What to do?

What do you feed someone who thinks it's ok to drink 18 oz of vodka in a few hours the day after? Chilaquiles! Crispy strips of tortilla in a casserole like mixture of eggs, cheese, peppers, onions, chiles and pork with red sauce. Even mr grumpy brightened a bit at the sight. I liked this restaurant, clean and cheerful staff, an older woman pressing homemade tortillas in the open kitchen. I tried the birria, a goat version of carnitas. Gamey and rich, crunchy and fatty, served with rice, beans and those tortillas. About $10, a huge portion, enough for at least two more meals. Onion, cilantro, radishes and oranges are brought as sides, chips and two salsas complimentary. Families were popping in before their soccer games and local elders breakfasted here as well.i tried the carrot juice, good, and the undead enjoyed his horchata. Strawberry agua fresca was refreshing and fruity.  About $50 for a family of four eating the most expensive entrees, which is to say cheap...and great!
Real Mexican Food.  Recommend the Chiliquiles and Huevos Rancheros for breakfast but really all of their food is good.  They also have some of the best agua frescas around.

I landed at Chava's because Chavita's (Mission near Chavez) ran out of birria, according to my friend who was born and raised in the mission Chavita's is incomparable. The two places are not own by the same folks even though the similarity in names may suggest that.

FAKE chips. This is one of my criterion for a good taqueria, they must make fresh chips! This place gets those yellow costco-y chips- blech! I came up with this theory though: they hate tortillas. They make their own corn tortillas (which are ok, not great) so I guess it wouldn't work that well to cut those up and fry them for chips since they're thicker and whatnot. So since they don't buy tortillas for their food, they dont have any to chop up and fry for chips. Uncool.The chicken Mole was ok, a tad sweeter than I like but to the average palate it would probably be quite good. Oh, I think I remember liking the rice and beans but they were skimpy on those.

used to go to the old location when i was little all the time before the fire. my parents say it just hasn't been the same since. but went again for the caldo de rez.  excluding the mariachi band's trumpet player screeching away at the birthday party in the back, the food was still good. huge bowl of hot beef chunks and veggies in steaming broth. finished with unions, lemon, rice and BAM! happiness in a bowl on a cold SF night. i'm such a soup junkie.
Chunky soup is "the soup that eats like a meal"? Puh-leeze. Get the caldo pollo soup here and good luck finishing all that food.

This place is in the perfect spot because it's so close to the hospital. Because of that t gets pretty busy at lunchtime. Service is pretty quick, very polite and patient. The sandwiches aren't super expensive and the portions are quite large so usually I will eat only half of my sandwich and share the other with a coworker. My favorite right now is their avocado turkey sandwich. It is made with chunks of turkey and delicious.

I'm not sure why this deli has such low reviews, it is called "deli 23" because it is on 23th Street right across from SF General, they have breakfast specials , sandwiches, large selection of drinks, sweets and potato chips, staff is super friendly as well. Indoor and outdoor seating a plus.

Horrible Mediterranean or middle east over priced sliced meat with nitrites place. I was overcharged for about 80% the stated price for a small coffee. Their phone number is a fax... Avoid these thieves or pay with cash and count every penny you get as change.
Discovered this little corner store through an order ahead type app. Needed something in Potrero Hill. I ordered a meatball sandwich and a 1/2 pint of hummus.
Late. Ordered for delivery through Eat24 at 8:41. Didn't get our food until 10:45. We called several times, and each time we were told the food would be there in a few minutes. Lies.
I've never physically been to this restaurant but me and my wife order here all the time. The food is wonderful, all dishes that we've ordered are delicious not exception.

This is a delivery staple for me, order At least once or twice a month, food always arrives fast (under 30 minutes) hot and delicious.   Is it my favorite Chinese joint?  No.  Most adventurous menu? No.  But is it the place I think of first whenever I want Chinese food? Abso-lutely!
Order from Eat24.. Where is my food tho? I mean, it's over 90 mins. And you said you still need extra 20mins to deliver?
Evenings like tonight are ones that make you happy to be alive, especially in San Francisco.
Bad. Just...bad.
I love Big Lantern!  I come here fairly regularly.  Lots of vegan options, including on the dim sum menu.  Friendly staff.  Good for groups.  Take out is easy too.  :)
ordered delivery and got veggie fried rice, hot and sour soup, and the vegetarian egg rolls with meatless chicken.

I signed up on yelp tonight solely so I could give a review on the terrible food we got tonight. We ordered delivery from Big Lantern through eat 24. No problem with the delivery but the food was the worst Chinese I ever had.

I typically order through Eat24.  Last few deliveries have been way over 90 minutes, food spilled all over the bag, and this last time they claimed they didn't get my order.  Too much hassle.  no thanks.

A friend had gotten delivery from here and as fans of dim sum, we wanted to give it a try but having had some bad luck with what looks like awesome restaurants and lousy delivery, we decided to eat in first. What attracted our attention was the very large selection of vegetarian and fake meat dim sum.

We are always on the lookout for inexpensive but tasty vegetarian food options.  We decided to try Big Lantern because it seems to be one of the few places with a decent selection of truly vegetarian dim sum.

This hidden gem may look like a dive from the outside, particularly considering the barely legible sign above the door which faintly announces that this establishment is, indeed, the "Big Lantern".  Notwithstanding the shoddy window dressing and not-much-to-speak-of interior, the food itself is excellent.  The fried rice was some of the best I've had, and the dim sum (we selected the variety option) was excellent.  The prices were very reasonable as well, increasing the overall value.  It's also just around the corner from Four Barrel, so you can get in the obligatory coffee stop while you're in the Mission.
Love this place. Friendly, prompt, family service and heaps of vegan options at reasonable prices. The food is alway delicious, fresh and hot. Highly recommended.
Was quoted 55-90 minutes for delivery, and the food arrived in 25 minutes.

The mabo tofu was like drinking hoisin sauce and too highly concentrated.  I expected there to be some ground pork, but there were clumps of hoisin sauce in the dish and way too much msg in the lunch entree mabo tofu  and the soup.  The soup was gelatinous and I felt really thirsty after a sip of the soup.  I came because Caucasian friends were from the area who wanted to eat there
Note!!! Hours on Thursday -- only open until 11.

Good soup and vegetables and we got the food in about 40 minutes after ordering but there was no indication in the menu that the chef special tea flavored chicken was breaded.  When we got it we were disappointed especially because it was all bread and no meat and basically tasteless. We ended up having to cook our own main course.

Honestly one of my favorite go to spot because of their vegetarian items. Check twice before eating though if you do order vegetarian. Few times my delivery (80 min wait) was real meat items instead but they brought the correct items back. Taro dim sum is pretty good but a little on the pricy side $4.50 for 3 pieces. I usually spend about 30~40 dollars for dinner here.

Mediocre food and crappy service. I've given this place a few different chances and each time it has disappointed me. Nothing stands out and the flavors all taste the same. Salty and fishy and not in a good way.  I mean EVERYTHING tastes like that... Even the chicken. I've tried the chow fun- lacked flavor. The house spicy chicken chow fun- also lacked flavor as well as heat. The Mongolian beef was overly salted and overcooked. The chow mein also lacked any flavor. The noodles are weird. You get the idea. How can everything I've had lack flavor when it's clearly MSG-laden?? Oh they all say no, but my pounding headache and unquenchable thirst says otherwise. The only thing that was ok was the shrimp dumpling. It was convenient because they do deliver, but forget about getting your order in less than an hour. It may take longer. It always takes longer than they say... at all hours. The last time I ordered I called them to ask where my food was after an hour and 45 mins- after they told me it would be 45 minutes... Then they told me they won't deliver to my house anymore. I know what you're thinking- I must have been rude. Quite the contrary, my orders have always been over $30-40 and I've always tipped the driver way more than 20% for their troubles and was always courteous on the phone even though they barely understand and u have to repeat myself a bunch of times. Maybe they think my house is too far- either way, an explanation would be nice. But no matter, I won't be missing much and for the lack of flavor as well as good service I'll be dining Chinese elsewhere. This is San Francisco- there's so many other options that taste way better! Thanks for nothing Big Lantern!
Decent food with great store hours. I got to the restaurant at 11:40 and they gladly accommodated my last minute orders.

It's rare that I'm happy with the food here.  Certainly anything "szechuan" hasn't been spicy, and hasn't had the right flavors.  The only thing I've had that I've actually enjoyed was the String Bean Beef.  It was perfect.  The beans, the sauce, the beef, the dish had a great umami and texture.  But I've probably had 5-6 things since and I've regretted every one.
Great food but the order came in a bag that was a sopping mess of sauce. It took a lot of careful extraction to keep sauce from spilling onto everything.
Very disappointing ordering experience!!!
Ordered through
This place was delicious!
Delivery only took a few minutes over an hour!  The woman on the phone was polite and helped me cancel an order through eat24, because I couldn't use the coupon with cash (sucks! Boo eat24!).
Delicious vegetarian Chinese main dishes and dim sum. Quick and fresh delivery.
This place is amazing! I've ordered several times using GrubHub and the food has always arrived on time if not early. It has always been flavorful and more than enough.

Big Lantern makes perfectly acceptable food, and the extensive menu offers you your choice of a variety of different regional cuisines. That versatility is its greatest strength, because everything else about this place is a bit lackluster. The food isn't particularly noteworthy: it tends to be greasy and is sometimes rather bland. When I leave, I feel like my pores are saturated with corn syrup. The service is middle-of-the-road, and the food is rather pricey for what you end up getting. I appreciate that this place has a wealth of vegetarian options, and I'm pretty sure that's how it gets its good reviews. If you eat meat, there's certainly better Chinese food to be had elsewhere.

Absolutely the WORST service known out there. They don't keep true to their delivery times. 45-90 minutes? Try over TWO HOURS. And why must I check in with my order 5 times instead of them keeping me updated? Absolutely unprofessional and do not know how to run a business right. I don't know how this restaurant is still standing.

I ordered the jalapeno chicken dish from here last night. What I actually got was the meatless version of the dish which is not nearly as good in my opinion. Had I ordered it and been expecting it I may have thought differently. I know this restaurant has a lot of vegetarian options but they need to get people's order correct, especially considering I ordered it online so they had a printout of the order right in front of them. I do not know if I will order from here again as I cannot trust them to get my order correct, even when it is written down.
DO NOT ORDER ONLINE FROM THEM!!

Worst delivery service ever. Was given an estimate of 50 minutes, which is already pretty long. Gave a call after 1 hour and was told the food would arrive "any minute". Called back after 2 HOURS and was told the food was JUST being delivered (10-15 additional minutes). Never order delivery from this place.

Big Lantern is definitely of the better places for dim sum outside of Chinatown. It seems a lot of people had bad experiences with takeout, and through a 3rd party (with their caps lock key stuck in a downward position), which is unfortunate. It's a neighborhood Chinese restaurant, not haute cuisine on the Rive Gauche. We go there every other week or so for our dim sum fix when we're too lazy to get across town. We haven't, and would not, try takeout in this neighborhood. The food is good, and if you venture to other plates on the menu, like the pineapple fried rice, it tends to be a good value and pretty decent food (speaking as someone who worked in a Chinese restaurant back in the day).  We usually walk away with enough leftovers for another meal later. I recommend this place to my friends for casual dining, especially those who haven't had good dim sum.
absolutely love their shrimp dumplings.  The pineapple fried rice also hits the spot and you can't go wrong with their sweet and sour pork.
Absolutely revolting. If it were possible to give 0 stars I would.

Ordered delivery 10pm Friday night, took about an hour and fifteen minutes. No big deal, it is Friday night after all. Ordered garlic eggplant, beef stew with spinach, and brown rice. Got orange eggplant (or at least that's what it tasted like), beef stew (as ordered), white rice, and fried rice. A little random. None of it was above average.
I don't know what I just put in my mouth but it was terrible.
Good pan-Chinese restaurant with an extensive menu, including many vegetarian dishes!
I've been blaming Terzetto in Mission Bay for serving bad salads. It's true they sell them but I just realized today they are MADE at the Lost Ladle Cafe.

It's so nice to have a little cafe in the building that you work in, especially on rainy days! The food is from area vendors, mostly healthy and organic. They offer some sushi, breakfast burritos with vegetarian sausage, and some basic sandwiches. There is usually a daily soup and entree special as well. Anne runs the show, and she is super friendly and efficient. I think a lot of people in our building go get a coffee so they can talk to her when they having a bad day.
This place is on the ground floor of the office building where I work and for convenience I pick up a meal there several times a week.

Well I went again last night to El Valenciano and I am hooked!1 I loved dancing with fabulous dancers!! No beginners here!! It was just perfect, not to crowded, and plenty of room on the dance floor to enjoy yourself with these fabulous dancers! The DJ was great and I love seeing these dancers dance on2.  It seems they are following the beat of the music better than the ones that dance on1! I  will definitely be going back for as long as i can! I just wish it was closer to home!

Went here with a few friends to dance salsa.  Granted, I moved here from Miami and my rhythmic expectations may be high, I have never seen such lifeless dancing.  When I sat back and watched it looked like everyone was regurgitating patterns learned in some class w/o any emotion or internalization of the music.  This is painful people and a total bastardization of grassroots salsa.  It's lifeless, passionless.  Being "good" isn't about who can turn 50 times in succession, toss their hair, or raise the painfully ballroom "style" hand highest.  Uff, Celia and Fania would be dismayed.

One of the best places to dance in the SF area. The floor isn't that great, but the better dancers usually come out over here. If you're a hardcore on2 dancer, then a place you should try when in the area.
**For Tuesday night tango**

Excellent version of the Bandeja Paisa. I once came in here on a whim and saw the meal on the menu.  It reminded me of my travels to Medellin. I have to say the meal was almost perfect, can't fault any part of it. Some may find it to be a bit heavy on the fat side but that's just authentic Colombian food.  I can't comment on the other menu choices because I keep getting the same thing.  Delicious food, service is good too

Went in here with a friend on a 'rainy' Thursday evening and it was not the happening night that are usual here - however, they still had some great music playing and a couple (maybe practicing) on the huge dance floor.
I really like this place and thank you , great customer service !!!!
Can't speak to the dancing, but boy do these guys pour drinks with a heavy hand. Strong drinks, good prices, friendly staff.

Wednesday Salsa Nights is great! Went for the first time and it was exactly the type of environment, music and dancers I've been looking for since I moved to SF. The Djs play salsa music that is for dancers that are very serious about dancing a "salsa sabrosa, salsa dura"  (yes, as one reviewer said before, for those salsa dancers that travel anywhere to go to Salsa Congresses, or those that mostly go out to dance during weekdays, more than 1 day a week....). For $10, I had a great time and the opportunity to dance On2 & On1 and meet amazing people until 1:30am. Highly recommended!
Note - this is not a dance review, just a drink review.  Stopped by here to meet old friends I haven't seen high school and college - so it was imperative we be able to hear each other.

Stopped in here for a quick drink before heading to a friend's art show. We were hoping to find a mellow, uncrowded place and were surprised to discover a bar that was just our speed. It was early in the evening and the DJ was playing a mix of funky 80s and Latin grooves. There was a mix of older and younger folks, but we were the only non-Latinos in the place, and clearly the only people that weren't regulars. In spite of that fact, the bartender welcomed us warmly and made a great recommendation for a wonderful sipping tequila. He let us know that later on, a band would be playing. Once the liquid courage kicked in, we actually even got on the dance floor for a bit. We had a great time, paid our $50+ tab, tipped generously, and told the door man we'd be back later for the band.

As a tango dancer I completely resent that this is the place where the highest-quality tango dancing* typically happens (*visitors take note--yes, this is one of your stops to get the best of the Bay--for dancers only, not for the bar or atmosphere or anything else).

Salsa venues in the Bay Area are dwindling...but El V is still going strong.  Now they have air conditioning (and you can bring some baby powder for your shoes), so I don't die stuck to the floor while dancing :)  My favorite DJ plays here and often surprises me with new, great music.  They also do a Vinyl only party on the last Wednesday of the month, where the DJs play LPs that are often pretty rare.  Hawt.
This rating is for the salsa nights that happen every Wednesday:

Every Wednesday for the past two years I've been coming to El Valenciano. Wednesday night is salsa night. They have a 8pm salsa class you can take and afterwards you can stick around to practice what you learned. Seems like all the good salsa dancer go here, so be sure to dance your ass off with the best of bayarea salsa dancers!!. there is no dress code, and the bar is opened all night. Great place.. love it..

My 21st birthday landed on a Saturday, and had no plans to do anything. Why? I've never gone to any club, gone out drinking, or gone out to any place late because of the strictness of living with latin parents. I've grown to accept their strictness, so I didn't think another day would make a difference.
Good place for dancing on the weekends, and the bartender was very nice. As usual there were a few creepers, but that's pretty much expected at any dance hot spot.

A local favorite for the Mission District where people of all ages (over 21 of course), come to get down, salsa down.  They didn't play all salsa though.  They would mix it up cuz we were grooving to JJ Fad's Super Sonic for a bit.  They have one long bar to the left and they sure do know how to make drinks.  We ordered cadillac margaritas and they were strong, so you'll be sure to get your monies worth.  In the back is the dance floor.  Surrounded with family style round tables wrapping around the dance floor, I felt like I was back in prom again.  It was sweet.  It was funny too, because we stood out like a sore thumb.  Let's just say, we were the token Asians there.  This place use to serve food, but they no longer do so.  Oh well, it would of been awesome to see that giant grill up front light up for some carne asada. This is a family owned establishment, where you'll meet the mom and son duo who pretty much knew everyone there.  They greeted my friends and I, and we've become fast friends.  Their security is tight, but you feel protected cuz of that.  They do have one tall smiley bouncer there that's super friendly and fun.  He too makes you feel extremely welcomed once your in.  Just make sure you got a collared shirt on buddy, or you can't enter.  Definitely a nice establishment for sure.

Yes. This place is one of the greatest places in the city to dance Argentine Tango on Tuesday nights. In fact, it is so awesome you can bring your non dancing friends to watch and enjoy a drink at the bar too. Hooray for Tuesdays!!
Hrm, after a few weeks coming here, I have to say it's consistent: this is THE BEST SOCIAL SALSA SCENE for advanced-ish dancers.

SALSA NIGHT REVIEW: Do you like men ages 50-70 dancing really close, whispering sweet nothings in your ear while simultaneously telling you you need to up your salsa game? What if they tell you how nice your ass is and wink at you like your second cousins uncle did at the last family gathering? How about sweaty old men chasing after you trying to get "your digits" (their words, not mine) as you head to the restroom? And finally, paying $12 bucks to have all this thrust upon you in one night of Salsa puking excitement? Yea, I didn't think so, and neither do I, so I won't be back.
Guilty as charged!  Okay yes I may have forgotten to let my friend know that my DJ friend plays hip hop AND salsa, merengue and kumbia music. MY BAD! but hey she had an awesome time!

On Saturday night, desperate to get my groove on, I was dismayed when my go to dance sport was far too crowded for any movement whatsoever, let alone dancing. However, my coworker and dance partner told me that he friend was DJ'ing at El Valenciano and we should check it out. Try something different. Live a little. I, of course, agreed.

Ok so being the "salsera" that I am, I was excited for a new wednesday night salsa place. I started of with my drink which was gracious and inexpensive. As I get ready to hit the dance floor, Im disapointed at the choices of music, the sticky floor, and the lack of ventilation/ air conditioning... a fan... something! Not a good sign when you have to step outside every other dance for fresh air.  I do not recommend this place for salsa dancing but I would come back here for just hanging out.

Saturday night , very busy night. This review is for their music since I have never sat down and eaten a meal here. Live Band great something about seeing people play music get's my feet moving. Ambiance pack with people and lots of security feeling very secure. Music  from Salsa and Hip Hop since there was a DJ as well. All in all move your feet and enjoy with the people you love!

I cannot say I know anything about the food. Great place to go dancing. My friend and I went on a Friday night. Got in free, not sure how much it was for the guys. Danced all night. Good drinks, live band, asked to dance like crazy. SALSA!!
It's not about the restaurant, but about salsa on Wednesday. If you love dancing salsa especially NY on2, it is the place to go. Good floor and enough dancers and some of great salseros!!!

Hello, El Valenciano is a really good place to go dance and have fun with friends. Me and my friends are frequent to this place we love the music, the DJ, the bartender and i love to be there. One thing is that they have a waitress (she has curly hair, short and light skin) that is very rude once she was very angry and she said that how come we didn't gave her any tips i think with tips or without tips she has to give good customer service, nothing against the place i love the place and its my favorite bar. I think they should have better waitress with better customer service and i'll give 5 stars.
My girlfriends and I came here on a Monday night, when Beretta was packed to the gills, in order to grab a couple drinks.
this restaurant is very close to where I live, so I walk by there a lot, and most of the time, it's mostly empty. I went there once - I know why now.

It get super hot there the music is good a lot of salsa and cumbia, live music is good. But its always hard to find seats, so if you want somewhere to sit get there early, but it gets pretty packed around 10:30pm...

Went here on a date on Friday night.  The building itself is old, but in a good, historical way.  The food, well, it was okay. I ordered a NY steak. The steak itself was tasty, but it came with a brown gravy all over it.  I had the Pear with blue cheese salad.  It was tasty, but a bit oily.  The server was very attentive. Good service. Then we moved to  the large dance hall at the end of the bar.  Wow! What a great surprise to see this nice dance hall, with a proper band stand and good acoustics.  Here too is where you can see that old SF architecture. Nice. Good sized dance floor and small tables around it.  Lots of places to sit.  The house band was playing and they're great! if you like real cumbia (central american style), salsa, merengue and bachata, this is the band. Danced all night long! Good vibes, everyone dancing and enjoying themselves. (General  age group: 35-50). Get there before 9:00 and forego  the $8 cover charge.
Popped in for a beer. I drank it. I left. Booze case looks like a museum.
The food at this restaurant is okay.

We just came here for the food, not the music or dancing, but it sounded great from the dining area.  The food was surprisingly good, almost as tasty as Picaro or Esperpento, but the service was attentive and friendly, in just the right amounts.  Fortunately, we weren't put off by the fact that the place was mostly empty at 9pm on a Friday.
OMG!!
I went here on Friday in order to burn some calories, and man, was I sweating it up.
Great paella.  Cool old-school bartender.  Nice ambiance.
